title: Paint and Drink Event at Space Aliens (13+ Event)
description: You will be learning how to paint "Flower Splash."Green Martini Paint Co. fuses painting, socializing and celebration into one fun event! Awaken your creative side while sipping your favorite cocktail and unwinding with friends. You will paint your own masterpiece while our instructors guide you, step-by-step, through the entire process.If you are not the “artsy” type – no worries! Vincent Van Gogh once said, “If you hear a voice within you say ‘you cannot paint,’ then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced!” You will laugh, relax and possibly discover the artist within.

title: I CHING  (Intermediate Course/Winter)
description: I CHING – Nature's Mirroring WisdomThe action and art of ‘divining’ is found in all cultures, with the I Ching: Book of Changes being the oldest divinatory device.  It is reflective of the natural elements and their accordance with our states of consciousness, and provides 64 facets of the prism of the human condition. Oracular knowledge suggests a ‘wise utterance’ of the voice of your True Nature. As you ask a question and gaze into a clear prism of your quieted mind, it reflects your innermost intuition. Thus affirming your right actions in all aspects of your life you consider thoughtfully.Join us as we meet on four Saturday mornings as we continue our exploration of the wisdom of the I Ching. We will meet from 10 am to 12 noon on:February 13    I    February 20   I   February 27   I    March 5   2016  Questions?  CONTACT DOMINIEClass will meet in Boulder.  Location information provided upon registration.

title: Underground Tango Music Experience
description:
We take you to the heart of the music!!♫ ♫ ♫ Come out and experience the festive atmosphere of one of the most prolific underground TANGO groups to come out of Buenos Aires in the past few years!!! Think of what a REBEL-TANGO band might sound like and you're on the right track.  ♫ ♫Enjoy a night out on the town with other music lovers! This small group musical outings take you BEYOND the typical commercial tango houses to experience first-hand the REAL TANGO of Buenos Aires.What you can expect:
We'll be meeting our group in the traditional tango neighbourhood of Abasto. There we will have a chance to see some typical street art of this important tango barrio, take photos, and learn a little about the history of the music.
Afterwards we'll take a short walk over to the concert venue. While we're waiting for the show to start there will be a chance to grab some drinks and snacks at the bar and be introduced to one of the musicians.
QUESTIONS? helena@clandestinomusictravel.com OR +5491166683347IMPORTANT NOTE: the concert venue is in a repurposed warehouse space that is run as a collective by musicians.  It is the policy of this venue to seat people on a FIRST-COME, FIRST-SERVED basis, with no exceptions (ie no table reservations)!  The concert is general admission with most seating at tables and on risers, and also standing room. While we will do our best to arrive early to get a table, there is never any guarantee. Wear comfortable shoes just in case!!★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★★Place: Abasto Shopping Centre: Corner of 'Anchorena' & 'Carlos Gardel' (1 block from Corrientes). MEET IN FRONT OF THE STATUE OF CARLOS GARDELTime: 8:30pm sharpLength: approx. 3.5-4 hoursCost: $55USD per person - includes mini walking tour + concert entrance + glass wine + empanadas (snacks)Who we are:  CLANDESTINO MUSIC TRAVEL Tracking down the hottest live music in an unfamiliar city isn’t always easy. We bypass the mainstream tourist venues and take you straight to the source. We work with local musicians, dancers, journalists and cultural tastemakers who have the inside scoop. With our ‘backstage’ connections, we get behind the scenes so you have direct contact with musicians and other artists. Concerts, workshops, rehearsals, street festivals – we’re sure to be wherever the music is happening.www.clandestinomusictravel.comwww.facebook.com/clandestinomusictravel

title: Wine and Cheese 101: Focus on Cru Beaujolais
description: In this introduction to pairing, we're matching a wide variety of cheeses-- differing by style, region of origin, and milk type-- with a finely-tuned selection of wines, all from the region of Beaujolais, all made with the gamay grape. Within those parameters, though, exists great variety-- and possibly the best value in the land of finely-made red wine. Mary Francis Cheeseman, Level II Sommelier, joins Cheesemongers of Santa Fe as we explore the magic of pairing cheese and wine through this focused tasting course.

title: Harvest Dinner at the Atrium
description: The Health Wellness and Sustainability Festival is fortunate to be partnering with Camosun College and the Island Chef Collaborative to create our second evening and dinner you will remember with fond memories.  This is a five course gluten-free dinner, created by some of the top chefs and bakers in Victoria, and top chefs and bakers of the future.  Proceeds  are going to the Growing Chefs Program, a non-profit society, to educate children, families and community members about healthy eating and healthy food systems. title: SW Michigan Jewish Film Festival - Cupcakes
description: A light and bubbly comedy about a group of young Israelis, from different backgrounds and with different challenges, who participate in an international singing contest.  Set in modern-day Tel Aviv and Paris, the story of these best friends is accompanied by an upbeat soundtrack that will have you dancing in your seat!  A film by celebrated Israeli director Eytan Fox, who also directed Yossi and Jagger, Walk on Water, and The Bubble.About the SW Michigan Jewish Film Festival: The best of Jewish film comes to the Kalamazoo area October 25 - November 1, including comedies, dramas, and documentaries.  A whole week of thought-provoking and entertaining films from around the world are coming to four venues near you!  Learn more about Jewish history, culture, and identity at this year's festival, sponsored by the Jewish Federation of Kalamazoo and SW Michigan.

title: Broad Mountain Vineyard Wine Glass Painting Event
description: Hope your having a fantastic summer! We are pleased to present Broad Mountain Vineyard wine glass painting event. title: Ways Not To Drown (Creating Source Material)
description:
Ways Not To Drown(Creating Source Material)physical theater workshops for artists of all disciplines

Second Saturday of each monthSeptember 12, October 10, and November 1410 to 1 pmWe highly encourage you to do all three, as each will build upon the last, but you can also drop-in.Are you looking for new ways to create source material?
How do you locate source material?
How do you transform it into your art form?
How do you translate it for an audience?

2015 Della Davidson Prize recipient Deborah Slater will draw on her 30 years of experience to address these questions, providing structure, guidance and support for you to learn new ways of creating work for audiences. You will use tools of writing, moving and vocalization to:
create new material
gain specific, repeatable tasks to use in your own creative process 
do experiments you never thought to try 
end up somewhere you didn’t expect to be
Let’s experiment together. It is fun and focused. We will think through questions together, playing and creating.

title: Think Media Images—Q&A Session
description:
This Q&A session is an opportunity to ask questions about Labragirl Film Project's media literacy teacher professional learning programs.
Are you looking for ways to incorporate media literacy into your classroom and/or school?
Would you like to integrate media literacy skills & education across your curriculum?
Do you want to bring meaningful media literacy conversations into your history & social studies classes?
Register today to find out if a Labragirl Film Project media literacy PD program is a good fit for you and your students.Think Media Images Q&A Session will be held virtually at 2PM Mountain/4PM Eastern on the third Tuesday of every month.Webinar will be held using Adobe Connect.
Labragirl Film Project supports teachers who want to help their students move from unconsciously consuming images to thinking critically about the influence media images have on the way they see themselves, others, and the world. We do this by integrating media literacy critical thinking and communication skills across the curriculum as a language and perspective—not as an art form or technology. www.labragirlfilmproject.org

title: TEDxReno - Friends + Family
description: Reno is on the verge. After years of struggle, a flurry of false starts and mixed opinions, our Biggest Little City seems to be honing in on the potential we’ve all felt was there, but lying dormant. TEDxReno believes that as our city begins to write a new chapter in its colorful history, we are in a prime position to take big ideas and run with them as a means to craft a story with depth, positivity and sustainability. It’s our opportunity and our responsibility to own Reno’s narrative, and to weave the minds and action of our local citizens and beyond into the core of who we want to be.

title: From the Beyond Con
description: From the Beyond Con is a new film festival that is invading Chicago this August. Held on August 8th at the Schurz Assembly Hall and High School, From the Beyond Con will feature independent sci/fi films from around the world. A festival that is featuring sic/fi films that have not yet been picked up for distribution. We give new filmmakers the opportunity to be seen and film lovers the chance to see the next big sci/fi film.But From the Beyond is not just about the films.  Being at one of the largest (and most haunted) schools in the U.S., we have a lot of space that we can fill.  Hallways ready for vendors, and multimedia rooms to be used for panel discussions and presentations.  http://fromthebeyondcon.com

title: Bernard Shakey Film Retro: Neil Young on Screen
description: The Bernard Shakey Film Retrospective: Neil Young on ScreenPresented by filmswelikeAdvance Single Tickets: $8Pass For All Films: $45 - ONLY AVAILABLE ONLINE!Pass holders get the following discounts at local businesses:The Monarch Tavern / Baju - 12 Clinton Street- $5 house pints & Free side dish with any platter orderSoundscapes - 572 College Street-15% off all Neil Young merchandiseThe Hogtown Pub & Oysters - 633 College St- 10% off the entire bill before and after the shows.June Records - 662 College Street- 5% off all new Neil Young LPs + 10% off all used LPsTickets At Door: $10One of folk and rock’s most respected artists, Neil Young—under the pseudonym Bernard Shakey—has also been making films for over four decades, from concert movies Journey Through the Past (1974) to the fiction feature Greendale (2003). This survey offers a rare opportunity to discover another side of Young’s creative genius, both behind and in front of the camera.The series of rarely seen films includes:Human Highway: Director’s Cut (1982/2014 - digitally restored),  a wildly anarchic satire of Cold War America starring Young, Dean Stockwell, Sally Kirkland, Russ Tamblyn, and Devo. (Thursday July 23, 7:00PM)Journey Through the Past (1974), a road movie and surrealistic fantasy with Young and his musical contemporaries. (Friday July 24, 7:00PM)Rust Never Sleeps (1979), a concept ‘theatrical’ performance with Young’s band Crazy Horse. (Saturday July 25, 4:30PM)Muddy Track (1987 – digitally restored), a one-of-a-kind chronicle of a troubled European tour with Young’s band Crazy Horse. (Saturday July 25, 7:00PM)Trunk Show (2009), Jonathan Demme’s documentary of two outstanding performances at Pennsylvania’s Tower Theatre. (Saturday July 25, 7:00PM)Greendale (2003), a musical look at the lives and struggles of people in the small fictional town called Greendale. (Sunday July 26, 4:30PM)A Day at the Gallery (2012), the paintings of Shepard Fairey come to life to tell a story of their own. Solo Trans (1984), Hal Ashby finds Young at an interesting artistic crossroad, illustrated by an opening solo acoustic set that moves into a song cycle of his experimental and electronic Trans period, followed by a closing set of rockabilly music accompanied by Young’s band The Shocking Pinks. (Sunday July 26, 7:00PM)

title: Yoga Poses on Hands
description: Have you ever wondered how your instructor or the yogi on the next mat can lift their entire body in a yoga pose on their hands then come along and join Manu in this special workshop. Discover ways to build strength, technique and alignment with step by step instructions and advanced assisting by the team. Come sweat, laugh, live with Living OM Dynamic yoga. Namaste!

title: Baking 101
description: Learn the basics of baking from noted pastry chefs, authors, and entreprenuers Matt and Allison Robicelli in the intimate setting of their Bay Ridge bakeshop.  These classes aren't meant to make you a better cake decorator or cookie artist- they're meant to make you a better baker! You'll learn the science behind the dishes, chefs secrets you won't find on television, and technique that will forever change the way you cook at home.This class is meant for your to build a solid repertoire of baked goods to whip up at home. You'll learn not just how to follow a recipe, but how these dishes come together, and why they occasionally fail.  You'll leave the class with a solid understanding of pastry, a full belly, and some sweet treats to bring home.We'll be making:-Chocolate Chip Cookies-Vanilla Cupcake Cake with Chocolate Frosting-Quiche with Bacon, Gruyere, Caramelized Onions and HerbsClasses will be a mix of chef demo and hands on work from selected students, with everyone getting to bring home a little something. Fee includes two hours of instruction and all materials.  All students will recieve 10% off all Robicelli's baked goods purchased after class.This class is family friendly, recommended for ages 8+. All students under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult.

title: Test-ride the FLEX folding ebike, MaRS Doors Open
description: Become a smart commuter! Ride an ebike to work or school and start saving money on transit, gas, parking and more. Say Hello to a new era of personal electric transportation.Come to MaRS Doors Open Toronto 2015, and be one of the first to test-ride the world's smallest chainless folding ebike, the recently unveiled FLEX model from Revelo Electric, proudly designed in Toronto.The FLEX ‪electric bike‬ delivers a fun‬, easy and unique ride experience for a wide range of riders!The FLEX is a folding, front pedaling and grease-less ebike, ideal for small space living, smart commute and all recreational activities..At 14 kg (31 lbs) including a removable lithium battery, it’s the world’s most portable, ultra-lite chainless ebike. In one motion, the FLEX quickly folds down in seconds to an amazing 58x81x30 cm (2x2.5 x1ft). Take it anywhere for instant travel!The FLEX is a street legal ebike, which makes it a great emission free urban commuting vehicle that can cut through congestion, at a top speed of 25 km/h, enabling the rider to get from A to B without breaking a sweat.At MaRS Doors Open meet our friendly team and give us your comments about the FLEX ebike.We'll have giveaways for our test riders! Please note: This is an outdoor test ride and weather dependent.Revelo Electric Corp.Founded in 2012, Revelo Electric Corporation is an award winning Toronto based company that is defining the future of clean personal electric transportation. Revelo Electric applies superior design to the challenge of urban mobility, creating solutions which improve quality of life and the environment.Find more information about the amazing FLEX ebike at our website: www.revelo.cainfo@revelo.ca; sales@revelo.ca1.888.504.3576Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram: @ReveloElectric Linkedin: Revelo Electric Corp.

title: 2015 UTCA Business Case Competition
description: Registration for the long-awaited 2015 UTCA Business Case Competition is now open! Apply for an opportunity to showcase your analytical skills, to network with consulting professionals, and to win cash prizes! If you are one of the 16 successfully admitted teams, you will be given three days to solve a business case. As one of the selected teams, you will have the opportunity to present your solution to a panel of judges from the world’s leading management consulting firms. The judges for the UTCA Business Competition have been confirmed and will consist of representatives from Bain & Co., Accenture, Monitor Deloitte, IBM, PwC, AT Kearney, ZS Associates and other top consulting firms. In addition, the resumes of the participants will be collected, and a list of top resumes will be sent out to the consulting firms. This is a great opportunity to get feedback and network with the judges. The competition will be held on January 24th, 2015 at Hart House. The team in first place will receive a cash prize of $400 dollars. Second, and Third place winners will receive cash prizes as well.Mark your calendars:• Applications open: Wednesday, November 26th, 2015• Application close: Sunday, January 4th, 2015 (11:59pm)• Event date: Saturday January 24th, 2014

title: Mostly-Naked Femmes
description: Join us as we close out Femme Fest 2014 with a raucous cabaret celebrating the artistry of Femmes!  Stay tuned for details on the lineup, but grab your tickets now -- proceeds will benefit Femme Fest!  **Please note that this show is 21+**___________________________________ABOUT FEMME FEST: Femme Fest is a free gathering of femmes of all genders in Seattle WA on October 18-19th. Femme Fest exists to create space and community for systematically oppressed feminine of center queers. We place special emphasis on the voices and experiences of trans femmes, femmes of color, disabled femmes, and other femmes whose identities are are similarly undervalued and unseen.ABOUT LILY DIVINE PRODUCTIONS: We believe in creating safer, sex- and body-positive spaces. We encourage performers who have felt left out of performance spaces, or haven't seen themselves represented in positive and affirming ways, Including: folks of different physical abilities, queer and trans* people of color, fat folks, and folks at the margins/intersections of all of these.**Accessibility** Neighbours is wheelchair accessible via the main entrance to the bar (located in the alley). There is a ramp between the door and the box office, and ample space for wheelchairs in the audience space. The show is ASL-Interpreted.Fragrance free request: Please join us in ensuring accessibility for beloved community members with chemical sensitivity and chronic illness by not bringing fragrances or scents on your clothes, hair, or skin from colognes and perfumes, scented laundry detergent, hair and body products, natural products, and essential oils. You can prepare in advance by not using products with fragrance, or by using fragrance free, non-toxic products. Two multi-stall all-gender restrooms are available.Information for scent sensitive people:Neighbors is not a scent free space. Scented cleaning products are used in all areas, including hand soap in the bathroom. Additionally,cigarette smoke from the smoking area in the alley drifts into the main performance space inside, fog is used on the dance floor, and many patrons are not scent free. Please protect yourself accordingly.

title: A Taste of Honduras - Part 2
description: Online tickets closed, tickets still available at La Bella Managua, come a bit before 12 noon today.Join us for yet another fabulous Taste of Honduras event, enjoy a delicious Central American lunch, and learn how Canadians are helping farmers in Honduras grow more food for their families.Hosted by David Rain, Coordinator of USC Canada’s Run for Biodiversity.Special guests include Dr. Sally Humphries, Director of International Development Studies at Guelph University, together with graduate and former graduate students who will share their own fascinating, first-hand experiences with seed-saving farmers in Honduras. Where: La Bella Managua restaurant, 872 Bloor St W, Toronto (near Ossington subway station): www.labellamanagua.com.Cost: $12.50, includes choice of vegetarian, beef or chicken dishes, plus beverage, taxes included.To join USC's Run for Biodiversity team in Toronto and help raise funds for Honduran farmers, contact David Rain at R4B@usc-canada.org, or visit www.run4biodiversity.org.

title: Nikki Clarke Show in NYC July 30, 2014!
description: Nikki Clarke Show Live Taping at Funkadelic Studios , NYC!The Nikki Clarke Show is a talk show featuring celebrity interviews, discussion of hot topics and live musical performances. Whether you live in Toronto or just visiting, we want you to be part of our live audience!The Nikki Clarke Show will tape LIVE at Funkadelic Studios, 209 West 40th Street,5th Floor  ,(Near 7th Avenue)  ,New York, New York 1001 ,between 7 and 8pm. Save the date and bring your friends! We have a diverse line-up of guests and amazing performances in store for this July 30, 2014.Guests include:LUISA OTERO,Tagged as “America’s No Nonsense Queen”, Luisa helps professional women increase their Self-Worth in Relationships to attract a powerful successful partner. Her groundbreaking coaching program www.lovestartswithyou.biz inspires women to be fearless and powerful in their own skin. Luisa is an example of someone that breaks stereotypes, and is committed to changing the world by speaking the truth about Self-Worth in Relationships. She tells it like it is and delivers her message in a straight up No Nonsense way, using kindness, compassion and humor.FOREVER,Michael Harewood better known as the Artist: Forever, was born in Boston Massachusetts. Both his biological parents where substance addicted, had very unstable lives, and where living a life of despair.At 4 months of age, Michael was taken by Child Protection Services and was eventually put up for adoption. Michael got involved with gangs, crime, alcohol, drugs and a dead-end lifestyle. He suffered through guilt knowing that the loving parents that raised him and had instilled spiritual values were also hurting to see his destructive path; still Michael had faith , and began to pray for wisdom.Today, he shares his gift of music with the world.MATTHEW L. TAYLOR,Born in Toronto, Ontario to two hard working Jamaican parents, Matthew Taylor is a smart ambitious young man with a gift of gab. He started as an award winning piano player by age 6, and became an international soccer champion by age 15. His 20's were spent attending and graduating college, reading many books, making music with the elite and learning through lifes experiences.  Now at the age of 30, Matthew Taylor is a mortgage broker, the founder of Mylessonsareyours.com and is also the author of published book "Student of Life: My Lessons Are Yours." Both his book and mortgage brokering business serve a similar purpose: to make life easier for others. AVIVA REIMER,Entrepreneur, Fitness and Dating Guru , CEO of Perfect- Fit Training and Dating Studio. Commitment, dedication and passion to help people improve their life on every level, are just a few characteristics that set Aviva Reimer apart from other industry professionals. With over 22 years experience in the fitness and life coaching industry, Aviva has created a very direct no games approach, when it comes to her dating advice and matchmaking services. Aviva will build your confidence, whip you in to shape Mind, Body and Soul, and teach you how to keep the guess work out of your dating life . Since 1990, Aviva has been changing peoples' lives, and her results driven determination, knowledge and experience brings success to all that are searching for their own happiness and positive journey.JA PAN- Edgy visionary and r and b / pop/funk/recording artist Hope to see you there!

title: Brand Yourself as an Expert - Leigh Mitchell
description: Brand Yourself as an ExpertJoin this webinar to get in on the discussion that was started at the April Passion to Profit conference.For many small business owners - you ARE your brand.  How do you create your brand, and market it, showing yourself to be an expert worth hiring?  Ask Leigh for her suggestions during this interactive webinar.Leigh Mitchell is the founder & president of Women in Biz Network and SMB Marketing Specialist. Leigh helps women achieve success through growing their businesses and networks. Leigh specializes in professional development for women through delivering skill building events, conferences, webinars, marketing and membership services. Leigh is passionate about connecting women across North America and is considered to be one of Canada’s leading small business ambassadors. Her goal is to create happy and inspired entrepreneurs that feel empowered with greater productivity and enhanced business skills. Leigh has successfully assisted many leading brands to engage with the WIBN community. Brands include: GM Canada, Microsoft Canada, Telus, Johnson & Johnson, Maple Leaf Foods, TD Canada Trust, Staples Canada and Random House. These organizations believe in the power, influence and value professional women bring to the economy. Leigh has been featured on CBC Radio, the Toronto Star, the Globe & Mail and in other media and has been a featured speaker at Blissdom Canada.

title: Let us paint for free!
description:
We are Brooklyn based artists. We do film, music, street art, graffiti, photography, design and much more. I am currently working on a graffiti based music video and I need your help! We are looking for anything (walls, windows, doors, roofs, rooms, cars, canvases, boring paintings, garbage, any object with the latent potential to become a piece of art) that we can spray paint and animate through stop-motion photography. The best part is you get to keep the painting absolutely free of charge, all we are asking for is the material and the space to do it in, we will even provide the paint. (Although it would also be nice if you happened to have any). 

Inquire within for examples of our work. We are an up-and-coming production company currently working on gathering a solid body of work with which we will establish ourselves. This is my latest passion project. 

(Attention! This is not an offer to paint your walls with house paint, please do not ask, what you will receive is a graffiti mural or street art piece that coincides with our specific aesthetic, not your living room furniture.)

title: EUFF 2013: Dinner With My Sisters
description:
Directed by Michael Hapeshis
Drama, 85 min
Language: Greek, English
Cast: Andreas Karras, Michael Kolovos. Popi Avraam, Nadia Charalambous, Julietta Michael

Andrew Michael is a Greek-Cypriot doctor lost in the anonymity of London medical life. His desire to return to his family home after 30 years is triggered by a letter lost in the mail, sent by his father a few days before he died. As his 3 sisters join him in Cyprus, he slowly realizes he is not welcome and embarks on a lonely journey to discover how his father died. The truth comes as suddenly as the rain that sweeps away all lies and sins, restoring the family to its former glory.

title: Eden Village Farm School Fall 2016: September 6
description:
For more information check out our Website!Located at Eden Village Camp's 248 acres, just an hour north of New York City, the Farm & Forest Homeschool Program empowers students to cultivate genuine lifelong connections to their food and to nature through innovative gardening, cooking, art, music, and wilderness experiences, all incorporating the natural rhythms of the Jewish calendar and holiday cycles.Eden Village Camp is offering you groundbreaking, farm to table and wilderness homeschool in a supportive Jewish environment.  Look for more detailed information about the spring curriculum on our website. Train Pick-upThere us a $10 train pick-up fee for all families traveling by the Metro North Railroad. Take the Hudson Line and get off at the Cold Spring Station. The train from Grand Central Station leaves at 9:40a. Pick-up time will be at 11:05am.To help our educators prepare there is a $5 courtesy walk in fee. You are highly encourages to register beforehand. If you fail to register beforehand or have any questions please email farm@edenvillagecamp.org 3 Year Olds:All children 3 or under can come for free! Add this free ticket to your order so we know how many other children to expect! NOTE: If you bring a sibling 3 years of age that would like to participate, please sign them up to pay full price. Please expect to accompany any children 3 years or younger for the duration of the program. Discount for More Than 1 Child:Discount Code for registration: If you are bringing more than one child who is participating, please enter 'CHILDREN' in the promotional code box. (Please enter just the word all UPPER case without the ' '). Helpful Tips:Lunch is bring your own picnic! Additionally, seasonal produce and eggs are available for purchase as available.If your children do not wish to participate in the class happenings they are free to roam the farm and field areas. We also will be providing a Cozy Corner in the dinning hall for adult lounging, breast feeding, and child napping. Tea and water will be available.Packing List: 
Full water bottle
Hat 
Long sleeve/long pants to have for hiking 
Closed toe and closed heel shoes 
Lunch 
Parent-if 3 years or younger 
Smile!
About Farm & Forest HomeschoolWhether planting trees, baking bread in an earth oven, sharing Jewish tales and midrashim around the fire, or packing Tzedakah boxes of homegrown produce for donation to a local food bank, students put ancient agricultural traditions into practice while participating in a vibrant earth based community.We learn about soil, seeds, compost, insects, herbs, and orchards, in our fields, our kitchen, and in our tradition, and through hands on growing and cooking projects. Our goats, bees, and chickens provide for our needs while teaching us about animal care and ethics. In the woods, we learn about trees and practice our navigation and safety skills, while learning to build primitive shelters, track animals, and identify wild edibles. Art projects include printmaking, plant sketching, making costumes and paper mache shofars, and tons more!If you have any questions about our homeschool program, please contact farm@edenvillagecamp.org

title: Eco-Design Farm Tour
description:
Join us for a guided tour of The Ecology Center and learn about ecological design!

The Ecology Center is a regional hub of sustainability with a mission to engage the entire community in fun, hands-on solutions to improve the health of our shared ecosystems. Our goal is to inspire positive change and cultivate a healthy, abundant future — together.

Join us for a guided tour of our historic home, built by pony express rider Joel Congdon in 1878. Over the last 7 years, we have transformed the land surrounding the Congdon house into a thriving learning landscape. We've carefully designed our spaces to serve as a model for sustainable solutions everyone can enact in their own lives and homes. Engage with sustainable solutions throughout our Eco-Labs, visit our carefully curated general store Tools for Change, and gain a deeper understanding of how you can be part of the solution.

This month, we focus on creating your own ecological oasis. Join us for a more in-depth exploration of our gardens and outdoor spaces.




Cancellation Policy: We understand your plans may change. We will give you credit toward a future program if you cancel at least 24 hours in advance. Credit must be redeemed within 90 days of issue. To account for our preparation and our instructor's time, we cannot give refunds or credits if cancelled with less than 24-hours notice or in the event of a no-show.

title: SA Creates: Social Uniforms Embroidery Workshop
description:
Social Uniforms uses the
concept of “uniforms” to explore and challenge the way people see themselves
and others. We believe in creating positive uniforms that nurtures deeper
connections within communities.

The (Un) Common Threads
embroidery workshop explores the concepts of personal narrative and how that
can be translated through clothes. In the (Un) Common Threads workshop,
participants will create a Scarborough uniform that narrates their personal
Scarborough stories. This will be done through embroidering their personal
narrative on the same colour shirt with the same colour thread. By the end of
this session, participants will learn that even though their stories are
different, there is still a common thread, connection and uniformity, between
them all.



About the FacilitatorJoanna Joy is the founder
of Social Uniforms, an online platform that uses clothes and textiles to
challenge the way people see themselves and others.

She is currently studying
Culture and Expression at York University and holds an Advanced Diploma in
Fashion Arts and a Post-graduate Certificate in Costume Studies for Film and
Television from Seneca College.  Also,
she’s a graduate from Centennial College’s award-winning program Culture and
Heritage Site Management where she earned a post-graduate certificate.

Joanna Joy has work in the film industry for
ten years as a Costumer. She has worked on short films that were featured at
TIFF 
	and recently worked on a short film that will be
showcased at Caribbean Tales Film Festival this fall. When she’s not in school
or on a film set, Joanna Joy volunteers at the Textile Museum of Canada as a
docent.

http://socialuniforms.ca/https://www.facebook.com/SocialUniforms

title: Two Tons of Steel
description:
Two Tons Of Steel : A Texas Treasure

Before there was Americana, before there was Texas Country, Two Tons of Steel front man Kevin Geil and his original band, “Dead Crickets,” rocked a sound that blended the best of musical worlds and pushed the envelope of “Texas” sound with a signature brand of country meets punk.

The San Antonio-based group packed the small bars and local hangouts and quickly became the Alamo City’s most-loved band, earning them a spot on the cover of Billboard Magazine in 1996. It was the beginning of a twenty year journey for Geil and the 4-piece ensemble.

Danny B. Harvey

DANNY B. HARVEY was born in Killeen, Texas and at the age of 6 moved to Catlettsburg, KY. where he first picked up and started playing the guitar. At the age of 15 after moving to Canyon Country, CA. he was fortunate enough to receive his first formal lessons with the great JOE PASS. Up until then he had learned to play by only watching older country guitarists back in Ashland, KY and Huntington WV, falling in love with the guitar style of fellow Kentuckian MERLE TRAVIS. At seventeen he was accepted to USC on a full scholarship to study classical guitar with PEPE ROMERO. Feeling out of place (after all he had only moved away for rural KY. two years earlier) and anxious to make a name for himself he moved to England with LEVI DEXTER after only years of study. Danny soon developed a finger picking guitar style that is very unique and based on his idol MERLE TRAVIS, CHET ATKINS, JOE PASS and his classical-technic he learned at USC.As a guitarist, producer and composer Danny has played and recorded with such great artists as Levi Dexter, Tim Polecat, Johnny Ramone, Nancy Sinatra, Lemmy Kilmister, Lee Rocker, Slim Jim Phantom and Wanda JacksonAnnie Marie Lewis

Annie Marie Lewis, American singer, Linda Gail Lewis' daughter and Jerry Lee Lewis' niece



Tickets available include:

General Admission

Balcony VIP Tables (4 seats)

Balcony VIP Bartop

Please Note: We will have a dancefloor in front of the stage for this event.

title: WTFilm Fest: SPACE BREAKERS
description:
The year is 1991, the universe is not our own, but rather a high-technology utopia wherein humanity stretches across multiple star-systems, and manages an addiction to cream-based foodstuffs and perpetual body-modification. Following an altogether alien holiday celebration, three bros (Zak Tatham, Aaron Mancyzk and Efehan Elbi) witness a commercial for an intergalactic mall known as the biosphere, and, with the help of Zak’s sister Tima, hijack a spaceship in an effort to fulfill the libidinal desires promised by the advertisement. The resulting adventure is an anarchic comedy that pays tribute to JOHN CARPENTER’S DARK STAR and Tarkovsky’s SOLARIS, but with a hyperactive energy akin to the work of Tim Heidecker and Eric Wareheim, and a transgressive edge reminiscent of John Waters.

Sprung from the minds behind the hilarious Toronto underground web-series LIVING WITH FRIENDS, SPACE BREAKERS is sure to confound, baffle and even shock most audiences. However, those willing to join the film’s joyously demented wavelength will find themselves breaking into uncontrollable hysterics throughout as Zak, Aaron and Efehan squabble with stowaways, Tima transmogrifies into a tattoo-ridden bro, and the whole gang struggles to fight off a literal swarm of space dicks attempting to penetrate the ship. It only gets weirder from there. (Peter Kuplowsky)

Single Tickets are $10 OR see all three days of programming with an All-Access Pass for only $30: https://www.universe.com/wtf2016

title: Shorts 1: Two of Wands
description: Super-UnitTeresa Czepiec20 min., video, 2015, Poland“Superjednostka (Polish for Superunit) is a huge block of flats designed as a housing machine. Up to three thousand people can live on 15 floors of the building. The lifts only stop every three floors so the residents must go through a maze of corridors and stairs in order to get to their flats. The main characters of the documentary are people living in Superjednostka and going through important moments of their lives there. This is where their emotions throb, their expectations engender, and their desires come true... or not.762 flat doors and 762 stories. We are opening only a few of them.” TCThe Anatomical UniverseDamon Mohl15 min., video, 2015, USA“Revolving simply around the friendship between a janitor and a security guard, The Anatomical Universe examines the life of a man named Edward Hillcot.  Charles Dickens said it best, “A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.” DMHeavy Fog TonightNathan Reich19 min., video, 2015, USA’”Conrad Milster, 80, chief engineer since 1967 at New York City's oldest running steam driven power plant, prepares for his last annual steam whistle show. Conrad will have to face the daily struggles of preserving an era long forgotten while adapting to the digital world around him.” NRIrradiant FieldLaura Kraning10 min., video, 2016, USA“Mirroring sky and earth, solitary mechanical sentinels follow the sun, while metal grids rain in a parched California landscape. Irradiant Field is a visual and sonic portrait at the intersection of nature and machine - a desert mirage of light, wind, water, and metallic reflection.” LKAnother CityLan Pham Ngoc25 min, video, 2016, Viet Nam“A drenched middle-aged woman taking off her wig, gazing out of the glass windows. A young man bursting into tears in a karaoke room surrounded by tropical landscape wallpaper. A young woman trying to wipe a smear off of the wedding dress she’s wearing. Each predicament is woven seamlessly together by a familiar Asian refrain…” LPN

title: Brand Story Strategy Workshop for B2B Marketers
description:
Are you ready to reignite within you the one true superpower we all possess – storytelling – to grow your professional services firm?In this fun and inspiring one-day workshop, you will learn to use the proven Story Cycle process that has helped hundreds of companies profit from getting their brand story straight.
Apply a powerful story strategy that helps you rise above the noise of the Attention Economy
Create your personal leadership story that will awe any audience
Define your authentic brand story that differentiates you in a crowded market
Align your stories to create a narrative that your employees can live into and prosper from
Connect with customers like never before
You should attend this intimate gathering (only 10 participants) if you're CEO who wants your team all pulling in the same direction, a communications professional who must cut through the clutter and move people to action, or a director of sales who wants to turn presentations into significant production..AGENDA:9:00 am: Introductions & ice breaker9:30 am: Explore the Story Cycle & Outline Your Leadership Story (What's Your Story field notebook provided)10:30 am: BREAK10:45 am: Q&A and Finalize Your Leadership Story11:00 am: Share Your 3-min. Leadership Story with Your Fellow StudentsNoon: LUNCH1:00 pm: Brand Story Development Part I (Get Your Brand Story Straight workbook provided)2:30 pm: BREAK2:45 pm: Brand Story Development Part II4:00 pm: BREAK4:15pm: Aligning Your Leadership & Brand Stories, and Next Steps5:00 pm: Beer, Wine & Cheese: You've earned it!Hear what others are saying about Business of Story workshops.If you are not 100% satisfied with the outcome of your story session, I will return 100% of your fee – guaranteed.$1,200 ticket value, yet priceless to the growth of your organization.YOUR INSTRUCTORI've been helping brands experience epic growth for more than 30 years: 20+ years running my own ad agency and the past 10+ years immersed in the power of storytelling. I also created and teach the communications curriculum based on storytelling for the Executive Master of Sustainability Leadership program at Arizona State University to help our international executive students use narrative to advance their social initiatives further, faster. And I'm excited to share this proven story structure with you to grow your nonprofit and your people. Here are the results other organizations have achieved using the Story Cycle. I promise you that when you leave this Business of Story workshop, you will have reignited within you the one true superpower we all possess – storytelling – to nudge the world in any direction you choose.

title: Event & Meeting Mgmt Fundamentals - VIRTUAL
description: If you're looking to become an event or meeting planner, or you've been planning events for a while but never got proper training, this is the ultimate course for you. Here you'll get a thorough understanding of how events work, why people and companies host events, how the industry is configured, and how to strategically plan and coordinate a typical event from A to Z. This course will cover the role of events in today's world, budgets and goals, workflow management, venue selection and negotiation, room layouts and seating formats, food and beverage, entertainment and speakers, design and decor, transportation and logistics, registration and check-in, hybrid meetings, apps and technology, basic lighting and audio visual, and more.This 10-week hybrid course blends online lectures and weekly in-person meetings. The first session will meet Wednesday, May 18 at 7:00 pm, continuing every Wednesday for the remainder of the course.INSTRUCTOR | Joe McKeown, SVP Strategic Event Solutions Sales and Marketing, Message BlocksJoe McKeown is technology focused, strategic marketing event leader with 20+ years experience delivering revenue-impacting event and experiential marketing programs and is passionate about face-to-face customer and employee engagement campaigns. Joe is respected for devising and using the latest event, exhibit and marketing technologies and applications, with a laser-like focus on event ROI. Having served as a Chief Marketing Officer as well, he brings a real-world experienced to deliver what makes a successful event management process from the marketing executive perspective.He currently heads Strategic Event Solutions at an event technology company, Message Blocks, based in Ann Arbor, MI where he leads onsite operations, sales, marketing and product development for the company. His portfolio includes thousands of large-scale marketing events, corporate communication campaigns, immersive tradeshow environments, hybrid events, recognition programs and sponsorship activations for companies from the Fortune 100 to associations to startup event and sponsorship agencies. Joe actively mentors across the industry, and works with hospitality students at Michigan State University and the University of Michigan, presenting on event design and event technology for hotel and conference center -bound students.INSTRUCTOR | Howard Givner,  Executive Director Event Leadership Institute With over 20 years of industry experience, Howard is a widely recognized expert and innovator in the field of special events, meetings and small business growth strategy. Howard is the Founder and Executive Director of the Event Leadership Institute, provider of best-in-class training and education for the events industry, through online, on-demand video classes, interviews with industry leaders, white papers, webinars and live events. He is the founder of Paint The Town Red, Inc., and the former CEO of North America for Global Events Group, the 13th largest event agency in the world, which acquired Paint The Town Red in 2008. During his tenure the company won over 30 industry awards. Howard is a Past President of the ISES (International Special Events Society) NY Metro Chapter; has served on the board of directors of MPI (Meeting Professionals International) Greater NY Chapter as VP of Education; has served on the Advisory Board of Special Events Magazine; been a judge of the Gala Awards & HSMAI’s Adrian Awards. He is a frequent speaker at industry conferences on a wide range of topics. He currently writes the monthly In Business column for Event Solutions magazine. He has been profiled in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, CNBC, National Public Radio, ABC News, The Apprentice, and USA Today, in addition to numerous trade media. Howard is the creator of the SuperPlanner Mobile App, winner of the 2010 BizBash Event Style Award for Most Innovative New Product, and the 2011 Special Events Magazine Gala Award for Best New Product / Service. On a personal level, Howard sits on the Board of Directors of Every Child A Reader, the charitable foundation of the Children's Book Council. He lives in Westchester, NY with his wife and two children.

title: From Last Comic Standing: Dave Landau LIVE
description: The Future of Comedy Show presents Dave Landau. Seen on NBC’s Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central’s Live At Gotham, and heard nationwide as a regular guest on The Bob & Tom Radio Show.Featuring Saginaw's very own Mike BallW Special guest Host Tom E Thompson Sponsored by Stretch Limo! About Dave LandauWorking the road nonstop since his 21st birthday, Dave Landau has grown into a true comedic juggernaut. Finding himself much in-demand among audiences and club owners due to his deadpan demeanor and those jokes — my God, those jokes — that fluidly fly forth with breakneck pacing and perfect timing. Dave, it can be said with all due respect, is a throwback to another era of comedy. The entertaining everyman. Innocent enough at first blush; as he states his case, you begin to see where you and he have quite a bit in common. A wife, a house. An odd sense of calm in an increasingly crazy world. You’re on a tour of the familiar and prosaic, with Dave Landau as the bus driver.Then he drops his foot on the accelerator. And things start to get wild. You see, Dave Landau might appear to be just like you, but he’s not really. His mind goes to places that angels would fear to tread, and he has no problem telling you about it. The mark of a great comedian, it is said, is the ability to find jokes where others would find tears. Dave find jokes everywhere; with his own foibles and faults, to his family, to pop culture and the state of the world today.Cutting his comedic teeth as a teenager in Detroit in the Second City’s Conservatory, Dave Landau has risen to become one of the most in-demand headliners working today. He’s appeared on Comedy Central’s “Live At Gotham” as well as being featured prominently on two consecutive seasons of NBC’s “Last Comic Standing.” He’s become a regular on the nationally-syndicated “Bob & Tom” radio show, and was honored as one of the top 21 club comics of today at HBO’s Las Vegas Comedy Festival.

title: Heirs of the Soil / Los del Suelo - Theater #4
description: Heirs of the Soil/Los del Suelo – Genre: DramaArgentina/2015/109 min.Directed by Juan BaldanaSpanish w/ English SubtitlesArgentina, 1976. Remo and Irma, militants for the Agrarian Leagues, an organization that defended the rights of peasants to own land, are forced into hiding in the jungles of El Chaco by the military dictatorship. After Irma gives birth to Marita, they decide to leave the newborn in the care of a local couple. When Marita is kidnapped by the military, Remo and Irma must choose between leaving the country and staying and risk their lives rescuing their daughter.Argentina, 1976. Remo e Irma, militantes de las Ligas Agrarias, una organización que defendía los derechos de los campesinos a ser dueños de sus propias tierras, huyen de la dictadura militar y buscan refugio en las selvas del Chaco. Después de dar a luz a Marita, la pareja decide dejar a la recién nacida al cuidado de una pareja local. Cuando Marita es secuestrada por los militares, Remo e Irma se ven obligados a escoger entre salir del país o quedarse y arriesgar sus vidas rescatando a su hija.

title: "Three Clarinet Quintets"
description: Only at Inner Space Concerts can you hear all three of the most well-known clarinet quintets (Mozart, Brahms and Weber) in one evening! Join Symphony Nova Scotia musicians Eileen Walsh, Isabelle Fournier, Mark Lee, Kerry Kavalo and Shimon Walt for these must-hear masterpieces for clarinet and strings!

title: Comedy-Gasm! Three Year Anniversary!
description: Holy shit, we've been doing this for THREE YEARS this April and we've gasm'ed like no one has gasm'ed before! We've survived the turning of the seasons, insane snowstorms, a venue change and even Pope month! We have laughed, we have cried, we have drunkenly flirted with our favorite comedians....alas, it is time to CELEBRATE three unbelievable years, and send off Comedy-Gasm into the future, whatever that will be!SERIOUSLY DO NOT MISS THIS:Hosting: Rachel Fogletto (duh)Featuring every single person from the very first show:Walter, LUMP Hamilton, Elise Thomson-Hohl, Brandon T Gorin & Alejandro Morales!Special Guest Rebecca Rush (really hilarious nyc comic that the 'gasm wanted to have on the last show)AND INSANELY EPIC DOUBLE HEADLINERS:KeithFromUpDaBlock and Dirty Diamond!!!NOTE: Doors for this very special show will open at 8:30!SHOW will start at 9!$10 at the door$5 online21+Drink SpecialsFree love

title: The Dawns Here Are Quiet - Program #91
description: Film Program 91It is late spring of 1942, and the Great Patriotic War is in full swing. Can Vaskov, the Russian Corporal and his 'band of courageous all female newbies' prevent Nazi sabatoge and at what cost?

title: The Fire / El Incendio - Theater #3 (1st Scr)
description: (1ST SCREENING)The Fire / El Incendio - Genre: Drama/ThrillerArgentina/2015/94 min.Directed by Juan SchnitmanSpanish w/ English SubtitlesIt should have been one of the happiest days of their lives. On the way to closing the contract on their first home, Lucía and Marcelo withdraw $100,000 in cash from their bank. Unfortunately, the seller postpones the signing to the following day, forcing the young couple to return to their apartment and hide the money for safekeeping. That simple act opens a festering can of worms as old resentments gush to the surface. Schnitman’s intense feature debut is anchored by Pilar Gamboa’s and Juan Barnerini’s uncompromising performances as the young couple.Se suponía que fuera uno de los días más felices de su vida. En camino a cerrar el contrato en su primera casa, Lucía y Marcelo retiran $100,000 en efectivo del banco. Desafortunadamente, el vendedor pospone la firma del mismo para el día siguiente, obligando a la joven pareja a regresar a su apartamento y esconder el dinero. Ese sencillo acto destapa una enconada caja de Pandora y aquellos viejos rencores que habían suprimido vuelven a despertar. Esta intensa ópera prima de Schnitman está anclada por las potentes interpretaciones de Pilar Gamboa y Juan Barnerini como la joven pareja.

title: Lonely Stars - Theater #7 (1st Scr)
description: (1ST SCREENING)Lonely Stars/Estrellas Solitarias– Genre: Comedy/Drama/LGBTQMéxico/2015/94 min.Directed by Fernando UrdapilletaSpanish w/ English SubtitlesDrag queens and best friends Valentina and Joana dream, respectively, of becoming a famous pop star and of celebrating a belated quinceañera. Their lives take a surreal turn when Valentina, facing competition from a female singer hired by the owner of the underground club she performs at, begins to see and talk to the ghost of her favorite pop star and Joana accepts to take on some rather illicit jobs to raise money for her party. There is music, drama, danger, and divas galore in this over-the-top film that channels John Waters’ transgressive spirit.Las travestis y buenas amigas Valentina y Joana sueñan, respectivamente, con convertirse en una famosa estrella del pop y con celebrar una tardía fiesta quinceañera.Sus vidas dan un giro surrealista cuando Valentina, al enfrentar la competencia de una cantante contratada por el propietario del club alternativo para el cual actúa, comienza a ver y a hablar con el fantasma de su estrella del pop favorita y Joana acepta hacer algunos trabajitos ilegales con la intención de ahorrar dinero para su fiesta. Hay música, teatro, peligro, y un montón de divas en esta película desmesurada que evoca el espíritu transgresor de John Waters.Shown with: Gloria

title: Passage of Life / Pasaje de Vida   - Theater #5
description: Passage of Life/Pasaje de Vida – Genre: Drama/Romance/ThrillerArgentina/Spain/2015/112 min.Directed by Diego CorsiniSpanish w/ English SubtitlesMario reluctantly takes over the care of his father Miguel, an Argentine exile in Spain, after he suffers a debilitating stroke that leaves him senile. Miguel begins to recall the names of old friends and events; he keeps repeating one name in particular: Diana. These brief lapses lead Mario to research his father’s history as a young political activist in 1970s Argentina. Past and present collide in this drama about the open wounds that the country’s tragic history left on its survivors and on their descendants.Mario renuentemente acepta encargarse del cuidado de su padre Miguel, un exiliado argentino en España, tras éste sufrir un derrame cerebral que lo deja senil. Miguel comienza a recordar eventos y los nombres de viejos amigos; no deja de repetir uno en particular: Diana. Estos breves lapsos conducen a Mario a investigar la historia de su padre como un joven activista político en la Argentina de los años 70. El pasado y el presente chocan en este drama sobre las heridas abiertas que la trágica historia del país dejó en sus sobrevivientes y sus descendientes.

title: Boston Whitecaps at New York Rumble
description: The New York Rumble welcome the Boston Whitecaps for the second home game of the 2016 regular season. title: The Good Dinosaur
description: Taking place in an alternate timeline, the asteroid that destroyed the dinosaurs 65 million years ago safely passes over Earth. Years later, two dinosaurs named Henry and Ida who are farmers give birth to three children, Libby, Buck and Arlo. Although Libby and Buck easily adjust to the farming lifestyle, Arlo finds that he is too timid to work in such an environment. Henry decides that in order to give Arlo a sense of purpose, he puts him in charge of guarding their silo from pests and helps them set up a trap. While on guard, Arlo catches a feral cave boy, and is too reluctant to kill him so he sets him free.This extraordinarily charming film has been receiving shining reviews from critics and audiences due to it’s endearing characters and beautifully animated landscape. We are so thrilled to welcome this clever and adorable film to our big screen, but we’re definitely gearing up to bring a few Kleenex along with us.

title: Introduction to eTextiles
description: eTextiles is the combination of fabric and textiles with electronics, and is the foundation of wearable device prototyping. This class will cover the basic eTextiles concepts used in designing wearable devices. Students will learn a few sewing basics, basic electronics, and will study conductive materials and processes relevant to eTextiles. Students will also learn about current research and projects being done with eTextiles from both Art and Engineering disciplines. The class will conclude with students designing and making their own wearable device. A small single evening showcase will happen on 3/24 from 7-9pm.

title: Big Rig's Taproom Sessions w/ Amos The Transparent
description: Big Rig Brewery presents: Taproom Sessions w/ Amos the TransparentEnjoy delicious craft beer? Do you like intimate live performances? Join Big Rig Brewery at their Kanata brewery location on Saturday, January 30 for an evening of beer tastings, brewery tours, and an exclusive performance by one of the biggest treasures in Eastern Ontario's indie music scene, Amos The Transparent. Coming off the release of their acclaimed 2014 record This Cold Escape, Amos The Transparent are geared to play Big Rig Brewery's Tap Room, featuring many songs that gained them recognition and airplay across Canada.Your passes include one beer ticket! Space is extremely limited, so be sure to get your passes early!The Brewery will be opening their doors early for three tours before the music starts at 7:00 p.m. Sample Big Rig's diverse collection of award-winning craft beers and learn about their brewing process before Amos The Transparent hit the stage. Tours fill up quickly, so reserve a spot soon by purchasing your ticket and RSVPing to events@bigrigbrewery.com. Tours will take place at the following times:Tour #1: 4:30pmTour #2: 5:00pmTour #3: 5:30pm----------------Event details: Saturday, January 30Big Rig Brewery - 103 Schneider Rd. in Kanata (map here)Tickets: $15 in advanceDoors at 4:00pm - 9:00pm EndMusic starts at 7:00pm19+ Only----------------

title: Toronto Founders Breakfast MeetUp
description: We will get together to enjoy breakfast and network with other tech founders here in Toronto.  This will be our second founders breakfast and we would like  to hold them monthly.

title: Network Notes
description: We all believe in movie magic, but is it technically "magic"? So much hard work goes into the creation of a film, but who is really making it all happen? Who should we be thanking for all our favourite Hollywood moments?That's right. The studio executives!Join Evany Rosen and Kayla Lorette as they show us what really happens when studio executives must give notes to those pesky creatives and hopefully shape their movies into something that won't be box office poison.Network Notes will feature improvised scenes from nonexistent movies, harsh and likely nonsensical notes on those scenes, and an endless supply of complimentary bottled water! Special Guest:Jordan Moffatt as "Assistant"So come check out Network Notes......Because the worst notes make the best improv!

title: FORGE: Illustration Workshop with Caitlyn Murphy
description: In this unique workshop participants will work with professional  illustrator and artist Caitlyn Murphy to learn the basics of contemporary  illustration and drawing. After some fun practice exercises using acrylics, pencil crayons and gouache,  participants will create several artworks to take home with them and then expand on their new skills! Yes, you can draw cats if you want to.Caitlyn Murphy is an illustrator and artist based in Toronto. She was  featured in CMYK Magazine’s Top 100 New Creatives issue in 2013 and  2014, and won the Project 31 Illustration Award at OCADU for her thesis Anxious Days.  Selected clients include COPA, Polaris Music Prize, and City of Craft.  Her work has been published by Chronicle Books and she is currently  working on an artist book for Toronto publisher Swimmer’s GroupSome materials will be provided, but we encourage you to bring supplies you love to use!

title: The Barefoot Medium ~ Emma Smallbone
description: Emma will explain how she connects with spirit and will give evidence that our energy is eternal. Emma uses her ability to connect with spirit to bring you messages of love and light. She will also share information about how you too can connect with your loved ones.Spirit is communicating with us everyday...........why not listen?*not every ticket holder will receive a personal message

title: Reid Jamieson & Carolyn Mill In Concert
description: We are super excited to present Vancouver's Reid Jamieson and Carolyn Mill to open the 2015 - 2016 season. The duo excel with beautiful voices, incredible harmony, award-winning songs, and charm to spare.Reid Jamieson shines his light with an incredible voice, therapeutic lyrics, and magical way with melodies. A regular on Vinyl Cafe, and winner of the John Lennon Songwriting Contest (folk), he has recorded with Cowboy Junkies, Samantha Parton (Be Good Tanyas), Sarah Harmer and various members of Blue Rodeo. Reid can often be found performing as an entertaining duo with his saucy wife and songwriting partner Carolyn Mill. Along with the Lennon win, this creative couple wrote their way into the Vancouver Folk Music Festival by winning 1st prize in the Pickin' a Folk Star Contest. They just released their first album singing together titled Juniper’s Kitchen - it’s a little Johnny & June meets Fleetwood Mac - and all about the songs. You are going to love these two!Jaspar Lepak (pronounced JAS-per LEE-pack) ﷯is a folk/Americana songstress whose  remarkable gift for melody is only surpassed by her poetry. A child of the Sonoran Desert, her songs are deeply influenced by the many places she has called home: Tucson, Minneapolis, Durban (South Africa), and currently Seattle. Sweeping across landscapes with an emotional depth that is extraordinary, her lyrics expose a brave vulnerability while her clear, pure voice touches the heart. "you’ll find more than enough beauty and original charm to make you a fan.” ~ Rolling Stone South Africa

title: Living Your Best Life Workshop Series
description:
The Living Your Best Life Workshop Series Continues Saturday, October 24 from 11:00 am - 2:00 pm at Seasons 52.These inspiring workshops are being created to provide life tools and creative takeaways, which inspire you to live your best life.An incredible group of women participated in our June Workshop, enjoy some of the feedback received from them.I have to say an afternoon at the Living Your Best Life event was not only fun but very informative.  We had the opportunity to network with like-minded women in the area and learn about how to live a healthy, fun and enjoyable life.  I really enjoyed Lesa Mullins' speech talking about a new way to look at your thoughts and the world.  Much appreciation ladies for offering this event to the community…- Rebecca/ Atlantic Beach FLThe October 24 Workshop will provide: A safe and inclusive environment for personal work
Interactive and valuable exercises
Takeaways for attendees to continue progress post-workshop 
Opportunity to build new relationships with the facilitators and other guests
Topics will include overcoming: Fears
Negative self talk
Limiting beliefs
Stress
We will also address incorporating more of the following into your life: Gratitude
Creativity
Travel
Fun & Play
Click on ‘Register Now’ button to reserve your seat.  Lunch/Wine/Cocktail costs are at guests expense.  Great door prizes to be won!
$25 Early Bird Registration through October 10, 2015
$35 Registration Fee through October 23, 2015
$45 Day of Event
A portion of event proceeds will benefit Wolf Connection. You can learn more about them at wolfconnection.org.Meet Your Living Your Best Life Facilitators:Lesa Mullins, Founder of Sacred Spirit, LLCStacie Perron-Smith, Founder and Owner of SPS CoachingCarole Sullivan, Founder of Wellness VisionYour three professional facilitators joined forces to combine their energy and expertise because each care passionately about helping others create choice and possibilities, achieve higher levels of personal and professional success, and have the healthiest and best lifestyle.  Lesa, Stacie and Carole address differing, but important areas of our lives in order to bring balance of mind, body and spirit.

title: Lean Startup for High-growth Innovations iForum
description: This is an interactive learning event about the Lean Method "how to drive a startup, how to steer, when to turn, and when to persevere and grow a business with maximum acceleration"- Growth engines explored!There will be a presentation introducing the key concepts of the Lean Method, followed by interactive panel discussion.Bring your questions about your business and we'll apply the lean method to help you.

title: Intro to Bump&Grind Dance - Eastside
description: This fun sampler of Burlesque dance moves is great for every body! No dance experience required. In just an hour students learn the fundamentals of the Bump, Grind, Shimmy, and Shake, plus some fancy vintage moves from Burlesque stars of yesteryear!Wear comfortable yoga or dance clothes. Class is taught in bare feet, socks, or dance sneakers. Character shoes with ankle straps permitted.

title: World
description: Championship determines the best in the world of fast chess.two-day event where game lasts 3 minutes (and 2 seconds are added with each move). It’s a 21-round Swiss-style tournament that determines the World Chess Blitz Champion.is a three-day tournament where game lasts 15 minutes (with 10 seconds added after each move). It’s a 15-round Swiss style event that determines the World Chess Rapid Champion.

title: Men's Basketball Reunion
description: Come and join our Gryphon Men's Basketball Alumni for a reception during the Men’s Varsity home game vs. the Mercyhurst Lakers with complimentary hors D'oeurvres. Registration for the event allows you access to the entire program of events!We look forward to seeing you there! title: Showstopper
description: Showstopper is a big Hollywood musical, created right before the audience's eyes! Pulling together a top tier cast of musical improvisers, this show has all the action of a big Hollywood musical - love! drama! high energy group numbers! heartbreaking ballads! - all based on the audience's suggestions! This is an improvised musical infused with an explosion of ultra-high-energy, bright-and-sunshiney fun7 musical theatre performers set out to create their own legendary Hollywood movie musical. Will it turn into a Little Shop of Horrors? Will they Grease the audience? Will the sun come out tomorrow for this group? Your suggestions help drive the creation of a never-seen-before-and-never-seen-again musical!Starring:Kristian BruunMatty BurnsNicole DunnAlexandra HurleyStephanie MalekJosh MurrayNug Nahrgang  Musical Director: Jordan Armstrong

title: Suckling Pig Tacos & Beer Flight
description: Haven Gastropub's culinary team is delivering a dining experience to accompany our amazing beer list for Tuesday's Anniversary Party!If you're up for an afternoon of tacos and beer, look no further!From 4-6pm ONLY, and ONLY WITH A TICKETFor $40, you'll be served a stellar meal of tacos beside a tasting flight of 8 of our beers on tap. We're starting with the best tortillas. Food & Wine Magazine recently named Carlos Salgado of Taco Maria in Costa Mesa one of their Best New Chefs of 2015. He is producing some of the finest masa around, using heirloom organic & non-GMO corn from Masienda in New York City, and providing it to the best Mexican restaurants in Southern California.On top of that, we're rubbing a fat little suckling pig with coarse salt & achiote, stuffing it full of aromatics like fresh oregano and citrus fruit, and then roasting it in our oven until the skin gets super crispy. We'll chop that up and pile it atop 4 of those freshly pressed tortillas.On the side, you'll get a helping of refried beans, avocado salsa, roasted tomato salsa, house hot sauce, oregano pickled onions, fresh cilantro, cotija cheese, and fried pig ears tossed in salsa verde. Choose 8 of the AMAZING beers we have on tap, and you'll get a tasting pour of each to sniff, sip, and suck down!FOLLOW US @havengastropubChef de Cuisine Craig Brady (IG @chef_brady)Executive Sous Chef Zach Scherer (IG @zachscherer)Executive Chef Greg Daniels (IG @havengastrochef)Beverage Director Wil Dee (IG @wilartdee)Buy your tickets now! Note: NO REFUNDS will be providedTax and gratuity not included

title: eDonate to Charley's Fund
description: We are excited to welcome those invited to the Party in aid of Charley's Fund!Charley’s Party | August 30th_________________________________________________________________With an afternoon of champagne, Hor D'oeuvres, and DJs, we will be raising funds and awareness for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD) and giving back to the fighters battling the fatal disease.The event will be held between 3p.m. and 7p.m. and will host various dedicated DJs mixing carefully-selected eclectic sets of old school hip-hop, soul, and indie rock.________________________________________________________________This event is exclusive to invitees and their friends.DJ Lineup:DJ Dongo (from Peru)Daimaro (formerly known as Wünderkind)Josh Freud

title: HAMLET | Spencer Smith Park, Burlington
description: Driftwood Theatre proudly presents Hamlet, the world’s most famous play, like you’ve never seen it before. On stage outdoors in communities across Ontario, July 9 - August 16, 2015. The summer tour will feature a thrilling new adaptation by dramaturg Toby Malone that is unpredictable, unsettling and downright dangerous - Hamlet with the brakes off. This electrifying revenge-thriller pits one man against the world around him as he sacrifices everything and everyone he loves to avenge his father’s murder.Young Hamlet’s world is turned upside down when, after the death of his father, his mother quickly marries Hamlet’s uncle Claudius. When the ghost of Hamlet’s father appears before him to accuse Claudius of murder, Hamlet is set upon a course of action which will have significant consequences for everyone that he holds dear. Hamlet is gripping tragedy fueled by grief and framed by a world dominated by the politics of fear.Both newcomers to Hamlet and Shakespeare aficionados will delight in this version; a perfect match for Driftwood’s inventive theatrical style and our magical outdoor settings.

title: Moncton MX National
description: Riverglade MX ParkOne of the best attended events on the national schedule, RIverglade MX Park always delivers an entertaining weeeknd of motocross racing. The eighth of ten rounds, this is when the top runners make their final push towards their respective championship. This has to be the best round where spectators get in the middle of the track to witness the high flying action that surrounds them. It's always our favourite!Saturday is amateur day.Sunday is Pro Day - practice starts at 8am, qualifiers start at 9am, and racing begins at 12pm. Camping available on-site.Directions to Tracks:Take the Silver Fox Irving Big Stop exit on the Trans Canada Highway just outside of Moncton, near Salisbury.Head towards Highway 112 (Coles Island Road), and turn left at the intersection and follow the road for several miles.  Riverglade MX Park (and the Riverglade stock car track) is located on the left.Driving instructions from Moncton Airport:Take Highway #15 to Rte.#2 (TCH) go west until exit #433 at Salisbury Big Stop.Go right on 112 one km to Homestead road turn left and go 5.5 km to track on left.Driving instructions from Quebec: Take Rte.#2 east to Exit 423 to St. John/Petitcodiac turn left on Homestead Road and go 5 km to track or continue on Rte. #2 to exit 433 at Salisbury Big Stop and go north on 112 as in west bound directions.Driving instructions from St. John NB:If coming from St. John NB, take Rte. #1 to Riverglade Exit and then east on Homestead Road 5 km to track. (Stevie Wonder could find RGMX).Ticket Prices:WeekendAdult        - advanced tickets $40, at-the-gate $50Under 12  - advanced tickets $25, at-the-gate $30Pre-schoolers (Under 4-years-old) FREESunday Pro DayAdult        - advanced tickets $30, at-the-gate $35Under 12  - advanced tickets $15, at-the-gate $20Pre-schoolers (Under 4-years-old) FREEHow to follow the series: Internet – www.mxnationals.ca, www.rockstarmotofest.ca, www.cmrcracing.com, www.mxpmag.com, www.directmotocross.com Facebook – www.facebook.com/CMRCMX, www.facebook.com/MXPMagazineTwitter: https://twitter.com/CMRCRacingGoogle +: https://plus.google.com/u/0/b/118314871843388361111/118314871843388361111/postsYouTube: www.youtube.com/cmrcracingInstagram: http://instagram.com/cmrcmxPinterest: http://www.pinterest.com/cmrcmxVine: https://vine.co/u/1058903116365598720Live Lap Times: Watch how each lap unfolds on your mobile device www.mobile.cmrcracing.com, or tablet or computer at www.cmrcracing.com.

description: Join us for a fantastic night of fun, painting, drinks, and snacks! Tickets include admission to uPaint Events painting class, instruction for 2 - 2.5 hours, music, free digital photography, and all supplies to create your painting!Light snacks provided. This event is BYOB - Bring your own Beer (or Wine). Fundraiser is to support the Marine Museum of Fall River.On street parking available or free lot parking a half block east of museum (there is a sign).Handicapped accessible.Please arrive 15 - 20 minutes before the event start time to choose your seats, place food and drink orders, and get comfortable.uPaint Events is a mobile paint studio based out of New Bedford, MA. We teach social painting classes in almost any location: homes, offices, local restaurants, and more!uPaint Events is an exciting and creative experience for any skill level. Recommended ages 10+!

title: Pandeiro Workshop with Maninho Costa
description: Maninho Costa, director of Batucada Carioca will be teaching a 2-day pandeiro workshop for anyone interested in learning Brazilian rhythms such as Samba, Partido Alto, Bossa, Baiao and more. Workshop is open to any level. Because of high demand, workshop participants will be divided into two groups, beginners and intermediate. Beginners are students who are new to the pandeiro and must still acquire the very basic technique. Intermediates are students who have some knowledge of the instrument and their basic technique already firm. Please RSVP and BYOP.. (Bring your own PANDEIRO)Monday June 8, 2015 & Monday June 15, 2015Beginners 7pm to 8:30pm Intermediate 8:30 to 10pm Private lessons for all samba instruments are also available contact batucadacarioca@gmail.com

title: COMBUSTION festival | TUESDAY | 9:30PM
description: From May 25-30, 2015, the COMBUSTIONfestival will set the Bad Dog Comedy Theatre ablaze with a week-long celebration of unscripted comedy, improvised theatre, unexpected collaborations, and large-scale mischief. Returning to Toronto after a four year hiatus, COMBUSTION brings together some of the most exciting, talented, boundary-pushing, genre-bending, industry-leading improvisers we know to showcase what they do best and to collaborate together on festival-exclusive projects and shows.
