title: La Boom! A Dance Benefit for Haiti
description: A Dance Benefit for Haiti.All proceeds go toward our maternity center in Leogane, Haiti. Funds raised will directly pay birthing costs in an area hardest hit by the earthquake in 2010.  226,000 people are estimated to have died in the 2010 Haiti earthquake, and Leogane was 4 miles from the quake’s epicenter.The quake crisis has lessened, but not the need for maternity care, and especially in the Leogane area. Maternal mortality rates in Haiti are the worst in the western hemisphere. This is because only 25% of births in Haiti are attended by a health professional. In contrast, 95% of births are attended by a health professional in the neighboring Dominican Republic.Event Details:Samba dance performance and instruction from Bella Diva DanceDance lessons, Haitian inspired appetizers, and drinks included w/ ticketTickets and Parking:Please bring printed or electronic copy of the ticket to the event.Tickets also available at the door.Limited parking at the Posner Center for International Development and street parking availableFor more information visit our website: www.globalhealthconnections.org oremail us at info@globalhealthconnections.org.

title: Flexitarian Feast by Chef Daniel Holloway: April
description:
Inspired by the success of the Vegan Supper Clubs, Urban Acorn’s Executive Chef Daniel Holloway creates a new monthly concept dinner that incorporates hand-made dishes for Gluten-Free*, Vegan and Omnivorous guests. Join him for this inaugural family style feast filled with old favourites and new delights.Family Style Dinner Menu(V+) Vegan (GF) Gluten Free (O) OmnivoreEntrées

(V+)(GF) Roasted Cashew & Granny Smith Apple Salad with Shaved Fennel, Rhubarb and Quinoa

(V+)(GF) Roasted Parsnip and Yukon Gold Gratin with ‘Béchamel’
le Plat Principal

(V+)(GF) Handmade Pierogi stuffed with Sweet Potato Topped with Apple Butter

(V+)(GF) Rustic Squash and Winter Vegetable Ratatouille with Toasted Fenugreek

(O)(GF) Seared Organic Cornish Hen served with Carrot-Lemongrass Mousse and Micro Sprouts
Desserts

(V+)(GF) Warm Dark Chocolate and Mocha Flourless Chocolate Brownie

(V+)(GF) Merlot Poached Bartlett Pear served with Whipped Lemon Curd

(V+)(GF) Vegan French Macarons
{About the Dinner}For those of you not familiar with family style think of your Thanksgiving dinner... Multiples platters of food on the table served all at once where guests can help themselves. In this case the dinner will be served in two waves: entrées and desserts. The aim is for everyone to enjoy dinner together; all items will be vegan and gluten-free with at least one meat item (which will also be gluten-free). Dinners are 19+.{About Chef Daniel Holloway}Executive Chef Daniel Holloway of Urban Acorn Catering believes great food is achieved by harnessing bold flavours from humble ingredients. With over 15 years in the culinary industry, he has catered for high profiled clients such as Margaret Atwood, Prince, former Lieutenant Governor Michaëlle Jean and Vegan athlete turned deputy general for the green part of Canada, George Laraque. Chef Holloway’s signature style can be best described as refined comfort food, a blend of rustic Canadian cuisine with fine French techniques. After studying Culinary Management at Humber College, Holloway began a four year apprenticeship under Chef Tobias Pohl-Weary former owner and head chef of Red Canoe Bistro in Burlington. He became a sous chef, later a pastry chef, then branched out on his own to launch a private chef business in the Halton/Peel region.  Looking to bridge the social gap between vegans and omnivores, Holloway moved to Toronto in 2012 and joined forces with Haitian partner Marie Fitrion. They created Urban Acorn LTD., a Toronto-based sustainable plant-based food company focused on connecting food and community. By collaborating with other chefs and like-minded local businesses, Holloway aims to create a communal connection to food and celebrate its diversity regardless of dietary restrictions. His food philosophy is simple…Food Should Unite, Not Divide People.

title: Operation Freedom Deception & Operation Freedom 2
description: Buffalo Niagara Film Festival                                                                                                                                         Operation Freedom Deception  (F, 47m)Operation Freedom Deception 2 (F, 89)

title: Comedy Bingo!
description: COMEDY BINGO combines everyone's favourite things in life: Saturday night, laughing at people and yelling BINGO! It’s half comedy show and half game show. It usually happens at The Making-Box in Guelph but for a few special nights this spring it's coming to The Bad Dog Comedy Theatre!Featuring: Some Bad Dog Rep Players, some special guests from The Making-Box Brigade, your host Jay Reid and more! “Get your bling on and get your bing on, Holmes!” –Edna TruthchurchFAQDo I get a Bingo Card? You betcha!And I can win prizes? Sheeeyeah! Some in the form of DRINKS!And I can scream Bingo? Yes. The louder the better.How do I win? By getting a Bingo, dummy! Get a line, get four corners, or get the coveted Making-Box box. Or, you can win by championing The Lightning Round or The Thunder Round! So easy.So, it's Bingo. But it's also funny? BINGO!HOW DOES IT WORK? Instead of numbers, each COMEDY BINGO card is filled with hilarious improv-style games that will be picked at random and performed by Bad Dog Rep Players and The Making-Box Brigade. They play the games based on your suggestions AND YOU PLAY BINGO!

title: ARVYDAS SABONIS 11 (March 15)
description: "Arvydas Sabonis.11" ­ is a documentary movie about the legendary Lithuanian basketball player. This movie is made for Lithuanian basketball legend Arvydas Sabonis with an aim to mention his 50th anniversary celebration. Arvydas Sabonis is the most famous athlete in Lithuania, who has been proclaiming and still proclaims our country with his sport achievements all over the world. We finally understood the importance of our legend only after we had a chance to meet and talk with NBA legends, the world famous coaches, teammates of A. Sabonis, managers and his main opponents on the pitch.

title: Superkick'd Live! at Variety Village
description: Superkick'd will be raising money for Variety Village! All of your favorite Superkick'd Stars will be in action!

title: The International Fusion Doc Challenge Showcase
description: The International Fusion Doc ChallengeThe International Fusion Doc Challenge dared young filmmakers from all around the world to create short documentaries (4-7 minutes) in five days from start to finish. Contestants were given a theme and a choice of two genres. The winners will be announced after this premiere screening and awarded $3,500. The top 12 films will also premiere globally on TheAudienceAwards.com in March and the audience's choice film will with $1,000. The top 20 films from competition receive an exclusive 18-month licensing deal with Fusion Media and will be featured across Fusion's broadcast and digital platforms. Films include:LIBERO, MIDDLE RIGHT by Tucker LucasMOMENTS OF GLITCH by Mary HoranWHAT IF by Alison WithersWAKE UP by Erin BabbinTHE HOUSE OF TOM FINLAND by Andrea LewisGMOTIONAL by Tom StaggHECTOR PICARD by Roberto GarciaESCAPE by Youngsun YunJERRY BROWN'S BUCKING BULLS by Michael Price3RD CULTURE KIDS by Jeremy RubierQUIET CULTURE by Cody MartinI AM JULI by Tarryn Crossman

title: I PUT A HIT ON YOU - Jan 9 - 14
description: "Canning and Ashmore hit the right chemistry of a couple uniting in the face of a rather absurd and dangerous situation..." - Kevin Jagernauth, IndieWireAfter her marriage proposal to Ray (Aaron Ashmore) is awkwardly rejected, Harper (Sara Canning) gets really drunk and in an attempt to blow off some steam, posts an ad online offering to trade her engagement ring for Ray’s death. The thing is, someone replies. And they sound serious. Fearful of what she might have done, Harper runs to Ray’s apartment in the middle of the night to warn him. At first Ray takes the situation lightly; it’s just some nut job online messing with her. But as the night goes on and a mysterious white van stalks Ray’s apartment, suddenly everything becomes more real. As they try to stay calm and deal with this bizarre situation like regular people, they’re forced to confront the downfall of their relationship and figure out where it all went wrong before the hitman takes away any chance of them getting back together.

title: Vegan Supper Club Series: Gluten-Free & Kimchi
description:

title: SWISH Launch Party Hamilton
description: Spirited Women in Wine, Suds & HoochCalling all women behind bars, barrels and sticky laptops! We’re gathering to launch SWISH—an industry group for ladies who earn their living from boozy beverages. Our purpose? To network with fellow women in all aspects of the drinks world, deepen our palates, intensify our knowledge, and find opportunities to collaborate —all while tasting plenty of fine liquids. Who’s invited? Any female who earns a living from suds, wine or hooch. Please spread the word to your colleagues. (And sorry, no dicks allowed). HAMILTON LAUNCH PARTY:Eat, drink & socialize: Lady chefs + Lady boozehounds = Palate Bliss!Our Hamilton Launch Event features 3 food and drink pairings from local lady chefs & boozehounds.   Sonja North from Garden Brewer's - Hamilton's newest brewery - will be serving their flagship beer Piperales.  This smoky amber ale will be paired with a smoky blue cheese, courtesy of Mickey McGuire's Cheese, and a dash of local Three Bees Honey from beekeeper Brandi Lee MacDonald.  Amber Dawkins of Dillon's Distillery is crafting a grapefruit-infused gin cocktail with muddled cucumber to pair with these delicious offerings from Erin Dunham at Hamilton's beloved bar Two Black Sheep:                                Slice of chilled, stuffed capon breast with prosciutto, lemon and herbsMasala bacon wrapped tiger shrimp with cucumber raitaSlaw of Asian pear, mango, sugar snaps, nappa, mint, lime and cashewsHaley Thompson of Red Oak Wines & Spirits will have two wines on offer:  GreenLane Estates 2012 Cabernet Franc and Cooper's Hawk Vineyard 2008 Cabernet Merlot Reserve.  The wine will be paired with chocolate!!All this for only $10!Plus you get to meet, socialize and network with other women in the industry. The Hamilton event is being held at Mills Hardware (95 King Street East) from 7-9pm on Monday November 10th.Hope to see you at the launch event. Your ticket includes inventive food and drink pairings from six talented lady chefs and booze-makers. We'll network, hear your wishes for SWISH, and let you know about opportunities to volunteer for our Board of Directors.See you on Monday, November 10th, 7-9 PMMills Hardware, 95 King St E., Hamilton (5 min. walk from GO station)Thanks to our sponsors:Dillon's Small Batch DistillersTwo Black SheepGarden BrewersMickey McGuire's CheeseGreenlane Estates WineryCooper's Hawk Vineyard*Any proceeds from ticket sales will be donated to Hamilton Halton Breast Cancer Services.SWISH. Drinking with Intelligence—since, well, forever.

title: Tips and Tricks for an Eco Chic lifestyle!
description: Gabby started her own Eco Chic Wedding and Event Planning company called 'Cause We Can Events and loves coming up with creative ways to "green" your event whether it's a holiday party for 10 or a wedding weekend for 200. She will be sharing some valuable tips on how to make your next event Eco Chic! Cristina has come out to the world as the Closeted Activist. There are so many different closets we let ourselves live in to fit in the norm, mostly to avoid the fearful thought of rejection. Whether it's "I am vegan", "I am bisexual", or "I believe in the power of the universe", she will share some insightful thoughts, products and recipes in order to help you embrace your inner Eco Chic!

title: Stamp Carving Workshop
description: Stamp Carving WorkshopLearn the tools and basics involved in carving soft linoleum. The materialused will allow beginners to create a stamp with very little effort.  Participants will learn how to transfer drawings or pre-existing images on-hand onto the lino, and focus on a few carving techniques that will transform drawings into a beautiful stamp. Participants will take home a few greeting cards and/or gift tags they have created using their new carving knowledge!Instructor: Michael Viglione of Kid IcarusMaximum particpants: 10

title: Indie Alehouse Home Brew Tap Takeover
description: We are doing it again! Indie Alehouse has Partnered up with Toronto Beer week to put on our second annual Home brew Tap Takeover. We put out a call to all home brewers to submit their recipes for a chance to come in a brew that recipe on Indie Alehouse's pilot system. we intended on choosing 16 but there were so many great recipes that we expanded and ended up with 21. Some of the results are pretty interesting!Here are the details for the event. - Taking place on Sunday September 14th. There is one session that starts at 1pm and run until 4pm Tickets are $10 and this  includes - entry into the event ( it was a very packed event last year), a custom glass, and two drink tokens.The event will be held at Indie Alehouse's Barrel House at 165 Geary Ave. ( Dupont and Dufferin) in order to accommodate more people. Drink tokens will be available for purchase,  one ticket = $1.50. One token will get you a 4 oz pour two tokens for an 8 oz pour. Food will be available for purchase on site.  Please be advised that because the beer was brewed on a pilot system they are small batches so some will run out sooner than others. There will be plenty of beer but if you want to try all of them we suggest being punctual. It is a cash only event so please come prepared. This is a 19+ event.

title: Speakeasy Tour at Museum of American Gangster
description: Discover the secrets of a former speakeasy on St. Mark's Place in the East Village, with access to mafia tunnel escape routes and artifacts, like one of two original safes that held enough money to buy the entire Lower East Side. The tour guide from the Museum of American Gangster will also give us a walkthrough of the museum that will conclude with a vintage cocktail at the bar of the theater 80 St. Marks, an area authentic to the original speakeasy.

title: Entrepreneur & HGTV Star Leura Spielman at GA!
description: Leura Spielman is a professional interior designer turned entrepreneur.After working as the senior designer for one of the world's top interior design firms ( Architectural Digest Top 100, International Interior Designer of the Year, and as seen on Bravo's "Million Dollar Decorators") Leura launched her own interior design business Leura Fine Interiors ( also featured on HGTV.)Leura believes in the power of great design and how it can transform the way you work, live, and love and she is very excited to share her story with us! ABOUT YOUNG FEMALE ENTREPRENEURSKatie & Gabby host the Los Angeles chapter of this non profit group that gets together monthly to share stories, enjoy new experiences and meet other young female entrepreneurs in the Los Angeles area. The events are meant to get women in business together and brainstorm new ideas, discuss challenges or just to have a cocktail and socialize! Have an idea for the next YFE event? Email Katie & Gabby at: YFELosAngeles@gmail.com

title: Laserblast: MECHANICAL VIOLATOR HAKAIDER
description: In the bowels of an abandoned building, a man breaks out of his giant chains. He morphs into a black clad superhero with a glowing brain. He jumps onto his bad ass motorcycle.He sets his mega shotgun to explosion! He rides into Jesus Town. He kicks some ROBOT ANGEL BUTT! From the mind of Director/Special effects designer Keita Amemiya comes an energetic burst of science fiction excitement that mixes up the best parts of Japanese sentai (superhero) shows, post-apocalyptic cinema and bone crunching action. Originally, released as an hour long special in cinemas, this LASER BLAST presentation of MECHANICAL VIOLATOR HAKAIDER will be a one of a kind video remix that will re-create experience of stumbling onto mind melting entertainment in the wee hours of SATURDAY MORNING TELEVISION - with all the wacky commercials intact!And as an added bonus, we’ll also be screening outrageous excerpts from the hysterical Americanization of the cult anime series TEKKAMAN!

title: Andean Flavours 2014
description: Discover the rich flavours and natural products from South America. Try and learn about these ethnic products and how to invigorate your menu with them.Join us on May 26th at the 3rd annual Andean Flavours Gourmet Tasting experience!"Andean Flavours" is Entertainment, Education and Experience, which includes a  Seminar "Ancient Flavours" for Chefs, and a Trade Show, where you can learn and also find the most exclusive, ethnic, healthy, organic, ingredients and products from Peru, Bolivia, Ecuador, Chile and Colombia.The exhibition and products for sale like: Quinoa, Sacha Inchi, Maca, Chia, Olive Oil, Chocolate, Coffee, Avocado oil, Exotic salsas, most of them are gluten free, sustainable, raw, non GMO, rich in omega 3-6-9 and high in proteins.Your ticket will give you access to enjoy five recipes, made by local prestigious chefs.They  will be cooking on live and combining with products and ingredients  from the Andean Region.You will also have access to samples offered by Wines of Chile and  demos of food and natural juices, live music and much more.Recipes - Perfomance live by Chef at Seminar.1.- Maca-herb crusted lamb chops, artichoke salsa.2.- Quinoa and summer vegetables salad with Peruvian hot peppers vinagrette.3.- Halibut's ceviche with sacha inchi nuts.4.- Merken  smoked chili pepper, spiked shrimp, exotic fruit drizzle.5.- Hearts of Palm dip, living sprouts.6.- Quinoa noodles with Avocado Oil  & tomato-palmito-artichoke salsa.The exhibitors are growers and companies from the Andean region with local presence in Canada.  Some of them:  Pacari Chocolate from Ecuador www.pacarichocolate.comEcoCanopy Andino www.flotrading.comOceania www.oceaniaimportexport.comPucara International www.pucara.caSelect Wine  www.selectwines.ca Media Partner : The  Wine Ladies www.thewineladies.com among others.If you are Chef, please register for the seminar "Ancient Flavours" at no cost,  just provide your ID as a chef. The Seminar will start at 5pm until 6pm.If you have courtesy ticket please click  in "Free courtesy ticket" and insert you code.Buy your tickets now!

title: Blue Earth~ Manifesting Magic Forest Festival
description: We are so happy bring you the 2nd edition of our forest festival offering a fusion of distinct spaces, talented performances, live & electronic music, creative artistic expressions and holistic healing energies. This year the festival will be centered on the Earth and all the beauty and wonder she gives us. Our major focus is expose people to the amazing music we have in our local communities and to create a space for people to connect with themselves, each other and the Earth.

title: Whisky Business
description:
(version française à suivre)

On Saturday, November 12, 2016, join us for part travelogue, part history lesson, and certainly a multi-sensory experience. You’ll taste 5 different whiskies with 5 epicurean food pairings.

Geoffrey J Skeggs, master sommelier, will walk you through how various influences determine the distinct characteristics in particular whiskies, the importance of ageing, and the process of maturation.

Creative food pairings are thoughtfully prepared and sponsored by The Swan at Carp.

In addition to the whisky and food pairings, there will be a selection of extraordinary prizes for raffle. The Diefenbunker is a not-for-profit, registered charity. By attending and contributing to this event you are helping us to preserve the Bunker and support our educational programming.



Event Info

Saturday, November 12, 2016

7:00 pm – 10:00 pm

Doors open at 6:30 pm

Optional Special Exhibitions Tour at 6:30 pm (reserve your spot at checkout)





Ticket Information

Tickets must be purchased in advance. There will not be tickets available at the door.

If you would like to pay by cheque or cash, please contact events@diefenbunker.ca.

Tax receipts are available for a portion of your ticket upon request.



Get Involved

Sponsorship opportunities are available as well as raffle donations, please contact Kelly Eyamie at k.eyamie@diefenbunker.ca or call 613-839-0007

Volunteer at our event! We’re always looking for extra hands to help us serve food and set up the event. We’d love to have new volunteers join our team! Email Lindsey Jansen at volunteer@diefenbunker.ca or call 613-839-0007



FAQs

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

Attendees must be at least 19 years of age to attend this event.

What is the dress code?

Come dressed in your best 60’s inspired attire, or enjoy yourself in smart casual wear.

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

The Diefenbunker offers ample free parking to all attendees and a Designated Driver ticket at a discounted fare.

While not accessible by public transit, you can bus to the Brookstreet hotel and take a short taxi ride to the Bunker.

What is the refund policy?

No refunds will be issued after Wednesday November 9.

Do I get a Charitable Tax Receipt for my order?

Upon request, the Diefenbunker will issue a tax receipt to the ticket purchaser for the eligible portion of your ticket.


Affaire de whisky

La 5e collecte de fonds et dégustation de whisky 

Le samedi 12 novembre 2016, joignez-vous à nous pour une expérience relevant à la fois du carnet de voyage et de la leçon d'histoire, et certainement multi-sensorielle. Vous dégusterez cinq whiskys différents accompagnés de cinq mets épicuriens.

Le maître sommelier Geoffrey J Skeggs vous guidera dans une découverte des diverses influences qui déterminent les caractéristiques distinctes des whiskys, en particulier l’importance du vieillissement et le procédé de maturation.

Les mets empreints de créativité sont soigneusement préparés et parrainés par The Swan at Carp.

En plus des accords mets et whiskys, il y aura une sélection de prix extraordinaires offerts en tirage. Le Diefenbunker est un organisme de bienfaisance sans but lucratif enregistré. En participant et en contribuant à cet évènement vous nous aidez à préserver le Bunker et vous soutenez nos programmes éducatifs.



Renseignements sur l’évènement 

Samedi le 12 novembre 2016

De 19 h à 22 h

Ouverture des portes à 18 h 30

En option : visite des expositions spéciales à 18 h 30 (Réservez votre place en finalisant votre commande).



Renseignements sur les billets

Les billets doivent être achetés à l’avance. Aucun billet ne sera disponible à la porte.

Si vous souhaitez payer par chèque ou en espèces, veuillez communiquer avec Events@Diefenbunker.ca .

Des reçus d’impôt pour une partie du coût du billet sont disponibles sur demande. 



Impliquez-vous 

Nous avons aussi des opportunités de commandite et vous pouvez offrir des prix pour le tirage. Veuillez communiquer avec Kelly Eyamie à k.Eyamie@Diefenbunker.ca ou composez le 613-839-0007.

Soyez bénévoles lors de notre évènement! Nous avons toujours besoin d’aide pour le service et la mise en place de l’évènement. Nous serions ravis d’accueillir de nouveaux bénévoles dans notre équipe! Communiquez avec Lindsey Jansen à volunteer@diefenbunker.ca ou composez le 613-839-0007.



Foire aux questions

Doit-on présenter une carte d’identité ou y a-t-il un âge minimum pour participer à l’évènement?

Les participants doivent être âgés d’au moins 19 ans pour participer à cet évènement.



Quel est le code vestimentaire?

Venez habillés dans vos plus beaux atours inspirés des  années 1960 ou prenez plaisir à vous vêtir de manière élégante et décontractée!



Quelles sont les options de transport et de stationnement pour cet évènement?

Le Diefenbunker dispose de stationnement gratuit pour tous les participants et offre un billet de conducteur désigné à tarif réduit.

Le Diefenbunker n’est pas accessible par transport en commun, mais il est possible de se rendre à l’hôtel Brookstreet par autobus et ensuite au Bunker avec une courte course en taxi.

Quelle est la politique de remboursement?

Aucun remboursement ne sera effectué après le mercredi 9 novembre.



Puis-je obtenir un reçu pour fins d’impôt pour ma commande?

Le Diefenbunker émettra un reçu d’impôt à l’acheteur de billets, pour la partie admissible (sur demande).

title: Official Paisley Park Tour VIP Dec. 23
description:
Paisley Park, Prince’s extraordinary private estate and production complex in Chanhassen, Minnesota, will open for daily public tours starting October 6, 2016. Fans will have the unprecedented opportunity to experience first-hand what it was like for Prince to create, produce and perform inside this private sanctuary and remarkable production complex.

Paisley Park tour tickets are only available in advance via online purchase and are NOT available for purchase at Paisley Park.  Ticket holders will only be permitted entry to the Paisley Park parking lot 20 minutes prior to their tour start time.  Ticket holders must depart within ten minutes following the completion of their tour.

Throughout the experience, visitors will see artifacts from Prince’s personal archives, including iconic concert wardrobe, awards (his seven GRAMMY® Awards, a Golden Globe Award, and an Academy Award® for the film “Purple Rain”), musical instruments, artwork, rare music and video recordings, concert memorabilia, automobiles and motorcycles.

title: Future Learning 2020 Summit
description:
Visit https://www.edcast.com/corp/summit2016/ for full event information.

You are invited to the 2nd annual Future Learning 2020 Summit presented by EdCast taking place at the Computer History Museum in Mountain View, California on Friday, Oct. 14, with a welcome reception on Thursday evening, Oct. 13.

The summit promises to be a fantastic event for senior leaders interested in the changing landscape of training and knowledge sharing. The summit will explore the lifelong learning arc, and the role of networks and community in that journey. The rich and deep discussion will combine keynote presentations, panel discussions, ignite talks, and an open conversation.

Get the agenda and event info here!

title: Exporting 101 Bootcamp
description:
THIS WORKSHOP IS FOR YOU IF YOU'RE A CURRENT CANADIAN EXPORTER, OR IF YOU ARE THINKING ABOUT EXPORTING IN THE FUTURE. 

EXPORTING 101 BOOTCAMP IS AN INTERACTIVE WORKSHOP DESIGNED TO ENSURE YOU HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE, RESOURCE AND TOOLS NEEDED TO BECOME A PROFICIENT CANADIAN EXPORTER.



IF ANY OF THE BELOW APPLY TO YOU, YOU’RE A GOOD FIT FOR THE PROGRAM.

YOU ARE:


	Seeking ways to find new      customers in the USA and internationally?
	Worried about overpaying      duties, taxes and shipping charges when shipping to foreign countries?
	Frustrated about losing      sales opportunities because of the uncertainties with exporting your products      to the USA and internationally?
	Wondering what you need to      do now, so that your products are export ready?
	Frustrated with all of the      jargon associated with international shipping?
	Unsure about new      regulations coming out that might impact your business?
	Curious to know what      regulations and documentation are required for you to effectively ship to      the USA and internationally?
	Interested in meeting      other exporters to share best practices

WHAT YOU'LL WALK AWAY WITH:


	A definitive list of      private and government resources that you can utilize to find new      international customers
	A comprehensive      understanding of importing into a foreign country, so you are not left      overpaying any costs, or taking on any unnecessary risk.
	Comprehend industry      jargon, so you’ll no longer be left in the dark
	Understand trade      agreements to better target new customers
	Understand the nuances      associated with all the different modes of transportation so you’ll know      which one best suites your particular situation.

	Best practices for exporting,      so you’ll feel confident that you’re making the right shipping decisions

WE GUARANTEE YOU’LL LEAVE WITH THE TOOLS TO ENSURE YOUR COMPANY MAKE THE BEST SHIPPING DECISION EVERY TIME. ONLY SIX SEATS REMAINING!

title: The Pre Madonnas and The Bright Side
description:
Ready for a FREE hilarious night of sketch comedy? Join The Pre Madonnas and The Bright Side for an outrageous, laugh-out-loud funny sketch comedy showcase bringing together members from both sketch comedy groups!

Whether you like your comedy dirty or silly, slapstick or satire, this show will have something for you!

The groups that previously brought you breakdancing anarchist squirrels, the crazy antics of Jaspurr the cat, karaoke mishaps, and a one-man Muppet Theater, are joining forces to create a show that should not be missed!

Come out to see and support two of Hampton Road's own sketch comedy groups at the intimate Push Comedy Theater in the heart of Norfolk's new Neon Arts District.

Tickets are FREE and can be reserved ahead of time or at the door. We highly recommend reserving tickets in advance, and arriving at the theater early to get a great seat!

The Bright Side:In early 2015, Andrea Bourguignon, Matt Cole, Brian Garraty, and Drew Richard decided to join forces and The Bright Side was born! The group describes their particular brand of comedy as a celebration of the absurd world in which we all exist. Audiences at a Bright Side show can expect to see polished and smart comedy that reflects the group members’ personal life experiences.

The Pre Madonnas:Way, way back, in a time before the flood, a group of students now known as The Pre Madonnas met through improv and sketch comedy classes at the Push Comedy Theater. It didn't take long before they realized their undeniable comedic (and sexual) chemistry and set out to form a comedy supergroup. In August 2015, the group formed over cheap, delicious tacos and a shared sense of narcissism.

Nate Fender (the old man)Evan Grummell (the brain)Evan Hartley (the hair)Bobby Mercer (the gun show)Amber Nettles (the sass)Brittany Shearer (the cat lady)Barrett Sigmon (the bro)

The Pre Madonnas and The Bright Side Present: Make Sketch Great AgainFriday, August 19, 10 PMFREE SHOW

Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street.

--

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: August Debauchery!
description: Debauchery is: queers stripping for queers in hot, anti-oppressive space, raising money for organizations that serve the queer community. The show features stripteases, tons of audience interaction and even birthday lap dances onstage! Be sure to bring plenty of dollar bills -- a portion of the proceeds goes to non-profits providing health and social services within the queer community.This month's show benefits our community fund!**Accessibility** Neighbours is wheelchair accessible via the main entrance to the bar (located in the alley). There is a ramp between the door and the box office, and ample space for wheelchairs in the audience space. The show is ASL-Interpreted.Fragrance free request: Please join us in ensuring accessibility for beloved community members with chemical sensitivity and chronic illness by not bringing fragrances or scents on your clothes, hair, or skin from colognes and perfumes, scented laundry detergent, hair and body products, natural products, and essential oils. You can prepare in advance by not using products with fragrance, or by using fragrance free, non-toxic products. Two multi-stall all-gender restrooms are available.Information for scent sensitive people:Neighbors is not a scent free space. Scented cleaning products are used in all areas, including hand soap in the bathroom. Additionally,cigarette smoke from the smoking area in the alley drifts into the main performance space inside, fog is used on the dance floor, and many patrons are not scent free. Please protect yourself accordingly.

title: Jack Droppers & the Best Intentions
description:
Jack Droppers & the Best IntentionsJuly 22, 8PM$5 advance online tickets, $8 day of show

Jack Droppers was born in Grand Rapids, MI, but until recently had spent almost all his life outside of the city. Like his new home in GR, JD's latest musical project is a homecoming of sorts. The Americana rock & roll that Jack Droppers & the Best Intentions play reflects a blend of the Springsteen cassettes he inherited and the garage-rock scene of Central Florida where he grew up. Droppers is joined by Laura Hobson (of Antrim Dells), Garrett Stier (of Stationary Travelers), Devin Sullivan, Haley Sullivan, Josh Holicki and James Kessel Jr. for an honest, rough-around-the-edges, and robust rock & roll sound.

title: JFL42 presents LAST LAFF: THE JERK
description:
With stand-up by K Trevor Wilson!Hosted by Amanda Brooke Perrin!Wednesday, July 20th8:00 PM"I was born a poor black child..."

Steve Martin stars as Navin R. Johnson, the loveable and dim adopted son of a poor black sharecropper family. Johnson decides to go out on his own to discover his true identity and make his way in the world, but comes across several ridiculous and hilarious hurdles along the way in this classic rags-to-riches story. After THE JERK released and Steve Martin first hit the silver screen in this powerfully hilarious debut, critics had no problem reminding audiences that he was the "arrow-in-the-head-guy" from Saturday Night Live, but, it quickly became apparent that his comedic genius translated to any screen, stage, or platform he happened to be on. Now often considered to be one of the funniest movies of all time, this movie is a striking balance of intelligent wit and outright oddball stupidity, and we can't wait to watch it again with you! Thanks to JFL42, this screening will be preceded by a side-splitting stand-up act by K Trevor Wilson, self described as the Man-Mountain of Comedy and hosted by the very funny Amanda Brooke Perrin. Join us every month for a new comedy feature and stand-up pairing!

title: Robots vs. Unicorns: CONAN THE BARBARIAN
description: In 1968, a tirelessly ambitious Austrian bodybuilder arrived in America. Despite a thick accent and all-but-unpronounceable name, the sheer force of Arnold Schwarzenegger's personality proved even bigger than his biceps. The five-time Mr. Universe winner set his sights on Hollywood early. Despite an inauspicious debut (as "Arnold Strong") in 1970's HERCULES IN NEW YORK, a memorable supporting role in Bob Rafelson's STAY HUNGRY (1976) garnered him a Golden Globe, while the 1977 bodybuilding documentary PUMPING IRON proved a perfect showcase for his charisma. Arnold's star was on the rise, but true stardom eluded him. Ironically constrained by the same things that made him memorable (no one was going to cast him as a romantic lead), he needed a role that would play to his strengths... literally.It took almost half a century for Robert E. Howard's Conan of Cimmeria to emerge from the pulp pages of WEIRD TALES and onto movie screens. Though the character had enjoyed a successful revival in the pages of Marvel Comics, finding an actor who could embody those larger-than-life qualities on screen had thus far proved impossible. In Schwarzenegger, producer Edward R. Pressman found Conan's ideal real-world avatar. And in Conan, Schwarzenegger found his passport into the studio big league.Director (and Hollywood enfant terrible) John Milius and co-writer Oliver Stone set aside most of the overtly fantastical elements of Howard's original stories. Their Nietzsche-fueled revenge plot provided a steely-but-simple narrative spine to Conan's journey from slave to thief to warrior to king. But the film also echoes Milius' APOCALYPSE NOW screenplay, with James Earl Jones' messianic cult leader Thulsa Doom as a Hyborean Age Colonel Kurtz awaiting Conan at the end of his own river of blood. Though only a minor financial success upon release in 1981, CONAN THE BARBARIAN sparked a small but energetic wave of lower-budgeted fantasy films. Most were forgettable, but a few, including Don Coscarelli's THE BEASTMASTER and Albert Pyun's THE SWORD AND THE SORCERER, would spawn cult followings of their own. More importantly, CONAN THE BARBARIAN soon set Schwarzenegger on his improbable, inevitable path from "unpronounceable name" to "household name".

title: The Contenders: Jay Nash & Josh Day
description: Nash and Day have been players and poets for the better part of two decades; they have been making music, telling tales, and having fun touring together as The Contenders since 2012. Join us as we welcome them back to ArtisTree!

title: Coconut Club July 18th 5 PM
description:
The Coconut Club is a whimsical culinary and mixology adventure inspired by the exotic flair of a Tiki bar, seeking to elevate the tenets of Tiki through a thoughtfully presented evening of imaginative cocktails paired with delicious food.

Tiki isn’t just about crazy cocktails and whimsical cuisine, it’s about taking all of its elements–the lure of the islands, the romance of the exotic, an escape into a world of mystery and adventure– and creating an experience inspired by the past but always pushing forward. For whatever reason, the Tiki phenomenon kind of stopped dead in its tracks sometime during the 70s. Sad but true. Since then, it’s been living in the past, spinning its wheels, asleep in the cabana, and churning out the same-old same-old. And while Tiki “same-old same -old” is more exciting than most, the potential to push it into an even bolder and more over-the-top direction is limitless.

The Coconut Club is not a restaurant, but rather a supper club experience.  We pop-up at various locations for short-run exclusive events.

title: The HOOTENANNY! Tour | Lindsay, ON
description: Tim & the Glory Boys are headed your way on their 2016-17 HOOTENANNY tour!Tim Neufeld (also of the band “STARFIELD”) is a multiple JUNO, Dove, and Covenant award winning Christian artist based out of Abbotsford, BC. He and the Glory Boys (A world-class Canadian bluegrass trio) have shared the stage on cross-Canada tours with artists such as Third Day, and most recently, his worshipfulness, Chris Tomlin. Now, starting September 2016, they’re hitting the road on their biggest headlining tour to date, bringing their ‘Worship Hoedown’ to your backyard!What is “Worship Hoedown” you ask?It’s a bluegrass inspired night of music and joy... beards, banjos, and blessings for the whole family! A night of corporate worship; with hymns, choruses, original songs, and comedy, geared towards all ages and denominations. It’s Baptists, Pentecostals, Catholics (and everything in between). It’s the local churches coming together to worship in unity, It’s a HOOTENANNY!

If you do need to transfer your tickets to someone else, please make sure to let us know via email so that we can update your ticket with the new guest's information.
EVENT AND DINNER INFORMATION:
The installation is at The Geffen Contemporary at MOCA in Little Tokyo. 

The doors open for the installation promptly at the scheduled/ticketed time, with dinner starting soon thereafter. Please make sure to arrive 15 minutes before your event starts. Due to time constraints, we will have to start the dinner without you if you are late. 


In addition to the regular menu, we are also offering pescatarian and vegetarian dinner options. Please select your preference at check-out. Due to the nature of the installation, we are unable to accommodate any other dietary restrictions/substitutions. If you have any food allergies, please send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com after you purchase your tickets.
You are invited to bring your own beverages to drink and to share with others. Beverages will not be sold at the event. We will provide water, ice, and glassware.
Parking is available at the museum and costs $8/vehicle. 
OTHER NOTES:
No dress code. Wear what you are most comfortable in.
Taking photos is always ok with us.
If you have any questions, send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com

The theater features performances in dance, drama, music, and other entertainment, and draws people from all over Bergen County and the surrounding metropolitan area, making Hackensack a center for arts and culture.Here’s how we can make it happen:The City of Hackensack and the Upper Main Street Business Alliance cordially invite you to “A Night of Fun, Friends & Follies,” to benefit the new Hackensack Performing Arts Center (PAC). title: Tony Conrad: Completely In The Present
description: 23rd Chicago Underground Film Festival Opening Night!Wednesday, June 18:00pmTony Conrad: Completely In PresentLacrimal GrooveMV Carbon4 min., video, 2015, USA“An isolated human calls upon the insects to interpret a message sent through the circuitry of a Buchla.  Communication gaps are patched between the species as the frequencies surpass the limitations of language.” MCTony Conrad: Completely In PresentTyler Hubby98 min., video, 2016, USA World PremiereThe Chicago Underground Film Festival is proud to present the World Premiere of Tony Conrad: Completely in the Present, a two-decades-in-the-making documentary about the legendary artist’s extraordinary life and influential work. One of the great American artists of our era, Conrad’s work has remained largely unknown to the world at large. Conrad’s career has directly touched and influenced most major contemporary movements in art, film, and music since the early 1960s, pushing the boundaries of what moving images and sound can be and providing inspiration for artists and musicians everywhere. Conrad performed in Jack Smith’s legendary underground film Flaming Creatures, for which he also provided the soundtrack. His own work with film commenced audaciously in 1966 with The Flicker, a film composed entirely of black and white frames, which turned the firm world on its head and helped launch the movement of “structural filmmaking” that dominated experimental film for the next decade. Working with composers such as Stockhausen and La Monte Young he was a central figure in the development of Just Intonation and Minimalism which led to his subsequent role in the formation of the Velvet Underground, directly or indirectly influencing all guitar-based rock music that followed. Conrad was an early proponent of public access television as a democratic activist tool. He continued to perform and make groundbreaking works right up until his death in April of this year and had finally begun to achieve the recognition he deserved.Reflecting Conrad’s own unconventional and forward-thinking means of creating art, Tony Conrad: Completely in the Present mixes intimate footage of the artist and his collaborators and accomplices shot by Hubby over the past two decades, along with selections from Conrad’s personal archive of recordings and films. Using a nonlinear framework that blends unconventional narration, deafening drones, Pythagorean mathematics, flickering frames of white and black, and of course the always surprising and playful Tony Conrad himself guiding viewers through free associative narratives of his astounding and creative life.“Tony Conrad has slowly been emerging from avant-gardist obscurity over the past few years, and about time. His multifold career — as experimental film and video-maker, composer, musician and sound artist — still looks radical and prescient a half-century after it began” – The New York TimesIncludes admission to festival opening night party at Elastic Arts with performances from Ben Baker Billington, Bruce McClure and Tony Conrad's Drone Strings--"A pioneering force behind the evolution of minimalism, violinist and composer TONY CONRAD introduced the idea of “Eternal Music,” a droning, mesmerizing performance idiom that employed long durations, amplification, and precise pitch to explore new worlds of sound. Through both his solo work and through collaborations with artists including LaMonte Young, John Cale, and Faust, he forged new creative directions that proved enormously influential on successive generations of artists ranging in background from pop to the avant-garde." - Big Ears Film FestivalIn commemoration of Tony Conrad and his work, JIM BECKER (Violin), MV CARBON (Cello), and FRED LONBERG-HOLM (Cello) will perform Tony Conrad's Amplified Drone Strings.--BRUCE MCCLURE is an experimental filmmaker, performance artist and architect. The Brooklyn-based McClure makes films and performances in which 16mm film projectors play the leading role. With his idiosyncratic methods of projecting, McClure may call himself a worthy successor of radical avant-gardists such as Peter Kubelka, Ken Jacobs en Hollis Frampton."Bruce McClure is an artist both increasingly known and unknown. His film performances have been featured (and cultishly coveted) in film festivals, galleries, cinematheques, and in various screening programs throughout the US, and in cities such as Rotterdam and Toronto. His name has become, in recent years, common currency in avant-garde circles, yet it takes time and effort to get to know his work, literally and conceptually. You must travel to see it, or if you’re lucky, it has to come to “a theatre near you...McClure has been called a para-cinema artist, a proto-cinema artist, an expanded-cinema artist, and even a vaudevillian." - Cinema Scope--BEN BAKER BILLINGTON will perform free form jazz with a Chicago-based ensemble. Billington has been an extremely active part of the Chicago music community since 2004 while also steadily touring the country with various projects. Primarily a percussionist, Billington is most often found in improvisational ensembles that lean into free jazz, noise, and psychedelic rock stylings. Current projects include Tiger Hatchery, ADT, ONO, Partner, Banal Anml, and countless more throughout the years. Ben also composes solo electronic music under the name Quicksails. Billington has brought together a special group of musicians tonight that will work within the realms of Tony Conrad's sound sphere by utilizing free improvisation, minimalist approaches to melody, and raw emotions.

title: Nursery and Demonstration Garden Tour - May
description: Tuesdays at 10 am; Third Thursday 6:30 PM PLEASE SIGN UP BY MONDAY AT NOON FOR TUESDAY TOUR and WEDNESDAY NOON FOR THURSDAY TOUR.  AFTER THE CUT OFF, PLEASE CALL THE NURSERY at 610- 395-2570.  THE TOUR WILL NOT BE HELD IF THERE ARE NO REGISTRATIONS. Join Edge of the Woods staff for a guided tour of demonstration gardens at the nursery.  Our gardens are certified ad Wildlife Habitat by the National Wildlife Federation and also as Monarch Way-Stations by Monarch Watch.Each week brings a new delight of blooms, insects, birds, and other wonders of nature.  We’ll scout the gardens for inspiration, butterflies, garden visitors and other surprises that present themselves to us. Attendees will learn about the importance of native plants to our eco-system.  The tour is informal and allows time for questions.  This is a great way to be introduced to native plants. The tour lasts approximately 45 minutes to an hour, depending on the group and the number of questions. We are informal so you may leave whenever you need to.These tours are designed for individuals who would like to learn more about native plants and our nursery.  Tours for groups such as garden clubs and school groups can be held by arrangement; a fee may apply.Donations for the tour will be used to support Edge of the Woods demonstration gardens, American Chestnut Orchard, and our Habitat Program which helps organizations create community habitat gardens.  Your support is greatly appreciated.A small service fee is removed from your online donation. Donations are also accepted at the nursery in person.FAQsAre there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?Children are welcome if accompanied by a guardian.  The tour is geared towards adults.What can/can't I bring to the event?Wear a hat and sunscreen, bring drinking water. Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?Call us at 610 395 2570 or email info@edgeofthewoodsnursery.comIs my registration/ticket transferrable?Yes, we ask for registration only so we know about how many people to expect.  If no one is registered, we will not hold the event. If you are registered, please feel free to bring a guest or send someone in your place if you can't attend.Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?You do not need to bring your ticket.  You may also bring along a guest.  We require registration so we know if we need to hold the tour on any given day.The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay?That is Okay.

title: The Fat Brothers: Overindulge
description: Magicana is pleased to present a special one-night-only performance in Toronto with three visiting magicians from Europe. Travelling from Finland & Spain, Dani DaOrtiz, Christian Engblom and Miguel Angel Gea are The Fat Brothers. These three-larger than life performers, recognized will be sharing an evening of gourmet magic. Magic from Europe has a very distinctive flavour — unconventional, eccentric, and full of unexpected twists and turns. There is heavy participation from the audience and things may get a bit crazy.The event will take place at the Wychwood Theatre (see map below). Limited seating available so reserve your tickets early.  Christian Engblom - Finnish champion of close up magic, as charming as he is deviously cleverMiguel Angel Gea - master of sleight of hand and winner of the Ascanio Prize and the Spanish National Grand Prix of Magic. Dani DaOrtiz - a master of chaos who seems barely able to hold onto a pack of cards and yet magic is constantly happening at his fingertips. The performance will be in English… more or less.

title: Architectural Photographer Masterclass
description: A rare opportunity to engage with one of the country's leading architectural photographersAndy Marshall is an award winning architectural photographer who deeply engages with his subject matter. His photographs of All Souls, Bolton have been seen in media all over Europe. His architecture photographs have been published in all types of media worldwide, and his architectural prints have received critical acclaim, with his most recent print selling for £1900. His photographs are rooted in, and drawn from his experiences in interacting with the built environment. His photography masterclass will focus around the built environment, but will be relevant to all types of photography. As well as showing us some of the techniques that he uses to gain his award winning shots, he will also provide a philosophy that helps nurture new ways of seeing.The masterclass will cover most types of photography including mobile photography, but will be principally focused around a camera with manual controls. This could be a compact or DSLR or even a smartphone with an app that provides unique levels of control. Finally, Andy will take you on a short photographic journey through the magnificent All Souls' interior with camera in hand so that you can capture yourself the unique combination of old and new. * Participants have the opportunity to submit a photograph of All Souls - either taken on this day or before 30th June 2016. The winning submission will be printed and displayed at All Souls*

title: The Gunguna / La Gunguna - Theater #7 (1st Scr)
description: (1ST SCREENING)The Gunguna/La Gunguna – Genre: Crime Thriller  Dominican Republic/2015/87 min.Directed by Ernesto AlemanySpanish w/ English SubtitlesThe Gunguna is a tiny .22 caliber pistol that once belonged to General Trujillo and had enormous sentimental value for the dictator. It is sought out by collectors worldwide who are willing to pay a pretty penny for it. Some are even willing to kill for it. The gun will fall in the hands of a construction worker in desperate straits, a corrupt border patrol sergeant, a merciless loan shark, a local Chinese mobster, an arms dealer, and a sleazy bar owner. Director Alemany and screenwriter Miguel Yarull make an auspicious debut with this dark, funny, and tense film.La Gunguna es una pequeña pistola calibre 22 que perteneció al general Trujillo y que tenía un enorme valor sentimental para el dictador. Coleccionistas de todo el mundo están dispuestos a pagar un ojo de la cara por ella. Algunos incluso están dispuestos a matar por ella. El arma caerá en las manos de un trabajador de la construcción en una situación desesperada, un sargento corrupto de la patrulla fronteriza, un usurero sin piedad, un mafioso chino local, un traficante de armas, y el propietario de un bar de mala muerte. Alemany y el guionista Miguel Yarull hacen un extraordinario debut con esta película divertida y tensa sobre el bajo mundo.Shown with: Last Memory

title: Bloom: an Event for New & Expecting Moms in KC
description: Bloom is a targeted event for new and expecting moms in 40+ cities across the country. This event will take place locally on Thursday, April 28, 2016.Bloom guests will have the opportunity to interact with local experts, gather swag geared toward new moms, win incredible giveaways and more - all in an intimate, engaging atmosphere with moms from their area.

title: Nanny / Nana - Theater #3 (1st Scr)
description: (1ST SCREENING)Nanny/Nana – Genre: DocumentaryDominican Republic/2015/71 min.Directed by Tatiana Fernández GearaSpanish w/ English SubtitlesPhotojournalist Tatiana Fernández Geara’s feature documentary debut explores the sacrifices three Dominican mothers have made to provide for their children. Employed as nannies outside their country, some spend years without seeing their own children, becoming surrogate parents for the ones they are hired to take care of. Back on the island, grandparents and other relatives become surrogate parents of their own. What started out as a master thesis project turned into a heartbreaking and intimate film about motherhood and the immigrant experience.En su primer documental, la fotoperiodista Tatiana Fernández Geara explora los sacrificios que hacen tres madres dominicanas para proveer a sus hijos. Empleadas como nanas fuera de su país, algunas pasan años sin ver a sus propios hijos, convirtiéndose en madres sustitutas para los niños que ahora cuidan. Mientras, en la isla, abuelos y otros familiares se convierten en padres sustitutos de los hijos que ellas dejaron atrás. Lo que comenzó como un proyecto de tesis de maestría se convirtió en una película desgarradora e íntima sobre la maternidad y la inmigración.Shown with: Yainis [Jey-nees]

title: Women Grow Vancouver Island Networking Event
description: Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.SpeakerKirk Tousaw is a barrister and advocate for law reform. His primary practice areas are Medical Cannabis Regulatory Compliance, Cannabis Criminal Defence and Strategic Litigation. In addition to the daily practice of law, Kirk sits on the Boards of the British Columbia Civil Liberties Association, NORML Canada, MAPS Canada and the Sensible BC Society. Kirk has written and spoken extensively on issues related to drug policy, privacy, religious freedom, and criminal justice policy has testified several times before the House of Commons and the Senate and litigated the first medical cannabis case to be heard by the Supreme Court of Canada.EVENT AGENDA6:30PM Check-in and Open Networking7:00PM Sponsor Presentation7:15PM Featured Speaker7:30PM Open Networking8:30PM Meeting ConcludesF.A.Q.Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Street parking is not guaranteed, plan accordingly.Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash.Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.TWITTER TIPSA great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabisSponsors Lift Resource Centre; Now open at Matraea Centre in Duncan, BC, Tousaw Law Corporation and The Duncan Journal

title: Esther Perbandt at LA Fashion Week F/W 2016
description: Esther Perbandt // “SOLANUM” Fall WInter 16/17“My fashion is loud“ – introduce herself Esther Perbandt, the most outstanding fashion designer in Berlin fashion scene. She was born and raised in Berlin, got toughened in Moscow and polished in Paris. Berlin based fashion designer looks at the fashion concept as it’s a wearable art which presents strong personalities out of any rules or frames. Art, fashion and musical technologies connect for classics, minimalism, aesthetics, clarity and individualism at Esther Perbandt show symphony with the aim to reach those who are lost, eager to find, grow and develop, share, create and connect for inspiring breathtaking moment. Esther Perbandt fashion label is Berlin breath and design in the best sense of the word: self-confidently clever and flexible, self-reliance meets professional internationalism. Eleven years of experience nominated Esther as the most influential designer in Berlin fashion scene and made her name immediately recognizable nationally and internationally.Being broad-minded, flexible and multi-functional in perception and creation spheres awarded fashion designer with plenty of opportunities to work in the art field. “Every project is a new beginning” – explains she the cooperation with Rammstein lead singer Till Lindemann. Designing the costume for the lead singer and styling two musicians of the band for Zoo MAgazin brought exclusive chance to connect passion for fashion and music.Esther Perbandt is a designer, visionary, performer, master of ceremonies and entertainer who playfully succeeded at designing the outfits for The Komische Oper Berlin musicians, costumes for the conductor Teodor Currentzis and dance ensemble "Sasha Waltzs & Guests“. “I am inspired by meeting and sharing, humanity has so much charming sparkle” – affirms Esther her happiness about being close friends and styling Veruschka von Lehndorff for the events as well as meeting Gerard Malanga, poet, photographer and filmmaker, who worked closely with Andy Warhol during the artist‘s most creative period.Working closely with Sven Helbig, German composer, music producer and director, gifted a new perspective about the music integration into the fashion field. “I have exclusive chance to work with a person who is among 50 the most talented musicians having a contract with "Deutsche Grammophon”, the label for classic music” – the designer shares her excitement. Sven Helbig is also a co-founder of the first European orchestra exclusively dedicated to contemporary music (Dresdner Sinfoniker), a genius who radically edits his orchestra compositions – deconstructs and recreates them in an electronica storm.“Esther is the queen of Mercedes – Benz Berlin Fashion Week” – the audience leaded her with the huge applause in the end of the last collection SOLANUM - AUTUMN WINTER 16/17// runway show. She brought the deconstructive modernism to a point where dark, concentrated beauty or elegance and singular personality come together to celebrate a new direction and complexity. Combination of the high fashion sense, Radialsystem V theatre atmosphere, contemporary "Sasha Waltz & Guests“ dancers and Sven Helbig electronic and classic music synthesis composed unforgettable experience. Withstanding the idealistic beauty in her shows expresses her stand for independence, versatility and individuality.About LA Fashion Week Fall/Winter 2016LAFW is the biggest apparel & design event in California. It's now a permanent feature on the international fashion week circuit alongside London, Paris, Milan, New York, and Tokyo. LAFW showcases award winning designers from all over the world with the new season’s collections twice a year to media, buyers, industry elite & affluent clientèle.Based in Hollywood, LAFW is unlike any other fashion event on the international calendar. LAFW represents a fashion authority in the western United States showcasing both Los Angeles based brands as well as international talent and trend setting collections from established designers. These designers are as relevant as the multi-label boutiques and department stores that carry them throughout the world.

title: Fantastic Negrito
description: Fantastic Negrito is one of our favorite bands ever, featuring Xavier Dephrepaulezz, a dynamic lead singer and songwriter who has made a huge splash in the last year, breaking into the national spot light. The band has developed an excellent reputation for the way they mix soul, rock and gospel elements into a truly compelling and unique sound. They have a brand new record coming out, and a tour coming up, and they wanted to play their new material for a hometown audience before hitting the road. So, I promise you, this is going to be a fun evening you won't forget! Show starts at 8 pm. Tickets are $15 in advance and $20 at the door.Speaking of Oakland, the very talented folk and blues chanteuse Aireene Espirtu will open the show with her beautiful voice and distinctive bluesy folk songs.The venue is Point Richmond Acoustic, 201 Martina Avenue, Point Richmond 94801. title: Jung and the Expressive Arts:  Looking for Home
description: An Experiential Workshop Using the Techniques of Jungian Art Therapy   Using HOME as a metaphor for the Self we will use active imagination, guided imagery and gesture to explore our personal search for our soul's journey.  The experience of this workshop promises to nourish the symbolic attitude of the psyche and to touch our relationship with essence.Sondra Geller, MA, ATR-BC, LPC is a Jungian Analyst, a Board Certified Art Therapist and a Licensed Professional Counselor.  She is in private practice in Chevy Chase, Maryland.  She gives lectures and workshops for the George Washington University Art Therapy Master's Programs, Philadelphia Jung Institute/ PAJA, the Washington Jung Society and the CGJung Institute in Kusnacht, Switzerland.  Her focus is on Making Art in the Presence of the Analyst, Jung and the Creative Process, and Jungian Art Therapy.PAJA/Philadelphia Jung Institute hosts  Public Programs for all who are eager to explore and be enriched by the ideas of Carl Jung and analytical psychology for their personal and professional development. No prior knowledge of Jungian thought is required.Continuing education for degreed professionals is available. NBCC CE certificate:  $10 (by cash or check at the event)Discounted parking available for lots at 1845 Walnut St. and 2101 Chestnut St. The Philadelphia Association of Jungian Analysts (PAJA) has been approved by NBCC as an Approved Continuing Education Provider, ACEP number 6671. Programs that do not qualify for NBCC credit are clearly identified. PAJA is solely responsible for all aspects of the program.

title: Dr. Lucky Exclusive Salon on Burlesque History
description: In this very special event curated exclusively for Indigo Blue’s Academy of Burlesque, spend the night with Dr. Lucky in this salon-style lecture/demonstration about the history of American burlesque history and discussion about the multiple possibilities of its future.  Inspired by the exciting growth of burlesque in style and content around the globe, this evening will be a history lesson and a call to action to bring into being the burlesque world we want to live in.Dr. Lucky will trace the history of burlesque as a literary form and a performance trope.  Coined in the 16th century as a literary form that inverts form and content, burlesque is a subset of parody that either elevates the mundane or vulgarizes the lofty.  When Lydia Thompson and the British Blondes invaded the United States in 1868, the public understanding of burlesque transformed from a literary form to a performance style, and the worlds of “leg shows” and burlesque became intertwined in the public imagination.  This history is well known, but we will pay particular attention to the “breeding ground” that existed prior to Thompson and her Blondes “coming on the scene,” so to speak, by examining other popular amusement and theatrical traditions of the time, and unpacking their relationship to burlesque.  This lecture will cover the influence of cultural forms such as blackface minstrel shows, feminized spectacles, antebellum theatre, vaudeville, concert saloons, and dime museums, to contextualize the reception around and popularization of burlesque in America.We will use this lecture and the metaphor of a “breeding ground” to think through the convergence of ideas, events, and social trends that made neo-burlesque popular today.  In small “break out groups,” we will collaboratively discuss the future of burlesque, and literally “map out” plans for the future as a way to chart infinite possibilities.  The purpose is not to codify burlesque — and thereby imply through exclusion what’s “not” burlesque – but rather to have an open, honest, thoughtful discussion of what we imagine this world can be.

title: Healing Birth Stories for Professionals
description: While we know how joyous and beautiful birth can be, we also know that about 10-15% of women experience something traumatic at birth. Birth trauma impacts mothers, babies and those that care for them. Therapists Sarina LaMarche and Maureen Campion have been offering their Healing Birth Stories workshop for 7 years and offer compassionate and effective tools to support both survivors and the professionals that work in this field. Come join us as we delve into the tough emotions around birth and explore our own trauma while looking at healing and transforming the stories we carry around birth.Sarina LaMarcheMaureen Campion Maureen's book- Heal Your Birth StoryCertificates of attendance for continuing education will be provided.Appropriate for doulas, midwives, therapists, medical staff, anyone who works with women around birth. Join us for a wine and cheese social hour immediately following the workshop.Please feel free to contact Maureen at maureen@marriagegeek.com if you have any questions.

title: Louis Landon & Scott D. Davis in Concert
description: An up-close and personal house concert featuring pianists Louis Landon and Scott D. Davis. Enjoy an evening of dynamic and emotional piano performance and personal storytelling.  Concert is in a private home, but is open to the public.  Exact address is on a "need to know" basis, and will be sent with your ticket confirmation. Louis Landon is a Steinway Artist, formerly of New York and currently of Sedona, who has dedicated his life to music. His passion is for peace. His career has taken him around the world playing a variety of styles with some of the most recognized names in the enter-tainment industry: classical music for Mikhail Baryshnikov on national and international tours, Latin music with "Pucho and his Latin Soul Brothers" on national and international tours, pop music with Rupert "Pina Colada Song" Holmes on television and national tours, rock & roll with John Hall, opening for "Little Feat" on national tours. For the past 24 years, through his production company, Landon Music, he has written and produced music for film, video, and commercials, including three years of "best plays" and "bloopers" commercials for the National Basketball Association.Scott D. Davis has the soul of a rock guitarist trapped in a piano player's body. His original music and rock/metal piano cover, though the pure touch of a solo grand piano, express the power and beauty of human experience. He's racked up over 20 million views on YouTube, and had opened for many of rock bands he idolized growing up including: Godsmack, Korn, P.O.D., Sevendust, as well as Vince Neil of Mötley Crüe and Geoff Tate of Queensrÿche.The $20 tickets price for this concert is voluntary; you may pay more or less if you wish.  We do it this way because we never want price to be a barrier for anyone to come enjoy our music, and we also appreciate your support which empowers us to perform more concerts and make more music!  Just enter the amount you'd like to pay per ticket, and the number of tickets.

title: "Current Dilemmas In Exhibiting Art In Israel"
description: Get your tickets for Achshav Yisrael‘s third program, “Current Dilemmas In Exhibiting Art In Israel."The Israel Museum is the largest cultural institution in Israel and is ranked among the world’s leading art and archaeology museums. In 2010, the Museum completed a major renovation of its 20-acre campus in Jerusalem, opening new galleries and public spaces. Three years later, the Museum appointed Dr. Noam Gal as the Horace and Grace Goldsmith Curator of Photography and the Head of the Noel and Harriette Levine Photography Department at the Museum.The international photography collection that Dr. Gal oversees is considered one of the best in the world — it includes rare and unique masterpieces and represents all modes of photography, from the medium's formative years to contemporary projects. The Department is also renowned for its dedication to the promotion and encouragement of contemporary Israeli photographers.Congregation Beth Sholom (CBS) invites you to learn from Dr. Gal about the state of photography and video in Israeli art, the growing international recognition of contemporary Israeli photographers, some of the challenges inherent in navigating public opinion as a curator of contemporary art in Israel, and his vision regarding the relationship between education and photography. Dr. Gal's talk will be accompanied by images and will be followed by a conversation with the audience.Snacks and refreshments will be served.For more information on Achshav Yisrael and this program, please visit the CBS blog.

title: Native Garden Design & Care Workshop
description:
Explore the basics of creating and caring for an abundant, low maintenance and drought tolerant garden using native plants adapted to our region’s climate!Learn about different plant types, garden designs, site preparation, lawn remediation, soil, irrigation, and other techniques to start, establish and maintain your native garden!Native gardens save water, reduce waste and pollution, require low care, are fit for any busy schedule, need no chemical fertilizers and pesticides, provide habitat for beneficial insects and wildlife, support local ecology and can be a source of natural therapies. Creating and caring for your own native garden is easy and has many sustainable benefits for yourself, your community and the environment. On average, a native garden uses 80% less water, generates 55% less green waste and requires 70% less maintenance than the traditional garden. The savings from these resources can be reinvested in other regenerative and sustainable home elements, like food producing raised beds, fruit trees, and culinary and healing herb gardens. A native garden promotes and supports of a healthy, abundant and sustainable future for all! Nothing, including hard degraded soils or lawns, can stay in your way to creating the native garden you desire at your home!Join US in this workshop and together we will: Learn hands-on about designing a home native garden
Gain insights on the step-by-step process to start, establish and maintain a native garden, including plant choices, site preparation, lawn remediation where appropriate, soil and earth works, irrigation, mulching, seasonal care and more
All attendees will start on a draft design for a native garden at their home and receive 1 or 2 informational hand-outs to complement the subjects covered in the workshop.Instructor:  Lucian TomaCancellation Policy: We understand your plans may change. We will give you credit toward a future program if you cancel at least 24 hours in advance. Credit must be redeemed within 90 days of issue. To account for our preparation and our instructor's time, we cannot give refunds or credits if cancelled with less than 24-hours notice or in the event of a no-show.
