title: A Dog Named Gucci (Sunday Afternoon Screening)
description: The 2016 COLLINSVILLE FILM FESTIVAL PRESENTS - A DOG NAMED GUCCISUNDAY, APRIL 3rd at 1:45PM (DOORS OPEN AT 1:30PM)A DOG NAMED GUCCI (Documentary)Director: Gorman Bechard (USA) *Filmmaker in Attendance*Screening  Time (84 Minutes): A DOG NAMED GUCCI is an inspiring documentary about a 10-week old puppy who was doused with lighter fluid and set on fire. Hearing the puppy's cries, college professor Doug James ran to help. After chasing away the abusers, and at the request of Gucci's young runaway owner, Doug took the puppy in as his own. Thus began a 16-year odyssey of love, devotion, and perseverance. Together with legislators, Doug and Gucci worked to create what became known as the "Gucci Bill," changing Alabama law, and making domestic animal abuse a felony.ADDITIONAL INFO:THESE FILMS ARE NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDRENAll films  throughout the 2016 Collinsville Film Festival will be shown at the  Canton Town Hall Auditorium in Collinsville, CT. We suggest you arrive 15 minutes before showtime. No later than 5 minutes!Once  purchased, tickets are non-refundable. Tickets cannot be shipped. At the  door we will have your name on file (will call). Please make sure you  have proper ID with you so we check our list and confirm your seat! For  questions please email info@collinsvillefilmfestival.com, visit  www.collinsvillefilmfestival.com or call our office at 631.678.8302*Subject to Change*

title: Salsation Workshop with SMT Nanna Jelbert June 4th
description: Salsation Fitness Workshop in Norway with SMT Nanna Jelbert************SALSATION is a dance workout that converts functional training protocols into innovative dance moves. The word “Salsation” stems from:   SALSA:   NOT from the rhythm / musical gender but from the spanish word  “SALSA” that actually means  "SAUCE”, because it is a SPICY mix of  different rhythms, cultures, dances and fitness protocols. SENSATION: the program has a strong focus on musicality, lyrical expression as well as on how the human body functions. Why Salsation?  What makes Salsation unique is that it is carefully designed to  integrate functional body movements into all dance routines working out  in a 3D fashion and using all planes of motion.  It’s not only easy and  fun but you can do it to improve your mobility and stamina no matter  your age.

title: Jesus Christ Superstar
description: Join us for a special Easter screening of the unforgettable biblical musical epic, Jesus Christ Superstar. WHAT ATOM EGOYAN SAYS ON JESUS CHRIST SUPERSTAR:"JSC is definite contender for my desert island film.   Think about it.  You get to be entertained, have fun, watch Jesus being whipped, crucified and resurrected in glorious TODD AO cinemascope AND sing and dance to one of the catchiest musicals ever written.  I know it all by heart.  It changed my life.  To have those stories from the bible - which I had to learn at school - suddenly come to life as rock opera was mind-blowing.   Then to see Norman Jewison cast it so perfectly and move the camera with such amazing dolly shots and have Rob Iscove (ANOTHER Canadian) design the dance numbers with such trippy energy and verve was inspiriting.  Enjoy!"------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Adapted from Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice's Broadway rock opera, Jesus Christ Superstar recounts the last days of Jesus Christ (Ted Neeley) from the perspective of Judas Iscariot (Carl Anderson), his betrayer. As Jesus' following increases, Judas begins to worry that Jesus is falling for his own hype, forgetting the principles of his teachings and growing too close to the prostitute Mary Magdalene (Yvonne Elliman). After Jesus has an outburst in a temple, Judas turns on him. Neeley and Anderson were nominated for two Golden Globe Awards in 1974 for their portrayals of Jesus and Judas, respectively, and the film remains popular, winning a 2012 Huffington Post competition for "Best Jesus Movie". Join us for this rollicking, wild '70s ride through the bible!

title: Color Confidence (Level 1)
description:
Tired of mixing blue and red and getting mud?

This afternoon workshop will give you a solid foundation in color that goes beyond theory into pigment reality. Through a series of fun, experimental exercises, learn all about the different kinds of pigments, get a solid handle on color mixing, discover how to mix a huge variety of hues with just a few colors, learn the difference between all the white and black colors, explore the gorgeous Iridescent and Interference line, and more.  Whether you’re brand new to acrylic or a professional who wants to get a better handle on creating luminous color, this workshop will leave you color confident. All materials included – including resources such as color wheels, mixing guides, handouts and a starter sample set to take home.

title: Living The Vows presents "Word to the Wives"
description: LADIES!! Get ready for an awesome day just for YOU! Living The Vows presents "Word to the Wives" A Married Wives Experience to give you the opportunity to celebrate your marriedness. We work, we play and we look good doing it. This experience is your opportunity to enhance your marriage and share your successes.This day will be packed with wives just like you who value themselves, their husbands and their marriages. But even when you see the overall value, have you ever wondered how different your marriage would be with a few more hours of quality time each week? Maybe a few less eye rolls and "woo sahs" after a disagreement? Or maybe some consistent and increased passion in your lovemaking sessions? If you want to:-enhance how you communicate your daily needs and desires -increase understanding of what your husband needs and how you can grow closer-share and learn to overcome disappointments in marriage-gain confidence and effectiveness in expressing your desires-maximize your sexiness, femininity and lovemakingthen keep smiling and register!

title: Seed Starting and Vegetable Gardening in the City
description:
Come and explore the magic of growing your own food in the city. Urban Seedling will guide you through how to over come the obstacles to vegetable gardening in the city, and specifically in Montreal's particular growing season.

At the Urban Seedling organic vegetable gardening workshop we will teach you how to plan, plant and care for your home organic vegetable garden, whether you are gardening in your balcony in your backyard or even on your rooftop.

You will learn how to:


	Plan and build your vegetable garden
	Put together the perfect soil mix and learn all about soil fertility
	Plant seeds and transplant seedlings
	Maintain the garden throughout the season
	Master companion planting
	Balcony gardening solutions
	Natural, organic control pests and disease 

At the end of the workshop, participants will receive their own organic vegetable seeds planted during the workshop and pertinent handouts. There will be seeds, soil, and vegetable gardening supplies available for purchase.

Urban Seedling is a Montreal-based company that helps people grow their own fresh food in the city. For the past 5 years, we've helped people across the city grow fresh vegetables, herbs, and fruit in backyards, front yards, balconies, and rooftops.

Led by co-founder and speaker Tereska Gesing.

This is an English workshop. The French workshop will be on March 18th from 4:00-6:00pm

title: St. Valentine's Eve Massacree
description:
St. Valentine’s Eve Massacree(with full orchestration and two-part harmony)Fellow travelers – let us  gather.This St. Valentine’s Eve, get slayed by the harmonic stylings of two of Chicago’s favorite clandestine duos: Chauncey & the Beast and The PhilBillies. Hosted by our pal Matt Lyle, this intimate concert for friends and family will feature each group performing seven songs a piece, all of which will be recorded, edited and mastered for the groups to do with whatever they damn well please.Tickets for this private BYOB event are $24 ($4 of which is a service fee - sorry), with all proceeds going to the recording and mastering process. The Foxhole, a cozy exposed-brick room that used to be a wallpaper store, only holds 50 people, so this show will sell out fast. No walk-ups, so please buy online as soon as you can!To sum up - what does that $24 get you? 
the secret password
 
an evening of amazing music with two talented duos that rarely gig (even though it's commonly agreed they should)
bragging rights
a digital download of the show (when it’s good and ready)
a good night’s sleep earned from helping our friends create something life-affirming
victuals to help keep up that blood sugar over the course of the evening
cold space and cups for those BYO beverages
Hope to see you out!

title: Beer Dinner with Firestone Walker | FEB 10th
description:
2016 is full of surprises!Haven Gastropub's culinary team is pairing inspired dishes with beers from the amazing Firestone Walker Brewing Company, based in Paso Robles.  Join us on Wednesday, February 10th for another 5-course beer dinner not to be missed!David Walker has confirmed that he will be here for the dinner, and he's excited to have some beers with all of you!This time, you'll also take home 3 rare bottles: 2015 Sucaba, Firestone XVIII Anniversary, 2015 Barrelworks Agrestic
SAMPLE MENU FROM OUR LAST DINNER - FULL FIRESTONE MENU TBA 5 courses with Highland Park BreweryShima Aji Crudogooseberry, apple, coriander dashi geleepaired with7 to 5 - 7 to 5 is a sister beer to Nebraska with the 7 to 5 name referencing working man hours (similar to the Nebraska reference, farmhands, and long hours). This Belgian-style pale ale was aged 5 month with multiple strains of Brettanomyces. This aging transforms an already complex, dry beer into a fermentation driven pale ale with huge earthy and tropical fruit aromas. Earthy brett, tropical guava, and pronounced spice lead into firm bitterness and citrus pith in the finish. 6.7% abvSpot Prawncoconut milk, shishito pepper, papayapaired withRaised Eyebrows - This beer utilizes Passionfruit and guavas from our tree in the parking lot. 100% aged in red wine barrels. The beer is fermented with our house cultures that contain lactobacillus, pediococcus, and brettanomyces. The exotic, ripe qualities of the unique fruit comes through as refreshingly zippy, aromatic, funky, and fun! 4%Guinea Hensunchoke, chanterelles, lemon balm, vin jaunepaired withAll The Yeast - This beer is a celebration of us brewing beer for one year! We used every strain of yeast taking up residence in our festive little brewery. It was fermented in oversized (132 gallon) french oak puncheon barrels that previously held red wine. It is dry and citrusy with a pleasant brettanomyces earthiness and a peppery, crisp finish. 5.9%Dry-Aged Strip Loinbeet, onion, cabbagepaired withGriffith J Griffith - Imperial Stout with Ethiopian coffee from Trystero. A full, warming Imperial Stout with rich, dark chocolate and char from the deep roast, dark berry qualities from the coffee, and decadent chocolate in the finish. 12.5% abv.Lemon Meringuecitrus, mascarpone, pink peppercornpaired withSun-Soaked - Ah, this beer is a fun one. We used French oak red wine barrels. Berliner weisse beers typically get their acidity from a bacteria, Lactobacillus, that thrive at temperatures above 100 degrees! So, we decide to let these critters go at it in barrels baking in our parking lot. After initial souring we added several other yeasts to finish up fermentation. Super zippy lemon and grapefruit with raw wood notes in the background. Simple, yet complex. Funky, yet super drinkable. 3.2% abv._____________________________________________________________________________Tickets are a base of $125, sold for $162 inclusive of tax & service charge, so you will not receive a bill of any kind the night of the event.Buy your tickets now! We are only offering out a small amount of tickets, as our little kitchen can only serve so many, while still serving the rest of the guests we have who are wondering why they didn't buy their tickets sooner, as they watch you salivate and ogle over each course.Note: NO REFUNDS will be provided within 72 hours of event.
FOLLOW US @havengastropubChef de Cuisine Craig Brady (IG @chef_brady)Executive Sous Chef Zach Scherer (IG @zachscherer)Executive Chef Greg Daniels (IG @havengastrochef)Beverage Director Wil Dee (IG @wilartdee)FOLLOW THEM @firestonewalker

title: From Justin to Kelly + Glassworks + The Pushers
description: Get ready for a great night of comedy as the Push Comedy Theater presents a comedy invasion!!!3 acclaimed groups!  1 night of kick ass improv!!!!Glassworks:Glassworks, based out of Eau Claire, Wisconsin, is the comedy trio of Alex Raney, Mack Hastings, and Elliot Heinz. Focusing on relationships, honesty, and the present moment, Glassworks crafts truly unique comedy. With over six years of rehearsals, shows, and 12-hour van rides on any of their six national tours, the performers share an infectious synergy. It's truth in comedy, but not like you've seen it before.From Justin to Kelly:Acclaimed as one of the best improv duos in the nation, longtime New York City comedians Justin Peters and Kelly Buttermore perform fully improvised one-act plays that are usually funny, sometimes disturbing, and always memorable. Whether they’re playing two lonely old ladies sunning themselves at a deserted public pool, or a down-on-their-luck married couple celebrating their anniversary with a furtive tryst in their kids’ treehouse, Peters and Buttermore emphasize high-stakes scenework that embraces the terror and potential of the present tense.The Pushers:The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group.  For ten years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage.  The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter.   The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival.  In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.From Justin to Kelly (NYC) + Glassworks (WI) + The Pushers (NFK)Thursday, November 19th at the Push Comedy TheaterThe show start at 8pm and costs $10 Acclaimed Improv Groups to Tour East Coast On November 13, 2015, the New York City-based improv duo From Justin to Kelly and the Eau Claire, Wisconsin-based improv trio Glassworks will make improv history by hitting the road for a nine-day, nine-show tour of East Coast comedy theaters. It is the first time that two independent improv groups have embarked on a joint tour of this magnitude. Barring catastrophe, it will not be the last. The First-Ever Tour of its Kind Improv comedy groups are traditionally tied to specific theaters, and will only leave those theaters to perform at comedy festivals, if at all. Glassworks and From Justin to Kelly are among the very few established improv groups nationwide that have decided to flip this model and make the road their “home theater.” In doing so, Glassworks and From Justin to Kelly hope to blaze a path that other groups can follow. They have patterned themselves on the many independent musicians who build their audiences through regular, DIY touring. This East Coast tour will mark Glassworks’ seventh national improv tour, and From Justin to Kelly’s fourth. Tour Dates Friday, November 13 - Arcade Comedy Theater Pittsburgh, Pa. Saturday, November - 14 Harrisburg Improv Theatre Harrisburg, Pa. Sunday, November 15 - House Show Brooklyn, N.Y. Monday, November 16 - House Show Brooklyn, N.Y. Tuesday, November 17 - Muchmore’s Brooklyn, N.Y. Wednesday, November 18 - DSI Comedy Theater Chapel Hill, N.C. Thursday,November 19 - Push Comedy Theater Norfolk, Va. Friday, November 20 - Coalition Theater Richmond, Va. Saturday, November 21 - Charm City Comedy Project Baltimore, Md.

title: Last Laugh presents: DANGEROUS MEN
description: "Dangerous Men is a majestic piece of cinematic lunacy gleefully unhinged from the basic rules of storytelling." - Geek Tyrant"It's the singular vision of a dogged outsider artist, and also a glimpse into the mind of someone who has a truly, deeply bizarre view of humanity." - Birth Movies DeathIn 1979, Iranian filmmaker John S. Rad moved to the U.S. to shoot his dream project, a rampaging gutter epic of crime, revenge, cop sex and raw power. Just 26 years later, he completed an American action film masterpiece that the world is still barely ready for today: DANGEROUS MEN.After Mina witnesses her fiancé's brutal murder by beach thugs, she sets out on a venomous spree to eradicate all human trash from Los Angeles. Armed with a knife, a gun, and an undying rage, she murders her way through the masculine half of the city's populace. A renegade cop is hot on her heels, a trail that also leads him to the subhuman criminal overlord known as Black Pepper.It's a pulse-pounding, heart-stopping, brain-devouring onslaught of '80s thunder, '90s lightning, and pure filmmaking daredevilry from another time and/or dimension. Blades flash, blood flows, bullets fly and synthesizers blare as the morgue overflows with the corpses of DANGEROUS MEN.-Alamo Drafthouse

title: Better Béziers: Digitizing Lettering Workshop
description:
We are excited to announce the details for our next workshop.By popular demand, we are excited to hose our first ‘Better Béziers: Digitizing Lettering Workshop’. The event will be held Saturday, November 28 from 12pm-4pm at hackerYou (483 Queen St W, Toronto, 3rd floor).The day will be hosted by local letterers (and Ligatures co-founders) Kyle Gallant & Christopher Rouleau. Kyle is a multi-faceted designer, skilled in calligraphy, expressive lettering, and even graffiti. He is a self-described “compulsive doodler” and passionate about all things type. Christopher is a freelance graphic designer & letterer, with a love for alphabets, antique lettering guides and old hand-lettered signs. He is comfortable working in a variety of media, including pen, chalk, acrylic, ink… the list goes on.Check out more of their recent work on Instagram: http://instagram.com/eckstatic   |  http://instagram.com/chris_rouleau  After the popularity of Kyle & Christopher’s brush pen workshops in Toronto and Calgary, they have pooled together their skills, knowledge and resources to put together a 4-hour tutorial on the fundamentals of digital lettering to take your work from the page to the screen – and beyond.  Pre-requisites: 
Ligatures brush pen workshop (suggested) 
basic working knowledge of Adobe Illustrator  
Requirements: 
laptop 
Adobe CS (CS5 or higher) 
a Dropbox account (for file sharing) 
scanned lettering work(s) you would like to digitize  
Cost: The cost of this full-day workshop is $80 ($60 with valid student ID, presented on workshop day). This price includes digital exercises, handouts, course instruction, as well as access to personal books and resources. Course plan: This 4-hour workshop will help budding letterers convert their lettering and calligraphy work into versatile vector files, perfect for all print and web uses. Half of the workshop will be dedicated to reviewing the digital toolkit (including the beloved pen tool), an overview of building beziers, and tips on making the most of Illustrator’s auto-trace, with plenty of demos and exercises. The latter half of the workshop will be allocated for one-on-one time with the instructors to ask questions and perfect your work. Participants will leave the workshop with at least one completed vector file, and the skills to continue their digital lettering journey.  We look forward to bringing your talents together, sharing knowledge with one another, and creating some new brush pen work work!  Thank you to hackerYou for sponsoring this event.

title: The Curator
description: Back by popular demand, The Curator returns to the Bad Dog stage after a hit run in the fall of 2014. The curator has five minutes to set the stage for our award-winning cast members, who then take over to create a completely improvised one-act comedy inspired by that work of art.The Curator is the brainchild of Haligonian improviser Henri Geilis, lovingly adapted by the Bad Dog Theatre Company and featuring the extraordinary talents of Kayla Lorette, Sean Tabares, Evany Rosen, James Gangl, Colin Munch,Anders Yates, Dan Beirne, Kris Siddiqi, Craig Anderson, Lucy Hill & Roger Bainbridge. Directed by Bad Dog’s Artistic Director Julie Dumais Osborne.

title: Fall for Wildlife Dinner & Auction
description: Join us for an elegant evening of great food, silent auction and fun at the Fall for Wildlife Dinner Auction at the Four Points by Sheraton Victoria Gateway on November 14, 2015.The Fall for Wildlife Dinner Auction is our signature fundraising event of the year. It is a special evening in which wild animal lovers and supporters come together to celebrate, find wonderful auction items, and support the life-saving work of the BC SPCA Wild ARC.Mingle with guests during our reception; enjoy great food, bid on silent auction items and an opportunity to be a Wild ARC intern for a day. And be treated to a video featuring a summer day at Wild ARC.Sponsorship opportunities are available!  Please contact Sharon Burkmar, Coordinator, Fundraising Events at 250-516-2137 or sburkmar@spca.bc.ca.Tickets are $80 each or $600 for a table of 8 and are available online, by email sburkmar@spca.bc.ca, in person at Wild ARC-1020 Malloch Rd or by calling 250-516-2137.In addition to raising much-needed funds for the animals in our care, the Fall for Wildlife Dinner Auction will create awareness about the important role of Wild ARC in our community.The Fall for Wildlife Dinner Auction is a fundraiser in support of the BC SPCA Wild Animal Rehabilitation Centre (Wild ARC). As the only wildlife rehabilitation centre on southern Vancouver Island, Wild ARC treats over 2,500 wild animals annually from throughout the region.Proudly Supported By:

title: Carrie
description: You already know that being a teenager is hard. On top of all of the general awkwardness, it's even harder with crazy moms, mean girls, and cute guys who want nothing to do with you because you're a total square, plus the pressure of wondering if anyone will ask you to prom. If you're dealing with all of these things and also happen to have telekinetic powers that are seemingly uncontrollable... well then soooooouie, life must be impossible. But you don't have to worry about that, because luckily for you, you're not Carrie. (Unless you are, in which case I'm sorry I called you a total square, please don't hurt me with your mind powers.)Brian De Palma's bloody masterpiece Carrie will be screening at The Royal as a part of our Halloween Spooktacular, and we can't wait to relive all of the memories that we've already worked hard on repressing about high school. I mean, high school was bad, but I guess at least it wasn't that bad. If blood-splattered high school gymnasiums aren't you thing, then at least come and witness John Travolta as Billy Nolan, with better hair than I could ever dream of having. Because if you don't come, remember, they're all going to laugh at you!

description: Christmas Wedding BabyNarrative Feature | 112 minutes | 2014 | USADirector: Kiara C JonesThree sisters struggle to find happiness through the holiday season as the youngest sister and bride-to-be is traumatized when she discovers that her first love has been hired as her wedding photographer."Kiara Jones took care to write beautifully flawed characters without making them caricatures. 'No harm was done to women of color in this film,' it says at the close of the credits. Indeed, it was a pleasure watching Black women characterized as women, sisters, lovers, mothers, human."  -Monique A. Williams | Shadow and Act

title: Week 2 | Lu Cuisine | Chef's Table
description: LU CUISINE | Shandong RegionTHE PLACE AND FOODShandong is a northern province that sits just across the Yellow Sea from Korea. Northern provinces grow more wheat than rice, but its position on the coast also means a lot of seafood, making the cuisine an interesting mix of heavy and light dishes featuring eel, herring, carp, noodles and steamed buns.CHEF'S TABLE CONCEPTChef Jeremy Hansen, owner of Sante and Common Crumb, will treat a limited number of guests each night to an incredible tour of Hu cuisine, receiving special courses and pairings all night. Chef's table limited to 20 guests per night.

title: HAMLET | City Park, Kingston
description: Driftwood Theatre proudly presents Hamlet, the world’s most famous play, like you’ve never seen it before. On stage outdoors in communities across Ontario, July 9 - August 16, 2015. The summer tour will feature a thrilling new adaptation by dramaturg Toby Malone that is unpredictable, unsettling and downright dangerous - Hamlet with the brakes off. This electrifying revenge-thriller pits one man against the world around him as he sacrifices everything and everyone he loves to avenge his father’s murder.Young Hamlet’s world is turned upside down when, after the death of his father, his mother quickly marries Hamlet’s uncle Claudius. When the ghost of Hamlet’s father appears before him to accuse Claudius of murder, Hamlet is set upon a course of action which will have significant consequences for everyone that he holds dear. Hamlet is gripping tragedy fueled by grief and framed by a world dominated by the politics of fear.Both newcomers to Hamlet and Shakespeare aficionados will delight in this version; a perfect match for Driftwood’s inventive theatrical style and our magical outdoor settings.

title: Man From Reno
description: Just added! Introduction and Q&A with Michael Lerman,writer of Man From Reno at the following screenings:• Saturday August 1st, 7PM - Q&A• Sunday August 2nd, 7PM - Intro• Friday August 7th, 7PM - Q&A A stranger in the increasingly strange city of San Francisco, Japanese crime novelist Aki (Ayako Fujitani - Tokyo!) is unsure of precisely what role she has to play in a real-life murder mystery involving ambiguous MacGuffins and amorphous identities. Unfolding in lonely places such as bookshops and hotel bars, Dave Boyle's (Surrogate Valentine, White On Rice, Big Dreams Little Tokyo) moody thriller uncovers exhilarating new takes on genre conventions. Consequently, it's an alluring l'homme fatal who supplies Aki with the breadcrumb trail of clues that entices her into a labyrinthine plot of sinister dealings. In turn, the aging sheriff (veteran character actor Pepe Serna - Scarface, The Black Dahlia, The Jerk, fantastic in a rare leading role), who should rightfully be riding to her rescue, proves to be equally out of his depth. The game is afoot, the chase is exhilarating and the stakes are perilously high in this inspired neo-noir. (Courtesy of Los Angeles Film Festival)

title: 2015 Ottawa Food Truck Rally - Vendor Registration
description: Preparation for this year's annual Ottawa Food Truck Rally is well under way and we are now accepting vendor registration. As those who attended last year already know, the rally is a great way to get some well-deserved exposure for your culinary talents. Register now to avoid missing out on what is sure to be the hit food event of the summer.   IMPORTANT INFORMATION:Where:The old St. Charles Church -135 Barrette St., OttawaVendor Permits:Upon arrival, you will be required to present a photocopy of your current vendor permit so that it can be added to our site manager’s documentation.  This will help us in the event of an inspector or By-Law arriving on the site.Food and Beverage Tickets:In order to manage alcohol consumption and make sure that all vendors are paid for all food they push out, a food and beverage ticket system has been devised.  Patrons will purchase as many $2 food tickets and $5 alcoholic beverage tickets they require from the main ticketing area.*** Food vendors: To ensure timely transactions and shorter lines, please refrain from selling beverages. All beverages will be provided by the Ottawa Food Truck Rally and our beverage vendors.Pricing and CompensationAll plates for the day must be priced at $2 increments between $4 and $10.  Patrons will pay with pre-purchased tickets in $2 denominations.  This is important if you will be selling any peripheral items.  These will need to be priced at $2 for this event as the only way we can compensate is based on the tickets you collect through the day.  Each truck will be provided with a ticket box to collect their tickets. At the end of the event, tickets will be gathered and stored in a secure location. All tickets will be counted by end of day Monday, September 28th. A report will be circulated by end of day September 29th and cheques will be cut to vendors no later than September 30th. They can be picked up or mailed, please indicate your preference.For more details:E-mail us: inquiries@ottawafoodtruckrally.comFollow us on Twitter: www.twitter.com/OttawaFoodTruckRallyLike us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/OttawaFoodTruckRally

title: Young People's Concert - Link Up - May 2016
description: A program of Carnegie Hall’s Weill Music Institute presented in partnership with the San Antonio Symphony, Link Up guides students and teachers in grades 3–5 through a months-long exploration of orchestral repertoire which culminates in hands-on, participatory concert.Students will sing, move and play soprano recorder or string instruments while learning basic musical concepts and composing their own music. Linking your classroom to the concert hall, this program provides extensive standards-based teacher and student materials and culminates in an interactive orchestral concert in which students actively participate from their seats.  This year's Link Up program, The Orchestra Rocks, explores rhythm as the universal element of music.  Composers and musicians play with elements of musical time, creating patterns of sound and silence that are expressive and exciting.  A consistent groove can unite musicians, singers, and audiences in an experience of listening and performing together.  Through the Link Up repertoire, hands-on-activities, and a culminating interactive performance with the San Antonio Symphony, we will discover how the orchestra rocks!

title: Birds of Neptune
description: About the FilmA sexy drama around two vulnerable sisters, living in their deceased parents’ home in Portland (shot on location).  A smooth-talking young man begins an affair with one of the sisters, only to then move in on the other sister.  A teenage neighbor feels he has to step in to protect the two beautiful sisters from the interloper and themselves.Director: Steven RichterCountry of Origin: USARunning Time: 97mDoc/Narrative: NarrativeLocation: Edison TheaterABOUT THE FESTIVALInspiring our community and future generations is essential.  We hope that the Mammoth Lakes Film Festival will unlock the creative mind of the public by providing emerging filmmakers with an opportunity to have their films excite the community.It will also encourage emerging filmmakers by providing them with a forum to have their work seen by industry professionals who have the potential to propel their careers. We want to bring human stories back into film without the worry of producing the blockbuster but rather use the medium to inspire and motivate our community.Our desire is to give the public opportunities to not only view the films but also our intent to provide a forum for our filmmakers to have exposure and mentorship with industry professionals is crucial. That is why we are bringing in working, successful writers, producers, filmmakers, and actors that can not only assist them with guidance but also give insight to help motivate.

title: Festival of New Spanish Cinema
description: Join us for the Festival of New Spanish Cinema, curated and Organized by Pragda and SPAIN arts & culture. Presented by The Royal Supported by Tourist Office of Spain and Trade Chamber of Commerce of Spain.Wednesday May 6 @ 7:00pm - THE KID (EL NIÑO)Dir./Scr. Daniel Monzón 16 Goya ® Award Nominations in 2015!Boasting 2014's biggest opening weekend figures for a Spanish film, this action-filled thriller by Daniel Monzon (Cell 211) was nominated for 16 Goya Awards, including Best Film, Best Directorand Best Screenplay. It tells the story of two teenagers on the one side, El Niño (Jesús Castro) and El Compi (Jesús Carroza), who want to enter the world of drug trafficking, and two policeofficers on the other, Jesús (Luis Tosar, Even The Rain, Cell 211) and Eva (Bárbara Lennie, The Skin I Live In), who have been trying to eradicate the drug trafficking network in the Gibraltar Straits for years. Also starring Eduard Fernández, Sergi Lopez and Ian McShane as El Inglés. Wednesday May 20 @ 7:00pm - MAGICAL GIRLDir./Scr. Carlos Vermut Official Selection, 2014 Toronto International Film Festival; Winner, Best Film and Best Director, 2014 San Sebastian International Film Festival. 7 Goya ® Award Nominations in 2015! Luis (Luis Bermejo) is desperate to fulfill his terminally ill daughter's last wish: to own the prohibitively expensive "Magical Girl Yukiko" dress from her favorite Japanese cartoon. Fate leads him to cross paths with Bárbara (Bárbara Lennie, The Skin I Live In), an attractive young woman with mental disorders, and with Damián (José Sacristán), a teacher retired from everything but his troubled past. Luis, Bárbara and Damian become trapped in a world of blackmail, where instincts and reason struggle in a tragic battle, changing their lives forever. Wednesday May 27 @ 7:00pm - FALLING STAR (STELLA CANDENTE)Dir./Scr. Luis Miñarro11 Gaudi ® award nominations 2015! Colourful feature debut from experienced producer Miñarro offers an almost hallucinatory look into the world of Amadeo van Savoy, who for two years was king of an ungovernable Spain around 1870. This intriguing episode is transformed into a plea for beauty, creativity and joy.At first sight, Falling Star presents itself as a historic film about the brief rule of Amadeo van Savoy, a prince from Turin who was king of Spain for two years. His mainstay, the powerful General Prim, was murdered before Amadeo was properly installed and then he had no one to fall back on; Spain in 1871 was already plagued by administrative and financial crises. Wednesday June 3 @ 7:00pm - MARSHLAND (LA ISLA MÍNIMA)Dir./Scr. Alberto Rodríguez10 Goya ® Award Winner 2015! Named the film of the year by critics and audience alike.The Spanish deep South, 1980. A series of brutal murders of adolescent girls in a remote and forgotten town bring together two disparate characters – both detectives in the homicide division – to investigate the cases. With deep divisions in their ideology, detectives Juan and Pedro must put aside their differences if they are to successfully hunt down a killer who for years has terrorized a community in the shadow of a general disregard for women rooted in a misogynistic past. From the creators of Unit 7, MARSHLAND is the new thrilling movie by talented director Alberto Rodriguez, who surprised us with Unit 7 and 7 Virgins.

This community  forum will discuss how primary care is changing for the better in our  community.Join in the conversation about improving access to  primary care and show your support for these hard working health care  professionals at the Partners in Health Care Community Forum

title: ChocoSol Chocolate Workshop
description: ChocoSol Traders is a Toronto-based Social Enterprise and Learning Community making artisanal dark chocolate from whole food ingredients. Winner of 'Best Chocolate' by NOW Magazine.Cacao is the "food of the gods", but somehow chocolate has been turned into "candy of the masses." Join us for an interactive chocolate workshop where we explore how sugars have been used to dilute chocolate into sugar-filled candy. We will provide chocolate food alternatives through a variety of creative, delicious, and nutritious treats that are free of cane sugar.This 2½ hour chocolate workshop provides interactive bean-to-bar chocolate education (including discussions on the history and cultural teachings of cacao, chocolate making techniques, horizontal trade and forest garden permaculture), a tour of the kitchen, hands-on ingredient preparation, and chocolate tastings.Attendees also have the opportunity to purchase ChocoSol products at a reduced price.

title: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes
description: "there is not one single moment when these characters, or this rightful classic, wear out their welcome.” - Chris Cabin, Filmcritic.com"You won't find a more elegant take on '50s va-va-voom vulgarity or a more joyous paean to the cheesecake self-empowerment of two little girls from Little Rock.” - David Fear, Time Out New YorkThis month’s instalment of the Royal Retro series brings Howard Hawks classic musical Gentlemen Prefer Blondes to The Royal. One of Marilyn Monroe’s most iconic roles (featuring her unforgettable performance of “Diamonds are a Girl’s Best Friend”, this comic romp Lorelei Lee (Marilyn Monroe) is a beautiful showgirl engaged to be married to the wealthy Gus Esmond (Tommy Noonan), much to the disapproval of Gus' rich father, Esmond Sr., who thinks that Lorelei is just after his money. Together with her best friend Dorothy (Jane Russell), Lorelei embarks upon a boat trip to Paris. En route, the girls are bedeviled by private detective Malone (Elliot Reid), hired by Esmond's father (Taylor Holmes) to make certain that Lorelei isn't just another gold-digger. When Dorothy falls in love with the poverty-stricken Malone, Lorelei decides to find her pal a wealthier potential husband, and that's how she gets mixed up with flirtatious diamond merchant Sir Francis Beekman (Charles Coburn) and precocious youngster Henry Spofford III (George "Foghorn" Winslow).See trailer HERE.

title: Anansi Education 11th Annual Auction
description: Anansi Education's annual auction is here! This wonderful event funds the high school education of teens in Ghana, West Africa. Join us for a silent and live auction featuring African art, jewelry, and fabrics, great food, and great company. Anansi Education makes it possible for bright but impoverished Ghanaian teens to reach their potential and improve the future of their community and country through access to education. Anansi currently sponsors 64 students and has proudly celebrated over 90 graduates. We hope to see you at this year's auction!Early-bird $50 tickets are on sale now until April 18. Regular tickets are $65.

title: Brazilian Fever 2015 - UNRATED!
description:
The 3rd annual Brazilian Fever is back to sizzle the National Capital once again!On Saturday, April 18, 2015, Lago Bar & Grill at Dow’s Lake Pavilion will be transformed into a carnival atmosphere taken straight from the heart of Rio de Janeiro!
oThe evening will start off with dinner between 6:00 and 9:00 with entertainment from MOONGLOW JAZZ ENSEMBLE–they’ll warm things up with an eclectic assortment of sultry Brazilian jazz.  
oThen, BATUCADA CARIOCA, a spectacular group of Brazilian percussionists promise to fill the room with the most traditional rhythms of Brazil’s samba schools. 
oGuests will be tantalized by sultry Brazilian sambistas adorned in feathers and sequin-covered costumes who’ll be dancing alongside Ottawa’s hottest party-goers. 
oRemember, this is a costumed evening, so after three years, we expect that you’ll be dressed in your SEXIEST Brazilian carnival get-up yet! 
oThroughout the night DJ COREAS will be mixing things up with the hottest Brazilian and Latin hits.
Brazilian Fever is organized by Party Twist Events, a Division of GNIM Media Inc., and like previous years, you’re guaranteed a sultry Brazilian experience…the kind that Brazil’s best known for! FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:1. How much are tickets and where can I buy them?Tickets are available for online purchase only. They can be purchased at www.BrazilianFever.ca. 2. Do I need to purchase a ticket if I’m just attending for the dinner? Yes, this is a private event and a ticket is required for entry regardless of whether you intend to just eat, or stay for the entire evening. 3. Are reservations required for dinner, and if so, how do I make a reservation?Yes, reservations are required for dinner, and you will need to call Lago Bar & Grill directly to make that reservation - (613) 235-5246. There will be two dinner sittings, at 6:30 and 7:45. 4. Will there be VIP tickets available?No, this year, due to space restrictions, there will not be a VIP section. 5. Will there be a coat check?Yes, a coat check will be available.6. How should I dress for the evening?Carnival in Brazil incorporates costumes as part of the fun so we definitely encourage you to give wings to your imagination! Here are some ideas to get you started:  A carnival mask, boas, beads, a funny hat, etc…  A Halloween costume you may have available  Men dressed as women and vice-versaOr just come as yourself! Costumes are not mandatory.  For more information:Michelle Maloney - Communications - michelle@partytwist.caJuliana Januario - Operations - juliana@partytwist.caGustavo Natotschiev - Marketing - gustavo@partytwist.ca

title: Most Trusted Advisors for Entrepreneurial Families
description: The most prevalent form of business ownership around the globe is family ownership and as the Director of Ivey's Business Families Centre I am hosting a special MBA session on this subject. My goal is to provide MBA's some insight into the unique challenges that come with working with entrepreneurial families. Whether you are from an entrepreneurial family or will be a consultant or advisor interacting with business families in the future - you will benefit.Format: Recognizing my MBA friends are nearing the end of their terms and also may want to head to other events, Friday morning I am organizing a three hour session - ending with pizza!You will get a little mini lecture, followed by several video cases that present challenges that groups of MBA's will solve. Due to the "last minute" nature of this, if I get a good number of MBA's registering, I will try and get some advisors to join us so I can mix practitioners with MBA teams.

title: Living With The Dead
description:
Pre-Show Reception starts an hour before screening time. Q&A Talk-back with filmmakers starts immediately following screening.Living with the DeadDrama, 93 min. USADirected by Christine VartoughianNYC PremiereMax McLean is eighteen years old and can't get out of bed. Since her boyfriend Adam killed himself over a year ago, Max has been using sex, drugs, and parties to ignore the pain until one day she wakes up in a hospital, haven taken a nearly lethal dose of sleeping pills. While being haunted by visions of Adam, Max runs away from home and ventures into the forest with a bizarre but endearing boy named Ish.Cast includes:Selenis Leyva: "Orange is the New Black"
Robert Clohessy: "Oz", "Boardwalk Empire", "The Wolf of Wall Street"
Chris Riggi: "Gossip Girl", "Vampires Suck", "Adult World"
Tanner Flood: "Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt", "Moonrise Kingdom"
Marc Coppola: "Leaving Las Vegas", "The Bling Ring"
Brooklyn Connection:We shot several scenes of "Living with the Dead" in Brooklyn (predominantly in & around Pratt). Many of our cast & crew are current residents of Brooklyn. Christine Vartoughian, the director, is a previous resident of Williamsburg. Rebekah Nelson, the producer, is a previous resident of East New York.

title: CYPRUS - Block 12
description: Tickets will be available online until 1:00pm on Nov. 23rd. After that time, rush tickets are available at the door starting at 3:30pm.Block 12Dir. Kyriakos Tofaridis / 2013 / 94 minutesHigh above the planet, English satellites discover large oil deposit in the area of the Old Mines in Cyprus. As it turns out, a substantial part of the area belongs to Greek-Cypriot man who bought it from his Turkish Cypriot colleague and has retired there with his wife. Events beyond their quiet property soon begin to encroach on the peaceful retired couple. The international economic crisis forces the man’s two sons to move their families into the house. This situation is made worse when the Cyprus government keeps asking to buy the house to capitalize on the oil reserves. Soon enough, two English oil company agents arrive and camp outside the house, hoping to cash in. Sounding echoes of Bill Forsyth’s LOCAL HERO, Tofardis’s BLOCK 12 is a wry and charming comedy. English sub-titles.Du haut du ciel, des satellites anglais ont repéré un gisement pétrolier dans la région des Vieilles Mines à Chypre. Un Chypriote grec l'a acquis (d'un collègue chypriote turc) et   a pris sa retraite avec sa femme. La crise économique force ses deux fils à y emménager avec leur famille. La situation empire encore quand le gouvernement veut acheter la maison, et que les représentants de deux pétrolières anglaises ainsi que l'héritier de l’ancien propriétaire chypriote turc établissent un campement devant chez lui. Une charmante comédie. Sous-titres en anglais.

title: Networking for Entrepreneurs with Allison Graham
description: Allison Graham: How to build a profitable network and reap the rewards that brings. Details:Date: November 10, 2014Time: 5:00 - 7:30 p.m.Location: Leenders Lounge, Ivey Business SchoolBy the end of this session you will know how to…grow your reputation in the marketplace so it’s easier to build your company, get funding when necessary and have a full prospect pipeline to move your products when you launch your business!Learn how to warm-up opportunities versus having to struggle like so many other entrepreneurs because they have to play the numbers game with cold calls.And you’ll understand Allison’s signature explanation of what it takes to build loyal referral influencers and create profitable relationship momentum.Allison Graham is the author of the bestselling book, From Business Cards to Business Relationships: Personal Branding & Profitable Networking Made Easy! As she enters her 9th year in business as an entrepreneur at Elevate Biz, she has worked with the many of Canada’s financial institutions, most influential associations and has touched the lives of thousands of entrepreneurs who have benefited from her content. In 2013 she was named to London, Ontario’s inaugural Top 20 Under 40 Economic Trailblazers list. She absolutely loves living in London and she makes good use of our airport and spends time travelling to serve clients. Last week she was speaking at The Venetian in Las Vegas and the week before she was in New York city to film Bestseller TV as her book was chosen for C-Suite Book Club! Whether you’re an introvert, extrovert or not even sure what that means, Allison’s concepts can help you become more successful in business.

title: Cirque des Shriners. 2 pour 1 MEILLEUR PRIX!
description:
ACROBATS, LES ANIMAUX ET LES CLOWNS ... plaisir pour vous et TOUTE LA FAMILLE SOUS LE PLUS GRAND et PLUS BEAU GRAND CHAPITEAU DU CANADA
Le Cirque des Shriners est à venir à Québec cet été 2014, Il a été une tradition familiale depuis quatre générations de Canadiens et c'est une expérience de votre famille à ne pas manquer.  Tout le monde aime le cirque. Les enfants sont fascinés par les acrobates, des clowns et des artistes d'origine animale. Parents, vous serez un enfant encore, voir la merveille du cirque à travers les yeux de votre fils ou fille de. Les grands-parents, vous serez ramenés à votre première visite au cirque, il ya toutes ces années et se sentent connectés à vos petits-enfants par une expérience passionnante de la vie partagée avec eux.  C'est amusant, abordable et respectueux des animaux. Nos artistes animales travaillent en étroite collaboration avec leurs formateurs, défiant les uns les autres pour le plaisir de leur public, en montrant comment les gens et les animaux peuvent vivre et travailler ensemble en harmonie. C'est une leçon importante pour tous les enfants à apprendre à travers l'expérience de cirque.  Visitez le Zerbini famille sanctuaire d'exécution pour les éléphants à Gainesville en Floride http://www.allaboutelephants.com/  C'est le 251e anniversaire de la Zerbini Family Circus. Depuis le début de l'humble Zerbini Family Circus à Paris, en France, en 1763, dix générations de Zerbinis ont parcouru le partager leurs talents avec le public du cirque sur trois continents monde.  Nous avons quelque chose pour toute la famille dans cette imagination, nouveau spectacle passionnant, y compris; Astounding Trapeze & Artistry aérienne, jongleurs, Monocycles, comédie musicale, High Flying sautoir acrobatie, clowns classiques, Pôle Perch l'Année action de cheval spectaculaire, et bien plus encore!  En raison de leur quête de l'excellence sans compromis, vous serez surpris par le célèbre Cirque des Shriners de cette année. Nous allons vous emmener dans un monde où vous verrez des performances spectaculaires du monde entier. Accrochez-vous à vos sièges et l'expérience d'une vitrine de talent que vous n'oublierez jamais!  Le Cirque des Shriners annuel est l'un des plus importants événements de collecte de fonds les continues à venir à votre communauté. Préparez-vous pour un, amusante expérience unique pour toute la famille.  Run Away au cirque pour une journée et "être surpris" à 2014 Cirque des Shriners!

title: { the GRATITUDE kit } workshop
description: Hosted by: Kate DurieDate: Thursday, July 17th, 2014  6:30 to 9:00pmLocation: The Studio Cafe, 1089 Somerset St WestAbout the Workshop:Having a GRATITUDE PRACTICE about pausing and savouring, reflecting and expressing. Even when we don't FEEL grateful, we can still practice. Gratitude not only has a positive ripple effect on our physical, emotional, and mental health, it makes us more resilient, joyful, and creative.  It transforms what we have into enough.More than enough.Simply put, gratitude rocks! At this workshop, you will create and take home a gratitude kit + a plan to put it into action + a whole pile of inspiration! You will tap into your creative spirit and together we will make magic.This kit will create a whole-hearted ripple of love throughout your life, and those around you.Cost: $45 (price includes all supplies and HST).If you would like to avoid the Eventbrite fee, I will happily accept email money transfers to kateUdurie@gmail.com.Please note: Once registered, refunds are not available.Love from a past workshop: http://nicole-belanger.com/2014/02/12/a-small-town-trip-with-big-time-gratitude/ (by Nicole Belanger)"Life is not a straight line. Speed bumps, setbacks, ups and downs. Big ups. Big downs. Big wins. Big losses. And so so many in betweens. Life comes with a whole pile of hopes, assumptions, expectations and beliefs. How life "should" go. But as you and I both know, sometimes life doesn't go as planned. We get stuck. We get lost. We get hurt.The remedy? Gratitude. And gratitude ... is a PRACTICE.Gratitude has the ability to pull us into the now. To pause. It has magnetic energy that grows and expands and attracts possibility to everything it touches. When we focus on what and who we are grateful for, transformation follows. You will be changed. You will spread change. It’s a practice and it takes practice. It's not about waiting for things to happen, to be perfect, to be extraordinary - it is your gratitude practice that will shift the way you see the ordinary, the every day. Your gratitude kit will give you the skills, tools, ideas, and momentum to keep your gratitude practice going throughout the entire year…and beyond.When we embody, express, and spread gratitude our heart feels lighter, brighter, and whole. Gratitude changes our perspective. Gratitude strengthens our work and our relationships – with those we love, and with our SELF – because gratitude gives as much to the sender as the receiver."- Kate

title: Being an Indie at Pixar

title: Manic Run Club - Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday Runs
description:
Come join the Manic RC every Tuesday and Thursday evening around 7pm at the Trinity Bellwoods gates at Queen and Strachen (right under the gates). We will leave around 7:15 so make sure your on time!

Will run anywhere between 7-10 km on a given night. 

For those who want to run a little longer, there is a run every Saturday morning at 8:30 am from Manic Coffee at College and Bathurst. A so called hangout run is anywhere from 10-20 kms depending on the group vote.

There are runners of all different paces so don't be afraid to come, there will always be someone to match you're ability with.

title: TEDxKaliningrad 2013
description:
На этот раз тема конференции «It’s time…», или в переводе — «Пора!». В прошлом году мы говорили об идеях как таковых, а в этом — об определяющей силе момента. Ведь хорошие идеи, при всей своей неисчислимой ценности, должны быть выражены в действии, иначе они быстро стареют, становятся неинтересными и умирают. Действие же возможно только здесь и сейчас, где мы находимся в настоящий момент, потому что прошлое уже закончилось, а будущее ещё не состоялось. Только настоящий момент содержит в себе зерно трансформации мира через реализацию идей.

ENG:
This time the theme of the conference will be “It’s time…”. Last year we talked about ideas and now we will focus on the transforming power of the present moment. Ideas may be great and offer value but unless these ideas are put into practice, they may soon become obsolete and end up in a closet. Action is possible only in the here and now because the past is over and the future is yet to come. Only the present moment has the potential, the seed, for transformation through theimplementation of ideas.

title: Culture & Fermentation Workshop (Weeknights)
description:
Culture of Health Workshop…a fermentation story

Fermenting local, in-season, sustainably grown produce is a great way to “keep it local” and enhance nutrition all year-round. It not only preserves food but also enhances the flavour and nutrient content. Cultures go to work to makes the minerals in fermented foods more readily available to the body. As an added bonus, the active cultures also produce B vitamins and enzymes that are beneficial for digestion. From pickles to kimchee and sauerkraut, the value of these foods in our diet is hard to...beet...and worth the effort.

Culturing or fermenting a food involves a chemical process that breaks down a complicated substance into simpler parts. The Fresh City canning team will show you just how to break down the art of fermentation into its simplest parts and have fun filling your pantry with this autumn’s harvest. You’ll be surprised what a blast it is to learn and how much money your new found cultural skills will save you. 

This is a 2 hour, hands-on class and you’ll be taking your own jar home with you to watch over and protect while it finishes! 

Wednesday Location:
Demo Kitchen at the Uniiverse head office
2nd floor, 111 Jarvis St., Toronto

title: SUPPER CLUB: A Night in Tunis by Dali Chehimi
description:
The name Tunis is often associated with an Arabic word that means to socialize and to be friendly. With hospitality so close to the heart of Tunisian culture, it should be no surprise that it also abounds with fantastic food.

Dali Chehimi has put together a delightful menu featuring several classic Tunisian dishes, many rarely seen in Toronto.

Ommek Houria
A spicy Tunisian starter, somewhere between a salad and a dip, made with sweet braised carrots combined with Dali's homemade harissa, garlic and olive oil. A popular dish to break the Ramadan fast.

Brik a l'Oeuf
This is the best-known version of Brik (pronounced breek), a Tunisian dish consisting of thin "warka" pastry wrapped around a  variety of fillings. In Brik a l'Oeuf, a whole raw egg is included with chopped onion, tuna, harissa and parsley, before it is fried to golden crisp. There is a Tunisian tradition where a bride-to-be's mother makes brik for the potential bridegroom — if the bridegroom eats it without spilling any of the egg yolk, he may marry the bride!

Chicken with Preserved Lemons and Green Olives
This is a classic North African tagine, or stew, named after the conical earthenware pots they are typically cooked in. This dish combines the aromatic citrus of homemade preserved lemons with briny, earthy green olives and tender chicken to great effect. Served with tri-color couscous.

Green Tea and Artisanal Baklava
Dinner ends with a cup of classic Tunisian tea and a selection of fine North African pastries.

JUST ANNOUNCED: Danny Castricone, wine broker and owner of Mondo Vino has offered to supply two exclusive wines paired with Chef Dali Chehimi's Tunsian Supper Club on Oct. 5: White: Cantina Nals Margreid from Alto Adige — 2012 Pinot Bianco Penon DOC, and Red: Azienda Agricola Le Salette from Veneto — 2012 Valpolicella Classico DOCG. You can enjoy the wine pairing for only an extra $10!

$40 +HST
with paired wines: $50 +HST

B.Y.O.B. — No corkage

Learn more about The Rusholme Park Supper Club
http://thedepanneur.ca/supper-club/

A veteran Toronto restaurateur, Dali Chehimi’s storied career has seen him working alongside luminary chefs like Greg Couillard at iconic restaurants such as Sassafraz, Sarkis and Avec, as well as running Casbah, an innovative pop-up food stall specializing in Tunisian fare.

title: Metamorphosis Eco Fashion Show & Marketplace
description:
Join fashion-lovers, designers, eco-friendly retailers and more on October 26th 2016 for this unique event that harmonizes fashion and sustainability: The Metamorphosis Eco-Fashion Show and Marketplace.Metamorphosis Eco Fashion Show and Marketplace is an event that showcases and supports environmentally-minded emerging fashion designers in the Ottawa area. Our designers will showcase their cutting-edge eco-friendly fashion, both on the runway and in an exclusive night time marketplace,  bringing together eco-friendly apparel consumers, sustainable designers and everyone in between.
	

Metamorphosis offers a supportive environment for local designers to exhibit and sell their innovative designs, all the while accessing small business support and development opportunities through EcoEquitable's Enabling Apparel Entrepreneurship Program. This program is designed to support budding apparel entrepreneurs in Ottawa, particularity those facing barriers to setting up their own businesses.






EcoEquitable is a registered Canadian charity and social enterprise providing temporary employment and skills development training through small scale textile recycling. Our mission is to provide a bridge between social and economic integration for new Canadians, especially immigrant women, experiencing barriers to finding employment.

We are helping women in our community learn the skills they need to contribute to the budding eco fashion industry while blending our love for the environment, support for entrepreneurship, and desire to help new Canadians find meaningful employment.

For the past ten years, we’ve provided employment and skills training for new immigrant and underemployed women, while diverting harmful waste from our landfills. And with your help, we will continue for another ten years: recycling fabric and changing lives.

title: Official Paisley Park Tour GA October 30
description:
Paisley Park, Prince’s extraordinary private estate and production complex in Chanhassen, Minnesota, will open for daily public tours starting October 6, 2016. Fans will have the unprecedented opportunity to experience first-hand what it was like for Prince to create, produce and perform inside this private sanctuary and remarkable production complex.

Paisley Park tour tickets are only available in advance via online purchase and are NOT available for purchase at Paisley Park.  Ticket holders will only be permitted entry to the Paisley Park parking lot 20 minutes prior to their tour start time.  Ticket holders must depart within ten minutes following the completion of their tour.

Throughout the experience, visitors will see artifacts from Prince’s personal archives, including iconic concert wardrobe, awards (his seven GRAMMY® Awards, a Golden Globe Award, and an Academy Award® for the film “Purple Rain”), musical instruments, artwork, rare music and video recordings, concert memorabilia, automobiles and motorcycles.

title: Biomass North AGM and Forum 2016
description:
Growing the Bioeconomy – Combatting Climate Change is the theme for this year's AGM and Forum. The event is focused on moving the Canadian Bioeconomy further along the value chain through knowledge sharing, technology demonstrations, workshops on policy gaps and skills development, and building strategic partnerships between industry, communities, and academia.

This 3-day event will be held at the Clarion Resort Pinewood Park in beautiful North Bay, Ontario from October 24 – 26, 2016. As well as workshops, seminars, a research symposium, a trade show and job fair, there will be a gala dinner and awards ceremony, allowing the best and most innovative sector leaders to be recognized for the excellent work they do.

As a multi-faceted event, Building the Bioeconomy – Combatting Climate Change has several objectives:


	Share how the emerging bioeconomy can be a key plank in combatting climate change
	Demonstrate the latest technologies in biomass supply, biofuels and bioenergy, bioproducts manufacturing
	Identify policy and regulatory barriers to a growing the Canadian bioeconomy and how to overcome
	Inform policy makers of the economic, social, and environmental benefits of a sustainable bioeconomy
	Understand the skills and training the emerging bioeconomy will require
	Share best practices, policy mechanisms, curriculum and expertise from jurisdictions farther along the biomass value-chain
	Identify areas for collaboration

Visit www.biomassnorth.org/forum16.html for full details.

title: Pviff
description: PVIFF is hosted by The African American Cinema Gallery (AACG) & Gipp. Museums, Inc. (501c3) PVIFF attracts 3,000 - 3,500 people each year from around the world with an online footprint of 300 million global impressions. PVIFF was created in 2006 under the previous name (Sweet Auburn International Film Festival) and have served as the launching pad for many successful filmmakers and other artists alike in the film & entertainment industry. This dynamic international film festival showcases feature length films, shorts, music videos, documentaries, and screenplays from around the globe. PVIFF also feature celebrity attractions, innovative workshops, panels, parties, and much more. PVIFF is poised to become one of the most celebrated film events through dynamic programming and a dedication to helping filmmakers excel in their careers. PVIFF's brand is entrenched in the old saying "It Takes A Village." Our vision allows us to create a village atmosphere that provides opportunities not only for filmmakers but for business owners and film enthusiasts.Artists such as Director/Writer Rob Hardy & Producer Will Packer of Rain Forest Films, Producer, Director/Writer, Malcolm Lee, Roger Bobb of Tyler Perry Studios, Emmy Award Winning Producer, Dean Hargrove, Casting Director/Producer, Reuben Cannon, Director/Producer, Roger Bobb, Casting Director, Alpha Tyler of Tyler Perry Studios, Actress, Mrs. Ruby Dee, Ms. Kim Fields, Actor, Bill Nunn, Humanitarian, Afeni Shakur, classic R&B group Full Force and many more have all participated in various aspects of PVIFF over the years. With increased exposure, the assistance from the film and business community PVIFF will help ignite opportunities and make dreams to come true for decades to come.

title: Imagining the Future of Company Culture
description:
Join us for

Imagining the Future 

of Company Culture 



with
 Svetlana Saitsky, Professional Coach | Storyteller
 Ty Walrod, Co-founder and CEO, Bright Funds

Joe Wheeler, Corporate Social Responsibility Associate, Dropbox




Culture  is critical to a company's success and can be the difference between  thriving and just plain surviving. It affects everything from the  ability to recruit and retain talent to public perception, customer  satisfaction and the bottom line.

This  session will address the changing landscape of company culture and  provide real-world examples and tips from a panel of experts.

Topics include:

- What creates true company culture (snacks & yoga classes don't count!)

- Conscious businesses that serves a higher purpose

- How to recruit people who will work well together and foster great company culture

- Strategies to achieve your vision for company culture

OUR SPEAKERS

Svetlana Saitsky  is a professional storyteller, artist and coach. She has worked with  Delivering Happiness, Google, Apple, lululemon, Great Place To Work  Institute, and Socially Superlative among others. Her writing has been featured in publications such as the Examiner.com, The Huffington Post and Delivering Happiness. For  the last decade, Svetlana has been researching the science of  happiness, inspiration, and ultimately, transformation. After  interviewing hundreds of CEOs, musicians, actors, politicians, and  leaders from all walks of life, her first book is set to be published in  2017.

Svetlana's work for Google X was featured in USA TODAY and  currently, she is coaching and consulting clients in the areas of  company culture-building, content, and brand strategy. As the Head of  Storytelling for YouCaring.com, her mission is to create a world where  no one faces hardship alone. What fascinates and inspires Svetlana is  the human ability to overcome, and become who we came here to be.





Ty Walrod  is the CEO and Co-Founder of Bright Funds, a technology platform  unlocking the multi-billion dollar market for individual and workplace  giving. Bright Funds is built for a new generation of savvy donors who  want a simple and rewarding way to give back. He serves on the boards of  directors of Sustainable Silicon Valley and Startup & Tech Mixer  and is an active member of Silicon Valley Leadership Group and Founders  Network.

Prior  to Bright Funds, Walrod co-founded OutServe, a global nonprofit  organization that united thousands of LGBT service members and worked to  build an environment of respect and integrity in the U.S. Armed  Services. He started his career in venture capital, private equity and  technology audit at Deloitte, followed by his work as senior business  analyst at Coverity. He is a summa cum laude graduate of Washburn  University, where he was awarded the Graduate of the Last Decade (GOLD)  Award in April of 2016.



Joe Wheeler is a Corporate Social Responsibility Associate at Dropbox.

Joe Wheeler led the creation of "Dropbox for Good" (DfG) in 2013. To date, the  program has contributed millions of dollars to organizations supporting  technology education, local poverty eradication, and digital rights.  There are DfG  chapters in San Francisco, Seattle, Austin, New York, Dublin, Sydney,  Tokyo, and Herzliya. Through DfG, employees have volunteered more than  4,000 hours of their time and donated over 25,000 terabytes of free  Dropbox space to nonprofits all over the world.

Prior  to Dropbox, Wheeler served as a Peace Corps volunteer in the South Gobi  province of Mongolia, living in a yurt and teaching English at a  vocational training center. He graduated from Whitman College with a  Politics degree in 2011.





The Nasdaq Entrepreneurial Center is  a San Francisco-based non-profit that provides aspiring and current  entrepreneurs with access to quality resources, including mentors,  training, and networking.

description: It’s like a dream. There you are, with up to NINE of your closest comrades, sitting at your private reserved table at The Great American Lobster Fest. You’re on the end of Navy Pier, a cold drink in your hand and a bib tied around your neck. You are hungry, really hungry. And BAM! Up to 50 POUNDS of whole, freshly cooked, steaming Lobster gets gloriously displayed on the table in front of you, along with corn-on-the-cob, potatoes, lemon wedges, and glorious melted butter for all your dipping pleasure. Come feast like royalty.... Oh, and this year.... you're VIP.Each Lobster Hero Feast table purchase for 6 guests includes: - 30 pounds of whole steamed Lobster - 6 drink tickets good A beverage of your choice (Beer, Wine, Spirits, Soda, Water)- 6 Grand Ballroom Tickets.- 6 Lobster Fest T-shirts.- A Family style serving of Corn-On-The-Cob and Potatoes.- Lobster bibs, Lemon wedges, and Melted Butter.- A 2-hour private reserved table for up to 6 people.- 6 VIP passes to access VIP areas at the fest (New this year!)- Bragging rights.* Total Cost for Table of up to 6: $650Each Lobster Hero Feast table purchase for 10 guests includes: - 50 pounds of whole steamed Lobster - 10 drink tickets good A beverage of your choice (Beer, Wine, Spirits, Soda, Water)- 10 Grand Ballroom Tickets.- 10 Lobster Fest T-shirts.- A Large Family style serving of Corn-On-The-Cob and Potatoes.- Lobster bibs, Lemon wedges, and Melted Butter.- A 2-hour private reserved table for up to 10 people.- 10 VIP passes to access VIP areas at the Fest (New this year!)- MEGA Bragging Rights.* Total Cost for Table of up to 10: $1,000___________________________________________________________________*Fine Print (because our lawyers say we have to!)- LIMITED AVAILABILITY. There are only 2 to 4 tables per time slot available! - Price is per-table, not per person. - The Lobster hero is designed for up to 6, OR up to 10 people (depending on the package you purchase). - Exact check-in location will be emailed to the person who registers and purchases the Lobster Hero table the week of the festival. - Lobster Hero is an all ages’ activation, but everyone pays the same price. - Each private table reservation is good for on the 2 hours during the scheduled time slot. - Price and availability subject to change. - By selecting your time slot when you sign up, you agree that you may not change your time slot. - All purchases are 100% non-refundable. No exchanges of any kind. - The Lobster Hero Fest will take place rain or shine. If weather is bad, your table may be relocated inside. - Giving lobster from your feast to anyone not part of your 6 or 10-person reservation is prohibited. The lobster is for you and your party only. Plus, we bet you can't eat it all! - Shirt Sizes may be limited.  - Your feast will arrive within 30 minutes of your scheduled reservation start time. - The fest is not responsible for you eating too much. How much you eat is up to you. - Your drink and t-shirt vouchers will be given to you by the Lobster Hero Feast host and your food will be dropped off by your Lobster Hero Feast food runner. You must get your own drinks from the different bars located around the festival. There are no servers for these tables. Tipping your host and food runner is appreciated but not required. -VIP Access with the purchase of the Lobster Hero Feast does not include additional food or drink vouchers.  - Festival is not responsible for any lost or stolen items. Customers consuming alcohol and festival food is at their own risk. Festival is not responsible for any illness or allergy related issues regarding consumption of shellfish or any other food and beverage served at The Great American Lobster Fest.

title: June Debauchery!
description: Debauchery is: queers stripping for queers in hot, anti-oppressive space, raising money for organizations that serve the queer community. The show features stripteases, tons of audience interaction and even birthday lap dances onstage! Be sure to bring plenty of dollar bills -- a portion of the proceeds goes to non-profits providing health and social services within the queer community.This month's show benefits our community fund!**Accessibility** Neighbours is wheelchair accessible via the main entrance to the bar (located in the alley). There is a ramp between the door and the box office, and ample space for wheelchairs in the audience space. The show is ASL-Interpreted.Fragrance free request: Please join us in ensuring accessibility for beloved community members with chemical sensitivity and chronic illness by not bringing fragrances or scents on your clothes, hair, or skin from colognes and perfumes, scented laundry detergent, hair and body products, natural products, and essential oils. You can prepare in advance by not using products with fragrance, or by using fragrance free, non-toxic products. Two multi-stall all-gender restrooms are available.Information for scent sensitive people:Neighbors is not a scent free space. Scented cleaning products are used in all areas, including hand soap in the bathroom. Additionally,cigarette smoke from the smoking area in the alley drifts into the main performance space inside, fog is used on the dance floor, and many patrons are not scent free. Please protect yourself accordingly.

title: Semba in Seattle with Eddy Vents
description:
Join world class instructor, Eddy Vents, for 4 hours of Semba instruction.   A "Foundation" pass that's beginner friendly and good for the first 2 hours of the workshop is available.  Technique class requires participation in the Foundation class.

Upcoming dates: June 11th, July 9th, September 17th, October 15th, and December 10th.

 SCHEDULE

	1pm-3pm Semba Foundation (beginner friendly) 
	3pm-5pm Semba Technique (must be present for the Foundation class)

PRICING: Book early and save!**


	FULL Early Bird Pass $40 (available online until midnight on Saturday one week prior to the workshop)
	FOUNDATION Early Bird Pass $20 (available online until midnight on Saturday one week prior to the workshop) 


	FULL Advanced Pass $52.50 (available until midnight the Friday before the workshop)
	FOUNDATION Advanced Pass $27.50 (available until midnight the Friday before the workshop)


	FULL Procrastinators Pass (Door)  $65
	FOUNDATION Procrastinators Pass  (Door)  $35

Private lessons inquiries: dance@eddyvents.com

STAY FOR THE EWE! PARTY SATURDAY NIGHT FEATURING DJ EFX, TICKETS HERE:

https://www.facebook.com/events/251080661925805/


About Eddy Vents

Eddy Vents was born in Guinea-Bissau and raised in Portugal. Growing up part of the Palop Community Eddy always felt electrified by Kizomba.

In 1998 he began his career as a promoter in Lisbon orchestrating parties which he continued after moving to London in October 2009.

Eddy’s immense love, passion and knowledge of Kizomba was recognized by respected Kizomba teacher Norma Facey and Eddy humbly credits her for starting his teaching career around March 2010.

That same year he founded Pitanga Dance Group as a platform for promoting authentic Kizomba through teaching and performance with a focus on enriching the student’s learning experience by acknowledging the origins of the music and dance. Eddy is known for a teaching style submersed in history and musicality which he believes are fundamental in producing top quality dancers and he is confident the success of his method is demonstrated each time his students take the dance floor.

Eddy’s interests include reading, playing chess, watching movies, listening to music and while he’s a self-proclaimed futebol fanatic his real passion is travelling the world dancing and teaching others about Kizomba.  Here’s a partial list of countries and festivals where Eddy has taught.

Countries: UK, Jamaica, Croatia, Finland, France, Portugal, Spain, Serbia, USA, Greece, Sweden, Switzerland, Luxembourg, Germany, Canada, Brazil, Italy, Poland, Estonia, Holland, Russia, Israel

Congresses and Festivals:  Áfricadançar, Batuke, Swimming Festival, Sensual Dance, Feeling Festival, Open Spain, Paris Tentação, Luxembourg International Kizomba Festival, Miami Beach Festival, Mambo City 5 Stars, Pointins, Fitness Weekender, Kent Salsa Festival, Salsa Splash, Salsa Splash Alicante, Bachaturo, and Kizomba Congress in Holland.

title: Renoir - Exhibition On Screen - Film Screening
description: Nucleus Arts Presents - Renoir - Revered and Reviled This wonderful film will allow a global audience to visit the Barnes Foundation in Philadelphia, home to the largest Renoir collection in the world.The film will grant completely unrestricted access to the unique collection amassed by Dr. Albert C. Barnes, who admired Renoir above all other artists. This unrivaled collection of 181 Renoir works, largely paintings from his ‘late period’, will promote a fresh look at one of the 20th century’s greatest artists, and help to explore why Renoir has polarised opinion for over 100 years.Renoir - Revered and Reviled will offer a rare opportunity to see these extraordinary artworks on the big screen, which have never before travelled to the UK and are never loaned. Beloved Impressionist, influential master or self-indulgent fantasist? You decide.Pierre Auguste Renoir is known and loved for his impressionist paintings. But Renoir himself grew tired of this style and radically changed course. This film – based on the remarkable never loaned collection of 181 Renoirs at the Barnes Foundation in Philadelphia – examines the new direction he took and why it provokes such extreme reactions even today.
