title: Brand Story Strategy Workshop for B2B Marketers
description:
Are you ready to reignite within you the one true superpower we all possess – storytelling – to grow your professional services firm?Brand Story Strategy Workshop for B2B Marketers from ParkHowell.com on Vimeo.In this fun and inspiring one-day workshop, you will learn to use the proven Story Cycle process that has helped hundreds of companies profit from getting their brand story straight.
Apply a powerful story strategy that helps you rise above the noise of the Attention Economy
Create your personal leadership story that will awe any audience
Define your authentic brand story that differentiates you in a crowded market
Align your stories to create a narrative that your employees can live into and prosper from
Connect with customers like never before
You should attend this intimate gathering (only 10 participants) if you're CEO who wants your team all pulling in the same direction, a communications professional who must cut through the clutter and move people to action, or a director of sales who wants to turn presentations into significant production..AGENDA:9:00 am: Introductions & ice breaker9:30 am: Explore the Story Cycle & Outline Your Leadership Story (What's Your Story field notebook provided)10:30 am: BREAK10:45 am: Q&A and Finalize Your Leadership Story11:00 am: Share Your 3-min. Leadership Story with Your Fellow StudentsNoon: LUNCH1:00 pm: Brand Story Development Part I (Get Your Brand Story Straight workbook provided)2:30 pm: BREAK2:45 pm: Brand Story Development Part II4:00 pm: BREAK4:15pm: Aligning Your Leadership & Brand Stories, and Next Steps5:00 pm: Beer, Wine & Cheese: You've earned it!Hear what others are saying about Business of Story workshops.If you are not 100% satisfied with the outcome of your story session, I will return 100% of your fee – guaranteed.$1,200 ticket value, yet priceless to the growth of your organization.YOUR INSTRUCTORI've been helping brands experience epic growth for more than 30 years: 20+ years running my own ad agency and the past 10+ years immersed in the power of storytelling. I also created and teach the communications curriculum based on storytelling for the Executive Master of Sustainability Leadership program at Arizona State University to help our international executive students use narrative to advance their social initiatives further, faster. And I'm excited to share this proven story structure with you to grow your nonprofit and your people. Here are the results other organizations have achieved using the Story Cycle. I promise you that when you leave this Business of Story workshop, you will have reignited within you the one true superpower we all possess – storytelling – to nudge the world in any direction you choose.

title: Classical in the park for moms & babies - May 25th
description: Join us on Wednesday May 25th at Trinity Bellwoods park for our new series "Classical in the park" seriesWe are pleased to welcome violinist Ivana Popovic who will offer a classical repertoire which will include music and insights into the pieces presented. Bring blankets & babies and enjoy some beautiful classical music!The concert will last a little more than 30 minutes.The event is free of charge.  You are welcomed to contribute a monetary amount, all amounts will go towards the Art Strollers fund, at the end of 2016 the cumulation of the fund will be allocated to art organizations in Toronto offering family programming.About Ivana Popovic"As a violinist and composer, I look at the world, both past and future, as the center of my inspiration.  Creations are the essence of my endeavours, sounds and words my favourite tools.  While my aesthetics includes both beauty and imagination, the most important element of my art is the summoning of emotions of all colours in others.  Reaching hidden corners - experiences, memories, vignettes of images and feelings - is the purpose of my music and my performances."www.ivanapopovic.comAbout Art StrollersOur purpose is to bridge families and art organizations, art institutions, galleries and artists. By engaging families with the arts, we strive to enrich not only the lives of the children and parents but also to contribute to the art world's reach and growth for current and future generations. It is a dual purpose to engage the future generations in appreciating and sustaining the continuous creation and presentation of art - visual and performing.www.artstrollers.ca

title: 2016 Emerging Leaders Symposium
description:
The Metropolitan Board of the Chicago Urban League (MetroBoard) is committed to service in every way: to our communities, to our affiliate, and to our own personal and professional development. Our programming and new initiatives are designed to create these opportunities to allow MetroBoard to address the unique service needs of the young professional.We will work to achieve our goal of preparing the nation’s next generation of leaders by hosting the 2016 Emerging Leaders Symposium: Unleashing the Greatness within You on Saturday, April 23rd from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. City Treasurer of Chicago Kurt Summers will serve as our opening keynote speaker.This symposium is designed to develop the young professional holistically in the areas of career development, service, and wellness. description: In celebration of National Grilled Cheese Month in April, Provisions Market and OC Baking Company will once again join forces to host The Big Cheese, Orange County’s grilled cheese festival and competition. Event Co-Founder Chef Greg Daniels and his fellow OC Chefs will compete for the title of “The Big Cheese” in this 3rd annual event to be held on Tuesday, April 19th from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. at Provisions Market (143 N. Glassell Street, Orange, CA 92866). OC Baking Company Master Baker Dean Kim will supply locally produced freshly baked bread to the competing chefs, while the farmer-owned dairy cooperative Tillamook will offer a selection of its award-winning cheeses and butter for use at the festival. The following chefs will present their own spin on the classic grilled cheese sandwich that festival attendees will sample and then vote on: Host Chef – Executive Chef Greg Daniels  OC Baking Co – Master Baker Dean Kim (supplying all breads) ADYA – Executive Chef Shachi MehraAnepalco’s Café – Executive Chef Danny Godinez  Break of Dawn – Chef/Owner Dee Nguyen  Crema Café – Chef Tarit Tanjasiri & Chef Erick SimmonsHaven Gastropub – Chef de Cuisine Craig Brady Mesa – Executive Chef Niki StarrOrange Home Grown Farmers & Artisans Market – Lisa GilmoreProvisions Market – Sous Chef Anthony Latteri  Sessions West Coast Deli – Executive Chef Max Schlutz Vaca – Executive Chef Amar SantanaWorking Class Kitchen – Executive Chef David Coleman  ProAm Challenger - Peter HsiehThis year’s event will feature one ProAm competitor who was selected by event organizers in an Instagram contest to join the professional chefs at The Big Cheese 2016. To enter, the public was asked to create and present an original grilled cheese recipe on Instagram and use the hashtag #thebigcheese2016. Congrats to Peter Hsieh!Tickets for the event must be purchased for $60 in advance (will include limited tasters of select craft beer) through Universe at http://www.universe.com/bigcheese2016. This event will be limited to 100 guests (tickets will be sold at the door, if capacity permits).

title: People, energy or space - Hurley Palmer Flatt
description: People, energy or space : what is more important to drive design?Hurley Palmer Flatt240 Blackfriars Road, London, SE1 8NWWhat is it that drives design? We have selected three critical items that help shape the buildings we design:Space: the ever pressing challenge of maximising square meterage, be it to provide ample accommodation or to maximise returns on investment;People: providing the most ‘comfortable’ environment, one that enhances senses and allows occupiers to be more productive in whatever they are doing.Energy: the drive to reduce energy consumption and carbon emission, heightened by the tightening of regulations or by clients’ CSR aspirationsBut which of these is more important? Most often there are clear champions for each of these areas: developers wanting more space, architects wanting the most of people experience and sustainability consultants pushing for the energy performance. With a short presentation of work we have been undertaking in recent projects in the three areas, we wish to discuss perceived conflicts and possible synergies between the three aspects. We believe an optimum balance can be achieved and it is always intrinsically related to each project, but how often is this reached?Join the discussion at our new offices at 240 Blackfriars Road!

title: Adam's Green Aladdin
description: Adam Green of The Moldy Peaches wrote, directed, scored, and heads a hipster dream cast–Macauley Culkin, Devendra Banhart, Alia Shawkat, Har Mar Superstar–in this pixilated, sexed-up musical take on the classic Arabian Nights tale of a boy and his magic lamp. Adam Green's Aladdin is about a failed recording artist in a papier-mache techno-dystopia who uses the wish-granting (or wish-printing), unmistakably phallic lamp to woo the corrupt sultan's decadent daughter and ends up remaking the world. Utterly original, profanely satirical, and eons from Disney.

title: Bang! The Bert Berns Story
description: Music meets the Mob in this biography of '60s hitmaker and 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductee Bert Berns. A prolific songwriter ("Twist and Shout," "Piece of My Heart," "Hang on Sloopy") and producer (Solomon Burke, Van Morrison) with an output to rival that of storied contemporaries like Lieber-Stoller and Goffin-King, Berns died of a heart attack at only 38 and his name receded into relative obscurity. Narrated by Steven Van Zandt, Bang! tracks a colorful life story that takes in Cuban revolutionaries, shady showbiz dealings, and gangster ties along with some of your favorite songs.

description: Dodge Hunger is an Annual Charity Dodge Ball Tournament benefiting the Joshua Tree Feeding Program.This is a Double Elimination Tournament.All teams with play until they have lost 2 matches.Matches will continue until only team remains.Teams consist of 6 players with 2 alternates.If you have a full team of players, they can be registered at one time, by using the Team Registration Option.If you are a Single Person that is interested in participating, we can help match you with a team that is missing a player.Matches will be held outside on the fields of A.R.C.H. (Arizona Recreational Center for the Handicapped), so be sure to bring sunscreen.In the event of the rare chance of rain, events will be scheduled for an alternate date.

title: Social DoGooder Happy Hour: Walk + Brunch
description:
Of course, we all enjoy a frosty adult beverage after a long day of work  but what if we made our happy hour mean a little more? Introducing,  Happy Hours by Social DoGooder, once-a-month evening gatherings where  fellow DoGooders get together and volunteer for a worthy cause and enjoy  their favorite beverage at a local watering hole for a post-doing-good  happy hour!For the month of March, we will be collecting books at the base of Tumamoc Hill to benefit 'Read On Tucson', from 11:30-11:45 a.m. and then we will hit the hill for a power walk, ending with a 360 degree view of Tucson. Of course, it wouldn't be a happy hour without a few frosty beverages, so we will head to Maynard's for Brunch and drinks after the workout.The best part? It's Free (well minus the food and drinks, post dogooding).  Plus, there will be a custom Bellini and Mojito bar. So there is that.
Information About Read On Tucson
Information About Maynard's Brunch
RSVP BELOW TO PARTICIPATE. REGISTRATION ENDS MARCH 11, 2016 AT 11:59 P.M.

You will paint your own masterpiece while our instructors guide you, step-by-step, through the entire process.If you are not the “artsy” type – no worries! The game will take place at the Gryphon Centre, puck drop is set for 2:00pm.The Gryphons are in search of their first OUA title since 1998. Expect goals to be hard to come by for the opposition as Gryphon goalie Valerie Lamenta led the OUA with a stifling 0.99 goals against average this season and a 1.72 goals against average through five postseason games. Aside from boasting one of the top goalies in the conference, the Gryphons pose a deadly scoring threat after leading the entire country during the regular season in goals scored. Leading the way in the scoring during the postseason has been veterans Christine Grant and Jessica Pinkerton. title: Arlington Summer Camps- At Ashlawn ES
description: Boolean Girl introduces girls to computer science fundamentals at a young age through a series of unique projects and hands-on challenges. Our goal is to mix play and programming. Classes are designed using a holistic approach to learning. A typical class begins with an introduction to programming by the class acting out stories they will later program on the computer. Students take turns writing a script using interactive tiles that the rest of the class to acts out. These short stories are then written in Scratch, a programming language developed by MIT on a Raspberry Pi device. Through these projects, girls learn more than computer science, they learn to work through project challenges in a collaborative method and ultimately present their final products to the group.

title: St Valentine's Eve Massacree ....
description:
St. Valentine’s Eve Massacree(with full orchestration and two-part harmony)Fellow travelers – let us gather.This St. Valentine’s Eve, get slayed by the harmonic stylings of two of Chicago’s favorite clandestine duos: Chauncey & the Beast and The PhilBillies. Hosted by our pal Matt Lyle, this intimate concert for friends and family will feature each group performing seven songs a piece, all of which will be recorded, edited and mastered for the groups to do with whatever they damn well please.Tickets for this private BYOB event are $24 ($4 of which is a service fee - sorry), with all proceeds going to the recording and mastering process. The Foxhole, a cozy exposed-brick room that used to be a wallpaper store, only holds 50 people, so this show will sell out fast. No walk-ups, so please buy online as soon as you can!To sum up - what does that $24 get you? 
the secret password
 
an evening of amazing music with two talented duos that rarely gig (even though it's commonly agreed they should)
bragging rights
a digital download of the show (when it’s good and ready)
a good night’s sleep earned from helping our friends create something life-affirming
victuals to help keep up that blood sugar over the course of the evening
cold space and cups for those BYO beverages
Hope to see you out!

description: DOORS: 7:30PMSHOW: 8PM (ends by 10PM)MORE INFO: http://wmbr.org/ampersandForma w/Peter BurrMusic: https://soundcloud.com/forma-1/forma-live-on-wbar-4-1-12Video: https://vimeo.com/125600771Nightime SunshineMusic: https://nightimesunshine.bandcamp.com/Video: https://youtu.be/hR7HM4rjKFMForma makes a combustible mixture of lush synth explorations and frenetic rhythm. They have captivated the margins of the international synth scene and their live performances are extended improvisational journeys veering from the ecstatic to the foreboding, drawing techno, noise, and synth disciples into their realm. They are collaborating with Peter Burr, a dark & glitchy visual artist from Brooklyn. His work has been presented in a variety of spaces including floating cinemas, cartoon schools, semi-legalized squats, libraries, and national museums all around the world.Nightime Sunshine is an experimental music/video project from Cambridge led by Jesse S. Gallagher, formerly of Apollo Sunshine - ranging in sounds from ambient to psychedelic.Don't forget to stop by before the show starts to check out the List Gallery upstairs. Free admission.

title: Sweet Smell of Success
description: Taking place in the late, desperate hours of the night, SWEET SMELL OF SUCCESS finds press agent Sidney Falco out of favor with powerful columnist J.J. Hunsecker and resorting to increasingly slimy measures to turn that around. Tasked with breaking up a romance between J.J.'s fragile sister Susie and jazz guitarist Steve Dallas, Sidney finds their bond is as unwavering as J.J.'s resolve to end it. Sidney's clients lash out against him, wondering what they are paying him for.Phone calls go unreturned and meetings are refused, with Sidney's charms only occasionally swaying a secretary here and there. Reeling with desperation, Sidney tracks down J.J. in the middle of a meeting with a senator and the pretty young thing he is trying to help make it, and we get a taste of how brazen and ruthless J.J. can be. He even pals around with a threatening, corrupt police lieutenant that clearly owes him some favors.The poison spreads from character to character as Sidney enlists other creatures of the night to facilitate a smear campaign that paints Steve as a pot-smoking commie. J.J. is then to come to Steve's rescue, thus absolving himself of being a part of the takedown. Setting up the trap, Sidney knows that Steve's strength of character breaks apart with his pride, and Steve falls right in with harsh words against J.J. that will make it impossible for him to be with Susie.Hollywood nice guys Tony Curtis and Burt Lancaster have their personas inverted here as two morally reprehensible men whose power plays turn them to monsters. As the sycophantic Sidney, Curtis moves quickly through each scene, perfectly filling out a shifty, soulless body. The sharp, cynical dialogue cuts deep, and the moment of redemption that we've come to expect may not be reached. Although Sidney Falco does bite back with the line "It's one thing to wear a dog collar; when it turns into a noose I'd rather have my freedom" but rather than walking away, he is easily manipulated back into the 21 Club booth.-Alamo Drafthouse

title: Sticks & Stones: A Forest Puppet Show
description: This event is BY DONATION, and a reservation is required. Please choose to pay any amount you wish when reserving your tickets. ALL DONATIONS support the creation of the Mt. Elphinstone Expanded Provincial Park. Reserved ticket holders will be informed of the secret location of the show on Mt Elphinstone.Follow The Only Animal deep into the woods on February 13th, for Sticks & Stones: a forest puppet show.  A trail walk will reveal the secret strange creatures of the undergrowth, some tender and green, some ancient and craggy. Puppets made from stick, leaf and moss will show you the forest anew. The outdoor shows begin at 12pm & 2pm and are intended for kids under 10 who are enthusiastic hikers and accompanied by adults. Wear sensible shoes and weather-appropriate clothing. Sticks & Stones is created by The Only Animal and directed by Kendra Fanconi, with Adeline Collective’s Katherine Binns, Mika Laulainen, and Robert Leveroos, and music by Nancy Tam. Sticks & Stones is a part of a year of art in, around, and in support of the expanded Mt Elphinstone Provincial Park. The Only Animal makes art with a deep relationship to place. Elphinstone Logging Focus protects key forests and habitats. Together we are making a stand for trees. We invite you to stand up for your forest. Go here to help.

title: Neon Dreams Cinema Club presents: MIAMI BLUES
description: Welcome to a world where people's worst impulses and darkest desires are stimulated by a landscape of synth-pop and bright neon lights. Nothing is quite as it seems as you surrender yourself to the dazzling sights and soothing sounds of the Neon Dreams Cinema Club, a monthly film series exclusive to The Royal Cinema bringing you the best in delightfully surreal neo-noir cinema from the 70's, 80's, and beyond.Pre-show starts at 7:00pmFeature starts at 8:00pmVISIT THE EVENT PAGE>>HERE<<This 35mm presentation is made possible thanks to our lovely sponsor Sonic Boom and will be preceded by a mind-shattering pre-show, featuring a themed video mixtape of music, film, and television to put you in the right mood. As always this will be a lisenced event, courtesy of Monarch Tavern, and there will be AMAZING PRIZES given out to many lucky patrons. Be sure to arrive early!======After Junior (Alec Baldwin) is released from prison, he plans on starting a new life in Miami. But when he kills a man in the airport, he flees the scene and finds Susie (Jennifer Jason Leigh), a mild-mannered prostitute searching for stability. The two opposites become romantically involved, and Junior steals a badge and gun from a veteran detective (Fred Ward). Using the officer's identity, Junior embarks on a crime spree and convinces Susie that he is the perfect man."George Armitage's Miami Blues is another film slightly ahead of its time. In 1990 its combination of tough, funny noir and flashes of shocking violence seemed to bemuse audiences. Only five years later would Tarantino turn what was once for cult appreciation only into a global smasheroo. This very entertaining Miami lowlife romp has at its heart two great badass performances, the grizzled Fred Ward as Hoke Mosely and the frequently shirtless and impressively hairy Alec Baldwin as the charming psychopath Junior. This film is a little gem of broken fingers, lost digits and missing teeth. Anyone who has seen my amateur film Dead Right will know that I stole a joke from Miami Blues."- Edgar Wright (director of Shaun Of The Dead, Scott Pilgrim Vs. The World)

title: Proper Octopus Record Release Show
description: Proper Octopus in association with Sleaze Magazine are proud to present Proper Octopus record release show with double headliner from Candice Gordon and A.S. Fanning with support from LeVent and with DJ Billy Acid [Dead Combo].on the 13th of November 2015 Proper Octopus will release 2 singles:A.S. Fanning's debut single 'Carmelita' https://soundcloud.com/asfanning/carmelita-2&Candice Gordon's latest single 'Smoke in the Air'https://soundcloud.com/candice-gordon/smoke-in-the-airWith both acts playing an exclusive Berlin live show.______________________________________________CANDICE GORDON                                        SMOKE IN THE AIR"She's possessed of a voice like poisoned black molasses trickling down the side of a jewel encrusted goblet held in the gnarly claw of Beelzebub himself" - Hotpress"Agreeably bonkers slice of horror themed garage rock raucousness" - The Guardian UK (single review)"Catch her before the trenderatti are all over her like a rash" - The Mirror UKCandice Gordon is set to release a new single 'Smoke In The Air' throughProper Octopus Recordson the 13th of November 2015.Berlin based Candice grew up in Dublin but hails originally from Botswana. Bohemian folk influences, garage rock qualities reminiscent of the 60s, 70s and 90s with a modern day production make Candice's exquisit sound and delivery. She already worked with the likes of Shane MacGowan, also sharing a stage with Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds, Kurt Vile, and the Horrors, has toured extensively, as well as released singles and videos over the last couple of years receiving great press from the likes of the Guardian, Daily Mirror Nylon as well plays on BBC Radio 1 and XFM.Smoke in the Air, occupies a rich and epic sonic space, with hypnotic guitar riffs throughout coupled with Candice' haunting rich vocals. Her vocals reminding of handful of impressive feamle artists from Nico to PJ Harvey to Mazzy Star. Smoke In The Air is the first single off Candice's debut album Garden of Beasts set for release in the new year._________________________________________________________A.S. FANNINGCARMELITAA.S. Fanning is a singer-songwriter from Dublin, Ireland, living in Berlin. His first release is the single ‘Carmelita’, a stark and haunting picture of the darker side of Dublin City.Fanning’s songs are often lyrically driven, taking inspiration from Irish literary tradition and folk music as well as from 60s psychedelia and gothic rock n roll. Biog:As a child he had little interest in school, and rarely attended, choosing instead to spend his days exploring his father’s book collection and huge array of jazz and blues records. There were always instruments around the house and at the age of 10 he picked up the guitar for the first time. He immediately formed a band with some friends and by the age of 12 they were gigging in pubs around Ireland, playing mostly Chuck Berry and Elvis Presley covers, among some original songs. There was always a lot of literary influence in his life, he came from a family of journalists and writers, his grandfather, A.P. Fanning had a play produced at the home of Irish theatre, The Abbey in Dublin, and Irish literary giants such as Ulick O’Connor, John B. Keane, Anthony Cronin and Brendan Kennelly were fixtures in his upbringing, as friends of the family.His songwriting started to develop in his teens, along with his interest in music production. He bought his first 8-track recorder and started recording, layering multiple instruments and sounds as part of his songwriting process. At the age of 17 formed the band Porn Trauma, who released one EP which reached the top 30 in the Irish charts, and another limited edition 7-inch single, before disbanding. They regrouped as The Last Tycoons who went on to release one eponymous album as well as several EPs and singles. His interest in production continued to grow and he spent as much time in the studio as possible, working as an assistant on legendary Dubliner Ronnie Drew’s final album before his death in 2008. As a multi-instrumentalist he has been in demand to play with acts such as Dublin troubadour The Mighty Stef, Berlin Industrial Electro outfit Suzies Ashes, and Irish songstress Candice Gordon, most recently producing and playing on Gordon's soon to be released debut LP.He now lives in Berlin and is releasing his first single with a debut solo album in the works. The self-produced ‘Carmelita’ is released on November 13th on Proper Octopus Records. Available digitally from usual outlets and on 7-inch vinyl from select stores.

title: EUFF 2015: Cowboys
description: Directed by Tomislav Mršić | Croatia, Comedy, 105 min, Language: CroatianCast: Deyan Donkov, Snezhina Petrova, Svetlana Yancheva, Stefav ValdobrevThis is no ordinary story of show business and art: this particular theatre company is an assembly of antiheroes, drifting aimlessly, seemingly lost in space and time in a small town where even the sun seems to set in the east. Under the guidance of theatre director Sasa, they must fight their demons and overcome prejudice. They decide to base their play on classic Hollywood westerns. As they embrace the stereotypes of the genre – the fight between good and evil, the clash between civilisation and wilderness – the actors develop their stories. As time passes, they start to view the play as a metaphor for their own destinies, and grasp it as the opportunity of a lifetime.

title: Ontario Food Tourism Summit
description:
We know that food tourism is a recipe for economic development success.OCTA’s Ontario Food Tourism Summit is your opportunity to significantly engage with other food tourism stakeholders like chefs, business owners, artisans, regional development officers and other hospitality professionals from across the province and the country.  This year’s theme is ‘Perfect Pairings’ — we’ll be exploring how local food and drink helps build stronger relationships and tell better stories across all sectors. Whether it’s sports tourism, heritage tourism, event management or restaurant pop-ups; pairing your project with local food will help grow your business, your brand and build better relationships. See you at the Summit!ON THE MENU7:00 AMRegistration Opens, Breakfast is served8:15 AMOpening RemarksRebecca LeHeup, Executive Director of The Ontario Culinary Tourism Alliance8:30 AMCrafting a Sense of PlaceNicole Vaugeois, BC Regional Innovation Chair in Tourism and Sustainable Rural Development, Vancouver Island University9:00 AMGo Green or Go HomeMariela McIlwraith, MBA, President, Meeting Change9:30 AMWhy I Love Museum Tours/Bring On The MerlotNick Gray, Founder & CEO, Museum Hack, New York City10:00 AMThe Jam-JamCelebrating three of the province’s best canners & preservers paired with an array of beautiful baked goods from the talented bakers at Evelyn’s Crackers10:30 AMMore Than Just A Picnic Basket, YogiDavid Adames of The Niagara Parks Commission in conversation with Chef Paul Pennock and Chef Elbert Wiersema11:00 AMEating To The Beat Of A Different DrumMarie Zimmerman, Executive Director, Hillside Music Festival11:30 AMWhat’s In Your Glass, Ontario? Telling The Local Drink StoryA thoughtful discussion led by Food & Travel Writer Valerie Howes with special guestsTerri Mathews of Boshkung Brewing, Paul Harber of Ravine Vineyards andGrant Howes of County Cider Company12:00 PMLocally Sourced Lunchpresented in partnership with The Tourism Industry Association of Ontario
Held in partnership with the 2015 Ontario Tourism Summit. To register for the Ontario Tourism Summit, visit: eply.com/2015OntarioTourismSummit

title: Advanced Social Media & SEO Fundamentals Workshop
description: Advanced Social Media Strategies for the Busy Business Person  - 2 Hour IntensiveYou have a Facebook business page and are on Twitter. Are you in need of some accelerated learning in Social Media - but you are past the basics? Do you want to be able to conquer the necessary principles of Social Media and create a solid marketing strategy without stressing out or feel overwhelmed? Do you crave learning new things to put into action immediately for better engagement, more followers/fans, and greater visibility for your business? Do you have some traction, but are at a plateau and need an injection of new engagement ideas? But....as most of us, you have very little time from your demanding schedule?In this 2 hour hands-on, in-depth, interactive workshop intensive, we will explore marketing your business using various social networks, including the main three platforms every business owner should have: Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. We'll also spend time on Pinterest, LinkedIn, Periscope, Google+ and more. We'll discuss best practices, scheduling, best times to post, content, user demographics, analytics, social selling and ads, new tools and bad habits to avoid. 100% knowledgable and fun! Please bring your laptops or tablets so you can follow along on your own accounts and we can hone in on your individual questions in class.(Prerequisite: Basic knowledge of Social Media is preferred but not necessary. it is very helpful to have accounts setup on the Social Media platforms we will be discussing, but not necessary. You do not need to have a computer for this workshop but are highly encouraged to bring one to follow along.)SEO Fundamentals for the Business Owner - 90 minute IntensiveDespite what you have heard, SEO (Search Engine Optimization) is not a fad or a sham. It is a vital tool used for business owners to inject best practices, solid algorithmic principles and social selling into their web presence and social media posts. How is this accomplished? We will start with your website first, how pages are viewed, explore how you are found online, compare you to others in your industry, find what keywords your competitors are using and how people find them, and lastly create a plan to maintain and manage your SEO plan for increased views, engagement and sales in the future! You will also learn how to get your SEO grade score! This 90 minute hands-on, in-depth, interactive workshop intensive is perfect for any business owner, web manager for a company, and those looking to create a website. (Prerequisite: Basic knowledge of websites and search is preferred but not necessary. It is very helpful to have a website so we can discuss, but not necessary. You do not need to have a computer for this workshop but are highly encouraged to bring one to follow along.)Date:Wednesday, November 11th, 2015Time:Registration and Coffee:8:00amSocial Media Session starts promptly at 8:30am.Quick break at 9: 30am,Finishing around 10:30am.SEO Session starts promptly at 11:00amFinishing around 12:30pm.Place:Cape Cod Chamber of Commerce5 Patti Page Way, Centerville, MA 02632Your workshop Instructor:Leslie FishlockFounder & CEO, Geek GirlTake Both Workshops and Save!Individual Social Media and Web Audits are available during the week. If you are interested, please email info@geekgirlcamp.com to schedule your time.

title: ​Improv 401: Advanced Harold
description: Improv 401: Advanced HaroldNow we put it all together. Students will combine the skills learned in the previous courses for an in depth study of The Harold. title: AeroPro infodag: Geen woorden maar data!
description:
Je ontdekt tijdens deze infodag ‘Geen woorden maar data!’ wat aerodynamica betekent voor je wielerprestaties en hoe je optimaler op de fiets kunt zitten. In deze editie: efficiëntie in het wielrennen aan de hand van vermogensmeters.Dit seizoen hebben we veel belangrijke tijdritten gezien bij de profs. Denk aan de Tour Proloog door Utrecht, de laatste spannende week van de Vuelta, de verrassende race tegen de klok voor de regenboogtrui in de Giro. De lange tijdrit in de 13e etappe bleek een prelude voor meer goede tijdritten voor Team LottoNL-Jumbo met als resultaat een mooie 5e plaats voor Steven Kruijswijk. Een bevestiging dat in de tijdrit de mannen van de enige Nederlandse World-tour ploeg het goed voor elkaar hebben!De grote motor achter het tijdrit succes, coach Mathieu Heijboer blikt dan ook met een tevreden gevoel terug op de resultaten. Ter voorbereiding heeft hij met zijn ploeg een aerotest bij AeroPro gedaan. Tijdens onze infodag “Geen woorden maar data” vertelt Heijboer meer over trap-efficiëntie met de Pioneer vermogensmeter en bekijk je nieuwe nog niet eerder vertoonde beelden van de ploeg.Programma: 
14.00 uur: Inloop
14.30 uur: Presentaties 
Coach Mathieu Heijboer: De weg naar de succesvolle tijdritten van Lotto Jumbo: De vertaalslag van geavanceerde data naar overwinningen. Met nieuw exclusief beeldmateriaal over de succesvolle tijdritten van LottoJumbo.
Pioneer: Nieuwe parameters in vermogensmeters: het belang van pedaal-efficiëntie doorPioneer Cyclesports.
AeroPro: De kunst van aerodynamische efficiëntie: de impact en gemak van reallife testen. Welke winst kan een AeroTest voor jou opleveren?

16.00 uur: Live demo: Live demonstratie van het Track Aero System (TAS) op de wielerbaan van Sportpaleis Alkmaar door AeroPro met borrelhapjes.
17.00 uur: Bespreken resultaten: Wat hebben we gemeten?
17.15 uur: Einde infodag

title: The Sandbox Project Conference 2016
description:
In its sixth year, this one-day event will bring together researchers, practitioners, policy makers, charities, industry, families and young people for updates, networking and solutions-oriented collaboration towards improving the health and wellbeing of children and youth in Canada. Preliminary Agenda

8:30
Registration and breakfast


9:00


Welcome: Conference MC Martin Reader, Sandbox Project Board Member, Co-Founder of StriveLife, and 2012 Canadian Beach Volleyball Olympian 

Update from The Sandbox Project:


Christine Hampson, President & CEO
Paul Brown, Chair of the Board





9:30

One-minute updates: Key 2015 milestones from a few of our Collaborating Partners



10:15

Playing in the Sandbox: Relationship building break





10:45

Sandbox working group updates: The leadership of each Working Group will present the progress to date on one priority initiative or project:
Environment: Official launch of the EduTOX Video Challenge 

Growing Healthy Bodies
Injury Prevention
Mental Health
The Young Canadians Roundtable on Health




12:00
Networking Lunch


1:00

Afternoon collaborative session led by Eric (Ric) Young, founder of The Social Projects Studio and Distinguished Visiting Professor of Social Innovation at Ryerson UniversityRic Young is recognized as one of Canada’s leading practitioners and thinkers in the field of social change. As a practitioner, he has committed his career over the past 25 years to advancing innovative approaches to social change. He cut his teeth on the early stages of the PARTICIPaction campaign, and was co-founder of Canada’s first dedicated social marketing agency. He left that company in the mid-90s to start The Social Projects Studio – a company focused on transformational social innovation. Working with government, non-government, corporate and community leaders, he has been the architect of numerous initiatives to address some of society’s most complex and pressing challenges. As a thought leader, Ric’s personal mission is to “change change” – that is, to foster new mindsets and skill-sets to enable society to tackle the transformational challenges of our time in constructive new ways.  He has written and lectured extensively on the nature of change, transformational leadership, civic engagement and the centrality of narrative in the pursuit of 21st century well-being. 



4:30
Networking reception


About The Sandbox ProjectThe Sandbox Project is a national charity that brings together leading researchers, governments, non-profits, industry and families to improve child and youth health and wellbeing in Canada. Sandbox shines a light on, and increases the impact of organizations working in our sector. By bringing likeminded individuals and organizations together, The Sandbox Project acts as an umbrella organization to foster innovation in the sandbox of child and youth health and wellbeing. As a charity that does not run programs "on the ground," Sandbox's innovative model allows us to identify areas where action is most needed, and where we can most efficiently leverage the expertise and resources of our combined organizations. Through this nimble working model, The Sandbox Project is finding new ways for our sector to innovate, collaborate, better use resources and increase the impact of all of our collective efforts. For more information, please visit our website.

title: Scottsdale-FEARLESS SALES!
description:
Our guest speaker this month is the amazing JENNIFER 'SPARKLE' JOHNSON! FEARLESS SALES METHOD TRAINING: How to Nurture Prospects Into Clients with Grace & Ease – even if you’ve ALWAYS struggled to sell your products/services!Jennifer is an Award winning Coach, founder of 3P Group, co-founder of The Purposeful Leadership Academy, and fearless ‘Sparkle Warrior’! Jennifer Johnson specializes in teaching women to go from hiding out to being in alignment with who they are, so they can build the wildly successful business and life of their dreams.Known for her warm personality, big smile, and contagious giggle, Jennifer takes women on simple, step by step, journeys from ‘what do I do?’ to ‘look what I did!’ Combining proven tools with focused coaching and ‘no excuses’ accountability, Jennifer helps her clients discover, package, and market their unique value to the world. She teaches women to give themselves permission to experience extraordinary results by letting go of limiting beliefs. They learn to value themselves so that they confidently and authentically claim their destiny.Jennifer’s business, and her passion, is all about making lives better…a dream she carries into her volunteer work, as well. Her Sparkle shows, even through her leather vest, as she rides to help abused children. In an effort to enrich lives globally, Jennifer also makes time to mentor young Chinese women through her work with World Academy for the Future of Women and has the honor of sitting on the Board of Directors of the Girls Rule Foundation.Being able to balance one’s life, business, and passion is something Jennifer lives and teaches. For this commitment, she was recently recognized as one of ‘Arizona’s Amazing Women’, by the Phoenix Suns and National Bank Arizona.To learn more about Jennifer go here: http://thejenniferjohnson.com/

title: Lost Histories of World War II
description: Come hear award-winning authors Raghu Karnad and Terese Svoboda discuss hidden family histories of the Asia theater of World War II. Moderated by N+1 editor Nikil Saval, author of Cubed: A Secret History of the Workplace.When Raghu Karnad found three sepia-toned photographs at his grandmother’s house, he learned the men they depicted were his grandfather and his brothers-in-laws. All three men had served in World War II as part of the Indian Army. The Indian Army was the largest volunteer army in world history, comprised as it was of 2.5 million men in WWII, even though South Asia itself still lived under the yoke of the British Empire. In his book Farthest Field: An Indian Story of the Second World War (W.W. Norton & Company 2015), Raghu tells the story of these three brothers-in-arms and India’s crucial, lost history in the Second World War. Telling the gripping adventures of guerrilla infiltrators in the jungles of Burma and the Bengal sappers heading off a Japanese invasion of India, the book is--in the words of Booker Finalist Neel Mukherjee--“a bravura feat of literary-historical imagination--the kind that one would normally associate with a novelist.” Hear Raghu talk about the book on NPR Books here.A similar quest to unearth a family member’s past catalyzed Terese Svoboda to write her memoir Black Glasses Like Clark Kent: A GI’s Secret from Postwar Japan (Graywolf Press 2008). When her uncle Don Svoboda suddenly committed suicide following the revelations of the Abu Ghraib abuses, Terese found that he had left behind a secret archive of tape cassettes: his audio confessions about what he did while guarding prisoners in postwar Japan. “The prison was getting overcrowded,” he remarks in one tape, and a captain “said he was going to have to start executing the prisoners, the ones in the death cells.” A memoir both political and personal, Black Glasses documents Terese Svoboda’s visit to Japan and her journey into the archives of this hidden chapter of WWII history. As The Brooklyn Rail writes: "Svoboda is an excellent companion: consistently candid, razor sharp, unapologetically flawed, and passionate. She is exactly with whom one would want to discuss these difficult topics." A Guggenheim Fellow, Terese Svoboda has written five books of poetry, won the NYFA Fellowship three times, and written for The New Yorker, The Atlantic, and The Paris Review. Hear her talk about the book on C-Span here.

title: Soul Camp West - Wonder Valley
description:
Soul Camp is a 3-day mind/body/spirit immersion that takes place from October 28th-31st. From morning reveille to lights out, campers (aged 21+) come together to participate in a range of activities spanning from yoga, meditation, dance, massage, bootcamps, breathwork, arts & crafts, flower-crown making and so much more. We will also be featuring a speaker series where campers can escape and listen to inspiring and empowering “SOUL-versations” from wellness experts and thought leaders in their fields. Soul Camp is an experience like no other. Come to take a breather and rediscover the truth of who you really are.Soul Camp™ West will be held at Wonder Valley, a magical sleepaway camp nestled in the foothills of the Sierra-Nevadas and conveniently located just 3 hours from both San Francisco and Los Angeles.We have arranged for a Soul Camp Lux Shuttle Bus to and from SF and LA available for an additional $140 roundtrip ($80 one-way), which you can purchase at checkout.During registration, you will be able to tell us what type of cabin you prefer to stay in or who you'd like to bunk with. At Soul Camp California, we have a variety of housing options for you to choose from:

Cabin/Dorm: Get the true sleepaway camp feel and bunk with a maximum of 5 other campers. Lots of late-night ghost stories and story-telling. Communal bathrooms down the hall.

Shared Room: Coming with your partner or BFF and want to stay in a room with them? This is your best bet! Comes with private bathroom.

Private Room: Do you know you need alone time? Want to gather your thoughts at the end of the night? This option will allow you the peace and quiet you deserve.

Private Cabin: With only 10 of these cabins available, these are prime real estate. The cutest little cabins you ever did see - these come with your own bathroom, fireplace, and porch on "Cabin Road". Ugh, to die for!
Join us for the experience of a lifetime this fall! For more information please visit our FAQ section at www.soul.camp or email us at info@soul.camp.Payment Plans options are available upon request. Email info@soul.camp to see if you are eligible to set one up.Price varies depending on housingEmail Us*note: Soul Camp Tickets are not refundable but totally transferable.

title: Stumptown Clown Collective Play Lab Series 2015!
description:
In our Second Play Lab Series, we'll explore  Expanded Perspectives in Play.Seven sessions facilitated by local theatre artists. These gatherings are opportunities to play and experiment with fresh perspectives on the art and wisdom of clown.  Radical acceptance of oneself and others and a commitment to connect to others will be allies in our adventure.All Are Welcome --  from experienced clowns to the clown-curious!Early Bird Pass $90 (by Aug 31) Regular Series Pass: $100  Drop-In $17 Holiday Soiree: $15 Suggested Donation  Sundays: 6-9pm: Expanded Descriptions for Each Play Lab Can Be Found at BottomSept 13 -- Elemental Clowns with Abbey Pleviak *Sept 27 -- Show Up, Let’s Play! with Melanya Helene *Oct 4 -- Beautifully Ridiculous with Jon Farley **Oct 18-- Kinesthetic Delight with Damaris Webb **Nov 1 -- Authentic Movement with Annie Blair **Nov 15 -- Raw Play with Marc Otto **Nov 29 -- Powerfully Present with Wendy Allegaert **AND: Dec 13 Holiday Soiree. Potluck, Party, Performance!**TWO LOCATIONS:* Hand2Mouth, Shout House, 210 SE Madison St., Ste 11** Be Space, 211 SE 11th AveContact: wendygingin@gmail.comStumptown Clown Collective. We believe in the transformational power of the ancient tradition of clown and seek to catalyze clown community through study, play and performance.
EXPANDED PLAY LAB DESCRIPTIONSSept 13 -- Elemental Clowns with Abbey Pleviak -- in Shout HouseExplore primal play through the elements: earth, wind, water, fire, and space.  We’ll draw from the Tibetan Buddhist Wisdom Families, which are connected to the elements, directions, seasons, neuroses, and wisdom qualities.Abbey has trained in Lecoq, Pochinko, and Rebel Clowning.  She is a voracious reader of mythologies and histories of clown and most recently has been reading up on Charlie Chaplin, Vaudeville, and Variety.. She’s a filmmaker, producer, and musician.  She's been a student in the Shambhala Buddhist tradition for a decade. Sept 27 -- Show Up, Let’s Play! with Melanya Helene  -- in Shout HouseYou are here already. Let's play! Together we will explore showing up fully as you are and discovering your unique, genuine presence.Melanya is a local performer/ director/ teacher /healer best known for her award winning one woman show "Hopeless" and the family program "Play after Play".  She also practices Embodied Relational Healing and Interpersonal Neurobiology.Oct 4 -- Beautifully Ridiculous with Jon Farley -- in Be SpaceTogether we will explore ways to open channels to authenticity through play, ways to be big, ways to think on the outside and reveal our common humanity.Jon is a clown and actor based in Portland.  He has studied clown with Sue Morrison in Toronto and with Barnaby King in Portland.  His most recent on-camera appearance was as a completely ridiculous Post Office troll in an episode of Portlandia.Oct 18-- Kinesthetic Delight with Damaris Webb -- in Be SpaceYielding to deep play, we evoke our individual kinesthetic delight with an awareness of the group. Using improvisational performance forms in mindfulness practices we make on-the-spot offerings, delighting in the present moment and the stories that space inherently tells.Damaris is a performer, theater deviser and teaching artist whose influences include Viewpoints, Psychophysical Acting, Composition/Moment Work, Developmental Technique, and Contemplative Dance Improvisation, as well as the methods from the streets of New York, such as Burlesque, Street Theater, and Large Scale Spectacle.  www.DamarisWebb.comNov 1 -- Authentic Movement with Annie Blair -- in Be SpaceAuthentic Movement is a simple form of self-directed movement, following inner impulses, in the presence of a non-judgmental witness. It assists both movers and witnesses in deepening their attention to the moment and developing the ability to listen to subtle inner experiences.Annie is certified in Processwork and has a background in dance, movement, and improvisational theater. She studied Authentic Movement with Susan Schell and has participated/participates in various Authentic Movement groups.Nov 15 -- Raw Play with Marc Otto -- in Be SpaceSomatic exercises and induction into the essential state of play, as mastered by toddlers, puppies and kittens. To experience raw play is to nourish the heart of your performance.Marc is an interpersonal artist and practitioner of Embodied Relational Healing. He’s the co-founder of Play after Play theater. Marc’s played with lots of kids and people of all sorts.Nov 29 -- Powerfully Present with Wendy Allegaert  -- in Be SpaceExplore the beauty of breath, somatic awareness, and play.  We’ll focus in on deep relaxation, authentic movement, and spontaneous action.  Letting go of extraneous tension, the performer gains greater connection to the expansive moment.Wendy is an AmSAT Certified Alexander Teacher, who has trained in Meisner, Grotowski, Lecoq, and Stanislavski.  Her clown teachers include Sue Morrison, Jane Nichols, Christopher Bayes, Aitor Basuri and Giovanni Fusetti. Being present, open and connected to others in clown makes the world a richer place.  So, she keeps coming back....AND. . . Dec 13 Holiday Soiree. Potluck, Party, Performance!  -- in Be SpaceThis is an opportunity to perform and socialize with classmates, friends, and family. All proceeds support Stumptown Clown Club Scholarships for Master Clown Teacher Trainings.

title: Meal Exchange Network Community Kitchen
description: As a thank you for your contributions to the Meal Exchange network, we would like to invite you to join us for an evening of cooking up good food and ideas! As part of the National Student Food Summit, student leaders will be facilitating a community kitchen where we will share stories, learn new skills and celebrate good food.  Meet student leaders from across the country, alumni and some of our partners in this evening of cooking and eating together....we hope you can join us!

title: Pride in Art Society Membership

Your membership helps support the organization, and gives you a say on what we do at QAF by allowing you to vote at Pride in Art’s Annual General Meeting. You’ll also receive emails with information about the festivalYour membership fee enters you to win a romantic getaway weekend package at the Hotel Plaza Kelowna!Memberships on a sliding scale $0-5 Each dollar you pay gives you one entry towards the prize package, value $329

title: Responding Effectively To Life's Stressors
description:
Changing Your Life For The BetterResponding Effectively To Life's Stressors  Monterey County: 
Have you noticed how much stress is affecting you, even as it takes a heavy toll?
What would your life be like if you were responding effectively to life’s stressors?
Are you wondering why you are often exhausted, frazzled, stressed-out, anxious and/or depressed?
The Way of 'Changing Your Life For The Better' extends its open doors for you to:
End the cycle of Stress and significantly decrease worry in your life.
Have an added edge in reducing relational stress in your life.
Change your life for the better.
Give it a Go!
Will you take the next step to become stress resilient? 

Mr. Lindor is pulling out all the stops to make sure the 2-hour talk is a tremendous value for you. Join the talk and receive the tools you need to:
Establish healthier habits 
Respond effectively to stress.
Start the process on becoming stress resilient.

Reserve Your Seat (s) Today.
Keynote Speaker:  Windsor Lindor Mr Lindor is truly one of the most inspiring spiritual  teachers of our time. He is an expert in Leadership, the spiritual and psychological  fields of life. He provides his clients the powerful insights, knowledge and successful tools... Once you hear his profound wisdom and insights, it is certain, you will appreciate how they can be a catalyst for amazing transformation in your life, if only you decide to  put them to work for you...

title: Book Talk on History of Broadway at NYPL
description: This illustrated talk, featuring vintage images of Broadway from the Library of Congress, the National Archives, and photographer Gregoire Alessandrini, feature the history of Broadway, from its origins as a Native American trail to its iconic status in global culture today, and tell the story of the city of New York as it grew from a Dutch colony into a world class metropolis. Broadway has been the site of many firsts and many superlatives: the first subway line in the city, the tallest buildings, and one of the longest streets in the world.This talk will feature the most surprising images of the 200 images from the book published by Arcadia.

title: The Role of Anatomy with Marshall Vandruff
description: THE ROLE OF ANATOMY IN TRAINING MASTER ARTISTS: An Introduction to How Masters Invent Human Figures (6 hours)Marshall Vandruff will show how great masters of the human figure, including comic and fantasy artists like Wally Wood, Jack Davis and Frank Frazetta, mastered anatomy before they were able to draw realistic figures from imagination. He will demonstrate that classic drawing requires at least two skills: understanding anatomy and inventing forms, and show how the teachings and drawings of George Bridgman from the early twentieth century continue to influence today's artists who want to master drawing and painting the human body. The presentation includes 200 slides of great art with commentary and comparisons between anatomy plates and finished works.

title: Meal Exchange NSFS Accomodations 2015
description: Accommodations will be at the University of Toronto St.Michael's College.  This is a follow-up to the Summit.

description: If you love the coast of Maine, you won't want to miss this high-summer  event! Each year we gather Maine's finest artists, architects,  boatbuilders, craftsmen, designers, furniture makers, jewelers, and  marine gear vendors together in ONE place at ONE time, so you can meet  them in person.

title: Ginger Minj @ Talbott Street
description: Ginger Minj is the stand-out of season seven of RuPaul's Drag Race! title: Type on Tap
description: We're excited to gather this month to celebrate summer and fresh ideas! Come join us for some food and drinks on a patio as we share current projects. No Work? No Problem! Connect with font-loving friends, old and new.

title: June Viking Dinner
description: N'ORLEANS: CAJUN INDULGENCESUNDAY JUNE 28 / 6PWITH SPECIAL GUEST CHEF JAKE MARTINJune Vikings be humbled by this New Orleans focused Cajun feast. What does the lively Cajun South have to do with Vikings you ask? Well, we know those hats hold at least a bottle per horn and that Jazz clearly has something to do with the flavors. We're letting this one lead the summer line up because, hey, we all need a little more South in our Left Coast. Buy your seat HERE- they're limited and this month will sell out!

title: Len Worley: Remarkable Effects of Meditation
description:
If you have ever been interested in experiencing the   remarkable effects of meditation, then Sunday   afternoon, June 28, will be of interest to you. Join me from 4:00-6:00 PM to   learn mind-body practices that are proven to:   
Boost immune function    Enhance creativity    Calm troubled emotions      As a practitioner of   meditation for over 30 years,   I can personally vouch for its capacity to transform old patterns   of self-doubt, anxiety and stress, and unlock hidden potentials within the   personality.   Joining me is special   guest Angel   Yamaguchi, who will introduce Yin Yoga, a novel form of effortless yoga   that allows for extended time in passive, relaxing postures (that anyone can   do). It is known for its restorative effects on body and spirit.   I will   give an overview of four approaches to meditation, some that stretch back into antiquity while others are based   on modern neuroscience research.  I will demystify meditation and make   it possible for anyone to do with immediate results. The information   presented will be useful for the rest of your life.   This event will be   held at a beautiful private yoga studio just a couple of minutes south of   Townlake off S Lamar. 
See my website to learn more about Four Approaches to Meditation: Four Sundays in July
I look forward to   sharing this event with you.

title: Smart Contracts - Tuspark Lecture Series
description: Today's contracts are difficult enough to read for most humans, who barely skip through them even on the matter of life and death. How can contracts become smarter, machine readable and self-enforcable? Two talks explore what is possible today, and give an outlook more science than fiction.Speaker: Joseph WangMember Fee: Free for members of Tuspark and the Bitcoin Association of Hong Kongand full-time students.Non-member Fee: 50 HKD (payable in cash upon arrival)For more information on this series and how to pay with Bitcoin see here.

title: Executives in Identity - Toronto - Wed.Jun.24
description: The DIACC’s continuing series of networking events makes its next stop in Toronto on Wednesday June 24th.  Come out to meet other members of the identity community and members of the DIACC and share your success stories and challenges with like-minded folks.Date:  Wednesday, June 24th, 2015Time:  5:30-7:30pmLocation:  The 3 Brewers, 120 Adelaide St. West, unit 100Attire is business casual. Food and drink will be served.We hope to see you there!

title: Summer In The House
description: Help us raise money for the Ronald McDonald House Toronto. Support George Brown College students in hosting a fun filled night of drinks, prizes and live entertainment. All proceeds raised will be donated directly to Ronald McDonald House Charities Toronto!

title: Rocky Horror Picture Show at the Apollo Cinema
description: The Rocky Horror Picture shows comes to the Apollo Cinema so put on your best tuxedo and fishnets and join us as we do the TimeWarp, again! Early and late shows at 7pm and 9:30pm.Props will be available at the theatre!

title: Summer Shorts - week 2
description: We present six weeks of six different newly written 15 minute short plays.To be performed in our miniature moveable theatre, created by Rosa Sijben.Location: The Market Hall, Borough Market, SE1 LondonWEEK 2 JUNE 17th till 20thTHE ALAN KEYJo's bed is falling apart. When she goes to Ikea to buy a new one, it seems her life is on the verge of doing the same. What she doesn't factor in is how everything is about to change, how she'll come back from Neasden with so much more than a new bed.This story plunges us into the tragi-comic reality of what it means to be a human, searching for love and meaning in the assemble-it-yourself age of Ikea.Written by Sammy KissinPerformed by Judith AmsengaSUMMER SHORTS is brought to you by Robin Linde Productions in collaboration with IMMERGE, a series of events leading up to MERGE Festival, produced by Illuminate Productions.In association with Better Bankside, Tate Modern and Borough Market

description: Please join us for an interactive webinar and Q&A about how you can get the most out of Noodle. Led by our VP of Product Alex Bargmann, this online event will answer all of your questions about publishing articles, answering questions, navigating the site, and more.

title: PEOPLE'S CHOICE: Jodi Heights at The Green Room
description: I need your vote! No, not for political office.  I'm hosting a "People's Choice" concert where you, the audience, vote on which songs you'd like to hear on my first demo. Fun huh? My future in the music business will be in your hands. Just think of it as a musical trust fall.

title: SHORTS 6: the great advantage of being alive
description: Saturday May 15, 3:00pmTheater 3SHORTS 6: the great advantage of being aliveFausto and EmilioNora Sweeney13 min., 16mm, 2014, USA““I like it...because it’s my job.” Waiting, snipping, shaving, smoking, and chatting. These are the daily rhythms of a barbershop in downtown Cincinnati, Ohio where brothers Fausto (age 83) and Emilio (age 75) have worked together for decades. The barbershop, with its turquoise barber chairs, porcelain sinks, collection of glass bottles of aftershave, vintage postcards from Italy, is more than a workplace - it is a window into an earlier time.” - Nora SweeneyPort NoirLaura Kraning11 min., Video, 2014, USA”Within the machine landscape of Terminal Island, the strata of a 100 year old boat shop provides a glimpse into Los Angeles Harbor’s disappearing past. Often recast as a backdrop for fictional crime dramas, the scenic details of the last boatyard evoke imaginary departures and a hidden world at sea.” - Laura KraningThe Klan in Chapel Hill 1987Michael Galinsky4 min.,Video, 2015, USA“Last year I found a couple of rolls of negatives from when the Klan came to town. I posted a few online and was told that it was the day after my high school graduation. Another friend shared a sound piece recorded by Brandon Uttley and Jeff Robins. We combined the sounds and images.” - Michael GalinskyAtomic CityDavid McMurry27 min., Video, 2014, USA“A meditation on the town of Arco, Idaho, the first city in the world lit electrically with atomic power. Once on the glowing edge of the nuclear future, Arco is a town of just under 1000 residents, struggling to resist fading into the backdrop of the west. Atomic City weaves together ethereal portraits and astrological archetypes to create a melancholy collage of a forgotten town on the atomic frontier.” - David McMurryReal WestKevin T Allen29 min., Video, 2014, USA“An ethnographic portrait of two roadside ghost towns in South Dakota and the elderly proprietors who devotedly maintain these sites. The film uses contact microphones and super-8mm film as archaeological tools to uncover the material traces of living history.” - Kevin T Allen

title: White God
description: A cautionary tale about our 'superiority' over 'lesser beasts' ... A seemingly harmless measure that aims to make dog-breeding more disciplined in Hungary kicks off a series of extraordinary events. Favoring pedigree and purebred dogs, the new regulation places a severe tax on those who own mixed breeds -- so owners begin to dump their mongrels and shelters quickly become overcrowded.

title: Shorts 2: Humanity i love you
description: SHORTS PROGRAM 2: Humanity i love youFriday May 15, 6:30pmTheater 3Everything For the MoviesLukas Buys20 min., video, 2014, Belgium“Oliver picks up a young actress Lize to take her to a remote film set. But how far is she prepared to go to make it in the movies?” - Lukas BuysOut of the MoldMichel Moon12 min., video, 2014, USA/Canada/Australia“The crumbling of a couple's relationship manifests itself in mold growing in their bathroom.” - Michel MoonSelf PortraitKristjan Knigge10 min., video, 2014, Netherlands“A terrible accident has left former dancer Julia paralysed and confined to a wheelchair. What could be nicer than being taken for a gentle walk in the woods by a caring friend?” - Kristjan KniggeVioletsJim Vendiola13 min., video, 2014, USA“Two strange, reclusive sisters quietly await the advent of their secretly twisted plan. Inspired by true events.” -  Jim VendiolaNature BoyAnnelise Ogaard27 min., video, 2014, USA“Is it a kidnapping, or a non-consensual health retreat? Lauren comes to in a warehouse, at the mercy of Nature Boy, a New Age sadist determined to save her from herself, or destroy her. Whichever, really.” - Annelise Ogaard

Please come early and join us for sacred play that begins the night.Live music, DJ sets, and projected visuals will guide us through the rest of the night, inspiring new patterns in our dance, opening our song and expanding our vision as we cover the walls with craypas and markers, and we’ll close the night with a healing sound bath to seal in the transformation of our journey togetherThroughout the night, visit Taste of Bhakti (Downstairs) to nourish your body and sensitize your tastebuds.Welcome to the Cosmic Renaissance!Get a bite to eat and hang at "Taste of Bhakti" before the event. Buffet opens at 5pm! Clear the mind and the heart for the next journey of expression…http://facebook.com/bhaktidojo---> Into the Journey of Expression with:: Artist Ashram http://artistashram.com/What does this mean? Interactive Art and Dance! It means we are covering the walls with paper.. markers and cray pas everywhere and getting our expression on. As the drum beats bump... as the body's sway. As we tap into our own personal and collective expression... :: Dancing With Gravity by Jesse Johnson 8-10:30pm :: Live Music and DJs :: Dan Bailey TribeJoin Dan Bailey Tribe in a gypset movement of soulful island surf funk with roots rhythms and djungle drums. Touring the isles, edens and oceans of Earth, Bailey spearheads a tribe of sun chasers, surf seekers, booty shakers and peacemakers in worldwide safari celebration. :: Jason Cohen ( Incus )Jason Cohen is a community organizer, a producer of transformational festivals including Forestdance Ceremonial Gathering, Sacred World Interdependence Day and Unifier Festival. He is the creative director for the heartbeat Collective Productions based in Boston, MA which has hosted more than 200 events, workshops, performances and rituals spanning more than a decade. www.UnifierFestival.com www.heartbeatcollective.org:: SriKaloGY - (DJ Set)Beats to open your hearts and move your feets! http://soundcloud.com/srikalogy:: Lily Fangz - Moments of Poetry****** Visual Art ******:: Emily Prism ART - Live PaintingEmily Prism delivers insight into subtle, yet magnificent realms of imagination beyond your wildest dreams. You will be entranced by the vibrancy and vision infused into her every brush stroke, channeled through deep meditation of the third eye, and delivered with both technical skill and raw creativity. Prepare to be astounded.:: The Visionary Art of Myztico - Live Visionary Shamanic 3D UV paintingwww.myzticocamp.com***** Chill Space Schedule (2nd Room)******* ::Brothers Of The GONG Is a collective of two Gong enthusiasts who have come together to help people experience deep states of meditation. They will be filling the room all night with sacred sound vibrations.::CC Treadway Treadway Esoteric - CC Treadway is a classically trained sacred singer and songwriter. She weaves together stories, original songs and sound healing, bringing forth the healing energies of the angelic realms to connect with your soul.**Closing Gathering by**:: Malia Kulp and Jascha HoffmanSociety for Spontaneous SingingTreats by::Yes OR No Raw Chocolate by Ebonie Lee:::: Goloka Juice Bar Organic Juices:: Runa Tea ::Lingzhi You: Free Medicinal Mushroom Tea:::Black Swan Sounds: Free Digital music Giveaways::=====================================$10 Presale: https://www.universe.com/cosmicren (Ticket sales start April 9th)$15 at the door*** All Ages *** (Speak to us about discounts for kiddies)::1st Floor Buffet closes at 10pm!Location:The Bhakti Center 25 1st Ave. 2nd Floor ===================================http://unitribe.net/http://artistashram.com/http://unifierfestival.com/

title: WEIRD by Phillip Psutka - ONE TORONTO SHOW ONLY
description:
COMING TO TORONTO FOR ONE PERFORMANCE ONLY!
THEATRE ARCTURUS & 918 BATHURSTwith the support of SHEPPARD FINANCIAL SERVICESpresentWEIRDBy Phillip Psutka"TRANSFIXING!...Theatre Arcturus nailed this piece and left the audience in a daze!" ~ Windsor Independent"INCREDIBLE!" ~ Cindy Triolet Pastoruius: Teacher at the Windsor Essex Catholic District School BoardStep onto the blasted heath of war-torn Scotland and witness the private deeds of three Weird Sisters, caught between the bloody business of Macbeth's tragedy and their own destructive sibling rivalry. In an innovative form of story-telling, WEIRD opens up vertical space as the Witches climb, twist and move through the air, harnessing wild elements and conjuring the haunting forces that will lead Macbeth to his end.WEIRD is a multidisciplinary show that blends original text and story-telling with circus arts, stage combat and original music.After premiering in Toronto, WEIRD has performed in Windsor, Hamilton and Stratford. The show will continue on to Ottawa Fringe in June and Nuit Blanche North in July, 2015. This production is recommended for ages 10+Written & Directed by: Phillip PsutkaCo-Created by: Lindsay BellaireCast: Lindsay Bellaire, Lindsay Sippel Eitzen, Emily HughesStage Manager: Lisa SciannellaTickets: Advance - $20              At-the-Door - $25For more information visit: www.TheatreArcturus.ca

title: Vegan Supper Club Series: All-Stars {Voted by You}
description: It tasted so nice, we're serving it twice…Our best Supper Club courses chosen by you!This is our last supper club of the season so whether you’ve been meaning to get out to one of our Supper Clubs or you are a monthly regular, this is the dinner not to miss! We’re polling peeps on their favourite Supper Club meals they'd like to try (or re-try). Vote now Voting begins April 19th favourite dish until May 12th; winning menu items will be posted (here) by May 15th.Note: Due to the nature of this menu no additional substitutions or modifications can be made. Menu may contain nuts, gluten, sulphates, and soy.Coffee, tea, sparkling and flat water included.The event begins at 7pm and dinner will start at 7:20pm or when most of the guests have arrived.Supper clubs will resume in September... have a great summer!{About Vegan Supper Clubs}We host a monthly themed Vegan Supper Club in our second level loft kitchen.What's a Supper Club you ask? Think of it as an informal dinner party meant to encourage guests to mingle, share and celebrate food. Events are 19+, complimentary sparkling and flat water will be provided. Here's a sneak peak of what to expect or check out our Supper Club Gallery.Are they always Vegan? Yes. We want people to feel included in the discussion around food, culture and the arts and feel making these events vegan will allow more guests to participate. We also do special Gluten-Free editions a few times a year.{About Urban Acorn LTD.}Just like an idea, acorns begin small with the hopes of becoming something big, strong and meaningful. This was the initial push behind Urban Acorn LTD. a Flexiatarian Catering company founded by Chef Daniel Holloway and his parntner Marie Fitrion.Inspired by art, music, and using food as a dialogue for social change, Urban Acorn wants to encourage people to broaden their understanding of food and each other with the hopes of building stronger communities.Their mostly plant-based 'Flexitarian' approach to cuisine, allows them to seemlessly create menus to both omnivores and vegans. Their philosophy is simple, they believe food should unite, not divide people

title: Yogurt! The Janet Fletcher Way!
description: Join us in welcoming the talented food writer Janet Fletcher to Portland with the launch of her latest book that covers everything you'd want to know about yogurt- from how to make it to how to incorporate it into all sorts of dishes in your kitchen.This is going to be such an awesome event- Janet has learned a tremendous amount about yogurt and she's even going to demonstrate how to make it at home! We will have dishes from the cookbooks and some tastes of wine to go along!

title: Kumiko The Treasure Hunter
description: The Flyway Minema Presents: Kumiko The Treasure HunterIn this darkly comedic odyssey, Academy Award nominee Rinko Kikuchi (Babel, Pacific Rim) stars as Kumiko, a frustrated Office Ladywhose imagination transcends the confines of her mundane life. Kumiko becomes obsessed with a mysterious, battered VHS tape of apopular film she’s mistaken for a documentary, fixating on a scene where a suitcase of stolen cash is buried in the desolate, frozenlandscape of North Dakota. Believing this treasure to be real, she leaves behind Tokyo and her beloved rabbit Bunzo to recover it – andfinds herself on a dangerous adventure unlike anything she’s seen in the movies.

title: Dreams For Kids Comedy Night
description: Join the Dreams For Kids family at Joe's Bar for a night of fun, laughter and an all around good time! Proceeds from the event will benefit Dreams for Kids. Raffle tickets for great prizes will be sold the night of! For more details contact Anna Bryan at Abryan@DreamsforKids.org

title: Hope Connections: Santa Clarita Valley
description: Hope ConnectionsDiscover Your Role in God's Mercy to the Poor. The Psalms say that God is “near to the brokenhearted and saves the  crushed in spirit.” And there are few experiences in life more beautiful  than when God chooses to use us to show His mercy to another.Join us for a meaningful evening of reflection and vision-casting  with Children’s Hunger Fund. Together, we will trace the amazing  connections that God is utilizing to provide hope for children here at  home and around the world. We hope you will discover your role in the  story of God’s mercy to the poor.We hope you will attend and bring with you friends who you believe will share your passion to deliver hope for suffering children. Sunday, May 3, 20156:30-8:30 PMRobinson Ranch Golf Club27734 Sand Canyon RdSanta Clarita, CA 91387Buffet dinner to be served

title: Organic Home Vegetable Gardening Workshop
description:
Come and explore the magic of growing your own food in the city. Urban Seedling will guide you through how to over come the obstacles to vegetable gardening in the city, and specifically in Montreal's particular growing season.At the Urban Seedling organic vegetable gardening workshop we will teach you how to plan, plant and care for your home organic vegetable garden, whether you are gardening in your balcony in your backyard or even on your rooftop.You will learn how to:
Plan and build your vegetable garden
Put together the perfect soil mix and learn all about soil fertility
Plant seeds and transplant seedlings
Maintain the garden throughout the season
Master companion planting
Natural, organic control pests and disease 
At the end of the workshop, participants will receive their own organic vegetable seedlings transplanted during the workshop, pertinent handouts, as well as a package of seeds to start at a later date. There will be seeds, soil, and vegetable gardening supplies available for purchase.Urban Seedling is a Montreal-based company that helps people grow their own fresh food in the city. For the past 5 years, we've helped people across the city grow fresh vegetables, herbs, and fruit in backyards, front yards, balconies, and rooftops.Led by co-founder and conferenicer Tereska Gesing.This is an English workshop. The French workshop is Sunday, April 12th 2015.The workshop is at the Coalition de la Petite-Bourgogne, a 2-minute walk from Georges-Vanier metro in Little Burgundy

title: Ned Rifle
description: American indie icon Hal Hartley completes the trilogy he began with Henry Fool and Fay Grim with this delightfully offbeat tale about Henry and Fay’s teenage son, Ned, who emerges from a witness protection program with a single, fixed purpose: to kill his father for ruining his mother’s life.For twenty-five years, Hartley has intrigued audiences with elegantly understated, deadpan-funny films featuring eccentric and endearing casts of misfit characters. He has created a cinematic universe that is uniquely his own, stamping his visual and verbal authority on each film. The film includes Henry (Thomas Jay Ryan) and Fay (Parker Posey), but they are secondary characters in what turns into a loving portrait of their son, Ned (Liam Aiken), now eighteen and recently released from witness protection. Despite the Christian upbringing he received from his foster parent (Martin Donovan), Ned sets out with one goal: to kill his father for having ruined his mother’s life. As the serious and well mannered young man begins his quest for revenge, he finds himself amongst a typical band of Hartley miscreants, including Aubrey Plaza (Parks & Rec) as a grad student obsessed with the work of Ned’s uncle, a former poet laureate."Repeating himself without ever lapsing into self-parody, Hartley has made a movie that will seem familiar to his fans, but which also looks, sounds, and moves like nothing else on the current American indie landscape.” - Ignatiy Vishnevetsky, AV Club"Move over, Boyhood. Hal Hartley completes his bio-trilogy half a dozen years longer than Linklater's decidedly conventional odyssey - an infinitely more dark and daring, toxically tantalizing suburban noir.” - NewsBlaze See the trailer HERE.

title: Messiah in Yarmouth
description: Come hear the stirring music of Handel as we sing and play our way through the entire Messiah! Orchestra, choir, and soloists collaborate to bring you a full evening of breathtaking music.April 5th at 5pm

title: Denver Food Rescue's Market & Menu
description: Join us for Denver Food Rescue's Market & Menu, a craft fair and fundraising dinner at The Garden in Park Hill. In addition to dinner, drinks, and a market with local artists (clothing, jewelry, fermented foods, painting, hand bound journals, & more) a vinyl DJ will set the tone for our celebration with friends and DFR supporters.  Proceeds benefit Denver Food Rescue. Guests have two ticket options:  50 dollars includes dinner, dessert, drinks, access to the art market beginning at 6pm, and DJ sets.15 dollars will allow guests in the door at 8pm for limitless drinks, access to the art market, and DJ set.
