title: Menug 2015
description:
Join us on May 4, 2015 for a full day of NonStop Product Updates, Roadmaps, Networking, and MORE!REGISTRATION INCLUDES: 
A full day of keynote presentations and breakout sessions where you will gain the latest technical knowledge and make valuable contacts
Partner Pavilion! Catch up with your favorite NonStop Partners to see the latest innovations and solutions in NonStop technology
Continental Breakfast, Networking Lunch, and Evening Reception
ACCOMMODATIONS:The 2nd Annual MENUG Meeting will be held at the beautiful Hilton Dubai Jumeirah Resort. Click here for discounted room reservations.PRESENTATIONS:NuWave specializes in connecting NonStop applications to other platforms and services. Messages are exchanged using SOAP, REST, and JSON.Presentation:NonStop InteroperabilityInteroperability is defined as "the ability of making systems and organizations work together". Let's do it! it's time to establish the NonStop as the gateway to modernisation and interoperability. Let's do it! plan for your NonStop to be an active participant in your interoperability solution.Speaker: David RossDavid Joined Tandem UK in 1998 and has been NonStop working ever since. Chairman of BITUG in 2010 and current committee member, David is now Regional Sales Manager of NonStop Middleware specialist, NuWave Technologies.Engaged in Information Technology Software Solution & Services with focus in e-Payment, Card Transaction Processing, EFT Switch domain catering to Banks & Payment Service Providers. We do have products & solutions on HP NonStop systems and also provide support services on the same.Presentation: TBASpeaker: TBATCM is the premier, accredited global provider of specialist NonStop IT services, delivering innovative, proven solutions for nearly 2 decades. During this time, TCM has maintained a 100% SLA record, achieved considerable references and has never lost a customer.Presentation: TBASpeaker: TBAFinancial Software and Systems (FSS) is a leading global payment systems company, offering business value in the areas of electronic payment, financial transaction processing solutions and services. The company has earned the status of being a payment systems leader through a combination of established portfolio of technology solutions, state-of-the-art infrastructure and 20 years of experience in the payments domain. Headquartered in Chennai, India, FSS has established a global footprint in Australia, Canada, Europe, Middle East, Singapore and the United States of America.Presentation: FSS Card Management System (CMS) V5FSS will highlight the launch of their key product: FSS Card Management System (CMS) V5.We will focus on our Card Management System, and the fact that it has been ported on to the HP Non-Stop platform, in addition to various other value added features of the product.Speaker: Philip GeorgeGravic, Inc. is a privately-held corporation located in Malvern, PA, about twenty miles west of Philadelphia, PA, USA. Gravic makes a number of computer software products for data collection, transformation, and distribution uses. Customers of its Shadowbase data replication and data integration product suite include banks, financial and brokerage firms, insurance companies, stock exchanges, electric utilities, healthcare, and telecommunications companies. Shadowbase sales and service are now available globally from HP or from select regional resellers. Visit www.gravic.com/shadowbase for more information.Presentation: HP and Gravic Partnership Delivers HP Shadowbase Advanced Data Replication Solutions for Business Continuity, Data and Application Integration, and Audit Compliance RequirementsHP now licenses, sells, services, and supports Gravic’s leading-edge Shadowbase solutions that address data replication for business continuity and heterogeneous data and application integration requirements. We provide a single point of purchase and support for these advanced replication solutions so that our customers benefit from the global reach, industry expertise, and 24x7 support available from HP. In a business continuity environment, HP Shadowbase solutions extend localized HP NonStop server fault-tolerance to the geographic fault-tolerance required by mission-critical enterprise applications, from active/passive on up through sizzling-hot-takeover to fully active/active architectures. HP Shadowbase also provides heterogeneous data replication between a variety of platforms and databases, including HP NonStop, Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, DB2, and Sybase. In addition, HP Shadowbase utilities provide tools for restoring corrupt databases, and helping to meet audit compliance requirements. As our customers architect next-generation solutions, we deliver advanced data replication and integration capabilities across heterogeneous platforms, including zero application downtime solutions for upgrades and migrations.Speaker: William Holenstein, Sr. Manager of Product DeliverycomForte provides proven and innovative middleware, connectivity, modernization, and security solutions for users of HP NonStop systems. We care about our customers and the HP NonStop platform, offering an unrivaled and unmatched portfolio of software products in the NonStop industry. With customer value in mind, it is comForte’s goal to deliver best-in-class products and solutions and to provide customers with the best support possible.Presentation: Quantifying Risk - When your business depends on card paymentsContributing factors for quantifying the impact of a data breach; Understanding the financial implications when credit card data start to be abused; What’s your risk appetite – what’s an appropriate investment vs what’s the gain of enhanced data protection? Protecting stored data: How tokenization contributes to lowering risk.Speaker: Andreas Lutz, Senior Key Account Manager EMEA, comForte 21Andreas Lutz has been working with acquiring banks and payment processors for about 15 years. He has been involved in many PCI compliance consulting projects and securing card based payment systems for financial institutes operating internationally across EMEA.Specialists in HP NonStop server software since 1983, XYPRO provides the tools to achieve security compliance in a NonStop environment. XYGATE security solutions range from Access Control, User Authentication, Authorization and Password Quality to Automated Compliance and Audit Reporting, Integrity  Presentation: XYGATE Data Protection: Optimization of Voltage Tokenization and Encryption for HP NonStop SystemsProtecting payment data and other sensitive information in the NonStop environment is a critical security requirement. In this session, learn how XYPRO has partnered with HP Security Voltage to provide data-centric security by enabling Secure Stateless Tokenization (SST) and Format-Preserving Encryption (FPE) solutions on the HP NonStop™ server. This session will review how XYGATE Data Protection (XDP) optimizes Voltage for NonStop systems, including implementation with no changes to NonStop applications, increased deployment flexibility, functional enhancements and integration with the NonStop system severity infrastructure.Speaker: Barry ForbesBarry Forbes manages sales and marketing for XYPRO Technology Corporation. XYPRO specializes in Platform Security and Encryption Software to improve HP NonStop server environments.The OmniPayments Financial Transaction Switch is deployed on HP NonStop for the highest availability and offers customers all the requisite functionality to manage credit/debit-card transactions.Presentation: The OmniPayments Financial Transaction Switch Is Now Pay-As-You-Go with OmniCloudX on NonStop XThe OmniPayments Financial Transaction Switch offers a comprehensive solution for financial institutions and retailers to acquire, authenticate, route, switch and authorize transactions across multiple input channels. OmniPayments guarantees that the switch will save a company at least 50% of its current transaction processing costs. New this year is OmniCloudX, a SaaS cloud platform that hosts numerous instances of OmniPayments on a pay-for-use basis and at a price so attractive that mid-size retailers now can afford the benefits of NonStop’s mission-critical platform. OmniPayments CEO Yash Kapadia discusses OmniCloudX, its value to the financial and retail industries, and the unique configurations being made to OmniCloudX to support the needs of such nontraditional audiences as the “unbanked” customer.Speaker: Yash Kapadia Yash Kapadia is the founder and CEO of OmniPayments Inc., a leading HP NonStop system integrator. His OmniPayments Financial Transaction Switch and the new OmniCloudX are popular with both financial institutions and retailers. OmniPayments is the product arm of Yash’s Opsol Integrators, a leading HP NonStop system integrator. Opsol specializes in managed services and in the fixed-price, custom development of NonStop applications and of open solutions ported to NonStop. Yash can be reached at yash@omnipayments.com and at +1 408-446-9274.Idelji offers a balanced integration of innovation, high quality products, and low time-to-market with the highest focus on customer service with products and services are relied upon by thousands of blue chip corporations around the world. Idelji specializes in the development of performance and operation management & analysis tools for HP™ NonStop™ Servers.Presentation: NonStop Manageability and Cloud Performance AnalyticsNonStop Manageability has never been easier. Learn how you can remotely and securely manage your operation from any device. To analyze performance, NonStop employs the latest in cloud analytics and automation. Off NonStop analytics monitor your NonStop every minute of every day, and provide you with insights to avoid SLA concerns and outages. And oh; you don’t need to be a NonStop expert to do any of these! NonStop made easy, through automation and cloud.SPONSORSHIPS AND CALL FOR PAPERS:Sponsorships for the 2nd Annual MENUG Meeting are still available. Be sure to reserve your prime booth space before April 1, 2015! The cost of exhibiting during the meeting is $1,000. For more information on sponsoring the 2015 MENUG event and to reserve your booth,click here.

title: FOLK IT ALL Music Festival
description: Folk music in Ottawa is not a new concept. From bar to festival, the city has boasted hundreds of great folk artists for decades.But while we often picture folk music as a quiet night out, those who have dug into Ottawa’s independent scene have found themselves dancing and screaming at the top of their lungs to artists who still proudly hang the folk flag. This festival is a celebration of the loudest and proudest independent folk, country and celtic artists of Ottawa. Seats and shushing be damned, this is an opportunity to stomp and scream for more. We hope you’ll enjoy it. Featuring:The Jerry Cans / Pai Gaalaqautikkut (Iqaluit folk rock) www.thejerrycans.comThe Noisy Locomotive (Ottawa/Montreal bluegrass)www.noisylocomotive.comSteamers (Ottawa/Gatineau power-folk)www.steamers613.comJames Leclaire & Cable 22 (Ottawa folk rock)www.jamesleclaire.comDublin Down (Kingston celtic rock)www.facebook.com/dublindownbandJon Creeden (Ottawa/Stratford folk punk)www.joncreeden.comwith all-vinyl DJ sets by the guys at Ottawa Showbox!Tickets available soon. This is a 19+ event.This will sell out! Tell your friends and get your tickets now!

title: Carlsberg St. Party's Day 1030PM-12AM Entry Time
description: **Please enter event during time slot specified. Once you have entered, you may stay until last call at 2 AM**St. Party's Day promises to be Toronto's biggest party for everyone's favourite psuedo-holiday. An all day banger at Brassaii sponsored by Carlsberg, this event will blow your little green trousers right off.Last year was a hoot with over 8000 people attending, and the event has only grown, now bringing in more live music including Rich McGhie, sponsored give-aways, and a whole new batch of St. Party’s Day enthusiasts eager to break a leg on the dance floor!What some of you may refer to as St. Patrick’s Day is now commonly being referred to as St. Party’s Day. In 2011 the first ever St. Party’s Day celebration was born when 3000+ people attended in Toronto, ON at the historical St. Lawrence Market. Event goers and members of the community came together and signed a petition for St. Party’s Day to become a statutory holiday which created a huge buzz around town. 2012, 2013 and 2014 each played host to over 8,000 patrons celebrating the fast growing, authentic Irish holiday, and St. Party’s is back with its partner, Carlsberg, for another year of the best celebrations in the country.**Please enter event during time slot specified. Once you have entered, you may stay until last call at 2 AM**

title: The Peacock Ball in support of ehcw
description:
The 3rd Annual Peacock Ball – a fundraising gala in support of the Elspeth Heyworth Centre for Women (ehcw) on March 13, 2015 at the Claireport Banquet and Convention Centre.We are pleased to announce that Suhana Meherchand, Dr. Angela Mailis and the Hon Dipika Damerla will be joining us.The peacock symbolizes some of the most admired human characteristics including; 
Benevolence
Patience
Kindness
Compassion
Good-will 
Nurturing. 
It is a cross-cultural symbol of integrity and the beauty we can achieve when we endeavor to show our true colors. Here at the Centre we empower women who have survived abuse to rebuild their lives and to show their true colours to the world. The Peacock Ball brings our community together to celebrate these women who have made positive changes in their lives, significant contributions to our community, and who are an inspiration to others.Funds raised through ticket sales and at the Peacock Ball will help us develop a community of empowered women by connecting them with meaningful employment to ensure that they can live a dignified, active life as contributing community members.

title: Terrance Love Live at The Dizzy Bird Lounge
description: Born and raised in Memphis Tennessee, TL was the oldest child and grandchild to a musical filled family. From the beginning he was born to be a musical Icon.  With his family having their own gospel group and playing almost every instrument, TL picked up on a lot of their talents.  At the age of 3 he started watching his favorite performer, Michael Jackson.  He trained himself vocally by repeating what he heard different singers do. At the same age he taught himself how to play the drums.  TL was aiming himself towards being a musical genius.  At the age of 7 he began to sing and play at his church and as he got older he started singing at many different programs for both school and church.  But he finally reached the point to which he knew this was his life long dream when he won the talent showcase his eleventh grade year in high school.  From there, he took off winning more showcases, and being exposed to greater things. After completing high school he auditioned for “American Idol”, making it through to the next round, but finding that they had all that they could take.  TL went on to sing in many different play productions.Singing with his 1st group, Nu Era, TL had a chance to sing for Dave Hollister.  But years later TL moved on with his musical dreams.  TL later joined with DK, D Jae, and C luv forming a group called Image IV.  At that time TL was going by the name T-love.  These 4 guys together experienced and accomplished a lot all because of their manager, Mercedes Jackson.  Image IV opened up for many different events and artists, such as: Pretty Rickey, Boys II Men, The New Years celebration on Beale Street, Africa in April, All Black Mayors Conference, A&R’S in New York @ the Harlem Bar and Grill, the Mayor’s Christmas ball and headlined a host of citywide talent showcases. They also appeared on channel 3 news twice and on the good morning Memphis News channel 13. They had the chances of meeting Master P, Romeo, Bow Bow, Scott Storch, Omarion, and Tracy Ellis Ross.  Image IV with the help of Mercedes put out a single “At the Party”.After releasing the single, the group departed because of creative differences.  That’s when “T-love” decided to become a solo artist changing his name to “TL”.  TL started his solo career opening up for Tyrese.  Then he went to St. Louis to meet with the St. Lunatics.  TL, also as a solo artist, performed at the city’s Christmas ball and then he opened up for Charlie Wilson and Tamia, Bow Bow and Pleasure P, Performed @ the Memphis Red Birds Game, Master P’s Christmas toy give away, St. Jude’s charity event, Charity for Africa, Living The Dream Concert, Africa in April and featured in the Street Master’s Magazine and many other events.  TL had finished his first solo album “The Love Story” and went on to record his new single “Hypnotized” under his name Terrance Love.  Experiencing a lot over the years TL, now Terrance Love, only knows that the best is yet to come.1luvtl

title: Vegan Supper Club Series: Robbie Burns Day
description: Heritage Month Part 2: Robbie Burns DayJanuary marks two important holidays for Urban Acorn co-founders Marie & Chef Daniel: Haiti's Independence day & Robbie Burns day. Both will be commemorated, beginning with Haiti's independence, followed by this Robbie Burns Day celebration...If Tiger Beat existed in the 18th century, Scotland’s national treasure & poet Robbie Burns would have been cover boy material! This UK heartthrob even has his own holiday, so to celebrate his legacy we’re busting out the kilt and wearing some plaid for this month’s Vegan Scottish menu.MenuIntroduction Course: Chunky Carrot and Red Lentil Soup with handmade Savoury DumplingsSecond Course: Yam and Cabbage Pie served with “Skirlie” Steal-cut Oatmeal Stuffing and Creamed SpinachMain Course: “Tatties and Black Pudding” Seared Black Bean Square Sausage and Creamy Garlic Mash Potatoes served with Mushy PeasDessert: Clootie Pudding, “Laphroaig Triple Wood” Scotch Soaked Raison Pudding with Whipped Coconut Milk and CherriesTickets are available in advance only.Cost is $45 for a 4-course dinner + Coffee/Tea service.Space is limited to 16 seats so make sure to snatch up your tickets early before they sell out.Want to know more about our supper clubs?

title: Vegan Supper Club Series: Haitian Independence Day
description:
Heritage Month Part 1: Haiti's IndependenceJanuary marks two important holidays for Urban Acorn co-founders Marie & Chef Daniel: Haiti's Independence day & Robbie Burns day. Both will be commemorated, beginning with Haiti's independence...In 1804 Haitians won a revolt against Napoleons army, becoming the first independent black nation in the world. Every January 1st Haitians remember that triumphant day with family, friends and of course food!!! Haitian food is quite unique and though it features many flavours from the Caribbean, it is the culinary techniques borrowed from the French that sets its food apart. Haitian food is island cuisine filled with warm notes and tangy flavours; it is not generally vegan (or vegetarian), however, we have done our best to presence the essence of these traditional dishes and infuse them with the same care and practices you'd expect to see in Haiti. We really hope you enjoy this special menu:MenuIntroduction Course: Soup Joumou {Acorn Squash Soup with Coconut Milk, Cilantro and Noodles}.Second Course: Raw Salade Russe tossed with Watercress, Peas and Shaved Ruby Beets served on Mais MoulinMain Course: Aubergine and Choux Toufée {Eggplant & Cabbage Strew} served with Riz Djon-Djon {Mushroom Rice} and Ti-Malice Sauce and Plantain ChipDessert: Haitian Coconut & Cassava Flan served with a Coconut “Tablet Cocoye” and Confiture ChadequeTickets are available in advance only.Cost is $45 for a 4-course dinner + Coffee/Tea service.Space is limited to 16 seats so make sure to snatch up your
tickets early before they sell out.Want to know more about our supper
clubs?

title: Aunt Hilda - Screening 2
description: "World   Hunger is Solved!" exclaims the antagonist in this beautifully rendered,   hand-drawn animation. Motivated by money, the company Attilem grows   biologically modified crops all over the world and it quickly replaces all   other forms of food. The only natural plants left are the ones Aunt Hilda has   been preserving in her huge green house.     Is genetically modified food the answer we have been waiting for? Is Aunt   Hilda ready to accept the future of botany? Is she really an Aunt? All these   questions and more will be answered in the latest family film from the   acclaimed French studio, Folimage creators of The Cat in Paris and OIAF 04   Grand Prize winner, Raining Cats and Frogs.     Suitable for all ages.

title: CME: Evaluation & Management of the Young Athlete
description:
Target Audience:Orthopedic surgeons, physician assistants, nurse practitioners, and allied healthprofessionals involved in the treatment of orthopedic patients.Objectives:At the conclusion of this activity, participants should be able to:
Make clinical decisions for proficient management of injuries to skeletally immature patients
Apply the latest non-surgical and surgical strategies for the treatment of both traumatic and non-traumatic conditions affecting skeletally immature patients
Recognize diagnostic indications and techniques in the evaluation of the skeletally immature patients.
Accreditation Statement:This activity has been planned and implemented in accordance with the EssentialAreas and policies of the Accreditation Council for Continuing Medical Educationthrough the joint sponsorship of the Carolinas Center for Medical Excellence (CCME)and the OrthoCarolina Research Institute. CCME is accredited by the North CarolinaMedical Society (NCMS) to provide continuing medical education for physicians.

title: The Telephone and The Medium by Menotti
description: Hello! :)Thank you for stumbling across our tickets page!We are Stephanie, Judith, Meher, Karen, Toni, Andrey, and Enzo!WHEN AND WHERE?Friday Sept. 12th | 7:30 PM drinks 7:45 PM show starts | Arts and Letters Club, 14 Elm Street, TorontoABOUT THE OPERASThe Telephone - MenottiA one-act 20-minute opera buffa for two singers. Lucy spends most of her time on the telephone, and when Ben, her boyfriend, visits her intending to propose, the telephone keeps ringing, interrupting Ben every time he is about to pop the question. Eventually, the audience and Ben realize that the telephone is not only Lucy's means of remaining connected to the world but also a defence mechanism. Ben decides to penetrate this shield by leaving the apartment and using a pay phone to get through to her. Will Ben finally get through to Lucy? The Medium - MenottiA cautionary tale where Baba poses as a medium with her daughter, Monica, posing as ghosts from the beyond. She takes in Toby, a mute, but distrusts him. The business continues until, during a séance, she feels a 'cold hand' tightening about her throat. When her customers return for another session, she tells them that she is a fake and demonstrates her tricks, but her clients protest that she must be real, that it was not Monica's voice they heard. She drives them out and resolves to cast out Toby as well. Whose hand was around her throat?

title: FREE Drive-in and Sock hop in Downtown Markham
description: Get ready for some summer lovin' as Downtown Markham's FREE Drive In returns on Wednesday, July 23, 2014 with a special showing of the classic movie musical Grease,starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John.Dress up as your favourite character from the movie or just in '50s style and join our pre-show Sock Hop for a chance to win prizes! And follow us on social media for more contests!

title: Family Fun Day & Open House @Sugar Ridge Retreat
description:
Open House at Sugar Ridge Retreat Center!You Are Invited To AttendOur Annual Celebration Of Summer!Time to relax and enjoy the summer.Find out why we host thousands of people at our peaceful retreats, mindful meditation and yoga classes.Here are some of the things you can do at our open house:
Meander the walking trails through our beautiful 150 acres 
Explore our yoga studio and snug cabins in the woods
Take in a free Yoga, Zumba, Groove or Kick Boxing  class 
Sip some refreshing organic herbal tea
Speak to our talented instructors on the different types of yoga and fitness classes 
Taste some yummy organic gluten-free vegetarian treats - like healthy chocolate cake - really!
Appreciate the beauty and aroma of the beneficial plants in our medicinal plant circle
Just relax and enjoy being outside! It's the summer, time to unwind and enjoy life!
When: Sunday July 13, 2014 from 1 – 4 pmWhere: Sugar Ridge Retreat Center5720 Forgets Road Wyebridge, Ontario L0K 2E0Only a short pleasant 1.5 hour drive NW of GTA.  Take a Sunday drive in the country with your family and friends. All are welcome including your dogs!Please RSVP for this FREE event so that we know how much tea to brew and treats to bake!We really look forward to welcoming you to our center.Liz and Kurt Frost

title: North York Moms Anniversary Pizza Potluck Picnic
description: Let's celebrate the amazing community that has come together in just 1 year!  We will gather outside by the Edithvale Outdoor Oven and make pizzas together.  There will be music, games and plenty of fun!  This event will run rain or shine.  We have an indoor room booked just in case.Kids are free!You will be emailed about about the potluck portion of the picnic closer to the event.  Local Sponsorship available for $30.  You must bring your own table to display your stuff.

description:

title: Connections & Collections: Engaging Minds in Math
description: Learn how to use a child’s natural inclination to sort, organize and classify to build science and math skills. Explore how collections can build a foundation for 21st century learning and encourage young minds to make connections to the world around them.

title: I'll Follow You Down + short film Pushers
description: I’LL FOLLOW YOU DOWNRelease Year: 2013Runtime: 93 minutesDirected by: Richie Mehta Country/Language: Canada / EnglishPremiere: OntarioSynopsis:Gabriel and Marika appear to have everything. He is an Ivy League educated physicist and professor, she a contemporary artist. Together they have found what everyone is looking for – true love. After years of marriage, they’re still happy with each other and completely adoring of their 9-year old son Erol. Until the day Gabriel flies to Princeton for a conference and mysteriously disappears off the face of the earth, without any explanation, and without leaving any clues as to where he has gone. For more information visit: http://scarboroughfilmfestival.com/portfolio/ill-follow-you-down/ ________________________________________________________PUSHERS Release Year: 2014Runtime: 14 minutesDirected by: Nicholas Posthumus Country/Language: Canada / EnglishProgram: In-CompetitionPremiere: WorldSynopsis:Pushers is a story about love, loss and purpose set in a world where every human being is born with a button that gives them the power to disappear. Where to though, nobody knows.For more information visit: http://scarboroughfilmfestival.com/portfolio/pushers/

title: Getting Your Ideas On Screen
description: A three hour workshop aimed at students and pros.  Rex Grignon will go over his experience as Head of Character Animation at DreamWorks for more than 17 years as it pertains to creative collaboration between artist and director.  Starting with "the launch" we'll talk about preparations, listening, reflecting and the importance of a strong relationship.  Post-launch, he'll go over important skills such as:  presenting, confidence, pushing the limits and bringing your own ideas to the director.  At the end of the day, animation is collaboration, but it's important for artists to feel that they've "brought something to the table".  Rex will show you how he pushes his teams to get involved!Venue:George Brown College | Workshop Room (Room 004) | 51 Dockside Drive, Toronto

title: TEDxWayPublicLibrary
description:
Way Public Library is pleased to announce our inaugural TEDx event!  We 
believe that a library is an excellent forum for sharing ideas and 
gaining inspiration. Our mission in hosting a TEDx event is to get our 
community motivated.  The theme for the event is “A Community of Ideas” 
and we want to tap our community – local and national – for speakers and
 attendees who have ideas and inspiration!  The event will take place on Saturday, April 12th from 7:00 pm-10:00 pm.  Doors open at 6:15 pm.No refunds.  Tickets will not be sold at the door.T-shirt size not guaranteed if registering after March 28th.

title: Memory Ball Donations
description: Brought to you by Young People Against Alzheimer's (YPAA), Memory Ball promotes Alzheimer’s awareness and works to dispel the myths and stigmas related to Alzheimer’s disease.All proceeds from the event are donated to the Alzheimer Society of Toronto.For more information please visit www.memoryball.org

title: Absolutely Fabulous Women Awards
description: Absolutely Fabulous Women - Over Forty will be celebrating it's 2nd Annual event bringing together women from all walks of life who will be awarded for their great achievements and accomplishments in life and or in serving others. On March 8, 2015 we will be "Celebrating Life Over Forty" and will proudly present to you this year's group of 40 Women Over Forty from the Greater Toronto Area including Peel and Halton Regions to be awarded for their remarkable achievements and contributions to the community they serve. These women will be honoured for bringing inspiration and empowerment to others. The day will consist of Shopping with local vendors, enjoying a Light Lunch, being entertained by Professional Talent and finally are well deserving awardees at the Award Ceremony.Nominations Deadline: February 8, 2015email: AFWomenOverForty@gmail.com to request a Nomination Form

title: A Gala Screening of GIRL RISING to Benefit CARE
description:
CARE Canada and I Am Powerful Ottawa will be hosting a Gala Screening of Girl Rising, a powerful, innovative documentary that tells the extraordinary stories of amazing girls and their strength of spirit. This groundbreaking film delivers an unforgettable message of hope: Educate Girls and Change the World.
YOU ARE INVITED TO BE OUR DISTINGUISHED GUEST and to help us 
CHANGE THE WORLD ONE GIRL AT A TIME
Join CARE Canada, Juno Award winner Jully Black,
award winning producer Martha Adams from Girl Rising, world-renowned violin ensemble Stellae Borealis and hundreds of Canadians who want to make a difference our special gala screening of this extraordinary film.
February 24, 2014 at The Canadian Museum of Civilization100 Laurier Ave., Gatineau, QC  
6:00 to 7:00 P.M.      -   VIP Reception 
7:00 to 8:30 P.M.     -    Documentary screening 
8:30 to 9:00 P.M.     -    Discussion with Q&A
As CARE Canada’s guest, we are pleased to extend 2 complimentary non-transferable VIP tickets which you may easily book online or you may contact Rosemary at 613 228 5603 to make your reservation.Proceeds from this event will benefit CARE's project in Ethiopia which is making a difference in the lives of women, girls and their communities. I Am Powerful Ottawa has been supporting this project since 2012.

title: EUFF 2013: Eat Sleep Die
description:
Directed by Gabriela Pichler
Drama, 104 min
Language:  Swedish, Serbo-Croatian, Serbian
Cast: Nermina Lukač, Milan Dragisic, Jonathan Lampinen, Peter Fält

Ever wondered who packs the fresh plastic-sealed salad you are having for lunch?
Who the people losing their factory jobs in dead end small towns would be?
Ready for a visit to the “new” Sweden?
When the forceful young Muslim Swedish/Balkan“take-no-shit”factory worker, Raša, loses her job, she faces the system of unemployment. With no high school diploma, no job – but her boots deeply stained with the mud of the small town she grew up in – Raša finds herself on collision course with society.

title: Ratanak Dessert Night & Silent Auction
description:
Join us for the 2nd Annual Ratanak Dessert Night & Silent Auction on Saturday, November 30, 2013 from 6:30-9:00pm.

Enjoy an evening of live music, dessert, silent auctioning, and our Christmas market!
With special guest speaker Brian McConaghy who will be talking about the work of Ratanak International.

EVENT DETAILS
When:   Saturday, November 30, 2013 from 6:30-9:00pm (please bring your ticket for entrance)
Where:  Five Stones Church
        612 Columbia St
        New Westminster, BC 
        (See map below)  

Tickets are on sale from October 29 to November 29, 2013 at 5pm.

For purchases at the silent auction and Christmas market, please be prepared to pay with cash or credit card. Purchases will be receipted but are not eligible for tax receipts.
There will be a donation box, and all straight donations are eligible for a tax receipt.
Street parking is free after 6pm and there is a 24 hr parkade behind the building with charges of $1.25/ hour.

All proceeds from the silent auction and Christmas market are going to support the important work of Ratanak International, which is committed to addressing the needs of the poor and exploited of Cambodia. Our projects include rehabilitation for children rescued from brothels, trafficking prevention, and job skills training for former sex slaves. Together let's contribute hope and freedom from exploitation, abuse and poverty.

title: Youngblood presented by Death Row Meals
description:
Join Death Row Meals on 10.11.13 at 6PM at the historic Hot Stove Club at the Air Canada Centre for YOUNGBLOOD. Modeled after the 1986 "classic" featuring Rob Lowe, Patrick Swayze and Cynthia Gibb, this food will not disappoint, and will surely feature some classics updated by our very talented crew of chefs. 

You may remember this talent from the event we did at Keriwa Cafe in 2012, "First Meal, Last Meal", featuring some up and coming chefs from Toronto's kitchens. That event sold out very quickly, and was a very memorable one for us at DRM, so we have re-assembled this crew, and added a couple of new "Youngblood's" to the roster. 

A portion of the proceeds from this event will be donated to Right To Play, Canada. Right To Play is a global organization that uses the transformative power of play to educate and empower children facing adversity. It was founded in 2000 by Johann Olav Koss, a four-time Olympic gold medalist and social entrepreneur. Through sports and games, we help children build essential life skills and better futures, while driving social change in their communities with lasting impact.

Featured at YOUNGBLOOD will be:
Coulson Armstrong, Canoe Restaurant
Luca Gatti, Sanagans
Kevin Gilmour, The Drake Hotel
Trish Gill, The Dock Ellis
Kellen Crumb, The Hot Stove Club
Dennis Tay, Richmond Station
Farzam Fallah, Richmond Station

Menu details to be released soon.

Tickets once purchased are non-refundable.

title: Learn to Make Dumplings and Glass Noodle Salad
description: Greg Cooks is a casual cooking class with the aim of making cooking easy and social. This week we will be learning to make dumplings and glass noodle salad with our teacher Cindy Chan. Cindy has done quite a bit of food tourism, is passionate about cooking and, yes, makes delicious dumplings! We will be making two types of dumplings, pork and beef. I apologize in advance if this is not suitable for you, and I am open to all suggestions for future classes!

title: I Miss Saigon — Indochine with Greg Couillard
description:
Greg Couillard built an international reputation on his flair for combining the flavours of Toronto in unique and spectacular ways. Through his many groundbreaking restaurants like The Parrot, Stelle, Avec, Sarkis, The Spice Room and others, his prescient embrace of this city's multicultural influences and ingredients foreshadowed the eclectic, international menus we can now take for granted. It would not be hyperbole to suggest that Greg Couillard is one of the most influential chefs in Toronto's culinary history. 

For this dinner, Greg looks at Indochina, the French colonial presence in South East Asia, with a menu that combines Vietnamese flavours, French techniques with Greg's modern and idiosyncratic sensibility.

Vietnamese "Kraft Dinner"
One of Greg's signature dishes, this dish features fresh rice noodles in a rich green coconut curry and spinach sauce, topped with a 3-choi stir-fry. 

Saigon Short Ribs
Beef short ribs slow-braised in a glacé de veau spiked with black rice vinegar and ginger, alongside a wok-fried brown jasmine rice with colourful asian vegetable confetti and black sesame rice crackers.

Jackfruit Crème Brûlée 

The quintessential French dessert gets a Vietnamese update with exotic jackfruit.

$40 +HST
B.Y.O.B. — No corkage

Book your spot:

Learn more about The Rusholme Park Supper Club
http://thedepanneur.ca/supper-club/

Mix and mingle with some of Toronto's urban elite in one of the most chicest rooftop patio in Toronto.  Let's enjoy the hot summer patio nights where everyone is all dressed in white!  In the event of inclement weather we will be in the glass house of the patio. Don't delay purchase your tickets in advance.

The Spoke Club - 600 King Street West
$25.00 in advance
$30.00 at the door

Please purchase your ticket in advance

What is Cocktail Crawl Social Club?
If you are a Lifestyle Connoisseur, if you'd like to meet great quality people, if you enjoy great food and wine, and... if you can dress... join us!

Cocktail Crawl Social Club meets once a month at the most upscale locations for networking and socializing. Please e-mail us to be added to our mailing list, for upcoming events :
info (at)cocktailcrawl (dot)ca

So how do you get all these great people to join?
Word-of-mouth! Our friends introduced their friends who introduced their friends who brought you.

General Information
Meet and greet other upscale urban professionals from diverse backgrounds at some of the most exclusive lounges. We host monthly networking events thoroughout the year.

Social Media
Be sure to check us out on Facebook and Twitter. We also have just launched our very own Blog, check out all our suggested venues and trends. All past event photos are posted on our Facebook page.

title: Big Day Wedding Expo - FALL 2016
description: Your big day deserves the best. The Big Day Wedding Expo is Winnipeg's bi-annual luxury wedding expo experience. Spend time browsing beautiful booths, talk to top end wedding industry experts, enjoy fashion shows and be inspired by ideas for your big day.

title: Composting Workshop 9/24 Carlsbad Residents
description:

title: Pickling, Fermentation & Canning
description:
Preserve the summer harvest by learning how to can and pickle at home.As summer comes to an end, food preservation skills become even more valuable. By preserving food, you can stretch and store the harvest without spoiling or sacrificing quality, taste, or nutritional value. In fact, with many fermented foods, texture, taste, and nutritional value are all enhanced.Adding fermentation to your kitchen skills is not just good for your digestion, it is also good for the health of the environment. Preservation helps to reduce energy consumption, food waste, and resources. Join us to gain accessible and practical knowledge on preserving simple homegrown foods.In this workshop we will: 
Learn many methods of preservation like lacto-fermentation, refrigeration, dehydration, canning & more
Explore topics of sanitation, sugaring, sealing and simple recipes
Learn intensive and non-intensive pickling
Taste a few different preserved treats from winter, spring and summer
Each participant will take home 2 jars of freshly preserved goods!Instructor: Kerri CacciataCancellation Policy: We understand your plans may change. We will give you credit toward a future program if you cancel at least 24 hours in advance. Credit must be redeemed within 90 days of issue. To account for our preparation and our instructor's time, we cannot give refunds or credits if cancelled with less than 24-hours notice or in the event of a no-show.

title: CUBE Tech Fair
description: The new annual CUBE Tech Fair will showcase the pioneering and disruptive innovations and technologies resulting from the CUBE cooperations between startups and the industry throughout the year.

title: Sept. 14th Happy Falloween!!
description:
Oh my goodness, I can't even tell you how HAPPY I am that Fall is finally here!!!!!!  Football, leaves changing, layered clothes, boots, scarves, Halloween decorations pumpkins, cool nights-I LOVE it all!  The months of September-November boast the BEST decorations of the year in my opinion!  I would leave pumpkins out year-round!  So for this month's crafts, I have a few versatile projects that you can have out until Christmas.  Choose 1 or more but please plan for extra time in the craft cave for more!

Without further ado-the Happy Falloween craft projects!

Spooky & Nice Pumpkin Trio $12

Set of 3 reversible, rustic, wood pumpkins.  Approx. dimensions: SM 5.5"x3.5"x2", MD 7.5"x3.5"x2", LG 9.5"x3.5"x2".

Pretty Stacked Pumpkin Set $18

Set of 2 rustic, wood pumpkins.  Approx. dimensions: SM 6.5"x6"x3.5", LG 8"x8"x3.5.

Witchy Boots $10

Faux weathered wood painted picture.  Approx. dimensions: 10"x7".

Vintage His/Her Skull Pair $28

Set of 2 his/hers faux weathered wood painted & framed pictures.  Approx. dimensions each picture: 11.5"x8.5"

***This item is available as Her/Her or His/His upon request.  Please send it in the notes at checkout, email onceuponacraftutah@gmail.com or Facebook message the Once Upon A Craft Utah page.

Deco Mesh & Ribbon Table Centerpiece $45

Lots and lots of deco mesh and ribbon make this a FUN statement centerpiece for all your Halloween festivities!  Approx. dimensions: 26"x20"x10".

Witchy Deco Mesh Table Centerpiece $65

Add a witch hat and legs + sparky floral sprays to the deco mesh & ribbon table centerpiece for some witchy flair!  It's like she's relaxing in a bubbling cauldron of purple, orange and black!   Approx. dimensions: 26"x20"x10".

Deco Mesh & Ribbon Wreath $55

Made with 4 colors of deco mesh & lots of complimentary ribbon!  Add your own signage and put this over the top for fun!  Approx. dimensions: 26"x26"x10".

Witchy Deco Mesh Wreath $75

Add a darling plush witch hat and legs to your wreath!  Approx. dimensions: 26"x34".

Flying Witchy Deco Mesh Wreath $80

Every witch needs a pimped out ride, right?  Add a glittery or natural twig broom to the Witchy Deco Mesh Wreath.  Approx. dimensions: 30"x34"

**Side Note:  The black glittery witch broom is sold out with my supplier already!!  I can't even believe it!  I have 10 on hand and available so if this is the project you want, please don't delay in signing up.  Once they are gone, they are gone.  There is a natural twig broom available when these are gone.  If you prefer the natural twig broom, please say so in the notes at checkout.

title: Eguana Technologies Lab Tour
description: Eguana Technologies designs and manufactures intelligent power electronics for distributed smart grid and micro-grid applications. Our proprietary inverters seamlessly integrate with storage devices and renewable energy generators.This creates systems with uncompromised efficiency and reliability at unbeatable lifecycle costs. We provide power and control solutions for microgrids based on our Bidirex and Paralex energy storage and PV inverters that enable system integrators total flexibility as they develop modular building blocks and supervisory controls for these adaptive autonomous power systems. Eguana can help battery manufacturers, energy management software suppliers and other industry participants to get the most out of an energy storage system."The best way to predict the future is to create it." (Alan Kay)While we may not be able to predict the future, at Eguana Technologies we certainly are claiming a stake in creating it…and for the better of the world’s energy needs.

title: Official Paisley Park Tour VIP
description:
Paisley Park, Prince’s extraordinary private estate and production complex in Chanhassen, Minnesota, will open for daily public tours starting October 6, 2016. Fans will have the unprecedented opportunity to experience first-hand what it was like for Prince to create, produce and perform inside this private sanctuary and remarkable production complex.

Paisley Park tour tickets are only available in advance via online purchase and are NOT available for purchase at Paisley Park.  Ticket holders will only be permitted entry to the Paisley Park parking lot 20 minutes prior to their tour start time.  Ticket holders must depart within ten minutes following the completion of their tour.

Throughout the experience, visitors will see artifacts from Prince’s personal archives, including iconic concert wardrobe, awards (his seven GRAMMY® Awards, a Golden Globe Award, and an Academy Award® for the film “Purple Rain”), musical instruments, artwork, rare music and video recordings, concert memorabilia, automobiles and motorcycles.

title: The Crooked Cabaret of Curiosities
description:
Roll up! Roll up! For two nights only, on the 21st and 22nd October 2016, Crooked Tree Theatre will be transforming Brunel’s Grand Entrance Hall into their own cabaret of curiosities - a museum and showcase of theatrical and musical oddities. The walls will be lined with exhibits for the patrons to gawp at in horror and fascination before the show begins…and what a show we have for you!



Crooked Tree will be debuting a Grindhouse double-feature of punk theatre:

THE LYNCH MOB

A psycho-fag-trash-noir through the bible belt, accompanied by a jagged and diseased live score from Bridport Dagger!

&ETERNAL SHADE

 A twisted tale of love, death and drag in a Nazi Germany, featuring live songs from London Antifolkers David Cronenberg's Wife!



There'll also be collaborations with the mighty Men Diamler and Outsider Pop Pioneers Paul Hawkins & The Awkward Silences! Plus the warped death-country fusion of Bridport Dagger and Crooked Tree - The Rattlin' Caskets!

 And to top it all off, our headliner is the twisted mind behind discordant art-rock satirists Country Teasers, it's The rebel!*

Crooked Tree Theatre is dedicated to new writing, pitch-black humour and inexpensive theatre. By combining the DIY ethics of punk and the absurdity of Grindhouse cinema with experimental theatre, we seek to produce cheap, dark and funny work for those who feel disenfranchised and the alienated by most contemporary theatre. Or, put simply: we invite you to laugh along with us at the downfall of our species.The Crooked Cabaret Of Curiosities will be in town for two nights only! So be at the Brunel Museum on the 21st/22nd October!

*Due to a scheduling clash, The Rebel will only be playing Saturday the 22nd of Oct.


Get your tickets NOW for what promises to be an unforgettable evening of theatre, art and live music. Over 18s only. 

...something crooked this way comes...

title: Etgar Keret – event cancelled
description:
EVENT CANCELLED

Due to Etgar Keret being involved in a car accident last week, he regretfully had to cancel his appearances in Toronto and the Koffler Centre of the Arts. He was released from the hospital with a broken rib and fortunately no other serious injuries. However he is experiencing significant pain from the accident, and was ordered by his doctor not to travel. He sends his personal regrets as he was looking forward to joining us.

“I’ve waited for this event for a very long time and nothing short of a speeding limo driver and a broken rib could have me cancel it. I’m aching twice, because I’ve really wanted to be with all of you in what I’m sure would have been a special event. I do hope there will be another occasion soon.”— ETGAR KERET

title: Positive Parenting for a Happy Family
description: Discover how to use “The Force” of relationship and connection rather than getting pulled into “The Dark Side” of control and power. Get some new ideas about parenting and discipline that respect both your child’s needs and your own.This class focuses on early childhood needs, 3-9. We will look at our own stressors as parents, and develop options for increasing the level of cooperation and effectiveness without punishment or yelling (most of the time!).Plan on having dinner or a beer at the American Legion and make the evening a date!

Paisley Park, Prince’s extraordinary private estate and production complex in Chanhassen, Minnesota, will open for daily public tours starting October 6, 2016. Fans will have the unprecedented opportunity to experience first-hand what it was like for Prince to create, produce and perform inside this private sanctuary and remarkable production complex.

Paisley Park tour tickets are only available in advance via online purchase and are NOT available for purchase at Paisley Park.  Ticket holders will only be permitted entry to the Paisley Park parking lot 20 minutes prior to their tour start time.  Ticket holders must depart within ten minutes following the completion of their tour.

Throughout the experience, visitors will see artifacts from Prince’s personal archives, including iconic concert wardrobe, awards (his seven GRAMMY® Awards, a Golden Globe Award, and an Academy Award® for the film “Purple Rain”), musical instruments, artwork, rare music and video recordings, concert memorabilia, automobiles and motorcycles.

title: Puntero laser comprar barato professional
description:
Un equipo de científicos de la Universidad de Osaka ha proyectado el  laser comprar más poderoso del mundo, equivalente a 1.000 veces el consumo eléctrico mundial.

Los primeros láser se desarrollaron en los años 60, tras décadas de investigación. Fue Einstein quien los fundamentos para esta tecnología y con los años llegaron por goteo los experimentos. Sin embargo, después de las primeras aplicaciones exitosas, el láser se convirtió en una herramienta útil para procesos industriales e incluso para cosas tan cotidianas como leer un CD. Por supuesto la ciencia ficción escogió otros usos para los rayos láser. Especialmente famosas se han hecho las laser verde , como las que se exhibían en Star Wars, cañones láser y demás armas .

Y es que a la ciencia ficción le gustan los disparos, la acción y las tecnologías fabulosas que realmente serían un peligro para la Humanidad y, en general, para cualquier cosa viva. La ciencia (sin ficción) se ha centrado en aplicaciones más alejadas del ámbito militar. Sin embargo, esto no quiere decir que la tecnología láser no haya pasado por las manos de los ejércitos y sus unidades de investigación. Sin ir más lejos la marina estadounidense ha desarrollado un rayo láser capaz de incendiar objetivos en un abrir y cerrar de ojos, concentrando toda la energía en un punto. Ni siquiera se ve el haz: el objetivo se incendia y explota.

La capacidad destructora de esta arma parece descomunal. Su potencia es de 30 KW, es decir, 3.000 vatios. A pesar de todo es laser potente militar una cifra ridícula comparado con los vatios los que despliega el rayor láser más poderoso del mundo. Un equipo de investigadores de la Universidad de Osaka ha establecido el récord recientemente. Los ceros se pierden en el número y, si se reduce a siglas, nos perdemos en las siglas. Son 2 petavatios, lo que equivale a 2.000 billones (de los españoles) de vatios.

Esta es la potencia que despliega el comprar laser potente más poderoso del mundo. Para hacerse una idea (ligera) de lo que significa la cifra se puede decir que esta equivale a 1.000 veces el consumo eléctrico mundial. Sin embargo, la investigación de la Universidad de Osaka no está orientada a fines militares. También hay que destacar que este rayo láser únicamente tiene potencia para hacer funcionar un microondas durante dos segundos.

Rayo láser más poderoso del mundo



El truco está en que los investigadores japoneses han alcanzado esta potencia extrema concentrando el rayo láser en un tiempo mínimo. De esta forma, la potencia del haz se despliega solamente durante un picosegundo, otra medida desacostumbrada, que quiere decir la billonésima parte de un segundo. Algo que evidentemente no podemos imaginar, pero sí representar, concretamente la abreviatura de picosegundo es ps.

Para desplegar el rayo láser se ha utilizado una estructura llamada LFEX (Laser for Fast Ignition Experiments), cuya longitud es de 100 metros y que se terminó de construir a finales del pasado año. Los responsables del experimento no se quedan aquí. De dos petavatios pretenden pasar a diez petavatios de potencia en el futuro.

title: Stylust Beats - Sustain Sundays at Venue 578
description:
Sustain at Venue 578 is proud to present Stylust Beats.

Join us for live art, cirque performances, vendors, and more.

All AgesDoors at 8PMOpening acts: BOYGOLD and Sleep Madness

Come early for the Sunday Jam with free entry from 2PM-8PM and for $15 AYCD Bloody Mary's and Mimosas with proof of ticket purchase to the show.

Known for his sleeveless, whimsical synergy with the fans, Geoff “Stylust Beats” Reich has been creating his own counterculture since he was a teenager. A skate punk and hip-hop devotee, this groundbreaking DJ’s talent for fusing rap hooks and dubstep bass with multiple music genres has earned him the rep as a creative renegade carving his own path. With a style that captivates lovers of all music, the Canadian-bred San Francisco DJ has emerged as a frontrunner in the new wave of industry heavyweights. In a interview for MusicYouNeed.net, this stereophonic chameleon explains the method to his madness, “My goal is to make timeless bass music: I try to make every track an epic melodic adventure through many different genres.”With unabashed rebellion and seamless finesse, Stylust Beats captains this musical trip through uncharted waters on his new album, R.Y.F.S.O., released in Fall 2013 on the formidable bass label, Play Me Free Records. Weaving genres of trap, hip-hop, larger-than-life dubstep and sonic chill with stupefying synth work, R.Y.F.S.O. boasts a kaleidoscope of sound yet un-experienced in the market. Not far removed from his award-nominated Soundbwoy EP, Stylust is showing no sign of backing down from the innovative stylism that has earned him well over a million SoundCloud plays to date.Blending classic turntablism with cutting edge tech prowess, Geoff has been touring as DJ Stylust Beats since 2008. Stretching all over the United States, Canada and Costa Rica, he has headlined major festivals, including Shambala, Envision and Burning Man, to name a few. With the 2014 festival season already in full swing, this bass-slinging workhorse will be slaying dance floors across North America all summer long.Inspired by his older brother who was in a band, Stylust Beats began testing his musical mettle on the wheels of steel in 1998. His imaginative spins of counterintuitive genres were new territory back then, and he quickly gained fame as a fearless, party-rocking DJ reinventing the game. Within a couple of years, he took on the daunting challenge of producing and managing his own recording house, All-In Studios, which he ran successfully for ten years. This was the laboratory within which Stylust evolved from bass DJ to mad scientist, cutting his own brand of sonic mixology and perfecting his craft as prime-time producer.Sporting his first full-length album, R.Y.F.S.O., Stylust Beats is poised to rip the sleeves off the dubstep status quo, blazing a new trail of sound that will redefine the industry norms. But don’t be fooled by his rebel-without-a-care persona: with his own label, Sleeveless Records, Stylust is a consummate pro with a passion for his art form and global respect within his reach. Best described in his own words, just “Rip Yer F#*ckin’ Sleeves Off!”

title: Grand River Rendezvous
description:
We will gather on the banks of the Grand River to paddle sections of the Grand River Heritage Water Trail. The campground is still under construction but will be open just for our group. Paddlers can arrive at the campground on Friday and stay until Sunday. There will be an opportunity for those who paddle downstream as far as Eastmanville (68th St.) to set up a shuttle for getting back to the campground. The rendezvous is a free event since there will be no charge for camping. Those who ride the shuttle will be asked to donate $10 to help cover the cost of rental of the van.

Boynton Landing is also the base for the Grand Lady riverboat. There will be a Sunday afternoon cruise from 1:00 to 3:00 pm on the river for anyone interested. Cost for the cruise is $15.00 per person and can be paid at the door.

The Grand River Rendezvous is organized in partnership with the Lower Grand River Organization of Watersheds and the Ottawa County Parks and Recreation Department.

title: Fergus O'Byrne - An Evening of Traditional Music
description: Born in Dublin, Ireland, Fergus emigrated to Canada in 1967. While living in Toronto he became a founding member of the Irish folk band Ryan's Fancy. In 1971 the group moved to St. John's, Newfoundland. During the next fourteen years, Fergus toured extensively throughout North America and Ireland as part of the trio. As a member of Ryan's Fancy, Fergus has been featured on many television shows throughout his career including the very popular C.B.C. series Ryan's Fancy, which ran as a national series for five years and the Tommy Makem/Ryan’s Fancy show that was syndicated throughout Canada and various countries around the world. Since pursuing a solo career he has continued to appear on both television and radio. "Fergus O'Byrne weaves the fabric of Newfoundland's musical heritage with his songs, stories and vast knowledge of musical history and roots.  You can't help but to tap your feet or sing along."Bernadette Walsh, Special Projects Officer, Tourism St. John'sFor additional details - www.beyondtheoverpass.ca Twillingate Box Office (Anchor Inn) - 709-884-2777 or 1-800-450-3950e-mail - info@beyondtheoverpass.ca For complete box office details and cancellation policy, please click this link - Box Office.

description:

Join us on Friday, July 8th to a night of jokes and laughs in support

of our veterans and to remember our truly missed dear friend Robin Williams.

Partial proceeds to benefit the Volunteers of American Veterans Service.



 

About GIs of comedy: 

The GIs of Comedy is a comedic troupe of troops, who have taken their love of their country and brought it to the comedy stage. Quite simply, as the motto says, they're Standup Comics.

Radio funny man Adrian Cronauer (Robin Williams) is sent to Vietnam to bring a little comedy back into the lives of the soldiers. After setting up shop, Cronauer delights the G.I.s but shocks his superior officer, with his irreverent take on the war.

Reserve parking by calling 213.531.0588

title: Ann Arbor Women Grow July Networking Event
description: Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.Note: Tickets for the July event are pre-sale.  SPEAKER: TBD EVENT AGENDA8:00PM Check-in and Open Networking8:35 PM Feature Presentation: TBD  Also, UPDATES on Legal Issues!9:40 PM Open Networking 10:00 PM Meeting ConcludesF.A.Q.Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Street parking is not guaranteed, plan accordingly.Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash.Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.TWITTER TIPSA great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabis

title: Dinner with Saxon Brown Winemaker Jeff Gaffner
description:
You're invited to join Jeff Gaffner, owner and winemaker of Saxon Brown Wines, for and evening of food, wine and fun on Tuesday July 26th at 6pm.

Jeff began his winemaking career over 20 years ago with the famed Chateau St. Jean Winery in Sonoma. During his time with them, he was part of the winemaking team that produced the 1996 "Cinq Cepages", winner of Wine Spectator Magazine's 1999 Wine of the Year award.

In 1997, Jeff founded Saxon Brown to make wines from the very special vineyards he'd come to know in the Sonoma AVA. His wines include scintillating chardonnay and semillon, silky smooth pinot noir and classic Sonoma zinfandel. Production of each of Jeff's fine wines is very limited, usually only 200-300 cases per vintage. This is a wonderful opportunity to enjoy exclusive wines and chat with the always entertaining winemaker himself.

Jeff, our chefs and our sommelier have designed a sumptuous menu for your enjoyment. Each of the five courses will be paired with a remarkable Saxon Brown wine that is sure to please. All inclusive $75 per guest includes all 5 courses, tax and a 15% gratuity.

Welcome Course:

2012 Fighting Brothers Semillon

Smoked Tuna Tostada

First Course:

2012 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay, Sonoma

2012 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay, Carneros

Butter Poached Lobster / Foraged Greens / Citrus / Crispy Quinoa

Second Course:

2012 Sangiacomo Vineyard Roberts Road Block Pinot Noir

Cedar Planked Duck Confit / Grilled Peach / Mustard Greens

 Third Course:

2009 Parmalee Hill Owl Box Syrah

Elk Striploin / Boysenberry Reduction / Sweet Potato Puree / Wild Arugula / Goat Cheese

 Dessert Course:

2007 Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon

Cocoa Nib Coffee Beignets / Boysenberry Gelato / Mocha Sauce

Prerequisite: Get Happy Workshop 
Dive deeper on a second weekend with: 
• Two full sessions over 2 days    • More intensive techniques - a toolbox you can take home with you for life    • Practical wisdom to improve focus at work and harmony in relationships    • More interactive sessions 

This course builds upon and extends the experience of the techniques introduced in the Get Happy course, and includes a complete practice of Sudarshan Kriya®.  Sudarshan Kriya® is a powerful breathing technique that uses specific, natural rhythms to not only release stress at the deepest level, but also balance and integrate mind, body and heart. 
Please note that completion of all sessions of the Get Happy course is a prerequisite for attending the Get Happier course.

title: Drunk Restoration Comedy
description:
Did you miss us? Well we're back again! Join us on Friday, November 4th for more DRUNKRESTO!

******Has the lack of drunken actors performing in classic restoration comedies been leaving a hole in your life? Well never fear, because Random Access Theatre is happy to announce that we will be presenting a THREE MONTH EXTENSION run of DRUNK RESTORATION COMEDY!

Starting FRIDAY, OCTOBER 7TH, we're back, taking over The Player's Theatre Loft on the first Friday of each month at 10PM for some more uproarious old-fashioned fun. In case you missed the first edition back in September here's how it goes down. The premise: our team of brave (or just crazy?) artistic associate actors will perform a reading of a restoration comedy. The catch: they'll be doing so while heavily under the influence. Even better, this interactive evening will give audience members a chance to choose their own adventure and dictate which performers get totally sloshed and which are sent packing. Anything could happen, come find out what does!

Tickets are only $12 and include a complimentary drink*- beer, wine, or craft cocktail, which means one less drink that YOU have to purchase for the fun drinking games we have up our sleeve! Buy your tickets online here, we can't wait to spend our Friday nights getting drunk and doing theatre with you!

Line up of shows:


	December: A Christmas Carol
	January: The Country Wife, by William Wycherley

	*Fear not - there's plenty of liquid courage to go around. Drinks will be available throughout the performance. Each general admission ticket includes one complimentary beverage, event is 21+

description: Sketch Comedy Writing 101Dive head first into the wonderful world of sketch comedy! Whether you're a seasoned writer or someone who rarely picks up a pen, this class will teach how to get the funny ideas out of your head and onto the page. In this class we will examine the various types of sketches, learn how to generate funny ideas and then turn them into a sketches ready for the stage. title: OUT! Q613 Softball Tournament
description: When: Saturday, August 27th, 20169:00 am – 8:00 pmWhere: LaRoche Park Mechanicsville // Hintonburg52 Bayview Road (at Burnside Ave, north of Scott Street)http://bit.ly/1ZxLDQw♥first & foremost:we would like to acknowledge and honour that all of the work we do is currently being done on unceded Algonquin Territory that was never given up and never surrendered. Music, on-site BBQ, splash pad, fun and family friendly dry event. Everyone’s welcome! Bring your frenz, family, little one’s, parents, gaybours, snacks, a new date, end up on a date, a cooler of bevvies (non alchoholic of course!), blankets, sun tanning lotion, sunglasses… Whatever your queer little hearts desire <3 Prizes for the tops teams and Raffles Prizes TBAAccessibility note: Laroche Park is free & accessible! It’s located North of Scott St at Bayview Rd meets Burnside Avenue. You can take the O-Train or Transitway to Bayview Station & it’s a short walk away! Any bus to Hintonburg works too, you just need to walk down Bayview to find us! This is a Liberation Space:o We build community, we amplify & we pushbacko We are working towards inclusivityo We are working towards being critical & self-reflexiveo We are working towards self-determination & not just safetyo We work to deconstruct systems of oppression & violenceo We support people's choices & recognize these choices incontexts of constraintQueering613 collectively strives to create spaces that are free of as many barriers as possible as means to working towards liberation. This means that we are all responsible for creating the spaces we desire, by educating ourselves, each other and ensuring that we are continually engaging in these conversations and creating relationships of support and collective responsibility. While we recognize that no space is exclusively “safe” for anyone, we must collectively work towards mitigating harms. In response to certain experiences that have happened within our spaces, we have decided to remix ground rules to apply to a specific situation in which groups of people come together.

title: JQY Teen Pride Prom
description:
You are cordially invited to our 2nd Annual JQY-JCC Teen Pride Prom!



This year's theme is "Memory Lane"

Celebrate all your favorite memories from your past and make some amazing new ones!

Dance, shmooze, mingle, meet new people, eat, connect with old friends and have a blast!

This party is open to all LGBTQIA youth AND friends, family and straight allies.

So BRING ALL YOUR FRIENDS!

You must be UNDER 21 to attend.

Absolutely no alcohol or drugs will be tolerated.

$10 admission for a fabulous time!

You can pay with a credit card here, or choose "Buy At Door" to pay cash at the door.

If you can not pay the $10, don't worry! Just email Info@JQYouth.org and we can offer a subsidy.

All information from registration will remain confidential and private.

title: The HOOTENANNY! Tour | Moncton, NB
description: Tim & the Glory Boys are headed your way on their 2016-17 HOOTENANNY tour!Tim Neufeld (also of the band “STARFIELD”) is a multiple JUNO, Dove, and Covenant award winning Christian artist based out of Abbotsford, BC. He and the Glory Boys (A world-class Canadian bluegrass trio) have shared the stage on cross-Canada tours with artists such as Third Day, and most recently, his worshipfulness, Chris Tomlin. Now, starting September 2016, they’re hitting the road on their biggest headlining tour to date, bringing their ‘Worship Hoedown’ to your backyard!What is “Worship Hoedown” you ask?It’s a bluegrass inspired night of music and joy... beards, banjos, and blessings for the whole family! A night of corporate worship; with hymns, choruses, original songs, and comedy, geared towards all ages and denominations. It’s Baptists, Pentecostals, Catholics (and everything in between). It’s the local churches coming together to worship in unity, It’s a HOOTENANNY!

title: A Torontonian's Journey Through Coffee
description: Does the aroma of freshly ground coffee beans excite you? Do you survive on at least a cup a day from the nearest Starbucks and/or Timmies but looking for more? Learn about the process from seed to cup and understand the passion, technique, and thoughtfulness involved right here in Toronto, making every cup that meets your lips taste even better.

title: ​Shorts 3: Three of Cups
description: REGALKarissa Hahn2 min., 16mm, 2015, USA“from:  film (theater) to > youtube (home) > to film (theater)  torrented/pirated (digital) images as found footage....printed from a household printer onto 16mm clear film....  such as the loading dial, REGAL aims to circulate and find its way back to the screen.  Take this proxy and see that the ghost has become tangible.  informed largely by: Hito Steyerl's "In Defense of the Poor Image".” KHSavasanaBrandon Daley10 min., video, 2015, USA“A man in the midst of a midlife crisis attempts to sooth his existential concerns by practicing the age old art of yoga.” BDFrom beginings to beginingSimon Quéheillard10 min., video, 2015, France“The blow of a baton can give birth to a character. Objects loom before him brutally and without reason, revealed by a harsh and shadowless light. An endless series of catastrophes, From beginnings to beginnings follows the travels of a straw man without interiority or speech.” SQ4'33" 4:3Michael Wawzenek5 min., video, 2015, USA“After John Cage” MWImmortal Cats #1Scott Fitzpatrick1 min., video, 2015, Canada“What is your greatest ambition in life? Laser-printed onto recycled 35mm film in 2015.” SFRabbit Season Duck SeasonMichael Bell-Smith5 min., video, 2014, USA“A scene from the 1951 Warner Bros cartoon’s iconic encounter between the hunter, the rabbit, and the duck frames a web of tightly constructed sequences that move across various forms of video, including traditional animation, live action, and 3-D animation. A loose essay film, the video adopts a variety of tones and genres to touch upon themes of resistance, taste, the construction of meaning, and the exhaustion of choice” MBDiscontinuityLori Felker16 min., video, 2016, USA“Discontinuity highlights the unexpected fissures that can form between us, including the things that can fall in and get lost. When Tabitha returns “home” after a separation from her boyfriend, Stephen, what they've been missing becomes opaquely clear and who they're becoming makes it hard for them to see each other. Their disconnections are mirrored in the film’s approach to editing, its confusion of time and space, and a free-wheelin' clowder of cats.” LFChums From Across the VoidJim Finn17 min., video, 2015, USA“Little Radek, the step-dancing Bolshevik; Machera, the Andean Robin Hood, and Maria Spiridonova, the Russian socialist assassin are your guides for Past Leftist Life Regression therapy. In this third Inner Trotsky Child video, narrator Lois Severin— a former Trotskyite turned suburban housewife—attempts to radicalize the personal fulfillment and self-help scene. Like the Christian fundamentalist activists in the 1970’s who prepared the way for the Reagan Revolution, the Inner Trotsky Child movement was a way to cope “ JFBevSamy Burch & Alex Mechanik26 min., video, 2015, USA“The son of a serial killer goes to a trust workshop in Tampa, has nightmares.” SB,AM

title: An Evening with Coby Parker-Garcia
description: SORRY, THIS EVENT IS SOLD OUT!The Bottle Shop, Sierra Madre welcomes Coby Parker-Garcia, owner & winemaker of El Lugar Wines, San Luis Obispo CA.Join Coby and Gus for an intimate wine tasting of El Lugar's entire lineup of El Lugar's newest terroir driven releases. Coby has been making wine in the Central Coast since graduating from Cal Poly SLO in 2000. Coby is head winemaker at Claiborne & Churchill and has his own winery called El Lugar which means "the place" in Spanish. El Lugar produces 250 to 350 cases of Pinot Noir. Small lot, vineyard designate wines that reflect the terroir of the vineyards. We will be tasting the entire lineup of El Lugar Wines (including a white Pinot Noir) and grilling Santa Maria Style tri-tip to enjoy with Coby's wines. Don't miss this great kickoff to the summer season!El Lugar Pinot Noir Blanc Greengate Ranch & Vineyard, Edna Valley 2015   56 casesEl Lugar Pinot Noir Hawk's Roost Ranch, Russian River Valley 2013  169 casesEl Lugar Pinot Noir Rincon Vineyard, Arroyo Grande Valley 2014  97 casesEl Lugar Pinot Noir Bien Nacido Vineyard, Santa Maria Valley 2013 93 Points Wine Enthusiast Editors' Choice  164 cases Tickets for the tasting are limited and must be pre-purchased.  $30 per person includes tri-tip, all the fixins' and the El Lugar wine tasting.The Bottle Shop, 58 W Sierra Madre Blvd, Sierra Madre CA 91024 (626) 355-1262

title: wolvesmouth: taxa at MOCA // sat, jun 4 -SOLD OUT
description:
'Taxa' is wolvesmouth's new large-scale installation where food, music, and technology come together under the umbrella of art, to examine the precarious relationship between humans and nature.TICKET INFORMATION
Tickets are $225 per person (plus 3% credit card processing fee). The purchase of a ticket provides each ticket holder with entrance to the installation and a nine-course dinner prepared by the wolvesmouth team.
There are no limits on how many tickets you can purchase.
There are no refunds or exchanges for the tickets. All sales are final. This ticket is like a ticket to a concert, theater show, or sporting event.

Tickets can be transferred to another guest, but they cannot be resold beyond face value (which in many states is illegal and honestly, just not cool with us). If you do need to transfer your tickets to someone else, please make sure to let us know via email so that we can update your ticket with the new guest's information.
EVENT AND DINNER INFORMATION:
The installation is at The Geffen Contemporary at MOCA in Little Tokyo. 

The doors open for the installation promptly at the scheduled/ticketed time, with dinner starting soon thereafter. Please make sure to arrive 15 minutes before your event starts. Due to time constraints, we will have to start the dinner without you if you are late. 


In addition to the regular menu, we are also offering pescatarian and vegetarian dinner options. Please select your preference at check-out. Due to the nature of the installation, we are unable to accommodate any other dietary restrictions/substitutions. If you have any food allergies, please send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com after you purchase your tickets.
You are invited to bring your own beverages to drink and to share with others. Beverages will not be sold at the event. We will provide water, ice, and glassware.
Parking is available at the museum and costs $8/vehicle. 
OTHER NOTES:
No dress code. Wear what you are most comfortable in.
Taking photos is always ok with us.
If you have any questions, send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com
