title: Afternoon Tea & Mother's Day Homemade Gift-making!
description:
Whilst enjoying afternoon tea and snacks in Mamma Halbreich's Cozy Moroccan-style Casita, we will create beautiful homemade remedies that you can either keep for yourself, or gift to your mother just in time for Mother's Day (Sunday, May 8)!You will walk away with the following:

2 types of healing lip balms (coconut oil / vanilla + essential oil / shea butter)

Homemade sunscreen, just in time for summer! (shea butter, coconut oil, tea tree oil, zinc oxide)

Anti-wrinkle under-eye stick, for your mom or you! (meadowfoam seed oil, coconut oil, beeswax, shea butter, vitamin e oil, carrot seed oil, frankincense and lavender essential oils)

Anti-aging face cream (almond oil, coconut oil, beeswax, vitamin e oil, shea butter, essential oil of your choice - I will have quite a few to choose from!)

Miracle night cream (beeswax, coconut oil, almond oil, shea butter, vitamin e oil, aloe vera, local honey, bentonite clay, lemongrass essential oil)

A pouch of lavender tea (only the best, imported from Provence, France, lavender capital of the world)
I will have labels and gift-wrapping for you to go wild!Two options: If you will be in town on Saturday, May 7, please come join! For $25, you will enjoy afternoon tea (+snacks) and walk away with all of the homemade items listed above, beautifully gift-wrapped for yourself or your mother!
If you will not be in town on Saturday, May 7, but would still like to enjoy the items listed above, please select the second option: "Mail me the homemade goodness!" and email me the mailing address separately. Also let me know if you'd like for me to include a note :)
* Please note that the 2 options listed are the same price ($25) because for guests who attend, afternoon tea and snacks will be included, and for those who are not able to attend, but would still like the homemade items to be shipped (as a gift of for yourself), shipping costs are included.* It is also important to note: I'm not making any money off of this - The $25 is purely to cover the cost of your materials. The rest is a gift from my heart to yours! Just excited to gather my beautiful friends!

title: Too Late
description: Presented in 35mm!"The cohesiveness between the film's story and the style of its telling is remarkable and announces Hauck as an emerging talent." –  Mark Olsen, Los Angeles TimesPrivate investigator Mel Sampson (Academy Award nominee John Hawkes) is tasked with tracking down the whereabouts of a missing woman from his own past.  With this familiar setup, TOO LATE takes the spine of the classic private eye genre and tears it to pieces, weaving it back together into a tapestry of southern California and the menagerie of eccentric personalities and lost souls who inhabit it. From the desolate, overgrown Radio Hill to the ritzy penthouse of The Beverly Hilton, the film presents a sprawling view of Los Angeles that ranges from the undiscovered to the iconic.  Filmed in the 35mm Techniscope format, the story of TOO LATE unfolds across five acts, each comprised of a single 20-plus minute uncut shot – roughly the same length as an entire projected film reel – making TOO LATE the perfect vehicle for a 35mm exhibition resurgence.Written and directed by Dennis Hauck, and featuring an ensemble cast that includes Crystal Reed, Dash Mihok, Rider Strong, Helen Sadler, John Hawkes, Brett Jacobson, Christopher K. Johnson, Vail Bloom, Jeff Fahey, Robert Forster, Sydney Tamiia Poitier, and Dichen Lachman, TOO LATE tells the story of a missing woman, but paints the portrait of a lost man.Official Selection: LA Film Festival, Fantastic Fest, Beyond Fest, Raindance Film Festival, Oldenburg Film Festival, Hells Half Mile Film & Music FestivalFor more information visit: www.TooLateMovie.com

title: Google I/O Extended @Ticketmaster, Hollywood

If you can’t make it to the Shoreline Amphitheater in Mountain View, California then you should join us for the Google I/O Extended event at Ticketmaster.  The folks at Ticketmaster are focused on bringing the local developer community together with Hackathons, HackerX events, and now we are partnering to make this event occur at our Forum at the Ticketmaster Hollywood office. title: One Night Stand - Theater #4 (2nd Scr)
description:
(2ND SCREENING)One Night Stand – Genre: ComedyUnited States/2016/90 min.Directed by Alonzo AlcarazFeaturing a who's who of Chicago's Latino theater and stand-up scenes, including Yunuen Pardo, Juan Villa, Lorena Díaz, Gwen LaRoka, Wendy Mateo, and Eddie Martinez, Alonzo Alcaraz’s feature debut centers on Mo and Paulie, a couple disappointed with their current romantic prospects. Despite their initial disdain towards each other after a chance encounter at a bar, a stolen wallet and an angry bartender, Mo spends his night at Paulie's loft and gets to know her through shots of whiskey, laughter and tears. How will the night end for this unlikely duo?Con un reparto integrado por un quién es quién del teatro latino y la escena de stand-up de Chicago, incluyendo a Yunuen Pardo, Juan Villa, Lorena Díaz, Gwen LaRoka, Wendy Mateo, y Eddie Martinez, la ópera prima de Alonso Alcaraz se centra en Mo y Paulie, una pareja desaventurada en el amor. A pesar de su mutuo desdén después de un encuentro casual en un bar, una billetera robada y un camarero enojado, Mo pasa su noche en el apartamento de Paulie y la llega a conocer mejor a través de tragos de whisky, risas y lágrimas. ¿Cómo terminará la noche para este dúo improbable?
Shown with: Number 2: If I Were Marilyn / Número Dos: Si yo Fuera Marilyn

title: The Dudes: What Would The Jesus Do?
description: Easter and Shabbos are done... now what? WWTJD - What Would The Jesus Do?Come find out with The Dudes! The Dudes are bunch of guys who like to drink like dudes, talk dude things, and perfom dude comedy. They're multi-IMPROVAGEDDON champions and they have an oscillating fan for some reason.Don't miss a night of Dude-inspired comedy, with an appearance from a special, secret guest Dude(tte), and featuring the Cinderellas of the 3-on-3 Improv Tournament, The Cat Nips!The Dudes Improvasitional Comedy are:Rafael Adam PaineJames RoachMatt Cole Brian GarratyAnthony NoblesThe Dudes: What Would The Jesus Do?Saturday, April 2nd at 10pmTickets are $5The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street.--The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts. The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting and film production.Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Vegan Forest to Table w/ Sapsucker Maple Water
description: Forest to Table Vegan Tasting Menu Featuring Sapsucker Maple WaterMother nature's temperament reads like a bad telenovela: plus 10 degrees one day minus 5 the next which means some crops and producers have an interesting season ahead...Take Maple Syrup for example. Some southern Ontario sugarbushes began tapping trees weeks ahead of schedule meaning only time will tell if this will be an exceptionally long or short season for Canada's favourite sugar alternative.Inspired by our love of maple and spirited by sustainable foraged ingredients our last themed vegan supper club of the season (before the all-star) is a  Forest to Table dinner featuring Supsucker Maple Filtered Water, a naturally sweet water alternative tapped directly from Maple trees.MenuAmuse Course: Purple Potato Rosti with Black Garlic Purée, Charred Cipollini, Green Apricot & Sapsucker GastriqueIntroduction Course: Creamy "White Velvet" Soup, Turnip Root, Parsley Root and Cauliflower topped with Mizuna Leaf Oil and Crispy DulseSecond Course: Chicken of the Woods (mushroom) Pot Pie with Raw Vegetable and Endive Salad tossed in a Fermented Spruce Tip and SapsuckerVinaigretteMain Course: Sumac Crusted Sweet Potato-Maple Confit served with Charred Leek and Smoked Apple Grits, Heirloom Carrots and a Parsnip ChipDessert:  Wild Rhubarb and Sapsucker Custard Tart, topped with a Poached Marshall Plum, Sea Buckthorn Coulis and a Canadian Black Walnut + Hemp PizzelleCoffee, tea and Sapsucker Maple Water included.The event begins at 7pm and dinner will start at 7:20pm or when most of the guests have arrived.No alcohol will be served onsite; if you choose to bring wine/beer, don't drink and drive.Have a gift card or voucher you'd like to redeem? Give us a shout, send us an email at info@urbanacorn.ca or message us and we can process your tickets manually. IMPORTANT NOTES: Due to the nature of these events modifications for allergies are often not possible. If you have any allergies, please contact us before purchasing a ticket to discuss. Our facility processes dairy, eggs, wheat, shellfish, soy and other allergens; we employ stringent cross-contact practices to avoid any contamination. For more information on our practices please visit our website or send us an email at info@urbanacorn.ca to discuss. Supper Club tickets are final sale. Thank you{About Vegan Supper Clubs}We host a monthly themed Vegan Supper Club in our second level loft kitchen.What's a Supper Club you ask? Think of it as an informal dinner party meant to encourage guests to mingle, share and celebrate food. Events are 19+, complimentary sparkling and flat water will be provided. Here's a sneak peak of what to expect or check out our Supper Club Gallery.Are they always Vegan? Yes. We want people to feel included in the discussion around food, culture and the arts and feel making these events vegan will allow more guests to participate. We also do special Gluten-Free editions a few times a year.{About Urban Acorn LTD.}Just like an idea, acorns begin small with the hopes of becoming something big, strong and meaningful. This was the initial push behind Urban Acorn LTD. a Flexiatarian Catering company founded by Chef Daniel Holloway and his partner Marie Fitrion.Inspired by art, music, and using food as a dialogue for social change, Urban Acorn wants to encourage people to broaden their understanding of food and each other with the hopes of building stronger communities.Their mostly plant-based 'Flexitarian' approach to cuisine, allows them to seamlessly create menus to both omnivores and vegans. Their philosophy is simple, they believe food should unite, not divide people

title: Son of Saul
description: The debut feature by László Nemes is an absolutely outstanding depiction of a death camp in Auschwitz-Birkenau in 1944. The film follows a prisoner named Saul (Röhrig), a man who works in the camp in the industrial process of body disposal. He is a member of the Sonderkommando, which is a group of prisoners given humiliating tasks, with minor increases in food ration in return for them carrying bodies from the gas chambers to pyres to be burned, and then dumping the ashes. While working Saul finds the body of his son, and begins a search to find a rabbi in order to secretly give his son the burial he deserves.Son of Saul is a harrowing, heartbreaking film that is incredibly well acted by the entire cast, with specific kudos to Rörig’s pained depiction of Saul. This is a very intense dramatic watch, but it is so profoundly human that it is not to be missed.

title: Make It Build It Club - Age 7 Plus - Monster Zines
description: Join us for an afternoon of creativity for kids age 7 - 16. This workshop is going to specialise in making Monster themed Zines with a special guest - local Zine creator Tukru (assisted by Natasha Steer). Please bring any monster stories you have, stickers or pictures (but don't worry if you come empty handed!).A zine (/ˈziːn/zeen; an abbreviation of fanzine or magazine) is most commonly a small circulation self-published work of original or appropriated texts and images usually reproduced via photocopier.The club will take place at our workshop studio at our Nucleus Arts Centre on Wednesday 6th April between 2pm and 4pm.The venue has full disabled access and has disabled toilets located on site.

title: Laserblast presents: FUTURE COPS
description: HONG KONG'S DELIRIOUS FUSION OF THE TERMINATOR & STREET FIGHTER 2!FUTURE COPS (1993)DIR. WONG JINGCAST: Andy Lau, Aaron Kwok, Jackie Cheung, Simon Yam, Ekin Cheng, Chingmy Yau & Dickey Cheung"The best adaptation of Street Fighter to date.... Like taking the Hong Kong equivalent of the cast of Ocean's 11 and placing them in SUPER SMASH BROTHERS!" - TarsTarkas.net"In terms of visual dementia, Future Cops is utterly satisfying." - Richard Scheib, Moria.co.nzA team of hoverboard riding, laser-blasting Future Cops (comprised of three of the four Heavenly Kings of Canto-Pop Andy Lau, Jackie Cheung & Aaron Kwok) are sent to the past to protect a clutzy high school student (the memorably named Dicky Leung) who will soon grow up to be a formidable Future Judge. It’s a wild tale in which faces get smashed, hearts get broken and it VERY unofficially features a bunch of video game characters. If you have ever wished The Terminator was about Street Fighter 2 characters in a high school comedy, then you're probably writer/director Wong Jing, guilty of some of the most entertainingly trashy Hong Kong films to ever attack an audience’s eyeballs, and host to that special brand of eccentric madness that we at The Laser Blast Film Society love to celebrate. The story goes that Mr. Wong sought the rights to adapt the popular videogame Street Fighter 2, was denied (probably because Campcom read his script), and then went ahead with his production anyway, slyly changing all the characters names (Guile becomes Broom-Man, Honda becomes Toyata), but preserving their costumes and even their patented special moves! The end result ricochetes between nonsense comedy in the vein of Stephen Chow (complete with an easter-egg cameo from the comedian), an insane wire-fu beat ‘em up and even a romantic comedy subplot that features a meet-cute set in the world of the Super Mario Bros. Bless you Wong Jing; you crazy, crazy man. (Justin Decloux)Tickets are $10! ($8 if you snap them up online!)WONG JING TRIBUTE PRE-SHOW STARTS AT 7:30 PMFEATURE STARTS AT 8 PM

title: Gone. But Not Forgotten
description:
An Evening of Art and Action on Human Trafficking.
Betrayed: Portraits of Strength, a photo exhibit documenting human trafficking survivors, leads us into this evening of art and discussion tackling the global violence of human trade and exploitation. As the film feature, Reel Causes is thrilled to host the Vancouver premiere of Richie Metha's poignant drama Siddharth, based on the true story the of a man he met in India, searching for his missing 12 year old son. This event of art and action supports two organizations working with survivors locally: the West Coast Domestic Workers Association and the Children of the Street Society. After the film, they will join the artists and the audience for a discussion about taking action. Human trafficking is everywhere - even in our own community. You just might not see it.

title: Black & Gold Weaved Bracelet
description:
Class Description:We will make this beautiful bracelet from metal beads, monofilament, head pins, and jump rings. You will learn basic bead weaving, how to tie knots that won't slide or open, how to make loops in wire, and how to open and close jump rings. The finished product will be a very rich looking and comfortable bracelet that will spice up any outfit.
Skill level: BeginnerTechnique: BeadingBring to class:  Bead mat
Optivisors (magnifying eyewear), or very strong reading glasses
Instructors will have only a limited supply of tools to share; please bring all tools and any task light/magnifiers as required if you have.Kit Fee:  $15.00 payable directly to the instructor at the beginning of the class
Kit includes:  36 metal bead
100 gold plated seed beads
1 gold plated lobster clasp
6 headpins
3 jump rings
line 
Instructor:Leslie Lacombe -I have always loved handcrafted jewellery, so when I was looking for a second career I decided to study silversmithing in Mexico. It was an incredible experience – my passion was ignited, and I spent all my waking hours in the studio. After Mexico I was invited to teach at the ArtCenter/South Florida. I taught classes for 6 years, and I loved it. My studio was always bustling with students and customers.Now I’ve found a lovely home in Eugenia, Ontario, where I am working to create that bustling studio environment again – that dynamic energy that feeds our creative souls.BONUS:Get a FREE 3 Day Pass to The Gem Expo with your class registration!

title: How to Do an Intake for NCLegalClinic
description: This one-hour training* will be presented by Neighborhood Christian Legal Clinic's Director of Legal Services, Brian Dunkel, and will be beneficial to any volunteer attorney who is currently doing intake at one of the Clinic’s intake sites. This training is only for attorneys who are licensed to practice law in Indiana with the status of “active in good standing”. Participants will learn more about the Clinic’s vision for intake and how to do high-quality intakes on the most common legal issues that our low-income neighbors confront. Participants will gain a working knowledge of the Clinic’s “Intake Guide for Volunteer Attorneys.” This training would also be well-suited to volunteer attorneys interested in making a monthly commitment to do intake at one of the Clinic’s intake sites. Meals will be provided.*No CLE credit will be provided.

title: :: 100%Open Spring Union @ Applied Works ::
description:
*** LAST FEW PLACES! ***We are delighted to invite you to the 100%Open Spring Union on Wednesday 16th March, kindly hosted by Applied works at their lovely Hoxton Square headquarters.Our theme for 2016's first Union is ‘Next Generation Inspired’ with a range of speakers sharing interesting collaborations and innovations that have been designed and produced with, for, or by younger people.With our quickfire format of 5 slides / 5 minutes we have some fantastic open organisations such as Intel, Pop Up Parks, Canon and Apps for Good lined up to share experiences and find new collaborators. And with over 90 people registered already sign up now to secure your place!We very much hope you can join us and we look forward to seeing you on the 16th!Roland, David, Simone & the 100%Open Team What is the Union Network?Union is an exclusive network of innovation and venturing professionals from across all sectors who believe that collaboration and partnerships are key to the development of future products and services.  As a peer practitioner network, Union brings together those responsible for innovation within multinational companies, charities and government organisations, to learn from each other, share ideas and inspiration, and build new partnerships.Originally conceived in 2008 by Oracle and 100%Open, we meet quarterly in London and Geneva, hosted in different locations.  Union meet-ups are inspirational yet informal gatherings, where we encourage members to collaborate and compare notes with similar professionals from different backgrounds in a social setting with the purpose of creating value through contacts.Joining Union is free, yet valuable and over the past 5 years, the network has sparked a whole series of collaborations valued at in excess of $75m through the creation of projects, the transfer of knowledge and the mutual recommendation of new technologies, techniques and innovative business partners.
Check out our short film below to get a taste of what Union offers and you can also join the Union Online Community to keep in touch in between events.

title: Salon West & Tafelmusik: Is classical a problem?
description: Join us on March 23rd for a performance and chat with friends from Tafelmusik Baroque Orchestra and Chamber Choir. We'll kick off the evening with a performance from Julia Wedman a violinist from one of the world's best Baroque orchestras and then sit down with their new Managing Director William Norris. William is new on the Toronto arts scene and comes to us from the UK where he served as Communications and Creative Programming Director for the Orchestra of the Age of Enlightenment. He's dedicated to pushing the boundaries of the art to attract new audiences and we're dedicated to pushing our arts leadership to do more for our city. Come for the music and stay for the fireworks at the salon.Doors open 6:30pmPerformance and talk: 7pmSocial: 8pmEarly bird tickets 20$, Regular 25$ and as always include refreshments and exclusive access to the Spoke Club art gallery and social spaces.

title: The Freedom Festival 2016
description: Held every year in March, The Freedom Festival is an amazing weekend for anyone who cares about freedom and liberty. You will be able to play an active part in discussions and debates about the big political, economic and moral issues of the day.  Over the weekend those who attend rub shoulders with some of the most inspirational pro-freedom speakers from across the UK and overseas, including writers, politicians, academics, journalists, economists and philosophers.All this takes place in the relaxed, seaside atmosphere of sunny Bournemouth. With everything happening under one roof at the Marsham Court Hotel, on the seafront, there is always lots of time for drinking, socialising and networking with fellow freedom-lovers throughout the weekend.Organised by The Freedom Association, it is always a weekend to remember.

title: wolvesmouth: taxa at MOCA // sat, apr 2 - SOLD OUT
description:
'Taxa' is wolvesmouth's new large-scale installation where food, music, and technology come together under the umbrella of art, to examine the precarious relationship between humans and nature.TICKET INFORMATION
Tickets are $225 per person (plus 3% credit card processing fee). The purchase of a ticket provides each ticket holder with entrance to the installation and a nine-course dinner prepared by the wolvesmouth team.
There are no limits on how many tickets you can purchase.
There are no refunds or exchanges for the tickets. All sales are final. This ticket is like a ticket to a concert, theater show, or sporting event.

Tickets can be transferred to another guest, but they cannot be resold beyond face value (which in many states is illegal and honestly, just not cool with us). If you do need to transfer your tickets to someone else, please make sure to let us know via email so that we can update your ticket with the new guest's information.
EVENT AND DINNER INFORMATION:
The installation is at the Geffen Contemporary at MOCA in Little Tokyo. 

The doors open for the installation promptly at the scheduled/ticketed time, with dinner starting soon thereafter. Please make sure to arrive 15 minutes before your event starts. We will start with or without you.


In addition to the regular menu, we are also offering pescatarian and vegetarian dinner options. Please select your preference at check-out. Due to the nature of the installation, we are unable to accommodate any other dietary restrictions/substitutions. If you have any food allergies, please send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com after you purchase your tickets.
You are invited to bring your own beverages to drink and to share with others. Beverages will not be sold at the event. We will provide water, ice, and glassware.
Parking is available at the museum and costs $8/vehicle. 
OTHER NOTES:
No dress code. Wear what you are most comfortable in.
Taking photos is always ok with us.
If you have any questions, send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com

title: Revolutionary Love: London
description:
Revolutionary LoveAn Energy Mastery WorkshopLEE HARRISwith Meg Fenwick & Steven WashingtonThe weekend when everything changes for the better...An inner revolution happens when the wounds of the past are finally transformed into gold.  When you are no longer held back from love by old disappointments,  doubts, and fears, your whole life begins to crackle and sparkle with  new energy. When you come face to face with the truth of who you really  are—someone infinitely worthy of love and destined for it—you begin to  breathe more deeply than ever before.You become a magnet—unable  to push away the closeness, tenderness, and intimate connection that  WILL transform every part of your life. Physical health, emotional  well-being, work, finances, family, creative self-expression, life  purpose—all of these areas and more are infused with new vision and  possibility.In a container of great safety, warmth, and humor,  join renowned energy intuitive and relationship mentor Lee Harris, along  with his extraordinary co-facilitators, for a weekend of unexpected and  unimagined magic and change.  WHO THIS WORKSHOP IS FOR…  Whether you are single, in the developmental stages of a relationship,  in a long-term partnership, seeking to bridge the divide in a  relationship, or at any other place along the path of loving, this  workshop will offer uplifting new insights, powerful communication  skills, and the warming light of hope cast over all your relations.  For those already familiar with Lee’s Energy Mastery Retreats,  Revolutionary Love represents the evolution of that profound body of  work—energy mastery applied to loving others and oneself. 
Highlights of the process include:

The 3 keys to life-changing intimacy — mastering communication, boundaries, and the art of openness

The gift of conflict — learning how to break through rather than blow up

The energy of sex — opening to the joy and empowerment of the erotic force.Special note:  We will be approaching this topic from an energetic and emotional  understanding, and with the utmost care, safety, and respect for the  boundaries of each individual and the group as a whole. There will be no  nudity or sexually explicit exercises.


The miracle of self-love — discovering the healing power of being enough

Learn  how to transform the inverted energies that keep relationship patterns  in place. If there is a past relationship you can't get over; a fear  that blocks you from taking risks in love; or shame and self-judgment  that hold you back, deep relief and freedom are your next destination  points along the journey.LEE HARRISLee  Harris is a gifted energy intuitive, author, and teacher. Leading a  vibrant online community, Lee reaches over 100,000 people around the  planet every month. His monthly Energy Forecasts, broadcast on YouTube,  have received over 2 million views to date and offer practical guidance  for navigating daily life with clarity and optimism. With his profound  understanding of the energetics of emotions, Lee’s private clients and  retreat participants report life-changing shifts as they discover and  clam who they are here to be. His events, held around the globe, are  adventures into the deepest aspects of living, loving, and awakening.  Lee is the author of Energy Speaks – Volumes One and Two, producer of more than ninety transformational audio and video recordings, and an accomplished singer-songwriter.MEG FENWICKMeg  Fenwick is an innovative relationship and sex therapist with a vibrant  background as a theatre artist. She combines theatre and sexual energy  to create a highly effective and enjoyable approach to loving and being  loved. Meg studied with Gay and Kathlyn Hendricks, achieving the  master’s level in their renowned Conscious Loving Advanced Training. Meg  has also studied with Barbara Carellas, completing the Urban Tantra  professional training. With great humor and insight, Meg brings her  years of experience working with couples and groups to put people at  ease with even the most taboo areas and to discover the joy of their  sexual self.STEVEN WASHINGTONSteven  Washington is a Pilates trainer and certified Advanced Neuromuscular  Massage Therapist. A true body master, Steven began to integrate fitness  and bodywork into his own self-care regimen during an illustrious  20-year dance career. Earning an exceptional arts education at NYU's  Tisch School of the Arts, Steven’s greatest artistic achievement was to  be a part of the Broadway cast of Disney's The Lion King. Through a  devoted practice of awareness and presence, Steven’s work today includes  supporting individuals and couples to access the deep, inner vitality  that reduces stress and sustains loving relationships.

title: Children's Shorts Block

For  questions please email info@collinsvillefilmfestival.com, visit  www.collinsvillefilmfestival.com or call our office at 631.678.8302*Subject to Change*

title: Memory Care: Embracing the Journey
description: This course explores the world of dementia and what it means to live in the moment. Students will learn about the 10 warning signs of Alzheimer’s disease, the difference between dementia and Alzheimer’s disease, the physical changes that take place in the brain, and the need for sensitivity throughout the aging process. It aims to prepare students for difficult interactions with those diagnosed with a neurocognitive disorder. Students will participate in hands-on experiences throughout this course. This workshop will be led by Jennifer Holcomb, Director of Memory Support at The Brethren Home, Cross Keys Village. She will also lead a second workshop called Memory Care: Life With Purpose on July 25, 2016. Attendance at both is helpful but not required.

title: "A Better Life" with Filmmaker Chris Johnson
description: Filmmaker Chris Johnson will be in attendance for a screening of his documentary "A Better Life: An Exploration of Joy & Meaning in a World Without God." View the full trailer at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vEJXD6r9d78. "If this is the only life we have, how does that affect how we live our lives, how we treat each other, and cope with death. As a follow-up to one of Kickstarter's most successful publishing projects, photographer and filmmaker Chris Johnson introduces us to some of the many voices from his book. In this fascinating documentary - learn the stories behind the book in interviews with some of our greatest thinkers. Join Chris as he explores issues of joy & meaning and travels around the globe meeting people from all walks of life and backgrounds who challenge the false stereotypes of atheists as immoral and evil. From Daniel Dennett and A.C. Grayling, to Julia Sweeney and Robert Llewellyn -learn the various ways many atheists have left religion to a better life filled with love, compassion, hope, and wonder!"This event is sponsored by the Tri-City Freethinkers, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit community outreach organization serving the religion-free population of the Tri-Cities metropolitan area by bringing nonreligious community members together for support, education, and advocacy.

title: Queens OSHA 10 Construction  - $119
description:
Queens OSHA 10 Construction Safety Class
Every Weekend
only $119

Earn you OSHA 10 Construction card for only $130: You cannot work on a major construction site in New York City without this card. Take this engaging safety class and be qualified to work on Monday.

Expert, entertaining OSHA Outreach Trainer who has more than two decades of construction industry and safety industry experience and expertise. This is a LEGITIMATE, authorized OSHA outreach trainer. See David Rogers' profile on the official OSHA site for authorized trainers, www.OutreachTrainers.org

Class ScheduleSchedule: Saturday and Sunday, 9:00 AM - 3:00 PMPrice: $119 online, $130 at the door1031 44th DriveLong Island City, NY 11101(7, E, M, or G to Court Square)
Walk-ins Welcome  -  No Pre-Registration Required
New York Safety and Training, Inc.A Veteran owned business. Ask about our discount pricing for U.S. military veterans.

LIKE us on Facebook: www.Facebook.com/NYSafetyandTraining

Visit our website: www.NYSafetyandTraining.com



New York City Department of Buildings mandates that all workers at major construction sites must have had the OSHA 10-hour Construction Industry safety class within the last five years. DOB inspectors regularly visit job sites to check for OSHA cards, and any laborer without an OSHA card will be ejected from the job. Taking this course helps students to remain safety compliant and maintain their current employment or to become safety compliant as a first step towards qualifying to be hired in the construction field.

OSHA 10-Hour Construction Industry -- Designated Training TopicsThis training program is intended to provide entry level construction workers information about their rights, employer responsibilities, and how to file a complaint as well as how to identify, abate, avoid, and prevent job related hazards on a job site. The training covers a variety of construction industry safety and health hazards which a worker may encounter. Training will emphasize hazard identification, avoidance, control, and prevention, not OSHA standards. OSHA mandates that the 10 hours of training be broken into 7 hours of mandatory topics, 2 hours of elective topics, and 1 hour of optional topics as follows:

Mandatory - 7 hoursIntroduction to OSHA -- 2 hoursCovers workers' rights, employer responsibilities, and how to file a complaint. It includes helpful worker safety and health resources. It also provides samples of a weekly fatality and 3 catastrophe report, material data safety sheet, and the OSHA Log of Work-Related Injuries and Illnesses.

Fall Hazards in Construction - 1.25 hoursCovers fall protection and related fall hazards encountered on construction sites, including how to remain safe and the proper techniques to establish fall protection.

Electrical Hazards in Construction -- 1 hourCovers electrical hazards and the dangers involved with working with electrical equipment and circuitry within the construction field.

Struck By Hazards in Construction -- 1 hourCovers hazards on construction jobsites that relate to falling and flying objects including vehicular strikes. Emphasis is placed on recognizing the hazard and avoiding the hazard.

Caught-In-Between Hazards in Construction -- 1 hourIncludes hazard awareness of trench collapse, machine guarding, and entrapment situations where workers can be caught in operating machinery or pinched between opposing objects.

Personal Protective Equipment -- 1/2 hourCovers the proper, effective use of personal protective equipment (such as hearing protection, safety goggles, and gloves), including statistics of injuries related to the failure to properly use personal protective equipment.

Hazard Communication, Health Hazards, and Silica-- 1 hourCovers the proper way to label and catalogue hazardous materials and chemicals, such as cleaners, solvents, and paint, and how to avoid chronic exposure to hazardous substances including silica.

Elective - 2 hours The instructor will teach two to four of the following topics: Scaffold Hazard AwarenessThis topic covers scaffold hazards including falls, improper usage, improper erection, and the various safety systems to keep workers safe while using scaffolds.

Trench and Excavation HazardsExcavation and trenching are among the most hazardous construction operations. This topic introduces learners to the hazards of trench and excavation safety as it is encountered in the construction process.

Confined Space Hazard IntroductionIntroductory Hazard Training that refers to an area which is enclosed with limited access which makes it dangerous. Hazards in a confined space often include suffocation by un-breathable gases which may be present but not visible or submersion in liquids or free-flowing granular solids.

Ladder SafetyLadder Hazard awareness, including how to properly select, use, and maintain ladders to ensure construction site hazards are minimized.

Respiratory ProtectionThis topic covers the dangers associated with potential exposure to pathogenic airborne contaminants that can cause acute and chronic diseases among construction workers.

ErgonomicsThis topic teaches how the use of Ergonomics, which is fitting a job to a person, helps lessen muscle fatigue, increase productivity, and reduce the number and severity of work-related musculoskeletal disorders.

Safety and Health ProgramThis topic teaches considerations for creating, implementing, and enforcing your own workplace Safety and Health Programs.

Optional - 1 hour There is also an hour reserved for optional safety training. We can tailor an additional topic to a specific client (such as water safety if the client is a school with a swimming pool), or what most often happens is this hour is reserved for any of the previous topics that the students are particularly engaged in and want to spend more than the allotted time on. It is often helpful for the instructor to have this hour at his or her disposal to be able to devote to any topic in which the students are especially engaged.

title: Santa Ana Winds FC VS Coras de Tepic
description: Santa Ana Winds FC now know as Winds FC will be taking on Deportivo Tepic F.C. commonly known as Coras de Tepic in a friendly match at Santa Ana College. Winds FC is a soccer team founded in Santa Ana, California. The team was established in 2011 and played in the National Premier Soccer League West-Southern Conference. We are looking to launch our professional platform as well as our youth development program to set a real foundation for soccer culture in the City of Santa Ana. Our Semi-Professional Team, Winds FC is the only team in the Orange County area to participate at any semi-professional or professional club level in 2011-12. Coras de Tepic is a football club that plays in the Mexican football league system Mexican Ascenso MX (second-tier). The club was founded in the late 1950s and currently plays in Tepic, Nayarit,Mexico.

title: KidProv at the Push Comedy Theater
description:
Don't miss out on the fun!!! Sign up your kids, grand kids, nieces, nephews, even the stinky neighbor kid from down the street for KidProv at the Push Comedy Theater.

This class is open to children ages 7 to 12. Students will explore the key elements of both long and short form improvisation. The children will play numerous improv games which will serve to develop and enhance their public-speaking, social and team-building skills.

This class will be conducted in a non-judgmental environment where the students will build confidence, make friends and most importantly ... have fun

The session concludes with the students performing in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater Stage.

This class will be held from 1:00pm-3:00pm on Sunday afternoons September 25th, October 2nd, October 9th, October 16th, October 23rd and October 30th, with a graduation show on the Push Theater stage October 30th at 3:30pm

This is class is $150 for new students and $140 for returning students.

 New students also receive a free tshirt.

---

Mary and Jim Veverka collectively have over eight years experience studying and performing improv. Mary, a former children's librarian, has been a professional storyteller for 20+ years. During that time, Jim assisted Mary by playing a variety of characters at holiday events. Prior to moving to the Hampton Roads area, Mary was selected as an adjudicated artist by the Indiana Arts Commission. Mary has also taught storytelling to adults and children of all ages at schools, libraries and other venues.

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For nearly ten years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. This fall they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

--

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts. The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting and film production.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: 'Painted Land' + Filmmakers in Attendance
description: ** IN PERSON FILMMAKER Q&A on NOVEMBER 14: **Producers Nancy Lang and Peter Raymont will be in attendance for the Saturday November 14 at 1pm & 4pm screenings! “The most important thing a painter can do is find a good place to sit.” – J.E.H. MacDonaldMore information about this film & event on: The Screening Room's website.ABOUT THE FILM:DocumentaryRunning time: 90 minutesCanadaRated NR (not rated)Produced by Peter Raymont, Nancy Lang and Phyllis EllisDirected by Phyllis EllisFrom the producers of West Wind: The Vision of Tom Thompson.Synopsis:  One would think The Group of Seven needs no introduction. One hundred years since the creation of Canada’s most iconic paintings, through their works have been seen by millions, little is known about the artists themselves. Why did they choose locations in the remote, rugged wilderness of northern Ontario? Does anyone know precisely where they went?Past meets present creating a film that is evocative in approach, energized by breathtaking cinematography and sound design and offers a new and articulate voice to the artists who were the Group of Seven. Their journey informs our story throughout the film.Painted Land weaves seamlessly the experiences and history of these artists – Lawren Harris, J.E.H. MacDonald, AY Jackson, Frank Johnston, Arthur Lismer, Franklin Carmichael and AJ Casson – with the adventures of three modern day sleuths, historian Michael Burtch, and the writer and photographer team of Gary and Joanie McGuffin, who are determined to track down the precise locations of these famous paintings.Archival film, letters, journals and photographs of the artists – some of which have never been seen in public – take the viewers back in time. Stunning cinematography woven together with the artist’s paintings takes viewers up mountains, down canyons, to rivers and over portages with our trio, as they try to achieve their own personal quest: to actually ‘walk in the artist’s footsteps’? “A must for Group of Seven fans, and a true eye-opener for those who only know a few of the gang’s iconic Canadian paintings” -The Georgia Straight

title: Life! Who Knew? – Songs of Broadway
description: SPECIAL ENCORE PERFORMANCES! Direct from Michael Feinstein’s “54 Below” Club, it's Life! Who Knew? – Songs of Broadway, starring Lisa Rothauser. Special guest comedian Frank Licari.Life doesn’t always go according to plan. Few people know it better than St. Louis native and Broadway actress and singer (The Producers, The Vote Orange) Lisa Rothauser. Now Ms. Rothauser brings her hilarious insight, along with her critically lauded voice, in an original production LIFE! WHO KNEW? to South Florida at The Palm Beaches Theatre. Featuring musical direction from Grammy-nominated producer/songwriter Tor Hyams, Lisa Rothauser and an 8-piece band return to the stage January 14 - 17, 2016 following a week of sold-out shows in November. Also appearing will be Frank Licari, one of South Florida's hottest comedians.   Lisa Rothauser grew up with a passion for singing and a love of showbiz. She broke away from small town life and made it to the bright lights of Broadway only to be swept away to the ‘burbs by the man of her mother’s dreams. Who knew? Ready for a change, Lisa sent the husband packing, dropped the kids off at school, and headed straight back to Broadway. Join her on the hilarious and inspiring musical transformation from Broadway performer to Stepford wife and back again. Coming from sold-out performances at the 54 Below Theatre in NYC, where it was hailed: “There is no question that Lisa’s voice is sensational. It was simply stunning.” -Times Square Chronicles, and “It’s raw. It’s real. It’s the story of the human experience.” –Broadway World, LIFE. WHO KNEW? takes the stage at The Palm Beaches Theater January 14 - 17, 2016. Show times are Thursday, January 14 at 7 pm; Friday, January 15 at 7 pm; Saturday, January 16 at 7 pm; and Sunday, January 17 at 7 pm. Tickets are $49.

title: After Hours Tour and Party Eldridge Street Museum
description: Following up our summer cocktail party with the Museum at Eldridge Street, which featured a Secrets of the Lower East Side tour and after hours exploration of the stunning Eldridge Street synagogue, we're partnering up with the organization again for the Untapped Cities holiday party. On Wednesday, December 9th, take a Secrets of the Eldridge Street Synagogue tour of the landmark sanctuary after hours and enjoy a wine reception.We'll share historical secrets of our century old synagogue and point out some of the building's most surprising architectural details. And to celebrate the Jewish Festival of Lights, we'll point out the building's dazzling lighting features, provide latkes, jelly donuts and other traditional holiday goodies, and light a menorah marking the fourth day of the holiday!

title: Improving Electronic Services
description: With the proliferation of mobile apps and the “Uberization” of consumer services, Canadians want government services that are digital, easy-to-use, and at their fingertips. This session will explore how behavioural economics can increase uptake of online services and improve service design and delivery.  Speakers: Frank Vermaeten (CRA), Urvashi Dhawan-Biswal (ESDC), Amira Chouieki (White House)--À la lumière de la prolifération des applications mobiles et de l’ « uberisation » des services aux clients, les Canadiens veulent obtenir des services gouvernementaux numériques, faciles à utiliser et au bout des doigts. Cette session examine l’économie comportementale et la façon dont elle peut accroître l’utilisation de services en ligne et améliorer la conception et la prestation des services.Conférenciers : Frank Vermaeten (ARC), Urvashi Dhawan-Biswal (EDSC), Amira Chouieki (Maison Blanche)

title: Hauntings: Dispelling the Ghosts Who Run Our Lives
description: Lecture and Book Signing by Noted Analyst and Author James Hollis, PhDOur ancestors believed in ghosts, and perhaps they were not far off the mark as so much of daily life is driven by invisible psychic forces, archaic agendas, and imperious admonitions and prohibitions, all the more powerful because they operate unconsciously.  What are the features of such “hauntings,” and how might we gain some further foothold on a more conscious conduct of life?The lecture will explore the concept of personal hauntings. The role of the unconscious in the conduct of daily life will be examined. The significance of “complex” theory as a useful tool for self-examination and psychotherapy will be presented and means of identifying complexes through dream work and pattern analysis discussed. We will work towards enlarging participants’ sense of the many arenas in which energies and concomitant messages from the past direct and contaminate present choices.James Hollis, PhD, is a Jungian analyst, Executive Director of the Jung Society of Washington, and a co-founder of the Philadelphia Jung Institute.  He has written 14 books which are translated into 19 foreign languages.  He is a retired Professor of Humanitites, and presently a Professor of Jungian Psychology for Saybrook Graduate School of San Francisco.  He regularly teaches in the Washington area and has spoken to over one thousand groups on four continents over the past twenty years.Discounted parking available for lots at 1845 Walnut St. and 2101 Chestnut St.Continuing education credit is available for degreed mental health professionals. NBCC CE certificate:  $10 (by cash or check at the event) The Philadelphia Association of Jungian Analysts (PAJA) has been approved by NBCC as an Approved Continuing Education Provider, ACEP number 6671. Programs that do not qualify for NBCC credit are clearly identified. PAJA is solely responsible for all aspects of the program.

title: Ashton Michael - LAFW - S/S 2016 RSVP
description: ASHTON MICHAEL - LA Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2016Born and raised in Los Angeles, Hirota made his debut on the fashion scene at the age of 19. He started his first company GLAZA only 2 quarters into attending F.I.D.M in 2002. His first showing in LA Fashion Week resulted in being picked up by destination stores including Patricia Fields NYC, Fred Segal LA, and Volcan & Aphrodite in Tokyo. A decade later Hirota continues his progressive movement with his current company Ashton Michael. Offering exclusive capsule collections available around the globe, wardrobe styling and custom one-of-a-kind pieces combined with artistic vision and a true understanding of fit and fabrication, Hirota creates empowering pieces that test the time not challenged by seasons. Ashton Michael combines goth-grunge with glamour edge and fine tailoring for the all the fashion fearless.If you have watched the Super Bowl, VMA’s, AMA’s or any award show video in the past 12 years you’ve most likely seen the work of fashion designer Ashton Hirota and his label Ashton Michael. Featured on clients ranging from icons of Hollywood to chart topping musicians, Hirota has designed custom pieces for celebrities as diverse as Cher, Will.i.am, Usher, JLO, Chris Brown, Janelle Monae, Miguel, Ciara, and Pitbull just to name a few. Today in addition to designing and producing his own Ashton Michael Label, Hirota is sought out by top stylist for his ability to create fashion forward leather pieces individualized for every clients personality with one of the industries quickest turn around times available. Hirota is a strong believer that there is no gender in creative expression, just individuality.Ashton Michael Atelier is located in the heart of Hollywood. Available by appointment only to industry professionals, the showroom caters to those looking for unique, one-of-a-kind pieces in addition to current collection items. Purchases and rentals are available with options to alter or customize any piece in house one on one with the designer himself.

title: Week 2 | Lu Cuisine | Thursday Dinner
description: LU CUISINE | Shandong RegionTHE PLACE AND FOODShandong is a northern province that sits just across the Yellow Sea from Korea. Northern provinces grow more wheat than rice, but its position on the coast also means a lot of seafood, making the cuisine an interesting mix of heavy and light dishes featuring eel, herring, carp, noodles and steamed buns.THE MENU1: Sea Cucumber & Shrimp with pork balls, 3 onions, noodles, fried peanuts, broth2: Fried Rice3: Fried Sweet & Sour Carp with sweet potato, onion, corn 4: Apple in Hot ToffeeServed Individually as Appetizer, Entrée and Dessert

title: David Silverman - "Fighting the Lie of God"
description: NOTE: THIS EVENT PAGE HAS BEEN CREATED TO GET THE WORD OUT. NO TICKETS ARE REQUIRED TO ATTEND THIS EVENT. ENTRANCE TO THE VENUE WILL BE ON A FIRST-COME, FIRST-SERVE BASIS. IT DOES HELP IF YOU "BUY" A TICKET THOUGH SO WE CAN ANTICIPATE HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE ATTENDING.The Tri-City Freethinkers present David Silverman, the firebrand president of American Atheists and one of the best-known atheists in America. Known as "America's loudest heathen," a term he embraces proudly, Silverman is passionate about atheism and atheist equality. He has appeared on several TV programs for on-air debates, including, The O'Reilly Factor, Hannity & Colmes, Scarborough Country, and CNN's Paula Zahn NOW. He lives in New Jersey with his wife and child. His first book, Fighting God: An Atheist Manifesto for a Religious World, will be available in December of this year.Silverman was raised Jewish and went through the standard religious education, but never believed. In college, he engaged in many debates with Orthodox Jews, but, since Silverman's style is fierce but not insulting, he became very good friends with many of his opponents, eventually marrying one of them.Across the Internet and on TV, Silverman has been called rude, uncaring, and fascist (the latter by Bill O'Reilly), but the readers of Fighting God will realize he is none of those things. His methods ruffle feathers, but they work, and they work for the good of all people (except those who make money with religion). As Silverman's Jewish mother told him on her death bed, he not only helps atheists, but every person in any religious minority, because in the end, he fights only for the equality that is due all of us.Today, after nearly 20 years in activism, Silverman is arguably America's best-known atheist activist. In Fighting God, Silverman lays out why telling people God doesn't exist and religion is a lie is not only effective, but downright nice.

title: HackOTR
description: HackOTR is an inclusive community hackathon hosted by The Brandery. We're looking for excited individuals who want to contribute their skills in design, programming, product development, and marketing to solve problems and have fun. Anyone is welcome to register! You do not need to be a programmer, be in a startup, or have previous experience with hackathons.There will be a tech hack and, new this year, a marketing challenge.  Technologists will be put on teams to solve problems using software or the provided hardware.  The marketing challenge will pair marketers and designers to solve problems rooted in business. By separating marketers and designers from technologists, we hope to fully utilize everyone's skills and challenge them accordingly.  Prizes will be offered to teams with the best hacks at the end of the hackathon. Hacks will be judged on the following criteria: creativity, usefulness, usability, and delivery. HackOTR will feature judges from The Brandery's network of experienced mentors and experts, as well as from our sponsors. The mentors offer significant experience with startup ventures, product development, and technology.Learn more about the event, the schedule, and the sponsors at www.hackotr.com!How can I become a sponsor?For inquiries about sponsorship, please send a message to hackotr@brandery.org.No more tickets?No worries! We can get you on the wait list. Email jessica@brandery.org to be placed on the list, and we'll contact you if any spots open up!

title: The Great Gotham Challenge MMXV
description:
Please note: we are no longer accepting pre-bookings for the Great Gotham Challenge.  Please come to Castle Clinton at 3pm on Saturday the 11th to participate.  Day-of registration will be $60.//The city seen from the Queensboro Bridge is always the city seen for the first time, in its first wild promise of all the mystery and the beauty in the world. - F. Scott Fitzgerald, "The Great Gatsby"Come explore New York City, seeing it again for the first time in it's mystery and beauty.The Great Gotham Challenge is a large scale competitive puzzle adventure based in New York City. As the clock ticks, participating teams race across Manhattan to find and decode a series of interactive clues that intertwine with the city’s rich culture and history.On Saturday July 11th, 2015 we invite you to dedicate yourself to an afternoon of historical treasure hunting in New York City. Sleuths in teams of two to four are invited to test their wits in a battle of code-breaking, riddle-solving, scavenging and of course, googling. Teams will be given a series of Gotham-based clues, the answer to each unlocking the next. The first team to complete the entire challenge and arrive at the ultimate destination will be awarded the grand prize.Teams will convene at 3PM in front of Castle Clinton, Battery Park, in front of the building from which 1 in 4 Americans can trace their heritage. From there they will disperse, only to reunite at the conclusion of the competition in the game's final location, where the inevitable victors and the those less fortunate will share a meal. Further information:
Each team's admission fee will be $60, $50 for online pre-registration.
Participants will be responsible for organizing their own teams of two to four. 
Any codebreaker, detective, investigator, or historian of good will is invited to enter.
Feet, Bikes, Cabs, Ubers, and scooters are all legal means of transportation. Private, dedicated cards, however, are not.
Good luck, and may the best team win!
The Great Gotham Challenge is the amazing race & pub trivia rolled into one glorious, fun package.- GraceThe most original and memorable event I've had the pleasure of discovering since 'Sleep No More.'- MikeYou may never sweat as much as you will running around the city trying to win The Great Gotham Challenge. But you will absolutely, hands-down never have as much fun.- WhitneyMy body got a workout. My brain got a workout. But most importantly, my heart for NY got a workout. Even after 10 years of living in this amazing city, I learned new things about its heritage that made me fall in love with New York all over again.- Elizabeth

title: Gilbert Castellanos
description: It's been a few years since Gilbert Castellanos was walking to elementary school in Fresno, listening to Freddie Hubbard on his Walkman and playing  the theme from Rocky on his first day in band class. Today, he is recognized as a new American master by DOWNBEAT magazine and  has established himself as one of the nation’s most inventive  improvisers in stirring live performances as a member of the Clayton  Hamilton Jazz Orchestra, Anthony Wilson Nonet, Charles McPherson  Quintet, Willie Jones III Quintet, and as leader of his own groups.Castellanos returns to Fresno as the artist in residence at the Milestones Youth Jazz Workshop Summer Jazz Camp and will lead a quartet in concert on Thursday, June 18 at Bullard High School. Castellanos has worked with world-renown artists Dizzy Gillespie,  Wynton Marsalis, Charlie Hayden, Les McCann, Poncho Sanchez, Diana  Krall, Willie Nelson, Michael Buble, and Natalie Cole, to name a few. A passionate advocate of formal jazz education, Castellanos regularly  conducts high school workshops and is a lecturer at the University of  Southern California’s Thornton School of Music. Don't miss what is sure to be an epic night of jazz featuring Fresno's own Gilbert Castellanos!

title: Electromagnetic Voyagers – H. Contant + B. Balogh
description: This workshop is part of the MEGAPOLIS Audio Festival, a weekend-long celebration of sound in Oakland + San Francisco. Full festival lineup at megapolisfestival.org.In this 3-hour workshop, participants will build an FM transmitter to occupy a small portion of the invisible radio frontier, while discovering new audio territories by listening to sounds beyond the familiar AM and FM radio bands. If you have never assembled an electronics kit before, that’s okay! We will teach you how to solder. Each participant should bring an audio source such as a phone or media player with a standard 1/8" headphone jack. Optionally bring a FM radio receiver of any type to listen to your broadcast (there will be some receivers on hand to use). All tools and materials are included in the cost of the workshop.Hethre Contant is a historian and experimental radio artist based in Sydney, Australia. Her research focuses on communities that have formed in order to explore the possibilities of the radio band of the electromagnetic spectrum. She is finishing her PhD at the University of New South Wales Art and Design (UNSWAD), and she lectures about Art History, Radio, and Walter Benjamin.Brett Balogh is a Chicago-based artist working at the intersection of objects, sounds and spaces. He is currently an instructor at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago, the University of Illinois at Chicago and the Illinois Institute of Technology, teaching courses in new media, architecture, digital fabrication, radio and sound. Brett is a free103point9 transmission artist and has exhibited and performed at P.S.1 (NY), Diapason (NY), Devotion Gallery (NY); The MCA (Chicago) and The Hyde Park Arts Center (Chicago) among others.

title: Sailing A Sinking Sea
description: Saturday May 15, 6:00pmTheater 1Sailing A Sinking SeaA Dream at The Edge of LandSteve Wood8 min., Video, 2013, USA“The textures and colors of this piece were made by hand-coloring 16mm film. These colorful, frenetic textures were then matted digitally with simple animated shapes and archival photographs. The resulting dreamlike visions of shorelines and seascapes tell of solitude, soul-mates and transformation.” - Steve WoodWar PrayerRichard Wiebe17 min., Video, 2015, Cyprus/USA“Last summer marked the 40th anniversary of Cyprus’s invasion and partition. For decades every US administration has exploited this partition, using military bases on the island to conduct surveillance in the Middle East. An icon is a prayer, a window to heaven, to a listening ear.” - Richard WiebeSailing A Sinking SeaOlivia Wyatt65 min., Video, 2015, USASailing A Sinking Sea is a feature-length experimental documentary exploring the culture of the Moken people of Burma and Thailand. The Moken are a seafaring community and one of the smallest ethnic minority groups in Asia, traditionally spending eight months out of the year in thatch-roofed wooden boats. Wholly reliant upon the sea, their entire belief system revolves around water. Sailing A Sinking Sea weaves a visual and aural tapestry of Moken mythologies and present-day practices, exploring underwater activity, religious ceremonies, healing rituals, music, language, and a broad range of daily practices.

title: Dying to Know: Ram Dass & Timothy Leary
description: About the FilmThis intimate portrait celebrates two complex, controversial characters that shaped a generation. Two 1960’s Harvard psychology professors began probing the edges of consciousness through experiments with psychedelics - Timothy Leary and Richard Alpert. The film invites us into the future and encourages us to ponder life, drugs, and death.Director: Gay DillinghamCountry of Origin: USARunning Time: 95mDoc/Narrative: DocumentaryLocation: USFS TheaterABOUT THE FESTIVALInspiring our community and future generations is essential.  We hope that the Mammoth Lakes Film Festival will unlock the creative mind of the public by providing emerging filmmakers with an opportunity to have their films excite the community.It will also encourage emerging filmmakers by providing them with a forum to have their work seen by industry professionals who have the potential to propel their careers. We want to bring human stories back into film without the worry of producing the blockbuster but rather use the medium to inspire and motivate our community.Our desire is to give the public opportunities to not only view the films but also our intent to provide a forum for our filmmakers to have exposure and mentorship with industry professionals is crucial. That is why we are bringing in working, successful writers, producers, filmmakers, and actors that can not only assist them with guidance but also give insight to help motivate.

title: Stuck
description: Pre-Show Reception starts an hour before screening time. Q&A Talk-back with filmmakers starts immediately following screening.StuckComedy, 85 min. USADirected by John PainzBrooklyn PremiereJohn, an agoraphobe, hasn't left his apartment in two years. Living in New York City has made life easier. He gets deliveries, cooks, works from home, and has plenty of visitors. Aside from being afraid to stepout his front door, his life is pretty normal. That is, until his new therapist challenges him to leave his apartment in thirty days.Brooklyn Connection:Writer/director John Painz was born in Brooklyn, and scenes from the film were shot at Coney Island.Stuck trailer from John Painz on Vimeo.

title: Kevin Blake's Secrets: A Magical Mystery Show
description: 2014 TEASER:PEOPLE SAY:"I have now seen 3 of Kevin Blake's shows and really have been wowed by all of them." - James M."The show was intrinsic, immersive, hilarious, and full of beautiful people. The night was a blast. The night was magic. Kevin Blake is Magic." - Anwar B."If someone were to ask me if I recommend seeing this show, the answer would be an emphatic and definitive YES!!!! Loved it" - Michael H."From the in-your-face magic to the mind-bending conundrums that span the whole show, his talent is wide and diverse. Just remember to wipe the shocked face off when you rejoin society after the show." - Connor M."A compelling and phenomenal performer that adds a new kind of twist to magic. He is witty and funny, and his stories and theme make the audience never want to miss a second." - Wilson F.ABOUT THE SHOW:Featuring hilarious tall tales, impossible feats of magic, and wonders of the mind, this 1.5 hr 'magical' one-man show is an immersive and interactive theatrical experience.Feats of derring-do! Wonders of the occult! Impossible happenstances! Come to the show. Bring your friends.DON'T TELL ANYBODY.#KevinBlakeSecrets

title: Comedy Roast of a Professional Wrestler (18+)
description: RoastSF is back with another heart stopping, fall-to-the-floor laughing, no-jokes barred comedy roast. Join us as we come together to mock each other and this months controversial guest of honor. You’ve seen the comedy roasts on TV, and online, now it’s time to see one live! Drinking encouraged, sensitivity…. is not.This month it's:Comedy Roast of a Professional Wrestler. The show will be as much about mocking our guest of honor, the amazing annoying Broseph Joe Brody of Hoodslam, as it is about razzing both Wrestlers and those that, for some reason, love the "sport."  They say we only Roast the ones we love.... definitely not the case this time. Broseph Joe Brody embodies all the stereotypes of modern day Bro douchebaggery from a love of Nickelback, to excessive AXE use, a wrestling career, and a vocabulary that consists 98% of words modified to include Bro in them (see BROcabulary).This Months Dirty Dais: Star ZagofskyPete O'KeefeCheryl WhiteMatt GroomClark LittleKieth Art Swiggart III Jesus U. BettaworkEvent Details: Friday - April 24th - Pappy's Grill & Sports Bar - 2367 Telegraph Ave, Berkeley 7:30 Doors / 8:00 Show - 18+#BROast

title: Le Potager Urbain - Aménagement et Enjeux
description:
Venez découvrir la magie de faire pousser votre propre nourriture en ville. Semis urbains vous guidera vers la meilleure façon de surmonter les obstacles à la culture maraichère en ville, et comment naviguer les particularités de la saison de croissance de Montréal.Pendant l’atelier de jardinage potager, nous allons apprendre à planifier, planter et à entretenir votre potager peu importe votre espace,  si vous jardiniez dans votre cour, sur votre balcon ou même sur votre toit.Vous allez apprendre à :
Planifier et construire votre potager
Créer le mélange de terreau parfait et apprendre sur la fertilité des sols
Semer et transplanter les semis
Maintenir le jardin durant la saison
Maitriser le compagnonnage des plantes
Lutter contre les ravageurs et  les maladies naturelles et biologiques
À la fin de l’atelier, les participants recevront leurs propre semis de légumes biologiques, transplantés lors de l’atelier. Il y aura des semences,  du terreau, et  des matériaux de jardinage biologique disponibles à l’achat.Semis urbainsest une entreprise basée à Montréal qui aide les gens à cultiver leur propre nourriture fraiche en ville. Pour les 5 dernières années, nous avons accompagné les montréalais  dans l’aventure et la découverte de cultiver des légumes frais, des fines herbes et des fruits dans leurs cours, sur leurs balcons, terrasses et toits.Animée par co-fondatrice et conférencière Tereska Gesing.Ceci est un atelier donné en français. L’atelier anglais est samedi le 11 avril, 2015 L'atelier est à la Coalition de la Petite-Bourgogne, à 2 minutes à pied du métro Georges-Vanier dans la Petite-Bourgogne. L’atelier anglais est samedi le 11 avril, 2015

title: Jays First Pitch
description: Jays First Pitch is a fundraising event being run by a group of students in their final semester of the Special Events Planning program at George Brown College. All proceeds raised will go directly to the George Brown College Foundation and the Jays Care Foundation, which raises money for boys and girls to provide them with a chance to play sports, a better education and to encourage them to reach their goals.Jays First Pitch is the season opener kick-off party! Taking place at the Rock n' Horse Saloon we invite you to join us while we support our Toronto Home Team take on the New York Yankees as we begin Baseball Season in Toronto. Our guests will enjoy plenty of activities, complimentary ball park food, a chance to play games, and a silent auction with a chance to win some amazing items. With loads of activities and entertainment the afternoon is guaranteed to be one of the best baseball parties you attend this year!This is a 19+ EVENT. ID will be required at the door.

title: HITS by David Cross (March 13)
description: ONE NIGHT ONLY!"A darkly caustic journey into the pathetic depths of viral videos, internet fame, and the insatiable vacuum of lowest-common-denominator post-reality culture." – Splitsider A talentless teen (Meredith Hagner) will do anything to get on TV's "The Voice." Meanwhile, her father (Matt Walsh), a municipal worker, creates an uproar when a video of his rants at City Hall goes viral. HITS, is a dark comedy exploring the nature of fame in 21st Century YouTube America. It’s a story in which fame, delusion, earnestness, and recklessness meet, shake hands, and disrupt the lives around them.The directorial debut of American stand-up comedian, actor and writer David Cross, known primarily for his standup work, the HBO sketch comedy series Mr. Show, and his role as Tobias Fünke in the sitcom Arrested Development.

title: Jon Lloyd Group
description: This return gig was by popular demand after last year’s storming debut for Birmingham Jazz.This group sees Jon moving away from his free-improv roots into a more harmonically inclined territory. His compositions provide melody interspersed with moments of dazzling virtuosity and creative drive. The current group includes:Jon Lloyd – soprano saxophone, bass clarinet, composition. I have played on the UK jazz and improvised music scene for over 20 years, playing with the likes of Paul Rogers, Mark Sanders, Marcio Mattos, Paul Clarvis, Stan Adler, Michel Pilz and Gerry Hemingway. John Law - Pianist has been a key member of my groups since the Jon Lloyd Quartet’s Syzygy backin 1991. He is a musician with a rare sensitivity and a fearless ability which cuts across all genres; his own musical path has connected freedom, classical music and jazz , reaching a high in recent years with his Congregation Trio with Asaf and Yuri Goloubev. He has also appeared for BJazz in his own right.Rob Palmer - Guitarist plays with a powerful soloing style coupled with a high regard for texture and ambient sound. He plays with saxophonist Theo Travis, vibes player Roger Beaujolais and French composer Daniel Biro.Tom Farmer - Bassist is part of the new generation of highly accomplished UK jazz musicians – a bandleader with the phenomenal Empirical and a bass player of enormous strength.Dave Hamblett - Drummer is one of the most in-demand young drummers on the UK scene. His style is rooted in the jazz tradition but is very much modern, encompassing influences from many different styles of music. His distinctive yet adaptable playing has lead him to work with many of the country’s finest musicians and play in a wide range of musical situations.The personnel will be: me on soprano saxophone, John Law on piano and keyboards, Rob Palmer on electric guitar, Tom Farmer on double bass and Dave Hamblett on drums.“…this is definitely a group to catch is you can.” John Lyons, Jazz UK.“A saxophone delivery as persuasive as a speaking voice. Lloyd should be seen and heard more often.” Penguin Guide to Jazz on CD“Ambitious and virtuosic...one of the most striking writers at the sharp end of British jazz and improvisation” John Fordham, The Guardian, UKThe personnel will be: John Lloyd soprano saxophone, John Law keyboards, Rob Palmerelectric guitar, Tom Farmer bass and Dave Hamblett on drums.

title: uPaint Events: Relay for Life Fundraiser

We teach social painting classes in almost any location: homes, offices, local restaurants, and more!uPaint Events is an exciting and creative experience for any skill level. Recommended ages 10+!

title: Tired Moonlight w/Drama
description:
Tired Moonlight 
Every town has a post office, lovers, guns, switchblades and beer. You just have to know where to look and when to look the other way. Pitting grand landscapes against dinners of fried chicken and the roar of v8 engines on Saturday nights, the film wanders through Solitaire games (always won), secrets lost in cavernous hearts, and the fifty miles of bad road that always gets you home.USARunning Time: 72World PremiereDirector(s): Britni WestScreenwriter(s): Britni West, Poetry by Paul DickinsonProducer(s): Britni WestCast: Liz Randall, Paul Dickinson, Hillary Berg, RainLeigh Vick, Alex Karpovsky, Charles Smith, Nicholas StocktonProgrammer's Notes:Tired Moonlight is a love letter to small town Americana oblivious to Facebook, reality tv and diet soda. Like a Bob Dylan song come to life, Britni West’s poetic debut marries lush Montana imagery with endearing characters that society has largely ignored, but viewers won’t soon forget. Every face in this film tells a different story, be it foolish dreams, unrequited love or childhood wonder. Gorgeously shot on 16mm and evoking the grainy naturalism of a Maysles brothers’ documentary, Tired Moonlight casts a spell and doesn’t let go until you can smell the fireworks lighting up the summer nighttime sky. - Josh Mandel, ProgrammerPlaying with short film:DramaA young couple who are going to have sex in a car but realize that there are no more condoms left. When they see a young woman standing at the corner of an intersection, the girl in the car believes the young lady is a prostitute, and asks the guy to ask her for a condom. The guy hesitates to go because he thinks the lady is not, and he doesn't want to be awkward. While they are arguing about the lady, a man walks to her…USARunning Time: 11Director(s): Guan TianScreenwriter(s): Guan TianProducer(s): Guan TianCast: Ni Yan, Guan Tian, Shi Sun, Yanyu Dong

title: The MUFF Society presents CLUELESS
description: DOORS OPEN 9PM - MOVIE STARTS AT 9:30PMAs If. Way Harsh. Ensembly challenged. Thanks to Clueless these are phrases we’ve all embraced and used on the regular. And if you don’t, well, then you’re just a full-on Monet. Ugh. At some point or another, we’ve all wished for a closet like Cher’s, or a love like Dionne and Murray’s, or someone to “rollin’ with the homies” with at a party. With Clueless, writer/director Amy Heckerling took the teen-movie genre and turned it completely on its head by creating a film that was funny, clever and sexy—with a few life lessons tossed in for good measure (like when a boy comes over you should totally have something baking). Also, Paul Rudd. 2015 marks the 20th anniversary of this iconic film so grab a mini dress (one Calvin Klein would approve of) and join us in getting a head-start on the celebration at the second monthly MUFF Society screening.The Monthly Underground Female Film Society (or MUFF Society for short) is a film series + community that aims to celebrate and champion all facets of women in film. More than just screenings—with photo booths, costume contests, and raffles—these are nights you don’t want to miss. Bring your friends, bring your loved ones, bring your girl power. #MUFFSociety #CluelessTO“Heckerling walks a fine line between satire and put-on, but she finds it, and her dialogue could be anthologized.” – Roger Ebert
