title: Achieving Diversity in the Technology Industry #5
description:
A monthly meetup to discuss improving diversity in the technology industry

We will host a variety of talks on diversity, inclusion and breaking of stereotypes and biases. We hope to hold open and frank discussions and debates on what can be done to increase diversity in the technology industry.

The evening will start off with food (with vegetarian and vegan options) and refreshments (wine/beer/soft drinks/etc). Talks will start at 7:00pm. After the talks please do stick around to chat and meet others who care about improving diversity.

achievingdiversityin.tech/

Speakers28/07/16 6:30pm

	Eunice Baguma Ball - Founder of Africa Technology Business Network

	Overview of the Africa Tech Landscape
	Technology in Africa is playing a key role in enabling innovative ways to address the continent's challenges and providing access to under-served communities. As a result tech hubs have sprung up to support the growing number of resourceful entrepreneurs across the continent who are using technology to solve the everyday challenges around them. In this talk I will give a quick overview of the emerging Africa tech ecosystem as well as some of the exciting innovations being developed.

title: Deprogrammed
description: DeprogrammedMia Donovon84 min., Video, 2015, Canada“Deprogrammed is a feature-documentary about the rise of Ted ‘Black Lightning’ Patrick’s deprogramming technique and anti-cult crusade. Deprogramming, as a form of cult intervention, started in 1971 and quickly snowballed into a vast underground movement composed of concerned parents, ex-cultist-turned-deprogrammers and some sympathetic law-enforcers whose mission was to physically and mentally remove individuals from groups referred to as ‘cults’.  Inspired by her stepbrother’s deprogramming by Patrick in 1991, Mia Donovan meets the infamous ‘Father of Deprogramming’ himself and begins to unravel his notorious legacy.” MDShown With:The LadiesTyler Zoanni13 min., Video, 2015, USA“For 50 years, a group of Ukrainian women has gathered in New York’s East Village to make dumplings for their church. This observational short offers an evocative portrait of “the ladies” and the work, faith, gossip, and humor that brings them together.” - TZ

title: Excursions
description: ExcursionsDaniel Martinico80 min., video, 2016, USA“In the hopes of revitalizing their marriage, a husband and wife retreat to a remote cabin getaway with some longtime friends. Their pleasant interaction quickly assumes a relentless intensity as they push one another, mentally and physically, towards transcendence. This shortcut to enlightenment, however, has unexpected consequences.” DM "Excursions is a slow burn that eventually sets your hair on fire. What begins as an idyllic couples getaway for Los Angeles yuppies quickly subverts into an animalistic symphony of oddities that pulls viewers down a rabbit hole, and then collapses the hole behind them."  - Josh Mandel, SlamdanceShown With:Old FriendsBruce Bundy11 min., video, 2015, USA“Kat and Arthur are married, Clara and Nicholas are too, and they all share a long friendship from their pursuits in higher education. Kat and Arthur have left the academic realm in favor of assuming control of a family-owned funeral parlor, while Clara and Nicholas have gone the route of adjunct professors; all are haunted by their positions. Clara and Nicholas taunt Kat and Arthur for leaving academia while lamenting their own newly onset professorial malaise, and envying their backdoor exit, while Kat and Arthur savor their roles as ejected fools while aching somewhat for the self-satisfying virtues of an academic life. They drink a lot and their strange, kinky, beautiful and tormented dynamics dance them through the course of their evening-long, heady reunion, proving that they are, indeed, old friends” BB

title: Emily Burns + Matt Gresham + Jonny Stemp
description: Emily Burnshttps://soundcloud.com/emilyburnsukEmily’s vocals have already drawn comparison to artists such as Alessia Cara, Nao, Jessie Ware and Tori Kelly and her unique R&B Pop sound and stand out vocals are creating a strong industry buzz which reached fever pitch at a recent stand out performance at the Great Escape music festival. With imminent plans to independently release her debut single and embark on her debut UK tour, working with writers/producers including: Emre Ramazanoglu, Dan McDougall and Edd Holloway, Emily Burns is definitely one to watch this year. Emily will be supported by rising emerging artists: Matt Gresham and Jonny Stemp. Matt Greshamhttps://soundcloud.com/mattgreshamofficial   Lead single Small Voices, produced by Scott Horscroft (Silverchair,  Birds Of Tokyo) and written with Jaymes Young (London Grammar) is one  such example of Gresham expanding beyond his already popular aesthetic.  With a soulful tenor that bounds over his placid acoustic guitar,  Gresham is a favourite for laidback listeners raised (as he was) on the  sounds of everyone from Ben Harper to Paul Simon.  “The fondest  memories [I have] are hearing my mum sing and my brother play guitar at  some of our back yard jam sessions when I was about 13,” he reminisces.  “I was so attracted to the sound of an acoustic guitar and hearing my  brother play.”   As Gresham relocates temporarily to Los Angeles  to write with new collaborators and a run of US shows, there’s an ocean  of possibility before him. It’s the beginning of a new journey for the  one-time Western Australian surfer who has been independently recording,  touring and playing around Australia for nearly eight years.   “I try to stay open to genres and listen mostly to the writing and tones  of instruments,” says Gresham. “Small Voices is a song about a man in  jail missing his daughter, but I've also been thinking it could be about  someone trapped in a city life who wants to break out and live in the  forest.”   With an EP on its way and 'Small Voices' set to make  further waves for Gresham back home, it looks like 2016 is going to be a  big one. Jonny Stemphttps://soundcloud.com/jonnystempHuman encompassing upon the journey of Music.

title: Panel: Crossing Borders
description: 20 Years in the making; Independent Latin Canadian Cinema“To be Latino is thus somewhat like directing a loquacious orchestra without a score, to undergo a seemingly endless negotiation of identity and difference from both inside and outside a multifaceted prism, and to be involved in a constant search for an inter- and intra-community common ground.”  Elena FederEchoing the film screenings, the issues and ideas discuss at the panel will cover all aspects of the diasporic experience of the Americas. The majority of the presenters residing in Canada who have also immigrated from elsewhere in the continent. About one-third are non-Latin filmmakers, academics, or both, whose work exhibits different foci and degrees of concern with border-crossing issues and post-national diasporic identity formations.In reflecting on the history, the panel aims to consider the framework evolution that will be needed to support Latin Canadian independent filmmaking into the future.  The question of the ongoing need for spaces for culturally specific media arts exhibition and their relevance to future generations of independent Latin-Canadian filmmakers is being questioned, and this question will serve as the starting point for discussion on this panel.Panelists include notable Latin American media artist and programmers such as Ricardo Acosta, Alejandro Ronceria, Jorge Lozano, and Sinara Rozo.With this special program we aim to showcase the achievements and talent of our filmmakers and their integral role in the artistic identity of the Canadian cultural panorama.

We’re bringing together artists who resonate with this and asking them to show us what tough means to them.Artists:Monica Tiulescu Addy Rabinovitch Mei Hsuan Chiang Andie Vallee  Laura Wong Emilee Yawn Brenna Daugherty Stephanie AcedilloEden MitsenmacherBeats:DJ WongPopups:The Vegan HavenLadie Katie  Tough celebrates strong womyn, independent womyn, womyn sticking together, working womyn, womyn from different walks of life, womyn of different cultures, and womyn excelling in the world.△ 1920C will give part of the art proceeds to Kiva which gives micro-loans to womyn to help them start and sustain their business globally & She's The First which provides scholarships to girls in low-income countries with the goal of creating first-generation graduates and our next generation of global leaders.△ A portion also goes to support 1920C member, Pacific Atrocities Education, a nonprofit who helps support womyn refugees.△ Sponsored by: Lagunitas Brewing Company & Red Blossom TeaCome celebrate & support these wonderful ladies! title: DIACC Annual General Meeting
description:
Why attend the DIACC AGM?

The DIACC Annual General Member meeting is your opportunity to connect with DIACC Members from all across Canada.  This year we're bringing together DIACC Members to share presentations and panels that connect legacies of Digital Identity research and the innovations ahead. You'll network with peers, partners, and competitors to share resources and tackle common problems.  Join us to help secure Canada's full participation in the Digital Transformation and global Digital Economy.

This event takes please on June 14 in Toronto.  We wish to recognize and thank our venue sponsors Telus for hosting the event!

Join DIACC for all of the inside information on adoption of the pan-Canadian Trust Framework, our Proofs of Concept pilots, and more! Stay June 15-16 to attend Identity North, Canada's premier Identity Event, where DIACC Members gain a special discount.

The DIACC 2016 Annual General Meeting will be held on Tuesday, June 14th from 9am-5pm, at Telus House, 25 York Street, 3rd floor.

title: Conscious Transitions: Living with Dying
description:
Through rites, rituals and ceremony, learn to approach death with confidence and courage.  Conscious Transitions: Living with Dying is a 2-day experiential workshop designed to help people approach death consciously. In this class participants discover a variety of techniques which will help the dying person and their loved ones find peace.This program draws from the wisdom of the indigenous peoples of the Andes Mountains in South America. The Great Death Rites expand our understanding of the psychological and emotional closure needed in the dying process.  Participants have found that their lives are enriched and their work with clients is shifted through the discovery of a new relationship with death.  Learning Objectives:
Identify and master the clearing of the 7 chakras in the human energy field.
Investigate the many ways to open and close sacred space for the dying.
Explore several different methods to assist in the practice of life review.
Experience the power of giving oneself permission to die.
Build an Aya Despcho, a prayer bundle for those who have died, and examine the ways in which participants may create an Aya Despacho ceremony.
Recognize the transformative nature of ceremony in the process of dying and analyze basic elements of a successful ceremony. 
Facilitated by:Kitty Edwards, The Living & Dying Consciously ProjectDeborah Owen-Sohocki, The Center for Heart-based LivingNaya Devi, Indigenous AlchemyKathleen Gorman, Suncrest HospiceWorkshop Hours:Saturday, August 20 & Sunday, August 21, 2016 9:00 am - 5:30 pm daily 14 contact hoursCOURSE FEES:  $250 general public  /  $125 professional hospice staffReduced fee available for paid Hospice Staff only  / Contact info@livinganddyingconsciouslyproject.org to determine your eligibility and receive promo code

title: The Poetry Brothel: Philly
description: The Poetry Brothel is a unique and immersive poetry event that takes poetry outside classrooms and lecture halls and places it in the lush interiors of a bordello. The Poetry Brothel presents a rotating cast of both male and female poets as “whores,” each operating within a carefully crafted character, who impart their work in public readings, spontaneous eruptions of poetry, and most distinctly, as purveyors of private poetry readings on beds, chaise lounges and in private rooms. For a small fee, all of the “poetry whores” are available for these sequestered readings at any time during the event. Of course, any true brothel need a good cover; The Poetry Brothel’s is an immersive cabaret, offering a full bar, musicians, burlesque dancers, painters, actors, and fortune-tellers, with newly integrated themes, performances and installations at each event.Doors open at 8pm; show starts at 8:30pm. Costumes and/or formalwear are encouraged but not required. This event is 21+. Please note seating is first come, first serve for those who purchase General Admission tickets. VIP tickets include reserved priority seating.For specific event details, please visit www.thepoetrybrothel.com/events.html.

title: Stocking Tease - Ellion Ness
description: Stocking Tease with Ellion Ness Ellion dazzled everyone the first time she returned to the burlesque stage. She excels at owning the stage with beautiful struts and sweeping cape work, but it's her smooth stocking work that won hearts. She’ll demonstrate techniques and gives tips on choosing stockings, showing off your legs, and making the most of this classically naughty bit of lingerie. Bring your own stockings and be prepared to seduce!Ellion Ness, The Thinking Man’s Readhead, was interested in dancing as soon as she was old enough to walk. Hailing from San Francisco, she began her career in the 1950s, mentored by Lili St. Cyr, and soon found her way to the stage of the legendary Minsky’s Burlesque. She’s a faithful member of the Burlesque Hall of Fame Legend Family, always ready with support and advice for up and coming burlesque performers. “Follow your bliss” is her motto!LIMITED ENROLLMENT!  THIS IS A MOVEMENT CLASS.  BRING YOUR OWN STOCKINGS.

title: WWF Pandamonium
description: Join us for a wild night of philanthropy and fun in support of WWF-Canada on Thursday, June 23.Pandamonium will take you on a journey of the senses, weaving together music, art, food and nature for an exploration of environmental issues and solutions. It’s both a cautionary tale and a celebration of nature’s majesty and resilience:Doom and Bloom. What does the future hold? It’s up to you: choose a world that is filled with natural wonder, sights, and sounds, or a world where nature is an apparition, lost forever.Tickets include a live performance from Juno Award-winning indie folk-rock group The Strumbellas, an immersive multimedia experience by internationally renowned digital masterminds Moment Factory, food stations curated by top chefs, striking art and floral installations, complimentary drinks and much more. VIP tickets also include a pre-party cocktail reception featuring a one-of-a-kind interactive wildlife encounter, an intimate performance from international opera star Teiya Kasahara, a VIP gift bag and a complimentary ticket to WWF-Canada’s summer party. Funds raised through Pandamonium will help WWF-Canada continue its work protecting wildlife and wild places across Canada. Learn more about how we’re working to build a future where people and nature thrive at wwf.ca.Presented ByCorporate ticket packages are available; please contact Kathryn Busch, kbusch@wwfcanada.org.For information about Pandamonium sponsorship opportunities, please contact Sarah Powell, Partner Marketing Senior Specialist: spowell@wwfcanada.org or (416) 489-4567 ext. 7305We accept Visa & Mastercard. Please note: tickets are nonrefundable but can be transferred. See our full Terms & Conditions.

title: AGBU Gala Benefit Dinner at The Landmark London
description: Evening keynote speakerThe Right Honourable Professor the Lord Darzi of Denham OM KBE PC FRSwill be joined by featured speakersCésar Alierta, Chairman of TelefonicaJoseph Oughourlian, Central Board Member of AGBU, CEO of Amber CapitalBerge Setrakian, President of AGBU, Partner at DLA Piper~Thanks to the generous support of Mr. and Mrs. Oughourlian, 100% of your contribution will support theAGBU Humanitarian Emergency Relief Fund for Syrian Armenians.Donations of 500£ or more will be recognized at the Gala.To pay in EUR: Contact UGAB France: Zarouhie Odabashian at 33 1 45 24 72 75 or email zodabashian@agbueurope.org. To pay in USD: Contact AGBU NY: Karen Papazian at 212-319-6383 (x116)              or email kpapazian@agbu.org ~AGBU: SAVING LIVES. GIVING HOPESince 2012, AGBU has provided humanitarian emergency relief aid to tens of thousands of Syrian Armenians. No one anticipated the extent of the destruction and suffering. No one could have imagined that our own community would become victims of the worst humanitarian crises of our time. Now, more than ever, we are depending on AGBU’s family and friends to support our humanitarian emergency relief efforts that provide food, clean drinking water, repairs to damaged homes, medical aid and funding for emergency procedures, shelter and other life-saving programs.  Relief efforts also include displacement support programs and university and AGBU school scholarships for Syrian Armenians struggling to restart their lives in Lebanon, Canada, and Armenia. Every contribution will help AGBU ensure the safety and survival of the Syrian Armenian community.Learn more about AGBU's relief efforts in support of the Syrian Armenian community.

title: 826LA Presents: Tell Me a Story
description:
General Admission Pre-sale tickets will be on sale until midnight on Wednesday, June 1. After that, you can purchase $65 at the door on Thursday, June 2. General Admission doors open at 7:15 P.M. Looking for VIP tickets, including cocktail party admission and dinner? Go here instead. Join 826LA & li.st for a night of music & wordsWith our friends:MARIA BELLOCATHERINE KEENER KEEGAN-MICHAEL KEY AL MADRIGAL BJ NOVAK BOB ODENKIRK KRISTEN SCHAALDAVE EGGERSMUSIC BY BEST COAST& More!About The EventFrom bucket lists to best-ofs, lists help us keep track and make sense of the world around us. Whether chiseled in stone or scrawled across the back of your hand, lists archive our past, index our present, and chart our future. Sometimes, lists make us ask more questions than they answer. And isn't that the fun of it?Join 826LA, li.st., and friends as we explore writing that is:
Practical and aspirational
Comprehensive and contested
Quotable and quotidian
Informative and inspiring
Watch your favorite performers read, joke, and play to benefit 826LA's free writing programs for kids. Share your love of storytelling in support of the brightest voices of tomorrow by celebrating the golden standard of information organization: the list!What does General Admission entail?General Admission includes an upstairs seat for the show only. It does not include a dinner seat or admission to the VIP cocktail party at 6:30. There will, of course, be a no-host bar open for business in the Mezzanine and in true 826 fashion, plenty of surprises throughout the night. Wait a minute! I want a premium dinner seat, including admission to the VIP cocktail reception!You've come to the almost-right place. Please click here to purchase a $500 premium ticket, including seated dinner and cocktail reception. Is there a dress code?There is no dress code enforced, but most guests will dress business casual. This is a celebration, after all! Is this event good for kids?Because alcohol will be available at this event, 826LA discourages bringing guests under 21 years of age.General Admission Pre-sale tickets will be on sale until midnight on Wednesday, June 1. After that, you can purchase $65 at the door on Thursday, June 2. General Admission doors open at 7:15 P.M. Looking for VIP tickets, including cocktail party admission and dinner? Go here instead.

title: Leveraging Tech to Transform Individuals & Orgs
description:
PROFESSIONAL ISSUES CONFERENCE 2016LEVERAGING TECHNOLOGY TO TRANSFORM INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS
Advances in technology are quickly and continuously changing the nature of work.  Holding several positions on the Society of Industrial Organizational Psychology's "Top 10 Workplace Trends of 2016," technology has become the focus on everyone's mind.  Social media and social networking sites are being utilized by recruiters to find new talent, telecommuting is becoming the norm for many employees, advanced information systems are now storing every bit of employee data, and the line between what is private and what is public is becoming less clear everyday.Come join the Organizational Psychology graduate students of Alliant International University's California School of Professional Psychology as they present new developments in technology, and the implications it has on talent management, employee engagement, work-life integration and employee wellness.Then stay for a diverse panel of guest speakers as they share their experiences with technology, discuss the impacts they have seen in jobs & industries, and offer some helpful tips & advice to be aware of before incorporating technology into your life.Breakfast and lunch will be provided,  Complimentary snacks and refreshments will also be available throughout the day..Schedule of Events9:00 AM - 9:30 AM            Registration & Breakfast 9:30 AM - 9:50 AM            Introduction Presentation 10:00 AM - 10:40 AM         Presentation 1 THE GROWING POWER OF SOCIAL MEDIA IN RECRUITMENT & SELECTION10:50 AM - 11:30 AM           Presentation 2HOW TO DRIVE ENGAGEMENT IN THE WORKPLACE USING TECH11:30 AM - 12:20 PM           Courtyard Lunch12:20 PM - 1:00 PM             Presentation 3COMING TO A COUCH NEAR YOU: A NEW WAVE OF TELECOMMUTING & TECHNOLOGY 1:10 PM - 1:50 PM                Presentation 4 LIFE BEFORE THE IPHONE: HOW TO HANDLE TECH AND STRESS2:00 PM - 3:15 PM              Guest Panel 3:15 PM - 3:30 PM               Closing
Guest Panel Speakers   Tina Robinson - Global Process Leader & Tech Story Teller - SAP   Randy Farber - President - Farber Consulting   Elizabeth Dyer - Director of Organization & Talent Development - Live Nation   Robert Pallares - Senior Value Manager - Workday   Kibibi Springs - Human Factors & Ergonomics Specialist - Herman Miller

title: The Ticketmaster API Devjam in Hollywood, CA!
description:
This year, Ticketmaster will be rolling out more new technology than ever before! We're taking the show on the road to meet with you, the developer community, to get your feedback on the developer experience we're building and on the new exciting updates to our APIs!


We'll also get to hack on some cool stuff together :)





APIS & DOCS
Get on our Developer Network to get your API key and take our APIs for a test drive. You can get started by reading through the docs or jump right into our API Explorer to see how the API works! We also have tutorials to kick start your imagination :)


THEME
The theme of this devjam is event discovery.


SCHEDULE
9:00am – Doors Open + Light breakfast

9:30am – Opening Remarks

10:00am – Developers dig into the APIs!

12:00pm: Lunch

4:00pm – Happy Hour!

4:30pm – DEMOS!

5:30pm – Closing Remarks


SWAG & PRIZES
Participants will receive Ticketmaster swag and potentially the opportunity to score game or concert tickets (via raffle). More details coming soon.

One of our many prizes is a lunch or dinner with our President, Jared Smith! A priceless opportunity to learn from the best :-)


PARKING
We'll be offering complimentary parking at Ticketmaster. Please park in the underground parking garage (the entrance is on Sycamore street, which is on the east side of their building just south of Hollywood Blvd). Please take the elevator to the LOBBY with your ticket to get your parking validated and check-in in the lobby.

With an expected high turn-out, parking is limited. We encourage you to UBER/LYFT if you can!


WE'RE ALSO HIRING!
Ticketmaster is constantly on the lookout for top talent in the industry.  We actively recruit through career fairs, student organizations, user groups, hackathons and any other method we can think of to locate people that fit into our culture.  Beginning in the fall we start looking for candidates to be a part of our summer internship program.  We try to identify these individuals by April.  As participants in the Devjam that we are sponsoring in January, students will have the opportunity to meet and interact with hiring managers and teams while they are participating.  They will also have the opportunity to see what our industry, company and culture is all about.

Looking forward to seeing you guys on June 25, 2016!

Happy Coding!

The Ticketmaster Devjam Team

title: wolvesmouth: taxa at MOCA // thur, jun 30-SOLD OUT
description:
'Taxa' is wolvesmouth's new large-scale installation where food, music, and technology come together under the umbrella of art, to examine the precarious relationship between humans and nature.TICKET INFORMATION
Tickets are $225 per person (plus 3% credit card processing fee). The purchase of a ticket provides each ticket holder with entrance to the installation and a nine-course dinner prepared by the wolvesmouth team.
There are no limits on how many tickets you can purchase.
There are no refunds or exchanges for the tickets. All sales are final. This ticket is like a ticket to a concert, theater show, or sporting event.

Tickets can be transferred to another guest, but they cannot be resold beyond face value (which in many states is illegal and honestly, just not cool with us). If you do need to transfer your tickets to someone else, please make sure to let us know via email so that we can update your ticket with the new guest's information.
EVENT AND DINNER INFORMATION:
The installation is at The Geffen Contemporary at MOCA in Little Tokyo. 

The doors open for the installation promptly at the scheduled/ticketed time, with dinner starting soon thereafter. Please make sure to arrive 15 minutes before your event starts. Due to time constraints, we will have to start the dinner without you if you are late. 


In addition to the regular menu, we are also offering pescatarian and vegetarian dinner options. Please select your preference at check-out. Due to the nature of the installation, we are unable to accommodate any other dietary restrictions/substitutions. If you have any food allergies, please send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com after you purchase your tickets.
You are invited to bring your own beverages to drink and to share with others. Beverages will not be sold at the event. We will provide water, ice, and glassware.
Parking is available at the museum and costs $8/vehicle. 
OTHER NOTES:
No dress code. Wear what you are most comfortable in.
Taking photos is always ok with us.
If you have any questions, send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com

title: Planetfall Sci-Fi Larp - Game 5 - Beta Series
description:
Become a colonist struggling to survive on an alien world. 200 years in the future, Earth struggles under environmental devastation and a tyrannical government. A lucky and disposable few are sent on the first mission to colonize another Earth-like planet 36 light years from Earth. Your wits, your knowledge and your courage are the tools you will use to survive.Planetfall is taking Live Action Gaming into the future. It is a roleplay-centered immersive game using groundbreaking mobile technology to create a unique live action gaming experience. We are based in Austin, Texas.Schedule

Saturday 0900 - 0930
Check-in


Saturday 0930 - 1000
Announcements and Opening Ceremonies


Saturday 1000 - 2200
Game (Staff On Site)


Saturday 2200 - Sunday 0900
Night Cycle (No Staff, RP only)


Sunday 0900 - 1400
Game (Staff On Site)


Sunday 1400 - 1500
Closing Ceremonies and Cleanup

More information is available at: http://www.prepareforplanetfall.comContact the staff or any player for an invite code.Site and Catering DetailsThere are no sleeping quarters on site. Please bring a tent if you plan to stay overnight, along with appropriate sleeping bags for the weather and wind. This is the windy plains of Texas, so tent stakes are highly recommended.Two breakfasts, two lunches and a Saturday night dinner will be provided to people who purchase the meal package with their ticket. Fire pits and limited electric will be available for cooking. If you do not wish to buy a meal plan, please bring your own food. Genre appropriate food is highly encouraged, e.g. MREs, ration bars and the like.Meal plans must be pre-purchased by the Wednesday before the game. A limited number of meal plans may be available for purchase on site, but you are not guaranteed to receive one.New PlayersYou can obtain an invite code from any current player. You can use this invite code to register and create your character on our website: http://prepareforplanetfall.com/#/signupYou must bring a 'drop box' where all your character's personal equipment, including guns, can be stored before the drop sequence, marked with your characters name. A plastic bin should be fine. The only items you will have in the drop sequence is your costuming and your personal scanner (i.e. cell phone or tablet)Large items such as tents can be stored in your car and taken out after your box is recovered, for simplicity's sake.

title: MATT MAHER - Assumption beONE Concert Series
description:
Since his 2008 major label debut, Matt Maher has become a staple in the artistic and songwriting community. A five time-GRAMMY® nominee, he has garnered multiple radio successes writing and recording songs like “Lord, I Need You,” “Hold Us Together,” “Christ Is Risen,” “All The People Said Amen” and “Your Grace Is Enough.” Maher has penned songs recorded by Chris Tomlin, Crowder, Third Day, Matt Redman, Hillsong, Passion and Meredith Andrews, among others.

Maher continues to perform and speak as a part of global high-profile events, including the upcoming World Meeting of Families, marking Pope Francis’ first visit to the US this year. In 2013, Maher performed on stage with Pope Francis in front of more than 3 million people at World Youth Day in Rio de Janeiro. Maher and his team are already in the planning stages of participating in World Youth Day 2016 taking place in the summer of 2016 in Krakow, Poland.

Don't miss this evening of moving prayer and spirit-filled praise with Matt!

_____________________________________________________________________________________________

title: VITALY: An Evening of Wonders
description: "Astonishing!" - CBC"Inspires Wonder" - The Vancouver Sun"Incredible!" - CHCH Morning LiveVitaly is an innovative illusionist who sees wonder in the world and  turns it into an unforgettable theatrical experience. From bringing  photographs and paintings to life to making a paintbrush paint all by  itself, even the most jaded illusionists have declared Vitaly's show as  containing “some of the most incredible and impossible magic ever  witnessed.”An Evening Of Wonders also features Vitaly's famous  feat where he manages to make the photo from your driver's license  disappear. So, if you're brave enough to surrender your ID to him, you  will have to expect the unexpected.  What if when he made the photo come  back, it wasn't a picture of you, but of Marilyn Monroe or George  Clooney?  Is it magic or trickery?  The only way to be sure is to catch  one of Vitaly’s increasingly popular performances before all of the  tickets have disappeared into thin air.--Recommended for ages 8 and up.For more info see: http://www.EveningOfWonders.com

title: Saathi: Celebrating Partnerships in Global Health
description: UW GlobeMed is hosting our 4th Annual Benefit Dinner at St. Demetrios Hall in Seattle! Join us for a lively evening featuring a silent auction, keynote speech, a fabulous catered Indian dinner, performances and our very own GlobeMed wine! We can't wait to see you there!GlobeMed at UW is working to encourage youth engagement on a local and global scale in order to raise funds for grassroots health programs. Our solution is to utilize the energy, passions, and resources of students in the United States to partner with the real change makers – the people of the communities around the world. Our chapter is partnered with the MINDS Foundation, a grassroots organization committed to eliminating stigma and providing educational, medical, and moral support for patients with mental illnesses in rural India. For more information about GlobeMed at UW and the work we do, please visit us at uwglobemed.org.

title: Flynn Creek Circus Summer Camp
description: Professional circus performers from all over the world will tutor children and adults in a variety of circus skills in the nostalgic Big Top Circus tent located at Friendship Park. Daytime and evening classes available.Tuesday, July 5 to Saturday, July 9, 2016Children’s program (ages 6-12) 10:00-2:30, Tue-SatFee: $235 (To apply for a need-based scholarship, contact director@ccmendo.org).This workshop will introduce multiple circus disciplines and work to the level of each individual student.Students will experience the thrills of vaultige, swinging trapeze, Chinese Pole, tightwire, aerial silks, juggling, hula hoop and partner acrobatics all in a safe and encouraging environment.General conditioning and stretching techniques will be emphasized to promote healthy exercise habits.Students will create an end of workshop performance.Signed Liability Waiver must be submitted before child may attend.Intermediate/Advanced (13 and up) Wed-Thur 4:30-6:30Fee: $80This intensive introduces students who have some foundation in circus skills to new skill development.  Along with exploring transitional path work between existing skills, students will also sample new disciplines.  Each session will focus on refining choreography, artistic cohesion and purposeful application of new skill development. New skill exploration will include vaultige, acrobatics, partner balancing and pole.  Other disciplines may be added by student request. *Students for the Intermediate/advanced course are expected to  be warmed up in time for their class start.Recommended attire: Students should wear comfortable clothing that covers the knees. Shirts should be tight or able to tuck in for upside-down activities. If students have flat-soled tennis shoes, ballet slippers or gymnastic shoes, please bring. Children's camp students need to bring their own lunch and snack daily.Signed Liability Waiver must submitted prior to first attendance.

title: Musicale presents: SIGN "O" THE TIMES
description: Dearly beloved /We are gathered here today /2 get through this thing called lifeJoin us on May 15 as we celebrate the life and music of one of pop music’s most transcendent and influential artists with a stunning 35mm print of Prince’s concert film SIGN O’ THE TIMES!Sexy as hell and containing more face-melting solos than you will be able to handle, the 1987 concert film – featuring the music from the album of the same name – is nearly impossible to see. A copy of SIGN O’ THE TIMES on Amazon is currently $460.Upon release, Robert Christgau of The Village Voice said that the Sign o’ the Times record is "the most gifted pop musician of his generation proving what a motherfucker he is for two discs start to finish” — a fitting description for the eclectic 1987 record often ranked amongst the greatest albums of all time. He had equal enthusiasm for the film, considering it a worthy challenger to STOP MAKING SENSE for the title of greatest rock concert film ever made.The film also features the ridiculously stacked band that accompanied Prince on his 1987 Sign o' the Times Tour, including drummer Sheila E. and The Revolution’s keyboardist Dr. Fink.Head to The Royal early for a pre-show and love-in of Paisley Park’s The Purple One! Doors open at 4:30PM.MUSICALE – (noun) a program of music performed at a party – is a new monthly film series at The Royal that celebrates everything from 1950s musicals to hip hop documentaries.

title: New Harold Night
description: It's New Harold Night at the Push Comedy Theater!So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?The Harold is the big, bad grand daddy of all long form improv! It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.This month don't miss house teams *69 and Third ChoiceNew Harold Night Friday, April 22nd at 10:00pmTickets are $5The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street.--The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts. The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classesare offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting. Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

#MakeYourChoiceEach and every day we all make about 20.000 decisions. Those decisions don´t necessarily change our lives dramatically, though our lives are constructs of the little choices we make every day. Thinking back we find that our lives could have run differently, if we decided on walking different paths by making different choices.Each of our speakers was at that crossroad, consciously choosing to walk a different path. title: Behind the Lens with Sam Javanrouh
description: For over 10 years, Sam Javanrouh's photographs have captured the beauty and chaos of Toronto's streets. He has transformed routine big-city corners into spectacular images.Javanrouh is best known as the photographer behind the internationally acclaimed photoblog "Daily Dose of Imagery", where he posted a photo everyday for 10 years from 2003 to 2013. Many Toronto residents and worldwide photo lovers have been gazing at our city through Javanrouh’s eyes for a full decade, day in and day out. In 2013, Javanrouh was recognized by "TopPhotoWebsites" as one of the top ten photographers in the world. This illustrious group included Joe McNally and Steve McCurry.Join the acclaimed photographer for an evening of unforgettable images and the stories behind them and become a tourist in your own city.www.samjavanrouh.com* All profits go to supporting refugee families from Syria.We are a group of 12 Toronto families who have come together to sponsor a refugee family from Syria. We have committed to helping the family financially once they arrive in Canada and assisting them to settle during the first year. The family arrived in Toronto on February 24. We are raising money for the family.

title: Chef Battle #3 Rudy Boquilla vs. Angel Sevilla
description: Ladies and Gentlemen,Welcome to ROUND THREE - THE FILIPINO SHOWDOWN!We at The Chef Cartel would like to reveal our next two contenders for our MAY 2nd BATTLE: Chef Rudy Boquilla vs Chef Angel Sevilla.If you weren't able to make it to Round One or Two, here's your opportunity to attend The BIGGEST BATTLE YET!Doors open at 6pm and the battle will commence at 8pm. Arrive early to get in -- space is limited!EARLY BIRD TICKETS on sale now thru April 30th :: $15 (limited quantity available). Limited tickets are available at the door :: Admission cost $20 Pre-buy tickets online at Universe.com or at the door -- CASH ONLY ON SITEWe are excited to announce that we have partnered with George Brown College - we welcome our GBC Chefs as part of our esteemed judging panel.Parkdale Daily Food Bank will be aligning with our chef battles, as we want to promote giving back to our community. Please bring a charitable donation (a cash donation or non-perishable item is welcomed). With your support we can lend a hand to the Parkdale Community Food Bank so they can keep up with serving over 3,000 people each month. These are people who need it the most so lets help them out!Rules of Engagement:Hosted By: Joey SalmingoThe Chefs will have 1 hour to produce two dishes using two secret ingredients (1 Produce item, 1 Protein item). The chefs may create whatever they desire as long as the secret ingredients are used in their final dishes.Our selected panel of esteemed judges based on The Chef Cartels outlined criteria will then judge the dishes.The Venue (CASH ONLY):We are privileged to have a group of local vendors in which guest will be able to sample products. If intrigued you may also purchase the products for a reasonable price. Food will be catered by Mata restaurant. All Food & Drink tickets are $5 and available for purchase all night long - cash only.Complimentary samples for you to indulge in will also be handed out throughout the evening.GIFT BAGS will be handed out to everyone who attends containing awesome goodies for you to take home and use in your kitchen!Transportation:TTC 504 King Street Line drops you right across the street from our venue; make sure to get off at King and Parliament. There is also a stop right outside the venue to take you home.Driving:There is parking located at the back of the venue, at standard cost. We will advocate that if you are driving please make sure you drink responsibly.If you have any questions please feel free to contact us. More details will follow, as we get closer to the date. Hope to see you all there!

title: TEDxUpperWestSide: "BE THE CHANGE"
description:
"BE THE CHANGE"STEELCASE WorkLife Center, 4 Columbus Circle 7th FloorTuesday, April 26, 2016 9:15-4:45What is the nature of change? And what can individuals do to effect change in complex and challenging times? As the rate of change accelerates across numerous disciplines in the 21st Century, our ability to thrive amidst abruptly converging crises could be severely tested. How will we ride out the superstorms which seemingly lay dead ahead?
Enjoy a full day of LIVE TEDx talks featuring a dozen* innovative and insightful presenters -- including noted writers, educators, artists, broadcasters, thinkers, humorists and futurists -- from the Upper West Side and beyond!In addition, we will present a select few of the Best of TED Talks, PLUS LIVE musical tributes honoring legendary Upper West Side songwriters JOHN LENNON and GEORGE GERSHWIN -- rounding out a memorable day!
SPEAKERS*TODD HALES, MANAGER OF STRATEGY, RYDER SYSTEM, INC.KARLA BRANDAU, CEO @ WORKPLACE POWER INSTITUTEDIANA SENECHAL, AUTHOR & TEACHERMARGARET ANDERSON, FUTURIST & VISIONARYPETER BURGESS, CEO @ TRUE VALUE METRICSRAYMOND RIGOGLIOSO, FOUNDER @ GAY MEN OF WISDOMSAM LIEBOWITZ, THE CONSCIOUS CONSULTANTFLASH ROSENBERG, "ATTENTION SPAN FOR HIRE" CARTOONIST PHOTOGRAPHER, WRITER & PERFORMERCAROLYN HALPIN-HEALY, CO-FOUNDER, ARTS & MINDSFRANK WENNIN, FOUNDER @ COIN: CENTER OF INFLUENCE NETWORK
PERFORMERS*ALLEGRA LEVY, VOCALIST (GERSHWIN TRIBUTE)PAUL UKENA, GUITAR & VOCALS (LENNON TRIBUTE)*Currently scheduled speakers and performers (as of 4/14/16) may be subject to change without notice.

title: Alma - Theater #7
description: Alma – Genre: ComedyChile/2015/98 min.Directed by Diego RougierSpanish w/ English SubtitlesAlma, a cheerful bipolar piano teacher, finds out that her husband Fernando no longer stands her and her shifting moods and kicks him out of her house. At first, he thinks the move is a blessing in disguise. But his feelings for her are rekindled as soon as he finds out that Alma is going out with an Argentinian suitor. “Alma” represents a cinematic change of pace for Rougier whose first film, the Spaghetti Western tribute “Salt”, took Chicago critics and the public by surprise at the 28th Chicago Latino Film Festival.Alma, una alegre y bipolar profesora de piano, se entera que su marido Fernando ya no la aguanta ni a ella ni tampoco a sus cambiantes estados de ánimo y lo echa de la casa. Para Fernando, no hay mal que por bien no venga. Pero sus sentimientos hacia ella se reavivan cuando se entera de que Alma está saliendo con un pretendiente argentino. Con “Alma,” Rougier (cuya primera película “Sal”, su tributo a los spaghetti westerns, tomó a los críticos de Chicago y al público por sorpresa en el 28 Festival de Cine Latino de Chicago) se lanza de pecho a un género totalmente distinto: el de la comedia romántica.

title: Fallen Soldiers & Awards Ceremony
description: April 17th, 2016 – Fallen Soldiers & Awards Ceremony – where Special Celebrity Guests and Presenters (including Stephen Lang, Larry Bishop, Frank Dux, Stanley Isaacs, Jon Van Ness and more) will be honoring families of fallen soldiers from the Iraqi War with Hero Paintings done by Kaziah Hancock of their loved ones and announcing the BNFF 2016 Award Winners.Event Starts at 1:30pm at the Tonawanda Castle with the screening of Kandahar Journal (Documentary, 76min) about a photojournalist who reflects on the events behind his psychological transformation after covering front line combat in Kandahar, Afghanistan from 2066 to 2010.Then at 3pm to 4:20pm we will be showing a special presentation of Beyond Glory (Documentary, 80 min) Which follows acclaimed actor Stephen Lang as he tracks the ten year odyssey behind his one-man show about eight medal of honor recipients. Stephen Lang will be there in person with Director Larry Brand for a Q&A and presentation afterwards.Then at 5:50pm we will be showing Kaziah The Goat Woman (a short Documentary, 20 min) about one woman’s determination to paint portraits of all the fallen soldiers of the Iraqi War.At 6:15 we will give away the rest of the awards and acknowledgements to our fallen soldiers and film recipients.Special Guests Attending: - Among some of the special guests and presenters for this years event will be Timothy Payne (a local double amputee Army Airborne soldier and recipient of Lifetime Achievement Award from President Obama), Actor Stephen Lang (Avatar, Conan, Tombstone), Frank Dux(Bloodsport, Lionheart, The Quest, also whose real life story these movies were based on), Larry Bishop (writer, director, actor and son of Joey Bishop from The Rat Pack and friend of Quentin Tarantino’s and the BNFF. Some of Larry’s films include Underworld, Kill Bill 2, Mad Dog Time, & Hell Ride), Stanley Isaacs (writer/producer/director, Raptor Island, Gross Anatomy, Albert S. Ruddy and Alan Ladd Docs, is also a friend of the BNFF and husband of Cheryl Boone Isaacs who is currently the President of AMPAS, Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences), and Jon Van Ness (The Natural, Brubaker, The Postman Always Rings Twice, The Hitcher), Larry Brand (Halloween: Resurrection, Christina, A Perfect Man), Barry Kivel (The Natural, Bound, Crocodile Dundee, One Fine Day), Dick Delson (Writer/Publicist/Strategist for numerous Golden Globes, Academy Awards & Presidential Campaigns – some of Dick’s films include, American Graffiti, Jaws, Rocky, Lord of the Rings, Air Force One, Chicago, Gangs of New York, &100’s more...) Dick Delson has been credited with over 300 Academy Award Nominations and over 100 Wins for him and his clients and will be the BNFF’s 2016 Lifetime Achievement Award Recipient and more (for additional details email or call bill at bcowell@thebnff.com or 716-432-1065Entire Event will be held at the Tonawanda Castle, Ton., NY 14150 (April 17, 2016)

title: €23 for 6 Courses plus Bread. Special Offer Pop Up
description: As we approach our first year hosting Pop Ups at Events, Festivals, Bars and Restaurants all over Amsterdam we decided to celebrate by hosting a series of affordable, tasty and exclusive Pop Up Dinners at Tunnel37 in Amsterdam. For just €23 you can have a great night in the Tunnel, a 6 course meal cooked by our Chef in this cozy little space. All diners will share one long table making it a really social event, all you need to bring is yourselves and your own drinks. Yes this is a bring your own drink event (there is no bar) making it even more affordable. Apart from drink we will provide you with everything to make your night great (We will even supply Napkins), now thats value for money. Because of the space we only have 20 seats so we advise you book as quickly as possible to secure your spot and below is the menu to make it easier for you to decide what drink you would like to bring. This Dinner is on Friday 17th June and Saturday 18th June (Saturday has now Sold Out) and if all attendees could arrive at 7-15pm ready for the Bread to be served at 7-30pm. We hope you enjoy this event and we look forward in seeing you all.FRESHLY BAKED BREAD, SWEET AND SALTED BUTTER*** CHICKEN SKIN SANDWICH*** PAN FRIED SCALLOP, TRUFFLE, GOLDEN RAISIN PUREE, HOMEMADE RAISINS***WILD MUSHROOMS, PINENUT PUREE, CORRIANDER***GRILLED SIRLOIN OF BEEF, CARAMELISED CAULIFLOWER RISOTTO, BURNT ONION***DUTCH APPLE PIE***VANILLA BEAN PANACOTTA, PINK CHAMPAGNE, BASIL

title: Tampa Bay Women Grow Signature Networking Event
description: Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.Note: Tickets for the May event are pre-sale. Event information, including location, is TBD. Please check back for updates prior to the event. EVENT AGENDA6:30PM Check-in and Open Networking 7:00PM Sponsor Presentation 7:15PM Featured Speaker 7:30PM Open Networking 8:30PM Meeting ConcludesF.A.Q.Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Street parking is not guaranteed, plan accordingly.Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash.Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.TWITTER TIPSA great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabis

title: Extirpator of Idolatries - Theater #4 (1st Scr)
description: (1ST SCREENING)Extirpator of Idolatries/Extirpador de Idolatrías – Genre: DramaPerú/2014/86 min.Directed by Manuel SilesSpanish & Quechua w/ English SubtitlesPolice detective Waldo is investigating a series of crimes that may be linked to ancient indigenous rituals in the Peruvian Andes. His main suspect is a so-called “Extirpator of Idolatries,” a sinister and religiously intolerant character who claims to be in the area on a mission of faith. Waldo’s investigation also leads him to a boy and a girl who claim to be interacting with mythic beings. As he tries to put an end to the Extirpator’s crimes, Waldo will not only have to confront the intolerance of the institutions he represents but his own identity.El detective de policía Waldo está investigando una serie de crímenes que pueden estar vinculados a rituales indígenas ancestrales en los Andes. Su principal sospechoso es un tal “extirpador de idolatrías”, un personaje siniestro y religiosamente intolerante que dice estar en la zona en una misión de fe. La investigación también lo conduce a un niño y a una niña que afirman estar interactuando con seres míticos. Mientras intenta poner fin a los crímenes del extirpador, Waldo no sólo tendrá que lidiar con la intolerancia de las instituciones que representa pero también con su propia identidad.Shown with: Alien Hunter

title: Perla / Pearl - Theater #6
description: Pearl/Perla – Genre: Drama/Comedy/FamilyChile/2015/84 min.Directed by Sergio CastillaSpanish w/ English SubtitlesPearl, a mutt, is abandoned in the streets of Santiago by her owner. Samuel, a filmmaker, is suffering a severe case of writer’s block; the fact that his estranged daughter is back in town and his mother’s health is failingdoesn’t help at all. Pearl and Samuel cross paths after Perla is run over by a car. Samuel’s reluctant adoption of the dog after she follows him home may be the best thing that has happened to him in a while, as he begins to “listen” to her stories.Perla, una perra de raza mixta, es abandonada en las calles de Santiago por su dueño. Samuel, un director de cine, está sufriendo un severo caso de bloqueo mental; poco ayuda que su hija distanciada esté de vuelta en la ciudad y la salud de su madre se está deteriorando. Los caminos de Perla y Samuel se cruzan tras la perrita ser atropellada por un coche. Al principio Samuel se muestra reacio a adoptarla; pero pronto descubre que Perla es lo mejor que le ha pasado en mucho tiempo a medida que comienza a “escuchar” sus historias.Shown with: The Good Night / La Noche Buena

title: LGBTQ Iftar
description:
Promoting Unity, Love, and Empathy
A special evening on June 24th, at David Bouley's Test Kitchen in Tribeca, bringing together members of the LGBTQ and Muslim communities -- and those who belong to both -- to break fast and promote unity, love, and empathy.

Scheduled to speak are

Steve Mendelsohn, Deputy Executive Director of the Trevor Project

Hasan Minhaj, comedian, activist, and The Daily Show correspondent

Faisal Alam, founder of the Muslim Alliance for Sexual and Gender Diversity (MASGD)

Daisy Khan, Executive Director of the Women's Islamic Initiative for Spirituality and Equality (WISE).

A videographer will be capturing the evening so we can spread the message of unity to a broader audience.

Jehangir Mehta (Graffiti and Iron Chef America) will be the Guest Chef for the event.

Tickets
Tickets are limited. Donations are suggested, but not required to attend. 100% of ticket sales will be donated to The Trevor Project and Muslim Alliance for Sexual and Gender Diversity.

The Trevor Project, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, is the leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ young people ages 13-24.

MASGD works to support, empower and connect LGBTQ Muslims. They seek to challenge root causes of oppression, including misogyny and xenophobia. They aim to increase the acceptance of gender and sexual diversity within Muslim communities, and to promote a progressive understanding of Islam that is centered on inclusion, justice, and equality.

Donations to MASGD are made through their fiscal sponsor, the National Queer Asian Pacific Islander Alliance (NQAPIA), which is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.

Special Thanks
Special thanks to David Bouley for generously donating his immaculate Test Kitchen facility, Jehangir Mehta for donating his incredible culinary talents, Robb Moss for the florals, and to Mah Ze Dahr bakery, Agata & Valentina, Honest Chops, and The White Moustache for their generous food and beverage donations.

Online ticket sales have closed. If you would like to attend, please email LGBTQiftar@gmail.com. Thank you.

title: Innocent Killers - Theater #7
description: Innocent Killers/Asesinos Inocentes – Genre: ThrillerSpain/2015/95 min.Directed by Gonzalo BendalaSpanish w/ English SubtitlesJavier’s dreams of graduating alongside his colleagues and starting that new job that would have helped him pay all his student loans come tumbling down after he flunks his Ethics class. He decides to appeal his grade; his professor, a man suffering from acute depression, makes him an offer Javier just can’t refuse: the professor will change his grade and pay him a considerable sum of money if Javier kills him. And so begins a tense, fast-paced cat and mouse game that evokes Alfred Hitchcock’s “Strangers on a Train.”Los sueños de Javier de graduarse junto a sus compañeros de clase y comenzar ese nuevo trabajo que le ayudará a pagar todos sus préstamos estudiantiles se vienen abajo tras reprobar su clase de ética. Él decide apelar la nota; su profesor, un hombre que sufre de una depresión aguda, le hace una oferta que Javier simplemente no puede rehusar: el profesor cambiará su nota y le pagará una suma considerable de dinero si Javier lo mata. Así comienza un tenso y veloz juego del gato y ratón que evoca el “Extraños en un tren” de Alfred Hitchcock.

title: In Between:   A One-Man Show
description: In Between is a semi- autobiographical one-man show that portrays the complexities and contradictions inherent in  Palestinian-Israeli identity. On the precipice between two cultures stands Ibrahim Miari. His play recalls his childhood in Acre, memories of his Jewish and Palestinian grandmothers, of war, and of the struggle to shape and understand his own multi- faceted identity.  The program will include discussion with Mr. Miari and an analyst member of PAJA/Philadelphia Jung Institute.Ibrahim Miari is a theater artist and educator. A graduate of Boston University's MFA in Theater Education program, Ibrahim is originally from Israel where he performed with the Acco Theatre Center Ensemble for nearly 12 years. In addition to acting and directing, Ibrahim is also Sufi dancer and sacred dances instructor.PAJA/ Philadelphia Jung Institute hosts  Public Programs for all who are eager to explore and be enriched by the ideas of Carl Jung and analytical psychology for their personal and professional development. No prior knowledge of Jungian thought is required.Discounted parking available for lots at 1845 Walnut St. and 2101 Chestnut St.

title: Magallanes  - Theater #4 (1st Scr)
description: (1ST SCREENING)Magallanes – Genre: DramaPerú/Argentina/Colombia/Spain/2015/109 min.Directed by Salvador del SolarSpanish & Quechua w/ English subtitlesFeaturing an understated performance from Damián Alcázar as the title character, Peruvian actor Salvador del Solar's impressive directorial debut centers on a former soldier who now makes a meager living as a Lima cab driver, occasionally driving his senile former commander (Federico Luppi) around town. Magallanes’ violent past catches up to him one day when Celina (Magaly Solier), who was captured as a child by his platoon and used as a sex slave by his commander, enters his cab. Magallanes will see in that fortuitous incident a chance for redemption. Con una actuación comedida de Damián Alcázar en el papel principal, este impresionante debut como director del actor peruano Salvador del Solar se centra en un ex soldado que ahora se gana la vida como taxista en Lima, transportando de vez en cuando a su ex comandante senil (Federico Luppi) por la ciudad. Magallanes se reencuentra con su pasado violento cuando un día Celina (Magaly Solier), que fue capturada de niña por su pelotón y utilizada por su comandante como esclava sexual, aborda su taxi. Magallanes ve en ese incidente fortuito una oportunidad para redimirse.

title: The Great New Zealand Wine Tiki Tour
description: Kiwis love setting off on a Tiki Tour. It’s a trip where you take the scenic route, sidetrack a little, linger and experience new things. We invite you to join us on the Great New Zealand Wine Tiki Tour. An evening of meandering, digressing, indulging and awakening the senses.Who knows where, what or whom you’ll discover! What we do know is there will be amazing NZ wines, fascinating people and memorable photo opportunities. It’s time to escape and explore! NEWSauvignon Blanc Regional Counter The explosive varietal that awoke the world! Let us take you on a journey of taste and experience how terroir and winemaking results in the many unique styles of New Zealand, Sauvignon Blanc. Participating WineriesAra WinesBabich WinesClark EstateInvivo WinesMarisco VineyardsMarlborough WineMatua WinesMud House WinesOyster Bay WinesPernod Ricard WinemakersSacred Hill VineyardsSaint Clair Family EstateSileni EstatesSpy Valley WinesStaete Landt Wine CompanyStoneleigh Vineyardste Pa Family VineyardsToi Toi WinesVilla Maria EstateWhitehaven Wine CompanyWither Hills

title: International Tiger Day Festival
description: Come celebrate International Tiger Day with the big cats at Crown Ridge Tiger Sanctuary! Enjoy a fun-filled day of tigers (and a lion), music, food and so much more! This fundraiser is our biggest event of the year & 100% of the proceeds go back to the sanctuary to care for the animals. During the day you can meet a tiger keeper, watch the cats receive special treats throughout the day and visit one of the many vendors on site that day. Kids will have a blast playing the carnival/conservation games, having their face painted and creating items for the animals to tear up! This is fun for the whole family!Gates open at 10am and close at 3pm. Tickets are $5 online or $10 at the door.A lunch plate is included with each ticket purchased and will be served from 11am - 2pm.

title: Join the Revolution
description: April 8, 2016, 6:30 PM.An evening of music and West Texas cuisine starring The Quebe Sisters Band with a special appearance by Abilene ISD's fiddle group, Revolution Strings.  The evening starts with appetizers and refreshments on the patio of the Abilene Woman's Club while Revolution entertains.  Then inside for a great meal and the show starring The Quebe Sisters Band. Proceeds from ticket sales will benefit Revolution Strings' Recording Project. For those only wanting to attend the concert portion, tickets are available for a reduced rate. Concert only doors open at 7:20 PM.

title: Community Shabbat Dinner
description:
We're hyper-connected and hyper-busy. We know it's not good for us, but what is there for it? Shabbat!On Friday, April 15, join fellow members of the CBS community for a delicious Shabbat dinner following our 3rd Friday Musical Kabbalat Shabbat service. CBS Executive Chef Jane Sykes is crafting a Shabbat feast, and we encourage attendees to bring their favorite bottle of wine to share with others. Together, we will turn our attention from the demands of the work week, celebrate our points of connection, and enjoy some really, really good food!The menu: 
Vegetarian Shepherd's Pie (lentils, carrots, celery, tomatoes, and onion, topped with cheesy garlic mashed potatoes)
Green beans
Green salad (lettuce, tomato, jicama, cucumber, shredded carrot, with balsamic vinaigrette)
Butterscotch brownies
Tickets are $32 per adult and $15 per child. (Please note that reservations placed after 5 p.m. on Sunday, April 10, will incur a surcharge of $15 per person.)If you would like to sit with particular people you know are attending, please email Christopher Orev Reiger with the request (creiger [at] bethsholomsf.org).

title: L'Aménagement Paysager Comestible
description:
Apprenez comment transformer votre terrain en une oasis comestible. Venez explorer la magie de cultiver de la nourriture chez vous en ville. Semis urbains vous guidera dans une transformation de votre espace en un paradis Simple, Beau et Productif. Venez découvrir comment incorporer des arbres fruitiers, des petit fruits, des fines herbes, des fleurs comestibles et des potagers chez vous.

Pendant cet atelier d'aménagement paysager comestible nous allons vous apprendre a plannifier votre aménagement, planter et entretenir vos fruits et légumes.

Vous apprendrez  :


	Le meilleur endroit pour vos arbres fruitiers, votre potager et vos petits fruits
	Les trucs et astuces d'entretien, de taille et de formation
	Le compagnonnage des plantes
	Les solutions pour le jardinage sur le balcon et en petits espaces
	Le contrôle naturel des ravageurs et maladies

Pendant l'atelier nous allons avoir une séance hands-on de design ou vous allez travailler votre propre design avec notre aide. Apportez les mesures de votre terrain si vous les avez.

Atelier présenté par la co-fondatrice de Semis urbains et conferencière Tereska Gesing.

title: Seven % Solution Healdsburg
description: Bergamot Alley owners and a small group of winemakers got together in 2012 to talk about farming. They had noticed that roughly 93% of Northern California Vineyard acreage was planted to only eight grape varieties- the remaining seven percent home to hundreds of lesser known varieties. Noting the dominance of the ”Big Eight” this small posse of friends set out to help highlight that seven percent of acreage, the varieties that are grown there, the folks who make wine from these varieties, and all the supporting efforts from winemakers and farmers made to shift these acreage percentages. The Seven % Solution Tasting Event is the result of these efforts.Seven % Solution headlines winemakers who champion these grapes, tend terroir, and produce wine that is slowly but surely shifting the perception of California wines toward varietal balance. We look for wines which show varietal balance. We look for wines that come from organic and biodynamic farming practices. We look for wines that presents indicators of climate and terroir. We are proud to support these individuals, winemakers and farmers alike, and to help bring these "Seven % Solutions" to a new cadre of wine connoisseur.

Ginuwine will be joined by Toronto artists Témi, a l l i e and Délon Om, as well as DJ Nino Brown and DJ Jason ChuckUnlike other shows produced in Toronto 5y is cultivating a experience that will last amongst our guests. In doing so, we are taking a portion of every ticket sale and proceeding it to the Big Brothers and Sisters Foundation. In addition to this we currently trying to support inner city public school by having students come and see how the set-up of a concert is done.
