title: Women Grow Denver: HR & Recruiting
description:
Women Grow Denver presents:
HR & Recruiting for the Business Owner

Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.

Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.





EVENT AGENDA


6:30PM - 7:00PM Check-in and Open Networking7:00PM - 7:15PM WGD & Sponsor Presentation 7:15PM - 7:45PM HR & Recruiting Featured Speakers:



MAUREEN MCNAMARA, FOUNDER - CANNABIS
TRAINERS


Topic: Generational differences in the
workplace.

Selling Cannabis involves many risks. Failure to act responsibly and proactively could result in fines, imprisonment, and suspension of licenses, increased insurance costs, or getting shut down.

Cannabis Trainers invites savvy, professional operators to prepare their team to handle these potential risks with extensive, in depth training programs.

Maureen McNamara is a Trainer, Facilitator and Coach. She has led hundreds of workshops and coaches business professionals and entrepreneurs to create more success and joy in their lives.

With 20+ years of professional training experience, Maureen has trained and certified 10,000+ employees, managers and owners in national certification programs. She has facilitated classes for small locally owned businesses as well as international corporations.

Maureen is the Founder and Chief Facilitator with Cannabis Trainers™; a corporation created and deliver training solutions for the Cannabis Industry. She has combined her skills and expertise into a comprehensive, engaging new program to ensure the Responsible, Knowledgeable and Safe sale of cannabis: Sell-SMaRT™, safe marijuana retail training.

Maureen worked with the Colorado Department of Revenue- Marijuana Enforcement Division to design the Responsible Cannabis Vendor Program in 2014.  The Sell-SMaRT™ program created by Cannabis Trainers was the first CDPHE & MED approved program.

The team at Cannabis Trainers deliver highly interactive and compelling workshops with enthusiasm, humor and professional facilitation. In addition to the Sell- SMaRT™ program, they are pleased to deliver the nationally recognized ServSafe® Food Safety training.

Cannabis Trainers is a member of The National Cannabis Industry Association and a founding member of Women Grow. Committed to excellence, professionalism and safety; Cannabis Trainers is a powerful partner to organizations and businesses in the Cannabis Industry.




Carole Richter, Owner - CRichter ~ HR
Consulting, LLC


Topic: Society for Human Resource
Management (SHRM) and Corporate policy and procedure.

I am a Human Resources professional who strived to implement a consultancy approach long before adopting the title. With over twenty-five years of business, operations, human resources management training and experience, business leaders have appreciated my firsthand experience in operations, my understanding of how all the HR functions impact the bottom line, and the proper balance of employee and business needs.

Before focusing on HR, I established a solid track record as a successful business partner improving revenue generation and containing costs when working with start-ups and organizations undergoing explosive growth. I derived keen insights from my operational background enabling me to improve profitability through attention to return on investments, employee retention, improved organizational design and development, and aligning HR to organizational strategies and goals. My experience is largely based in retail, and other client or customer service industries, with exposure to mining and financial organizations. I have extensive experience in recruiting, training and facilitation, employee relations, negotiation and conflict resolution, talent management, leadership development and succession planning.

Recently, I completed a Master’s Degree in Human Resources Management with a Specialization in Organizational Leadership and have successfully applied my knowledge in the latest trends affecting HR and business today – talent management, employee engagement, leadership development and organizational culture. I remain current through education and networking, in large part, from my involvement with the Mile High Society for Human Resource Management, the local chapter of the global association of SHRM, where I serve as Secretary/Treasurer on the Board of Directors.

As a lifelong learner, I share my knowledge of successes… and failures. As a risk taker, I share the benefits of diversity and change while overcoming associated challenges. As an optimist, I emphasize the positives while dealing with the negatives.







CAELA BINTNER & CHRIS CASSESE, CO-FOUNDERS AND MANAGING DIRECTORS - FACES 
Topic: Differences between HR and recruiting


Caela Bintner brings more than two decades of communications, marketing and senior sales experience to Faces Human Capital Management (“Faces”), a Human Capital Management (HCM) company of which she is the co-founder. Faces is an entrepreneurial organization providing human resource solutions to the cannabis industry.  Prior to founding Faces, Ms. Bintner was an award winning sales and marketing executive at Insperity, and was a Vice President at Diversified Human Resources, a PEO with a geographic focus on medium sized businesses in the Southwest United States.  In these roles, she was known for her tenacity, deep client relationships, and ability to create customizable and scalable solutions.

Ms. Bintner began her career as a public relations specialist in The Bush Administration, where she became an expert in complex policy communications and working with national and international media.  She leveraged that experience into her own public relations company, Bridger Communications, where for over a decade she was the President and Founder of a strategic communications firm serving multi-national companies and political operatives in and around Washington, DC.

Caela is involved in a number of industry and policy organizations, including the National Association of Professional Employer Organizations (NAPEO), Women Grow, The National Cannabis Industry Association (NCIA) and Marijuana Business Association (MJBA). Caela is a Colorado native and graduated from University of Maryland College Park.



Chris brings 20 years of Sales Strategy and finance experience across a variety of business verticals. His vast professional network and array of experience brings breadth and depth to Faces Human Capital Management. He has worked at Fortune 500 Companies like Merrill Lynch, HSBC and Insperity. His tenure at these companies has allowed Chris to bring large company strategies and best in breed processes to small and mid - sized businesses.






CHRIS HOLMQUIST, SPHR, SHRM-SCP, CHIEF PEOPLE OFFICER  &

SCOTT AFABLE, CEO & FOUNDER – HIGHEST REWARD

Topic: Termination


Chris has spent over 15 years driving human resources strategy, improving operational efficiency, and promoting transparent business practices. Her intention is to guide the continued growth of the employer and employee relationship to promote a diverse and thriving workplace. She is inspired by and supports her wife's pursuits in the industrial hemp industry. They both strongly value and believe in the plant's natural ability to better our economy, environment, community, and overall quality of life. In her free time, Chris enjoys volleyball, yoga, hiking, music, farmers markets, and volunteering. You’re most likely to find her grilling homegrown meals, listening to music while entertaining close friends and family.



Scott’s experience spans over a decade alongside leaders and HR departments of fortune 500 companies and as a management consultant in both private and public sectors. His greatest desire is to see businesses connect to and embrace the people who make their success happen and for Cannabis to be known as a great place to work. He started Highest Reward in Colorado because it is the epicenter of Cannabis and where business entrepreneurship is currently flourishing. He enjoys live music, spending time with his family, and all things gummy candy.





KEEGAN PETERSON, FOUNDER AND CEO - WURK 

Topic: Outsourcing vs In house HR

Keegan has a background in retail consulting,
advising, and selling of large enterprise wide workforce management solutions
(including HR, PR, Time & Attendance, and Talent Management). He has worked
with over 50 of the nation’s most notable retail and hospitality clients,
scaling from small sized retailers to several of the top Fortune 500 brands. He
received his degree in finance from Florida Atlantic University in which he
also served as the starting punter for the schools division one football team.






8:30PM Meeting concludes

_________________________________________



Thanks to our wonderful sponsors! We extend our sincere appreciation to our sponsors, without whom our events would not be possible. We invite you to support these organizations. Please click on a logo to learn more about them.


 





F.A.Q.


Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.

Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.

How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.

Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.

Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.

What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Street parking is not guaranteed, plan accordingly.

Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash.

Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.

Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.

Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.
TWITTER TIPS
A great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!
#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabis #WomenGrowDenver

title: Salsation Workshop SMT Luis Calanche, Lisboa
description: Salsation Fitness Workshop with Luis Calanche -  Salsation Mastertrainer (SMT)************SALSATION is a dance workout that converts functional training protocols into innovative dance moves. The word “Salsation” stems from:   SALSA:   NOT from the rhythm / musical gender but from the spanish word  “SALSA” that actually means  "SAUCE”, because it is a SPICY mix of  different rhythms, cultures, dances and fitness protocols. SENSATION: the program has a strong focus on musicality, lyrical expression as well as on how the human body functions. Why Salsation?  What makes Salsation unique is that it is carefully designed to  integrate functional body movements into all dance routines working out  in a 3D fashion and using all planes of motion.  It’s not only easy and  fun but you can do it to improve your mobility and stamina no matter  your age.

title: Open House Party
description: The Grandview Gallery is opening! Join us for our first Open House Saturday, April 2nd, 2016 at 7:30pm! Tickets are FREE but LIMITED!We are starting this off right with a party featuring the works of Kelly Campbell Berry, Katy Seals, Jon Martindale, live music by Brittany Nicole and John Bomboy & the Underscores!Desserts provided and cash bar available... it is a party, after all!!!Come early and stay late as we celebrate the debut of the Grandview Gallery!

title: Newspaper Day 2016
description: The Advertising Club of Toronto is pleased to present Newspaper Day 2016.  This year our annual Newspaper Day Luncheon and Award Ceremony will take place on Thursday, April 7th, at the Arcadian Court in downtown Toronto.  Our event celebrates the industry by providing a forum to network and socialize amongst Canada's largest Newspaper players.  Our goal is to spark ideas and provoke conversation that will motivate audiences.  The keynote speaker will be announced shortly.  Additionally, at our event we award exceptional individuals who have been instrumental in developing the Canadian Newspaper industry.  Stay tuned for the People’s Choice and Merit Award nominees. Please also join us for drinks and entertainment at our after party in the Arcadian Lofts!

title: You’re Ugly Too / More Than God
description: Online sales have ended. You can still purchase tickets directly from the box office at Somerville Theater. Best Feature Proudly Presented by BA Event Promotions YOU’RE UGLY TOO2015 / Ireland (81 min) Director: Mark NoonanWill is released from prison on compassionate leave to care for his niece Stacey after the death of her mother. As they both head into the sleepy Irish midlands and attempt to be a family, they suffer a series of setbacks; Stacey is refused admission to the local school because of her recently developed narcolepsy; Will repeatedly comes close to breaking his prison-ordered curfew; and his attempts at being a father figure to her prove disastrous… As Stacey’s future hangs in the balance and Will must reckon with his own demons they search for a new way forward together.Director Mark Noonan in personMost Inspiring Short Proudly Presented by Alderman Jack Connolly MORE THAN GOD2015/Ireland (9 min) Director: Kev CahillA pious Doctor is forced to deal with a family matter whilst hiding under the bed of a stranger.

title: MRCF Your Feelings Don't Matter
description: You think comedians feelings matter?  They don't; at least not to you this fine eve as we give the audience kazoos to toot every time they hate you, or love you, or want to express emotion without clapping.  Hosted by the only comic without feelings Zach O Wiseman.9-9:50p*Erik Escobar*Brian Plumb *Joe Glasgow*Virgil Lestrange

description: Take me to the King

title: Bunny Maid Cafe Usagi-Chan Event
description: Official page: https://www.facebook.com/events/1512334272407847/Bun BUn Bunny Bun BUN! Bunny Maid Cafe Usagi-chan event is almost here! If you love the Neko Maid Cafe in Feb, don't miss out in March we will go again! We have bun-bun games and bun-bun performances, and also Bunny Maid Date Auction! Boop~~ :3Bunny Maid Event is right next to Little tokyo (5 mins away) in the Brewery Arts Colony, Next to Barbara's Bar, on the second floor (Studio #220), so feel free to "hop" on over after your regular scheduled LT trip! ^^ It is easy to find with plenty of free parking on site at the lot. $20 (cash at-the-door) will include: Bunny Open Bar, Bunny Games, Bunny Performances, Bunny dances, Bunny DJs, and Bunny Treats!Only pre-reg will get a door prize: Kawaii Easter egg with a surprise inside!Fundrasier Snack Booth will also be open! All items are always $2-5! It's super affordable! :) Cup Ramen, freshly grilled hotdogs, and more!Bun-Bun Games:- Leap Bunny : One maid bend down on her knees while another jumps over her! "Oops! I accidentally fell! Silly me~~!"- Chubby Bunny: Watch your favorite bunny maid play chubby bunny! Eating mashmellows and poofy cheeks is so adorable! :3- Shake Dat Bun-Bun: A game where the Bun-buns must shake their bun-buns to win!- Bunny Hop Dance: Audience participation required! Everyone get in a line and BUNNY HOP! ♥

title: Power Breakfast for A Power Player: Barbara Atkin
description: When: Monday, March 14 from 8AM - 10AM ESTWhere: Shopify TorontoPower Breakfast for A Power Player: FGI Presents Fashion Visionary Award to Barbara AtkinKick off Toronto Fashion Week as FGI celebrates internationally respected fashion trend forecaster, Barbara Atkin. Learn how she created innovative retail concepts such as the Holt Renfrew World Design Lab - an incubator for emerging designers and experimental ideas, and how she continues to nurture new ideas now.Who Should Attend?Executives in Fashion, Beauty, Retail, Marketing, Media, PR and related industries

title: QWS Kruger Award Dinner
description: The 2016 Quiet Water Symposium will again feature the Kruger Award Dinner. As part of the dinner program, the 2016 Verlen Kruger Award will be presented to Tiffany and Patrick Van De Hey. The Kruger Award is given annually to a person (or persons) who has supported and promoted paddle sports along with water conservation, education, or history in Michigan. The recipient of this award receives a plaque, and a brick on which the date and the name of the recipient is engraved. A duplicate brick will be added to the walkway around the Verlen Kruger Memorial located by the Grand River in Portland, Michigan. The recipient’s name is also engraved on a plaque that is housed at the AuSable River Center in Roscommon, Michigan. Presented by the Quiet Water Society a 501(c)(3) nonprofit corporation located in Lansing, Michigan.

title: How Doisy & Dam launched a chocolate startup
description: Stylist’s Reclaim Your Lunch Break: Hear how Doisy & Dam launched a chocolate start-up and grew a brandEd Smith and Richard Wilkinson, founders of the Doisy & Dam super-food chocolate company, will give you a little lunch-time inspiration by talking through how they built their vegan chocolate-bar business from scratch into a thriving brand, now with white and milk-chocolate launches. Learn how they grew their business from a blog, discover the secrets to taking your foodie passion global and how to grow an online audience right through to launching a product. Nibbles from Timberyard Soho will be provided, plus there will be plenty of chocolate to munch on. The talk starts at 1pm but pop in anytime between 12.30pm-2pm for Q&As and chocolate tasting.www.doisyanddam.com; https://tyuk.com/Share your experience: Twitter & Instagram: @doisyanddam; Twitter & Instagram: @timberyardukRemember to use the hashtag #ReclaimYourLunchBreak

title: The Winnipeg Parents and Kids Show 2016
description: Parents & Kids Show - A weekend dedicated to parenthood. Families will discover the latest family-related products & services, and will also be treated to fun and interactive entertainment in the Family Zone. Part of the proceeds from general admission will be donated in support of Variety, the children's charity; An organization that makes a meaningful and genuine contribution to the lives of Manitoba children.

title: Bring the nOISE
description: Dear Friends & Family,I just received my acceptance to OISE's Master of Arts in Child Studies & Education program - and I am inviting you to come celebrate! This is my dream - and I am here because of the love & support of all of you :DMy amazing boss, Lisa, has offered up our workspace (Action Potential Lab) to host the party, so for many of you it'll be your opportunity to check out where I spend most of my time these days. There will be activities, pizza + snacks, and for dessert, I'll be leading everyone through one of my favourite experiments at the lab - sorbet making!RSVP by getting a ticket below :) Can't wait to see you there!---BYOBDriving: Some parking available close by on Davenport - best to park at Loblaws (at Dupont) and walk up ChristieTTC: Catch the 26 bus from Christie station, 126 from St. George, or 127 bus from Spadina

title: Front Range Rally 2016
description: The Front Range Rally is a festival celebrating Colorado’s rich culture of Craft Brewing and the emergence of a growing cadre of quality Mobile Food Vendors. The two certainly go hand-in-hand and are a logical choice to support the work of Food Bank for Larimer County.Last year, 63 Craft Breweries and 13 Food Vendors served up an amazing array of unique food and fantastic beer. If you were there, you know what a blast it was. We’re working to make it even better this year!One Hundred Percent of the net proceeds from the festival go directly to Food Bank for Larimer County. In 2015, with a staff of 39 and over 2,700 volunteers, Food Bank provided more than 8.9 million pounds of food to thousands of people who struggle each day to feed themselves and their families. Front Range Rally is proud to be part of their mission. You can find more information about them at http://www.foodbanklarimer.org/Get your tickets early.  Prices go up after April 15th.  Must be 21 years of age to attend.

title: wolvesmouth: taxa at MOCA // sat, may 7 - SOLD OUT
description:
'Taxa' is wolvesmouth's new large-scale installation where food, music, and technology come together under the umbrella of art, to examine the precarious relationship between humans and nature.TICKET INFORMATION
Tickets are $225 per person (plus 3% credit card processing fee). The purchase of a ticket provides each ticket holder with entrance to the installation and a nine-course dinner prepared by the wolvesmouth team.
There are no limits on how many tickets you can purchase.
There are no refunds or exchanges for the tickets. All sales are final. This ticket is like a ticket to a concert, theater show, or sporting event.

Tickets can be transferred to another guest, but they cannot be resold beyond face value (which in many states is illegal and honestly, just not cool with us). If you do need to transfer your tickets to someone else, please make sure to let us know via email so that we can update your ticket with the new guest's information.
EVENT AND DINNER INFORMATION:
The installation is at the Geffen Contemporary at MOCA in Little Tokyo. 

The doors open for the installation promptly at the scheduled/ticketed time, with dinner starting soon thereafter. Please make sure to arrive 15 minutes before your event starts. We will start with or without you.


In addition to the regular menu, we are also offering pescatarian and vegetarian dinner options. Please select your preference at check-out. Due to the nature of the installation, we are unable to accommodate any other dietary restrictions/substitutions. If you have any food allergies, please send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com after you purchase your tickets.
You are invited to bring your own beverages to drink and to share with others. Beverages will not be sold at the event. We will provide water, ice, and glassware.
Parking is available at the museum and costs $8/vehicle. 
OTHER NOTES:
No dress code. Wear what you are most comfortable in.
Taking photos is always ok with us.
If you have any questions, send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com

title: Naturalization Basics: Casework & Filings | 2 CLE
description: We rely on volunteer attorneys to assist us in providing high quality legal assistance for our immigrant neighbors. Without you, we could not effectively serve the growing number of individuals & families entering our doors. In order to maximize our services we need your help. Join us on March 18th as Staff Attorney Rachel Van Tyle covers the basics of Naturalization casework in preparation for the Clinic's March 19th Naturalization Day - a one-day volunteer event.  Rachel will be instructing attorneys on how to interpret questionnaires, in addition to preparing the following: N-400 forms, G28 forms, disability forms, (RFE) Request For Evidence forms, and fee waivers.We are offering this course for free to those willing: to volunteer their services at the March 19th Naturalization Day or take 1 Naturalization case referral upon completion of this CLE.2 CLE - credits pendingAbout the Presenter: Rachel Van Tyle practices at the Neighborhood Christian Legal Clinic and focuses on immigration. She assists clients with adjusting status, family reunification, deferred action, asylum, and naturalization. Van Tyle earned her B.S. from Xavier University and her J.D. from Northern Kentucky University Salmon P. Chase College of Law. She serves as the Pro Bono Liaison for the Indiana Chapter of the American Immigration Lawyers Association and recently became a co-chair of the Welcoming Indianapolis Taskforce.

title: Comedy for Causes Benefit for Raelynn!
description: Join us for a great night of food and funnies as we help raise funds and awareness for Raelynn's rare condition. This beautiful girl is only 3 years old and since she was 8 months, she has suffered 7 strokes. The doctor's aren't even able to diagnose her condition. Proceeds from the show will help the family with medical costs and living expenses as they work to get help for Raelynn.

title: The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show
description: Get ready for short form (Whose Line is it Anyway?) improv at the Push Comedy Theater.You demanded it! So now it's here!!! Our very own short form improv show. All the fun of Whose Line is it Anyway... right here in Downtown Norfolk.The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv ShowFriday, February 26th, 8pmTickets are $5The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street and in the parking lot directly across from the theater.---The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For nearly ten years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. This fall they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.--The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Gotham Girls Roller Derby: Brooklyn vs. Manhattan
description: Our first game of the 2016 season is between the 2015 Champs Brooklyn Bombshells and the 2014 Champs Manhattan Mayhem. You do not want to miss these juggernauts in the season opener! See you trackside!Roller derby is a full contact sport played on quad skates. For full information on the rules and teams visit our site: gothamgirlsrollerderby.comDoors open at 6:00 pm and the game begins at 7:00 pm sharp.Children 5 and under (who can sit on a guardian's lap) admitted for free.

title: Carlo Lamagna @ Unit 120
description: TWO NIGHTS ONLY!Executive Chef Carlo Lamagna of Portland, Oregon's Clyde Common debuts his pop-up dinner series, 'Twisted Filipino,' at Unit 120 of Far East Plaza in Chinatown onWednesday, February 24 & Thursday, February 25Seatings will be at 5:30, 7:30, and 9:30$75 / personFor more info please visit http://www.unit120.com/schedule/ or email Alvin Cailan @ info@unit120.com

title: Graduating Gryphon Breakfast
description: As a Gryphon athlete you have dedicated a great deal of time, energy and effort to your sport and to your team. You have faced the challenges of balancing varsity athletics with your academic pursuits and as a student-athlete you have been held to a high standard. As a role model and ambassador for the University of Guelph we are very proud of your accomplishments as a student-athlete. As a token of our appreciation to your commitment to Gryphon Athletics, the Department of Athletics would like to invite you to the Graduating Gryphon Breakfast.You are receiving this invitation because you are a 4th or 5th year athlete. If you do not plan to graduate this year, we would ask that you wait until next year to attend. If you intend on graduating after this semester, please RSVP no later than 4pm on Wednesday, March 16, 2016.Wednesday, March 30, 20167:00am - 8:30amCutten Fields, Cutten Room190 College Ave East, GuelphEvery yesterday is a memory of dreams.Every tomorrow is a vision of hopes.Forever a GryphonIf you have any questions, please contact:Jennifer Green, External Relations and Event OfficerUniversity of Guelph, Guelph Gryphonsjgreen15@uoguelph.ca

title: Demo Con
description:
Demo Con is an epic celebration of Demo Entertainment's game universes and the global player communities that bring them to life. The ninth Demo Con will take place at the 180 Sansome St. San Francisco  
Hands-on play time with the latest versions of games
Global finals for eSports, featuring top pro gamers from around the world
In-depth discussion panels with game developers and artists
Community contests with great prizes

title: The Wedding Band Workshop
description: In a single five-hour workshop, you and your partner make your own wedding bands from scratch in silver, white gold, rose gold or yellow gold. Measure, cut, shape and polish your rings to perfection! Come in prior for a consultation and fitting to choose your styles. We can even set stones into the ring for you after for added bling! No prior experience necessary!

title: 420 Games Los Angeles 2016 + AFTER PARTY
description: THE 420 GAMES LOS ANGELES + PATO BANTON AFTER PARTY!where: Santa Monica Pier + The V Loungewhen: Saturday, March 26th, 2016 | 9am - 2pm at The Pier | 3pm - 8pm at The V LoungeCome join The 420 Games as we hold our FIRST ANNUAL LOS ANGELES 420 GAMES!This is a great event for all who want to exercise, listen to some beats, and partake in one of the fastest growing industries in the world!Event Info:Starting Saturday morning at 9:30am, we will take a trip from the North lot at The Santa Monica Pier heading South along Ocean Front Walk to VENICE BEACH, turn around, and back to The Pier. For 4.20 miles of exercise before The Event!Event is in the lot north of the pier.You can Walk, Jog, Skate, Ride, or even SUP the 4.20 miles!After the 4.20 mile course, join us in the Northwest Lot of The Santa Monica Pier, where we will have 2 hours of Beer Tasting sponsored by Lagunitas from 11am to 1pm, enlightening music, educational speeches, some comedy stand-up, and industry sponsors and exhibitors! Event at The Santa Monica Pier ends at 2pm, making way for the AFTER PARTY(details below)!Come join one of the fastest growing industries in America!Tickets options are available for all portions of this event.AFTER PARTY:Now, this is where the fun begins!After The Santa Monica Pier portion of the event, around 2pm, we will head over to The V Lounge where we will meet up with INTERNATIONAL REGGAE SUPERSTAR PATO BANTON as well as THE KYLE TURLEY BAND from 3PM - 8PM!The After Party will play host to medical sampling for those with valid 215 Recommendations, meetings with industry reps, and an amazing concert!Shuttles will be available to take participants from The Pier to The V Lounge from 2pm-3pmAfter Party ends at 8pm.COME RUN WITH US AND FORGE A NEW RESPECT FOR CANNABIS USERS!Get your tickets now, availability is limited.

title: Gamma Phi Winter Date Party!
description: Gather at the house by 9:45 for pictures and snacks and we'll load up the buses at 10. Then we'll have a fun and memorable day at Six Flags! The buses will be leaving the park at 6 so we should be back at the house by 7:30 (or 8 by the absolute latest).

title: Celebrate Toronto - 182nd Anniversary
description: ☆ Celebrate Toronto –  182nd Anniversary - Midnight Soirée ☆Join us on Saturday March 5th, 2016 at 7:00 pm at Steam Whistle Brewing (255 Bremner Blvd), to look back and celebrate Toronto’s past, and down the track to our promising future together!▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬[The Event] - Entertainment -7:00pm – Gallery Reception, complimentary Hors D'oeuvres9:00pm - Live Band10:30pm – Live Band** Midnight Countdown for Toronto's 182nd Anniversary! **12:00am - DJ  - Photography Presentation by Thank You Toronto - - Live Body Painting by Liquid Imprints - - Dress - Cocktail Attire, Dancing Shoes!Tickets include: Complimentary Hor' Doeouvres, Panago Pizza, Coat Check, non-alcoholic beverages, Swag bag- Check out the Official Video from 2014 -https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HJl3H5AbDl0▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬[Tickets]Early Bird - $30.00General Admission - $40.00 TICKETS NOW ON SALE www.celebratetoronto.ca/tickets- or -Soundscapes: 572 College St West, Toronto▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬[The Mission]Celebrate Toronto collaborates with local artists, entertainers and businesses in celebrating Toronto's "Past, Present, and Future" while highlighting its accomplishments and diversity. Our goal is to bring the city together in pride of their home. Throughout the year, Celebrate Toronto is dedicated to the development of sustainable projects across the city, supporting and promoting innovation for Toronto's future. We work towards informing and inspiring others to make a positive impact in our city and enriching the lives of those within it. ▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬www.CelebrateToronto.caFor any questions/inquiries please contact us at info@celebratetoronto.caphotography provided by @Jazzyphotos

title: Damage Inc, Tribute To Metallica, Noise Pollution
description: Damage Inc is Southern California's premier tribute to Metallica.Damage Inc has been privileged to be featured on AXS TV’s “The World's Greatest Tribute Bands” show.They have spent the last ten years playing numerous sold-out venues, as well as donating their time to several benefits concerts.  With a never-ending library of timeless classics mixed with today's hits, Damage Inc captivates audiences with the sound and intensity of a live Metallica performance.Special guestsNoise Pollution ( The Ultimate AC/DC Experience )

title: Salsation Workshop Radom by SMT Angelika Kiercul
description: SALSATION is a dance workout that converts functional training protocols into innovative dance moves. The word “Salsation” stems from:     SALSA:   NOT from the rhythm / musical gender but from the spanish   word  “SALSA” that actually means  "SAUCE”, because it is a SPICY mix of    different rhythms, cultures, dances and fitness protocols. SENSATION: the program has a strong focus on musicality, lyrical expression as well as on how the human body functions. Why Salsation?    What makes Salsation unique is that it is carefully designed to    integrate functional body movements into all dance routines working out    in a 3D fashion and using all planes of motion.  It’s not only easy  and   fun but you can do it to improve your mobility and stamina no  matter   your age.

title: AAU Junior Olympic Games
description: For the second time in four years, Houston and Harris County will play host the AAU Junior Olympic Games.An estimated 18,000 amateur competitors and 30,000+ spectators from across the United States will make their way to Houston to take part in this 11 day event!The AAU Junior Olympic Games is held annually each summer in communities around the country. Comprised of 18 sports, the Junior Olympics will take place at multiple venues across the Houston area. Sports include Track &Field, Multi-Events, Basketball, 7 on 7 Football, Bowling, Swimming, Field Hockey, Jump Rope, Baton Twirling, Karate, Kung Fu, Taekwondo, Powerlifting, Weightlifting, Table Tennis, Trampoline & Tumbling, Wrestling, and Sport Stacking2016 marks the 50th Anniversary of the AAU Junior Olympic Games and with the Harris County - Houston Sports Authority leading the charge, these Games look to be bigger and better than ever!

title: ONLINE TICKETS CLOSED! VibeUP & Kathryn Budig
description:
:: SOME TICKETS AVAILABLE AT THE DOOR FOR $60 / $30 FOR JUST BOOK::VibeUP Presents: KATHRYN BUDIG'S "AIM TRUE" NATIONAL BOOK LAUNCHTHE OFFICIAL TOUR STOP IN CHICAGOWHO IS KATHRYN? Kathryn Budig is an internationally celebrated yoga teacher and author. With over a decade of experience in her field, she is the yoga contributor to Women's Health magazine, writes weekly for Yoga Journal, and serves on the Yahoo! Health advisory board as well as contributing regular recipes. Kathryn teachers around the world and now here is your chance to catch her in Chicago on her official book launch tour. (Learn more about Kathryn below.) WHAT IS IT?Come take a class from Kathryn herself and 400+ yogi's as we officially launch her brand new book, "Aim True", together in Chicago. After class hear from Kathryn about the purpose of her book & daily mantra, "Aim True", then stick around to socialize mindfully + get your very own book signed!  VibeUP is about growing a conscious community -- come sweat, meditate, consume consciously, rejuvenate & heal, be mindful, get inspired, & join old & new like-minds! Don't want to yoga? Just get a 8:15PM social ticket!

WHERE IS IT?BLOCK37. 3RD FLOOR. 108 North State Street. Chicago, IL. See map below.

WHEN IS IT? THU. MAR31, 5:30-9:30PM.

5:30PM :: DOORS OPEN - MEET & MINGLE WITH HEALTH & WELLNESS VENDORS & FRIENDS!

7PM :: 75minute Yoga Class Led by Kathryn Budig

8:15-9:30PM :: MiniTalk + Book Signing + "SOCIAL" with conscious snacks, drinks, vendors, & more!

Don't want to yoga? No prob. Get the 8:30pm ticket for just the talk + signing + social. 
GA TICKET INCLUDES
Entrance begins at 5:30pm, please arrive by 6:30pm
Your very own copy of the new book, "Aim True" ($25 value)
A 60+ minute yoga class from Kathryn Budig 
After class enjoy a brief talk about the book followed by a book signing with the Author
Meal options from SPRIG (for new users only) - more info coming soon.
Healing sessions including reflexology, massage, health coaches & more.

Health & protein bars from LUNA BAR

Jerky from Krave Jerky

Receive your own copy of "Aim True" for signing if desired. 
Brief talk by Kathryn after class + book signing option & social

BRING YOUR OWN MAT & WATER BOTTLE.
BE SURE TO ENTER 30MINS PRIOR TO CLASS.

----------------------------------------------MEET KATHRYNKathryn Budig is an internationally celebrated yoga teacher and author known for her accessibility, humor, and ability to empower her students through her message, "aim true." She is a warrior for self-acceptance, honesty, and helping her students and readers find true balance. The Kansas native graduated from the University of Virginia with a double degree in English and Drama before moving to Los Angeles, where she trained under the tutelage of Maty Ezraty and Chuck Miller.With over a decade of experience in her field, she is the yoga contributor to Women's Health magazine, writes weekly for Yoga Journal, and serves on the Yahoo! Health advisory board as well as contributing regular recipes. She's a sponsored athlete in Under Armour's "I WILL WHAT I WANT" campaign, an ambassador for Ford's "Warriors in Pink," and the founder of her animal project, Poses for Paws. She is the creator of the Aim True Yoga DVD produced by Gaiam, author of The Women's Health Big Book of Yoga, and will be releasing her second book,Aim True, in early 2016 through William Morrow; an imprint of Harper Collins.You can practice with Kathryn around the world at workshops, festivals, and conferences, & we hope to see you at her official Chicago stop on her national tour on Thursday, March 31, 2016. OUR OFFICIAL EVENT SPONSORSADDITIONAL TERMS & CONDITIONS:MUST BE 18 YEARS OLD TO ENTER OR WITH PARENT. 21+ TO CONSUME ALCOHOL. MUST BRING YOUR OWN YOGA MAT. ARRIVE AT LEAST 30MINS BEFORE CLASS. ALL GUESTS ENTER AT THEIR OWN RISK AND PARTICIPATE IN ALL HAPPENINGS WILLINGLY AND KNOWINGLY INCLUDING ACTIVITIES, SPONSORS, PHOTOGRAPHY, VIDEO, ETC. title: NEW CITY ART FAIR New York 2016
description: After its launch in March 2012, New City Art Fair, a boutique art fair which aspires to globalize contemporary Asian art, will return for its fifth New York edition, March 3-6 2016. Hosted by Hpgrp Gallery in Tribeca, moved its location from Chelsea last year, this edition will exclusively present Japanese exhibitors. Its opening day will conclude that evening with a reception party (invitation only) from 6:30-8:30 pm, welcoming contemporary art enthusiasts with a traditional sake reception. On view will be works focusing on young and emerging Japanese artists accessible to new and seasoned collectors alike, in media ranging from painting, drawing, and photography, to sculpture, and mixed-media constructions. The fair will include booths by five participating galleries from Tokyo including Einstein Studio, Gallery Kogure, Harmas Gallery, The blank Gallery, and Hpgrp Gallery.NEW CITY ART FAIR New York 2016Dates: Thursday, March 3rd - Sunday, March 6th, 2016Thursday, March 3: Preview 11:00am-6:00pm  Reception Party 6:30pm-8:30pm  (Invitation only)Friday, March 4th 11:00am-7:00pm / Saturday, March 5th 11pm-7pm / Sunday, March 6th 11pm- 6pmVenue: hpgrp GALLERY NEW YORK (434 Greenwich Street. New York, NY 10013)Admission: FreeURL: www.newcityartfair.comFacebook: www.facebook.com/newcityartfair   Twitter: www.twitter.com/NEWCITYARTFAIRInstagram: @newcityartfair

title: Rabbit Hole
description: Winner of the 2007 Pulitzer Prize. "Grade: A! A transcendent and deeply affecting new play, which shifts perfectly from hilarity to grief." —Entertainment Weekly. "RABBIT HOLE presents a tragedy and its consequences with utter candor, and without sentimentality. The dialogue is most impressive for capturing the awkwardness and pain of thinking people faced with an unthinkable situation—and eventually, their capacity for survival, and even hope." —USA Today. Becca and Howie Corbett have everything a family could want, until a life-shattering accident turns their world upside down and leaves the couple drifting perilously apart. RABBIT HOLE charts their bittersweet search for comfort in the darkest of places and for a path that will lead them back into the light of day. (R, Drama)

title: Blithe Spirit
description: To gather material for his next book, Charles and his strait-laced second wife Ruth, invite the eccentric clairvoyant Madame Arcati to their country home to conduct a séance. However, the ‘spirited’ séance goes wrong when the ghost of Charles’ first wife, Elvira, is inadvertently summoned. Appearing only to Charles, the wild and temperamental Elvira soon outstays her welcome by making increasingly desperate attempts to disrupt Charles' marriage to Ruth. In a clash of personalities, ghostly and mortal, love and marriage soon turns into laughter and mayhem when the feuding wives plot to sabotage each other’s and Charles’ existence! (PG, Classic Comedy)

title: Winters vs Montreal: The 2016 Edition
description: Winters vs Montreal: The 2016 EditionNew and continuing members of Winters College, you are about to embark on one of the most anticipated events Winters College has to offer. Come join us as we set out on yet another adventure to Montreal in the hopes of creating unbelievable stories and lasting memories.  Ticket Sales Date: Sunday, January 31st 2015 @ 11:59pm estTickets will be sold ONLY online.First come first Serve.A maximum of 2 tickets per transaction will be acceptable. Do not try to exceed this limit. We will know and this may result in you forfeiting your ticket for yourself and whom ever you are purchasing for. You must create a Uniiverse account in order to purchase a ticket. It is recommend you do this before the time of purchase so you can later refresh fast, they will sell out!**Non-York and Winters students may attend this trip ONLY IF they are attending with a current York student OR York Alumni affiliated  from WINTERS(no ifs, ands or buts). The Winters student will be responsible for the Non-York/Non-Winters student on the trip. This means we reserve our tickets specifically for WINTERS students and are not intended for other colleges or students(i.e. McLaughlin College).**Winters Alumni are permitted to attend this trip. That being said with such a limited amount of tickets sold, in order to provide opportunities for new members of the community and current students, we are limiting Alumni participation to people who have been graduated for one year, with few exceptions.** *Pricing is set for Winters affiliates. If you are not a Winters affiliate or a student your rate is $103. You will be required to pay the difference during sign ins before you can attend the trip. If you do no pay the additional $10 you will not be permitted to attend the trip. Refunds & Returns****When tickets sell out, a waiting list will be generated; any refunds will be given to those on the waiting list on a first come first serve basis. The waiting list will work just like purchasing a ticket. You will be required to fill out all the required fields and provide you credit card information. You WILL NOT BE CHARGED if you are not  accepted from the waiting list. Once you are accepted you will receive an e-mail confirmation that you have been charged. ****-If you decided not to attend the trip you may not simply "SELL" or "GIVE AWAY" your ticket. Tickets are to be return to Winter College Council and they will refund you. All available tickets are to go to those on the waiting list first.(Note we have all your information on file, if you give away a ticket to someone who in not on our list, we will know and they will not be able to attend the trip or board the bus.)IF YOU CANNOT ATTEND MONTREAL vs. WINTERS 2015 and WOULD LIKE A REFUND Bring your EMAIL CONFIRMATION (printed) to the Winters College Council office by Friday February 12th, 2016. This will be the last day to refund.The Trip:Date: Thursday, February 18th 2016 @ 6:00a.m -Sunday, February 21, 2016@ 12p.m (@york aprox. 6pm)Location: Hotel Le Saint-Andre: 1285 Saint-André Rue Montreal, QC Busses DEPART Winters promptly at 6:00 AM on Thursday, February 18th, 2016. Please meet in the Winters College Dinning Hall 001 with everything packed and ready to go no later then 5:00 AM for sign in. The Dinning Hall is Located Across from the Complex one Caffe in the basement of Winters. For sign ins please bring with you:1. YU Card2. Signed Waiver Form (if you haven't already handed it in)The busses will be leaving at 6:00AM sharp once everyone is boarded, WITH or WITHOUT you. Arrive on time or be disappointed. Roommate Request & Waiver FormsIn regards to rooming in Montreal, we ask that you request either two OR four people to a room. A room Request Document will be emailed to all attendees, so be sure your emails are entered correctly! If you only know one person who you would like to share a room with, put yours and the other person's name and we will group you with another pair if needed. Please ensure you pre plan your room preferences and submit them by February 8th. Again, these are only room requests. We will try our best to accommodate you, but please note you may not get your preferred choices.All Attendees will have to sign a legal waiver and disclaimer form to be submitted during sign in on the day of the trip. ALL ATTENDEES MUST SIGN A WAIVER FORM BEFORE THEY GET ON THE BUS!************FOR LIABILITY PURPOSES WINTERS COLLEGE COUNCIL RESERVES THE RIGHT TO DENY THE PURCHASE OF OR REFUND ANY TICKET**************______________________________________________For more information feel free to contact our VP SoCul Angelica Grospe: vpsocul@winterscouncil.com or Check the online Facebook event page______________________________________________- By purchasing this ticket you have agreed to the above guidelines. If you have any questions regarding this, please email Taneisha McAdams at president@winterscouncil.com for any additional questions.

title: Macbeth
description: “Fassbender was born for this.” -The TelegraphJustin Kurzel’s Macbeth is the latest fantastic adaptation of Shakespearean’s grittiest, and it is being cited as one of easily one of the best, due to the fantastic performances from Fassbender in the titular role and Cotillard as Lady Macbeth. Although the question “What more can you do with Macbeth after so many great directors have already touched it?” seems to be a natural query, Kurzel takes the already blood-soaked classic tale and digs deeper, creating a gruesomely dark, enthralling depiction of one of literature’s most ill-fated main characters. Justin Kurzel hits the screens like a bat out of hell, with his only previous feature being the brutal serial killer flick Snowtown, set in his hometown. This visceral viewing is as beautiful as it is dark, and deserves to be remembered in the annals of time as one of the necessary Shakespeare adaptations.

title: TEDxNorwichED
description: TEDxNorwichED is a contemporary, relevant and inspiring  TEDx event, which is being designed to stimulate discussion and action around how we can ‘think differently’ about education.TEDxNorwichED will be the first education focused TEDx event to be held in the UK for over two years.   We want to encourage anyone who is interested in education (whether or not they work in education)  to attend and be part of the discussion.The event will be open to people from across the UK, but a set proportion of tickets will be reserved for those from the East of England. What will happen at TEDxNorwichED?You'll hear a carefully curated program of talks by renowned 'thinkers'- both within the education field and beyond.    Each speaker will present an 'an idea worth sharing' about education and how it could be improved, through an inspiring and engaging 'TED style' presentation.      Expect short, lively and entertaining presentations which really make you think.There will be plenty of carefully planned opportunities for networking and discussion, so that the event can act as a springboard for real, grass roots, change.What are TEDx Events? In the spirit of ideas worth spreading, TED has created a program called TEDx. TEDx is a program of local, self-organized events that bring people together to share a TED-like experience. Our event is called TEDxNorwichED, where x = independently organized TED event. At our TEDxNorwichED event, TEDTalks video and live speakers will combine to spark deep discussion and connection in a small group. The TED Conference provides general guidance for the TEDx program, but individual TEDx events, including ours, are self-organized.

There is also limited parking on the street and in the lot directly behind the theater.The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts. The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting. Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Powerful Grace with Dirty Martini
description: Epaulement and other naughty foreign words a burlesque queen should know...This class teaches the essential studies of ballet as applied to burlesque movement.  Perfect for adult beginner dancers, Powerful Grace explores the structure of a classical ballet class but breaks free of the traditional applying ballet principals to basic burlesque dance movement.  The class focuses on economy of movement and corporeal awareness for stage performers.  Ballet barre warm up leads to bump and grind center.  Tailor made for any level of expertise, students can learn the building blocks of choreography, mastering them for use on the stage.

title: Inspiring Deeper Learning with Music
description: Why do we teach and learn our ABC’s with a song? Learning techniques that use music, motion, humor and fun take place in the affective domain of the brain, and tend to be deeper and longer lasting. Join two veteran singer-songwriter-performers for tips and tools for using music to teach and reinforce concepts for long term behavioral changes.Remy Rodden is a singer-songwriter and Manager of Environmental Education and Youth Programs with the Department of Environment, in Whitehorse, Yukon, Canada. He's performed his "not-for-kids-only" nature and conservation songs from coast to coast to coast in Canada, and every continent including Antarctica -- in schools, in festivals, at conferences, and for the penguins! Joyce Rouse (Earth Mama) is a singer, songwriter, actor, educator and creator of the  Earth Mama® music projects.  She addresses the critical issues facing our planet, as inspired by her love of Earth and her Masters Degree in Earth Literacy.   She communicates her messages in an effective and entertaining way, in words adults and children alike can readily understand, and in a variety of tempos that make them fun to listen to and easy to remember.  Her songs are heard world-wide through various media, at Earth Mama concerts, and on her eleven CD’s which now play on six continents.

title: Trademarks & IP Protection | Business Masterclass
description:
About the MasterclassTrade marks can be a minefield and a huge expense for a new business. However, the importance of protecting your brand and intellectual property can not be underestimated at any stage of operating a business. This interactive workshop will give you access to the fundamentals of trade marks and why they matter. What you'll learn: 
What a trademark is and why it is so important

How to apply for a trademark
How your brand strategy might be affected by existing trademarks
At what stage of your business you need to be considering trademarks
How to protect your intellectual property in other areas of your business
What to do if you believe your trademark rights are being infringed
How and why to trademark your brand internationally
Who is this Masterclass for?Whether you’ve got existing trademarks or are considering registering a trade mark for a new idea, this workshop will explain the important factors to consider, implications of infringing existing trademarks and how trademarks can protect the longevity of your business.About the InstructorsHannah Finster is a second year trainee solicitor at Hansel Henson. Her work focuses on intellectual property, commercial and digital media law. Hannah has experience assisting on commercial transactions and agreements. She provides advice on a variety of intellectual property rights including trade marks and copyright, with a particular expertise in registered and unregistered design rights.Important Refund Notice: Please double/triple check your diary. Sadly no refunds can be offered.

title: OWFF takes a trip with Syrian refugees January 28
description: Online ticket sales for tonight's presentation of On The Bride's Side have closed but there are still tickets available! Please purchase your ticket at the ByTowne Cinema box office at 325 Rideau Street. Note: The ByTowne Cinema only accepts cash, but there's an ATM there that you can use.Thank you to everyone who purchased a ticket in advance. We look forward to seeing you this evening!Join One World Arts and the One World Film Festival on January 28th, 2016 at 6:45PM at the ByTowne Cinema (325 Rideau St., Ottawa) for a one-night-only screening of the acclaimed documentary ON THE BRIDE'S SIDE.The film follows five asylum-seekers from Syria and their European supporters as they travel from Milan, Italy to Stockholm, Sweden over four days in a fake wedding party."More than a traditional documentary, On The Bride’s Side is a  statement   and an irreverent act of defiance on the part of a  seldom-heard  segment  of Europeans who feel the need to speak out  against immigration  laws  they deem unjust and arbitrary." Juan  Baquero, Hot DocsA discussion on responding to refugees fleeing the war in Syria will follow On The Bride's Side.Tickets are $12.00.  Media are invited to attend free of charge. Please RSVP to media[at]oneworldarts[dot]ca attend.ABOUT ON THE BRIDE'S SIDEA Palestinian poet and an Italian journalist meet five Palestinians and Syrians in Milan who entered Europe via the Italian island of Lampedusa after fleeing the war in Syria. They decide to help them complete their journey to Sweden – and hopefully avoid getting themselves arrested as traffickers – by faking a wedding. With a Palestinian friend dressed up as the bride and a dozen or so Italian and Syrian friends as wedding guests, they cross halfway over Europe on a four-day journey of three thousand kilometres. This emotionally charged journey not only brings out the stories and hopes and dreams of the five Palestinians and Syrians and their rather special traffickers, but also reveals an unknown side of Europe – a transnational, supportive and irreverent Europe that ridicules the laws and restrictions of the Fortress in a kind of masquerade which is no other than the direct filming of something that really took place on the road from Milan to Stockholm from the 14th to the 18th of November 2013.The One World Film Festival is Ottawa's longest-running annual documentary film festival focused on raising awareness on a diverse range of global issues. The festival presents thought-provoking documentaries, panel discussions with experts, Q&As with filmmakers, and an information fair, connecting audiences with opportunities to learn more about and take action on issues of local and global concern.One World Arts is a volunteer-based, Canadian charitable organization that has been raising awareness and fostering public engagement on global issues since 1972.

title: DSQ presents: Schubert's 'Winterreise'
description: Diderot String Quartet is joined by Grammy-award-winning singer Dashon Burton and bassist Doug Balliett, for a winter’s journey not to be missed.  Franz Schubert’s 'Winterreise' song cycle, based on poems by Wilhelm Müller, tells a devastating story of unrequited love and isolation.  It is one of the final works completed by 31-year-old Schubert before his death, and has left a lasting mark on the vocal repertoire.  Originally for voice and piano, this arrangement for voice and string quintet by Harold Birston, performed on historical instruments, adds new dimensions of color and texture to the haunting work.

title: Planetfall Sci-Fi Larp - Game 3 - Beta Series
description:
Become a colonist struggling to survive on an alien world. 200 years in the future, Earth struggles under environmental devastation and a tyrannical government. A lucky and disposable few are sent on the first mission to colonize another Earth-like planet 36 light years from Earth. Your wits, your knowledge and your courage are the tools you will use to survive.Planetfall is taking Live Action Gaming into the future. It is a roleplay-centered immersive game using groundbreaking mobile technology to create a unique live action gaming experience. We are based in Austin, Texas.Schedule

Saturday 0900 - 0930
Check-in


Saturday 0930 - 1000
Announcements and Opening Ceremonies


Saturday 1000 - 2200
Game (Staff On Site)


Saturday 2200 - Sunday 0900
Night Cycle (No Staff, RP only)


Sunday 0900 - 1400
Game (Staff On Site)


Sunday 1400 - 1500
Closing Ceremonies and Cleanup

More information is available at: http://www.prepareforplanetfall.comContact the staff or any player for an invite code.Site and Catering DetailsThere are no sleeping quarters on site. Please bring a tent if you plan to stay overnight, along with appropriate sleeping bags for the weather and wind. This is the windy plains of Texas, so tent stakes are highly recommended.Two breakfasts, two lunches and a Saturday night dinner will be provided to people who purchase the meal package with their ticket. Fire pits and limited electric will be available for cooking. If you do not wish to buy a meal plan, please bring your own food. Genre appropriate food is highly encouraged, e.g. MREs, ration bars and the like.Meal plans must be pre-purchased by the Wednesday before the game. A limited number of meal plans may be available for purchase on site, but you are not guaranteed to receive one.New PlayersYou can obtain an invite code from any current player. You can use this invite code to register and create your character on our website: http://prepareforplanetfall.com/#/signupYou must bring a 'drop box' where all your character's personal equipment, including guns, can be stored before the drop sequence, marked with your characters name. A plastic bin should be fine. The only items you will have in the drop sequence is your costuming and your personal scanner (i.e. cell phone or tablet)Large items such as tents can be stored in your car and taken out after your box is recovered, for simplicity's sake.

title: Robert, by Briana Brown. A workshop reading.

title: Jay Nash
description: Jay Nash’s music is like the river that raised  him—strong and deep, with a little bit of lullaby and a big damn  current. Twenty years ago, he played loud in bars along the Saint  Lawrence River, in the reaches of New York so far-flung they’re almost  Canadian. For the last decade, he’s journeyed the US and Europe solo,  selling over 60,000 records without ever putting ink on a conventional  record deal. Now in the green mountains of Vermont, the quiet cold of  winter rarefies wit and musicianship into the kind of Americana that  knows where it comes from.

title: Holiday Great Skate at Marriott
description: The Holiday Great Skate at Marriott will be delighting families, couples and skating enthusiasts this December with a 2,400 square foot eco-friendly synthetic skating rink. During four fun-filled weeks enjoy skating under the sun and stars at the Courtyard Scottsdale Salt River located at 5201 N. Pima Rd. Scottsdale, AZ 85250.This year's skating kicks off on December 9th, 2015 and will continue through January 3rd, 2016.Hours:Monday - Friday: 4:00 pm - 10:00 pmSaturday & Sunday: 10:00 am - 10:00 pmShow voucher upon arrival to obtain your all-day skating pass. NO REFUNDSThe Great Skate FAQ’sQ: Are skate rentals included?A: Yes. Included in your skating purchase is a pair of rental skates. Skates come in all sizes for both adults and children.Q: How long will I be skating?A: As long as you want on the day you purchased your admission. The admission passes are an all-day pass. Q: Are there any age restrictions? A: Children must be at least 5 years oid to participate in the Great Skate. Q: I have a large group, will we all be able to skate together?A:  The 2,400 square foot skating rink can hold a maximum of 40 skaters. For large groups we suggest coming earlier in the day or during week days. Q: Does the surface skate like real ice?A: It won’t be made of ice. Instead, skaters will glide on top of a recyclable polymer surface made to look like ice. Skaters will wear real skates, but the surface won’t feel cold like traditional ice. The synthetic rink requires no electricity or refrigeration. To keep it slippery, the surface with be sprayed with a slide enhancer liquid that reduces the friction of skate blades. The surface will skate just slightly slower than real ice.Q: I pre-purchased a ticket, what do I do now?A: Bring your pre-purchased ticket or voucher to the Great Skate ticket booth which is located at the rink. Here you will exchange your ticket or voucher for an all day skating pass for that day. Q: Will there be food and beverage available for purchase?A: Yes. Enjoy a great menu of holiday food and beverage brought to you by the staff at the Courtyard Scottsdale Salt River. You can also venture into the Marriott Bistro to enjoy additional menu items.Q: Do I have to pre-purchase my tickets?A: It is suggested that tickets be purchased ahead of time, but not required. Pre-purchased tickets will be redeemed at the Great Skate for your all day pass. Q: Does the skate rental include socks?A: The Holiday Great Skate does not provide socks so please make sure to bring your own.Event Partners:

QCBF, ACEing Autism’s annual winter fundraiser, showcases the Charlotte-area’s craft breweries that have put the Queen City on the craft beer map. Each brewery and exhibitor offers a variety of its beer and food for guests to sample in an intimate setting. Live music and interactive games will be on hand during each of the two tasting sessions: 1-4PM and 6-9PM. Enjoy Charlotte on tap 2/6/16! PLEASE NOTE: the 1-4PM Session is Sold Out.About ACEing Autism:ACEing Autism is a non-profit organization that uses the sport of tennis to improve the lives of children affected by autism spectrum disorders. Funds raised from QCBF will be used to expand program enrollment, purchase equipment and keep registration costs as low as possible for participating families through a scholarship program. Note:Less than 100 tickets remain for the afternoon session! Secure your tickets before they sell out. See you February 6th!

title: Fish & Cat
description: A number of college students have traveled to the Caspian region in order to participate in a kite-flying event during the Winter solstice. Next to their camp is a small hut occupied by three cooks who work at a nearby restaurant. The cooks are looking for some meat to cook and there's no one around other than the young students. The film is based on a true story about a restaurant that served minced human flesh for food and is shot in a single take.Awards:Dubai International Film Festival 2013 - Muhr Asia-Africa Special Jury PrizeFribourg International Film Festival 2014 - FIPRESCI Prize and Youth Jury AwardVenice Film Festival 2013 - Venice Horizons Award - Special Prize13th Lisbon International Film Festival - Best Film award13th If Istanbul Independent Film Festival - Best Film AwardDirector's view: Fish and Cat is a film about time. It is about how to make a perspective within time, and thereby, unhinging time. What fascinated me about making this film was the style of its execution: the insistence on a fictional narrative style within the bounds of single shot and the attempt to create fissures in time during that single shot. I chose to tell a true story in this film, a true story which nevertheless, resembles a nightmare.The movie's language is Persian, with English subtitles. خلاصه فیلمنامه: چند دانشجوی دختر و پسر برای شرکت در جشن بادبادک بازی در شب یلدا به شمال رفته اند. در همسایگی کمپ کوچک آنها کلبه ای قرار دارد که سه آشپز یک رستوران ساکن آن هستند. آشپزها برای پخت غذا به گوشت احتیاج دارند و جز این جوانها کسی آن اطراف نیست ... قصه فیلم بر اساس یک داستان واقعی درباره رستورانی است که گوشت چرخ کرده انسان را پخت میکرده، و تمام فیلم در یک سکانس پلان اتفاق میافتد. دیدگاه کارگردان: ماهی وگربه فیلمی است درباره زمان. درباره اینکه چطور میتوان در زمان پرسپکتیو ایجاد کرد و آن را درهم ریخت. جذابیت ساخت این فیلم برایم در شیوه اجرایش بود. پافشاری بر روایت داستانی دریک سکانس پلان و تلاش برای اینکه در یک پلان که طبیعتا زمانی روبه جلو دارد شکست به وجودآورد. برای بستر چنین فیلمی، داستانی واقعی را انتخاب کردم، داستانی که شبیه یک کابوس به نظر میرسید.

title: SOLD OUT!!! 310 Young Professionals Holiday Soirée
description: OUR EVENT IS SOLD OUT! WE ARE NOT SELLING TICKETS AT THE DOOR DUE TO CAPACITY LIMITS. THANK YOU FOR YOUR UNDERSTANDING!  This is THE holiday party to be at in the Southbay. We've worked really hard to make this one of our biggest and best events. The evening will include: a silent auction, live music DJ Cool Whip, food and desert trucks, drinks, dancing and awesome people all under one awesome space @Big Door Studios! All of our proceeds go to charity. GIFT COLLECTIONThis year, we've partnered with South Bay Santa to supply some much needed Christmas presents to some amazing and deserving kids. Let's make this Christmas great! You can support by: 1. Visiting theToys R Us Wishlist page2. Entering the following wish list code: 378954503. Purchasing an item4. Bring your item, we will have a collection spot at the event5. Don't have time to run out? Don't worry, we know you are busy! We've got you covered. You can donate at the event as well.SILENT AUCTIONBeen a little naughty this year? Maybe you can redeem yourself in Santa's eyes by participating in our silent auction. Proceeds benefit 310YP charities. We have some really great items, so be sure to check them out!PARKINGWe *STRONGLY encourage as many people as possible to Uber or Lyft. Not drinking? Great, free parking will be available at St. Anthony Church 222 Sierra St. El Segundo CA 90245, but is limited and will be on a first come, first serve basis. We will have an attendant there to guide you to the venue. DRINK TICKETSIf you will be enjoying some adult libations, plan on purchasing some drink tickets. We will have plenty of beer, wine and mixed drinks to offer. We can accommodate credit/debit cards, but cash is strongly preferred for expediency sake.FOOD TRUCKSWe've arranged a food truck and a dessert truck, so if you are jetting to the event and don't have time to eat...we got you! You can purchase food at the event.ATTIRENow you don't have to go all Jim Carrey, Jeff Daniels Dumb and Dumber with top hats and all, but come on and dress up a little. It's the holidays!EVENT DETAILS*WHO: 350 of South Bay's Young Professionals FinestWHAT: Food Trucks | Drinks | DJ Cool Whip | Silent Auctions | Fun | Dancing I Photo BoothWHEN: Friday 12/4/15 7:00 pmWHERE: Big Door Studios 114 Sheldon St., El SegundoWHY: Kickoff the holidays! Proceeds benefit 310YP Charities*Fun is not optional and laughter, dancing and/or persistent smiles are mandatory!Lastly, we've worked really hard to make this a great event. Have a great time, thank you for your support and see you on the dance floor!

title: Tea Tasting and Class
description:

We will also try 5 different teas covering a wide variety (white, green, oolong, black,  and rooibos).

Each session lasts approximately 1 hour and can accommodate 6 people.

Note: The tea tasting takes place on our second level up a flight of stairs. Please be able to use stairs comfortably if you are booking a tasting. We can arrange a special tasting downstairs after hours; if needed please email us.

title: Sur les traces de Champlain
description: Sur les traces de ChamplainMusique, poésie, humour et saveurs autochtones!Le Salon du livre de Toronto vous invite à célébrer les 400 ans de présence francophone en Ontario. Au programme : musique, poésie et humour avec :Zachary Richard, Robert Paquette, NathashaKanapé-Fontaine, Guy Mignault et Micheline Marchildon. Vous allez déguster– formule buffet - les mêmes mets que les Autochtones ont généreusement offerts à Champlain et ses compagnons, en 1615 : soupe des trois sœurs, saumon grillé et salade de riz sauvage, ragoût de cerf, bannocket un dessert de bleuets sauvages. Bière et vin disponibles au bar.Chaque participant recevra un exemplaire du livre J’écris Champlain - une œuvre collective de jeunes francophones et francophiles de l’Ontario - lancé lors du Salon du livre.Prix : 50 $ par personne (boissons non incluses) plus frais de billeterie Samedi 5 décembre à 18h15 au 18 Yorkville, 8e étage (Métro Yonge et Bloor)Places limitées, réservez dès maintenant https://www.universe.com/surlestracesdechamplainwww.salondulivredetoronto.cawww.oliverbluepr.comEnglish:Please join us for an evening of music, food and poetry.Menu: Three sisters soup, grilled salmon with wild rice, deer ragout and wild blueberry bannock dessert. Every guest will receive an original work, a book written by youth to commemorate the 400th anniversary of Champlain.Please use the link above to reserve your seats.Space is limited.

title: HoHoTO, in support of YWCA Toronto's Girls' Centre
description: The party that Twitter started is back. Join 500 of your favourite startup, tech, social media, and design friends as we celebrate 2015 and deliver on our new mandate.This year, impact and opportunity are our focus, as we bring the digital community together in support of organizations that directly affect beneficial change in our technology ecosystem.Participating in HoHoTO year-round, beginning with this year’s holiday event Dec 11, 2015, are a number of organizations who are helping to drive opportunity, diversity, and innovation in the workplace now and in the future.HoHoTO will be the hub that connects their efforts to engage more women and minorities in entrepreneurial, digital, and engineering pursuits.In purchasing a ticket, you not only get to enjoy a great holiday party, but you'll be helping to fund YWCA Toronto's Girl's Centre. This centre serves girls ages 9-18, of all ethnicities and belief systems, by providing a safe space, food, activities, and learning programs, 7 days a week. With our collective efforts, we can provide over 400 girls with new opportunities in business and technology.Once again we'll be hosting the event at The Mod Club, where you'll be able to dance and mingle in the main room, head upstairs for more intimate conversations and to connect with organizations such as YWCA Toronto and Ladies Learning Code.Last year sported an assortment of live DJs, a photo booth, and late night pizza. This year we've lowered ticket prices to encourage connecting with your peers and these great organizations, but you can rest assured HoHoTO's first Friday night party will be better than ever! See you on December 11!

title: Artisanal Food Crafting Workshop
description:
Discover the joy of making sustainable, homemade food crafts. Learn hands-on how to create simple, yet sophisticated, artisanal edible gifts for your own pantry and your loved ones.Homemade food crafts, such as jared goods, culinary and medicinal herb mixes, flavored salts and sugars, infused oils, snacks, and dry food mixes, have been part of people’s pantries for millennia. As gifts, the love and effort that go into making them always enhanced their value in the community. Technological advancements and industrialization in food crafting made it easy for people to buy these goods for their pantries and gifts. In the process, the thoughtfulness, creativity, and human productivity attached to homemaking has become lost, and environmental degradation increased. Homemade artisanal food crafts replace the energy, water and natural resources wasted in big-commercial-industrial operations with human ingenuity, purposeful effort and love. A home food craft maker is a promoter and supporter of health, abundance and sustainability for all!Join Us to learn hands-on and enjoy the art and science behind artisanal food crafting. In this workshop we will: Learn hands-on how to use edible ingredients to create beautiful artisanal food crafts for your pantry and for gifting
Make herb bundles, flavored salts and sugars, infused oils, simple syrups, heirloom dried soup mixes and more
Taste a variety of artisanal food crafts
Each participant will take home a personalized salt blend, herb bundle and choice of infused oil or simple syrup!Instructor: Chef Kerri CacciataInstructor Bio: Kerri was born and raised in Orange County. She earned her Bachelor’s degree in community organizing in San Francisco and studied culinary arts locally, finding harmony when the two subjects come together. She has worked in non-profit agencies, farmers markets, and in a number of professional kitchens. Kerri has spent over 10 years working and volunteering in the city of Santa Ana, and has worked hard to help bring a new farmers’ market to the community, launching the DTSA Certified Farmers' Market March 2014.In Southern California we’re blessed with a passionate group of farmers, artisan food crafters, and creative chefs. Supporting these amazing people brings consciousness and community into the kitchen. “There is communion of more than our bodies when bread is broken and wine drunk.” -M.F.K. FisherThe Ecology Center is a non-profit educational center that teaches hands-on environmental solutions at the household and community scale. Your participation supports our programs and our mission to inspire and create a healthy and sustainable future for all.*Become an Advocate of The Ecology Center to receive member discounts. Plus, after you complete 5 workshops and 5 eco actions, you are eligible to receive 1 free workshop!
Cancellation Policy: We understand your plans may change. We will give you credit toward a future program if you cancel at least 24 hours in advance. Credit must be redeemed within 90 days of issue. To account for our preparation and our instructor's time, we cannot give refunds or credits if cancelled with less than 24-hours notice or in the event of a no-show.
