title: The ACGA US National Mòd
description: The US National Mòd is a yearly competition and festival showcasing the Scottish Gaelic language in poetry, story, and song.  The event is held in the beautiful highlands of Pennsylvania near Pittsburgh.  Each year, we bring a judge from Scotland or from Nova Scotia, as well as host the two winners, male and female, of the Royal National Mòd held every year in Scotland. It's a unique chance to hear, enjoy, and even learn some authentic Scottish Gaelic in an affordable and comfortable setting.

title: GrowthBeat - VIP
description:
GrowthBeat 2015: Mastering growth through marketing technologyWhat is GrowthBeat?GrowthBeat is the premier event for leading edge marketers to network and share proven, cutting edge marketing methods that grow their business. Technology is changing marketing quickly. GrowthBeat helps you identify what works for you and how the best have made it work for them.Why should I attend?We uniquely focus on arming you to grow your business through new technology-led marketing methods. There are around 500 senior level marketers from top brands attending, and you’ll network with peers, learn through cases studies and panels from a very high caliber of C-level speakers covering today’s growth topics. You’ll leave with actionable insights that you can apply to your business the next day.Additionally, VB Insight, VentureBeat’s research team, will also be present to share their cutting edge findings on these topics and engage in conversation with attendees. Come prepared with questions.What we're covering in 2015Our research team has talked with over 200 CMOs in 2015. They have compiled best practices, identified the most pertinent topics, and invited the speakers who best represent these issues:
The Customer – How to boost engagement across every step of the customer journey.
Convergence – How provide an excellent customer experience across online & offline worlds.
Attribution – How to tell how your media is working across traditional, digital, & mobile channels.
Storytelling – How to deliver the right message at the right time to make your brand stand out.
Disruption – How to build a responsive organization that can innovate quickly.
Leadership – How to build a true customer-centric organization & culture.
Profit from the exclusive networking. Take back incredible insights only available through this event. Challenge your thinking. Shape your organization. Drive Growth for your team and your company. Join us at GrowthBeat.

title: Daughters of Brooklyn
description: Join us for an evening featuring Tanwi Nandini Islam and Naomi Jackson, whose debut novels share a setting in Brooklyn, home to so many families who call somewhere else home. Born to immigrant parents, Islam's and Jackson’s heroines wrestle with competing cultural messages, gender norms, and a poignant sense of placelessness, all while navigating the tribulations of teenhood in America. In Islam’sBright Lines, the Bangladeshi Saleem family raises three girls on Cambridge Place: rebellious Charu, bookish adoptee Ella, and runaway Maya, who seeks refuge from her abusive father. When their home falls victim to fire, the Saleem family returns to Bangladesh, where they must confront the demons of their past alongside the ones of the present. Home and homeland come into conflict again in Jackson’s The Star Side of Bird Hill, when the Braithwaite sisters, Dionne and Phaedra, are torn from Brooklyn and sent to Bird Hill, Barbados to live with their grandmother. Jackson transports the reader through history, tracking the stories of three generations of Braithwaite women, and confronting love, mental illness, and the struggles of immigration. The discussion will be moderated by the Workshop's very own, Nadia Q. Ahmad!Brooklyn resident Tanwi Nandini Islam’s writing has appeared in Elle.com, Fashionista.com, Open City, Women 2.0, Billboard.com, and Gawker.  She is the founder ofHi Wildflower Botanica, a 2013-2014 AAWW Open City Fellow, and a graduate of Vassar College and the Brooklyn College MFA program.Naomi Jackson was born in raised in Brooklyn, and graduated from Williams College. She has studied writing at the Iowa Writer’s Workshop and the University of Cape Town in South Africa.AAWW Program Assistant Nadia Q. Ahmad is a writer. A board member of the Bangladesh Institute of Performing Arts (BIPA) and 2015 VONA/Voices alum, Nadia currently lives in East Elmhurst, Queens.

title: The Royal Tailor w/ Q&A
description: THE ROYAL TAILOR | 상의원NEW YORK PREMIERE (U.S. CONTINENTAL PREMIERE)INTRODUCTION & Q&A w/ director LEE WON-SUKLEE WON-SUK, 2014 | CAST: HAN SUK-KYU, KO SOO, PARK SHIN-HYE, YOO YEON-SEOKSOUTH KOREA | KOREAN WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES | FORMAT: DCP | 127 MINUTESPresented with the support of Korean Cultural Service in New York.Co-presented with The Korea SocietyTwo years after his anarchic comedy How to Use Guys with Secret Tips, Lee Won-suk returns with his second feature, an ambitious, big-budget period drama about the clash between tradition and modernity in the royal court of 18th-century Korea. After serving the court for three decades, the king’s tailor Jo Dol-seok (Han Suk-kyu) is on the brink of rising to the rank of nobleman. But his life's dream is threatened with the sudden appearance of young, handsome, and carefree “designer” Lee Gong-jin whose radical fashion ideas quickly earn the Queen's favor. Unlike most films about the power of art (and music), Lee lets Jo Sang-gyeong’s striking costume designs speak for themselves, without resorting to reaction shots or exposition. The film's traditional costumes took as much as six months to create, at a cost just shy of $1 million. A playful, fresh, and daring reinvention of one of Korea’s most conservative film genres.

title: A Dinner in Peru
description:
Please click here for tickets to A Dinner in Peru on Thursday, July 16
Wednesday, July 8, 6pm - 10pm  is SOLD OUT!!$75 + tax & gratuityMALAPARTE350 King Street West, TIFF Bell Lightbox, 6th Floor,Toronto, ON  M5V 3X5 |  Driving DirectionsAt this Summerlicious Culinary Event, Malaparte and Chef de Cuisine Guillermo Russo invite you to celebrate the 2019 Pan Am Games host country with an evening of Peruvian food and culture!First enjoy a reception on the outdoor terrace: mingle and take in the stunning downtown views; listen to the sounds of a Peruvian creole ensemble; and indulge in a pisco cocktail, authentic canapés, such as ceviche, quinoa-crusted shrimp with maracuya (passion fruit) sauce, beef empanaditas and ají de gallina (chili pepper chicken) vol-au-vents.Next, move indoors for a family-style dinner with wine, crafted by Chef Guillermo and inspired by his Peruvian roots. Focused largely on seafood, dinner will feature arroz con mariscos (seafood rice) and fish escabeche, as well as unique accompaniments, such as fried cassava with Huancaína (spicy cheese) sauce, Andean grain solterito (salad), and causa (a cold layered potato dish), among other dishes.As you explore the best of this culture's cuisine, learn about the traditional flavours and cooking styles from Chef Guillermo. After dessert, alfajores and tres leches cake with pisco caramel, flambéed gooseberries and candied quinoa, leave with a goodie bag filled with Peruvian treats and gifts!

title: Excavating “New” Philippine Myths
description: Join us for a special event celebrating a new anthology of Filipino myths: Kuwento: Lost Things. We’ll hear from three contributors from the anthology: Anna Alves, PhD student in American Studies at Rutgers University, Newark; Sarah Gambito, cofounder of Kundiman; and Melissa R. Sipin, co-editor of Kuwento). Moderated by acclaimed novelist Jessica Hagedorn, author of Toxicology and a winner of the AAWW Lifetime Achievement Award.In 2011, Melissa R. Sipin and Rachelle Cruz began Kuwento: Lost Things as a search, an obsession, a need to excavate the stories of anitos (deities) and engkantos (spirits) their families once told them. But, when they first indulged in the idea of curating an anthology on Philippine myths, they were struck by how diverse the retellings were. Was the Aswang a bat-like vampire woman? Or was she a shape-shifting beast, or a giant black bird with a long, fetus-eating tongue? They understood that the stories passed on to them from their fathers and mothers were varied, but also culturally inherited. It was as if their bodies knew the stories, and knew them well. This book, a diverse collection of eclectic prose and poetry, seeks to ensure that their "invocation of the past is somehow answered, somehow quelled, somehow excavated, and thus, reborn—reborn in our own terms, in our own myths, in our own kuwentos."Co-sponsored by TAYO Literary Magazine, Kweli Journal, the AASP at Hunter College, and the Hunter College NEH Summer Seminar for School Teachers: Asian Americans in New York: Film & Literature.Image titled "Fishers of Men," by Eliseo Art Silva.

title: Ladies of Hip-Hop Festival Showcase
description: In July dancers, choreographers and dancers from around the world will come together for annual Ladies of Hip-Hop Festival.Starting in 2004, this annual Hip-Hop festival puts the focuses on women and their relationship with Hip-Hop culture. Ladies of Hip-Hop Festival exists to develop and provide women with positive roles that are present and represented within the Hip-Hop culture. Traditionally, men have dominated all facets of the hip-hop scene, but Ladies of Hip-Hop Festival changes this tradition and puts women center-stage for the entire event.The festival is an event given by women, for women. Each year an elite group of female artists from around the world are selected to exhibit work, teach, and perform as part of the festival. After a weekend of workshops, a panel discussion and LADIES BATTLE! the weekend will culminate with the annual showcase. Join us for a night of amazing, talented, powerful girls and women sharing their talents on stage.

title: Scottsdale Beer Palooza
description: Scottsdale Beer Palooza is an air-conditioned craft beer festival at WestWorld on June 20th, 2015.  Besides over 100 craft beers to try, there's a huge game zone with a human foosball table!Every attendee will receive an order sheet to purchase beer and take it home from the festival. Beer-friendly foods will be available for purchase from M Culinary concepts and there will be a special appearance by the Mustache Pretzel food truck!Participating breweries include: Abita, Alaskan, Bells, Big Sky, Coronado, Deschutes, Desthil, Dragoon, Firemans Brew, Firestone Walker, Four Peaks, Goose Island, Grand Canyon, Green Flash, Guinness, Hacker Pschorr, Huss Brewing, Lagunitas, Left Hand, Magic Hat, Mud Shark, Nimbus, North Coast, Odell, Oskar Blues, Peoria Artisan Brewery, Prescott, Rogue, Sam Adams, SanTan, Sapporo, Schilling, Shipyard, Sierra Nevada, Ska, Sleepy Dog, Sonoran, Stone, Tommyknocker, Uncle Bear’s, Venice Beach Beer Company, and Wyders. (This list is subject to slight change.)Gate ticket prices: GA $35, VIP: $55 (plus tax). Please note: Very limited gate sales will be available. Please arrive early. Please Note: The City of Scottsdale will be charging $5 per car (cash) to park.

title: OHRG vs. Ft Wayne (Ft Wayne, IN)
description:
DON'T MISS GAME 5 OF OHRG'S 10TH YEAR OF ROLLER DERBY!The Ohio Roller Girls host the Fort Wayne Derby Girls (Ft. Wayne, IN) for this very special Decade of Derby home game. You can't have ten years of incredible Ohio roller derby without ten years of great skaters and officials, and today we celebrate them all. Join us for the only 10-year reunion you'll legitimately enjoy!All Ohio Roller Girls home games this 2015 season will be in the Ohio Building at the Ohio Expo Center.
Doors open at 4:00 pm at the Ohio Expo Center's Ohio Building.
Action starts at 5:00 pm with Ohio's All Star team.
OHRG's B-team, Gang Green plays at 7 pm.
Beer and concessions are available on site.
General admission bleacher and chair seating.
Due to venue restrictions, no outside chairs permitted.
Parking is $5 per car; carpooling is encouraged.

title: ChivePA present Chivespringa
description: Back by overwhelming demand is CHIVESPRINGA! Last year over 200 people showed up to party their asses off in a field to raise money and have a good time. Lets top that!July 18th is the main date for this, but to be properly prepared JULY 25TH WILL BE THE RAIN MAKEUP DATE.What is Chivespringa? Its that one time of the year we throw a meetup that you can really let loose at! EVERYTHING is included with your ticket purchase. MUSIC, DRINKING, DANCING, GAMES, SILENT AUCTIONS, AND BONFIRES! SLEEPING: Bring a tent because we have an acre of flat land roped off for everyone to spend the night. NO DRINKING AND DRIVING!!! There is a hotel nearby that we can hook you up with if a tent scares you. WE ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR YOUR BELONGINGS. Hate to say it because you'd think we are all adults here but shit goes missing. PARKING: The parking area and camping section will open up  at 3pm. Parking is $5 unless there is 3 or more people in the vehicle. There is a walmart down the street that we encourage chivers to meet at and carpool in from. We are sorry for instituting this but we have limited parking spots on location. The party area will remain closed off until 6pm.BEER: Keystone Light, Miller Lite, Yuengling Lager, KCCO Gold Lager, maybe moreLIQUOR: Fireball and Jungle Juice by the GALLONSFOOD: This year we will be operating on a BYOF system to help put more money towards charity instead of operating costs. We will have a grill there ready.---BENEFITING CHARITY---All proceeds from Chivespringa will be going towards the Pet Pantry of Lancaster! Their mission is to help avoid the surrender of a family pet due to the lack of resources to feed and care for them. Pet Pantry of Lancaster County wants to lend a temporary helping hand to ease the burden, whether the cause is from trying economic times, health or emergency related circumstances. Visit them over at www.petpantrylc.org/

title: uPaint Events: March of Dimes Fundraiser
description: Join us for a fantastic night of fun, painting, drinks, and snacks! Tickets include admission to uPaint Events painting class, instruction for 2 - 2.5 hours, music, free digital photography, and all supplies to create your painting!Food, drinks, and gratuities not included. Fundraiser is to support the March of Dimes.Please arrive 15 - 20 minutes before the event start time to choose your seats, place food and drink orders, and get comfortable.uPaint Events is a mobile paint studio based out of New Bedford, MA. We teach social painting classes in almost any location: homes, offices, local restaurants, and more!uPaint Events is an exciting and creative experience for any skill level. Recommended ages 10+!

title: Evergreen Asado BBQ
description: UPDATE: NOW SOLD OUT!Get fired up for the biggest, tastiest barbecue party of the season—a South American-style festival full of fun, flames and food.For one night only, 40 top chefs tame the flames over dramatic open-air parilla barbecues to bring you the smoke and sizzle of South American cuisine. Dine alfresco on farm-fresh food and local drinks prepared by Brad Long, Steve Gonzalez and more. Then join the carnival and dance the night away—all in support of green, healthy cities.Visit evergreen.ca/asadobbq for more info.Admission covers entry and all food and drinks during the event. All ticket holders must be 19+ in age.

title: Rocky Top BBQ Fest 2015!
description: Great BBQ. Even Better CauseThe Rotary Club of Bearden presents The 3rd Annual Rocky Top BBQ Fest. This is a Tennessee State Barbeque cookoff sanctioned by the KCBS. Bring your whole family and enjoy a fun-filled weekend and observe some of the best barbeque chefs in the country and a smorgasbord of other festivities.Rocky Top BBQ Fest will happen on May 29 -30, 2015 at the World’s Fair Park, and all proceeds will go to support Mobile Meals, Flu Shot Saturday, Pond Gap Elementary, Knox County Schools, 3rd Grade Dictionary Project (all Knox County Schools, West Hills Park, Interfaith Clinic, Friends of the Smokies and many others through the Rotary Club of Bearden. 50 teams will compete for Knoxville’s own sanctioned Tennessee State Barbeque Championship.Come join the fun and festivities!

title: 13 the Musical
description: Arete Productions to present 13, a grown-up Broadway musical about growing upShowcase fundraiser and preview night Friday May 29 at 7:00 pm;Full shows Saturday May 30 at 7:00 pm and Sunday May 31 at 3:00 pmat the Marjorie Luke TheatreSanta Barbara, CA—Arete Productions, the performance arm of Santa Barbara School of Performing Arts (SB SOPA), presents the Broadway hit musical 13, a grown-up story about growing up, at the Marjorie Luke Theater on May 30 and 31, with a preview and showcase on May 29, featuring local artists, SOPA star alumni and the Inner Light Community Gospel Choir. Proceeds from the showcase will benefit Santa Barbara School of Performing Arts scholarship students.Featuring a talented cast of local young performers ranging in age from 11 to 15, and set to an unforgettable rock score from Tony Award-winning composer Jason Robert Brown, 13 is a hilarious, high-energy musical for all ages about discovering that cool is where you find it—and  sometimes where you least expect it.  Directed by Austin Escamilla with musical direction by Dauri Kennedy, the cast of 13 includes Anthony Jensen (12) in the lead role, and Grace Gibbs (15) and Kara Boger (13) double cast in the role of Patrice. Other cast members include Kai Kadlec (15), Greta Regan (13), Drewes McFarlin (12), Logan Fleming, Mariana Mezic (13), Dawson Escamilla (11), and others. Director Austin Escamilla is also a homegrown talent who has starred in two SOPA shows. 13 is his second show as director.Arete Productions is the company that brought the Tony Award-nominated musical Swing! to the New Vic Theatre last March, featuring the beloved music of jazz greats Duke Ellington, William “Count” Basie, Benny Goodman, and Glenn Miller. In 2014, Arete Productions presented the Tony Award-winning rock musical Rent, with four sold-out shows and a review by the national theater publication Broadway World.“It's great working with the cast of 13,” Arete founder and 13 musical director Dauri Kennedy says. “Seeing their growth is wonderful. Many of them have been in our debut track, developing singing, dancing, and acting skills; some are brand new to the stage. 13 presents a unique opportunity to develop into mature performers because the entire cast is young.” The preview night showcase is a perfect accompaniment to this production because proceeds will benefit these and other young and intermediate performers, many of whom go on to  professional training programs based on having their talents recognized and nurtured at an early age. Featured in the showcase will be the local high school band Vital Signs, led by Brolin Parris, who is a SOPA alum and a longtime student of Kennedy's from Marymount of Santa Barbara, the Inner Light Community Gospel Choir, and others.Santa Barbara School of Performing Arts was founded by Dauri M. Kennedy in 2012. SBSOPA’s mission is to nurture, motivate and build confidence in our community’s youth through the use of contemporary and classic theatrical works.In addition to directing the Santa Barbara School of Performing Arts and Arete Productions, Kennedy also heads DMK Studio and Performing and Visual Arts Camp (PVAC). She is on the music faculty of Marymount and Santa Barbara City College Adult Education and director of Inner Light Community Gospel Choir. She attended the renowned New Orleans Center for the Creative Arts (NOCCA), earned a Bachelor of Music degree from the University of Illinois and a Master of Music from UCSB. She is an alumna of the Music Academy of the West and was a featured soloist with the SB City College Jazz Band, Chamber Orchestra, and Grand Opera. Her extensive opera performances include lead roles with Seattle Opera, New Orleans Opera, and recently Des Moines Metro Opera.  13will be presented at 7:00 p.m., Saturday, May 30 and at 3:00 p.m. on Sunday May 31, with a special preview and SB SOPA alumni stars performance showcase at 7:00 p.m. on Friday May 29. All performances are at the Marjorie Luke Theater, 721 E. Cota St., St., Santa Barbara. Tickets are $25/general; $20 students and seniors. Tickets can be purchased through Universe ticketing www.universe.com/13themusical, or for the showcase/preview evening here: www.universe.com/sopashowcase. For more information call 805-708-8897.New classes formingSB SOPA is pleased to announce its summer line-up of performing arts classes for all ages. Hippity Hop with Mr. Cabrera provides a fun-filled class environment designed to facilitate ongoing skill development and maximum fun, while immersing children in all aspects of motion.  With every class, students learn a new set of easy-to-follow mini hip-hop routines and combinations, and work on drilling them together.  Class is on Mondays & Fridays from 3:30- 4:30 PM. Ballet with State Street Ballerina Leila Drake Fossek is a basic class that introduces students 8 and older to the elementary positions of classical ballet.  Classes are thorough to ensure proper alignment and understanding and are held Tuesday & Thursday from 5:00 to 6:00 PM. Both classes are at Santa Barbara Dance Center located at 127 W. Canon Perdido. Adult Cabaret with Mr. Cabrera empowers the absolute beginner, age 15 and up, with confidence by building physical strength, while unleashing her inner vixen. Adult Cabaret incorporates high kicks, shakes and shimmies with spins and dips. Class is every Wednesday from 5:30 to 6:30 pm at The Dance Network located at 4141 State Street, Ste 4A. All classes are $20 for drop-ins OR $18 for a 10-class commitment card. For more information, call Mr. Cabrera at 805-637-1191

title: AWBEN Pow Wow Pitch 2015
description: OTTAWA, OntarioVincent Massey ParkJune 20, 2015 Are you interested in starting your business?  Have just started your business? Are you looking to grow your business?Want to pitch your idea to a panel of celebrity judges?Want a chance to win $5000, $2500 or $1000Save the date!15 Applicants/Pitchers must be women.

title: Omo Child: The River and the Bush
description: About the FilmFor generations, people in the Omo Valley (southwest Ethiopia) believed that some children are cursed, and that these ‘mingi’ children must be killed. Lale Labuko, a young educated man decided to stop this practice.  This beautiful film shot over a five year period follows Lale's journey to stop an ancient practice. Director: John RoweCountry of Origin: USARunning Time: 90mDoc/Narrative: DocumentaryLocation: USFS TheaterABOUT THE FESTIVALInspiring our community and future generations is essential.  We hope that the Mammoth Lakes Film Festival will unlock the creative mind of the public by providing emerging filmmakers with an opportunity to have their films excite the community.It will also encourage emerging filmmakers by providing them with a forum to have their work seen by industry professionals who have the potential to propel their careers. We want to bring human stories back into film without the worry of producing the blockbuster but rather use the medium to inspire and motivate our community.Our desire is to give the public opportunities to not only view the films but also our intent to provide a forum for our filmmakers to have exposure and mentorship with industry professionals is crucial. That is why we are bringing in working, successful writers, producers, filmmakers, and actors that can not only assist them with guidance but also give insight to help motivate.

title: Ex-Machina with Sam Drysdale
description: Limited tickets are also available at the door, cash only, on a first come, first serve basis. Box office opens at 7:30 pm on the night of the event.Ex-MachinaRating: 14ARunning Time: 108 minutesAlex Garland, writer of 28 Days Later and Sunshine, makes his directorial debut with the stylish and cerebral thriller, EX MACHINA. Caleb Smith (Domhnall Gleeson), a programmer at an internet-search giant, wins a competition to spend a week at the private mountain estate of the company’s brilliant and reclusive CEO, Nathan Bateman (Oscar Isaac). Upon his arrival, Caleb learns that Nathan has chosen him to be the human component in a Turing Test—charging him with evaluating the capabilities, and ultimately the consciousness, of Nathan’s latest experiment in artificial intelligence. That experiment is Ava (Alicia Vikander), a breathtaking A.I. whose emotional intelligence proves more sophisticated––and more deceptive––than the two men could have imagined.With a musical performance by Sam DrysdaleDepending on how much rain is falling, the event may be able to move indoors at 99 Sudbury and run on the same schedule as if it were outside. In the unlikely event that the indoor venue is unavailable, a raincheck will be provided to a future screening. All info will be sent to the email address provided when purchasing your ticket. Tickets are non-refundable. In the event of a cancellation, proceeds from tickets will be donated to MusiCounts. Please use an email you check frequently for information regarding any potential cancellations.

title: Mammoth Lakes Film Festival Opening Night Gala
description: OPENING NIGHT GALAKick off Mammoth Lakes' first juried, independent film festival in style!  Dance the night away to some sweet digital tunes, enjoy an open bar, and meet our visiting filmmakers.Wednesday, May 27, 8:30PM - 1AM, Sierra Event Center The Mammoth Lakes Film Festival is committed to raising consciousness of film as an art form by bringing back the human story. We will provide a forum to present quality Independent films within the beautiful setting of Mammoth Lakes, California. We are a perfect backdrop for an Independent Film Festival as well as a premier tourist destination in our own right. Because we are a destination resort we have strong allies within the entertainment industry and will be inviting reputable artists within the industry to be the 9 judges that award the categories of Narrative Feature Films, Documentary Feature Films, and Short Films. Cash prizes from $500.00 to $1,000.00 will be awarded. We will also provide travel stipends, housing, and festival passes for our filmmakers. A combination of 50 films, divided into shorts and feature length films, will be screened over the five days in various venues throughout Mammoth Lakes.

title: The ONE Film Festival
description: The Ottawa Northeast Film Festival or The ONE Film Festival is a not-for-profit community organization created to develop and implement plans in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada for an annual film festival. Our focus is primarily on filmmakers and films created in Northeast North America. The Northeastern United States geographic region is the most economically developed, densely populated and culturally diverse region in the United States. Combined with the talents of Ontario, Quebec and Atlantic Canada, this event has already won an unprecedented number of endorsements.

title: Matmos // Kevin Blechdom
description: NOTE: online ticketing has ended! To buy at the door on Friday night @8pm, come to the the Lab (2948 16th St., SF). Friday, June 5th. Where are you going to be? We see futures, we already know. You will be at THE LAB, taking in a rare performance by Matmos with an amazing opening set by Kevin Blechdom. Co-produced by MEGAPOLIS and The LAB.[ This performance is included with an all-access pass to the MEGAPOLIS Audio Festival, a weekend-long celebration of sound in Oakland + San Francisco. Rather go all-in for an all-access festival pass? Then DON'T BUY THIS TICKET! Go here instead. ]Matmos is M.C. Schmidt and Drew Daniel (Baltimore). Since 1995 Matmos have made recordings and performed live using the sounds of amplified crayfish nerve tissue, the pages of bibles turning, a bowed five string banjo, slowed down whistles and kisses, water hitting copper plates, the runout groove of a vinyl record, a $5.00 electric guitar, liposuction surgery, cameras and VCRs, chin implant surgery, contact microphones on human hair, a five gallon bucket of oatmeal, and the vagina, uterus, and reproductive tract of a cow. Matmos released albums under Matador Records for nine years before signing with Thrill Jockey in 2012, and has also been found collaborating with Björk both on studio recordings and live tours.Kevin Blechdom (Kristin Erickson) is the avenging angel of pop music. Armed with a laptop, top notch programming skills, keyboard and a banjo, Ms. Blechdom has brought much needed life into electronic music with her one woman show filled with Song, Dance, Blood and Guts. She began over ten years ago by releasing 2 albums as ‘Adult Rodeo’ on the revered Shimmy Disc label. Later she hooked up with Bevin Kelley and formed Blectum From Blechdom to release music on labels like Tigerbeat6 and Deluxe, the later recording winning 2nd place at the prestigious ars electronica prize in linz. Kristin then kept her team name Kevin Blechdom and relocated herself to Berlin where she produced two albums for the Chicks on Speed label entitled ‘BITCHES WITHOUT BRITCHES’ (2003) and ‘EAT MY HEART OUT’ (2005).Full festival lineup at megapolisfestival.org.

title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail - Presale OVER!
description: PRESALE OVER!Dear Sir/Madam Knight,It's been 40 years since the release of Monty Python and the Holy Grail and we must celebrate and be merry with a double bill of Monty Python films on May 21stJoin us for:A 7pm screening of Monty Python and the Holy Grail complete with your own set of coconuts to ride along with the Knights of the Round Table.And a 9:15pm screening of Monty Python and the Meaning of Life, complete with a Silly Walk competitionThe ticket includes: -Admission to both films-Set of coconuts to first 100 ticket purchasersOnly $11 for members or $21 to purchase a membership and double bill!Check out the perks of membership Individual tickets will be available at the door only.Groups of 15 or more can be pre-booked by emailing andy@apollocinema.ca

title: CUFF Closing Night! Burnt in Memory
description: Closing Night!World Premiere!Burnt In MemoryBurnt in Memory, My Lover has Steel Legs and Street Lights for EyesRobert Stockwell73 min., Video, 2015, USA"Burnt in Memory chronicles life in Chicago. Its impressionistic tableau has no dialogue, no characters, no story, and no acts. It is just a glimpse of people and their places, their in between places, and their forgotten places.  Burnt in Memory documents the mundane. The places passed on the way to work. Finding the moments worth looking at, showing something you've seen but never remembered. It's seeing again the things all around that are filled with life and yet forgotten about.  The film/video is an experiment to rewind and strip away the conventions about narratives in documentaries. My intent is to bring back the simplicity of walking around with a camera capturing life and moments, without the overuse of effects, and very little money. I entrust the viewer to see for themselves.  The music is entirely improvised. The musicians include Azita Youssefi on piano, Amber Amar-Walton on cello, Justin Martin on guitar, Nandini Khaund on the Folktek Quadrum, and Ben Clarke as musical director. These mainstay Chicago musicians played to a projection of the film and the results are unique and varied from most every other film score. Rather than composing restrictive melodies and rhythms the musicians played just as freely and uninhibited as Burnt in Memory was photographed.  I hope you enjoy seeing Chicago as I see it. It's a city steeped in stereotypes, but after wandering around the city day after day its true personality comes forth. Its beauty and ugliness, its power and frailty, its inhabitants and its abandoned caverns are what makes this city intriguing. It's been a pleasure to explore Chicago completely without commercial pretense. We're not trying to sell you on Chicago. We're not saying, "come on over, the water is nice!" We're simply sharing what we see." - Robert StockwellThis special world premiere screening of Burnt In Memory will feature a live soundtrack, and filmmaker Robert Stockwell in attendance!!

title: AoBFF MERCHANDISE (Available during Festival only)
description: Take home a piece of the 2015 Art of Brooklyn Film Festival! All proceeds support the mission of AoBFF.Merchandise is only available at the Festival (no online ordering or shipping).

title: Short Drama Block
description: Pre-Show Reception starts an hour before screening time. Q&A Talk-back with filmmakers starts immediately following screening.Bubbles / La Última Noche/ Father Like Son / Our Quiet Night / Fish Hook  / As A Friend/ EulogyBubblesDrama, 5 min. USADirected by Robert Gadol LavensteinBrooklyn PremiereTwo brothers deal with the death of their pet one summer afternoon in Brooklyn.Brooklyn Connection:The film was shot entirely in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn.Bubbles (trailer) from Robert&Raul on Vimeo.La Última NocheDrama, 13 min. USADirected by Felipe Vara de ReyNYC PremiereTwo friends. One American, the other one Spanish. A night together in the city. The last one.Director's Statement:Immigration is a complex phenomenon: it's painful when you're forced to leave your country of origin, but then it's equally tough when you're forced to go back. As a Spaniard trying to make a living in New York, I had a lot of friends in mind while I was working on this story, and the film is dedicated to their struggle, strength and courage.Father Like SonDrama, 16 min. USADirected by Derek Shane GarciaWorld PremiereA disturbed young man gets off a bus at Port Authority in New York City during a massive hurricane to try and track down his father who he believes is in Coney Island.Brooklyn Connection:The film captures Brooklyn at the time of Hurricane Sandy and also uses Brooklyn as a character within in the created world of the film.Our Quiet Night4 min, USADirected by Lisann ValentinBrooklyn PremiereWhen a young mom desperately tries to hold on to holiday traditions, she wonders whether her grasp is too tight.Brooklyn Connection:Writer/director Lisann Valentin was born and raised in Brooklyn and Our Quiet Night was shot on location in Brooklyn, New York. Fish HookDrama, 11 min. USADirected by Nickolas DuarteEast Coast PremiereBrandon is in pain. Swollen and infected, he is in need of an extraction. A dormant agony from his childhood resurfaces and forces him into a visceral struggle of what right and wrong actually are. Where the limit is. In his darkness and pain, he embarks on a journey of passive acceptance to violent retribution.Fish Hook Trailer from Nickolas Duarte on Vimeo.Brooklyn Connection:From the director: "After I cast the lead (a Brooklyn resident), I visited him and started exploring the borough. And fell in love. Soon, our entire story changed to take place in Brooklyn. All the locations were in Brooklyn. The rest of our cast and crew made their homes in Brooklyn. It became an undeniable source of inspiration. I couldn't imagine this film being made any other way now."As A FriendDrama, 18 min. USADirected by Miles Joris-Peyrafitte"As a Friend" is the telling and retelling of a relationship between three teenagers. It rebuilds the events leading to one teens death through a construction of desperate memories prompted by a police investigation.Brooklyn Connection:Director Miles Joris-Peyrafitte, Producers Joseph Mastantuono, Pierre Joris, Nicole Peyrafitte and post house Goodpost are all based in Bay Ridge.As A Friend - OFFICIAL TRAILER from Tawil Productions on Vimeo.EulogyDrama, 13 min. USADirected by Don CapriaBrooklyn PremiereA convicted murderer returnshome to make peace with his past.Eulogy reveals a modern day, New York City, Albanian criminal culture that maintains its old country values. In 13 minutes, our main character, Zef, learns he must give up trying to guard his life, so he can begin to guard his faith.Brooklyn Connection:The film stars Brooklyn artist and actor “Kaves,” who plays Zeph Celaj, who is currently serving time for a crime his brother Martin committed.

title: When the Gun Goes Down/ Lake Nowhere
description: Pre-Show Reception starts an hour before screening time. Q&A Talk-back with filmmakers starts immediately following screening.When The Gun Goes DownAction/Drama/Western, 34 min. USADirected by Ali EldinBrooklyn PremiereIn 1894 Darling Duke Lynch slipped the noose at Blackwater. With the help of an old man named 'Shaky' they must travel the countryside and learn how to survive before the law catches up to them. With harsh weather and bandits at their back there is much to learn when the gun goes down.Brooklyn Connection:Though most of the film was not shot in Brooklyn, the film would not be complete without it. The entire grip team, best boy, sound, and one of my strongest AD's were from Brooklyn. I think its safe to say the entire backbone of the production was born and bred in Brooklyn. They kept the wheels turning and saved time from burning. Without these men and women I could have not have done what I did. I have nothing but appreciation and respect for them, and I thank you for giving them someplace to show off all their hard work and dedication.Lake NowhereHorror, 50 min. USADirected by Christopher Phelps and Maxim Van ScoyBrooklyn PremiereFrom the vaults of the golden age of slasher films comes LAKE NOWHERE, a raucous, bloody romp which resurrects the thrill of gory midnight movies for an hour-long plunge into the depths of horror. Inspired by the dusty days of VHS, LAKE NOWHERE is preceded by original trailers & commercials, replicating the experience of watching a long lost bootleg tape.When a group of friends arrive at a desolate lakeside cabin, they are stalked and murdered by a Masked Maniac, whose lust for blood transcends our world. This age-old tale of senseless slaughter quickly spirals into the realm of supernatural horror and classic monster movies, as we learn the true power that lies within LAKE NOWHERE.LAKE NOWHERE was shot over six intense days in a remote cabin on the Great Sacandaga Lake in Upstate New York, at the base of the historic Adirondack Park, with a skeleton crew of ten people, eight actors and a dog. LAKE NOWHERE was produced almost entirely out-of-pocket, with additional funds crowd-sourced through IndieGoGo.From concept-to-screen, LAKE NOWHERE took just over one year to produce. As the project grew in scope, additional actors and crew were brought on to create the supplemental material which has become an integral part of the experience of LAKE NOWHERE.Brooklyn Connection:LAKE NOWHERE was written and produced by the Brooklyn-based production company, Ursidae Parade. Christopher Phelps, the co-director, co-writer, and editor of the film, also lives in the borough, along with many of the actors and crew.While LAKE NOWHERE was shot in Upstate New York, the supplemental material that precedes the film was shot in part in Bushwick and neighboring Ridgewood.

title: Andean Flavours - Gourmet Culinary & Pisco Tasting
description: Discover the rich flavours and natural products from South America!Come Say Hello To Summer at the Green Carpet for Golden Product Awards! 4th Annual Andean Flavours & Pisco Experience!YOUR TICKET INCLUDES:*chef tasting*drink ticket*event entry//Taste unique culinary creations of South America ~ explore traditional dishes like ceviche and quinoa//Discover the most exclusive organic and unique superfoods from Peru, Bolivia and Ecuador  ~quinoa, maca, sacha inchi, golden berries, Pacari chocolate and more//Sip on exotic molecular mixology martinis, cocktails and drinks ~we'll be serving Pisco, Peru's traditional brandy//Listen to a live South American band, and enjoy the groovy beats of DJ Jonathan Stein//Take in a live art illustration//Our mission is to educate and support the growers of the AndesFor Chef and Media Tickets please enter your Promo Code

title: when serpents bargain for the right to squirm
description: Saturday, May 16, 10:00pmTheater 1SHORTS 9: when serpents bargain for the right to squirmSome Southern CountryMichael Paul Lopez27 min., Video, 2014, USA“A 13-chapter video comic book, wherein a teenage boy experiences sexual adventures and overcomes obstacles of the heart atop a generic, racially ambiguous, American 80s world determined to perpetuate tribal war in a southern jungle. Green agents blackmail, torture, spy, cry and trash their bedrooms in a private high school while a concurrent narrative in text details the personal development of a cruel and horny teenager overcoming his fear of love. These conflicting narratives are rendered together with gradual color changes, hand-drawn illustrations, sound effects, synth and faux orchestral arrangements.” - Michael LopezNight of the Blood SquatchKenny Reed22 min., Video, 2015, USA“One night a man making a Bigfoot "documentary" encounters a few other intense characters with their own issues to contend with.” - Kenny ReedThe Lingerie ShowLaura Harrison8 min., Video, 2014, USA“A drug addict, Lorraine, attempts to entice her bisexual boyfriend Cesar away from his boyfriend, Wade, with a lingerie show she and her friends put together. An animated portrait of characters on the fringes of society.” - Laura HarrisonBite RadiusSpencer Parsons30 min., Video, 2015, USA“Last night Peyton had such a great time that he can't even remember the murder he committed. So he tells a friend. Big mistake. Inspired by actual events.” - Spencer Parsons

title: Real Women Model Casting Call
description: REAL WOMEN MODEL CASTING CALLWE WANT REAL WOMEN TO MODEL IN OUR FASHION SHOWS!  hosted by the Real Women Talk Show and Partying for a PurposeSaturday, May 30, 2015  10am-2pmat the LOUNGEsix at the Hotel SolamarModel Casting for the 12th Annual Champagne & Purses Party and other Fashion Shows. title: Philadelphia's High School Football Showcase
description:
2016 Philadelphia High School Football Showcase Part I (June 5th, 2016) from Rashad Campbell on Vimeo.
High School Football Showcase
OPEN to Entrants Grades 7 - 12





StayCool, LLC (StayCool)

Presents Philadelphia's Annual High School Football Showcase 

In conjunction with SCH Academy 







Our Mission

	As the 5th Largest City in the United States we want to offer a platform for the High School Athletes of Philadelphia and surrounding areas the opportunity to showcase their talents, compete with the best in the area and jump-start a successful summer of off season training.
	Create an atmosphere that is competitive and fast paced that will replicate an elite college football camp and combine experience.
	Expose High School Athletes to Past and Present NFL Players and Coaches. Also offer guidance from the areas Top High School Coaches, and recent Division 1 Collegiate Athletes. *Though the backgrounds of these players and coaches differ, they all share one common trait; the love of FOOTBALL!*
	Teach High School Athletes how to approach the game safely while still managing to introduce the latest and most innovative techniques. 
	Provide an opportunity for athletes to network and develop friendships while fine tuning their skills as they head into off season training. We plan on providing a competitive team environment ideal for developing leadership skills. 
	Ultimately, we want the High School Athletes to have fun, and understand that the Off-Season and Training Camp are the most important factors contributing to championship teams and quality performances on GameDay.
	
	


Showcase Program
12:30 PM Registration

1:45 PM Warm Up

2:00 PM Speed School (40-Yard Dash, NFL Shuttle, L Drill)

2:30 PM Break

2:40 PM Opening Remarks (Introduction + Overview)

2:50 PM Defensive Position Skill Work (Position Specific Drills DB, LB, DL)

3:20 PM Speed and Agility Stations: Cones, Hurdles, Ladders (8 Mins Each)

3:45 PM Break

3:50 PM Offensive Position Skill Work (Position Specific Drills QB, RB, WR/TE, OL/TE)

4:20 PM Break

4:25 PM 1 on 1’s (WR vs. DB's, RB/TE vs. LB's) Competitions (OL/DL)

4:50 PM Camp Finisher

4:55 PM Closing Remarks

5:00 PM Camp Ends (Autographs + Giveaways)

*Subject to Change*



QUICK FAQs

	Venue: SCH Academy Football Field - 500 West Willow Grove Ave, Philadelphia, PA 19118 (Formerly CHA)
	What to Bring: Comfortable Athletic Attire, Sneakers (Mandatory) and Football  Cleats (No Metal/Track Cleats), *Non-Contact Camp* No Helmets or  Shoulder Pads Needed. Don't Bring Personal Items such as Footballs,  iPods, Laptops or any other valuables to camp. We (StayCool, A-Game and SCH Academy) will not be responsible for  any lost or stolen property. There's no need  to bring additional money other than funds for on-site registration.  Water, Gatorade, and Healthy Snacks will be provided.
	How do I get a Camp Shirt? You must purchase a ticket before July 17th, 2016 to receive a camp shirt as they are pre-ordered.
	Where do I park? Free Parking is available along Willow Grove Ave and in the main lot next to the football stadium/track.
	Watching the Showcase: There will be a designated observation areas and stadium seating provided for all parents and onlookers to sit. We  recommend you bring your own chair if you do not wish to sit in the stadium seats as additional seating will not be provided. 
	Refund Policy: THERE ARE NO REFUNDS OF YOUTH SHOWCASE PAYMENT.  Please realize that the SHOWCASE commitment to staff, equipment, and facility access are determined  based on camper commitment to attend.
	*Rain Dates* will be announced upon cancellation.

title: 2015 AoBFF - Festival Pass
description: 'The Art of Brooklyn Film Festival is an indie gem that showcases the best of the borough… the festival has become a hub for the area’s indie film scene.' – INDUSTRY MAGAZINE'Seems like every neighborhood in North Brooklyn these days has its own localized film festival that may or may not feature locally focused content. In contrast, [AoBFF] is a platform for Brooklyn-centric independent film…a film festival for Brooklyn, by Brooklyn and about Brooklyn.' – THE L MAGAZINEThe Art of Brooklyn Film Festival is the only independent, international festival for, by and about Brooklyn indie film — a local scene with global influence. Founded in 2011 by working artists, we screen films from all over the world whose creators are connected to Brooklyn’s diverse independent film community. Come see the best of Brooklyn-born, Brooklyn-based and Brooklyn-centric indie film with an AoBFF Festival Pass, which includes admission to every 2015 screening and event, including Opening Night and Closing Night parties!

title: The Alejandro Angulo & Friends Experience 2015
description:
SCHEDULE:MASTER CLASS 7:30PM - 10:00PMKICK OFF 2015 ZUMBA CONVENTION WITH ALEJANDRO ANGULO & FRIENDS THIRD ANNUAL PRE-ZUMBA CONVENTION. EACH YEAR WE TRY TO BEAT OUR PRIOR YEARS!! FOR THE FIRST TIME, ALEJANDRO ANGULO, WILL BE INTRODUCING HIS OFFICIAL SALSATION WORKSHOP, IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO BE ONE OF THE VERY FIRST TO BE CERTIFIED IN 2016, THEN WE ENCOURAGE YOU TO BE THERE!! NOTE THAT SALSATION INSTRUCTOR TRAINING REQUIRES THIS WORKSHOP AS A PRE-REQUISITE TO THE INSTRUCTOR TRAINING.SPACE IS LIMITED!! PLAN YOUR TRIP AHEAD BECAUSE YOU DON'T WANT TO MISS THIS OPPORTUNITY OUT!!! AT THE END YOU WILL LEAVE WITH THE TIME OF YOUR LIFE AND A CERTIFICATE OF COMPLETION.SALSATION WORKSHOP - 4 HOURS 1:00PM - 5:00PMGet inside Alejandro’s head and see how he comes up with such  great, effective and easy to follow choreographies.The Salsation workshops are carefully designed to benefit experienced dancers as well as non-dancers, instructors and students through:
Improved understanding of music.
Variations of basic steps.
Basic understanding of Salsation
Insight into each choreography and elements that make them so unique and effective.
Improved movement, musicality.
Break down of choreographies so that you can start at a basic level but eventually take your students to a more advanced one
Learn how to connect each routine to your audience.
Although taking the workshop is the first step before taking the instructor training, it is a highly recommended workshop for everyone, from students to teachers. ***NO VIPs WILL BE SOLD AT THE DOOR...ONLY REGULAR IF WE HAVE AVAILABLE****** ALL SALES ARE FINAL. NO REFUNDS OR CANCELLATIONS, TICKETS ARE TRANSFERABLE*** For Vendors and Sponsorship oportunities please contact Raelys Arroyo and send us your request at alejandroangulousa@icloud.comHOST: RAELYS ARROYOEVENT & PROGRAM COORDINATOR FOR ALEJANDRO ANGULO: RAELYS ARROYO

title: Saathi: Celebrating Partnerships in Global Health
description: UW GlobeMed is hosting our 3rd Annual Benefit Dinner at 415 Westlake! Join us for a lively evening featuring a silent auction, keynote speech, a fabulous catered Indian dinner, dance performances and our very own GlobeMed wine! We can't wait to see you there!GlobeMed at UW is working to encourage youth engagement on a local and global scale in order to raise funds for grassroots health programs. Our solution is to utilize the energy, passions, and resources of students in the United States to partner with the real change makers – the people of the communities around the world. Our chapter is specifically partnered with the MINDS Foundation, a grassroots organization committed to eliminating stigma and providing educational, medical, and moral support for patients with mental illnesses in rural India. For more information about GlobeMed at UW and the work we do, please visit us at www.uwglobemed.org

title: GigUtah: How Fiber Networks Are Transforming Utah
description:
SPECIAL EVENT: Join the Utah Breakfast Club for LUNCH!GigUtah: How Fiber Networks Are Transforming Salt Lake City, Provo and UtahUtah Breakfast Club EventUtah State Capitol Complex, State Office Building AuditoriumFriday, April 24, 2015 **NEW DATE**, 11:30 a.m. - 1:30 p.m.(Gather  at the auditorium at 11:30 a.m. for a box lunch and networking; the  program will begin promptly at Noon, and end by 1:30 p.m.)Google  has captivated the enthusiasm of internet users -- and the attention of  economic development professionals -- by offering Gigabit Network  service in selected cities across the country.In announcing on  March 24, 2015, that Google Fiber will expand to Salt Lake City (it's  eighth metropolitan area nationwide), the broadband world turned its  envying eyes on Utah. With Google Fiber in Provo and now Salt Lake --  and with Gigabit Networks available in the 11 cities served by the Utah  Telecommunications Open Infrastructure Agency, or UTOPIA -- Utah is  poised to be the first state where a substantial portion of its  residents have access to the fastest-possible broadband internet  services.What does Google's investments say about the economic  health and technology-savvy nature of Utah? What do cities and citizens  get from Google Fiber that they haven't gotten from traditional telecom  companies? And, for cities and states seeking to get a Gig, what are the  best options to build and enhance Gigabit Networks?Join us for discussing the future of GigUtah!Confirmed Panelists:

Devin Baer, Head of Fiber Business, Salt Lake, Google

Paul Cutler, Mayor, City of Centerville

Justin Jones, Vice President, Public Policy and Communications, Salt Lake Chamber

David Shaw, Shareholder, Kirton McConkie; Chair, Government and Utilities Practice Group
Other panelists have been invited.
Moderated by Drew Clark, Of Counsel, Kirton McConkie; Founder, Utah Breakfast Club

title: Bonnie Bishop LIVE - @SparrowHouston
description: In 2012, Bonnie Bishop won her first Grammy for songwriting "Not Cause I Wanted To", co-written with former NRBQ guitarist Big Al Anderson and recorded by blues legend Bonnie Raitt. The song was voted Song of the Year by the New York Times and caused Bonnie Raitt to proclaim: "Bonnie Bishop is very special - I think she's going to be a big star."This special one night only show will be Thursday, April 23. You'll get dinner AND the show, by Bonnie in our gorgeous front yard.

title: Trapped: A St. Louis Room Escape - Volume 4
description: 60 minutes. 10 people. 1 locked door. Think you can escape?You  are locked inside a room with nine other people. A clock counts down  from one hour. All you have at your disposal is a series of cryptic  clues and perplexing puzzles. Will you and your cohorts be able to solve  the mystery and escape the room before time runs out?You will  have to strategize and work together to beat the game. The puzzles  require no special knowledge or skill - just logic, reasoning, and  teamwork. The mystery is challenging, and you may not solve it in the  given time. If you do, you'll be immortalized on our winner's wall. If  you don't, we promise to let you out of the room anyway!Don't  miss out on this unique event - an interactive experience that is  gaining popularity across the US and world, but the first of its kind in  St. Louis! And stay tuned for future editions with new themes, puzzles,  and challenges.The maximum number of players at one time is 10.  You may purchase tickets in any number from one to 10. All players that  purchase tickets for the same time will be on one team. If you wish to  form your own team of up to 10 players and don't want other people to  join you, you must purchase all 10 tickets.Please dress  comfortably and arrive at least 15 minutes prior to scheduled time.  Expect the total commitment to be about 1.5 hours, to include  orientation and debriefing. Puzzles will be the same for the entire run  of the event, so please do not plan on attending more than once or share  answers with other players.

title: Iona Village Hall Music Festival
description: We're back! Once again the beautiful and tiny isle of Iona hosts this uniquely intimate music festival, centred around the island's much loved Village Hall. With an incredible line up of talent, great food and beer, and the best venue in the world, there is only one place to be this July 3rd/4th.We're keeping it simple this year - one ticket for the whole event.  A weekend pass costs just £50.Friday 3rd  - Doors 1700, music from 1800 featuring Argonaught Soundsystem,  Admiral Fallow,  Pictish Trail,  Rozi Plain, Tuff Love.Saturday 4th  - afternoon doors at 1330, music from 1400  - 1700 including Sorren Maclean,  Michael Anguish, Harry Bird and the Rubber Wellies,  Andrew Mitchell,  and more.Saturday 4th - evening doors at 1830, music from 1900 featuring  Hannah Fisher Ceilidh band,   Idlewild,   Shy Nature,  Siobhan Wilson. As well as the music in the Village Hall there will also be various fringe events going on around the island which are free and open to everyone. Further details to follow.For information on how to get to Iona and where to stay, please visit www.welcometoiona.com. Please ensure you have some accommodation booked before traveling to the island. Most accommodation will already have been taken by the island's regular visitors, but Iona Campsite is about half a mile from the Village hall and ready to take your bookings! http://www.ionacampsite.co.uk.

title: Child Haven International Fundraiser Dinner
description: Child Haven International is a Canadian based non-profit organization with nine homes across south east Asia. Their homes take in and care for children who come from extremely destitute circumstances. Many of the children are orphaned and all them children come from poor, socially disadvantage situations. Child Haven's mission is to provide these children with an opportunity for a better life by uplifting them with shelter, food, clothing, and education.The primary source of funding for Child Haven is through private donations derived from fundraising dinners/silent auctions held across Canada. The money raised goes towards supporting 1200 children in need.

title: Father Son Campout - The Austin Stone
description: Our 2014 Father Son Campout is officially SOLD OUT! Please look for additional opportunities in the future.Come join us for our first-ever Austin Stone Father Son Campout on May 15-16. All boys in 1st-5th grade and their fathers are invited to leave distractions behind and spend some extended "guy time" together. Our theme for this year's campout is "Survival Camp." You and your sons will be participating in various activities including learning how to start a fire, learning how to build a shelter, archery, and more! We'll also be looking at the Bible and learning what God has to say about what we need to survive.No previous camping experience is necessary. We'll provide the campsite, the packing list, and all the food. All you need is a tent for you and your son(s), a sleeping bag or bedroll for each of you, and clothes/toiletries. You'll drive out after work on Friday and be home in time for dinner on Saturday.The cost is $30 for one father and one son. Each additional son is an additional $10. To inquire about scholarships, email kids@austinstone.org.If you are a single-parent mother and would like to send your son(s), please reach out to us to ask us how to make that happen. We would love to find a way for your sons to join us. Email us at kids@austinstone.org.Questions? Email kids@austinstone.org.

title: Creative Consumption - with Sir Ken Robinson
description:
Imaginese Productions presents"CREATIVE CONSUMPTION"
Savor an evening of music, poetry and lightning talks from local visionaries and global leaders.
Featuring acclaimed thought leader on creativity & education :SIR KEN ROBINSONJoin us in an exciting night of artistic expression and creative transformation as we celebrate service-driven leadership, and share bold new visions for social change -- all to help kickstart education for at-risk youth in Los Angeles.Imaginese is honored to have the singular Sir Ken Robinson - globally renowned thought leader in education and business with the most watched TED talk in history - generously speaking in support of our cause."Creative Consumption" will highlight cutting-edge approaches to community empowerment with dialogue from socially engaged artists, educators and entrepreneurs.All proceeds to support Imaginese Education Programs, providing leadership development for at-risk youth through the arts.THURSDAY APRIL 9th, 2015 @7:30pmLAEMMLE ROYAL, 11523 Santa Monica Blvd, West LA, CA 90025====Sponsored by Furlined Productions, Laemmle Theatres, and The Bresee Foundation.====If you can't attend, but would still like to support our educational programs for at-risk youth, please...click here to donate and be sure to write IMAGINESE EDUCATION in the comments.Every dollar goes directly to developing creative youth leaders, dedicated to revitalizing their communities.Imaginese Education:Imaginese has been providing arts education to at-risk youth in Central and South LA for the past three years. Our mission is to develop youth leadership through the arts with programs that empower students to express themselves creatively, harness their full potential and serve others.About Imaginese:Imaginese is a non-profit arts organization that aims to create positive social change through the arts and education. Our education programs cultivate civically engaged leadership with at-risk youth -- while our production arm, Imaginese Productions, creates socially-conscious work from diverse voices, highlighting under-represented communities and social issues. Proceeds from every production support the causes we highlight.

title: 24 HOURS FROM VINE TO BRINE! Pickling Workshop
description: Imagine the recipes that you can create by opening up a jar of garden vegetable pickles right from your pantry!By popular another great “Vine to Brine” Pickling Workshop at Blue Moon Acres. While the pickles are processing enjoy a selection of Rustic Pressed Sandwiches (vegetarian and meat) along with a Cold Summer Fettucine Pasta Salad and Gluten Free Quinoa Summer Salad. title: Hello City Group Show 2015
description: I am please to announce our Third Annual Hello City Group Show opens on March 6th, 2015, with the opening reception on Friday the 6th from 6-10pm, and will be on view for the weekend only—closing on Monday, March 9th. The Blue Oak Brewing Company will be here opening night serving up some locally crafted brews for us to enjoy. Kitty White, better known as Hello Kitty, was first introduced in Japan in 1974 and in the United States in 1976. Since then, this character—who if you didn't know is a girl from Britain who enjoys baking, traveling and listening to music— has become an iconic image recognized worldwide. For this show, we have asked local artists to reimagine Sanrio's Kitty White in any artistic form they choose. You can expect to see a wide range of techniques and mediums used from this year's group; all of which place their own individual stamp on this time honored character.Featuring Artwork by:Mark Adamusik  NORIO FUJIKAWAZEBULON GOODELL  Krista WrightElliott C. title: The Muslim Protagonist 2015: Art as Protest
description: Columbia MSA and The Muslim Protagonist Planning Committee bring you The Muslim Protagonist 2015: Art and Protest!  This full day of panels and talks on Feb. 28 is open to people of all  backgrounds, ages, faiths, and cultures as a means of facilitating  dialogue, networking, and tools for pursuing “literature as an agent of  social, intellectual, and spiritual change.” The event is NOT an event  exclusively for Muslims, “minorities,” or Columbia  students/faculty—everyone is welcome.2015.muslimprotagonist.comIn its third year, The Muslim Protagonist will build  on the previous years’ remarkable successes and delve deeper into the  issue of marginalized narratives in and outside of Muslim communities in  a unique and thoughtful way, bringing  together writers from diverse communities in America. This year’s theme,  “Art as Protest,” will feature discussions surrounding art and  literature as agents of socio-political, intellectual, and spiritual  change. We will be examining questions such as: What does it mean to  produce and interpret non-canonical literature? What does it mean to be a  subject, a citizen, a community member, an artist, and a protagonist?  What roles do literary and artistic works play in the charged political  climate dominating our world today? What role have they played  historically for Muslims in and outside of modern America, and what  lessons if any do they provide us with today? What is at stake in  producing work that disrupts dominant narratives?LOCATION: 417 SIPA, 420 W 118th St #1, New York, NY 10027

title: BOX OFFICE - photo la 2015
description:
~The international photographic art exposition photo la returns for its 24th year at The REEF, located in the historic LA Mart building in downtown Los Angeles, January 15 - 18, 2015. The 2015 edition of photo la will expand its uniquely diverse and far-reaching showcase of photographic art, ranging from 19th Century works to contemporary and innovative photography-based art. Alongside galleries, dealers, museums, and nonprofit organizations, photo la will also expand its acclaimed programming to include more lectures, roundtable discussions, special installations, and docent tours with distinguished members of the photographic/arts community. This year, photo la is pleased to honor Catherine Opie, and the fair's exclusive VIP opening gala will celebrate her lifelong contributions to the arts.We invite you to join us at photo la 2015 and to become an integral part in this explosion of the arts and culture in Los Angeles. For more information and updates, please visit www.photola.comPublic Fair Times: 
FRIDAY January 16 : 11:00 am - 7:00 pm
SATURDAY January 17 : 11:00 am - 7:00 pm
SUNDAY January 18 : 11:00 am - 6:00 pm
Opening Night Benefit Gala:  *Tickets to the gala can be purchased HERE*THURSDAY January 15 : 7:00 pm - 10:00 pmNote: Children under 12 are free.

title: Two Day Design Workshop with Stephen Silver
description: If coming from out of townRecommended Hotel info: http://www.expedia.com. City of BurbankTwo-day workshop January 24-25, 2014Lunch and snacks includedSaturday 10am - 5pmCharacter Design WorkshopDay one is a full day of learning and designing characters. I will be covering many facets of the design process including: design fundamentals, sketchbook drawing, tools and techniques to guide you on your creative journey. Business practices of art and marketing will be discussed, live demos and a chance for you to do lots of drawing with personalized instruction. You are encouraged to bring your portfolio, so I can review it with you.Sunday 10am - 5pmCharacter Gesture DrawingUnderstanding how to draw the human figure is essential in every aspect of the drawing profession. You will be given many exercises during the workshop that will teach you how to observe in a new way and push your drawings in order to give more life to them. description: You'd better not pout, I'm telling you why... our NINTH annual SantaCon Chicago is coming to town!Join us for another party with a few hundred of your favorite Santa Clauses! Maybe you're a veteran or maybe this is your first year coming to SantaCon, but either way you're in for a lot of fun. We'll start in the loop and hit up some great bars and Chicago landmarks like the Art Institute and The Bean -- you're going to have to ho-ho-HOLD that pose to capture all the crazy moments with your camera phone! #SantaSelfie #SantaConChi! Wristbands are a $10 donation, which gets Santas quick entry into all of the bars, plus drink specials at every bar and a chance to win some great costume prizes at the bars! title: Untapped Cities Happy Hour Tour at Finback Brewery
description: We're excited to announce our holiday happy hour at Finback Brewery. Finback was a reader's choice in our article on the Top 12 Microbreweries in NYC. We'll be having our holiday happy hour for readers and the Untapped Cities contributor team in the tasting room at Finback with on Wednesday December 10th with tours of the microbrewery led by the staff. Entrance to the event is free, with drink specials for Untapped Cities attendees. Happy hour discount will be between 6 and 7pm, and the brewery tours will take place at 7pm and 8pm. The brewery has an expansive evergreen offering with awesome names like Coasted Toconut and Plum & Proper, along with seasonal beers. If you’re looking for more unique flavors, this is the place for you–with sour beers and others flavored with the likes of jalapeno, coconuts and plum. But there are also more easy drinking options, like the Fort Tildenist brew.

title: SWEDEN - Force Majeure/Turist
description: RUSH TICKETS FOR THIS FILM CAN NOW ONLY BE PURCHASED AT THE VENUE.BOX OFFICE OPENS 30 MINUTES BEFORE THE SCREENING TIME.Force Majeure/TuristDir. Ruben Östlund / 2014 / 118 minutesA Swedish family travels to the French Alps to enjoy a few days of skiing. The sun is shining and the slopes are spectacular but, during a lunch at a mountainside restaurant, an avalanche turns everything upside down. With diners fleeing in all directions, Ebba calls for her husband Tomas as she tries to protect their children. Tomas, meanwhile, is running for his life... The anticipated disaster failed to occur, and yet the family's world has been shaken to its core, a question mark hanging over their father in particular. Tomas and Ebba's marriage now hangs in the balance as Tomas struggles desperately to reclaim his role as family patriarch. Premiered at the 2014 Toronto International Film Festival, FORCE MAJEURE is a stunning film from a rising directorial star in Swedish cinema, Ruben Östlund. English sub-titles.Une famille suédoise profite de vacances de ski dans les Alpes françaises. Le soleil brille et les pentes sont spectaculaires mais, à l'heure du lunch, dans un restaurant de montagne, une avalanche met tout sens dessus dessous. Les dîneurs fuient dans tous les sens. Ebba, la mère, appelle son mari Tomas au secours pour l'aider à protéger leurs enfants, mais Tomas a pris ses jambes à son cou. Le désastre prévu ne survient pas, mais les fondements de la famille sont ébranlés : le rôle du père est remis en question. Le mariage de Tomas et d'Ebba est désormais en péril et Tomas tente désespérément de reprendre sa place de chef de famille. Sous-titres en anglais.

title: #LeanEnterpriseTO - Lean Brand + PwC Innovation
description:
Join us Tuesday November 25th at 6pm at Climax Media (300-107 Atlantic Ave in Liberty Village) for Part 6 of the Lean Enterprise Toronto, 6-Part Speaker Series.Part 6 features two amazing sessions:1. Aaron Eden, Co-Founder of Moves The Needle, which helps corporations innovate like startups with the Lean Enterprise Accelerator Program (L.E.A.P). 2. Eugene Bomba, Partner with PwC's Tech Group and PwC's Emerging Company Services Canadian Leader along with Ted Graham, Innovation Leader at PwC in Canada.Come out and learn from Aaron, Eugene and Ted, who will be discussing how large companies are using lean startup principles to innovate from within.Event Schedule:
6pm – Doors open
6:30pm – Aaron - Moves The Needle (virtual)
7pm - Eugene + Ted - PWC Innovation (on-site)
7:30pm – Drinks and Mingling
9pm – Doors Close 
There will also be complimentary drinks and pizza thanks to our sponsor Steam Whistle and Panago.We will also have a few Lean Enterprise books to give away, thanks to support from the authors Trevor Owens and Obie Fernandez.Aaron Eden - Co-Founder of Moves The NeedleAaron is a lifelong entrepreneur, teacher and design thinker. He is a prolific force in the Tucson startup community and adjunct professor at the University of Arizona. Previously Aaron was an Innovation Catalyst and product manager at Intuit Inc., where his lean startup workshop series and mentorship transformed thousands of aspiring internal entrepreneurs into lean startup practitioners.Eugene Bomba - PwC's Emerging Company Services, Canadian LeaderEugene Bomba is the Canadian Leader of PwC's Emerging Company Services practice, working in the Toronto office.He focuses on early stage and high growth companies in the areas of technology, digital media, mobile, social media and enterprise solutions.Prior to joining PwC in 2008, Eugene was the CFO at Healthscreen Solutions Inc., an early stage technology company that was listed on the TSX-V.Ted Graham - PwC's Canadian Innovation LeaderTed is PwC's Canadian Innovation leader where his role is to drive new products and services that solve important problems for our clients. PwC helps organizations and individuals create the value they’re looking for. We're a network of firms in 158 countries with more than 180,000 people who are committed to delivering quality in assurance, tax and advisory services.About #LeanEnterpriseTOLearn to innovate like a startup. Together we'll start having better conversations about bringing the lean startup mindset into larger organizations. title: EUFF 2014: Ballymun Lullaby
description:
Directed by Frank Berry | Ireland, Documentary, 72 min,
Language: EnglishThis heart-warming documentary follows the dynamic and funny Ron Cooney  who has been working in the Ballymun high-rise housing estate in Dublin  for fifteen years, helping his community through music.  This music will  challenge the negative views many still hold of the area – views that  have the potential to hold his students back. The camera follows Ron and  composer Daragh O'Toole as they work with their talented students to  produce an original, world class collection of music that gives voice to  their story, leading to a unique collaboration with the RTÉ Concert  Orchestra. What Ron and his students have achieved is simply amazing.  Ballymun Lullaby is a story that needs to be heard.

title: EUFF 2014: The Ambassador to Bern
description:
Directed by Attila Szász | Hungary, Drama/Thriller, 76 min,
Language: HungarianCast: Kulka János, Kádas József, Szabó Kimmel TamásAttila Szász’s political thriller chronicles the day of August 16, 1958, when two Hungarian immigrants break into the Hungarian embassy in Bern and take the ambassador  hostage. As the Swiss police surrounds the building and a group of  Hungarian immigrants shows up on the street to demonstrate, a tense,  twist-filled hostage drama plays out behind the closed doors of the  embassy. The screenplay by Norbert Köbli (author of last year EUFF  Hungarian film The Exam) is based on a true story about the aftermath of  the 1956 Hungarian revolution.

title: FounderFuel Product/Market Fit Panel
description: Are you considering applying for FounderFuel’s Spring 2015 cohort? Concerned about your product/market fit? On Tuesday, October 14th, we will be hosting a Product/Market Fit Panel at Notman House where you’ll have the chance to hear a panel of founders talk about their unique paths to customer success.The 4 panelists from various stage startups will include:- Francis Davidson - Flatbook - Fall 2014 Cohort- Sam Vermette - Transit App - Summer 2013 Cohort- Danial Jameel - OOHLALA - Fall 2011 Cohort- Sam Haffar - Chegg Doors will open at 5pm for a networking session, and at 6pm Gabriel Sundaram will host a fireside chat with Laurent Maisonnave, Co-Founder & CEO of Seevibes (Fall 2011) about his experience in the program, and living/working in the Montreal startup community. At 6:30pm the panel will begin and we'll discuss different challenges with achieving product/market fit, successes and roadblocks, and various perspectives from companies at varying stages of growth.With the Spring 2015 applications just having opened, FounderFuel is actively seeking early stage companies who have an MVP and can spend the program achieving product/market fit. Be sure to attend the event, and apply for the Spring 2015 Cohort if you think this applies to you!

title: Smithsonian Family Workshop: Making Music
description: Making MusicRecommended Ages:  19 months - 3 yearsSaturdays: April 18 - May 9Time: 10am—11:30amWe all know that toddlers love music, but did you know that it can help them build a lot of other skills too? Music can nurture cognitive, social-emotional and even language skills. Each week we will explore music and its different components.You can purchase the 4-week package for $170 OR individual classes for $45/each. Tickets are for one child and their caretaker.More information about our family programmingFAQ'sDo I have to stay with my child during the class?Yes, this is a family workshop and parents are expected to attend and PARTICIPATE.  Its a great way to connect!My child isn't the right age, can they still attend?We work hard to create age-appropriate programs and hope that you can find a class that suits your child's age and schedule.  If you still feel strongly about attending, we will of course, welcome you.  But, please understand that we are unable to alter the class format and content to suit the needs of individual children and thus, your child might not have the best experience.Can I bring a sibling?We would prefer that you don't as it can be distracting and take away from the connection you can make with the child attending the class.  However if its a choice between the sibling or not attending the class, we would much prefer you come to the class! What will we do during the class?We will meet at the Natural History Museum introduce the theme in a SEEC classroom.  After our introduction, we will walk to a museum on the Mall and return to the classroom for a final activity.Will we be walking?Yes and in ALL weather.  Come prepared!  It’s a great way for the kids to get some exercise and fresh air too!What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?Metro - Federal Triangle, Smithsonian There is limited availability of street parking along the National Mall and Constitution Ave.Several parking garages in the area.No matter what you choose, give yourself an extra 20 minutes to park and walk to Natural History. Is my registration/ticket transferable?If there is room in another class, we will do our best to accommodate you. Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?Yes, please! What is the refund policy?Tickets will be refunded minus a $50 non-refundable deposit up to 2 weeks before the first class.

title: #LeanEnterpriseTO - Value Proposition Design
description:
Join us Wednesday October 15th at 6pm at Climax Media (300-107 Atlantic Ave in Liberty Village) for Part 5 of the Lean Enterprise Toronto, 6-Part Speaker Series.Part 5 is all about Value Proposition Design with Alan Smith, Co-Founder of Strategyzer and Co-Author of Value Proposition Design (Business Model Generation sequel) and Craig Saila, Director of Digital Products at The Globe and Mail.Come out and meet Alan and Craig, who will be discussing how to create products and services customers want.Event Schedule:
6pm – Doors Open and Drinks
6:30pm – 2 Talks + Open Forum 
7:30pm – Drinks and Mingling
9pm – Doors Close
There will also be complimentary drinks and pizza thanks to our sponsor Steam Whistle and Panago.We will also have a few Lean Enterprise books to give away, thanks to support from the authors Trevor Owens and Obie Fernandez.Alan Smith - Co-Founder of StrategyzerAlan is obsessed with design, business, and the ways we do them. A design-trained entrepreneur, he has worked across film, television, print, mobile, and web. He created the Value Proposition Canvas with Alex Osterwalder and Yves Pigneur, the break-through design for Business Model Generation, and co-authored Value Proposition Design. He co-founded Strategyzer where he creates tools and content with an amazing team; helping people make stuff customers want. Follow him online @thinksmith.Craig Saila - Director of Digital Products, The Globe and MailCraig Saila specializes in online news media with a unique focus on creating engaging products and user experiences for content-rich sites. In the fall of 2010, he rejoined The Globe and Mail as Director of Digital Products, where he has overseen the development of its digital subscription efforts as well as the creation of its mobile app portfolio.Prior to that, he lead the web design and development team for NBC News’ network of sites. During his time there, the team rebuilt the network’s story-telling platform and worked on some of Facebook and Twitter’s first media partnerships. He also launched the debut mobile apps for the NBC News, the Today Show, Meet the Press, and the Rachel Maddow Show.About #LeanEnterpriseTOLearn to innovate like a startup. Together we'll start having better conversations about bringing the lean startup mindset into larger organizations. We host a monthly Speaker Series with large enterprise guest speakers, interactive forums and of course a few cold drinks!*If you haven’t already, join our community on Meetup to receive exclusive offers and discounts to future events: http://www.meetup.com/Lean-Enterprise-Toronto/Organizing TeamCorey Eastman – Head of Digital Consulting, Climax MediaCarlos Oliveira – Lean Strategy Manager, TelusRamli John – Lean Startup AdvisorMichael Cacho – Founder, Inkly.ca
