title: Vertical Tour of St. John the Divine
description: On this adventurous, “behind-the-scenes” tour of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, climb more than 124 feet through spiral staircases to the top of the world's largest cathedral. Learn stories through stained glass windows and sculpture, and study the grand architecture of the Cathedral while standing on a buttress. The tour culminates on the roof with a wonderful view of Manhattan. Untapped Cities works directly with St. John the Divine to curate a tour full of insider, "untapped" facts for our very knowledgable readers! Join us after for an optional cocktail at the cozy Max Caffe.

title: Disney Shorts Currated by Jerry Beck Screening 2
description: As   part of our celebration of Walt Disney Animation Studio, we asked two   well-known animation historians, Leonard Maltin and Jerry Beck, to curate a   selection of their favourite Disney short cartoons. Their selections run the   gamut of Walt Disney's peak period between the 1930s-1950s.They feature a mix   of standards (Skeleton Dance, Clock Cleaners, Hockey Homicide), oddities (Der   Fuehrer's Face, No Smoking) and a few unexpected gems.And don't be surprised   if you see some famous characters here and there.     "Picking a program of favorite   Disney cartoon shorts isn't as easy as you'd think. The general consensus is   that while Disney excelled at feature length animation, his movies filled   with strong storytelling and superb character animation, the studio's short   cartoons are supposedly lacking.They pale in comparison to Fleischer, Warner   Bros. and MGM's library of classic cartoons. Nothing could be further from   the truth. While Walt's personal attention veered away from shorts and was   focused on the features and theme parks in the 1940s and 50s, he left Mickey   Mouse, Donald Duck and Goofy in some very talented hands and the Disney   shorts of that era were still the ones the other studios were trying to beat.        The earlier films, the cartoons produced by the studio in the 1930s, are   still miraculous by any standardliterally pushing the medium forward on a film-by-film   basis."Jerry Beck     Suitable for all ages.

title: Debauchery
description: Debauchery is: queers stripping for queers in hot, anti-oppressive space, raising money for organizations that serve the queer community. The show features stripteases, tons of audience interaction and even birthday lap dances onstage! Be sure to bring plenty of dollar bills -- a portion of the proceeds goes to non-profits providing health and social services within the queer community.This month's show benefits our community fund!**Accessibility** Neighbours is wheelchair accessible via the main entrance to the bar (located in the alley). There is a ramp between the door and the box office, and ample space for wheelchairs in the audience space. The show is ASL-Interpreted.Fragrance free request: Please join us in ensuring accessibility for beloved community members with chemical sensitivity and chronic illness by not bringing fragrances or scents on your clothes, hair, or skin from colognes and perfumes, scented laundry detergent, hair and body products, natural products, and essential oils. You can prepare in advance by not using products with fragrance, or by using fragrance free, non-toxic products. Two multi-stall all-gender restrooms are available.Information for scent sensitive people:Neighbors is not a scent free space. Scented cleaning products are used in all areas, including hand soap in the bathroom. Additionally,cigarette smoke from the smoking area in the alley drifts into the main performance space inside, fog is used on the dance floor, and many patrons are not scent free. Please protect yourself accordingly.

Formed in 2012 after the split of Kraft Foods, this global snacking powerhouse offers unique challenges for innovators who must adopt an ‘intra-preneurial’ mindset to deliver a constant stream of innovation in fiercely competitive categories for some of the world’s most recognized brands including Oreo, Chips Ahoy!, Ritz, Triscuit, Wheat Thins, Nabisco & Mr. Christie.About #LeanEnterpriseTOLearn to innovate like a startup. title: Mike Vax Quartet
description: Internationally renowned trumpeter and Summit Records recording artist Mike Vax. Mike has played lead and solo trumpet with the Stan Kenton Orchestra, the Clark Terry Big Bad Band, and the U.S. Navy Show Band. Currently Mike is leading his own groups: Stan Kenton Alumni Band directed by Mike Vax, The Mike Vax Big Band , TRPTS (Trumpets), The Great American Jazz Band, and the Mike Vax Quartet, Quintet and Sextet and does over 100 shows every year all over the world! title: Cyril's Wine Flight Club
description: The IdeaWe love wine. We love making it. We love sharing it. We love exploring all that it has to offer. We have found that some vintages and varietals are best experienced by groups of people for reasons ranging from bottle size to availability, and of course cost.Flight Club is our attempt to form a group of fellow explorers who will join us in a series where we look at some of the most fabled and beloved regions and wines around the world.We’ll taste, learn, possibly argue and definitely laugh—capitalizing on the power of a collective to purchase wines beyond our reach as individuals, peruse regions and bottle formats we’d never dream of on our own, and broaden our palettes. At the end of each club meeting, we will let the group elect the region, varietal, or format we’ll explore next. Wine for the people, by the people!Episode #1: Barolo NightWe will taste five (5) Barolos from the Piedmont region of Italy. Barolo is made from Nebbiolo grape and is considered one of the most important and praised wines of the world. The Romans planted grapes in the first century AD and the Nebbiolo grape has been planted there since the 1300s. These wines are typically highly structured and designed for years of aging. The rule of thumb for Barolos is to age for 15 years before you open them! It has been called “The King of Wines” and the 2000s has brought a string of fantastic vintages for Piedmont. We will be picking three to four wines from the historic 2004 to 2008 vintages. We will also taste a Barolo from the 1990s so we can experience a more aged Barolo. These wines are traditionally described as tasting of tar and roses--we will see if we can find those notes!-- but also have notes of chocolate, dried fruit, leather, mint, plum, spices and even truffles. We will also explore the tension in Barolo between the Traditionalists and the Modernists; the shift in techniques and approach between these producer groups and how that has affected the taste, age potential and “approachability” of the wine at younger ages.If any of the wines have a lasting impression, we can special order them for you. The question is if you can wait 15 years to drink them….Tasting Party: Sept 24th 2014 6.30pmphoto credit: made-in-italy.com

title: Rock On Winters Orientation 2014
description: Are You Ready to Rock!!??! Get ready for a week like no other. Winters Orientation Week is always the biggest, best Orientation week on campus. This year our theme will be “Rock and Roll”, we want to see your inner rock star shine through. Join us for a jammed packed week of amazing events and activities like our famous Downtown Tours, or our beautiful Toronto Harbour Boat Cruise, Band Night, Art Battle- And so much more!. Get a chance to meet and interact with your future classmates before classes even begin. Here at Winters, we want to you to have the most enjoyable and memorable first week of your University career. Orientation week has always provided the perfect gateway for new first year students to get fully involved in the Winters community.ALL FROSH WEEKS AT YORK ARE COMPLETELY DRYWhat does that mean? It means we are staying sober for the week. This is to ensure that our students who are under the drinking age can be included equally, as well as provide with a week you will actually remember. It is important that we all get to know the REAL you! No Ke$ha Business!!!By Buying this frosh kit:You will have access to all of York's most exclusive (Winters) events.Your standard issue Rock on Winters swag (Team T-Shirt, bandanas, and other Winters paraphernalia )A Rockin Tour Kit filled with more awesome swag Information on how to make the best of your University experience The tools you need to become the best rock star you can be Tons of new friends and people you can look up to, ask questions, and share experiences.Your very own all (Winters) access pass (Bracelet)and memories of the most magical part of University By the end of the week you'll find yourself looking in the mirror, and see the next greatest rock star staring back at you. ~~ See you there~~ Love From, Katie Powe and Nabil BabuYour Winters College Orientation- Chairs Join our Facebook group:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/709950985737603/***Pending on rate of sales, LIMITED quantities MAYBE available for purchase on the 1st day of Orientation, September 1st 2014 from 9:00a.m*******No CASH SALES : PayPal, Visa, Debit-Visa, Interac E-Transfer, & MasterCard are all accepted forms of payment********ALL SALES ARE FINAL******Please ensure to have YorkU Card/ Government Issued I.D at all times over the week**-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Please enjoy the following videos provided to you by your orientation leaders!About life in residence: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AOO_z-MAH2c&feature=youtu.beAbout commuting:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bh8DnRN1r5c

title: Work and Wine Wednesday
description: Need to play catch up on some work in the evenings? Why do it alone? Join the rest of us night owls for Work and Wine Wednesday. Come for two hours of solid work and then an hour of good wine and great conversation to reward yourself for a job well done. Limited spots available! Reserve your wine glass now!

title: A Ticket on the 4
description: Opening on July 17, 2014 for an exclusive six day residency at Toronto’s Aluna Theatre, A Ticket on the 4 is the most recent mixed media production by Toronto-based artist Jennifer Lindsay. Inspired by the poetry and prose of Charles Bukowski, the show is a stark look at the gritty world of horse-racing.Presented as a series of whisky-soaked vignettes exploring solitude, lust and the risk of a gamble, A Ticket on the 4 is told through it's transient hero Hank as he encounters a collection of vagabonds all while attempting to win his big ticket from the racetrack bar.July 17, 18, 19, 24, 25, 26 8:00PM and 10:00PM with the exception of opening night, which will feature a single performance at 8:00PM followed by a reading of works by Bukowski as well as a talk with the director and cast. Tickets also available the door (cash only) | Warning: Graphic Content | 19+Produced in association with Peacock Productions.

title: 14 juillet à Toronto ! Bastille Day in Toronto!
description: L'entrée est gratuite de midi à 18h. Ensuite, les billets pour le bal populaire qui commence à 18h coûtent $10 (gratuit pour les enfants de moins de 12 ans). Achetez vos billets ici.  14 JUILLET - Célébrons la fête nationale française, le  dimanche 13 juillet de 12h à 22h à Wychwood Barns - 601 Christie  Street, Toronto (métro : St Clair West).Au programme des festivités :• A partir de 12h – Traditionnel pique-nique organisé par Torontois.com• A partir de 15h – Festival : marché de produits  français, kermesse, jeux, animations, concours, musique, diffusion de la  finale de la coupe du monde de football… et bien plus encore !• A 17h30 – Cérémonie officielle & hymnes nationaux• De 18h à 22h – Bal populaire & tirage au sort avec de nombreux prix à gagner ! TOUT LE MONDE EST LE BIENVENU ! Alors n'hésitez pas à inviter votre famille et vos amis! Venez nombreux ! On compte sur vous ! Plus d’informations: consulfrance-toronto.org ---Entrance is free from noon to 6pm. Tickets for le bal that starts at 6pm are $10 (free for children under 12). Buy your tickets here. BASTILLE DAY - Let’s celebrate France’s national holiday on Sunday,  July 13, 2014 from 12 PM to 10 PM at Wychwood Barns - 601 Christie  Street, Toronto (subway station: St Clair West)Event schedule:• Starting at noon – Traditional picnic organized by Torontois.com• Starting at 3:00 PM – Festival: French market, games and activities, competitions, music, and much more!• At 5:30 PM – Official ceremony & national anthems• From 6:00 PM to 10:00 PM – Bal populaire & draw with many great door prizes!  EVERYBODY IS WELCOME! Come and join us for this fun day! Don't forget  to share this invitation with your family and your friends! We're  counting on you! For more information: consulfrance-toronto.org

title: How I Learned To Love Your Portfolio
description: In today’s hyper competitive world, what does it take to stand out to a recruiter? And not just any recruiter, but the top recruiters in North America? In this engaging panel find out from top recruiters from Arc Productions, Cartoon Network, Nerd Corps Entertainment, Mercury Filmworks, and a little studio called Disney to hear more about what they’re looking for from you and why they want to love your portfolio if you’d only do it right.Venue:Corus Quay | Atrium | 25 Dockside Drive, Toronto

title: TAAFI Toonville
description: TAAFI Toonville – Children and adults can learn about animation this Father’s Day weekend with screenings of the latest cartoons— including five of the amazing new Mickey Mouse shorts— followed by hands-on workshops with the animators, voice actors and artists behind them. Plus, family portrait caricatures, cartoon face painting and drawing, drawing, drawing, including a Mickey Mouse tutorial from some of the actual animators from Mercury Filmworks who brought Mickey back to life (all materials provided)!Toonville Tickets for Saturday include:Saturday Morning CartoonsFace Painting and Free DrawingNEW Mickey Mouse Shorts & Mickey ActivitiesVoicing Cartoons for Kids with Dan Povenmire and other voice actorsFangbone: Screening & Chat with Michael RexToonville Tickets for Sunday include:Phineas & Ferb: Behind The ScenesThe Nut JobLike Comics: Storyboarding Cloudy 2How To Draw CaricaturesVenue: George Brown College | Toonville (Lower Level Learning Landscape) | 51 Dockside Drive, Toronto

title: Swampy and Dan’s 16 Years to Air: Phineas and Ferb
description: PHINEAS AND FERB creators Dan Povenmire and Jeff "Swampy" Marsh worked together on the Nickelodeon series ROCKO’S MODERN LIFE, and cut their teeth in animation on the Simpsons under David Silverman. PHINEAS AND FERB was conceived after Povenmire sketched a triangular boy—the blueprint for the eponymous Phineas—in a restaurant. Povenmire and Marsh developed the series concept together and pitched to networks for 16 years before securing a run on Disney Channel. Sit back while the boys spin yarns about how they did it, and how you can too….16 years later...Venue:Corus Quay | Atrium | 25 Dockside Drive, Toronto

title: The Big Pitch + TAAFI Awards + Closing Ceremonies
description: The triple threat event to close down TAAFI 2014!First, witness the BEST pitches from TAAFI’s Pitch-A-Palooza as they go head to head in front of our panel and audience decide the best pitch of the year.Next, find out who will win this year's Golden Taafys during the 2014 awards for the best Canadian, International and Student short films as well as the coveted audience choice.And finally, join us as we cheer the end of another fantastic festival and celebrate the beginning of the Society for Animation Studies (SAS) conference, hosted by our venerable partner Sheridan College. (Visit theanimator2014.com for more details.)Venue Corus Quay | Atrium | 25 Dockside Drive, Toronto

title: The Stop's Night Market - STAFF TICKETS!

Rain or shine, no refunds, no date changes.The Stop strives to increase access to healthy food in a manner that maintains dignity, builds health and community, and challenges inequality.

title: 20 Feet from Stardom with Jill Godin
description: Limited tickets are also available at the door, cash only. Box office opens at 7:30 pm on the night of the event.Director: Morgan NevilleGenre: DocumentaryRunning Time: 90 minutesRating: PG13Starring: Darlene Love, Judith Hill, Merry Clayton, Lisa Fischer, Tata Vega, Jo LawrySynopsis: Millions know their voices, but no one knows their names. In his compelling new film TWENTY FEET FROM STARDOM, award-winning director Morgan Neville shines a spotlight on the untold true story of the backup singers behind some of the greatest musical legends of the 21st century. Triumphant and heartbreaking in equal measure, the film is both a tribute to the unsung voices who brought shape and style to popular music and a reflection on the conflicts, sacrifices and rewards of a career spent harmonizing with others.Watch the Trailer:Music Performance By: Jill GodinAt just 20 years old, Jill Godin has already demonstrated formidable songwriting instincts and a relentless dedication to her craft. Originally from Quispamsis, New Bruswick, Jill recently relocated to Toronto after winning Slaight Music’s annual “It’s Your Shot” contest and is now hard at work with some of Canada's most acclaimed and successful songwriters and producers.______________________________________________________________________Depending on how much rain is falling the event may be able to move indoors at 99 Sudbury and run on the same schedule as if it were outside. In the unlikely event that the indoor venue is unavailable, we’ll be sure to let you know. A raincheck will be provided to a future screening. All info will be sent to the email address provided when purchasing your ticket. Should you choose not to use our raincheck offer, the money will be donated to MusiCounts. Tickets are non-refundable. No outside food or drink permitted.

title: Online Marketing Expo! Meet LinkedIn, P&G Experts
description: Join 600 of Toronto’s top entrepreneurs, business owners and media specialists! Learn cutting-edge search engine and social media marketing strategies from experts at LinkedIn, P&G, TekSavvy, FreshBooks, Microsoft, DMZ and more!Don’t just hear about the latest techniques! Learn how to master them from industry leading experts & speakers who donated their time to help you take your business to the next level & support a great cause!Whether you are just getting started planning your online marketing strategy, or deep into implementation; Donate & Learn Events will provide you with the knowledge, strategies and networking opportunities needed to improve your social media and online marketing results, and take your business to the next level!What is the Donate & Learn Initiative?The Donate & Learn Initiative was created by Green Lotus to support local Toronto charities and provide informative workshops with a focus on social media, online marketing strategies, and the tools needed to achieve online marketing goals! So far, the Donate & Learn Initiative has raised over than $17,000 for the YWCA and Big Brothers Big Sisters of Toronto. title: Boston GreenFest 2014 Exhibitor Registration
description: Boston GreenFest is heading towards its 7th and most exciting year.  Our theme is Envisioning Our Future.  Help us educate all those who come about the importance of making green choices.  These span areas of energy, water, health & wellness, communication, transportation, design, technology, architecture, recreation, fashion, gardens, homes, children, food, urban agriculture and more.   We are looking for a diverse group of exhibitors and vendors that will showcase their sustainable services and products.  The more creative, energy-efficient, water-efficient, recycled, and upcycled your products are, the better!This year our event will span the weekend. Festival hours will be:Friday, August 15:  Noon-10 pm*Saturday, August 16:  Noon-10 pm*Sunday, August 17:  Noon-5 pm*Exhibitors will close at 6 pm.  Vendors remain open until 10 pm.  If any exhibitor wishes to remain open until 10 pm, please let us know.  Sign up now for the early bird special and work with us to choose your location. We are working to design a vibrant community setting for all who come to Boston GreenFest. This year we will expect all exhibitors to be open during the entire event.  Please be sure that you will have appropriate coverage.  Also, moving on and off the plaza will be more challenging due to the MBTA construction.  We will need everyone's help and cooperation.  We have tightened our organization and detailed site information will be provided well in advance.Let's envision our future together!

title: Smithsonian Family Workshop: On the Go
description: On the Go Recommended Ages:  19 months - 3 yearsSaturdays: October 18 - November 8Time: 10am—11:30amWhat better placed for your child to experience planes, trains and automobiles firsthand than the Smithsonian! Each week will feature a different mode of transportation and inspire your child's inner engineer.You can purchase the 4-week package for $170 OR individual classes for $45/each. Tickets are for one child and their caretaker.More information about family programmingFAQ'sDo I have to stay with my child during the class?Yes, this is a family workshop and parents are expected to attend and PARTICIPATE.  Its a great way to connect!My child isn't the right age, can they still attend?We work hard to create age-appropriate programs and hope that you can find a class that suits your child's age and schedule.  If you still feel strongly about attending, we will of course, welcome you.  But, please understand that we are unable to alter the class format and content to suit the needs of individual children and thus, your child might not have the best experience.Can I bring a sibling?We would prefer that you don't as it can be distracting and take away from the connection you can make with the child attending the class.  However if its a choice between the sibling or not attending the class, we would much prefer you come to the class! What will we do during the class?We will meet at the Natural History Museum introduce the theme in a SEEC classroom.  After our introduction, we will walk to a museum on the Mall and return to the classroom for a final activity.Will we be walking?Yes and in ALL weather.  Come prepared!  It’s a great way for the kids to get some exercise and fresh air too!What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?Metro - Federal Triangle, Smithsonian There is limited availability of street parking along the National Mall and Constitution Ave.Several parking garages in the area.No matter what you choose, give yourself an extra 20 minutes to park and walk to Natural History. Is my registration/ticket transferable?If there is room in another class, we will do our best to accommodate you. Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?Yes, please! What is the refund policy?Tickets will be refunded minus a $50 non-refundable deposit up to 2 weeks before the first class.

title: Protect Yourself From Fraud and Identity Theft

title: Just Eat It - Vancouver Friends Screening
description: Come  join Peg leg Films and Metro Vancouver for a special screening of Just  Eat It: A Food Waste story, the first in the Metro Vancouver region.   The movie will be followed by filmmaker Q & A with Jen and Grant and a reception.Synopsis:Filmmakers and food lovers Jen and Grant dive into the issue of  waste from farm, through retail, all the way to the back of their own  fridge. After catching a glimpse of the billions of dollars of good food  that is tossed each year in North America, they pledge to quit grocery  shopping cold turkey and survive only on foods that would otherwise be  thrown away. In a nation where one in 10 people is food insecure, the  images they capture of squandered groceries are both shocking and  strangely compelling. But as Grant’s addictive personality turns full  tilt towards food rescue, the ‘thrill of the find’ has unexpected  consequences.Featuring interviews with TED lecturer, author and activist  Tristram Stuart and acclaimed author Jonathan Bloom, Just Eat It looks  at our systemic obsession with expiry dates, perfect produce and portion  sizes, and reveals the core of this seemingly insignificant issue that  is having devastating consequences around the globe. Just Eat It brings  farmers, retailers, inspiring organizations, and consumers to the table  in a cinematic story that is equal parts education and delicious  entertainment.

title: TEDxAmRing: Change - worth fighting for
description: We cordially invite you on the 30th of May to join us at the HOFBURG Vienna to broaden the discussion of change and sustainability. TEDxAmRing focuses on sustainable change. Whether in the fashion industry, science and technology, or in everyday living, we must work together to create a solid foundation for lasting global change: to save lives, protect our environment, and create possibilities for conscientious living.Seats are limited so book yours now: www.tedxamring.atThe speaker lineup includes:* Vivienne Westwood* Conchita Wurst* Danny Resnic* Regan Hofmann* Bill Roedy and many moreCheck out the speakers here: www.tedxamring.atWe are looking forward to meeting you on the 30th of May at the Hofburg Vienna!Address of venue entrance: In der Burg, 1010 Vienna (Schweizer Tor)Wheelchair access is on Heldenplatz left of the National Library.Registration starts at 12:00All tickets are non-refundable.

title: HOMAGE 'Mother's Day Eve' Launch Party
description: In partnership with the Windup Bird Café, HOMAGE invites you to their official launch reception!Munch on appetizers while enjoying the company of HOMAGE blog’s fierce roster of women (and their children, from infants to adults!) Plus, learn about how the Windup Bird Café is changing the world from the corner of College & Borden, one dish at a time. Following the launch event, all guests are welcome to stay on for an optional prix fixe Mother’s Day dinner, with menu specially designed by Chef (and mother) Yumiko Kobayashi. Optional Prix Fixe Dinner Details (following launch)$35 + HST & Gratuity4 course dinnerIncludes vegan, gluten-free and dairy-free optionsIncludes one complimentary glass of wine(Other drinks not included)www.bloghomage.comAbout the BlogIn the HOMAGE space, every Monday is MOMday, publishing the stories, wisdom and striking portraits of the women who help shape the way future generations think, love, work, and make their way in the world. Each mother is asked for an advice theme of choice – from an area of professional expertise to a skill and/or quality they passed down to their children - and are subsequently interviewed and photographed in a significant environment of their choosing.The HOMAGE mandate is three-fold: honour, reattribute, curate. HOMAGE aims to honour both timeless, traditional advice alongside radical additions to mothers’ collective wisdom,  reattribute once-private-now-public knowledge back to its original source, and create a space where this knowledge can be enjoyed, critiqued and even acted on by readers.The blog is a love-child of four young female Toronto friends & neighbours – a designer, a librarian, a consultant and a TV creative. Check out their progress (and special features) as they trek from momma to momma at bloghomage.com/fieldnotes.

title: The Garbage Economy :: May 14th, Calgary
description: DE Breakfast SeriesWednesday, May 14th :: Ranchmen's Club, Calgary, ABJoin us on Wednesday, May 14th for breakfast and learn how DEC members are turning a profit from garbage with clean, effective and affordable projects that use waste streams to produce on-site heat and power.Agenda7:30 - 7:45    Registration7:45 - 7:50    Introduction, DEC                      Keynote Speakers7:50 - 8:05    Navigating the Bioenergy Roadmap in Alberta                        Angus Taylor, Senior Manager of Transportation and Renewable Energy, C38:05 - 8:30    Converting Biomass and other Waste Materials into Clean Energy                      Barry Berman, CEO & Anthony Khan, President, AgriPower Incorporated8:30 - 8:40    Q&A8:40 - 8:45    AdjournLocation: Ranchmen's Club, Calgary710 13 Avenue SW, Calgary, ABFree parking is offered on a first-come, first-served basisDress code: Business casual (no jeans)If you have any questions or comments about this event, please contact:Ana Medina, amedina@deassociation.caAbout DEC Breakfast SeriesDEC works to accelerate the deployment of technologies in real markets. The DEC Breakfast Series focuses on how Decentralised Energy (DE) contributes to a resilient, affordable, clean and reliable energy future in Canada.About AgriPower IncorporatedAgriPower, Inc. is a Delaware (US) corporation established in 2004. They design, manufacture, install, maintain and service a wide range of unique, proprietary, modular and transportable waste-to-energy, heat only, power only and combined heat & power systems. The systems use biomass and many other waste materials as fuel to provide a clean, reliable and sustainable source of low-cost heat energy, electricity and cogeneration. About Angus TaylorAngus is primarily engaged in business and project development and providing leadership to the organization as it transitions from a non-for-profit to a social enterprise. As a renewable energy project developer, his attention has been focused on biomass fuel opportunities including thermal conversion of biomass into value added products such as Biocoal, Pyrolysis Oil, and Syngas. He also manages C3's transportation file where recent focus has been on the environmental and economic benefits of fuel switching heavy and light duty trucks from diesel to natural gas. Whilst at C3, he has gained insight into the socio-economic value of energy efficiency, and renewable energy while also supporting the company's effort to reduce greenhouse gas emissions through the most cost effective means.

title: Deaf Rapper Sean Forbes Performance Show
description:
Deaf Rapper Sean Forbes brings his vibrations to
TORONTO!

Deaf and Loud, that’s his motto.  An accomplished and passionate dummer,
rhythms pours out of him, just the way he is!Sean grew up in Detroit where his parents, both
musicians, filled their home with the sounds of the Motor City: Mitch Ryder,
Bob Seger, the Funk Brothers and more.   Sean
soaked up the beats and the vibrations, experiencing great music in his own
way.  Inspired by what he calls “The Three B’s” (the Beastie Boys, the Beatles,
and Bob Dylan), Sean started out making music videos in his basement and today
is producing professional music videos with a focus on the deaf and
hard-of-hearing community. He is a voice for not only his generation but Deaf
culture.With his passion for music, Sean has opened the door to musical expression
– a world historically considered off limits to people in the Deaf community.
Since 2008, Forbes has performed in over 40 cities across the US; including
college campuses, live venues, and at retailers such as Borders and Barnes
& Noble. AtCome and watch him perform at the ARIA COMPLEX Night Club on 180 Peter Street, Toronto!  You will
be sure to experience DEAFandLOUD.comThis event is in partnership with the Ontario Association of the Deaf and the Canadian Cultural Society of the Deaf.

title: Shuck-U: Sustainable Canadian Oysters and Wine 101
description: Shuck – U – An Oyster Class instructed by Patrick McMurray of Starfish and Ceili Cottage, on the “Merroir” of Sustainable Canadian Oysters from the East and West Coasts, Paired with Local Ontario Wines. Sponsored by Domenic’s Fish Market, in Partnership with St Lawrence + Wine Country Merchants.

title: Friends With Benefits for The Royal - May 2, 2014
description: Here’s the skinny:TICKETS STILL AVAILABLE AT THE DOOR!!!May 2, 2014 at Lago Bar – Grill – View at Dow’s Lake in Ottawa ON:8:00 pm to 10:00 pm – Silent Auction, Cocktails, Appetizers, Entertainment and Words10:00 pm – 2:00 am –  Dance Party!  Friends With Benefits was conceptualized by a group of friends whose aim is start a dialogue to reduce the social stigma around depression. By getting our friends, coworkers and neighbors together to share stories, we hope to illustrate that there are many people who are successful, contributing members of the community that are living (and thriving) with mental illness.About Friends With Benefits:Launched last May in 2012, the 2012 and 2013 Friends With Benefits events have raised over $28,000 for the Jennie James Depression Research Fund to promote awareness, understanding, research and treatment of depression and to end the silence surrounding suicide.  The Fund contributes directly to the Royal Ottawa Foundation for Mental Health to support the best possible patient care and leading edge research provided by the Royal Ottawa Mental Health Centre, the Brockville Mental Health Centre, and the uOttawa Institute of Mental Health Research.  2014′s event exceeded expectations: the 150 advanced tickets were sold out a week before the event, there was friendly competition for the silent auction items donated by over 50 local businesses, and the event attracted media attention from Rogers Daytime, Boom 99.7, the Ottawa Sun, Ottawa Citizen and the Ottawa blog Be Healthy Be Beautiful.

title: Brasstronomical by The Heavyweights Brass Band
description:
ANYONE WHO PURCHASES YOUR TICKETS FROM NOW ON PLEASE PRINT YOUR RECEIPT OR HAVE IT ON YOUR SMART PHONE TO MAKE IT EASIER FOR US TONIGHT!! I'VE PRINTED THE LIST AT THIS MOMENT*Tracks will be emailed to you via dropbox the night of your purchase, if there are any problems don't hesitate to contact chris@chrisbutchermusic.com*The Heavyweights Brass Band releases Brasstronomical  

Thursday March 6th 2014  

with  

Jane Bunnett
Jay Douglas
Luis Orbegoso
DJ General Eclectic
Street Brass (opening set)  

Lula Lounge (1585 Dundas Street W) Doors 7PM, Show 8PM  

Brasstronomical EPK  

This country’s greatest purveyors of feel-good horn music burst onto the Canadian jazz scene with their energetic brass band covers of contemporary pop hits. Now with Brasstronomical, the Heavyweights are offering a unique sound with emphasis on their original compositions. They delve deeper and more eclectically into each musical direction implied on their first album. Brasstronomical reveals the band’s music is stronger, bolder, funkier and more mature than ever before.   

$10 at the door or $20 with a CD.  

As an incentive to purchasing your tickets online we are giving away three tracks recorded at the Brasstronomical sessions that aren't included on the CD. They will be emailed directly to you.  

As a second incentive every package other then "General Admission" includes a direct download of the entire album as well. Meaning you don't need to wait until the March 6th to get it, you get Brasstronomical emailed to you now. The physical copy of the CD will be picked up at the door.  

For our friends who live out of town or who can't make the concert, don't fret you can purchase a digital download or a physical copy of the CD mailed to you here.  

If you want a taste, the album is streaming in it's entirety for a very limited time from our SoundCloud .  

Brasstronomical also features world famous percussionist Giovanni Hidalgo (Paul Simon, Dizzy Gillespie) and one of the bonus tracks features Canadian jazz legend Robi Botos on rhodes.

title: HomeEc 25: Craft Beer Salon (for the Beer-curious)
description:
You like beer?  Want to learn more about it while sharing pints with 
friends?  This is going to be a fun night celebrating beer and offering 
you a chance to try something unique and meet a bunch of passionate beer
 lovers who want to share what they love about beer!This is an 
informal night (there isn't any lectures or anything like that); we're 
bringing along some friends that we thought you might be interested in 
chatting with (there's no speeches and you don't have to chat - come out
 and have fun if that's all you want!)
The evening is 
sponsored by Kensington Brewery who will bringing a one-of-a-kind cask 
of beer to try.  You can also talk to their brewer and team to learn 
about brewing beer.
David Ort (who wrote The Canadian Craft Beer Cookbook) will be on-hand to chat about cooking and pairing beer and food.
Steve
 Riley (BetterBeer.com) is a cicerone (it's like a somalier of beer), 
beer judge and an expert on draft beer systems.  He's got a cool trick 
to show you what bad beer tastes like!
We're in the final stages of confirming this guest - but if you've ever thought about home brewing, they'll be the one to ask!
We'll
 be working with HiLo to make a beer-inspired cocktail for the evening. 
 There will also be a raffle and some surprises along the way!

title: Panel Event: Local or Organic?
description:
Local or Organic: What's at Stake and Why It Matters

When it comes to the food we eat, should we choose local or organic? The easy answer is both. But what to do when local, organic produce is not available? Which is the greener and healthier choice? Join Fresh City, Local Food Plus, and Pfenning's Organic Farm on Thursday, February 20th at 6:30p.m. for a free panel event to discuss this topic. Our goal is to help you make more knowledgeable, conscious food choices. Every dollar we spend on food is a vote for the kind of food system we want - let's make an informed choice.

More details here: http://www.freshcityfarms.com/get-involved/panel-event/Have a question for our panelists? Send a tweet to @freshcityfarms and hashtag #LocalorOrganic

description:

Try some delicious craft beer from the Black Oak brewery and grab some innovative new beer-infused products. And sample java from an exciting new social venture out of Toronto, KLINK Coffee. These folks will be letting you know a little bit about the beverages and unique biz stories.

Being an entrepreneur in good food isn't the easiest thing in the world. These meetups help us connect to share stories, learn from each other, and offer/ask for help. Entrepreneurs, innovators and good food enthusiasts of all kinds are welcome. Doubling as Food Forward's holiday mixer, this will be a great opportunity to show off to others in the food business community). Already many great items confirmed!

title: EUFF 2013: Jackie
description:
Directed by Antoinette Beumer 
Comedy/Drama, 90 min
Language: English, Dutch
Cast: Carice Van Houten, Jelka Van Houten, Holly Hunter

Sofie and Daan are twin sisters who were raised by two fathers. When they get a phone call from America that their biological mother is hospitalized with a complicated leg fracture awaiting transfer to a rehabilitation center, the two end up in an adventure where everything they believed in is called into question.This results in an unforgettable journey to New Mexico with the strange and inappropriate Jackie where the lives of the two sisters will change forever.

title: EUFF 2013: My Father's Bike
description:
Directed by Piotr Trzaskalski 
Drama/Comedy, 90 min
Language: Polish
Cast: Artur Żmijewski; Michał Urbaniak; Krzysztof Chodorowski

When 70 year-old Wlodek finds out his wife has left him, he faints and ends up in hospital. His son and his estranged teenaged grandson come to visit him and are faced with the shocking news that Grandma left to live with another man in a picturesque place by the lake where the family used to go for summer holidays. The trio decides to go and bring her back. On the trip, old frictions come back to life, but the common goal gives them the opportunity to get to know each other anew. Day after day, what seemed to be bad is indeed good, and rebuilding their lost relationships becomes more important than retrieving Grandma.

title: EUFF 2013:The Exam
description:
Directed by Péter Bergendy
Drama/Thriller, 89 min
Language: Hungarian
Cast:  János Kulka, Zsolt Nagy, Gabriella Hámori, Péter Scherer

The 1956 Revolution has fallen. Terror reigns. Appointed by the Soviets, the new prime minister orders that each and every National Security officer’s loyalty be tested according to new and rigorous directives. Jung is a super-ambitious cultural NS officer living undercover as a private teacher. Marko, Jung’s immediate superior, and also his only friend is ordered to monitor Jung’s apartment and activities for a day to test his friend’s loyalty to the new regime. What sets out as routine surveillance takes a wild turn when Markó uncovers disturbing secrets in Jung’s life; secrets that can easily destroy the careers of both men.

title: TJLF: Nora Gold, Fields of Exile
description: THIS EVENT IS PAY-WHAT-YOU-CAN AT THE DOORTHURSDAY, MAY 29, 2014 | 7:30 PMNora Gold: Fields of ExileArtscape Youngplace, Flex Studio, 180 Shaw St.Nora Gold launches her new book, Fields of Exile, the first novel about anti-Israelism in the academe. It has received enthusiastic advance praise from Phyllis Chesler, Irwin Cotler, Alice Shalvi, Steve Stern, Thane Rosenbaum, Naim Kattan, Nava Semel, and Ann Birstein, and was picked by The Forward as one of the “5 Jewish Books to Read in 2014.”Dr. Nora Gold writes fiction, edits the online journal Jewish Fiction.net, does academic and professional work, blogs for Haaretz, and engages in community activism. Her first novel, Fields of Exile will be published in May 2014 by Dundurn Press. Her previous book, Marrow and Other Stories, won the Louis Lockshin Prize for Short Fiction, a Canadian Jewish Book Award, and was shortlisted for the Danuta Gleed Award, a prize for the best first short story collection in Canada. Dr. Gold’s academic career includes ten years on faculty at McMaster University’s School of Social Work and numerous scholarly publications and funded projects. She is currently the Writer-in-Residence and an Associate Scholar at the Centre for Women’s Studies in Education (CWSE) at the Ontario Institute for Studies in Education, University of Toronto (OISE/UT).

title: EUFF 2013: Volare
description:
VOLARE: The Great Story of Domenico Modugno
Directed by Riccardo Milani
Biopic, 131 min
Language: Italian
Cast: Giuseppe Fiorello, Kasia Smutniak, Alessandro Tiberi, Antonio D'Ausilio

Domenico “Mimmo” Modugno has barely outgrown his childhood when he leaves a small village in Southern Italy to make his fortune as an actor in Rome. He ends up staying in a homeless shelter, singing at downtown bars to survive. His strong Southern accent and other misadventures will change his dream to become an actor and lead him to choose music over cinema. His song “Nel blu dipinto di blu” (better known as “Volare”) will receive two Grammys with sales over 22 million copies, and will represent Italy in the 1958 Eurovision Song Contest. “Volare” will revolutionize the Italian music scene of the 60s, becoming the soundtrack of a country now aiming for the sky.

title: Foodival Daytime
description:
Join us as we bring together Toronto's best, hand selected, food vendors for a food carnival you will never forget. Each vendor will create your childhood favourites or carnival themed foods with a modern twist. With each portion priced between $3-8, you can eat your way through the carnival. It would not be a carnival without some games and performances. In between eating, join in carnival themed games and programming in support of Real Food For Real Kids.

Daytime Session (All Ages): 11:00 AM - 3:00 PM
Evening Session (19+): 6:00 PM - 10:00 PM

Tickets: $12.50 Adults, $7.50 Children (under 14)
Door Tickets (if available): $15 Adults, $10 Children Cash Only

title: Fresh City Harvest Festival
description:
Come celebrate the Fall Harvest season with Fresh City! Join us at Downsview Park on Sunday, October 6th for an afternoon full of autumnal activities and homegrown goods. There will be cider beer from Indie Alehouse Brewing Co., pumpkin pie from Cookie Martinez, fall soup from Urban Acorn Catering, food and crafts, farm tours, games, workshops and more. Bring a blanket, your family and friends!

Join member farmer Arlene for a workshop on Composting, and member farmer Mélisanne for a workshop on Sprouting. Kids are welcome.

Our farm is a short transit ride or drive away. If you’re taking transit, you will see our greenhouse on the south-east corner of the Keele St. and Sheppard Ave. intersection. If you’re driving, there is parking available next to the building at 70 Cannuck Avenue.

title: WORKSHOP: Gourmet Mini Donuts by Brad Kurtenbach
description:
Ontario has the most donut shops per capita of anyplace in the world — so why is it so hard to find a really good, quality donut? Although a new generation of gourmet donut shops are starting to crop up, paying upwards of $30 for a dozen donuts is a daunting proposition.

Join Chef Brad Kurtenbach as he shows you how to make your own gourmet mini (3") donuts in this fun, family-friendly workshop.

Working with a both sweet white and savoury whole wheat doughs, you'll create dozens of amazing flavour combinations including sugar-dusted, jelly filled, creme-filled, chocolate glazed and more... And decorating these delicious little treats is half the fun.

And to add a fun, personalized twist, every person who signs up gets to nominate a custom flavour combination that they'd like to see made at the class. Maple bacon? Chocolate chili? Strawberry balsamic? It's up to you!

FAMILY SPECIAL - bring kids under 12 for 1/2 price

Brad Kurtenbach is a Red Seal-Ready chef-at-large, as well as the founder of Kensington Organic Ice Cream and the man behind the in-house dairy fermentation program at URSA (recently voted one of the top 10 restaurants in Canada).

description:
Camping Upgrades must be accompanied by a Festival & Camping Pass.  These are vehicle or area passes and are not required for each person.  See more information below on what is included with each upgrade.

RV Passes: A 20’X40’ space for Class A, B, C RVs, “5th Wheel” or Tow-Behind Trailers (including utility trailers). If you need more space for additional vehicles, tents or people you can just purchase 2 RV Passes. Any Volkswagen campers or vans are not required to purchase a RV pass. Space is limited and we request that you purchase a “Reserved Car Camping Pass” for smaller standard sized vehicle if you would like to camp with your vehicle.

Reserved Car Camping Passes: If you would like to camp with your car you will need to purchase a “Reserved Car Camping Pass.”  This pass allows you to park 1 car and setup 1
tent (up to 2 people) in a
10’X35′ space. Only 1 Pass is required for each 10’X35′ space and not for each
person. For example, if 2 people arrive in 1 car they would need to just
purchase (1) “Reserved Car Camping Pass.” If 2 people arrive in 2 cars or need
space for 2 tents the will need (2) “Reserved Car Camping Passes.”

title: NCF: Improv Explosion (Saturday)
description:
Chris Trew +2
Trew + 2 is Chris Trew plus two strangers from the audience with no improv experience who get a very quick lesson (less than 3 minutes). The three of them do a montage, the final scene being the first and only scene featuring only the two strangers who, strangely enough, always seem to figure it out and make something killer and memorable happen.

Trew + 2 is a big hit on the comedy festival circuit and is appearing at several festivals this year.

About Chris:  Chris Trew is a full time comedian (“Trew is out of his fucking mind” - The Austin Chronicle) and part time professional wrestling manager (“a performance artist at the highest level” - The Wrestling Blog) splitting his time between New Orleans and Austin where he is the Creative Director of The New Movement, a comedy theater and training center that's home to events like Hell Yes Fest and the Megaphone Marathons.

Trew has headlined comedy festivals all over the U.S. and has been featured in GQ Magazine, Splitsider, the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally, America’s Got Talent, and many other strange things.  He helped “start a comedy scene from scratch” (Splitsider) and is the co-host of Air Sex Battles on MTV, debuting later this year.

He was named "one of 10 comedians you should know" by Paper Magazine and is the co-author of Improv Wins, a book about improv that serves as the textbook at The New Movement.

For bearded, out of the box comedy, your aim is Trew - Star News Online, Wilmington, North Carolina

Chris Trew’s Unabashedly Weird Comedy Comes to the Scruffy City Comedy Festival - Knoxville Mercury

What Not to Miss at This Year's Chicago Improv Festival - The Chicagoist




Jet Pack
Andy Livengood (Theatre 99, Charleston SC) has assembled an improv team from all over the east coast. Charleston, Norfolk, New York come together to create a one of a kind improv experience. Fast, unpredictable , and explosive; Jet Pack combines lightning quick improv with grounded characters and scenes. Strap yourself in, you never know where Jet Pack will take you!

Jet Pack Improv: you'll laugh so hard, you'll wet somebody else's pants!!

About Andy: Andy has been performing improv for over a decade. In that time he has studied at Theatre 99 (Charleston, SC), The Annoyance Theatre (Chicago), and The Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre (NY).

He regularly performs at Theatre 99 where he was a founding member of the groups CLUTCH and Cats Hugging Cats. In 2010 Andy was voted Charleston's best comic.

He is a massive improv nerd and will always geek out with fellow improvisers at bars after shows.



____________________________Coalition TourCoCoalition TourCo are a premium blend of performers from Richmond, Virginia’s Coalition Theater. Since 2009, the Coalition have been producing high-energy, physical, weird longform improv shows.Coalition Theater is Richmond's home for live comedy shows and improv, sketch and stand-up classes. Find out more info at rvacomedy.com. Live Comedy. Dead Serious.

title: Risebrough Residence High Performance House Tour
description:
The Risebrough Residence is SUSTAINABLE.TO Architecture + Building’s latest proof that ‘Simple is the New Smart’. This forward-thinking home employs readily-available construction materials in innovative ways to achieve a future-proof dwelling for a young Toronto family.

On September 10, we will be running tours of the Risebrough Residence every hour, on the hourfrom 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. to showcase the unique design features and sustainable strategies that make this a high performance home. Throughout the day, team members from SUSTAINABLE.TO and from Greenbilt Homes, the builder of the Risebrough Residence, will be on site to answer any questions you may have about green building and design.

Sustainable strategies integrated into the design of this project include continuous exterior insulation, an airtight envelope, passive heating, natural ventilation and free cooling, high-performance triple-glazed fibreglass windows, in-floor radiant heating, exposed concrete floors for thermal mass, and dedicated ventilation through an energy recovery ventilation system.

These simple sustainable strategies, combined with Mid-Century Modernist sensibilities, result in an unprecedented architectural achievement: the ultimate in pragmatic functionality never before seen in Toronto.

For more information, check out the Risebrough Residence on our website.

For more info. on the Builder, Greenbilt Homes Ltd., please visit: greenbilthomes.ca

title: Wander House PassivHaus Tour Architect Mark Rosen
description:
Come and visit a newly built Passive House in the heart of Hintonburg!

Built on an infill lot and designed by PLOTNONPLOT Architecture, The Wander House is a single family home that uses roughly 85% less energy for heating than a standard new home. It is built with super-insulated walls, ceilings and floors, and is extremely air-tight. It showcases a shallow geo-thermal ground loop, grey-water ready plumbing system, high efficiency ventilation system, and heat pump hot water tank. The Wander House is one of only a handful of houses in Canada to target the rigorous international PassivHaus standard.

title: The HOOTENANNY! Tour | Grande Prairie, AB
description:

He and the Glory Boys (A world-class Canadian bluegrass trio) have shared the stage on cross-Canada tours with artists such as Third Day, and most recently, his worshipfulness, Chris Tomlin. Now, starting September 2016, they’re hitting the road on their biggest headlining tour to date, bringing their ‘Worship Hoedown’ to your backyard!

What is “Worship Hoedown” you ask?

It’s a bluegrass inspired night of music and joy... beards, banjos, and blessings for the whole family! A night of corporate worship; with hymns, choruses, original songs, and comedy, geared towards all ages and denominations. It’s Baptists, Pentecostals, Catholics (and everything in between). It’s the local churches coming together to worship in unity, It’s a HOOTENANNY!

title: MILF Life Crisis- a sexy comedy about dating again!
description:
What happens when you're newly divorced with kids? You go dating every other weekend! A new kind of relationship comedy! Because after marriage comes dating!

 Written & Performed by Anne Marie Scheffler of Second City Toronto, Just For Laughs, The Comedy Network, SPANK! The Fifty Shades Parody, and Caroline's on Broadway

So you dated badly in your twenties and thirties, and just in the nick of time, you snagged a soulmate and started a family. But now your perfect life has fallen apart- your marriage is over! Did you really just land back on the dating market? What kind of cruel world is this? Do you really need to go through first dates and new lovers all over again? Or is this happening to everybody: sexy confident adults who can have amazing relationships and not be trying to get married and start a family? Cougar town? Utopia? Or just a lot of wine and lingerie? Who are these guys you're dating? A new kind of fun!

Audience Quotes:

She was unbelievable! - H. S.

GO SEE THIS SHOW!!! You will Not be sorry!!! - B. L.

Anne Marie Scheffler, you and your show are an inspiration to all of us single guys and dolls. Tinder on, Anne Marie. We will always swipe you to the right! - M. W.

Your show is amazing!- M. L.

Last night's performance was fantastic, with a perfect balance of excellent acting, insightful writing, and comedic talent. - S. M.

We saw MILF LIFE CRISIS last night & our cheeks still hurt from laughing. Anne Marie is a comic genius and incredible woman taking on the challenge of midlife dating (after divorce).

YOU SHOULD SEE THIS IF: You are midlife, separated, divorced, dating, or in a relationship, a young guy with a thing for Hot Mamas, or if you just need a good laugh. - D. B.

Anne Marie's show is the funniest hour you will spend in Toronto with your clothes on. I urge everyone to catch her last show. -

M.W.

title: Metro Detroit Signature Networking Event
description:
Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.

Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.



Featured Speaker


Medicine, Music and Education





Sabina Lone - Medical Cannabis and the Endocannabinoid System

Women Grow Metro Detroit is honored to announce that one of their own members, Sabina Lone, AKA “Dr. Cannabina”, will be presenting a fun and educational power point presentation on the Endocannabinoid system, and how cannabis can be used as medicine. Sabina is a medical cannabis patient and activist, and finds her passion in educating others on all things cannabis. Her medicine, healthcare, and business background, with her love to learn and help people, keeps her eager in spreading the word on how Cannabis is medicine. Sabina thrives to help others learn how Cannabis can help them with medical ailments, and although she is not a medical physician, she can certainly guide and provide extensive knowledge on the subject matter.

Nikki Harris and Angela Carpenter will also be speaking on how CBD's helped their lives and families.



September Event Adgenda 
6:30PM Check-in and Open Networking

7:30PM Sponsor Presentation

7:45PM Featured Speaker

8:30PM Open Networking

11:00PM Meeting Concludes



Pre-sale tickets available: 

October Event - TBD



F.A.Q.

Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.

Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.

How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.

Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.

Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.

What are my transportation/parking options? Parking available onsite, for free.

Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash. Price is $40 at the door.

Are tickets refundable or transferable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.

Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.

Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

TWITTER TIPS

A great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!

#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabis

title: Double Feature: The Made Up Movie
description:
Double Feature is back for another round of made up, movie mayhem!!!!

Who needs Hollywood! With a single audience suggestion an entire movie is created right before your eyes. Courageous heroes... dastardly villains... mind blowing special effects... you'll see it all and more crammed into two 25 minutes sets of improv magic.

Double Feature: The Totally Improvised MovieSaturday, September 3rd at 8pm

Tickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street and the lot directly across from the theater.

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For nearly ten years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

--

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts. The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: The HOOTENANNY! Tour | Saskatoon, SK
description: Tim & the Glory Boys are headed your way on their 2016-17 HOOTENANNY tour!Tim Neufeld (also of the band “STARFIELD”) is a multiple JUNO, Dove, and Covenant award winning Christian artist based out of Abbotsford, BC. He and the Glory Boys (A world-class Canadian bluegrass trio) have shared the stage on cross-Canada tours with artists such as Third Day, and most recently, his worshipfulness, Chris Tomlin. Now, starting September 2016, they’re hitting the road on their biggest headlining tour to date, bringing their ‘Worship Hoedown’ to your backyard!What is “Worship Hoedown” you ask?It’s a bluegrass inspired night of music and joy... beards, banjos, and blessings for the whole family! A night of corporate worship; with hymns, choruses, original songs, and comedy, geared towards all ages and denominations. It’s Baptists, Pentecostals, Catholics (and everything in between). It’s the local churches coming together to worship in unity, It’s a HOOTENANNY!

title: Lip Service!  The Ultimate Lip Syncing Competition
description:
Because of the weather, we are regrettably canceling our shows tonight.  Lip Service: The Ultimate Lip Sync Competition is being moved to Friday, November 4th at 8pm.

If you are unable to attend this new date, please email us at pusherscomedy@gmail.com and we will refund your ticket.

Sorry for the inconvenience,

-Push Comedy Theater





Are you ready for this?

Nine contestants, four months, one Golden Mic!  Core Theatre Ensemble and Push Comedy Theater present the ultimate Lip Sync Competition in Hampton Roads!

Each month three brave contestants will show off their Lip Syncing skills over three different rounds!

Join us for an evening of loud music, sweet dance moves, trash talking, and a few surprises along the way!



Friday, July 8th @ 8pm.  Featuring Nancy Bloom, Evan Lambert, and Skye Zentz.

Special Guest: Ashley Hall



Saturday, August 6th @ 10pm.  Featuring Angel Sanchez, Jessa Gaul, Pam Goode

Special Guest: Dennis Andrews



Saturday, September 3rd @ 10pm.  Featuring Mark Haynie, Willie McGhee, Amanda Steadele

Special Guest; Amber Forehand-Hughes



The winner of each show will then battle it out in our final night:

Friday, November 4 at 8pm.  The winner takes home the Golden Mic!



The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.Free parking available behind Virginia Furniture Company (745 Granby Street) and at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street.

title: TEDxNewYork: Down the Rabbit Hole
description: TEDxNewYork is an immersive, full-day event featuring a slate of superstar New Yorkers, great food, and ideas worth spreading. A lineup of renowned and underground speakers will present surprising, thought-provoking, and engaging ideas. This year's theme is "Down the Rabbit Hole," dedicated to cross-pollinating ideas and getting all the way down to where the good stuff is.

title: 2016 Forte Studios Battle of the Bands
description:
TICKETS AVAILABLE AT THE GATE on 9/24 | $10

Join us for a fun and exciting outdoor concert festival featuring regional midwest music, a food and drink vendor and a street beer garden serving local craft beer from Boone Valley Brewery & Budweiser!  Midwest bands battle to win a free album recording ($5,000 value) in an annual outdoor festival style concert downtown Boone, Iowa

You be the judge!  Audience participants will vote for their favorite band during the afternoon battle rounds reducing the competition to six bands for the evening concerts.  In total twelve bands will compete and perform on an outdoor live stage downtown.

Bands performing include:


	
	D-Ko  | Punk Rock from Rochester, Minnesota | https://www.facebook.com/DKOofficial/ -
	
	Far From Innocent | Rock Band from Hampton, Iowa | https://www.facebook.com/Far-From-Innocent-6672084... -
	
	Booksie & the Pages | Swing & Jazz Rockabilly from Rochester, Minnesota | https://www.facebook.com/BooksiePages/?fref=ts-
	
	
	Silent Redemption | Power Rock from East Dubuque, Illinois | http://www.facebook.com/SilentRedemptionMusic -
	
	Righteous Wicked | Alternative Blues Rock from Ames, Iowa | https://www.facebook.com/therighteouswicked -
	
	Of the Monks | Blues Funk From Des Moines, Iowa | https://www.facebook.com/ofthemonks -
	
	The 9th Planet Out - Hard Rock from Rochester, Minnesota | https://www.facebook.com/The9thPlanetOut/ -
	
	
	The High Bank Boys | Country music from Deep River, Iowa | https://www.facebook.com/thehighbankboys/-
	
	What Lies Within - Metal music from Des Moines, Iowa | https://www.facebook.com/whatlieswithinofficial/ -
	
	Kickstart the Sun | Rock music from Ames, Iowa | https://www.facebook.com/kickstartthesun   -
	
	The Crak-Pots | Psychedelic Rock Funk from Minneapolis, Minnesota | https://www.facebook.com/CrakPots/ -
	
	Bad Authority | Rock band from Carroll, Iowa | https://www.facebook.com/blackdiamond5769/?fref=ts
	



Featuring Guest performances in the afternoon and evening in between the battles by:

1.  Through the Darkness | Metal band from Grand Junction, Iowa | https://www.facebook.com/wefindthelight/?fref=ts


2. Vaudeville | Rock band from Minneapolis, MN | https://www.facebook.com/vaudevillemn/?fref=ts


3. Hawk McIntyre | Blues from Boone, Iowa | https://www.facebook.com/hawkmcintyremusic/?fref=t...



Itinerary of Events

11:30AM - Gates open12:00PM (noon) Battle Rounds (Features both bands on stage at the same time battling for 30 minutes)

12:00PM Battle - Kickstart the Sun VS Of the Monks1:00PM Battle - What Lies Within VS The 9th Planet Out

2:00PM - 4:00PM - Kids Activities

2:00PM Battle - Bad Authority VS The High Bank Boys2:30PM Guest Feature Band - Through the Darkness3:00PM Battle - The Crak-Pots VS Booksie and the Pages4:00PM Battle- The Righteous Wicked VS Far From Innocent4:30PM Guest Feature Band - Vaudeville5:00PM Battle - Silent Redemption VS D-KO5:30PM Battle Round Awards & 50/50 raffle

6:00PM Final Rounds Begins! (Featuring 30 minute concerts of the 6 battle round winners) Guest acoustic performance in between set changes by Hawk McIntyre

10:45PM - Champion Award Announcement

title: CEG MarsterChef
description:
¡Trae tu mejor receta!

Desde la Casa de España en Georgia queremos probar y compartir vuestras recetas. Por eso, os esperamos el  11 de Septiembre a las 5:00pm en en el Club House de una de nuestras miembros para pasar un buen rato e intercambiar conocimientos. ¡Habrá premios a los entrantes, principales y postres más votados!  Prepara tu mejor plato y preséntalo a concurso. Nosotros ponemos la bebida. Este evento es gratis para los socios y solo $10 para no socios, para colaborar en alquiler de local y bebidas. El pago será en efectivo a la entrada, pero por favor registraros pinchando "Reserva" con vuestro nombre, correo electrónico y plato que vais a traer.

Bring your best recipe!At the Casa de España en Georgia we want to try and share your recipes. This is why we look forward to meeting you on September 11th at 5:00pm in the Clubhouse of one of our members to have a good time and exchange knowledge. There will be prizes to the most voted appetizers, main and desert dishes!.

Prepare your best recipe and bring it. We will provide drinks. This event is free for members, $10 for no members to cooperate with venue rent and drinks.  The payment will be in cash at the door, but please register by clicking "Get Tickets" with your name, email and dish you are going to bring.

title: Texas Contemporary Art Fair
description: Texas Contemporary, Houston’s premier modern and contemporary art fair, returns to the George R. Brown Convention Center this September 29th through October 2nd for its highly anticipated sixth edition. The fair is pleased to announce exciting highlights from a roster of esteemed galleries from around the world as well as the return of the celebrated focus section The Other Mexico. Texas Contemporary 2016 will partner with influential institutions including Inprint, Gulf Coast, and the Houston Ballet to present a dynamic program of special events, talks and tours, broadening the fair's reach beyond traditional artistic disciplines to engage the creativity and artistic patronage that is essential to and synonymous with the city of Houston.

title: Brooklyn OSHA 10 Construction - Weekends - $115
description:
Brooklyn OSHA 10 Weekend

OSHA 10-hour Construction Class 
$115 pre-registration price
Earn you OSHA 10 card for the bargain price of only $130. You cannot work on a major construction site in New York City without this card. Take this engaging safety class and be qualified to work on Monday.





Schedule: Certain Weekends:
Friday, 3:30 PM - 9:30 PM 
and Saturday, 9:00 AM - 3:00 PMPrice: $130 at the door
$115 if register online in advance
231 Norman Avenue, Suite 212
Brooklyn, NY 11209
(G train to Nassau Avenue)
Classes available in 
Brooklyn, Queens, the Bronx, and Manhattan

Walk-ins Welcome  -  No Pre-Registration Required


New York Safety and Training, Inc.A Veteran owned business. Ask about our discount pricing for U.S. military veterans.

LIKE us on Facebook: www.Facebook.com/NYSafetyandTraining

Visit our website: www.NYSafetyandTraining.com

New York City Department of Buildings mandates that all workers at major construction sites must have had the OSHA 10-hour Construction Industry safety class within the last five years. DOB inspectors regularly visit job sites to check for OSHA cards, and any laborer without an OSHA card will be ejected from the job. Taking this course helps students to remain safety compliant and maintain their current employment or to become safety compliant as a first step towards qualifying to be hired in the construction field.

OSHA 10-Hour Construction Industry -- Designated Training TopicsThis training program is intended to provide entry level construction workers information about their rights, employer responsibilities, and how to file a complaint as well as how to identify, abate, avoid, and prevent job related hazards on a job site. The training covers a variety of construction industry safety and health hazards which a worker may encounter. Training will emphasize hazard identification, avoidance, control, and prevention, not OSHA standards. OSHA mandates that the 10 hours of training be broken into 7 hours of mandatory topics, 2 hours of elective topics, and 1 hour of optional topics as follows:

Mandatory - 7 hoursIntroduction to OSHA -- 2 hoursCovers workers' rights, employer responsibilities, and how to file a complaint. It includes helpful worker safety and health resources. It also provides samples of a weekly fatality and 3 catastrophe report, material data safety sheet, and the OSHA Log of Work-Related Injuries and Illnesses.

Fall Hazards in Construction - 1.25 hoursCovers fall protection and related fall hazards encountered on construction sites, including how to remain safe and the proper techniques to establish fall protection.

Electrical Hazards in Construction -- 1 hourCovers electrical hazards and the dangers involved with working with electrical equipment and circuitry within the construction field.

Struck By Hazards in Construction -- 1 hourCovers hazards on construction jobsites that relate to falling and flying objects including vehicular strikes. Emphasis is placed on recognizing the hazard and avoiding the hazard.

Caught-In-Between Hazards in Construction -- 1 hourIncludes hazard awareness of trench collapse, machine guarding, and entrapment situations where workers can be caught in operating machinery or pinched between opposing objects.

Personal Protective Equipment -- 1/2 hourCovers the proper, effective use of personal protective equipment (such as hearing protection, safety goggles, and gloves), including statistics of injuries related to the failure to properly use personal protective equipment.

Hazard Communication, Health Hazards, and Silica-- 1 hourCovers the proper way to label and catalogue hazardous materials and chemicals, such as cleaners, solvents, and paint, and how to avoid chronic exposure to hazardous substances including silica.

Elective - 2 hours The instructor will teach two to four of the following topics: Scaffold Hazard AwarenessThis topic covers scaffold hazards including falls, improper usage, improper erection, and the various safety systems to keep workers safe while using scaffolds.

Trench and Excavation HazardsExcavation and trenching are among the most hazardous construction operations. This topic introduces learners to the hazards of trench and excavation safety as it is encountered in the construction process.

Confined Space Hazard IntroductionIntroductory Hazard Training that refers to an area which is enclosed with limited access which makes it dangerous. Hazards in a confined space often include suffocation by un-breathable gases which may be present but not visible or submersion in liquids or free-flowing granular solids.

Ladder SafetyLadder Hazard awareness, including how to properly select, use, and maintain ladders to ensure construction site hazards are minimized.

Respiratory ProtectionThis topic covers the dangers associated with potential exposure to pathogenic airborne contaminants that can cause acute and chronic diseases among construction workers.

ErgonomicsThis topic teaches how the use of Ergonomics, which is fitting a job to a person, helps lessen muscle fatigue, increase productivity, and reduce the number and severity of work-related musculoskeletal disorders.

Safety and Health ProgramThis topic teaches considerations for creating, implementing, and enforcing your own workplace Safety and Health Programs.

Optional - 1 hour There is also an hour reserved for optional safety training. We can tailor an additional topic to a specific client (such as water safety if the client is a school with a swimming pool), or what most often happens is this hour is reserved for any of the previous topics that the students are particularly engaged in and want to spend more than the allotted time on. It is often helpful for the instructor to have this hour at his or her disposal to be able to devote to any topic in which the students are especially engaged.

title: Ben's Bells Speaker Series: TED Speaker Guy Winch
description:
Guy Winch grew up as an identical twin, which made him an expert at identifying favoritism. When he was older he began to notice a favoritism of a different kind, favoritism towards the health of the body over the mind. This observation launched him into 9 years of research that led to his book titled, "motional First Aid: Healing Rejection, Guilt, Failure and Other Everyday Hurts". On August 26th, he will be joining forces with the Ben's Bells Project to tell us why we don’t have to deal with things alone. Instead, we can practice emotional hygiene, when we learn to identify and manage our minds and our emotions with as much attention and care as we give our physical bodies. Join us for this special series to learn, be inspired, and to spread kindness to the world, and more specifically yourself. DEADLINE TO REGISTER IS AUGUST 25t AT 11:59 p.m.

The Deets:


	Friday, August 26, 2016
	7:00pm
	Temple of Music and Art
	330 S Scott Ave
	Tucson, AZ 85701

Ticket Options:


	Regular Admission: $18
	Student Admission: $15
	Kindness Bundle: $40
	
		Guy Winch's Book "Emotional First Aid"
		Social DoGooder Tee Shirt:
		
			Saguaro Tee Shirt
			Do Good Shit Tee Shirt
		
		
		One Admission
	
	

All proceeds will go to Ben's Bells Project.

title: Jinkx Monsoon in - "Return To Grey Gardens"
description:
Qurb Media Group & Peaches Christ Productions Present:

JINKX MONSOON, PEACHES CHRIST, and MINK STOLE in:   "Return To Grey Gardens"

A theatrical comedy spoof that pays homage to the acclaimed documentary film Grey Gardens (1975).

The beloved cult documentary by the Maysles Brothers captured the eccentric lives of mother and daughter former society doyennes, now fallen on hard times. This hilarious live production written and directed by Peaches Christ, is set forty years into the future and documents the routine of an aging drag mother and her bitter drag daughter who continue to perform for an empty house.

STARRINGJinkx Monsoon as Lil' Jinkxy - www.JinkxMonsoon.comPeaches Christ as Big Peachy - www.PeachesChrist.comWITH SPECIAL GUEST STARMink Stole - www.MinkStole.com

AND FEATURINGMajor ScalesSparkle LeighSylvia O'StayformoreLeicester LandonWITHAbbey RoadsTipsy Rose LeeIsabella ExtynnJames Majesty



Don't miss your chance to see Seattle's very own RuPaul's Drag Race Season 5 WINNER Jinkx Monsoon performing her WORLD FAMOUS Snatch Game character LIVE on stage!  ONE NIGHT ONLY!

Written & Directed by Peaches Christ.
