title: Legal + Business Considerations: Cannabis Startups
description:
Entrpreneurs and other smart professionals are starting businesses in both medical (MMJ) and adult-use marijuana as the end of cannabis prohibition looms closer in New England and across the US. But the cannabis industry isn't quite like others when it comes to setting up shop and maintaining a business in full compliance with state and federal laws.

Join Women Grow: Boston and attorneys Scott Moskol, Lesley Muldowney and Frank Segall of Burns & Levinson LLP's Medical Marijuana Business Law group for a presentation covering:

-Startup issues such as operating agreements, due diligence and management agreements-Real estate issues including host city agreements and insurance-Raising investment capital and handling investor relations-Operational concerns such as grow facility and retail issues-Banking and regulatory requirements-Other legal issues

LOCATION: Burns & Levinson LLP

125 Summer St, 8th Fl, Boston

EVENT AGENDA

6:00 PM - Check-in and open networking6:30-7:45 PM - Presentation and Q&A7:45 - 8:30 Open networking

F.A.Q.

Who attends? At Women Grow: Boston events, you'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. You'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way.

What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Burns & Levinson is very conveniently located between South Station and Downtown Crossing stations. Street parking is not guaranteed in the Financial District, so plan accordingly.

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

MORE

Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.

Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.

Who attends Women Grow events? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.

Why attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.

Contact boston@womengrow.com with additional questions about our events, sponsorship opportunities and membership.

title: Methodologies: Broader Horizons
description:
Publishing in Research and Practice: Between Industry and
the Academy

Thursday 15th and Friday 16th September 2016

The first Publishing Studies Network event is planned for the 15th and 16th September 2016 on the campus of the University of Stirling.

Supported by the Scottish Graduate School for Arts & Humanities and the University of Stirling, this exciting two-day event seeks to develop on existing connections and create new links between scholars and practitioners in the fields of; publishing studies, creative writing, visual arts and design, cultural policy and the variety of other topics within the creative industries.

Participants can expect training on research methodologies, workshops with industry practitioners in the arts and creative industries. Networking opportunities will also offer the potential for future interdisciplinary research and industry collaborations.

This two-day training event is open to any postgraduate doctoral research candidate across the disciplines of: visual arts, design, film, cultural policy, media and communication, creative writing, publishing studies and literary studies.

A travel bursary is available for all attendees from any SGSAH member institution, who need to travel to the University of Stirling for this event.

The event is organised in partnership between the University of Stirling, the University of Edinburgh Centre for the History of the Book, Edinburgh Napier University and the Association for Publishing Education.

title: Harrisburg Business & Career Networking Event
description:
HARRISBURG BUSINESS & CAREER NETWORKING EVENT
Join us for a summer networking event in Harrisburg. This is a great opportunity to meet license applicants, medical professionals, business professionals, real estate agents, and career seekers. Learn the latest news straight from PAMCS staff, special guests and sponsors.

NON-MEMBERS

Join the Pennsylvania Medical Cannabis Society to meet, greet and learn the latest news straight from PAMCS staff & special guests.

MEMBERS
Current PAMCS Career, Industry and Vendor Members attend for FREE!  Contact your Account Representative for the applicable promo code!





Brought to You By:
The Pennsylvania Medical Cannabis Society


Sponsored By:



New Frontier Data is an independent, technology-driven analytics provider that guides trailblazers in emerging markets to critical decisions based on truth. Our real-time data solutions drive radical and responsible growth in the cannabis industry.

Speaking about the data essential to license seekers will be John Kagia. He is the Executive Vice President of Industry Analytics for Frontier Financial Group Inc. He applies his keen understanding of market research, business strategy and industry analysis to help high-performing organizations achieve their strategic objectives. Leveraging his years of experience managing research studies for industry-leading clients including Accenture, Microsoft, The George Washington University, and the U.S. Department of State, Kagia brings an incisive understanding of how market insights enable organizations to plan, grow, compete and measure performance more effectively.


Core Deign Group


Sarah Werner is the Business Development Manager for CORE Design Group - an architectural and structural engineering firm with office locations in PA, MD, and DE. CORE Design Group has experience and expertise in the design of large-scale cannabis manufacturing facilities. We are a design resource not only after a license is secured, but during the application process as well. CORE Design Group’s services are tailored to fit our client’s specific needs and can range from schematic floor plans to fully documented, permitted, and “shovel-ready projects. Please visit our website at www.core-designgroup.com for more information and to view our online portfolio.




Current PAMCS Career, Industry and Vendor Members may attend the NETWORKING EVENT AT NO CHARGE. Contact your Account Representative for applicable promo code.

title: Брати Гадюкіни вперше в Чикаго
description: Брати́ Гадю́кіни — культовий український рок-гурт, створений 1988 року у Львові; першими з українських рок-команд здобули популярність на теренах колишнього СРСР і пострадянському просторі. «Гади» випустили 4 студійні альбоми, 4 концертні альбоми та 2 збірки хітів. Крім цього, була величезна кількість концертів та участь у фестивалях по всьому світу. Гурт припинив концертну діяльність в 1995 році і возз'єднався в 2006 році для концерту в київському «Палаці спорту», який зібрав 15 000 глядачів — абсолютний рекорд для українських музикантів.

description:
Learn to skate from the Gotham Girls Roller Derby coaches!If you are a female between the ages of 6 and 11 years and want to learn to skate and play roller derby, this is the camp for you!We will cover roller skating basics and introductory roller derby skills. You must have your own skates, knee pads, elbow pads, wrist guards, helmet, and mouth guard. No skating skills are necessary, but you must be able to make it around the track without holding onto walls or people. Gotham Girls Junior Derby Basics Skating and Derby Summer Camp will run Monday August 15 through Friday August 19, 10am-4pm each day. 
Each camp day will have a morning skate session, lunch and fun off-skates activity, and an afternoon skate session. 
Mid-day breaks will be BYOL (bring your own lunch) and will include activities like icebreakers, footage viewing, movie watching, derby rules session, and skate maintenance with Five Stride Skate Shop. 
Camp days are cumulative and must be purchased as a whole package.

title: Cheesemaking 101: Bloomy Rinds
description: Ever dreamed of making your own buttery brie or mushroomy camembert? Now you can! We'll taste superb examples of these delicate wheels before rolling up our sleeves and making our own! Learn which cultures create the satiny, white rinds and how to delicately handle the curd to ensure a custardy wheel. After setting our wheels aside to drain and set, you'll return the next day to collect your wheel, which you can salt and age at home! This class is capped at ten students to enhance the workshop experience.

title: Hunt for the Wilderpeople w/Most People Wed Aug 24
description:
Wednesday August 24th at Open Roof FestivalLimited tickets are also available at the door, cash only, on a first come, first serve basis. Box office opens at 7:00 pm on the night of the event until tickets are sold out.
Hunt for the WilderpeopleRating: PG13Running Time: 1h 33minRaised on hip­hop and foster care, defiant city kid Ricky gets a fresh start in the New Zealand countryside. He quickly finds himself at home with his new foster family: the loving Aunt Bella, the cantankerous Uncle Hec, and dog Tupac. When a tragedy strikes that threatens to ship Ricky to another home, both he and Hec go on the run in the bush.As a national manhunt ensues, the newly branded outlaws must face their options: go out in a blaze of glory or overcome their differences and survive as a family.  Equal parts road comedy and rousing adventure story, director Taika Waititi (WHAT WE DO IN THE SHADOWS, upcoming THOR: RAGNORAK) masterfully weaves lively humor with emotionally honest performances by Sam Neill and Julian Dennison.  A hilarious,touching crowd­pleaser, HUNT FOR THE WILDERPEOPLE reminds us about the journey that growing up is (at any age) and those who help us along the way.With a musical performance by Most PeopleDoors open at 7:00 pm, Most People performs at 8:00 pm, and Hunt for the Wilderpeople will begin when the sun goes down (roughly around 9:00 pm). 
Depending on how much rain is falling, the event may be able to move indoors at 99 Sudbury and run on the same schedule as if it were outside. In the unlikely event that the indoor venue is unavailable, a raincheck will be provided to a future screening. All info will be sent to the email address provided when purchasing your ticket. Tickets are non-refundable. In the event of a cancellation, proceeds from tickets will be donated to MusiCounts.Please use an email you check frequently for information regarding any potential cancellations.

title: ARCS Tampa Bay Annual Dues and Contributions
description:
ARCS Tampa Bay would like to invite you to renew your membership and journey with us to a 7th year of making science matter in Tampa Bay. A portion of your dues is earmarked for the Scholar Awards given to high performing USF PhD students from the College of  Marine Science and Cancer Research.

PLEASE use this site to renew your membership or make a donation to further the mission of the ARCS Foundation.

 Our scholars are discovering a new understanding of the health of our coastal waters and managing Gulf fisheries and conducting cutting edge research to better understand bone marrow disorders and melanoma cells in the brain.  We need your support to help keep this research going in Tampa Bay.  Your participation will support our four scholars continue their studies.   96% of ARCS Tampa Bay revenue supports the scholarship funds!.
	

The ARCS Foundation advances science and technology in the United States by providing financial awards to academically outstanding U.S. citizens studying to complete degrees in science, engineering and medical research.

It is ARCS Foundation's belief that support of STEM education is essential to US economic growth and technological competitiveness, and helps to ensure continued US leadership in global innovation, health and quality of life.

title: Red Bull Rampage 2016
description:
The uniquely demanding terrain of Virgin, Utah, once again beckons the best mountain bike riders to the desert to compete for glory in one of the biggest tests of skill and guts in the world.

Judged by former competitors, the 21 invited athletes have found an all-new event zone with more natural terrain options than recent years — returning the 11th edition of Rampage to the roots of big mountain riding, raw and untamed.

DISCLAIMER:

Spectator Advisory

Red Bull Rampage features the world's greatest riders tackling the most intense terrain any contest has offered – no novices here. The same applies for spectators; this event is not for casual observers. The new Red Bull Rampage venue was chosen for its ability to challenge the riders and push their limits, so it is remote, hot, dangerous, and unforgiving.

It is four miles to the contest venue over uneven desert terrain that you will either have to hike or pedal. If you ride it, you'll need to check your bike at the on-site bike valet once you reach the contest venue, no exceptions. Spectators will be required to stay within designated viewing areas at the base of the course near the finish line – no exceptions. No pets will be allowed, and non-adult spectators are not recommended. If this sounds harsh, that's because it is; this isn't a mountain resort, this is the desert. All on-site rules and requirements are necessary to ensure everyone's safety and enjoyment.

If you decide to attend, pack plenty of water, snacks, sunscreen, extra layers of clothing, basic first-aid gear, and a flashlight/headlamp as no provisions will be available on-site. In other words, treat it like an unsupported weekend ride with your buddies. Just think ahead, be smart, and come prepared.

title: Webinar: 2016 Planner Pricing Report
description:
Show me the money!


	How much do independent planners charge per hour? Per event?
	How does that differ based on years of experience, corporate vs. social, home vs. office? 
	What pricing models do they use: Flat fee? Markup? % of Budget?
	What percentage accept commissions from venues or vendors? 
	What percentage disclose these commissions to their clients?
	Why do clients hire them: Logistics? Creative Ideas? Resources? Production?
	Are planners making more, less, or the same money as last year?

This webinar will discuss the answers to these questions and more, as we unpack the data in the newly published white paper., based on our survey of 516 independent event/meeting/social planners or event company owners. We'll utilize over 25 graphs and charts in analyzing and explaining our findings in this highly informative webinar, on a topic rarely talked about, but critical to all business owners and independent planners.

WHEN: Tuesday, August 30 | 1 pm Eastern
COST:
Webinar access is available at no additional cost to PAID ELI subscribers.  (Subscribers please check your inbox for the details).  Subscriptions are $25 / month, or $250 / year (2 months free) and include unlimited access to all on-demand video classes, white papers, interviews and webinars.  For more info click here.

title: Planetfall Sci-Fi Larp - Game 6 - Beta Series
description:
Become a colonist struggling to survive on an alien world. 200 years in the future, Earth struggles under environmental devastation and a tyrannical government. A lucky and disposable few are sent on the first mission to colonize another Earth-like planet 36 light years from Earth. Your wits, your knowledge and your courage are the tools you will use to survive.Planetfall is taking Live Action Gaming into the future. It is a roleplay-centered immersive game using groundbreaking mobile technology to create a unique live action gaming experience. We are based in Austin, Texas.Schedule

Saturday 0900 - 0930
Check-in


Saturday 0930 - 1000
Announcements and Opening Ceremonies


Saturday 1000 - 2200
Game (Staff On Site)


Saturday 2200 - Sunday 0900
Night Cycle (No Staff, RP only)


Sunday 0900 - 1400
Game (Staff On Site)


Sunday 1400 - 1500
Closing Ceremonies and Cleanup

More information is available at: http://www.prepareforplanetfall.comContact the staff or any player for an invite code.Site and Catering DetailsThere are no sleeping quarters on site. Please bring a tent if you plan to stay overnight, along with appropriate sleeping bags for the weather and wind. This is the windy plains of Texas, so tent stakes are highly recommended.Two breakfasts, two lunches and a Saturday night dinner will be provided to people who purchase the meal package with their ticket. Fire pits and limited electric will be available for cooking. If you do not wish to buy a meal plan, please bring your own food. Genre appropriate food is highly encouraged, e.g. MREs, ration bars and the like.Meal plans must be pre-purchased by the Wednesday before the game. A limited number of meal plans may be available for purchase on site, but you are not guaranteed to receive one.New PlayersYou can obtain an invite code from any current player. You can use this invite code to register and create your character on our website: http://prepareforplanetfall.com/#/signupYou must bring a 'drop box' where all your character's personal equipment, including guns, can be stored before the drop sequence, marked with your characters name. A plastic bin should be fine. The only items you will have in the drop sequence is your costuming and your personal scanner (i.e. cell phone or tablet)Large items such as tents can be stored in your car and taken out after your box is recovered, for simplicity's sake.

title: Albuquerque Women Grow Networking Event
description:
Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.

Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.

SPEAKER & TOPIC:

We would like to invite you to October’s Women Grow ABQ Networking event!

Ever wonder what it would be like if New Mexico became a recreational cannabis state? Please join us Thursday, October 6th in welcoming Nicole Olonovich to the Women Grow stage! Nicole will be speaking on her experience in customer service and management within Colorado’s medical and recreational environments. Come with your questions on how Colorado made the transition from medical to recreational, and how this move has impacted the industry. This month’s event will be taking place at Bow and Arrow Brewing Co.!

Save $5 by purchasing your ticket online prior to Sunday, October 2nd.

At the door ticket price is $35

EVENT AGENDA
6:00PM Check-in and Open Networking6:15PM All About Women Grow and Why We Need More Diversity in the Cannabis Industry6:30PM Speaker Presentations7:45PM Open Networking8:30PM Meeting Concludes


F.A.Q.
Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.

Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.

How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.

Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.

Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.

What are my transportation/parking options? There is plenty of free parking, but feel free to carpool with a friend!

Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash.

Are tickets refundable or transferable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.

Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.

Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

TWITTER TIPS

A great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!

#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabis

title: Formula E pre-season testing 2016/17
description:
DONINGTON PARK, UK - The new-look fully-electric Formula E cars will take to the track for pre-season testing ahead of the 2016/17 FIA Formula E Championship at Donington Park.

The 10 teams, with the new addition of Jaguar and Techeetah, have six days of official testing to prepare their challengers for the opening round of the third season of the world’s first fully-electric racing series in Hong Kong on October 9.

With a free Eticket, you can get general admission access to Donington Park. There is a limited number of grandstand seats available on a first-come-first-served basis. On arrival, you will be advised which grandstands are open. Doors open at 09:00. The morning testing session runs between 09:00-12:00 and the afternoon testing session between 14:00-17:00 (schedule subject to change). Please note the final admission to the circuit will be 16:00.

There will be an organised pit walk from 13:15-13:45. Wristbands for the walk can be purchased from the Donington Park ticket booths on the day for £5 each. Complete your day by showing your Eticket to obtain a 50% discount on admission to the Donington Collections Museum (offer applies to Formula E testing days only).

title: The Ticketmaster API Devjam in London, UK!
description:
This year, Ticketmaster will be rolling out more new technology than ever before! We're taking the show on the road to meet with you, the developer community, to get your feedback on the developer experience we're building and on the new exciting updates to our APIs!



	
	


We'll also get to hack on some cool stuff together :)







APIS & DOCS
Get on our Developer Network to get your API key and take our APIs for a test drive. You'll find our API Documentation very useful. In case you had a question or something isn't clear, our FAQs could be helpful as well.


THEME
The theme of this devjam is event discovery. We encourage everyone to use our APIs and mash them up with other APIs to create meaningful experiences for fans.


SCHEDULE
9:00am – Doors Open + Light breakfast

9:30am – Opening Remarks

10:00am – Developers dig into the APIs!

11:30am – First round of feedback

12:00pm: Lunch

4:00pm – Demos!

4:30pm – Closing Remarks

5:00pm – Happy Hour!


LOCATION
The Imperial Bar @ Ticketmaster, 4 Pentonville Road, London, N1 9HF, United Kingdom


SWAG & PRIZES
Participants will receive Ticketmaster swag and potentially the opportunity to score game or concert tickets (via raffle). More details coming soon.


WE'RE ALSO HIRING!
Ticketmaster is constantly on the lookout for top talent in the industry.  We actively recruit through career fairs, student organizations, user groups, hackathons and any other method we can think of to locate people that fit into our culture.  Beginning in the fall we start looking for candidates to be a part of our summer internship program.  We try to identify these individuals by April.  As participants in the Devjam that we are sponsoring in January, students will have the opportunity to meet and interact with hiring managers and teams while they are participating.  They will also have the opportunity to see what our industry, company and culture is all about.

Looking forward to seeing you guys on September 3 2016!

Happy Coding!

The Ticketmaster Devjam Team

title: Classic Feast Night: From Dusk Till Dawn
description:
On Classic Feast Nights we team up with the Mercury Cafe to offer up a specialized menu themed to the screen!

This month's screening of From Dusk Till Dawn will be complimented by:

-Gecko Brothers Nachos with house made salsa-Satanico Pandamonium Chicken or Black Bean Burrito-House made "Sex Machine" Churros-Choice of Descendants El Buscador Cerveza, Shot of Tequila or Fountain Beverage

Get your tickets by July 25th to take advantage of the full menu!

Service of the special menu begins at 6:30pm so don't be late!Feature starts at 6:45pm!

Tarantino and Clooney are the Gecko brothers, sick and ruthless killers, respectively. They commandeer the motor home of the Rev Fuller (Keitel) to evade the cops en route to a midnight rendezvous at the Titty Twister, hottest whorehouse in all Mexico. Along for the ride are Fuller's teen kids, and the Reverend himself, who has most definitely picked the wrong day to lose his faith. Written by Tarantino in 1990 on a commission from a special effects company, the film is aimed squarely at horror movie fans who appreciate the nuances of impalement by pool cue, pencil and table leg. Rodriguez has a lot of fun dreaming up cool ways to kill people (he's making this his life's work), but he also gets something resembling a performance from Tarantino and transforms Clooney into a full-fledged movie star. Bikers, head-bangers and film geeks will rave to the grave.﻿ - TimeOut

title: BlizzCon - November 4-5, 2016 (EMPLOYEE PURCHASED)
description:
BlizzCon is an epic celebration of Blizzard Entertainment’s game universes and the global player communities that bring them to life. The tenth BlizzCon will take place at the Anaheim Convention Center in Anaheim, California on Friday, November 4 and Saturday, November 5, 2016.Tickets to attend BlizzCon 2016 will be priced at $199 USD (plus applicable taxes and fees) each and will be available for purchase in two separate batches.The first batch goes on sale at 7 p.m. Pacific time on Wednesday, April 20, and the second batch goes on sale at 10 a.m. Pacific time on Saturday, April 23.In addition to serving as a gathering place for Blizzard Entertainment gaming communities, BlizzCon will offer attendees a chance to enjoy:   
Hands-on      play time with the latest versions of Blizzard Entertainment games  
Global      finals for Blizzard esports, featuring top pro gamers from around the      world  
In-depth      discussion panels with Blizzard game developers and artists  
Community      contests with great prizes  
Commemorative      merchandise based on Blizzard Entertainment’s game universes  
More      activities and attractions to be announced on www.blizzcon.com

In addition, an exclusive pre-BlizzCon dinner to benefit Children’s Hospital of Orange County (CHOC) will also be held the evening of Thursday, November 3, from 6:30 p.m. to 10:30 p.m. PT at the Hilton Anaheim Hotel in Anaheim, CA. BlizzCon Benefit Dinner attendees will get the chance to eat, drink, and be merry alongside Blizzard developers, artists, and community representatives while supporting a great cause. Tickets to the BlizzCon Benefit Dinner go on sale Wednesday, April 27 at 7 p.m. PT. Approximately 200 tickets will be available for $750 USD each (plus applicable taxes and fees; limit two per household), and Blizzard Entertainment will donate the proceeds to Children’s Hospital of Orange County (CHOC).  For more information on BlizzCon 2016 and the BlizzCon Benefit Dinner, visit www.blizzcon.com.

This course builds upon and extends the experience of the techniques introduced in the Get Happy course, and includes a complete practice of Sudarshan Kriya®. title: Hudson Bay Farm
description: Ray and Tom Williams, and their  spouses Melinda Eden and Penny Hawkins operate Williams Hudson Bay  Farm, located just west of Walla Walla on the stateline. Their farm is  on land that the Hudson Bay Company originally cultivated starting in  1821 and now encompasses over 3,000 certified organic acres. They also  are certified "Salmon Safe".The Williams organically grow  wheat, alfalfa, hay, alfalfa seed, sweet corn, grain corn, popcorn,  winter squash, and pumpkins. They also have a complete nutrient  recycling program through their dairy replacement livestock feeding  operation. They market directly to Bob's Red Mill Natural Foods and  other regional organic suppliers, including two distilleries, one of  which won an international award for the "World's Best Vodka" in 2014. The  Williams Family invites you to visit their farm and discuss the  practice of sustainable agriculture and organic farming. It's really  very simple: all you need is good organic fertility, excellent soil  biology and effective weed control (an impossible task, but they keep  trying to do it).

title: Green Feast 2016
description:
From all over Southern California, organic farmers, fishermen, wine makers and renowned chefs will contribute their expertise to serve up The Ecology Center’s ninth annual Green Feast. This elegant farm to table dinner raises funds to support The Ecology Center's educational initiatives.

Beyond a delicious meal, Green Feast is a celebration of our local food artisans and a reminder that a vibrant food community is at the center of a sustainable, abundant future. Ingredients for the meal are sourced by our chef team from within 250 miles of The Ecology Center.

Green Feast will take place in The Ecology Center's learning landscapes, a historic property surrounded by rolling hills. The evening begins with a stroll through our gardens, where guests will taste a variety of appetizers freshly prepared by local chefs. As the sun sets, a four-course dinner will follow, served on long tables dressed in white linens and candles, set up communal-style. The evening culminates in a lively auction in support of The Ecology Center's educational programming, including Grow Your Own! a school and home garden initiative.

TICKETS

Green Feast 2016 tickets will go on sale on July 13th. Member tickets are $250 and non-member tickets are $300.

Annual membership starts at $50 for a full year of benefits.  All proceeds from Green Feast will be directly invested into The Ecology Center’s eco-educational programs and initiatives. For more information, visit theecologycenter.org/support or contact membership@theecologycenter.org.

Discounted member tickets available for purchase depend on membership level:

Individual Members - 1 ticket

Family Members - 2 tickets

Community Members - 4 tickets

There is a 4 ticket per person limit for all purchases. 

For more information about sponsoring Green Feast, please contact vicki@theecologycenter.org.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

Earn you Flagger card for the bargain price of only $90 ($100 at the door price). Make yourself more hireable if you're looking for work, and if you already have a job, make yourself more invaluable to your team with your Flagger certification.

New York Safety and Training’s Flagger class is an interactive learning experience that teaches participants the safe and effective practice of directing pedestrian and vehicular traffic at and around active construction sites.  Students learn proper signaling techniques and how to appropriately and safety control the flow of traffic.  The course presents the required personal protective equipment to be worn during flagging operations. title: Vending @ American Music Festival for the Lake
description:
The 2016 American Music Festival for the Lake

Invites you to Vend / Exhibit at this year's event on Sept 24-25 in the Charles R Wood Park in Lake George

(across Beach Road from the steam boats at the old Gaslight Village space)

Food & Non-Food participants are welcome at exceptionally affordable vending fees

Sell at the fest....or .. just  set up an info-only (non-selling) table

Buy your "Vending Ticket" here.

.

A Description of the Event:

- A two-day outdoor/open-air festival

- Third Annual: 2x Lake George's most successful, popular and acclaimed music festival

- Music, food, craft beers, skateboard park, kids' play area, and charity poker tournament

- Saturday Music Headliner: Blue Oyster Cult + more

- Sunday Music Headliner: Ryan Montbleau Band + more

- Predicted attendance:  2,500-3,500 over the two days

.

How do you join the fun as a vendor?

1.  Choose / Purchase your vending-participation option via the 'GET TICKETS'  process

2. A Contract w/ details will be soon after be emailed to you.

3, Either mail a signed version to our office ... or.....sign one at the festival

3. NOTE to Food vendors: Warren County now requires a Health Dept permit, which we will send you (+$35)

4. Selling at the event? You will need a Sales Tax # and certificate displayed on-stie. Don't have one? NYS has an 800-number to get one.

5. You will be instructed as to Logistics prior to the event

ALL RATES ARE TWO-DAY (full weekend).. and are in 'Early Bird' pricing mode: they will increase shortly,

.

Note: FOOD rates = for on-site consumption.  IF you are selling food specialties for consumption off-site (ex: maple syrup, pet treats, cooking oil, etc), use & choose the NON-FOOD schedule of rates

.

"Tabletop"  and "under tent" and "food truck"  vendors are allowed two (2) personnel to work the event. The second helper does NOT have to buy an additional vending "ticket".  If you need additional consideration / help: email us first.

.

Note: No 'political' or 'offensive' (as per our definition) exhibiting will be accepted. We hold the right to deny and fully refund any participation that we deem as contrary to our family-friendly atmosphere, with no recourse to the applicant.  We will also strive to limit the # of Food vendors that have similar menus; it makes no sense having multiple vendors selling the same thing. A wide variety is sought, both for ambiance and for vendor success.

title: The Ladyvine Sessions: Z-STAR DELTA & JAY POWER
description: The first in a series of sessions hosted by Zee Gachette (Z-STAR) featuring live performances by Z-STAR DELTA & JAY POWER.LadyVine weaves an ubiquitous energy line of genre bending sounds, improv and visuals connecting like minds and music lovers within its creative diaspora, Music. Consciousness. Social. ___________________Z-STAR DELTA is the stripped back delta blues rock folk flipside of British rock band Z-STAR. The explosive duo features guitar prodigy Sebastien Heintz with the electrifying award-winning frontwoman Zee Gachette on acoustic guitar and drums, who effortlessly deliver a fascinating cinematic road trip of sound. Zee's lush raspy blue tones, big acoustic guitars and swampy grooves laced with Seb's dark desert slide, psyche blues guitars and synth make for an evocative dangerous concoction. Expect a riotous roadtrip of passionate tales delivered with a dark dangerous earth shattering sound. This will be their UK debut show, after giving birth to the project in Australia. Zee and Seb will be showcasing tracks from their Dark Days Down Under tour album, as well as stunning new tunes written on the road. "A rare blend of power and delicacy, deliver with an audience engagement that can't be learned" - Baha Music Bar (Australia)"They are the real real deal!" - 4ZZZ 102.1fm (Australia)"The duo had the audience entranced with their evocative stage presence. Great musical diversity" - Rip It Up (Australia)__________________Combine slick beats and sassy vibe with vocal prowess and JAY POWER is what you get. Her show combines a dash of urban beats, a hint of funk and a splash of neo soul. Along with her power packed live performances, Jay Power’s reputation as an Australian act to watch is well and truly justified. Jay was a 2015 finalist for South Australian Female Artist of the year. Touring in the UK for the first time this summer, not to be missed!“Sexy and sleek. If you like soul, wrapped in pop, driven by funk and laced with hip hop, then this show is for you” - Beat Magazine“Jay Power is just the right blend of sass and soul” - The Advertiser__________________The Brunswick, 1-3 Holland Road, Hove, BN3 1JF / 01273 733984www.brunswick.netTickets £8-£10 in advance / £15 on the doorDoors from 7.30pm / Show 8pmProfits from the show will be donated to RISE BRIGHTON ~ Freedom from Domestic Abuse. A national award winning charity providing sanctuary and support in Sussex since 1994.

title: YogaFest 2016
description:
Come celebrate yoga and unity with us!

We gather at YogaFest among other like-minded seekers at Song of the Morning, a center that has been a place for spiritual healing and renewal for over 45 years! YogaFest is an annual festival that brings together truth-seekers from far and wide! Dozens of yoga and meditation classes, workshops, dance circles and musical performances will enrich your soul and leave you feeling inspired to go back out into the world to spread the vibrations of kindness and bliss wherever you go.

YogaFest celebrates yoga, or unity, in all its divine manifestations. From devotional kirtan and breath based asanas, to heart opening meditations and self-expanding workshops, YogaFest serves to transform all who come!

Whether you've been coming to Song of the Morning for decades or have only recently heard of our yoga retreat center, from our heart of hearts, we invite you to join us!

Jai Guru! Victory to all that serves for the upliftment of the world! May our gathering bring greater peace and harmony to the planet!

The YogaFest Team

title: Women Grow Dallas/Ft Worth - JULY 7, 2016
description:
Join Women Grow Dallas/Ft Worth for 
THE "STATE OF CANNABIS TEXAS"
HOW FAR HAVE WE COME | MORE WORK TO BE DONE


EVENT AGENDA - THE STATE OF CANNABIS TEXAS
UPDATE ON THE GOP & DEMOCRATIC CONVENTIONS | CARVE OUT YOUR SPACE IN HISTORY

6:30PM Check-in and Open Networking

 7:00PM Welcome & Sponsor Presentation

 7:15PM Featured Panelist - CANNLIV John David Carrasco  & LOOKING GLASS Lori Strubbe

 8:00PM Q&A Session

8:30PM Meeting Concludes



Thank you for your generous commitment to Women Grow Dallas!  

Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current  professionals in the cannabis industry.

Through our monthly events, our  members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and  networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series  attracts both men and women to connect.

Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.



F.A.Q.

Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different

stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.

Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.

How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.

Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.

Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.

What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Street parking is not guaranteed, plan accordingly.

Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash.

Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.

Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.

Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

TWITTER TIPS

A great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!

#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabis

title: Salon Series: Business & Legal for Web Content
description:
The second event in our Salon & Networking series, features a close look at business and legal considerations for the independent content producer, followed by an evening of networking. Presenter Ryan Keller sits on the board of directors of the IWCC, and is an Entertainment Lawyer at Duarte Spiel LLP.

Our community of creators thrive on networking at our bimonthly meetups, which have been regular since 2013. This year, the IWCC & T.O. Webfest introduce a new series of networking events where we incorporate discussion among industry thought leaders, exploring important themes, relevant to content creators.

Our first event featured a panel examining Diversity on the Web, co-presented by the WGC/Bell Media Diverse Screenwriters Program. Other themes to be discussed in the salon series include tips and tricks of social media marketing and content amplification, leveraging brand partnerships and online strategies to promote success, and showcasing women creators challenging the invisible boundaries still existing today.

The Independent Web series Creators of Canada (IWCC) is a policy-focused, non-profit association that supports and promotes the needs and activities of independent Canadian artists, producing creator driven and audience focused web series. We seek to inform stakeholders and build relationships to help create better frameworks and policies for people to access a democratized digital media.

ADMISSION IS FREE FOR MEMBERS OF THE IWCC & THE SPOKE CLUB.

Check your email for your discount codes in our newsletters!

title: Women Grow Portland
description:
Please join the Portland Chapter of Women Grow for our July Signature Networking event on Thursday, July 7, 2016 from 6-9pm at The Laurelhurst Club!

As cannabis industry professionals, and for those looking to enter the cannabis industry, it is absolutely essential we understand that policy comes before industry. In response to this need, our July program focuses largely on civic engagement, policy change and reform, and how to communicate effectively with legislators to help ensure the success of your business!

This engaging panel includes Nikki Fisher, executive director for The Bus Project, Rayleen McMillan, Assistant Director of Government Relations at Portland State University, and Marissa Johnson, Board Advisor at Portland State University's Center for Women's Leadership. These ladies have a vast knowledge of how to mobilize and work towards policy change and we deeply appreciate them coming to share this information with our community!  Topics that will be covered include how to prepare to vote, how to citizen lobby, and how to become more involved on a grassroots level.

We will open the evening with a presentation from sustaining sponsor speaker Green Leaf Lab's Chief Science Officer, Eric Wendt. Eric is a subcommittee member helping to craft testing requirements for the industry, and is also a participant in the rules advisory committee meetings. Thanks to Green Leaf Lab for their steadfast support of our chapter!

We are still in need of an event sponsor for this program, so please contact Amy Peradotta for more information!

We hope to see you there!

*All photos courtesy of Mirifoto



Panelist bios:

Nikki Fisher, Executive Director, The Bus Project 

A Portland native, Nikki Fisher obtained her B.A. in Government and World Affairs and went on to work for the ACLU of Florida on immigration reform, reproductive rights, and LGBT campaigns among other issues.. Nikki has experience with Oregon politics, and was a regional director for the Oregon United for Marriage Campaign. Her passion is driven by a focus on criminal and social justice reform, LGBT issues, reproductive rights, economic and racial justice, education and veterans’ issues. Nikki is on the board of the Oregon Women’s Campaign School and the Women Investment Network Political Action Committee in addition to serving as the E.D. of The Bus Project.



Rayleen McMillan, Assistant Director of Government Relations for Portland State University


	Rayleen McMillan serves as Assistant Director of Government
Relations for Portland State University. Prior to this, she spent three years
on the government relations team at Portland Community College, and is also a
proud alum of both institutions. Rayleen is passionate about her professional
advocacy and feels strongly that quality, accessible public education is altogether
crucial to the pursuit of meaningful social change. Rayleen is a
self­identified civic participation nerd, and fills her time with a range of
gratifying duties. She serves as chair of City Club of Portland’s Government
& Public Policy Forum Committee, and has been a very active member of the
Club since 2011. An ardent proponent of gender equity and a strong believer in
the impact of professional mentorship, Rayleen also serves as chair of the PSU
Center for Women’s Leadership Alumnae Committee.

Marissa Johnson, Board Advisor at Portland State University's Center for Women's Leadership

Marissa is a driven and creative leader dedicated to service, community, and civic engagement. She has served the Oregon State Legislature as a Policy Advisor to two State Representatives from 2012-2016. Marissa currently holds several volunteer leadership positions including serving as a member of the board of directors for a local, nationally acclaimed women's leadership organization -  The Center for Women's Leadership at Portland State University. She also has a background in organizing and campaign support. Currently, she is an artist and organizer living in Southeast Portland.

Reserve your seat at the Feast now !!*Fountain Drinks, Juice also available as a substituteIs there such a thing as a perfect film? One that knows what it wants to achieve and does it, flawlessly, artfully and intelligently? If so, then ‘Jaws’ is as good a candidate as any. Thirty-seven years on (and reissued in a new HD print), this tale of an island community terrorised by a killer shark still feels timeless and terrifying. The characterisation is precise and acutely observed (it’s one of the great guys-on-a-mission flicks), the dialogue is witty and wise, and the plot fits together like a finely crafted watch. The performances – not just leads, but the kids, townsfolk and the grief-stricken mother too – are impeccable. Best of all is Steven Spielberg’s direction: the camera moves like a predatory animal, gliding eerily across the surface of the vast Atlantic, creating sequences of almost unbearable suspense (never mind that the scariest scene was shot in a swimming pool). It’s no wonder a generation of holidaymakers still thinks twice before stepping into the water.﻿ -TimeOut

title: MIHS Class of 1996 20th REUNION
description: Mercer Island High School Class of 1996 - 20 year class reunion! Join our cohort of graduates at the Parlor in Bellevue for a night of reuniting and celebration.Our party will have a private room at the Parlor and your ticket includes entertainment, unlimited drinks (beer, wine, champagne, soda), heavy appetizers, pool tables, & dancing!At 10pm, the Parlor opens to the public & you may stay for the DJ & dancing or a reduced ticket price to the Parlor comedy club.

title: Iola Car Show- 2016
description: The Iola Car Show is a production of Iola Old Car Show, Inc. a non-profit, and is One of the Biggest and Best Car Show/Swap Meets in America.  This July will mark the 44th annual Show, and is sure to be something special!  The Show features over 2,200 show cars, 4,200 swap spaces, 1,000 car corral spaces and 1,600 campsites.  This is spread out over 300 acres of well maintained property and the Show hosts better than 120,000 guests.  This year's theme is 'Trucks & Chargers', and there is a lot of new and exciting happenings planned for this year's event, including our first ever concert!The Car Show offers free parking, WIFI and shuttle services to make this a fun, affordable and family friendly event.  We have excellent food throughout the grounds and with all our variety of offerings, there's truly something for everyone at The Iola Car Show!  All tickets are non-refundable.

title: Walking in Heels
description: Ever learned how to walk in teetering stilettos? Want that shapely behind as you sashay in tall high-heeled shoes? Can you chase down a taxi in your faux Prada pumps? This class will teach you the elusive skill of strutting with confidence, sex appeal, and style. At the conclusion of this class students will be able to choose a shoe style that works for them, understand the impact of high heels on body mechanics, and have an arsenal of strategies to handle walking in heels.  Students should bring two pairs of heels of varying heights (one “high-ish”, one “lower-ish”) in their size to practice in.  Walking up and down stairs may be practiced, weather permitting.

title: Women Grow Ventura County: Cannabis & Cooking
description:
Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.
Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.

SPEAKER- CHERI SICARD 



Cheri Sicard was a professional food writer and recipe developer long before she became a medical marijuana patient and cannabis cook.  She created the popular cooking website FabulousFoods.com and is the author of The Complete Idiot’s Guide to Easy Freezer Meals (2011, Alpha Books), and the editor of the freezer and make ahead cooking blog CheriOnIce.com.  When writing The Cannabis Gourmet Cookbook, she approached marijuana recipe development from the perspective of being a foodie, believing there’s no reason to have to choke down bad tasting or boring edibles in order to receive the benefits of edible cannabis.

Had someone told Cheri back in 1996, when California’s Prop 215 first legalized marijuana for medicinal use, she would become entrenched in the cannabis movement, she wouldn’t have believed them.  Other than the rare toke at a party, Cheri didn’t use marijuana.  It wasn’t until she was nearly 40 years old that her doctor suggested, off the record as the hospital he worked for didn’t “allow” it, she try marijuana to help with a chronic nausea problem that a variety of prescription drugs had failed to help.  It worked immediately.   After regularly using cannabis for a while, Cheri was surprised to discover she no longer felt the need for the anti-depressant prescriptions she’d been taking for years, as for her, cannabis did the job better without unwanted side effects.  Lifelong chronic digestive problems disappeared too.

While Cheri marveled at how cannabis had improved the quality of her daily life, she worried that she might somehow be doing herself harm.  Like most Americans, she had been indoctrinated into the school of thought that marijuana is an evil and dangerous drug.  So she started reading and doing research.  She even went so far as to attend and graduate from Oaksterdam University, the cannabis industry’s leading training institution.  Afterwards she continued to attend classes and seminars at every opportunity.

The more Cheri learned, the more the scientific evidence bowled her over and convinced her that the marijuana she was using not only improved specific symptoms, but overall health and well being as well.  She found it impossible to keep quiet about all the astounding medical research that’s routinely ignored by the mainstream media, and started talking about it to everyone she knew.  She continually found herself outraged by government hypocrisy surrounding the war on drugs and the fact that people all over the county, including in states where the people have voted to make medical marijuana legal, are still being jailed over this benevolent plant.

Over the course of six months Cheri went from the typical closeted American marijuana user to an outspoken cannabis legalization and anti drug war advocate.  And she hasn’t looked back since.  When she isn’t cooking and developing new recipes, you can often find Cheri speaking at civic meetings and city and county councils, organizing rallies, teaching classes, and attending court supports for medical marijuana defendants.

SPONSOR

Thank You to our generous sponsor, Grasshopper, Ventura's #1 Medical Delivery, one lucky attendee will be getting a copy of Cheri's book, The Cannabis Gourmet Cookbook!



EVENT AGENDA

6:30PM Check-in and Open Networking 7:00PM Sponsor Presentation 7:15PM Featured Speaker 7:30PM Book Signing & Open Networking 8:30PM Meeting Concludes

F.A.Q.

Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.

Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.

How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.

Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.

Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.

What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Street parking is not guaranteed, plan accordingly.

Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash.

Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.

Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.

Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

TWITTER TIPS

A great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!

#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabis

title: Fundraising Event Management
description: Fundraising events provide an opportunity for non-profits to secure essential income but also help to educate donors, guests and volunteers of the organizational mission. Whether a gala dinner, cultivation event, walk-a-thon or benefit concert, this course will examine the fundamentals of fundraising event management. Through this course you'll learn who the key players are within a non-profit, event budgeting, income projections and ticketing, marketing outreach, food and beverage, logistics management, as well as how to employ strategic tools such as silent and online auctions, live appeals, video components, etc. to help increase the financial success of a fundraising event.

title: "ATTACKING THE DARKNESS" Seattle Film Premiere
description:
A comedy mockumentary about the people who want to ban tabletop gaming and their epic quest: to produce the ultimate anti-RPG movie.
Join the cast and crew of Attacking the Darkness  for a special premiere event at the AMC Pacific Place cinemas in Seattle, Washington. This special event is also open to Kickstarter backers and ZOE fans.

Featuring rare behind-the-scenes comedy appearances by Seattle film professionals, including Ben Rapson, Sarah Crowe, Sam Graydon, Shawn Shelton, Damon Vanhee, Gabriel Gonda, Daniel Mimura, Keri Owen, Mark Meseroll, Rory Emmons, and many more.

Pre-screening social: 7:30 PM at the AMC Pacific Place upstairs bar
	

Screening: 8:30 PM at AMC Pacific Place



This is a movie unlike any other: a feature film shot behind the scenes of another, totally different film production. Attacking the Darkness features some of Seattle’s best comedy improvisers as our leads and a cast and crew willing to play original characters in our film while simultaneously performing their real jobs in that other movie.

The result is a comedy about how far people will go in the name of their passions: filmmakers who will do anything to get the shot, churchgoers who will stop at nothing to save souls, and gamers who will fight tooth and nail to defend their hobby.

title: Convercent: Innovation in Compliance
description: You're invited to a private networking event to learn about Convercent. The Compliance industry has seen no technology innovation for decades...until now. Convercent is one of the first companies to use new technologies and experiment with machine learning and AI to improve how companies manage risk and engage their employees to avoid incidents like fraud, theft, workplace violence and other risky behaviors.This exclusive event will take place on Thursday June 16 from 4p-6p.  You're invited to check out their cool offices in the Golden Triangle and learn more from an Engineering team including Greg Ebert, Vice President of Research. He's the visionary who steps outside the normal way of thinking to search for new patterns for managing compliance.The main purpose of this event, and why we've chosen you to attend, is to help Convercent double the size of its Engineering team. While you learn about the organization, you'll have the chance to talk to Convercent's team about the opportunities available. We believe you have the skills to make an excellent candidate to join their team!Convercent is working with some big names like Airbnb and Zenefits, helping them to solve real world problems. You could be part of that team helping to not only push the envelope in terms of technology innovation, but really making a difference.If you're interested, you must register here to reserve your spot. Spots are limited.

title: Seattle Art Fair 2016
description: Seattle Art Fair, presented by AIG, has confirmed over 80 exhibitors for the 2016 fair, running August 4-7 at CenturyLink Field Event Center. The Seattle Art Fair is co-produced by Paul G. Allen’s Vulcan Inc. and Art Market Productions. The fair will provide access to some of the most prestigious galleries worldwide, many of which will be returning for the second year, along with new U.S. galleries from Chicago, Dallas, Los Angeles, Miami, New York, Portland, San Francisco, and international newcomers from Paris; Cologne, Germany; Seoul, South Korea; Buenos Aires, Argentina; and Tokyo. Max Fishko, Director of the Seattle Art Fair, says, "The 2016 edition of Seattle Art Fair will demonstrate impressive growth from our 2015 debut. From a remarkable array of proposals, we selected over 80 galleries to present a truly unique opportunity to the collecting public. This is a chance to see work being made in, of, and about the Pacific Northwest and Pacific Rim in concert with some of the most important contemporary artists of our time—and better still, to do so in the elegant, energetic, and magical environment that is Seattle in the summer."

title: SalesHacker Rooftop BBQ with Sean Sheppard
description:
Join Vancouver SalesHackers for a rooftop BBQ and a fireside chat with GrowthX Founding Partner Sean Sheppard, lead instructor at the GrowthX Academy at Galvanize and five-time founder, about why start-ups really fail and how to build a go-to-market strategy.

We'll start flipping burgers & veggie burgers and cracking beers at 5:30 sharp.



About SalesHacker

SalesHacker is a community of ambitious sales professionals from start-up and SaaS sales orgnizations. It's an open sharing environment for salespeople to learn and accelerate their performance.



About Sean



Sean is a Founding Partner of GrowthX, and the Lead Instructor of GrowthX Academy at Galvanize. As a serial entrepreneur, Sean has been a five-time selling founder and has successfully grown dozens of early stage companies across a wide variety of products and markets. Sean is an expert in monitoring and adjusting revenue pipelines to improve the probability and predictability of sales and marketing success. At GrowthX, Sean is laser-focused on driving market development for portfolio companies.

Before co-founding GrowthX, Sean built and ran the sales and business development track at Tradecraft, a flipped-classroom trade school where people develop the knowledge, skills and training to succeed in traction roles at startups. Sean also co-founded the Professional Sales College to change the way the world values the sales profession through graduating the best educated and trained sales professionals in the world.

Sean is a former PGA Professional. Among his previous ventures, Sean applied his golf industry expertise at Magique Golf, where he grew it from 3 employees with $200K in sales to 40 employees and $5M revenue before successfully exiting.

*This is a rain or shine event but if it rains we may order pizza and spend less time on the roof.

title: Nashville STORY Gathering Launch
description: Since STORY has found its home in Nashville, as a team, we began meeting with and learning about the creative community in this city. It came to our attention very quickly that you are craving community. Not just another place to network with people in your industry, but a space that will leave you inspired. A time to connect with innovators outside of your vein of work, and hear what leaders around the city are doing to make an impact through their art.That’s why we want to invite you to the launch of a monthly gathering of storytellers. A night where you will be inspired and challenged as elite members of the creative class.

title: TechCrunch Disrupt SF 2016
description:
TechCrunch Disrupt is a three-day, single-track conference and startup competition to immerse you in the debate about what's changing in technology right now, what's causing it and what we need to do about it to survive and thrive in real time.

TechCrunch Disrupt gathers the leaders and innovators of the technology and media industries to give you deep insights into the creative destruction happening right now. The big changes. And the subtle trends.

We’ll bring the experts together to talk about what’s next. And why.

You’ll meet the people behind the new startups, new products and new technologies driving disruption today and be part of a conversation that will stimulate and challenge you.

LOCATION: Pier 48

DISCLOSURE: TechCrunch Disrupt tickets are non-transferable. Ticket purchases cancelled by July 31, 2016 are subject to a $250 cancellation handling fee. Tickets cancelled July 31 and later are not eligible for a refund for any reason. Lost name badges at the conference are subject to a $500 replacement fee.

title: REFUGE: City
description:
Drawing on works as diverse as Meredith Monk’s Churchyard Entertainment, Leonard Bernstein’s Mass, and Isabella Leonarda’s Ave Regina Caelorum, Vancouver’s summer chorus of queer classically trained singers presents REFUGE, an exploration of both found and created safety and shelter.

Under the direction of Mark Reid, Cor Flammae’s REFUGE includes new works by Vancouver composers Shane Raman and Michael Park, plus works by Peter Tchaikovsky, Joan Szymko, Stephen Smith, Rodney Sharman, Dominique Phinot, and more, presented in two spectacular venues.

REFUGE: City on Saturday July 16 is at Pyatt Hall, the acoustically perfect jewel box concert hall at the VSO School of Music. Fully wheelchair accessible and complete with bar, it is the perfect place for our post-concert mingler. Please join us!

REFUGE: the condition of being safe or sheltered from pursuit or trouble. From seeking our chosen families to creating welcoming and diverse cities and countries, Cor Flammae draws on the queer outsider experience to build a lateral compassion for all who seek refuge and hope.

title: It's the Berries: Lampson Farm & Frazier Farmstead
description: On this outing, we'll visit Lampson Blueberries, along the South Fork of the Walla Walla River. Here we'll investigate what it takes to grow that popular super fruit, blueberries. The Lampsons will share their history of their farm, discuss the different varieties they grow, and possibly have a few tasty buckets for sale. The Lampson's farm is a valley icon for all blueberry lovers.We'll next visit the Frazier Farmstead Museum, a six-acre site listed on the National Register of Historic Places. In 1892 William Samuel Frazier built this house that was extensively remodeled after his death in 1896. Members of the Frazier family occupied this house for 115 years. Since 1983, the estate has been operated and maintained as a restored house and farm museum by the Milton-Freewater Area Historical Society.

title: PASS THRU - A NEIL BREEN FILM
description: ONE NIGHT ONLY! Bear witness to the TORONTO PREMIERE of a new film from visionary director NEIL BREEN, the creator of FATEFUL FINDINGS. Artificial Intelligence from far into the future arrives to immediately CLEANSE the human species of millions of humans who are harmful to other humans. A VISIONARY, REVOLUTIONARY FILM which pushes the human species to the limits of controversial, thought-provoking actions.

description: Market Art + Design returns to The Bridgehampton Museum this July 2016, bringing the East End's premier art fair to the center of bustling Bridgehampton. Market Art + Design, the successful evolution of Art Market Hamptons, will showcase presentations by top galleries enhanced by a striking and tightly curated design component pulling from dealers and designers from around the world.Market Art + Design will work alongside sponsors and partners The Wall Street Journal, Hamptons Magazine, The Bridgehampton Museum, and Perrier to create an exciting and extremely visible event for Eastern Long Island.

title: Shorts 11: High Priestess
description: All Tru-ishMina Mir3 min., Video, 2015, USA“A One-sided relationship is depicted through a series of vibrant, absurdist vignettes.” MMDear LordeDuke & Battersby27 Min., Video, 2015, USA“Bone collector Maxine Rose, a 14 year old teenage girl, is looking for validation from her heroes, amongst them the primatologist Jane Goodall, bishop Desmond Tutu and the New Zealand teen pop Star Lorde. Offering them a gift of language, Maxine Rose stands for the desire to be visible and understood, not unlike the desire of an artist. We are particularly impressed by the multilayered story telling structure, the freshness of the characterization, and the honest exploration of an artists` vulnerability."  –Excerpt from the jury’s comment on awarding Dear Lorde the EMAF award.Pattern For SurvivalKelly Sears7 Min., Video, 2015, USA“Pattern for Survival channels the frenetic energy and aggression of security and preparedness. As you read the rest of this manual, keep in mind the need for a survival strategy.” KSCrystal LakeJennifer Reeder20 Min., Video, 2016, USA“A group of young girls take over a skate park, forming an all-female force field on the half pipe. There on the reclaimed ramp, with no boys around, they are thriving and visible. This is an anthem for young feminists, which presents female friendship as a means to survive adolescence. EVERY GRRRL-SHAPED BREATH IS A BATTLE CRY.” JRBaghdad, IowaUsama Alshaibi34 Min., Video, 2015, USA“This liminal landscape, artificial yet grounded in a personal cultural mash-up of memory and pain, is seen through the camera, or the windshield as screen, as an attempt to reach a border between the seen and unseen. The town Baghdad, Iowa, is an imagined place that is transitional and conceptual. It is a place that connects my personal memories and trauma to an artistic space, which in turn allows both fears and desires to be expressed. Baghdad, Iowa is the mask, the shadow and the night stars that sing the sorrow song of death. The traveler is you and the voice you hear is your own. You might be dreaming, so don’t wake up until you arrive in Baghdad, Iowa.” UA

description: Tuesday July 5th at Open Roof FestivalLimited tickets are also available at the door, cash only, on a first come, first serve basis. There they are obliged to find a matching mate in 45 days. If they fail, they are transformed into an animal of their choosing and released into The Woods. A desperate Man escapes from The Hotel to The Woods where The Loners live and falls in love, although it is against their rules.With a musical performance by Kayla DiamondDoors open at 7:00 pm, Kayla Diamond performs at 8:00 pm, and The Lobster will begin when the sun goes down (roughly around 9:00 pm). Depending on how much rain is falling, the event may be able to move indoors at 99 Sudbury and run on the same schedule as if it were outside. In the unlikely event that the indoor venue is unavailable, a raincheck will be provided to a future screening. All info will be sent to the email address provided when purchasing your ticket. title: Afternoon Tea & Cheese Soirée
description: Love wine and cheese? Try something different this spring and summer with a fresh, modern twist on afternoon tea. Join the Cheese Grotto and tea specialist Rachel Safko for a garden-inspired tasting of premium tea, artisanal cheeses and other culinary surprises to celebrate the warmer months and all the new blooms out there. Learn how to pair summery white and green teas, oolongs and lighter black teas with a selection of spring-y cheeses, fruits and sweets—from tea cakes to goat cheese topped with flower petals. Come relax with us and find out how to make your next party (or quiet evening with friends) an easy, elegant smash that rivals the experience of a boutique hotel.Jessica Sennett is the president of Cheese Grotto, an innovative new cheese storage system. She has worked at many acclaimed cheese shops including Cowgirl Creamery, Formaggio Kitchen and Bedford Cheese Shop, in addition to apprenticing in France and Washington. She makes her own cheese and is also well-versed in tasting, educating, and cooking with cheese. She now teaches at the Natural Gourmet Institute and curates a series of House-Made Cheese Suppers in NYC.Rachel Safko is a tea specialist and journalist who writes about everything from French couture to ancient Chinese Yixing teapots. Some of her most recent articles include a cover story for the Edible Manhattan drinks issue about fika: the Swedish art of the coffee break as well as a primer on tea and food pairing in Fresh Cup Magazine. She is a certified tea specialist with the World Tea Academy (soon-to-be certified sommelier) and hosts tea soirées in New York.

title: Rue Morgue CineMacabre: THE NEON DEMON
description: Thick with sensual atmosphere, mindblowing visuals and shocking moments of violence, The Neon Demon is savage beauty unbound. The first foray into horror from acclaimed director Nicolas Winding Refn (Drive, Bronson, Only God Forgives), it stars Elle Fanning (Super 8) as a teenager in Hollywood who finally makes it as a fashion model, only to discover everyone around her is a predator trying to devour her youth, her beauty, and even her body. The impressive list of co-stars includes Keanu Reeves, Jena Malone (The Hunger Games), Christina Hendricks (Mad Men), Desmond Harrington (Dexter), Abbey Lee (Mad Max: Fury Road) and Bella Heathcote (Dark Shadows). Be the first to see a new vision of horror from a cinematic master with a sneak peek of The Neon Demon.
