title: Women Grow Chicago - Signature Networking Event
description:
Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.

Continuing education is crucial to success in the cannabis industry.  Join the Chicago Chapter as we bring you professional development in a safe and inviting environment.  Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month (2nd Thursdays when holidays occur the first Thursday).


Event Agenda:


	6:00pm - Networking
	6:15pm - Welcome, Announcements & Introductions
	6:30pm - Neighborhood Watch: Local Legislative Cannabis Updates
	6:45pm - Education
	7:30pm - Networking
	8:00pm - Event concludes



FAQs

Have questions about the Women Grow - Chicago: Networking Event?Please email  chicago@womengrow.com If you're unavailable for this date, sign up for Women Grow's newsletter to get future invitations.

Who attends?You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way.

Watch the video to see for yourself.

Why should I attend?Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members.

Together we have more power.  As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.

How can I get the most out of networking events?

We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo.com for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow).

Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.

Where are there Women Grow events?Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter. 

Are there ID requirements to attend?All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.

Are there public transportation options?You can also call 312.836.7000 or visit www.transitchicago.com for further public transit travel information.

Can I pay at the door?Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements.  If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash AND a card. We'll take whichever payment method we're able to at that venue.

Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.

Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month?Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you are on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.

Why do you charge for events?Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. Think of your event payment every month as your monthly dues for Women Grow, if you cannot attend a particular month, then you do not pay your dues. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about limited volunteer opportunities.

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry?Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

title: REFUGE: Sanctuary
description:
Drawing on works as diverse as Meredith Monk’s Churchyard Entertainment, Leonard Bernstein’s Mass, and Isabella Leonarda’s Ave Regina Caelorum, Vancouver’s summer chorus of queer classically trained singers presents REFUGE, an exploration of both found and created safety and shelter.

Under the direction of Mark Reid, Cor Flammae’s REFUGE includes new works by Vancouver composers Shane Raman and Michael Park, plus works by Peter Tchaikovsky, Joan Szymko, Stephen Smith, Rodney Sharman, Dominique Phinot, and more, presented in two spectacular venues.

REFUGE: Sanctuary on Friday July 15 is at Vancouver’s historic and beautifully restored Christ Church Cathedral. This Anglican cathedral is a safe, welcoming and positive space for LGBTQI people, and is both air conditioned and fully wheelchair accessible.

REFUGE: the condition of being safe or sheltered from pursuit or trouble. From seeking our chosen families to creating welcoming and diverse cities and countries, Cor Flammae draws on the queer outsider experience to build a lateral compassion for all who seek refuge and hope.

title: The Reel Film Club - Illusions S.A.
description: RECEPTION (APPETIZERS AND DRINKS): 6:00 PM MOVIE SCREENING: 7:00 PM------------ILLUSION S.A. / ILUSIONES S.A.Mexico | 2015 | 90 min.Director: Roberto GiraultGenre: ComedySpanish with English subtitlesStarring Jaime Camil (“Jane the Virgin”) and set in Campeche, México in the 1950s, “Illusions S.A.” centers around an agency that turns your deepest fantasies, wishes and even lies into reality. A noble grandfather has, through fictitious letters, lied to his wife about the true nature of his grandson who left their house more than 20 years ago. After the grandson apparently dies when the ship carrying him back to México sinks in the ocean, the firm’s director (Camil) and a recent recruit (Adriana Louvier) take on the mission of posing as the grandson and his wife. But things get out of hand when the real grandson pops up with demands of his own.Protagonizada por Jaime Camil (“Jane the Virgin”) y ambientada en la década de 1950 en Campeche, “Ilusiones S.A.” gira en torno a una agencia que convierte sus más profundas fantasías, deseos e incluso mentiritas en realidad. A través de cartas ficticias de su propia pluma, un noble abuelo le ha mentido a su esposa acerca de la verdadera naturaleza de su nieto a quien él expulsó de su casa hace más de 20 años. Cuando el barco que lleva al nieto de regreso a México se hunde en el mar, el director de la empresa (Camil) y su nueva recluta (Adriana Louvier) asumen como misión hacerse pasar por el nieto y su esposa para hacer realidad todas las mentiras contadas por el abuelo. Pero la misión se les va de la mano cuando el nieto reaparece.

The workshop is arranged with a flexible schedule, so the group can organically discuss and share feedback, based on their unique areas of interest or desired areas of improvement. title: wolvesmouth: taxa at MOCA // thur, jun 2 -SOLD OUT
description:
'Taxa' is wolvesmouth's new large-scale installation where food, music, and technology come together under the umbrella of art, to examine the precarious relationship between humans and nature.TICKET INFORMATION
Tickets are $225 per person (plus 3% credit card processing fee). The purchase of a ticket provides each ticket holder with entrance to the installation and a nine-course dinner prepared by the wolvesmouth team.
There are no limits on how many tickets you can purchase.
There are no refunds or exchanges for the tickets. All sales are final. This ticket is like a ticket to a concert, theater show, or sporting event.

Tickets can be transferred to another guest, but they cannot be resold beyond face value (which in many states is illegal and honestly, just not cool with us). If you do need to transfer your tickets to someone else, please make sure to let us know via email so that we can update your ticket with the new guest's information.
EVENT AND DINNER INFORMATION:
The installation is at The Geffen Contemporary at MOCA in Little Tokyo. 

The doors open for the installation promptly at the scheduled/ticketed time, with dinner starting soon thereafter. Please make sure to arrive 15 minutes before your event starts. Due to time constraints, we will have to start the dinner without you if you are late. 


In addition to the regular menu, we are also offering pescatarian and vegetarian dinner options. Please select your preference at check-out. Due to the nature of the installation, we are unable to accommodate any other dietary restrictions/substitutions. If you have any food allergies, please send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com after you purchase your tickets.
You are invited to bring your own beverages to drink and to share with others. Beverages will not be sold at the event. We will provide water, ice, and glassware.
Parking is available at the museum and costs $8/vehicle. 
OTHER NOTES:
No dress code. Wear what you are most comfortable in.
Taking photos is always ok with us.
If you have any questions, send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com

title: Funkfest
description: ONTARIO'S FIRST OUTDOOR SOUR BEER FESTIVAL!Enliven your tastebuds with barrel-aged Berliners, funky-fresh fruit brews and concocted kombuchas from 17 Ontario craft breweries. Enjoy the funky beers with live funk bands, a kettle sour demonstration, food trucks and juice bar.In celebration of this funky day, Sawdust City Brewing Company will be brewing and bottling a unique sour beer for the FunkFest. Bottles of this exclusive FunkFest Sour will be available for purchase only to FunkFest 2016 attendees.

title: FREE SHOW! Ask the Audience: Your life in Improv
description: From the people who brought you "Getting to Know the Couple" comes Ask The Audience: Your life in Improv!The performers will interview a lucky group of people about their lives and use the information gathered to make up an entire performance. That's right, completely made up on the spot, based off of the audience members lives! The best part- it's a free show!Ask the Audience: Your life in ImprovSaturday, May 14th at 10pmThis is a Free Show--The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting and film production.Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: FanHQ presented by Sprint - Glendale June 7
description: Copa America Centenario FanHQ presented by Sprint is the official fan destination for the Copa America Centenario tournament, offering a celebratory and free of charge experience for all soccer fans in town for the once-in-a-lifetime event to be played June 3-26 across the United States and featuring some of the world's best teams and players! With an atmosphere of live music, merchandise,  food and beverage, tournament décor and other entertainment, Copa America Centenario FanHQ provides a fun place to hangout and extends the fan's interaction ahead of the match.  We hope to see you there!For more information visit www.ca2016.com/fan-events or www.ca2016.com #Copa100 #FanHQ

title: MCLA Championships SATURDAY
description:
The Finals of the 2016 MCLA National Championships Powered by Under Armour on the campus of Chapman University in Orange, CA. Division II Championship - 11:30am. Division I Championship - 2:30pm.    - See Ticket Restrictions on Confirmation
- Ticket includes Event Program (while supplies last)- Tickets Required By ALL 
- Campus parking fee

- CLICK for more MCLA Championship Information The MCLA promotes safe and fair play to its membership while honoring the history of the game. Fans in attendance are asked to do the same while enjoying the games. This includes excessive yelling at players, officials, or coaches. Fans are subject to removal if deemed necessary by the event staff. Please enjoy the games, cheer on your teams, and keep the negative comments to yourself. Purchase of this ticket is acceptance of this policy.

title: AngelSummit Europe
description: WELCOME TO ANGELSUMMIT EUROPELearn from the world’s most forward-thinking investors and entrepreneursMeet trailblazers in corporate innovation and community developmentExplore new opportunities and partnershipsDiscover Europe’s dynamic startup sceneIn a conference set among the beauty and culture of summer in IrelandATTENDEES INCLUDEAngel Investors // VC's // Family Offices // Startup Community Leaders //Accelerator ManagersCorporate Innovation & Venture Leaders // Economic Development OfficersSerial Entrepreneurs // Chambers of CommerceTickets sold until June 6th, 2016. No tickets will be sold at the door.Proceeds from AngelSummit Europe ticket sales are used to underwrite costs incurred by Startup Angels for production of high-quality content.

title: 2016 Hudson Valley Ribfest
description:
The 2016  Hudson Valley RibFest  celebrates it's 12th year as the regions largest and most unique  barbecue food event for the whole family.   Mark your calendar for August 19th, 20th & 21st!

Admission$7 General Admission (Kids 12 & Under are free)$75 Young's Motors VIP Admission (Friday Night only)

Saturday, August 20 	11am - 10pm

Sunday, August 21 	11am - 5pm

title: LEGO Imagine Nation Tour - Ottawa, ON
description:
Tickets are also available on site. All major credit cards (Visa, MasterCard, and American Express) are accepted. Cash or debit are not accepted.

Families of all ages, take your brick building to the next level! Discover life-size LEGO® models, dive into a huge Brick Pit, learn from a Master Model Builder and so much more!

Un événement interactif pour les familles de tous âges ! Venez relever de nouveaux défis de construction, remplir des missions interactives que vous ne verrez qu’à la Tournée Imagine Nation de LEGO, découvrir des modèles LEGO grandeur nature, plonger dans un énorme bac de briques, apprendre des trucs de notre Maître Constructeur de modèles et bien plus encore!

title: Place-based Education with David Sobel
description: Place-based education is a positive and creative way to connect schools to their communities, and to counter the decoupling of schools from historic sites, local landscapes, and farms. What we need are schools organized around the principles of the farmers' market, drawing on the resources and variety of the local community.Speaker David Sobel, author of Place-based Education: Connecting Classrooms and Communities and Communities and Childhood and Nature, will introduce examples of place-based education from the US, Canada and Europe to illustrate innovative initiatives from preschool through high school settings.Host: Cam Collyer, Executive Director, Programs, Evergreen

title: ALBION PROS v SoCal SC
description: This is the third league home game of the Albion Pros NPSL season vs SoCal SC.  The Albion Pros currently sit at the top of the league table undefeated.  Join us as the quest for a national league championship continues.  The party starts at 3pm at Tap Room on Garnet Ave.  At the game, there will be Primo's Mexican food, chair massage, a supervised kids zone, face painters, balloon man, prizes, giveaways and more.  After the game, we all head back to Tap Room on Garnet Ave to hopefully celebrate another victory.

title: ACTIVEZ Conference
description:
ACTIVEZ will bring together industry leaders to discuss how data and technology are fueling innovation and how that will shape the future of OOH.   New research will be presented on the value of OOH; its impact on brand metrics and ROI.  Hear from marketers and their agencies on how OOH is achieving their goals by delivering targeted, relevant and contextual moments that matter.

ACTIVEZ is a bilingual conference – speakers will be presenting either in English or French.

To learn more about ACTIVEZ conference, please subscribe to our newsletter here.


ACTIVEZ rassemblera des chefs de file de l’industrie qui examineront comment les données et les technologies suscitent des innovations déterminantes pour l’avenir de l’affichage. On présentera de nouvelles recherches traitant de la valeur de l’affichage et de son influence sur les résultats d’affaires et le rendement des campagnes. Annonceurs et agences décriront comment l’affichage les aide à atteindre leurs objectifs en créant des interactions avec les consommateurs ciblées, contextuelles, pertinentes et efficaces.

ACTIVEZ est une conférence bilingue; chaque conférencier fera une présentation soit en français, soit en anglais.

Pour en savoir plus sur la conférence ACTIVEZ, veuillez vous inscrire à notre infolettre ici.

title: Sports Prom NYC
description:
Standing on a New Court: Sports Prom Arrives...!!ARE YOU GAME?Bring your best blazer and nakama for the sports "ball" you'll never forget! All sports anime characters are welcome, so have a wheelin' good time! Toss some goodie bags and race into some suits, and get ready to dance an evening away with your best teammates and a home game! And... make way for the Ace of the Court!DetailsGuestsThe event will be $40 per person and will include:
help-yourself snacks throughout the event
dinner course
a goodie bag including an event-exclusive postcard, sports-anime themed keychain, and other party favors
automatic entry to the sports anime merch-themed raffle
free photobooth session
4 hours of activities, dancing, and meeting new friends!
Event Schedule

[5:00-5:45] Set-up
[5:45] Check-in begins
[6:15] Seating and dinner course (buffet style)
[6:30] Intros
[6:45] Sports AMV Rally
[6:50] Games and Icebreakers
[7:10] Prom Ace and MVM Speeches
[7:40] Voting
[7:55] Prom Ace and MVM Announcement and First Dance
[8:00] Free Dance
[9:45] Last Song
[10:00+] Clean-up
Schedule subject to change based on guest's requests
FAQWhat will be at the event?There will be a photobooth with printable pictures/frames, snacks to munch on, a booth selling sports-anime art (thanks to our lovely artist staff) and, of course, a dance floor!Can I cosplay to the event? Is there a dress code?Of course! We encourage all prom goers to cosplay to the event, and any cosplay is permitted, but please wear formal attire and do not bring any props with you. While encouraged to cosplay, you also free to come as yourself in formal attire!Do I need to purchase anything at the event?You don't need to purchase anything, however, there will be things at the event you may want to buy, such as art, so feel free to bring some cash!Why is your event more expensive than previous cafes?Our previous cafes costed less mainly due to cheaper venues. Dance and prom spaces tend to be extremely expensive, and in order to also accommodate for the larger amount of people for food and goodies, we needed to up the price for the prom. Though expensive, it should be worth the experience and goodies!What are the food and drink options?We are still in the midst of contact catering locations and deciding the menu. There will be multiple options and it will be served similar to a buffet! If you have any dietary restrictions, please include them in the form so we can accommodate you and offer options accordingly!LiabilityBy buying a ticket and being accepted into the event as a guest, the ticket holder becomes responsible for their personal liability. The ticket holder will assume all risks with respects to any dangers incidental to Sports Prom NYC. A ticket is required for entry into the event and must be shown at the door. Failure to comply with the organizer's requests and directions, including disruptive or inappropriate behavior, will result in the revocation of the ticket, and ejection from the cafe. The organizer may revoke tickets and eject anyone from the cafe at any time for any reason without a refund. Sports Prom NYC is not responsible for personal items. Under no circumstances is alcohol or any illegal substance allowed on the premises of the cafe. Anyone that shows up intoxicated or under the influence of any drug will not be accepted into the cafe. Theft, assault, drug use, or other illegal activities will be prosecuted to the full extent under the law. Discrimination and/or harassment of any form will not be tolerated.

title: GET HAPPY Minneapolis
description:
"I felt a huge change in my whole body. After almost three years and nothing working, a simple breathing technique had just changed my life. I now feel amazing. I'm back to the old me and I see the world differently."– Maddy King, Model





"Within three days I started experiencing a deep shift within myself from anxiousness to peace, from sadness to joy. As each day progresses, I find myself more and more centered in the joy and clarity of a calm and peaceful existence."– Glenn-Douglas Haig, CEO





“Yesplus allows me to be the best that I can be as a student, a leader, and a person.”– Jackie, Entrepreneur





"Within three days I started experiencing a deep shift within myself from anxiousness to peace, from sadness to joy. As each day progresses, I find myself more and more centered in the joy and clarity of a calm and peaceful existence."– Glenn-Douglas Haig, CEO





"I have been looking for this for 15 years! The techniques are truly a gift. When I practice them regularly, I feel great no matter what has happened during the day."– Charlotte Puls, Lawyer





“I have so much clarity, and I now know my path.”– Katie Little, University Student





"I used to be so tense. I'd be getting so angry, shouting, screaming, pushing around to get my orders through. Now when I realize I'm getting tense I just breathe and I calm down. I realize that I'm much more focused and much more productive."– Mawahib Shaibani, Financial Advisor





“I discovered who I can be as a strong, resilient person.”– Jason, Entrepreneur

title: Feeling Dance Festival
description:
FEELING DANCE FESTIVALLatin With Soul is happy to present the first edition of the Feeling Dance Festival in Trondheim.For this first edition we will bring you one of the most exciting Bachata couple in the world, Eduardo & Virginia. They will join you for two days of intensive workshops and great parties. You will have a chance to take part in more than 10 hours of classes in all levels and styles.This is the perfect opportunity to boost your dancing skills  and  learn from dedicated teachers. International & local instructors 
Inspiring workshops & Shows
3 parties with Bachata, Salsa & Kizomba  
INSTRUCTORSEduardo & VirginiaEduardo Oyola, was born in Colombia. He is a former member of the group Sabor dinámico one of the pioneer group in Salsa caleña in Spain (Columbian style). Eduardo has also worked alongside the famous Bachata Couple Daniel & Desiree being part of their Dance company Cha3 Dance.Virginia Galan, is former member of Fusión latina, two-time Spanish Bachata champions & Vice chamption in the 2015 Bachata World Masters. Virginia  is a trained dancer in ballet & contemporary.We are are delighted to have them both in Trondheim !Latin With SoulLatin with soul is a  Salsa & Bachata dance school based in Trondheim  led by Steeve OAGI. Steeve has been established in Trondheim since 2013.Sjur & IngridSjur & Ingrid are some of the most experienced  Latin dance instructors in Trondheim. They have been teaching since  early 2000 and have given classes in most types of Latin dances as well  as kizomba. They are a driving force in the local dance community and  are often to be found on the dance floor in different festivals and  events around the world.PROGRAMFRIDAY 20THPre-Party @ Me Night ClubSATURDAY 21ST Workshops @ RAW DANCE STUDIOParty with shows @ RED ZONESUNDAY 22NDWorkshops @ RAW DANCE STUDIOSOCIAL DANCE @  KREM KAFFEBARVENUE/LOCATIONME NIGHT CLUB - Dronningens gate 15, 7011 TrondheimRAW DANCE STUDIO - Olav Tryggvassons gate 39 TrondheimRED ZONE - Fjordgata 60, 7010 TrondheimKREM KAFFEBAR - Krambugata 3, 7011 TrondheimSIGN UPEARLY BIRD FULL PASS 750 NOK SINGLE  20 PASS

title: Paint and Drink Event at Saint Michael Cinema
description: You will be learning how to paint "Under the Carolina Moon."Green Martini Paint Co. fuses painting, socializing and celebration into one fun event! Awaken your creative side while sipping your favorite cocktail and unwinding with friends. You will paint your own masterpiece while our instructors guide you, step-by-step, through the entire process.If you are not the “artsy” type – no worries! Green Martini Paint Co. events are for everyone, zero experience required. Vincent Van Gogh once said, “If you hear a voice within you say ‘you cannot paint,’ then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced!” You will laugh, relax and possibly discover the artist within.

title: Difficult Conversations & EQ
description: This is a workshop for all employees interested in personal and professional development. The focus of this class will be how to have difficult conversations, how to be more effective in communication, and how to recognize and understand emotions.

title: Montana Brewers Spring Rendezvous
description: Montana-made beer only, unlimited samples, food vendors, live music, and a collectible glass with every ticket.Come and visit with Montana Brewers at our 2016 Spring Rendezvous in Bozeman. Taste beer from the far reaches of the state along with your hometown favorites. Our festivals feature only beer made in Montana, from those long-established beer producers, to the really small start up breweries that aren't yet distributing their goods beyond their walls. We are so proud to feature Montana's finest beers and introduce you to the brewers who are at the epicenter of this creative and tasty venture.4:00- 5:00 is VIP Hour; early entrance and access to brewers and their samples without the crowd. $35 IN ADVANCE, $40 DAY OF FESTIVAL includes unlimited beer samples in your special edition VIP glass.5:00-9:00 is General Admission; great times sampling ONLY beer Made in Montana. $25 IN ADVANCE, $30 DAY OF includes unlimited beer samples and a commemorative glass.

title: DreamHack Montreal
description:
TICKETS AVAILABLE ON APRIL 21st at 6PM EST.

For the first time ever the World’s largest digital festival DreamHack is coming to Canada. Participate in the LAN party and enjoy World’s class esports live at DreamHack Montreal, tickets available April 21st!

DreamHack Montreal will feature all the core content pillars that make DreamHack what it is for visitors to enjoy, the LAN party, DreamExpo, International Esports tournaments, BYOC competitions, Cosplay, Indie Game Zone, and DreamStore. As always with DreamHack attendees will be able to shape the future of DreamHack Montreal, focusing on the content as well as games and genres which the visitors are most interested in, whether its PC FPS, MOBA, RTS, Fighting Games, or Console Games, and even other gaming related activities like table top gaming and more.

For more information be sure to stay tuned to http://montreal.dreamhack.com/en/ Initial early bird LAN and visitor tickets will be released on April 21st, and details regarding the esport competitions will be released soon as well. Any inquiries regarding the event should be sent to info@dreamhack.ca.

To get all the latest info, head to http://montreal.dreamhack.com/en/

title: BlizzCon - November 4-5, 2016
description:
Thanks for purchasing tickets to BlizzCon® 2016! Get ready for two epic days of gaming, developer panels, esports tournaments, and more.

BLIZZCON 2016 BADGE PICKUP

Ticket email(s) containing a bar code to claim a BlizzCon badge will be sent to both the purchaser’s email address as well as the email address assigned to each ticket closer to the event.

IMPORTANT: Each attendee must print the email containing their bar code and bring it to BlizzCon, along with valid photo ID. In order to receive a badge, the name on the ID must match the name on the ticket, as well as the name assigned to the ticket in the ticketing system.


	General Attendee Pickup Location: Anaheim Convention Center, Hall E
	Thursday, November 3 from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.
	Friday, November 4 from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m.
	Saturday, November 5 from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m.

Ticket purchasers who entered their own name for all tickets will need to pick up all badges personally and distribute them to their guests at the show.

For more information, including details on attending with minors or making attendee name changes on-site, visit http://www.blizzcon.com.

BENEFIT DINNER ADMISSION & BLIZZCON 2016 BADGE PICKUP

Ticket email(s) containing a bar code to grant admission to the Benefit Dinner and claim a BlizzCon badge will be sent to both the purchaser’s email address as well as the email address assigned to each ticket closer to the event.

IMPORTANT: Each attendee must print the email containing their bar code and bring it to the Benefit Dinner, along with valid photo ID. In order to gain admission and receive a badge, the name on the ID must match the name on the ticket, as well as the name assigned to the ticket in the ticketing system.


	Event Location: Hilton Anaheim Hotel, 777 Convention Way, Anaheim, CA 92802
	Event Time: Thursday, November 3, 2016 from 6:30 p.m. PT to 10:30 p.m.

Ticket purchasers who entered their own name for all tickets will need to pick up all badges personally and distribute them to their guests at the show.

For more information, including details on attending with minors or making attendee name changes on-site, visit http://www.blizzcon.com.

BLIZZCON IN-GAME GOODIES, VIRTUAL TICKETS, AND MERCH SALE

Every BlizzCon, attendees receive a set of in-game goodies for their favorite Blizzard games. Codes granting access to these goodies will be emailed directly to ticket buyers at the email address used to purchase tickets. These codes will also grant access to the BlizzCon Virtual Ticket and this year’s BlizzCon online merchandise sale, beginning before the show.

Prior to the event, ticket buyers will receive up to 4 codes (one for each ticket) to distribute to guests. Stay tuned for more information.

For further assistance, contact Blizzard Support at http://www.battle.net/support/help/.

title: Listening Between the Lines
description: Listening Between the Lines: Hearing (and Telling) Hard StoriesNancy Donoval, Storyteller, Story Coach, Sexual Violence Activist, Minneapolis, MNThis storytelling performance and interactive workshop will affirm and explore the deep human need to be seen and heard. We will look at the difficulty of hearing hard stories, especially as part of our professional lives, and examine common barriers to deep listening. Come celebrate how the simple act of listening is itself one our most powerful tools for healing and change.While attending this session, participants will: (1) Enjoy being entertained by stories; (2) Expand their definition of what it means to listen; (3) Discuss the dynamics at play when hearing and sharing difficult stories in our professional and personal lives; (4) Explore listening, reflection and self-care techniques; (5) Remember the importance of being truly heard -- for all of us, but especially for troubled youth.

title: Salsation Instructor Training Vladimir Gerónimo
description: Salsation Instructor Training in Berlin mit Mastertrainer Vladimir GerónimoWas ist Salsation™?  «Salsation Fitness™» wurde von Alejandro Angulo aus Venezuela kreiert.  Er selber beschreibt sein Programm als eine Mischung aus den Begriffen  «Salsa»; was nicht nur den Tanzstil,  sondern vorallem auch die Sauce, also den knalligen Mix aus den  unterschiedlichsten Stilen, Rhythmen und Kulturen beschreiben soll und  «Sensation»: das Gefühl der Lebensfreude, der Happiness, die einem  überkommt, wenn man tanzt.  Alejandro, seine Mastertrainer und  Elite Instructoren legen in ihren Choreos großen Wert auf eine gefühlte  Interpretation der Songs, also auf Tanzschritte und Bewegungen, welche  die Musik besonders gut unterstreichen. Das Motto lautet stets *Let the  dancing do the talking*  Werde jetzt Salsation Instructor!!!  ++++++++++++++++++++  Die Ausbildung wird auf Deutsch von dem Mastertrainer Vladimir Gerónimo geleitet! title: Achieving Diversity in the Technology Industry
description: A monthly meetup to discuss improving diversity in the technology industryWe will host a variety of talks on diversity, inclusion and breaking of stereotypes and biases. We hope to hold open and frank discussions and debates on what can be done to increase diversity in the technology industry.The evening will start off with food (with vegetarian and vegan options) and refreshments (wine/beer/soft drinks/etc). Talks will start at 7:00pm. After the talks please do stick around to chat and meet others who care about improving diversity.21/04/16 6:30pmSpeakers: Kirstie WhitakerIntroducing the STEMM Role Models databaseWomen and other minorities are less likely to be invited to speak at academic and tech conferences. The STEMM role models database will help conference organisers access a diverse and representative group of the most exciting                researchers and developers in their field from around the world.  www.stemmrolemodels.com Gerry McDonnell and Jo Franchetti'I had no idea that this was happening'After our showing of Code - Debugging the Gender Gap. and the discussion that followed, we noticed that one of the common reactions was 'I just had no idea that women faced this kind of adversity'. The film highlighted the online abuse that many high profile women in the technology industry face every day, and as our discussion of the film went on, more people came forward with similar experiences. We'd like to hold a discussion around whether or not the technology industry is an inclusive environment. As such we're going to open the floor to you. Have you ever experienced discrimination or negative treatment at work because of your gender, skin colour, age or disability? What did you do? Was there a resolution? Have you been called out on discriminatory behaviour? And, the ever present question, are we being too sensitive?If you'd like to anonymously send in your thoughts or experiences, email                   info@achievingdiversityin.tech or@talk_diversity.

title: FYI! Sayang Singapura
description: This event is brought to you by The Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA).The Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) is Singapore's national land use planning and conservation agency. URA's mission is "to make Singapore a great city to live, work and play". We strive to create a vibrant and sustainable city of distinction by planning and facilitating Singapore's physical development in partnership with the community.As the main land sales agent for the State, our multifaceted engagement strategy includes the sale of State land to attract and channel private capital investment to develop sites for meeting our land use needs. As the place manager for Marina Bay, we promote exciting activities within Marina Bay in collaboration with other government agencies and private stakeholders. To create an exciting cityscape, URA also actively promotes architecture and urban design excellence. For more information, please visit us at www.ura.gov.sg.

title: Twisted Measure Spring Concert
description: Elon's first and oldest a cappella group, Twisted Measure, presents an evening of music featuring new songs by artists such as Jess Glynne, Adele, Coldplay, and more! Join us as we celebrate an awesome year and send off our senior class.About Twisted MeasureFounded in 1999, Twisted Measure is Elon University’s first co-ed a cappella group.Since its foundation, Twisted Measure has recorded 6 studio albums, and has enjoyed performing at various events around Elon as well as up and down the East Coast during the group’s annual Fall Break tour.As a tradition, the group has always performed barefoot. Why? Going shoeless seems to bring a little more "sole" to the music.In the past year the group has toured Charleston, SC and Nashville, TN, performed for Elon University President Leo Lambert, and released a music video for single "Chandelier," which garnered more than 5 million views and was featured in People Magazine, Time, and USA Today among others. Most importantly, Twisted Measure is a group of friends who love singing together.

title: Nanny / Nana - Theater #3 (2nd Scr)
description: (2ND SCREENING)Nanny/Nana – Genre: DocumentaryDominican Republic/2015/71 min.Directed by Tatiana Fernández GearaSpanish w/ English SubtitlesPhotojournalist Tatiana Fernández Geara’s feature documentary debut explores the sacrifices three Dominican mothers have made to provide for their children. Employed as nannies outside their country, some spend years without seeing their own children, becoming surrogate parents for the ones they are hired to take care of. Back on the island, grandparents and other relatives become surrogate parents of their own. What started out as a master thesis project turned into a heartbreaking and intimate film about motherhood and the immigrant experience.En su primer documental, la fotoperiodista Tatiana Fernández Geara explora los sacrificios que hacen tres madres dominicanas para proveer a sus hijos. Empleadas como nanas fuera de su país, algunas pasan años sin ver a sus propios hijos, convirtiéndose en madres sustitutas para los niños que ahora cuidan. Mientras, en la isla, abuelos y otros familiares se convierten en padres sustitutos de los hijos que ellas dejaron atrás. Lo que comenzó como un proyecto de tesis de maestría se convirtió en una película desgarradora e íntima sobre la maternidad y la inmigración.Shown with: Yainis [Jey-nees]

description: Testing testing testing

title: CTO Talks Luncheon Hosted by VMware
description: Hosted lunch with VMware!Chris Wolf will be hosting a lunch at CTO Talks, on April 12 from 12:30pm - 1:00pm. Tickets are limited!There will be limited lunches available. It will be provided on a first come, first serve basis. To receive a lunch, pre-registration is required. Lunches can be picked up starting at 12:20pm. The talk will start promptly at 12:30pm.Session Details:Architecting for Successful Multi-Cloud OperationsThis workshop takes a practical look at successful architectures and pitfalls commonly associated with operating across multiple clouds. Multi-cloud application and data management, networking and security present unique challenges and will shape many new technology advancements in the coming years.Speaker Bio:Chris Wolf is the VP and CTO, Americas at VMware. Chris serves as a partner and trusted adviser to VMware's customers in the Americas, and also collaborates with the IT and business community at large on cloud, mobile, virtualization and data center modernization strategies. Chris and his peers in the Office of the CTO work closely with VMware's product teams to ensure that VMware's future innovations align with essential market needs.Prior to joining VMware, Chris was a Research Vice President for Gartner's Technical Professionals service, where he managed the data center and private cloud research agenda, and was responsible for the strategic direction and technical accuracy of the team's collective research. There he had the privilege of engaging with more than 200 end user organizations annually, advising CIOs, architects and directors on private and hybrid cloud computing, server virtualization and desktop transformation strategies.Prior to Gartner, Chris was a founding member of the Data Center Strategies team at Burton Group, was a nationally recognized independent virtualization consultant, instructor at multiple colleges, worked for several years at CommVault Systems, and started his IT and technology career in the US Marines. He also authored Virtualization: From the Desktop to the Enterprise, the first book that was exclusively devoted to defining all aspects of x86 virtualization as we know it today.

title: A Wedding in Castañer - Theater #7
description: A Wedding in Castañer/Una Boda en Castañer – Genre: ComedyPuerto Rico/2015/112 min.Directed by Raúl GarcíaSpanish w/ English subtitlesThe mountain town of Castañer is going to witness what promises to be the greatest wedding in its history: that of Mariana Zalduondo, only daughter of respected doctor Eduardo Zalduondo, and Ender, her medical school classmate. All hell breaks loose when past mistakes as well as cultural (and even racial) prejudices threaten to derail the wedding in this entertaining comedy starring Braulio Castillo Jr., Adrián García, Marian Pabón, Georgina Borri, Jazmín Caratini and salsero Michael Stuart.Los residentes del pueblo montañoso de Castañer van a ser testigos de lo que promete ser la boda más grande de su historia: la de Mariana Zalduondo, única hija del respetado médico Eduardo Zalduondo, y Ender, su compañero de clase en la escuela de medicina. Un lío mayúsculo se desata entre ambas familias cuando ciertos pecadillos del pasado, así como algunos prejuicios culturales (e incluso raciales) amenazan con descarrilar la boda en esta comedia divertida protagonizada por Braulio Castillo, hijo, Adrián García, Marian Pabón, Georgina Borri, Jazmín Caratini y el salsero Michael Stuart.

title: Workshop: Curve Balls and Breaking the Rules
description: “There are no rules in improv.” We’ve all heard this, but then we get so hung up on not breaking these nonexistent rules. This workshop will put you in scenes that “you’re not supposed to do.” Transaction scenes, stranger scenes, teaching scenes; we’ll cover them all.This fun class will teach you how to playfully throw curve balls at your scene partner, and what to do when you get a curve ball thrown at you. Your scene turning into a fight? No problem! Are you begging for an add-on that just isn’t coming? Don’t worry! You’ll learn that your scene isn’t going off the rails. it’s just getting started. Curve Balls and Breaking the Rules with Andy LivengoodSaturday, April 16 at 10amPrice: $30This workshop is for students who have completed Improv 201 and up._____________Andy LivengoodAndy Livengood wandered into an improv theatre to see a friends show and became hooked for life. He is a graduate of the Theatre 99 training program (Charleston, SC) and has studied at the Upright Citizen’s Brigade Theatre (NY) and The Annoyance Theatre (Chicago).For 10 years he regularly performed at Theatre 99 with the groups CATS HUGGING CATS, Human Fireworks, and Clutch. He was voted Charleston’s Best Comic in 2010 and has written for the sketch comedy groups Maximum Brain Squad and This is Chucktown. His one man show, The Christmas will be Televised, was voted Best Play in Charleston in 2011 and has been performed in theaters all over the south east. Andy has performed and taught in theaters and festivals all over the US. He is also a big comic book nerd. (Bring up Batman in a workshop and you’ll make a friend for life)

title: Burden of Peace / Paz y Paz - Theater #3
description: Burden of Peace/Paz y Paz – Genre: DocumentaryGuatemala/Netherlands/2015/77 min.Directed by Joey Boink and Sander WirkenSpanish w/ English SubtitlesWhen Claudia Paz y Paz became Guatemala’s first female Attorney General in 2010, only 2% of murder cases were solved and the crimes committed during the civil war were still unpunished. By the time she left office four years later, 30 of every 100 murder cases were solved. However, it was her successful trial against dictator Efrain Ríos Montt for genocide that won her accolades from around the world as well as enemies. “Burden of Peace” follows her from the beginning of her term and witnesses her uphill battle against corruption and impunity.Cuando Claudia Paz y Paz se convirtió en la primera mujer en servir como fiscal general de Guatemala en 2010, sólo el 2% de los casos de asesinato eran resueltos y los crímenes cometidos durante la guerra civil todavía estaban sin castigar. Al dejar el cargo cuatro años más tarde, 30 de cada 100 casos de asesinato estaban resueltos. Sin embargo, fue su exitoso juicio por genocidio contra el dictador Efraín Ríos Montt lo que le ganó elogios al igual que enemigos. “Paz y Paz” la sigue desde el principio de su mandato y narra su batalla cuesta arriba contra la corrupción y la impunidad.Shown with: One Hundred Years Older / Cien Años más Viejo

title: Frankie Cosmos at Milk Run
description: Frankie Cosmos w/Eskimeaux, Yowler, & Anna McClellanGreta Kline’s musical output as Frankie Cosmos exemplifies the generation of musicians born out of online self-releasing. Kline initially built a reputation with her prolific catalog of bedroom recordings and as a performer and advocate of New York’s All Ages DIY scene. The beauty in Kline’s writing does not lie within immense statements and large gestures, but instead can be found in her ability to examine situations and relationships with heartbreaking sincerity. In 2014 Kline released her first studio album, Zentropy. Within months of its release, Zentropy became one of the most critically acclaimed independent albums of the year and was named New York Magazine’s #1 Pop album of 2014. In 2015 Kline signed to Bayonet Records, immediately releasing an EP where she experimented with writing in an electronic setting. The EP Fit Me In was well received and garnered a Best New Track from Pitchfork. Kline then began recording her next album appropriately titled, Next Thing. Like Zentropy, Kline approached Next Thing by fleshing out several old home recordings, and by writing half of the album from scratch. Next Thing explores new emotional and instrumental territory for Kline, and is slated for release April 1st on Bayonet Records.

title: Women Grow Sacramento Networking Event
description:
Marketing Your Cannabis Business Right!

Learn quick tips and best practices from experts.

EVENT AGENDA

6:30 PM Check-in and Open Networking

 7:00 PM Announcements and Sponsor Highlights

7:15 PM PANEL DISCUSSION:  Marketing Your Cannabis Business Right!

8:30 PM Event Ends

PANELISTS:

Jessica Redding / CEO, Thrive Agencies:  

Jessica has over 20 years’ experience in sales, marketing, branding and advertising and has lived and worked in Sacramento, Los Angeles and Las Vegas.

In 2013, Jessica opened Connect Direct Marketing, a company focused on utilizing data and analytics for direct marketing campaigns, both locally and nationally.

In 2016, Jessica partnered with two other women business owners to expand her company and create Thrive Agency, bringing a full-service branding and marketing agency to Sacramento. Thrive Agency is unique in the fact they are an agency servicing clients within the cannabis industry as well as traditional verticals. Jessica and her team delivers their clients highly strategic business development plans that result from combining research, data analytics, proprietary marketing tools, innovative creativity, technical excellence and industry experts.

Eric Esalo / CEO, Defonce Chocolatier:  

Défoncé Chocolatier takes cannabis-infused chocolates to new heights. Drawing upon years of chocolate-making experience by veteran artisans, as well as single-origin cannabis grown by one of California’s most innovative and responsible farmers, Défoncé offers the best-tasting, most impeccable infused chocolate in California. The care and attention goes beyond chocolate-making and cannabis growing. Our single-origin, craft-forward cannabis undergoes the cleanest, most gentle extraction process available, and our chocolatiers source ingredients from partners that hew.



F.A.Q.

Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.

Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.

How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.

Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.

Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.

What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Street parking is not guaranteed, plan accordingly.

Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash.

Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.

Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.

Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

TWITTER TIPS

A great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!

#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabis

title: Bronx OSHA 10 Construction - Weekends - $115
description:
Bronx OSHA 10
OSHA 10-hour Construction Safety Class 
for only $115



every Saturday and Sunday.
9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

Earn you OSHA 10 card for the bargain price of only $115. You cannot work on a major construction site in New York City without this card. Take this engaging safety class and be qualified to work on Monday.

Schedule: Saturday and Sunday, 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM
Price: $115 advanced online registration
$130 at the door
We accept cash, money order, company check made out to "New York Safety and Training," and credit/debit card with a $4 surcharge
975 Kelly Street, 4th FloorBronx, NY 10459
2 or 5 to Intervale or 6 to Hunts Point
Street parking available or underground parking garage for $6 per day
Classes available in all 5 Boroughs.


Want MORE Certifications? Combine OSHA class with NYC DOB 4-hour Supported Scaffold class for only $215 total. Have both certs, OSHA 10 and Scaffold, by Sunday afternoon.
New York Safety and Training, Inc.A Veteran owned business. Ask about our discount pricing for U.S. military veterans.
LIKE us on Facebook: www.Facebook.com/NYSafetyandTraining

Visit our website: www.NYSafetyandTraining.com

New York City Department of Buildings mandates that all workers at major construction sites must have had the OSHA 10-hour Construction Industry safety class within the last five years. DOB inspectors regularly visit job sites to check for OSHA cards, and any laborer without an OSHA card will be ejected from the job. Taking this course helps students to remain safety compliant and maintain their current employment or to become safety compliant as a first step towards qualifying to be hired in the construction field.
OSHA 10-Hour Construction Industry -- Designated Training TopicsThis training program is intended to provide entry level construction workers information about their rights, employer responsibilities, and how to file a complaint as well as how to identify, abate, avoid, and prevent job related hazards on a job site. The training covers a variety of construction industry safety and health hazards which a worker may encounter. Training will emphasize hazard identification, avoidance, control, and prevention, not OSHA standards. OSHA mandates that the 10 hours of training be broken into 7 hours of mandatory topics, 2 hours of elective topics, and 1 hour of optional topics as follows:
Mandatory - 7 hoursIntroduction to OSHA -- 2 hoursCovers workers' rights, employer responsibilities, and how to file a complaint. It includes helpful worker safety and health resources. It also provides samples of a weekly fatality and 3 catastrophe report, material data safety sheet, and the OSHA Log of Work-Related Injuries and Illnesses.
Fall Hazards in Construction - 1.25 hoursCovers fall protection and related fall hazards encountered on construction sites, including how to remain safe and the proper techniques to establish fall protection.
Electrical Hazards in Construction -- 1 hourCovers electrical hazards and the dangers involved with working with electrical equipment and circuitry within the construction field.
Struck By Hazards in Construction -- 1 hourCovers hazards on construction jobsites that relate to falling and flying objects including vehicular strikes. Emphasis is placed on recognizing the hazard and avoiding the hazard.
Caught-In-Between Hazards in Construction -- 1 hourIncludes hazard awareness of trench collapse, machine guarding, and entrapment situations where workers can be caught in operating machinery or pinched between opposing objects.
Personal Protective Equipment -- 1/2 hourCovers the proper, effective use of personal protective equipment (such as hearing protection, safety goggles, and gloves), including statistics of injuries related to the failure to properly use personal protective equipment.
Hazard Communication, Health Hazards, and Silica-- 1 hourCovers the proper way to label and catalogue hazardous materials and chemicals, such as cleaners, solvents, and paint, and how to avoid chronic exposure to hazardous substances including silica.
Elective - 2 hours The instructor will teach two to four of the following topics: Scaffold Hazard AwarenessThis topic covers scaffold hazards including falls, improper usage, improper erection, and the various safety systems to keep workers safe while using scaffolds.
Trench and Excavation HazardsExcavation and trenching are among the most hazardous construction operations. This topic introduces learners to the hazards of trench and excavation safety as it is encountered in the construction process.
Confined Space Hazard IntroductionIntroductory Hazard Training that refers to an area which is enclosed with limited access which makes it dangerous. Hazards in a confined space often include suffocation by un-breathable gases which may be present but not visible or submersion in liquids or free-flowing granular solids.
Ladder SafetyLadder Hazard awareness, including how to properly select, use, and maintain ladders to ensure construction site hazards are minimized.
Respiratory ProtectionThis topic covers the dangers associated with potential exposure to pathogenic airborne contaminants that can cause acute and chronic diseases among construction workers.
ErgonomicsThis topic teaches how the use of Ergonomics, which is fitting a job to a person, helps lessen muscle fatigue, increase productivity, and reduce the number and severity of work-related musculoskeletal disorders. 
Safety and Health ProgramThis topic teaches considerations for creating, implementing, and enforcing your own workplace Safety and Health Programs.
Optional - 1 hour There is also an hour reserved for optional safety training. We can tailor an additional topic to a specific client (such as water safety if the client is a school with a swimming pool), or what most often happens is this hour is reserved for any of the previous topics that the students are particularly engaged in and want to spend more than the allotted time on. It is often helpful for the instructor to have this hour at his or her disposal to be able to devote to any topic in which the students are especially engaged.

title: Women Grow LA Networking Event - MONDAY July 11th
description:
Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current  professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our  members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and  networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect.

WOMEN GROW IS NOT JUST FOR GROWERS, AND YES - MEN ATTEND OUR EVENTS!!

Signature Networking Events usually occur the first week of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.

EVENT AGENDA

6:30PM Check-in and Open Networking

7:00PM  Introduction by Chapter Chair Lisa Sweeney

7:05PM Q&A with Vice Chair, Jackie "Jackpot" Subeck

7:15PM Featured Speaker: Krystal Kitahara from Yummi Karma

8:00PM Open Networking

9:00PM Event concludes

**Parking is available across the street for $10**




Krystal will speak about why she began Yummi Karma after noticing a gap in cannabis products that appealed to women, and why having a female-run company has played such an important role in Yummi Karma's success. She'll talk about cannabis branding, and why it's so vital in our marketplace. Also, why we aim to set the bar for compliance in edibles packaging and manufacturing in California. She'll also give advice to anyone trying to break into the canna-business now.


PLEASE BE MINDFUL THAT THIS IS A NON-CONSUMPTION EVENT

AND

NO MEDICATED OR LIVE PRODUCT ON SITE




Thanks to our wonderful sponsors! We extend our sincere appreciation to our sponsors, without whom our events would not be possible. We invite you to support these organizations.














Events We Are Sponsoring:


CANNABIS QUALITY STRATEGIES & SOLUTIONS SUMMITJULY 19-21, 2016 | MILLENNIUM BILTMORE HOTEL, LOS ANGELES, CAClick for more info and to buy tickets

Come join Women Grow Los Angeles as we support the future of cannabis operations and testing from multiple states.  Register now to not miss this conference!




F.A.Q.
Who attends?  You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in  the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning  more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are  looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up  their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the  status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business  owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.

Why should I attend?  Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the  wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy  business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our  members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a  national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new  American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create  environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and  cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.

How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.

Where are there Women Grow events?  Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in  prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is  on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn  more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.

Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.

What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Street parking is not guaranteed, plan accordingly.

Can I pay at the door?  Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure  you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in  advance, please bring cash.

Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?  No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket  under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you  are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to  show us.

Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month?  Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month  (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times.  Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure  you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.

Why do you charge for events?  Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our  events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are  unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about  volunteer opportunities.

Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.

Can I consume cannabis at this event even if I have a medical marijuana recommendation? No.  All Women Grow LA events are non-consumption events.

TWITTER TIPS

A  great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags  when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on  Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!

#WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj #medicalmarijuana #medicalcannabis


ABOUT THE SPEAKER:

KRYSTAL KITAHARA
Just named one of the Top 40 Under 40 by Marijuana Venture Magazine, and featured in High Times, The Economist, Forbes.com, and the San Francisco Chronicle.

After graduating with a business degree, Krystal started several small businesses, interned for a marketing agency, and dabbled in the corporate media world as an account executive. Realizing there was an opportunity to make an impact in the cannabis industry, Krystal left her 9 to 5, and sought to create a company that brought a fresh approach to canna-business. And that’s how Yummi Karma was born.

Focusing on products that are unique to the market and building a brand that is appealing to women has been the key to Yummi Karma’s success. She also is passionate about playing a role in the political debate surrounding legalization of cannabis and supports organizations that empower women, like Women Grow.

Yummi Karma is sponsoring the Lakeside BBQ and Dance at this year's Women Grow Retreat in Lake Tahoe next month, so if you're going, make sure to let Krystal know!

She believes in being hands-on in her company, and no job is too big or too small. Krystal is always very approachable, so please feel free to ask questions and join the conversation. She truly loves what she does!

title: The Rural Retreat
description:
Terroir Hospitality brings together innovative and creative influencers from the field of hospitality - including chefs, food and beverage experts, writers and business leaders.700 influencers, three amazing days, one big celebration. This year we’re celebrating the people pioneering change in our industry at home, and beyond. The day following Terroir, participants are invited to explore a different region of rural Ontario. This year, we are partnering with Feast ON - a provincial program that celebrates chefs and restaurants commited to sourcing local food & drink, and Durham Region We will be coming together to showcase the flavours, producers and landscape of the area. The day acts as a portal into the culinary landscape of the region. It is an opportunity for more intimate dialogue among Terroir presenters, media and sponsors. It is also a day for the International community of chefs to interact, cook and forage together.

title: GET HAPPY Boston
description:

title: 2016 Farm Lab Camps
description:
Unique week-long day camps for kids ages 5-9 to observe nature, explore our learning labs, gain hands on skills, and engage with quality mentors in an intimate, interactive outdoor setting. Farm Lab Camps take place in a well-designed educational and natural setting that nurture the whole child.Farm Lab Camps are led by a team of experienced leaders in the arts, sustainability, and school gardens who get kids excited about becoming stewards of the environment through fun and inventive projects, activities, and games.Farm Lab Campers will dig deep into food and farm life in the season when the garden really comes alive! Activities include: care of plants and animals, planting, harvesting, composting, cooking from the garden and more. Taking place on a 1-acre teaching facility nestled next to a 28-acre organic farm, campers will have a unparalleled view of the farm process and what it means to grow from seed-to-harvest.Farm Lab Camp Sessions:
Farm Lab Camps Session 1 Ages 7 - 9, coed / Tue - Fri 9 am - 1 pm / June 21-24
Farm Lab Camps Session 2 Ages 7 - 9, coed / Tue - Fri 9 am - 1 pm / June 28-July 1
Farm Lab Camps Session 1 Ages 5 - 6, coed / Tue - Fri 9 am - 1 pm / July 12-15
Farm Lab Camps Session 2 Ages 5 - 6, coed / Tue - Fri 9 am - 1 pm / July 19-22
Cancellation Policy: We understand your summer plans may change. We will be happy to give you a refund for cancellation up to 1 month of the camp's start date. To account for our preparation and our instructor's time, we cannot give refunds or credits if cancelled with less than one month's notice or in the event of a no-show.

title: Брати Гадюкіни в Чикаго
description: Брати́ Гадю́кіни — культовий український рок-гурт, створений 1988 року у Львові; першими з українських рок-команд здобули популярність на теренах колишнього СРСР і пострадянському просторі. «Гади» випустили 4 студійні альбоми, 4 концертні альбоми та 2 збірки хітів. Крім цього, була величезна кількість концертів та участь у фестивалях по всьому світу. Гурт припинив концертну діяльність в 1995 році і возз'єднався в 2006 році для концерту в київському «Палаці спорту», який зібрав 15 000 глядачів — абсолютний рекорд для українських музикантів.

title: To register please contact Claire Pollock
description:
To register please contact Claire Pollock at cpollock@ahmm.co.uk
AHMM
407 St John St, London EC1V
As the meaning of ‘green’ widens to encompass factors affecting our wellbeing and productivity, we discover new ways to measure and record anything. A diverse group of innovative intelligence gatherers will tell us how architectural, operational and aesthetic aspects of space can influence wellbeing. We will hear how simple data recording - as well as more illusive impacts – can be turned into valuable intelligence influencing future design, building operation, policy, and development of cities. Buro Happold’s Trevor Keeling will present research using multisensory wearable technology to measure physiological responses to the building environment - some of which was done at the Angel Building. Ines Idzikowski Perez, UCL, will discuss work carried out in AHMM’s Morelands offices studying the relationship between architecture, energy and productivity. George Bartley, Building Sustainability, will showcase data collection technology facilitating rich information collection, dissemination and provoking behaviour change through the ‘internet of things’. Jane Willis, Willis Newson, will use innovative arts programming at Southmead Hospital, Bristol to tell us about engaging users and communities to create a strong sense of community, inclusion and social cohesion - and a building that is part of  a city-wide cultural landscape. Hosted by Craig Robertson, AHMM’s Sustainability Specialist.

title: Hackathon TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2016
description:
The Best Hackathon in New York is Back! TechCrunch Disrupt NY's 24-hour Hackathon at the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal.Saturday, May 7, 2016
12:30pm - Registration opens (lunch not provided)
1:30pm - Hacking Kickoff
2:00 - 6:00pm - API workshops scheduled in 30 minute intervals (To Be Announced)
7:00pm - Dinner
Sunday, May 8, 2016
7:00am - Breakfast served
9:30am - Hacking concludes and hacks submitted to wiki
10:00am - General public welcome to enter to attend hackathon presentations
11:00am - Hackathon presentations begin
Approximately 2:00 pm - Hackathon will conclude with final awards and recognitions will be provided by the judges. The final awards may be held earlier or later depending on duration of hack presentations.HOW TO PARTICIPATE:HACKERS & DEVS - Tickets are for Developers who wish to participate and work on hack projects to present ONLY. To learn how you can provide support for the developer community, please contact sponsors@techcrunch.com.SPECTATORS may attend the Sunday Hackathon Presentation and tickets will be available in April (TBD).

title: Gotham Girls Roller Derby: Basic Training Level 2
description:
Ready to make contact?  Let's go to Level 2!  Basic Training Level 2 is for women and men whose basic skating skills -- form, crossovers, stops, starts, and safe falls -- are already strong and who are ready to add some contact. Practices will build on the form drills taught in Level 1, and introduce roller derby contact, gameplay, and scrimmage style drills. Assessments are conducted at the end of the 10 week program to determine if you are ready to move on to Level 3.In order to sign up for this class, you must have previously taken a GGRD Basic Training Level 2 or passed the Winter Skills Assessment. The dates and times for this class are:Saturday, April 2nd - Saturday, June 11th (No practice on 5/28)11am - 1pmThis 10-week program costs $250.You must have your own skates, knee pads, elbow pads, wrist guards, helmet, and mouthguard. In addition, all participants will be required to purchase supplementary WFTDA insurance for $70. Please see here for WFTDA insurance purchasing instructions. Primary health insurance is strongly encouraged.
You must bring proof of your WFTDA insurance policy number on the first day of class 
Please note that we reserve the right to cancel this class with one week of notice in the case of insufficient interest. In the event of cancellation, skaters will be issued a refund.**Tickets are NON REFUNDABLE and NONTRANSFERABLE**Questions?Email: basictraining@gothamgirlsrollerderby.comPhoto by Annakill Skywalker

title: Sakura Days Japan Fair April 9 & 10, 2016
description: Sakura Days Japan Fair ( #SDJF ) is a family-friendly, two-day Japanese festival showcasing Japanese cultural and performing arts, cuisine and business while celebrating spring and the ephemeral beauty of the cherry blossom. Traditional, modern and fusion Japan. Experience it all.Soak in the wonderful Japanese festival atmosphere and enjoy taiko drumming, martial arts, koto (Japanese harp), dance and singing performances. Participate in a tea ceremony, origami (paper folding), haiku or calligraphy and try getting dressed in an authentic yukata.www.JapanFairVancouver.comSakura Days Japan Fair will be held on April 9 & 10, 2016 from 10:00am to 5:00pm each day at the spectacular VanDusen Botanical Garden. 5251 Oak Street, Vancouver, BC.Avoid the line-ups by buying tickets online. Tickets will also be available in person at VanDusen Botanical Garden Visitor Centre, Admissions Desk during garden hours starting end of March.*Early bird ticket pricing ends at 11:45 pm PDT April 8.Tickets will also be available at the door - please keep in mind that you will have to wait in a longer line-up to enter.There is a reduced rate for VanDusen Members, but all Member tickets must be purchased in person at VanDusen either before or on the day of the event. Ticket sales at VanDusen start in March.Sakura Days Japan Fair was established in 2009 and is presented by the volunteer-run Japan Fair Association of Vancouver (JFAV) as one of the Vancouver Cherry Blossom Festival Month events. The JFAV is comprised of individuals representing Vancouver’s leading Japan-Canada business associations. JFAV’s mission is to showcase Japan and Japan-Canada communities to the Canadian community at large, in an effort to facilitate better understanding and relationships.Please Note: - Each ticket is good for all day entry to the event on EITHER April 9  OR April 10. If you would like to attend both days, you need to purchase  two tickets/person.- This is a rain or shine event. NO REFUNDS.

title: The 80s Alt Rock Sing A Long
description: I Forgot What 8 Was For: The 80s Alt Rock Sing A LongIn the 80s, “Alternative” in Alt Rock actually meant something. The alternative to pop music, to R&B, to classic rock. Some of the bands that started out on the college radio circuit became huge, like U2, REM, The Police. Others built giant cult followings like the Violent Femmes, The Replacements, Madness and the Pixies. This month IndieFest celebrates 80s Alt Rock with a play list of some of the hit music videos of 120 Minutes and other fringe music programming of the years between punk and grunge. We know you know all the words, but just in case, we'll have the lyrics on screen for you to sing a long to.The show is all ages. Tickets are $10/advance, $12/at the door.Presented by SF IndieFest and RADIO VALENCIA (radiovalencia.fm)Co-presented by NEW WAVE CITY (newwavecity.com)This show is a benefit event for SF IndieFest and Radio Valencia

title: Violation Withdrawal
description: Violation Withdrawal  |  Cassandra CottaApril 5, 2016 - April 7, 2016Anita's Way137 West 42nd Street(the through-block connecting 42nd and 43rd streets,between Broadway and 6th Ave)New York, NYNearest Trains: B, D, F, M, 1, 2, 3, SPerformances Tuesday, April 5, 4-7pmWednesday, April 6, 4-7pmThursday, April 7, 4-7pmThe piece runs around 45 minutes and will be performed twice every night—once at 4:30pm and again at 6pm. For the brief windows before and after each performance, the space remains open to the public and performers will be available to speak with visitors. Inboxes full of text messages, emails, voicemails, and notifications. People walking into each other, trees and poles on the sidewalk. Headphones in, announcements over loudspeakers, strangers asking for spare change, and signs begging for your business. Is there such a thing as a private moment anymore? Is it even possible to complete a thought without it being interrupted by an entirely different idea? It seems that the potential for withdrawal from these kinds of bombardments is slowly but steadily becoming a thing of the past.Violation Withdrawal is a continuation of the work presented by 5th Digit at Anita's Way in November 2015.About the Company5th Digit Dance, founded by Cassandra Cotta in December, 2015, aims to create athletic, intriguing and relevant material through a highly collaborative process in which each individual performer is viewed as an equal choreographer.Since its founding, 5th Digit has performed all over NYC - at Green Space, the West End Theater and the Old First Reformed Church in Brooklyn. In February, 2016, they were named "first runners up" in MTV's "Dancing with DNCE Contest" and had a clip of their dance video presented on air. 5th Digit performed a version of Violation Withdrawal as part of the Ruby Slipper Fringe Festival in North Carolina. They are excited to continue their creative process with performances slated for May, 2016 with the Hoover Dam Collective and winter, 2017 in Spoke the Hub's new Gowanus space.About the ChoreographerCassandra Cotta is originally from Point Pleasant, New Jersy. She holds a BFA in modern dance performance from Temple University in Philadelphia and, under the direction of her mentor, Daniel Giel, became a certified Pilates instructor through Sal Anthony's Movement Salon in NYC.She has worked with many different choreographers and companies throughout the NYC and Philadelphia areas including Chrismastersdance, Malcolm Low/Formal Structure, Kun-Yang Lin/Dancers, and Human Architecture.For more information, contact: fifthdigitdance@yahoo.com

title: The Last Days of Judas Iscariot: SOLD OUT
description: Thirty pieces of silver made his name synonymous with traitor. Now Judas Iscariot, history’s most hated sinner, gets his day in Purgatory’s court. After spending a couple millennia in the ninth circle of Hell, Judas Iscariot’s case is brought before a jury of people awaiting their own judgment. Judas’s final actions on Earth are debated by saints and sinners alike in a trial where saints, apostles, Mother Teresa, Sigmund Freud, Satan, and Christ Himself will all testify. The Last Days of Judas Iscariot is the smart, hilarious, and heartbreaking story of Judas’s ultimate fate. But can a man trapped by his own guilt and despair ever truly be exonerated?
