description: An invite-only event that looks at why competitive gaming is one of the most closely-watched growth areas in video games, how to encourage better treatment of players, and opportunities for non-games companies in the space.

title: Social Innovations in Health
description: On Tuesday April 12, the community gathers to celebrate the global innovators who are applying new social enterprise models to improve the health of citizens in Charlottesville and around the world.Beginning with a conversation between Dr. Helen Lee, President and CEO of Diagnostics for the Real World, Dr. Rick Shannon, Executive Vice President of the UVA Health System, and Ross Baird, Executive Director of Village Capital, the community will gain insight into the role that impact investing and philanthropy are having in shaping research and discovery, and the system innovations that will impact millions of lives.Dr. Lee chaired the Diagnostic Steering Committee at the World Health Organization (WHO) and was awarded the 2006 British Female Inventor in Industry Award for her multiple patents and work to develop cutting-edge technologies and diagnostic capabilities in resource poor countries.Following the discussion, local innovators will share their stories of building globally relevant, system changing therapies and technologies that bridge nonprofit and corporate structures to develop new models for social innovations. Presenters include David Dusseau, CEO, MadiDrop PBC, Brynne Potter, CEO and cofounder, Maternity Neighborhood, David Kalergis, founder of Diffusion Pharmaceuticals, and Neal Kassell, MD, founder of Focused Ultrasound Foundation.

title: Phlemuns at Los Angeles Fashion Week F/W 2016
description: James Flemons was born and raised in Los Angeles, California. When life offered him asthma, he tooled it and fueled it to the discovery of his sister's Barbie sketch designer launching his interest in fashion. In 2012 he graduated with an Associates degree in Product Development from FIDM, and his senior portfolio was used as the platform to base the Senior Product Development Curriculum at all campuses.Flemons to PHLEMUNS, is contemplative and dynamic. Thinking outside the norms of convention and taking to reinvention and recycling. Creating the perfect fluidity of reconstruction of old to new. The use of playing with off proportions is shown throughout his pieces. He achieves a balance of unisex androgyny, classic silhouettes, and the idea of juxtaposition through the process of looking at womenswear and make it masculine for men, and then translating that back into womenswear. With the state of trend driven fast fashion and reselling that we live in today, he strives to create clothing that people will want to hold on to and wear forever.About LA Fashion Week Fall/Winter 2016LAFW is the biggest apparel & design event in California. It's now a permanent feature on the international fashion week circuit alongside London, Paris, Milan, New York, and Tokyo. LAFW showcases award winning designers from all over the world with the new season’s collections twice a year to media, buyers, industry elite & affluent clientèle.Based in Hollywood, LAFW is unlike any other fashion event on the international calendar. LAFW represents a fashion authority in the western United States showcasing both Los Angeles based brands as well as international talent and trend setting collections from established designers. These designers are as relevant as the multi-label boutiques and department stores that carry them throughout the world.

title: Dan Savage's Hump Film Festival - 8:15p

Created and performed by sex-positive people just like you, HUMP! films are sexy, funny, thought-provoking, artistic, outrageous, and oh so real. Now, we're bringing the very best of HUMP! to your town! See 22 of the hottest HUMP! films in action. They'll make you laugh, squeal, and marvel at the broad (and creative) range of human sexuality. It's the best of HUMP! You'll be glad you came.

title: Manitoba Airshow 2016
description: This years Manitoba Airshow will feature exciting aerobatics displays by the Snowbirds and Canadian Forces CF-18 Demo Team. As well spectators will be treated to invigorating and adrenaline pumping demonstrations by the Sky Hawks parachute team and a Search Rescue Demonstration involving our Canadian Forces SAR team and a CC-130 Hercules! Airplanes not your thing? How about Manitoba's largest classic car show? Or our vintage motorcycle show? You can even check out our fashion show! Why not get your nails painted or your hair done? After that, why not listen to some live music and enjoy a cold one in our beer gardens?Plenty of fun for the little ones too! There will be a variety of tents set up where youths can learn about airplanes/flying, build model airplanes, watch RC demos, and get their faces painted! title: Neon Dreams presents: 8 MILLION WAYS TO DIE
description: Welcome to a world where people’s worst impulses and darkest desires are stimulated by a landscape of synth-pop and bright neon lights. Nothing is quite as it seems as you surrender yourself to the dazzling sights and soothing sounds of the Neon Dreams Cinema Club, a monthly film series exclusive to The Royal Cinema bringing you the best in delightfully surreal neo-noir cinema from the 70's, 80's, and beyond.Pre-Show starts at 7:00Feature starts at 8:00As we close out our first year of programming, Neon Dreams has dug deep and will be unearthing the widely forgotten and nearly unavailable final film of beloved director Hal Ashby (Harold & Maude, Being There, Coming Home). Matt Scudder (Jeff Bridges) is a depressed and hard-drinking Los Angeles cop troubled by a shooting that occurred in the line of duty. After Matt meets Sunny (Alexandra Paul), a call girl involved with powerful drug lord Angel Moldonado (Andy Garcia), he decides that he wants to help her escape the shady underworld. However, Sunny is soon found dead, and Matt tries to win the trust of Angel and his girlfriend, Sarah (Rosanna Arquette), in order to take him down.This screening was made possible thanks to our lovely sponsor Sonic Boom and will be preceded by a mind-shattering pre-show, featuring a curated video mixtape of music, film, and television guaranteed to put you in the right mood. As always this will be a licensed event, courtesy of Monarch Tavern, and there will be AMAZING PRIZES given out to many lucky patrons. Be sure to arrive early!

title: Who Dunnit? ...The Improvised Murder Mystery
description: Get ready for a spine tingling murder mystery!!!There's a killer on the loose... can you solve this classic who dunnit before they strike again!?!This show will have all the trappings of a thrilling mystery... a dastardly villain, shifty suspects and an intrepid detective....And it will all be made up on the spot!!!Don't miss this exciting mystery, all based off the audience's suggestion.Who Dunnit? ...The Improvised Murder MysterySaturday, March 12th at the Push Comedy TheaterThe show starts at 8, tickets are $5The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.Free parking available behind Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street.---The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: St. Party's Day 12PM-1PM Entry
description: **Please enter event during time slot specified. Once you have entered, you may stay until last call at 2 AM**Buy Tickets for the 2:30 PM to 3:30 PM Entry Time Slot HereBuy Tickets for the 5:00 PM to 5:45 PM Entry Time Slot HereBuy Tickets for the 8:00 PM to 8:30 PM Entry Time Slot HereSt. Party's Day promises to be Toronto's biggest party for everyone's favourite psuedo-holiday. An all day banger at Brassaii sponsored by Carlsberg, this event will blow your little green trousers right off.What some of you may refer to as St. Patrick’s Day is now commonly being referred to as St. Party’s Day. In 2011 the first ever St. Party’s Day celebration was born when 3000+ people attended in Toronto, ON at the historical St. Lawrence Market. Event goers and members of the community came together and signed a petition for St. Party’s Day to become a statutory holiday which created a huge buzz around town. 2012, 2013 and 2014 each played host to over 8,000 patrons celebrating the fast growing, authentic Irish holiday, and St. Party’s is back with its partner, Carlsberg, for another year of the best celebrations in the country.**Please enter event during time slot specified. Once you have entered, you may stay until last call at 2 AM****Tickets cannot be refunded once purchased**

title: Dena Burton at Los Angeles Fashion Week F/W 2016
description: What began as exposure and an appreciation for music and art in her formative years, Dena Burton has been cultivated into a fashion designer who creates for the beautiful purpose-driven jet setter. Based in Los Angeles, Dena designs clothing for the woman who knows her own beauty, her purpose and the road that takes her there.In past years, The Dena Burton Collection has appeared in several of the exclusive fashion events such as, Mercedes Benz Fashion Week LA, San Francisco Fashion Week, Miami Fashion Week and recently Fiji Fashion Week. Because Dena believes in giving back, she has showcased the collection in Africa as well as Jamaica for various charities. Currently in partnership with the American Heart Association she is showcasing her signature red wrap for the Go Red campaign.Dena's success and rising popularity has fortified the brand's vision, by seeing women feel and become confident with their own sense of purpose. The Dena Burton Collection solidifies this concept of being for every woman; whether she is an executive board member or woman aspiring to be more, and all those in between.As a native of Chicago and graduate of Howard University in Washington, DC, Dena moved to California to work in several capacities of the entertainment industry, including TV, short films and theatre. It was also where she decided to pursue her dream of fashion design. As a Karen Kane scholarship recipient at the Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandise (FIDM), Dena produced her first collection while at FIDM where she received numerous accolades from industry leaders, press and peers.The Dena Burton Collection continues to present luxurious classics with a seductive yet playful side. As apart of the brand, Dena combines exotic fabrics with softer, feminine fabrics, to compliment her customer's persona.About LA Fashion Week Fall/Winter 2016LAFW is the biggest apparel & design event in California. It's now a permanent feature on the international fashion week circuit alongside London, Paris, Milan, New York, and Tokyo. LAFW showcases award winning designers from all over the world with the new season’s collections twice a year to media, buyers, industry elite & affluent clientèle.Based in Hollywood, LAFW is unlike any other fashion event on the international calendar. LAFW represents a fashion authority in the western United States showcasing both Los Angeles based brands as well as international talent and trend setting collections from established designers. These designers are as relevant as the multi-label boutiques and department stores that carry them throughout the world.

title: Women Grow Toronto Networking Event
description: Women Grow Networking Events connect aspiring and current professionals in the cannabis industry. Through our monthly events, our members develop authentic relationships via personal contact and networking. While our events are women focused, our networking series attracts both men and women to connect. This months Women Grow features Big Brother Canada winner Sarah Hanlon! Sarah rose to reality television fame as a "hemployee" at Vapor Central and rose to the top of contestants. As a Big Brother Canada winner Sarah helped raise awareness by normalizing cannabis across the country. Sarah will share her story of her rise to fame and why we need to support local cannabis businesses now more than ever!Signature Networking Events occur the first Thursday of every month. Sign up for the Women Grow newsletter for the most up-to-date information on chapter and national events.EVENT AGENDA6:00PM Check-in and Open Networking6:30PM All About Women Grow & Why We Need More Diversity in the Cannabis Industry6:45PM Sponsors7:00PM Keynote: Sarah Hanlon, Big Brother Canada WInner8:00PM News - Local Announcements and Games8:30PM Networking9:00PM Meeting ConcludesF.A.Q.Who attends? You'll meet women (and men) at all different stages of their career in the cannabis industry. Many will be in the research phase, just learning more about opportunities, while still working day jobs. Some are looking for jobs with existing organizations. Others are starting up their own cannabis venture or ancillary business. Depending on the status of legalization in your state, you'll also meet cannabis business owners & investors who are well on their way. Watch the video to see for yourself.Why should I attend? Personal connections are the key to professional success. Through the wide variety of events offered to members of Women Grow, trustworthy business relationships sprout from the face-to-face interactions of our members. Together we have more power. As the cannabis industry grows on a national and global scale, women have the opportunity to build a new American industry from inception and redefine the workplace to create environments in which we can flourish and define our own destiny, and cultivate the next generation of industry leaders.How can I get the most out of networking events? We recommend bringing business cards and a pen to take notes. If you don't have business cards, check out Moo for 10% off your first order (and your first order supports Women Grow). Watch our video on networking tips from Women Grow founding members.Where are there Women Grow events? Women Grow events are held in small towns and large cities, in prohibition and legalized states alike. No matter where your county is on the road to legalization, you can have a Women Grow chapter. Learn more about starting a Women Grow Chapter.Are there ID requirements to attend? All attendees must be 21 years or older and have a valid ID as many events occur in establishments serving alcohol.What are my transportation/parking options? We recommend taking public transportation. Street parking is not guaranteed, plan accordingly.Can I pay at the door? Paying in advance helps speed up our check-in process and makes sure you receive all event announcements. If you are unable to pay in advance, please bring cash.Are tickets refundable or transferrable? You may send a friend to attend in your place. Tickets are not refundable.Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, as long as your ID matches the name your registered the ticket under. You may also show us your ticket on your mobile device. If you are giving your ticket to a colleague, please forward them the ticket to show us.Are events on different days other than the first Thursday of the month? Women Grow networking events are on the first Thursday of each month (except for holiday weeks). Social events can be planned at other times. Women Grow's national events are held a few times a year. Make sure you're on the Women Grow mailing list to receive invitations.Why do you charge for events? Women Grow is funded by event proceeds and sponsors. We charge for our events so that Women Grow is a self-sustaining organization. If you are unable to afford an event, please contact the organizer to ask about volunteer opportunities.Why should I consider a career in the cannabis industry? Watch our videos on getting started in the cannabis industry and why women should get involved.TWITTER TIPSA great way to connect with fellow participants is to use common hashtags when tweeting about the event. You can use the same hashtags on Facebook. Photos rock. Please share them if you take any!#WomenGrowTO #WomenGrow #cannabis #womenincannabis #mmj

title: Yellow Belt Training
description: Yellow Belt es un hábil implementador de herramientas Lean para aumentar la productividad y calidad de los procesos de las empresas. Participa como líder de eventos Kaizen cuando es necesario para mejorar procesos específicos, generalmente, como parte de un proyecto de implementación de mejora.Durante el sábado,19 de marzo de 2016  la American Society for Quality capítulo estudiantil del RUM les trae el taller "Lean Six SigmaYellow Belt Training". El mismo será ofrecido por el Dr. Pesantes CEO de "X6sigma Consulting".  Este taller tiene una duración de 8 horas y todo participante al finalizar el taller recibirá un certificado como “Yellow Belt Trained". El taller se ofrecerá en la Universidad de Puerto Rico recinto de Mayagüez en el anfiteatro de Enfermería.Costo:  $50 para miembros | $90 para no miembros | $130 para profesionalesIncluye desayuno, almuerzo y materiales.La agenda del taller es la siguiente:7:00am- 8:00am: Registración y desayuno8:00am- 12:00m: Primera parte del taller12:00m- 1:00pm: Almuerzo1:00pm- 4:00pm: Segunda parte del taller

title: 5 Course Russian Dinner Pop-Up
description: From the winner of the prestigious Mildred's Temple Kitchen Tin Chef 2015 battle and the loser of MasterChef Canada Season 3 auditions comes another in your face pop-up dinner. Join us for a 5 course dinner at the Zagat-reviewed Belljar Cafe, located in the hippest part of the west end of Toronto.We are offering 5 Russian-inspired courses including dessert. Drinks are not included, but there will be feature cocktails and a fully stocked bar.Special requests and food allergies: before purchasing, please contact Roman here to enquire whether they can be accommodated.Menu:Zakuskipickles, beef tongue, caviar sandwich, golden beet pashtetFish Piegrandma Lea’s pirozhki, potato, salmon belly and smoked whitefish rillettePelmeniOxtail and cabbage or buckwheat and porciniStroganoffShort rib, millet kasha, carrot and daikon pickleDessertApple terrine, tvorog, sea buckthorn

title: Free Boyd Tinsley Concery with Crystal Garden
description: SEATS LIMITED: The legendary musician plays a free public concert with upcoming band, Crystal GardenAs a founding member of Dave Matthews Band, Boyd Tinsley’s violin is indelibly linked to DMB’s sound. The Grammy award winning artist has helped propel the band to become the biggest ticket-seller worldwide of the past decade and recognized as one of the top 100 highest selling American bands of all-time with CD and DVD sales surpassing 37 million.This evening offers an introduction to one  Boyd’s projects, Crystal Garden. Boyd produced and curated this group of great musicians and turned them into a great rock band. It took two years for Tinsley to find the right mix, but the patience has paid off in Mycle Wastman, Matt Frewen, James Frost‐Winn, and Charlie Csontos. These musicians from San Francisco, Seattle and Toronto converged in Charlottesville and  Crystal Garden began recording. Their debut release will feature Boyd Tinsley and special guest Stanley Jordan, a legendary jazz/fusion guitarist.

title: Trafalgar 24
description: 24 ARTISTS. 24 HOURS. 6 NEW PLAYS.Twenty-four artists receive a scant 24-hours to write, rehearse and perform six site-specific plays in Whitby’s beautiful 19th century castle. TRAFALGAR 24 is a theatrical event unlike any other, where the audience is right on top of the action as each of the 10-minute scripts play out around them in locations throughout the castle. At TRAFALGAR 24 audience members play a vital role of their own, helping to select one winning play to receive a commission for further development from Driftwood Theatre. As Driftwood Theatre’s signature gala event of the season, TRAFALGAR 24 raises over $20,000 annually in support of bringing the magic of accessible, live theatre home to audiences across Ontario. It is a sumptuous affair featuring both a wine and cheese and (nearly world-famous) dessert buffet, and a silent auction with some of the best deals around in entertainment, electronics, services, and art.Friday, March 11, 2016. Trafalgar Castle. 7:30pm.401 Reynolds Street, Whitby, ON | Silent Auction begins at 6:30pm | Tickets: $100 Platinum VIP, $60 General Admissiondriftwoodtheatre.com/event/trafalgar-24/

title: Soirée Fromages et Vins
description:
Envie d’un petit apéro dinatoire? Rejoignez-nous à la boulangerie La Parisienne (dans une salle privative à l'étage) pour notre soirée Vin-Fromage le 27 Février à partir de 19h.L’idée est que (par exemple) les hommes apportent le vin, les femmes le fromage, en mode « pot luck », afin que nous puissions tout partager. Réservez votre place en fonction de ce que vous apporterez afin que nous ayons assez de tout (vin et fromage). Merci d'indiquer ici ce que vous comptez apporter comme fromage afin que l'on ne se retrouve pas avec 20 roqueforts ou 20 camemberts :-) : 
Liste des fromages prévus à ce jour: http://1drv.ms/1REksCw 
Entrez votre fromage: http://1drv.ms/1VfBfeh

Si vous souhaitez du bon vin français venant en direct de petits producteurs, rendez-vous sur le lien de l’entreprise partenaire Jwines, www.jwines.us/ufevin , qui nous offre des tarifs préférentiels pour l’évènement. Celle-ci se chargera de livrer vos bouteilles directement sur place. Vous y trouverez également des conseils pour accorder au mieux vos vins et fromages, et sublimer ainsi votre dégustation !Le prix d'entrée couvrira l’achat de couverts jetables, pain, charcuterie, fruits…N’hésitez pas à prendre vos tickets des maintenant (membres et non-membres) car le nombre de places est limité: http://vinfromage.ufeseattle.org .A bientôt !*N’oubliez pas de devenir membres de l’UFE Seattle pour l’année 2016 afin de profiter de tous nos services!  http://adherer.ufeseattle.org/ .Nous vous rappelons que votre adhésion est déductible des impôts et, le cas échéant, vous pouvez demander un matching de votre société !

title: EE New Family Overview Meeting
description:
New families are invited to attend an informational meeting hosted by the Director prior to enrollment. New Family Overview meetings are offered twice a month during the school year. RSVP is required.

Attendance at a New Family Overview meeting is required for all new families. In addition, a separate Parent and Student Orientation will also be required for all families.

Please plan for a MINIMUM of ONE HOUR for this overview meeting plus additional time for question & answer and an optional tour of the campus. Prospective students ages 9 and up are encouraged to attend. Siblings and younger children and welcome, but they may become bored. All children must stay with a parent at all times while visiting the campus.

title: wolvesmouth: taxa at MOCA // sat, mar 26 -SOLD OUT
description:
'Taxa' is wolvesmouth's new large-scale installation where food, music, and technology come together under the umbrella of art, to examine the precarious relationship between humans and nature.TICKET INFORMATION
Tickets are $225 per person (plus 3% credit card processing fee). The purchase of a ticket provides each ticket holder with entrance to the installation and a nine-course dinner prepared by the wolvesmouth team.
There are no limits on how many tickets you can purchase.
There are no refunds or exchanges for the tickets. All sales are final. This ticket is like a ticket to a concert, theater show, or sporting event.

Tickets can be transferred to another guest, but they cannot be resold beyond face value (which in many states is illegal and honestly, just not cool with us). If you do need to transfer your tickets to someone else, please make sure to let us know via email so that we can update your ticket with the new guest's information.
EVENT AND DINNER INFORMATION:
The installation is at the Geffen Contemporary at MOCA in Little Tokyo. 

The doors open for the installation promptly at the scheduled/ticketed time, with dinner starting soon thereafter. Please make sure to arrive 15 minutes before your event starts. We will start with or without you.


In addition to the regular menu, we are also offering pescatarian and vegetarian dinner options. Please select your preference at check-out. Due to the nature of the installation, we are unable to accommodate any other dietary restrictions/substitutions. If you have any food allergies, please send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com after you purchase your tickets.
You are invited to bring your own beverages to drink and to share with others. Beverages will not be sold at the event. We will provide water, ice, and glassware.
Parking is available at the museum and costs $8/vehicle. 
OTHER NOTES:
No dress code. Wear what you are most comfortable in.
Taking photos is always ok with us.
If you have any questions, send an email to info@wolvesmouth.com

title: Salsation Workshop Lithuania 18.3.16 SMT Angelika
description:
SALSATION is a dance workout that converts functional training protocols into innovative dance moves. The word “Salsation” stems from: 
  SALSA:   NOT from the rhythm / musical gender but from the spanish 
word  “SALSA” that actually means  "SAUCE”, because it is a SPICY mix of
  different rhythms, cultures, dances and fitness protocols. SENSATION: the program has a strong focus on musicality, lyrical expression as well as on how the human body functions. Why Salsation?
  What makes Salsation unique is that it is carefully designed to  
integrate functional body movements into all dance routines working out 
 in a 3D fashion and using all planes of motion.  It’s not only easy and
  fun but you can do it to improve your mobility and stamina no matter  
your age.

description: TechCrunch Disrupt is a three-day, single-track conference and startup competition to immerse you in the debate about what's changing in technology right now, what's causing it and what we need to do about it to survive and thrive in real time.TechCrunch Disrupt gathers the leaders and innovators of the technology and media industries to give you deep insights into the creative destruction happening right now. The big changes. And the subtle trends.We’ll bring the experts together to talk about what’s next. And why.You’ll meet the people behind the new startups, new products and new technologies driving disruption today and be part of a conversation that will stimulate and challenge you.LOCATION:  Brooklyn, NYDISCLOSURE: TechCrunch Disrupt tickets are non-transferable. LAFW showcases award winning designers from all over the world with the new season’s collections twice a year to media, buyers, industry elite & affluent clientèle. Based in Hollywood, LAFW is unlike any other fashion event on the international calendar. Combining FASHION & TECH, LAFW represents a fashion authority in the western United States showcasing both Los Angeles based brands as well as international talent and trend setting collections from established designers. These designers are as relevant as the multi-label boutiques and department stores that carry them throughout the world.LAFW Show Schedule:Thursday, March 17th:6 pm - Nicole Miller7 pm - Dena Burton8 pm - George Styler9 pm - Marcelo QuadrosFriday, March 18th:4 pm - Rose Cottage6 pm - Cosmogyral7 pm - Toit Volant8 pm - Michael Sta. title: February Debauchery!
description: Debauchery is: queers stripping for queers in hot, anti-oppressive space, raising money for organizations that serve the queer community. The show features stripteases, tons of audience interaction and even birthday lap dances onstage! Be sure to bring plenty of dollar bills -- a portion of the proceeds goes to non-profits providing health and social services within the queer community.This month's show benefits our community fund!**Accessibility** Neighbours is wheelchair accessible via the main entrance to the bar (located in the alley). There is a ramp between the door and the box office, and ample space for wheelchairs in the audience space. The show is ASL-Interpreted.Fragrance free request: Please join us in ensuring accessibility for beloved community members with chemical sensitivity and chronic illness by not bringing fragrances or scents on your clothes, hair, or skin from colognes and perfumes, scented laundry detergent, hair and body products, natural products, and essential oils. You can prepare in advance by not using products with fragrance, or by using fragrance free, non-toxic products. Two multi-stall all-gender restrooms are available.Information for scent sensitive people:Neighbors is not a scent free space. Scented cleaning products are used in all areas, including hand soap in the bathroom. Additionally,cigarette smoke from the smoking area in the alley drifts into the main performance space inside, fog is used on the dance floor, and many patrons are not scent free. Please protect yourself accordingly.

title: Planetfall Sci-Fi Larp - Game 4 - Beta Series
description:
Become a colonist struggling to survive on an alien world. 200 years in the future, Earth struggles under environmental devastation and a tyrannical government. A lucky and disposable few are sent on the first mission to colonize another Earth-like planet 36 light years from Earth. Your wits, your knowledge and your courage are the tools you will use to survive.Planetfall is taking Live Action Gaming into the future. It is a roleplay-centered immersive game using groundbreaking mobile technology to create a unique live action gaming experience. We are based in Austin, Texas.Schedule

Saturday 0900 - 0930
Check-in


Saturday 0930 - 1000
Announcements and Opening Ceremonies


Saturday 1000 - 2200
Game (Staff On Site)


Saturday 2200 - Sunday 0900
Night Cycle (No Staff, RP only)


Sunday 0900 - 1400
Game (Staff On Site)


Sunday 1400 - 1500
Closing Ceremonies and Cleanup

More information is available at: http://www.prepareforplanetfall.comContact the staff or any player for an invite code.Site and Catering DetailsThere are no sleeping quarters on site. Please bring a tent if you plan to stay overnight, along with appropriate sleeping bags for the weather and wind. This is the windy plains of Texas, so tent stakes are highly recommended.Two breakfasts, two lunches and a Saturday night dinner will be provided to people who purchase the meal package with their ticket. Fire pits and limited electric will be available for cooking. If you do not wish to buy a meal plan, please bring your own food. Genre appropriate food is highly encouraged, e.g. MREs, ration bars and the like.Meal plans must be pre-purchased by the Wednesday before the game. A limited number of meal plans may be available for purchase on site, but you are not guaranteed to receive one.New PlayersYou can obtain an invite code from any current player. You can use this invite code to register and create your character on our website: http://prepareforplanetfall.com/#/signupYou must bring a 'drop box' where all your character's personal equipment, including guns, can be stored before the drop sequence, marked with your characters name. A plastic bin should be fine. The only items you will have in the drop sequence is your costuming and your personal scanner (i.e. cell phone or tablet)Large items such as tents can be stored in your car and taken out after your box is recovered, for simplicity's sake.

title: Energy Huntsville Meeting: February 2016
description: Featured PresentationMr. Alden Sanborn“Secure Grid Initiative”The Tennessee Valley Corridors has established a "Secure Grid Initiative."  The goal is to unify public, private, and institutional participants in creating a national test bed to develop and deploy training and technologies that effectively address the numerous challenges of protecting the electrical grid from physical attack. TVC (http://www.tennvalleycorridor.org/ ) links public and private science and technology assets in the Tennessee Valley to serve regional economic development.Event DetailsWhen:Tuesday, February 16, 0830-1000, followed by networkingWhere:U.S. Space and Rocket Center, Education and Training FacilityDirections:Adjacent to the Marriott hotel on the U.S. Space and Rocket Center CampusCost:Members/Sponsors: FreeNon-Members: $15Students (with ID): Free Plan to become a member or sponsor at the meeting and register for free now!JOIN NOW!!!

title: Feast On The Oxford County Cheese Tour Feb 29th
description: HAVE YOU CURD?Meet Oxford County's award-winning cheese producers (including the oldest running cheddar factory in Ontario). Learn how each producer makes their unique cheeses, hear about suggested pairings and of course, SAMPLE SAMPLE SAMPLE! The full day will start with a hearty breakfast from Sanagan's Meat Locker before boarding a bus to Oxford County. Here's the itinerary: 9:00AM - Meet at Sanagan's in Kensington Market for breakfast. Parking at the Green P at 35 Bellevue Ave. 9:30AM - Bus departs from Green P heading to Woodstock. 11:15AM - Pick up for chefs not in the GTA - Exit 250 in Drumbo (parking is available at the gas station).11:30AM - Stop at Bright Cheese & Butter 12:30PM - Stop at Gunn's Hill 1:30PM - Lunch at SixThirtyNine 2:15PM - Cheese tasting with Local Dairy and Mountainoak Cheese + special pairings with Oxford tastes. 3:30PM - Depart for Toronto There will be plenty of time to chat with the cheese producers, your fellow Feast ON chefs and some of our awesome Preferred Purveyors.  Bonus: You'll take home plenty of Oxford County cheese and some other treats from the region to share with your staff!Email: julia@ontarioculinary.com for more information.

title: CHINA NOW: Selections from Cinema on the Edge
description: Premiering groundbreaking animations and experimental cinema from across the mainland. Just in time for Chinese New Year, TYPOLOGY is proud to announce our support for CHINA NOW: Independent Visions, in the form of two exciting film screenings we’ll host in Small World Music Centre’s theatre space at Artscape Youngplace this spring!Organized by Toronto-based curator and critic Shelly Kraicer, LA-based producer Karin Chien*, and Chicago-based filmmaker JP Sniadecki, CHINA NOW is the touring arm of Cinema on the Edge, a program of 29 experimental films representing the best of the Beijing Independent Film Festival from 2012-14. Launched to wide acclaim in New York last summer, Cinema on the Edge will debut in Toronto this March with a monthlong program of eight documentaries hosted by TIFF Cinematheque, under the series title The Crisis of the Real: New Chinese Independent Documentaries.Following fast on TIFF's heels, TYPOLOGY will present our own selection from the original series: three groundbreaking animations and one experimental feature which comprise an eye- and ear-opening program of independent contemporary cinema from across China. Featuring filmmakers from Shenyang in the north to Guangzhou in the south, and Tibet in the west to Taiwan in the east, this selection bespeaks volumes on the vastness of space, time scales, and cultural difference experienced by these artists, who must find their voices in a country where censorship remains the order of the day.…And now for the program:CHINA NOW | Selections from Cinema on the Edge, presented by TYPOLOGYThe Animations (3 films, approx 1 hour total screening time)THE HUNTER AND THE SKELETON, 2012 | Dir. BAI BIN | 26 minThis splendid animation of an Eastern Tibetan folk tale is a visually inventive mash-up of traditional Tibetan thangka painting techniques and 80s video arcade game aesthetics. Rendered in Flash with a score that blends native Tibetan music and contemporary sounds, it is an audiovisual delight that goes much deeper — a riveting adventure story with an allegorical twist.FAMILY REUNION, 2012 | Dir. CHEN LI-HUA | 18 minA-mei, an indigenous Taiwanese woman working long hours in a fish processing plant, is called home for the Harvest Festival, but her boss refuses to let her go. Chen’s imaginatively drawn tale is artfully rendered in stop motion style — a moving family portrait with a quirky, storybook feel that has universal appeal.PERFECT CONJUGAL BLISS, 2014 | Dir. ZHONG SU | 5.5 minSurreal and playful, this lusciously rendered animation streams across the screen like a magical river of plenty or a fantastical living scroll emerging and transforming out of the wreckage of a virtual wasteland. Accumulating a hallucinatory visual force which recalls the explosive ending to Antonioni’s Zabriskie Point, Perfect Conjugal Bliss deeply satisfies the eyes even as it questions the origins and implications of humanity’s insatiable desires.The Feature Film (approx 1 hour screening time)YUMEN, 2013 | Dir. HUANG XIANG, JP SNIADECKI, XU RUOTAO | 65 minThis collaboration between two Chinese avant-garde artists and an American experimental filmmaker is a visually stunning ficto-documentary aptly described by curator Shelly Kraicer as a celluloid psycho-collage. Shot on 16mm film, it’s set in the largely abandoned oil town of Yumen in China’s Gansu province near Mongolia. Moving between a barren yet starkly beautiful landscape and what’s left of a city torn by economic collapse and decay, signs of life (or afterlife?) in the form of nameless, wandering characters (ghosts?) perform impromptu, absurd, poignant, or poetic actions and interventions to the sounds of 70s Taiwan pop, contemporary Korean girl bands, and much more. A meditation on survival, this follow-up to Sniadecki’s 2012 film, People’s Park, is an altogether different take on life in contemporary China. Made with the support of Harvard University’s Sensory Ethnography Lab. 16mm-to-digital, in Mandarin Chinese and Gansu dialect with English subtitles."Fusing documentary and staged scenes in a manner reminiscent of Godard from the 1970s onward, Yumen brings dignity and beauty to a place that lies in near ruins, and was the finest piece of cinematic portraiture I witnessed at this year’s Berlinale."— Travis Jeppesen, Artforum"When a film like this articulates its setting… a once oil-rich beacon of production in the northwest Gansu province that has since been nearly abandoned — one realizes how few films understand how to create a vivid sense of place…. The monstrous, pulsating rhythm of drilling, the contrastive contours of the landscape, and the lonely group of buildings contained therein. The sound design brings forth a new layer of varying ironies and heartbreak — the very fabric of a broken space."— Adam Cook, MubiSniadecki will be in Toronto to introduce his masterful 2012 film, People’s Park, as part of TIFF’s lineup of documentary films from CHINA NOW. Go see it and meet him on March 15 at TIFF, then come watch Yumen, his follow-up to People’s Park, with us!…SCREENING DETAILSThere will be one evening screening  and one daytime screening, each beginning with a brief introduction and closing with a short Q+A:Wednesday, March 30 from 7–9 pm (animations from 7–8, feature from 8–9 + Q&A)Sunday, April 3 from 1–3 pm (animations from 1–2 + kids' Q&A, feature from 2–3)Space is limited; advance ticket purchase recommended — plus save up to $3 per ticket purchased in advance! Advance tickets are available for the full program or each half separately (animations or feature) as follows:$12 for the full program$8 for just the animations (bring the kids! suggested age 5+ / 3 shorts / approx 1hr)or just the feature film (bring the film buff! experimental documentary / approx 1 hr)Limited tickets will be available at the door for $15/full program or $10/half program40% of every ticket sold will go to the featured filmmakers in China.For more information on the films, the filmmakers, and the organizers, visit  www.typology.ca/exhibition/china-now…*Incidentally, Karin Chien is also the producer of UNTITLED (STRUCTURES), 2012 by Leslie Hewitt in collaboration with cinematographer Bradford Young, currently on view as part of the exhibition Collective Stance at The Power Plant through May 15.

title: Ice Addiction Tournament - Blue Mesa
description: Welcome to the 2016 Ice Addiction Tournament Series  brought to you by Tightline Outdoors.  Come fish one of our epic ice fishing tournaments in this series or fish them all!  The single heaviest fish in these events takes home up to $3,000 CASH!  In addition, there will be prize payouts up to 10th place or more!  This is a safe, family friendly, fair and fun event.  No augers are needed!  With a pre-drilled course, you choose your spot and get out your gear.  Show off your skills against up to 1,000 other ice fisherman!  Random prize giveaways during the event and don't miss out on the Mr. Heater Hot Spot with fresh, hot coffee and world know Johnson's Corner hot cinnamon rolls! (No ice shelters allowed)Fisherman check-in will begin at 5am the day of the event.  Pre-drilled holes are first come, first served. Please review the rules and information sheet at www.tightlineoutdoors.com for this event to answer further questions. We can't wait to see you on the ice, and hand you that $3,000!

title: Akshongay
description: AKSHONGAYNova DanceChoreography by Nova Bhattacharya and Louis Laberge-Côté February 10-13, 2016  |  8pmCreated and performed by two bright lights on the Toronto dance scene, Nova Bhattacharya & Louis Laberge-Côté, Akshongay is a compelling and intimate duet offering a profound experience of love, loss, separation and connection.  Nominated for 4 Dora Mavor Moore Awards (Choreography, performance, lighting and sound design), Akshongay is a contemporary dance that brings together multiple influences; bharatanatyam, modern dance; Hindu mythology, French Canadian folklore; love and loss; togetherness and separation; regrets and passions; joy and heartbreak. Intimate, rich with powerful images, a hybrid physical vocabulary and theatrical sensibility combine to create a hypnotic journey. More information: colemanlemieux.com/akshongayChoreography:Nova Bhattacharya Louis Laberge-Côté Music:Phil StrongPerformance:Nova Bhattacharya Louis Laberge-Côté Lighting Design:Marc Parent

title: Tour de Hives to Celebrate Earth Day
description: Celebrate Earth Day by getting up close and personal with some of our tiniest environmental heroes!Sarah Red-Laird, beekeeper and director of the Bee Girl organization, will be giving a guided tour of live bee hives at SOU’s Center for Sustainability on April 23rd.Take a look inside the secret life of bees: find the queen, see what “baby” bees eat, look at nectar before it becomes honey, and of course taste some fresh “liquid gold”.These no-cost hives tours are at 11am, 12pm, and 1pm, and are limited to 10 people.We have suits, veils, and gloves for both kids and adults. You must register to participate. The tour will be about 30 minutes, and you will be provided with all of the protective equipment to keep you safe and comfortable.  More details and exact location of the  hives will be given upon registration.

title: Season Ticket
description: Season Tickets get the holder into every one of Albion Pros 9 scheduled home games and first priority to playoff tickets.

title: The Odd Couple
description: It’s Summer, 1965 and a group of “the guys” meet for their weekly poker game in the NYC West Side apartment of divorced sportswriter Oscar Madison. If the mess is any indication, it’s no wonder that his wife left him. Late to arrive is Felix Unger who has just been thrown out by his wife. Felix appears to be at the end of his rope, but as the action unfolds Oscar goes off the deep end too, when the clean-freak and the slob room together in this classic American comedy. (PG, Classic Comedy)

title: Vegan Supper Club: {Gluten Free} Breakfast in Bed
description: {Gluten Free} Breakfast in BedA Special Valentine's Day Dinner Pairing with Sloane Fine Tea MerchantsA dozen roses? Sure. A box of chocolate? Great. But make no mistake, nothing is quite as nice as a scratch-made  breakfast in bed... So we've put together a special breakfast themed dinner menu featuring a tea pairings with Sloane Tea, a beautifully packaged Toronto-based merchant that sources and blends teas certified by sommeliers.And just in case chocolate or take home tea is something you'd fancy for Valentine's Day, we're including a $10 gift card* for Urban Acorn Market  for each guest, which can be used towards our many vegan products in-store or another supper club.MenuAmuse Bouche: Buckwheat Flake Crusted Chia Bread French Toast served with Banana Pastry Cream, Hazelnut Spread and Organic Raspberries Paired with... Sloane Fine Tea Merchant's Darjeeling 2nd FlushIntroduction Course: Cardamum & Anise Toasted Oatmeal Fritters served with Purple Cabbage-Lemongrass Velouté and Saffron Poached Pears Paired with... Sloane Fine Tea Merchant's Perfectly PearSecond Course: Hickory Smoked Morel & Basil Quiche served with Cilantro-Avocado Creme and Heirloom Tomato Concassé Paired with... Sloane Fine Tea Merchant's Oolong CremeMain Course: Faux-ched Eggs Florentine served with a Roasted Garlic and Potato Waffle, Charred “Bacon” Asparagus and Creamed Spinach Paired with... Sloane Fine Tea Merchant's Jasmine Jade PearlDessert:  House-made Strawberry Jam Pop Tart with Lavender-Earl Grey Glaze and Graviola Aquafaba and a Chocolate Dipped Organic Strawberry Paired with... Sloane Fine Tea Merchant's Heavenly CreamCoffee, tea, sparkling and flat water included.The event begins at 7pm and dinner will start at 7:20pm or when most of the guests have arrived.No alcohol will be served onsite; if you choose to bring wine/beer, don't drink and drive.NOTE: Due to the nature of these events modifications for allergies are not always possible. If you have an allergy please contact us before purchasing a ticket to discuss. Thank you{About Vegan Supper Clubs}We host a monthly themed Vegan Supper Club in our second level loft kitchen.What's a Supper Club you ask? Think of it as an informal dinner party meant to encourage guests to mingle, share and celebrate food. Events are 19+, complimentary sparkling and flat water will be provided. Here's a sneak peak of what to expect or check out our Supper Club Gallery.Are they always Vegan? Yes. We want people to feel included in the discussion around food, culture and the arts and feel making these events vegan will allow more guests to participate. We also do special Gluten-Free editions a few times a year.{About Urban Acorn LTD.}Just like an idea, acorns begin small with the hopes of becoming something big, strong and meaningful. This was the initial push behind Urban Acorn LTD. a Flexiatarian Catering company founded by Chef Daniel Holloway and his parntner Marie Fitrion.Inspired by art, music, and using food as a dialogue for social change, Urban Acorn wants to encourage people to broaden their understanding of food and each other with the hopes of building stronger communities.Their mostly plant-based 'Flexitarian' approach to cuisine, allows them to seemlessly create menus to both omnivores and vegans. Their philosophy is simple, they believe food should unite, not divide people

title: WedTech Summit Maui 16
description:
WedTech Summit Maui '16The silicon meets the sand at WedTech Summit (WTS) Maui in February.Join us at the Royal Lahaina Resort on Feb 22 – 23, 2016, where we network, explore, and share about technology driving the $300B wedding industry ($905m in Hawaii).Over 400 wedding professionals, hospitality companies, investors, and businesses will convene in the wedding paradise of the Pacific.Reasons to Attend WedTech Summit?
Two days of action packed panels, hands on workshops, and networking at the stunning Royal Lahaina Resort
Inspir-action! Trends, tricks and tools to run a better business, and power networking with future partners, investors and journalists.
Takeaways Include — Practical lessons for brands, startups and businesses, growing community through creative, authentic, amplification tactics, and showcasing futurists inventing the technology pivoting the wedding market.

Full Agenda with Speakers below:

title: Tech Step | Web and Digital Marketing Analytics
description:
TechStep is a beginner-friendly hands-on workshop that explores practical topics at the intersection of technology and entrepreneurship. We cover technical subjects that small business owners, freelancers, designers and new developers need to know!Bring your laptop and get ready to roll up your sleeves! Our speaker, Amanda Thomas, will incorporate exercises and hands-on activities throughout her talk. You’ll walk away from TechStep  with tangible skills  you can apply to your business, your project or your career.TechStep is open to all backgrounds and skill sets. It is a safe, supportive space to explore technology and entrepreneurship. Gentlemen Geeks are welcome too! We encourage men to bring a female friend, but if you want to come by yourself, you’re more than welcome. We ask that you respect the women in our community by being supportive and friendly.
 
- Meet Brooke Boser, Founder / CEO of LTIA Consulting Inc -
As an experienced entrepreneur and Freelancer, Brooke knows the importance of getting to know who you are working with and why they do what they do. Her company, LTIA Consulting, embodies what she hopes to achieve in both her personal and professional life. The Letters LTIA stand for “Live To Inspire Action”, which is a reminder to inspire others and also to take action so they can move from point A to point B. As Founder/CEO and Web & Digital Marketing Analytics Specialist at LTIA Consulting, Brooke is passionate about web and digital marketing, and its influence on consumer decision-making. The internet has become the first (second, third, fourth) touch point between companies and consumers. Her work is to help businesses and entrepreneurs make the most of this touch point.https://www.linkedin.com/in/brookeboser - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -Topic: Web and Digital Marketing AnalyticsWe will go more in detail on exercises, the benefits of web analytics for your start up and more! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -*We use an inclusive definition of 'women', encouraging the participation of diverse identities traditionally underrepresented in technology.

title: A Streetcar Named Desire
description: In the classic play by Tennessee Williams, faded Southern belle Blanche DuBois comes to visit her pregnant sister, Stella, in a seedy section of New Orleans. Stella's boorish husband, Stanley Kowalski, not only regards Blanche's aristocratic affectations as a royal pain but also thinks she's holding out on inheritance money that rightfully belongs to Stella. On the fringes of sanity, Blanche is trying to forget her checkered past and start life anew. Attracted to Stanley's friend Mitch, she glosses over the less savory incidents in her past, but she soon discovers that she cannot outrun that past, and the stage is set for her final, brutal confrontation with her brother-in-law. (PG-13 Classic Drama)

title: Steel Magnolias
description: Beloved Dramatic Comedy.Grab your girlfriends (and tissues) to see this much beloved story unfold at Giving Tree! A group of Louisiana women bond and gossip at a local beauty shop while following the marriage and motherhood of one of the customer's daughters. Robert Harling's play made its 2005 Broadway debut after a 1987 off-Broadway premiere and successful 1989 film. Not to be missed, we are sure you'll laugh, cry, and love every minute of it. (PG, Heartfelt Comedy)

title: Salsation Workshop mit Vladimir Gerónimo Dresden
description:
SALSATION is a dance workout that converts functional training protocols into innovative dance moves. The word “Salsation” stems from: 
   SALSA:   NOT from the rhythm / musical gender but from the spanish  
word  “SALSA” that actually means  "SAUCE”, because it is a SPICY mix of
   different rhythms, cultures, dances and fitness protocols. SENSATION: the program has a strong focus on musicality, lyrical expression as well as on how the human body functions. Why Salsation?
   What makes Salsation unique is that it is carefully designed to   
integrate functional body movements into all dance routines working out 
  in a 3D fashion and using all planes of motion.  It’s not only easy 
and   fun but you can do it to improve your mobility and stamina no 
matter   your age.

title: Borrowed Time
description:
"Borrowed Time" - An immersive evening of magic with one of the most unique close-up artists in the world. For the first time, since starring in his critically acclaimed two-man show "Nothing to Hide", Helder Guimarães is debuting a limited engagement magic experience unlike anything that's been seen before. Merging art, theater and Helder's sleight-of hand virtuosity, "Borrowed Time" promises to transport its very intimate audience to a space where anything is possible and magic is real. The event will be held at a SECRET LOCATION. The address will be e-mailed to you on the day of your show. 
IDs will not be required, but you must be at least 16 years of age to attend.
Doors open 20 minutes BEFORE show time and close promptly AT show time. No ticketed guests will be allowed once doors have closed. Ticket purchase price will not be refunded if you are late to the event. Please plan to arrive early.
All ticket sales are final. Tickets will not be refunded or transferred to another date and time. 
Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns at: borrowedtimela@gmail.com

title: Ordinary Days
description: Big City Life, Love & MusicGiving Tree's first musical is an adorable story of four New Yorkers whose lives intersect as they search for fulfillment, happiness, and love! From one of musical theatre's most exciting new composers comes ORDINARY DAYS, a refreshingly honest and funny musical about making real connections in the city that never sleeps (but probably should at some point.) Through a score of vibrant and memorable songs, their experiences ring startlingly true to life. With equal doses of humor and poignancy, it celebrates how 8.3 million individual stories combine in unexpected ways to make New York City such a unique and extraordinary home. (PG-13 for periodically sung adult language, Musical Comedy)

title: Groundhog Day
description: To truly honour the spirit of Groundhog Day, a single $10 ticket will be valid FOR BOTH SCREENINGS, so you can buy one admission and watch Groundhog Day over and over again (well, twice, really...) on Tuesday February 2!"Groundhog Day. The perfect comedy, forever" – Ryan Gilbey, The GuardianBill Murray called it 'probably the best work I've done' and, 20 years after its release, Groundhog Day can still take your breath away. This early '90s classic has made it on to many filmmakers' own "all-time top 10" lists, and it's certainly on ours! Here at The Royal, we want to celebrate Groundhog Day the way it deserves to be celebrated! With multiple screenings of Groundhog Day!

title: A River Transformed:Singapore River and Marina Bay
description: This event is brought to you by The Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA).The Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) is Singapore's national land use planning and conservation agency. URA's mission is "to make Singapore a great city to live, work and play". We strive to create a vibrant and sustainable city of distinction by planning and facilitating Singapore's physical development in partnership with the community. As the main land sales agent for the State, our multifaceted engagement strategy includes the sale of State land to attract and channel private capital investment to develop sites for meeting our land use needs. As the place manager for Marina Bay, we promote exciting activities within Marina Bay in collaboration with other government agencies and private stakeholders. To create an exciting cityscape, URA also actively promotes architecture and urban design excellence. For more information, please visit us at www.ura.gov.sg.

Open Circuit Dining: A 12-Course Pop-Up Experience **Location will be distributed in the confirmation email** 

 DINE DIFFERENTLY
From the moment you enter the secret location of your Open Circuit experience, you'll understand that this is not your typical dinner. Crack open some BYOB beverages and interact with the chef as he creates your 12-course tasting menu from scratch.


YOUR CHEF, SERVER, AND HOST
Chef Jacob Demars brings together farm-to-table ingredients and sensibilities with fine-dining techniques, resulting in vibrantly colorful platings of dishes that look as good as they taste.

title: The Social Collective & COC The Marriage of Figaro
description: Join The Social Collective for a night of visual and musical extravaganza at the opera, in collaboration with the Canadian Opera Company!  We are very pleased to invite you to the COC's Ensemble Studio performance of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's 'The Marriage of Figaro' on Monday, February 22nd, at 7:30pm at the Four Seasons Centre for the Performing Arts (145 Queen Street West).  The event will be preceded at 6:45pm by photographer Veronika Roux-Vlachova introducing her current exhibition, 'Opera: Faces and Words'.Opera: Faces and WordsUsing photography, Veronica Roux-Vlachova aims to bring forth another aspect of opera by working with dual elements which create stillness within the traditional performing art form: portraits and words.  Presenting portraits of opera singers alongside their selected operatic pieces presents each as a performer and as a person, adding an elevated dimension to the experience.We hope you can join us for an unforgettable evening with the COC along with fellow art and culture enthusiasts.TSC TeamThe Social Collective is brought to you by Bazaar Marketing & Communications Inc.

title: 2nd Annual Orlando City Pub Crawl
description:
3 Drinks, Concert Entry & Match Ticket = Only $25 (advance ticket)*If we learned anything in our inaugural season, it’s that City fans know how to party. Well then, what’s the best way to kick off our 2nd season… the Orlando City Pub Crawl in Downtown Orlando! Put on your purple and head downtown for the Orlando City Pub Crawl featuring the official City Pubs: Wall Street Plaza, Elixir and Harry Buffalo. You will get 3 drinks and a live concert with Ballyhoo! To top it off, each participant will receive one ticket to our opening match on Sunday, March 6th. The Orlando City Pub Crawl is sponsored by Heineken and hosted by Orlando City SC and Orlando Pub Crawl.With your ticket you’ll receive the following:
Admission to all Pub Crawl venues
1 ticket to Orlando City’s opening MLS match on Sunday, March 6th at 2 pm at the Orlando Citrus Bowl (FAQ)
3 complimentary drinks: Heineken, Finlandia Vodka or Barefoot Wine
Drinks Specials include $3 Heineken Bottles $4 Heineken Drafts $4 Barefoot wine and $4 Finlandia Vodka cocktails
Live concert with Ballyhoo!
Venues & Schedule:
3-4:30 pm – Harry Buffalo Street Party including surrounding venues on Church Street
4:30-6 pm – Elixir Street Party
6-7:30 pm – Wall Street Plaza Street Party
7:30 pm – After party and live concert at Wall Street with Ballyhoo!
Check-in will be available at each venue during the times listed above.*Pricing Structure:
$25.00 on or before February 26th
$30.00 between February 27th and March 4th
$35.00 the day of the event
Online payment is non-refundable, non-transferable and you must present your ticket (printed or display bar-code on smartphone) to check-in for the event and receive your drink tickets and match voucher.21 and up only. Must present valid ID to participate on the day of the event.Tweet us: @orlandocityscJoin the Conversation: #citypubcrawlPlease drink responsibly. Always designate a driver.Game Tickets & Additional Game Tickets: Each participant will receive one ticket to the opening match on Sunday, March 6th at 2 pm at the Orlando Citrus Bowl as part of this package. All ticket vouchers will be distributed exclusively as a part of the registration process at the Pub Crawl on March 5. If you do not register on the day of the Pub Crawl, you will not receive your voucher(s). Once you complete the registration process, you will have the ability to purchase additional ticket vouchers at a discounted price of $20. The purchase link will be included in your confirmation email.For FAQs regarding your ticket voucher(s) for the opening match visit www.orlandocitysc.com/voucherFAQ. For more information about Orlando City Soccer Club season tickets and schedules visit www.OrlandoCitySC.com.

title: 2nd Annual Purple Pride 5K
description: Online registration is now closed. You CAN still register for the Purple Pride 5K on race day at Lake Eola from 4-6 p.m. for $35. A ticket voucher for City's home opener will still be included with your registration.Join thousands of Orlando City fans for the Purple Pride 5K, as we run through downtown Orlando and show off our purple pride. This officially timed 5K race features all of the Orlando City game day festivities including confetti, tailgate games, inflatables, food trucks and beer! Also, each runner will receive a t-shirt and one ticket voucher for City’s opening match on March 6th.Each runner (ages 21 and over) will receive a drink coupon good for 1 beer at the Heineken beer garden located in the post-race celebration area. In addition, the post-race celebration will include complimentary runner refreshments, food trucks with food for sale, and interactive games and activities for the entire family.The Purple Pride 5K is sponsored by Sherwin-Williams, Environmental Painting Alternatives, Orlando Health, Publix and Academy Sports + Outdoors. For more information about Orlando City Soccer Club season tickets and schedules visit www.OrlandoCitySC.com.GENERAL INFORMATION Thursday, March 3rd, 2016 – Race Start 6:45 p.m.  Location: Lake Eola Park                512 E Washington St. (corner of Eola and Washington)                Orlando, FL 32801Purple Pride 5K - Each entry includes 1 ticket to the opening match on Sunday, March 6 at 2 pm vs. Real Salt Lake All registrations through 2/7 are $30Registrations 2/8 through 2/26 are $32Registrations 2/27 through 3/1 are $35All registrations are $35 at Packet Pick-up on March 2 and 3 and on Race DayRace Day registration is available at Lake Eola from 4-6 p.m. Entry fee and any additional match tickets purchased are non-refundable and non-transferable.Course MapGame Tickets & Additional Game Tickets Each runner will receive a voucher good for one ticket to the opening match on Sunday, March 6th at 2 pm at the Orlando Citrus Bowl as part of this package. All vouchers will be distributed exclusively as a part of the Packet Pick-Up process. If you do not pick up your packet, you will not receive your voucher(s). Once you complete the registration process, you will have the ability to purchase additional ticket vouchers at a discounted price of $20. The purchase link will be included in your confirmation email.   For FAQs regarding your ticket voucher(s) for the opening match visit www.orlandocitysc.com/voucherFAQ. Packet Pick-Up Information & PoliciesIn addition to race day, there will be a minimum of 2 additional days and locations of pack pick-up for your convenience. Those details are TBD and will be updated as soon as they are finalized. You must present a form of government issued photo ID in order to pick up your packet. The only exception to this will be parents picking up packets for their children, however the parent will still need to present a photo ID.You may pick up a packet for a friend, family member or co-worker, however you must present a written note (email or in handwriting) that indicates you have that permission AND a photocopy of that person’s government issued photo ID.Packet pick-up may not be available at certain locations, depending on when you register for the race. Here are all the details:If you registered online before 12:00 pm on Sunday, February 28 – You can pick up your packet any of the days and times listed below.If you register online between 12:01 pm on Sunday, February 28 and 12:00 pm on Monday, February 29 – Your packet will be available starting Tuesday, March 1 at Academy Sports + Outdoors KissimmeeIf you registered online before 12:00 pm on Monday, February 29 and 12:00 pm on Tuesday, March 1 – Your packet will be available starting Wednesday, March 2 at Academy Sports + Outdoors Lake Mary.If you register online between 12:01 pm and 11:59 pm on Tuesday, March 1 – Your packet will be available to be picked up on race day, Thursday, March 3 at Lake Eola.Packet Pick-Up Dates & LocationsMonday, February 295 - 7 pm, Wall Street Plaza (Sideshow)*Happy hour drink prices and half-off select appetizersTuesday, March 111 am - 2 pm, Academy Sports + Outdoors, Kissimmee (621 Centerview Blvd, Kissimmee, FL 34741)5-8 pm, Academy Sports + Outdoors, Waterford Lakes (11955 E Colonial Dr, Orlando, FL 32826)Wednesday, March 211 am - 2 pm, Academy Sports + Outdoors, Lake Mary (3641 Lake Emma Rd, Lake Mary, FL 32746)Thursday, March 34-6 pm, Lake Eola East Lawn (corner of E. Washington St. and N. Eola Dr.)Day of Event Schedule 4:00-6:00pm – Registration & Packet Pick-up Open 6:45pm – 5K Race Start 6:45-9:00pm - Post-Race Party 7:45pm (approx.) - Awards CeremonyT-ShirtsThe first 2,000 registered runners will receive a race t-shirt. (sizes not guaranteed) More than 2,000 runners have registered, shirts are no longer available.Awards Top 3 Overall Male & Female Winners receive gift cards from Publix, with $250 for first, $150 for second and $100 for first, along with other prizes. In addition, top 3 male and female age group winners will receive gift cards from Academy Sports + Outdoors. Age groups include 14 & under, 15-19, 20-24, 25-29, 30-34, 35-39, 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69, 70 & over.Timing & Scoring Race will be timed and scored with a disposable chip provided, which will be attached to the back of the bib.GENERAL EVENT FAQ How long is the course? The 5K is 3.1 miles.How will I be timed?  The race uses an electronic timing system that records race time and place via a transponder chip that will be given out at registration. Each individual competing in the 5K is required to use the race chip. Official times will not be recorded without a chip. There will be a clock at the finish line to view your time.When and where do I pick up my registration materials? See schedule above.Can I use my own race chip or tag rather than utilizing the one that is provided? No, every participant has an assigned bib and chip.Who gets a T-shirt? The first 2,000 pre-registered runners that successfully complete the registration and payment processes are guaranteed a free race t-shirt. (sizes not guaranteed)What if I need help along the way? Qualified emergency medical professionals are available to provide assistance at the start/finish lines.Can I participate in the event with my dog? Sorry, as much as we love our pets too, the safety of participants is our main concern. Therefore, we do not allow pets on the course.Can I participate with a stroller? Yes, nurturing future generations of runners is a priority and demonstrating healthy lifestyles to our kids is special. Please, however, start in the later part of the runners.What do I do with my personal items while I’m running? You can leave your items in your car or have a family member watch over your personal belongings.Should I bring my own water? Water will be provided on the race course as well as at the finish line. Where do I park? Arriving 1 hour early is strongly recommended due to traffic congestion. Area parking garages available, hourly rates may apply.For FAQs regarding your ticket voucher(s) for the inaugural match visit www.orlandocitysc.com/voucherFAQ.

title: Dry Diggings festival
description:
The Dry Diggings Festival is a music, camping and beer festival that will take place at the El Dorado Fairgrounds at the base of the beautiful Sierra Nevada mountain range just 45 miles east of Sacramento and 65 miles west of South Lake Tahoe. The idea behind the event was to create a festival where we could offer people a refuge where they could enjoy camping, music and some of the finest beers in the region.

Our inaugural year presented a top notch lineup, featuring The Dirty Heads, Tribal Seeds, Nahko and Medicine for The People, J Boog, Stick Figure and so many more. In our 2nd year we plan on bringing a bigger lineup and more activities. We will have 2 stages showcasing some of the best bands in the scene and a slightly different layout to the venue.

title: SIO Winter Warmup 2016
description: Celebrate the start of the New Year of the Monkey with the Sake Institute of Ontario (SIO)!  As we warm up your late January evening with winter-appropriate sake styles and food pairings, take part in typical Japanese celebratory and New Year customs, all in the grand setting of the Japanese Canadian Cultural Centre.  Experience a 'kagami-biraki' (a sake barrel breaking ceremony) and 'mochi tsuki' (traditional rice-cake pounding ceremony) while sipping premium sake offerings from our Member distributors & Toronto's Izumi brewery.  Hope you can join us for this popular event in our sake calendar, for these great activities & an awesome giveaway - we'll be drawing for 2 VIP Passes to Kampai Toronto 2016 coming up this spring!Kampai (Cheers!) & Happy New Year!#SIOWarmup2016 19+ Event. For more information on SIO, please visit www.sakeinstituteofontario.com.

title: Hustle Con
description: Hustle Con is a badass conference where the best non-technical founders (aka hustlers) teach how they got started and give practical advice on growing your startup. If you’ve heard of a hacker, well a hustler is its counterpart. Basically, it’s like a rock n’ roll version of TED, except not as hoity-toity. The catch? title: The Witch's Local Fresh Beer Festival
description: Celebrating our 5 year anniversary week we will be hosting a small Beer festival inside the DEN on this day. Broken up into 2 sessions (2-5pm) and (7-10pm) this event will feature 21 Florida breweries whom we invited to share this experience and day with. Each session has only 100 tickets for sale as we want it to be a fun beer gathering of friends celebrating our local fresh beer community. Each brewery will be featuring 2 rare selections and will be operating their tables for conversation. The brewery list will be below and the actual beer list will be added onto this event page as we move closer to the date. There are also brewery collaboration beers that will be tapped up at the main bar counter during each session featuring 5 one of a kind creations celebrating our 5 years. See the collaboration list in the comment thread. Tickets will be sold with a pre sale to folks who have access to the code on Sunday 1/10/16. Tickets are $55 + service fees & inclusive of entrance and access to all the beers, a Witch 5 year anniversary 16 ounce stemmed glass (this glass also gets you access to $3 beers for all taps during our 5 year anniversary celebration on thursday February 4th, as well as discounts on taps all through the year), a full BBQ den plate of food, a door entrance raffle ticket to win prizes from brewery donated items as well. Keynote industry speaker will be doing a small presentation as well during the sessions (name and topic to come along)This event is also a fundraiser for Tampa Bay Watch who daily works hard to maintain our local Tampa Bay waterway. Proceeds from ticket sales as well as a membership drive and a raffle will be during each session. Please stop by their table inside and see what they are doing here in our community. We are very honored to be working with them on this event !!list of participating breweries:Cigar City BrewingCigar City Cider and MeadJDub's Brewing Company & Tap RoomKeel & Curley WinerySt Petersburg Brewing CompanyCrooked Thumb BreweryPinellas Ale WorksOverflow Brewing CompanyArkane AleworksMotorworks BrewingTomoka Brewing CoRapp Brewing CompanyCoppertail Brewing CoTampa Bay Brewing CompanyPair O' Dice BrewingBarley Mow Brewing CompanyGreen Bench Brewing Co.7venth Sun BrewingAngry Chair BrewingFunky Buddha BreweryCycle BrewingCheers to 5 years of Fresh Beers !!!

title: 34th Annual Paso Robles Wine Festival
description: The 34th Annual Wine Festival kicks-off Thursday, May 19 with a selection of Winemaker Dinners. Following the seminar, more than 80 wineries come together in the Paso  Robles Downtown City Park to showcase their wines during the Grand Tasting.  Wineries at the Grand Tasting will be arranged by “regions” for a  seamless and focused tasting experience: Bordeaux-style, Rhône-style,  Zinfandel, Burgundian-style, Italian varieties and Other Wild Wines for  your tasting pleasure.LOCALS - enter your zip code in the "access key" field to unlock the hidden Locals Only Festival ticket. (Offer Expired March 15)  	Order your lunch in advance from one of the pre-packed Picnic Lunch options, complete with reusable Paso wine lunch bag! (Grand Tasting admission sold separately.) For a complete list of FAQ, visit http://www.pasowine.com/events/faq.php.

title: TEDxVCU 2016
description: Our community stands on the crux between the book-smart and street-smart, the medical prodigies and the boundary-pushing creatives. Richmond, once the capital of the Confederacy, is the now most liberal city in the state. A melting pot of ideas and stories. Our tattoos are plenty, our bikes are everywhere, and there’s always a festival going on. We may seem scary but that 300-pound bearded gentleman is an amateur opera singer and gives the warmest hugs ever. We never take no for an answer.Virginia Commonwealth University is at the center of this maelstrom of a mixup. We embody the future and study the past. We cause noise complaints and shush others during finals. TEDxVCU is meant to epitomize the spirit of VCU, the contrasts and shades of personalities of the varied people that inhabit our university. We aim to inspire through sharing innovative ideas with the entire community.TEDxVCU serves as a platform for going beyond boundaries. We go to class within walls, bolstered by our own borders between each other. The loneliness of focus begs for interruption, for fresh and new ideas, new horizons of creativity. TEDxVCU seeks to cause a collision of the old and new, bad and good, big and small, in order to reflect upon our communal identity and instill new connection from within and without.To juxtapose is to compare and contrast, to stare long and hard and to glance at in passing. For TEDxVCU this year we want to illustrate the differences and similarities in our community and how we can heal the rifts that break us apart and celebrate the ideas that bring us together. Join us on February 6, 2016 at the Academic Learning Commons.

title: Clarity: A Different Kind of Valentine's Event
description: EVERYONE DESERVES A HEALTHY LOVE RELATIONSHIPFounded by marriage and relationship therapist Dr. Isabell Springer, LovEd is an innovative love education company specializing in fun, interactive programs on love relationships. This Valentine’s weekend, LovEd will present its Clarity event on Saturday, February 13th, 2016 from 5:00p.m. to Midnight at The Wooly in Gainesville, Fl.CLARITYClarity is a different kind of social event designed to empower singles to make wise choices in love and encourage couples to enhance their love relationships.A FUN & INTERACTIVE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCEClarity is divided into three exciting parts:Discover: In the first hour, participants discover why we struggle with romantic relationships and with the use of a powerful, yet simple easy to use tool, we can finally create the satisfying, long-lasting relationships we deserve. Relate: Next, participants will apply their new knowledge in an exciting interactive activity. We create a safe, inclusive atmosphere to ensure everyone gets the most from their experience.Engage: Time to celebrate our new clarity! This three-hour social will allow everyone to connect with like-minded individuals while enjoying food, drinks and dancing. Participants also have a chance to win tons of raffle prizes while visiting 20 interactive stations presented by well-known Gainesville businesses. These GVL business owners will be using their wildest creativity to deliver a fun Valentine’s themed exhibit.  Attendees that engage with each sponsor exhibit will enter into a raffle for a chance to win that booth’s gift basket (valued at $100.00). After visiting each of the exhibits, attendees will anonymously nominate their “Most LovEd Business” and a traveling award will be given to the winner with the most votes.PEACEFUL PATHSDomestic Abuse Network has been the certified domestic violence center since 1974. Several years after the initial opening, the agency grew from operating a crisis hotline to a full-time emergency shelter. Today, Peaceful Paths has grown and expanded to include numerous outreach programs as well as providing residential services for victims and survivors of DV.

title: SwampCon V - February 13-14, 2016
description: SwampCon is a multi-genre convention for all ages hosted at the University of Florida and held in the Student Reitz Union. For four years, University of Florida students, representing several student organizations, organized the annual convention. SwampCon is a free convention featuring a combination of Anime, Gaming, and Sci-Fi themed events. This year, the fifth year, SwampCon and its staff will continue to provide exceptional entertainment for fans and first-time attendees alike.This year's theme is, to put it simply, love. Not a specific love, and not specifically Valentine's Day. We mean ALL kinds of love. Whether it be the love you hold for your family, for your friends, your significant other, or even love of yourself. SwampCon V invites you to join us in our two-day celebration of love in all its forms.Returning this year is the SwampCon Drag Show, Fanmade Vocaloid Hologram Concert, Miad Cafe, and many of our popular main events! We will also be bringing you brand new main events from talented people and organizations from all around! Vendors and Artists are once again welcome at SwampCon V! Check out our website for more information on renting a table and rules on selling your wares!First started in 2011 by the UF Delta Nu Delta Tabletop Gaming Club, Gator Anime Club and Science Fiction Consortium, SwampCon has tripled its attendance over the years. Every year, SwampCon strives to grow and evolve its programming to better provide a fun and enjoyable atmosphere for all of its attendees.Find out more at www.swampcon.org
