title: NYE @ The Wick: Whitney Day + Lauren Flax
description: We’re going underground to ring in 2016 at Brooklyn’s Music Fortress, The Wick.Color this original, brick warehouse canvas with your presence on NEW YEARS EVE, Thursday, December 31st, and we’ll bring the Beats, Babes, Bubbly & Beer.  A former Brewery, The Wick has stayed true it’s industrial roots in design, but has been completely transformed into one of Brooklyn’s top music venues.  Located right off Bushwick ave, a painted exterior covered in massive murals leads you inside the Wick, which spans the ground floor of an Mega music compound where recording studios, practice rooms, music magazines and other related companies are housed.  A truly unique location for a special night of the year.Soundtrack of the night by DJs Lauren Flax + Whitney DayLauren Flax,  a local superstar in Brooklyn.  The accomplished DJ, songwriter and producer, originally from Detroit, has been from Dubai to Berlin, Paris, London and beyond for a myriad of notable gigs.  At home, she can be found spinning the best parties and venues in NYC like Output, Cielo, Le Bain, Good Room, Bossa Nova Civic Club, and Union Pool.  As a multi-dimensional artist, she’s composed scores for Television & film, produced tracks for both major mainstream and underground players such as Sia, Kim Ann Foxman and Marc Kinchen and has a dozen and a half official remixes under her belt.  She’s also one-half of the noteworthy Brooklyn-based electronic project CREEP. Whitney Day, a fixture in the NYC LGBTQ nightlife scene as both a DJ and event producer.  Her resume is stacked with coveted gigs and major event productions at local legendary venues like Cielo, Marquee, Madison Square Garden, Highline Ballroom, PH-D and Pacha.  Her annual Pride parties, which attract thousands of people each June are infamous in NYC. On the DJ front, Whitney travels often for gigs that span the globe; from Sweden to Germany, Austria, Canada, Australia, and within the US, Los Angeles, Boston, D.C., Miami and more.  Whether it’s an underground Brooklyn warehouse, an international music festival, a tropical circuit party or a celebrity studded benefit, it's her infectious passion for mixing music and performing on- the-fly sets that keeps the vibe fresh and energetic every time. Outdoor / Smokers Patio60 Beers on TapLimited Advance Tickets: $20Coat Check $2 / item21+ w/ ID

title: ProductCon 2016 Conference & Hackathon
description:
ProductCon: Silicon Valley's largest tech product management conference.Join 1,200+ Product Managers and Product Developers at ProductCon 2016 July 15-17 in San Mateo, CA.In a technology-driven world, “Product Management” touches every part of the business and technology lifecycle. ProductCon is the largest convergence of Product Managers, Product Developers, and Product Marketers. ProductCon has 3 tracks:1- The Product Manager Summit is where professional product managers learn best practices in product lifecycle management, tools, workflows, and product marketing skills.2- Product Developer Summit is where developers gain the product management skills to augment their programming skills such as product usability, testing, deployment, and code collaboration.3- The Product Hackathon is where teams build apps or product prototypes and compete for $50,000+ in cash and prizes.ProductCon Topics: 
What’s new with Agile product management
Crash course on usability testing
Managing troubleshooting & bug tracking
PM Tools: Project Management, Resource Allocation, Communication
Application Deployment & Continuous Integration
Evaluating Product / Market fit
Mobile App Marketplaces & Ecosystems

title: Dr. Jane Goodall: Journey from the Jungle
description: Join Dr. Jane Goodall as she takes you on a journey through the forests of Gombe where her groundbreaking research on chimpanzees helped her become a household name. Dr. Goodall first set foot in the forests of Tanzania in 1960, armed with little more than a notepad, a pair    of binoculars and a dream of living in Africa and observing wildlife.  Dr. Goodall will share tales from the moment she witnessed a chimpanzee make a tool to the moment she decided to leave the park in order to save the chimpanzees she cared for. Dr. Goodall’s talks never fail to inspire people of all ages, from all walks of life, as she offers wisdomgleaned from her scientific breakthroughs coupled with hope for the future through her dedication to youth-led action for sustainable change.All proceeds support the Jane Goodall Institute of Canada’s conservation, humanitarian and youthengagement programs.Doors open at 6:30 pm.

title: FORGE: Arts & Business Management Workshop
description: FORGE: Arts & Business ManagementJanuary 14, 6:30- 9:00pm.Committee Room 2, Toronto City Hall- 100 Queen Street WestIn this workshop, Ben Benedict (Benedict Creative Communications) will provide guidance on art career management and operating a small business. Topics for discussion will include effective marketing, sourcing private and public funding, exhibition opportunities, proper artist fee payments, effective tax and bookkeeping methods and professionally documenting your artwork and accomplishments. Following the presentation, there will be a Q&A and group discussion.The session will be divided into the following sections:Artist Marketing and Publicity (Print, Social media, online, networking)Exhibition Opportunities (OAAG, Artist Run Centres, Venues, Commercial Galleries)Getting Paid/Funding  (CARFAC Fees, Copyright, Grant applications)Business Structure & Bookkeeping (Income Tax, Federal/Provincial Sales Tax, Insurance, Bookkeeping)Curriculum Vitae (Documenting your artwork and career).Tickets: $10 (To cover presenter fee)Bio: Ben Benedict of Benedict Creative Communications is recognized as one of Ontario’s leading culture workers as a writer/editor; visual artists/curator; public relations and corporate communications professional and educator; and a sought out public speaker on The Business of the Arts, with the most recent presentation being Marketing 2.0 as part of a CARFAC: Webinar Series for Visual Artists across Canada in October 2014

title: Richmond Station hosts Chef Gabrielle Hamilton
description: Sunday January 17th the Stratford Chefs School is presenting a culinary collaboration not to be missed. For one night only, renowned Chef, Author and 2015|16 Stratford Chefs School Joseph Hoare Gastronomic Writer in Residence Gabrielle Hamilton will take over the kitchen of Richmond Station. Working alongside co-owners Carl Heinrich ('05), Ryan Donovan ('05) and team, Chef Hamilton will present a mouthwatering four-course meal. Canapé and aparetif upon arrival. MENU | to be complimented by Southbrook Vineyards wine pairings Fried Egg, Toast, Calabrian Chili Butter and Shaved Bottarga - 2015 Southbrook Orange WineBraised Lamb Shoulder with Lemons, Tomatoes and Cinnamon - 2007 Southbrook Poetica Cabernet MerlotShaved Celery Salad with Radishes, Fennel and Valdeon - Southbrook The Anniversary [fortified]Frozen Milk Punch and Sesame Biscuits - 2006 Southbrook Vidal IcewineChef Hamilton is the chef-owner of Prune restaurant in New York's East Village and was named Best Chef NYC by the James Beard Foundation in 2011. Her work has appeared in The New Yorker, The New York Times, GQ, and Bon Appetite among other publications. Most notably, Chef Hamilton authored the 2011 best-selling memoir Blood, Bones and Butter and released her first cookbook, Prune, in November 2014. Richmond Station opened in 2012 and was a huge success from the start. "Committed to delicious food and excellent hospitality", Heinrich and Donovan have honed a team who appreciate quality local ingredients and thoughtfully crafted dishes. Books will be available for sale and signing.

title: Ivey ACE Conference - The Art of Entrepreneurship
description: The Ivey ACE Conference is a yearly event held with the purpose of uniting interdisciplinary learning with entrepreneurship and business. In 2016, the fifth annual Ivey ACE Conference will be themed “The Art of Entrepreneurship.” Focused on uniting students from interdisciplinary backgrounds, the 2016 conference will be a platform for entrepreneurial growth in all facets. Featuring a keynote address, followed by workshop breakouts, delegates will spend the morning hearing from successful entrepreneurs. With a focus on making connections, the latter half of the conference is centred around networking, and the first annual interactive environment for delegates. This year’s conference “The Art of Entrepreneurship” focuses specifically on a global approach to entrepreneurship, encompassing various facets of business. We hope the theme of the conference will inspire students from all academic backgrounds to learn from industry professionals and peers, while working in the beautiful space provided by Ivey.

title: Salon West Fall Season at the Spoke Club
description: December 7, "Governance in the Arts: Who's running the show?" with TSO President and CEO Jeff Melanson and Capital Canada President and CEO Robert Foster  Many arts organizations are governed by boards, but just what does that mean? Who should be on these boards? Who should win in the internal board battles of art versus the bottom line? We'll ask these questions and more. Don't worry there will be delicious food and drink to make sure that this  discussion will be palatable.

title: Hotel Transylvania 2
description: Anybody else missing Halloween? Then come join us for Hotel Transylvania 2 with Dracula, the Wolfman and many more of our favourite spooky characters in our Kids Matinee this month!Years after the events of Hotel Transylvania, Dracula (Adam Sandler) has finally approved of the wedding of his daughter monster Mavis (Selena Gomez) and her human fiancé Johnny (Andy Samberg). After some time in their happy marriage Mavis discovers that she is pregnant, and gives birth to the bouncing baby boy Dennis, who is half human and half monster. Grandpa Drac starts to get concerned because Dennis hasn't grown fangs yet, so he begins to try his hardest to make sure that his grandson is 100% monster, but then things get even crazier when Dracula's human-hatin' father, Vlad (voiced by the iconic Mel Brooks) shows up.This film is stacked with famous voices, including Kevin James, Steve Buscemi, David Spade, Fran Drescher, Molly Shannon, Keegan-Michael Key, Nick Offerman, Megan Mullally and many more! Although the first film is already a must-see quirky flick, this sequel ups the ante and keeps the one-liners coming right from the get-go. Don't miss a chance to see this hilarious and adorable offbeat comedy about family and accepting yourself. Playing all month only at The Royal!

title: BNI Christmas Celebration & Variety Show!
description: The holidays are here!! :)It is a perfect time to come together with our BNI families and we are having a Christmas Celebration and Variety Show! Crescent Moon will be hosting this year with a lovely dinner buffet (salad, a meat, a side - TBD.. You know you're gonna eat it! The Moon has great food!) - adult drinks are not included so please open your tabs with your servers. $28 per person... Spouses, team members, clients - everyone is welcome!  And the entertainment, you guys.. we have some serious TALENT in this region!Do you have a cool talent? Can you sing, dance, make balloon animals? WE WANT YOU!! Please contact Sam Boe at 936-252-1211 with your talent/song/etc and she will put you on the evening line up! Don't be shy - you know we wanna see your skills!AND, this celebration will also be the final drop off site for Cans for Christmas! The MEGA Group is gathering up non-perishables for families in need this holiday season. Please bring your canned and boxed food items to Crescent Moon and thank you for your support!See you all there!

title: DeveloperWeek 2016 Conference & Festival
description: DeveloperWeek 2016 is San Francisco’s largest one-week tech event series with over 60 week-long events including the DeveloperWeek 2016 Conference & Expo, the DeveloperWeek Hackathon (1,200+ attendees), Official Hiring Mixer (1,000+ hireable developers and 50+ hiring companies), and dozens of city-wide partner events. DeveloperWeek puts the spotlight on new dev technologies. Event hosts and supporters of last year’s DeveloperWeek include Google, Facebook,Yelp, Rackspace, IBM, Cloudera, Red Hat, Optimizely, SendGrid, Blackberry, Microsoft, Neo Technology, Eventbrite, Klout, Built.io, Ripple, GNIP,Tagged,HackReactor, and dozens more! Because DeveloperWeek covers all new dev technologies, our conference and workshops invite you to get intro lessons (or advanced tips and tricks) on technologies like HTML 5, Python, Javascript, Robotics Dev, Data Science and Machine Learning.Subscription: By registering for this event, you are opting into DevNetwork email updates. These updates will notify you about Integrate news as well as announcements about DevNetwork events. You can opt out of this email newsletter at any time.Due to limited availability, DevNetwork events cannot offer refunds once you purchase a pass. If you need to cancel your registration, we will give you a credit towards future conferences of equal value.

title: Revolutionary Love: Melbourne
description:
Revolutionary LoveMaster your relationships... Change your lifeLEE HARRISwith Meg Fenwick & Steven WashingtonSYDNEY: 16 - 17 JANUARY, 2016MELBOURNE: 23 - 24 JANUARY, 2016The weekend when everything changes for the better...An inner revolution happens when the wounds of the past are finally transformed into gold.   When you are no longer held back from love by old disappointments,   doubts, and fears, your whole life begins to crackle and sparkle with   new energy. When you come face to face with the truth of who you really   are—someone infinitely worthy of love and destined for it—you begin to   breathe more deeply than ever before.You  become a magnet—unable  to push away the closeness, tenderness, and  intimate connection that  WILL transform every part of your life.  Physical health, emotional  well-being, work, finances, family, creative  self-expression, life  purpose—all of these areas and more are infused  with new vision and  possibility.In  a container of great safety, warmth, and humor,  join renowned energy  intuitive and relationship mentor Lee Harris,  along with his  extraordinary co-facilitators, for a weekend of  unexpected and  unimagined magic and change.  WHO THIS WORKSHOP IS FOR…  Whether you are single, in the developmental stages of a relationship,   in a long-term partnership, seeking to bridge the divide in a   relationship, or at any other place along the path of loving, this   workshop will offer uplifting new insights, powerful communication   skills, and the warming light of hope cast over all your relations.  For those already familiar with Lee’s Energy Mastery Retreats,   Revolutionary Love represents the evolution of that profound body of   work—energy mastery applied to loving others and oneself.HIGHLIGHTS OF THE PROCESS INCLUDE: 

The 3 keys to life-changing intimacy — mastering communication, boundaries, and the art of openness

The gift of conflict — learning how to break through rather than blow up

The energy of sex — opening to the joy and empowerment of the erotic force.Special note:   We will be approaching this topic from an energetic and emotional   understanding, and with the utmost care, safety, and respect for the   boundaries of each individual and the group as a whole. There will be no   nudity or sexually explicit exercises.


The miracle of self-love — discovering the healing power of being enough

Learn   how to transform the inverted energies that keep relationship patterns   in place. If there is a past relationship you can't get over; a fear   that blocks you from taking risks in love; or shame and self-judgment   that hold you back, deep relief and freedom are your next destination   points along the journey.

title: The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv Show
description: Get ready for short form (Whose Line is it Anyway?) improv at the Push Comedy Theater.You demanded it! So now it's here!!! Our very own short form improv show. All the fun of Whose Line is it Anyway... right here in Downtown Norfolk.***The new Improv Riot teams won't make their official debut until January, but here's your chance to see some of the new players in action.***The Improv Riot: The Short Form Improv ShowFriday, November 27th, 8pmTickets are $5The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street and in the parking lot directly across from the theater.---The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For nearly ten years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. This fall they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.--The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: The Man Who Came To Dinner
description:
Famous radio personality Sheridan Whiteside comes to small-town Ohio for dinner and gets more than he bargained for. Falling and hurting his hip, he stays at the home to recover and terrorizes the lives of the whole family. Set in 1937, this classic comedy by Kaufman and Hart is a family-friendly night out!Important Notes:
Online ticket  sales for evening performances will close at noon on the date of those performances.
Online ticket sales for matinee performances will close at 9:00AM on the date of those performances

title: Mornings with Santa
description: Join Kansas City Moms Blog and Lauren Alexandra for a morning with Santa! Enjoy breakfast, shopping, and a visit with Santa in one of our favorite shops in Brookside. A professional photographer will be on hand to capture your family's visit and will provide one free, high-quality digital photo to use in Christmas cards, on social media or to print with the option to purchase additional photos. Please note: Tickets are being sold (one per family) by the half-hour and will be honored on a first-come/first-serve basis within the half-hour for which you have purchased your ticket.

title: Atelier d'initiation au vélo d'hiver
description: Pour les personnes qui commencent tout comme celles qui ont de l'expérience, rien de mieux qu'un petit rafraichissement avant le refroidissement.Dans une ambiance conviviale, il sera question de préparation mécanique et d'entretien du vélo, de vêtements et de conduite préventive.Cet atelier est offert grâce au soutien de l'arrondissement du Plateau-Mont-Royal, qui prête le local de formation.L'organisation suggère une contribution d'au moins 5$.

title: Bulgarian New Year's Party 2016
description: PLEASE JOIN US FOR A NEW YEAR'S EVE PARTY hosted by Bulgarian Business Network, a non-profit organizationALL INCLUSIVE BULGARIAN SOIREE, featuring BULGARIAN LIVE MUSIC* TRADITIONAL BULGARIAN CUISINE* OPEN BAR*KIDS ENTERTAINMENT*RAFFLES AND MORESPECIAL GUESTS DJ VIKTOR FROM CHICAGO AND BULGARIAN FOLK MUSIC  WITH ANTON SHEKERDZHIEV  FROM TUSCONFOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, GROUP RESERVATIONS AND REQUESTS PLEASE CONTACT THE EVENT COORDINATOR VALERIYA NEDEVA AT 602 908 2454 Tickets: (all inclusive: food,drinks, entertainment)BEFORE December 15ADULTS- $100* TEENS- $60* 12 and under- $ 25, seated at a kids tableAFTER December 15 ADULT- $ 120*TEENS- $ 80*12 and under- $ 25It’s a New Year’ blow out bash! The champagne is chilling and the clock is counting down the last days of the old year. We invite you to celebrate the old accomplishments and welcome the New Year in a traditional Bulgarian way in the company of family and friends. The party begins at seven o’clock, when you will be welcomed by the sounds of traditional Bulgarian bagpiper. Enjoy a cocktail or two in the foyer while you await the arrival of friends and awake your appetite with passed hors d'oeuvres. You will be guided to your table, where you will experience a night, full of dancing, Bulgarian music, traditional food, served family style, alcoholic beverages to your liking and good times, surrounded by family and friends. Children may join the kids’ area, supplied with toys, books and entertainment, where a few attendants will be available for play and fun time. After we count down the last seconds of the old year with a toast and traditional Bulgarian horo, you will enjoy delicious banitza with fortune wishes and reveal what is to come ahead in the new 2016 year. As the New Year begins and the old one ends, come celebratewith you family & friends!MENUMingle with friends and enjoy Cucumber wheels with smoked salmon and cream cheese and topped with capers and caviar. A roasted eggplant dip, seasoned with garlic, lemon and tahini, served over a savory crisp. This classic Mediterranean dip makes an exciting addition to your cocktail menu. Fresh eggs halved and stuffed with pureed seasoned yolks, promptly served from 7:00 till 8:00 p.m.Awaken your appetite with Russian salad and the very popular  and tasty Bulgarian Shopska Salad, served at each table.Enjoy a family style dinner under the sound of live folk musica Chef d'oeuvre of traditional Bulgarian Kurnache, a pork chop, roasted to perfection and topped with caramelized onions and mushrooms,paired with staffed cabbage leaves, drizzled with béchamel sauce and colorful couscous salad with seasonal vegetables and seasoned with olive oil and fresh lemon. Your meal will be accompanied by a round loaf of traditional bread, served at each table. Before you welcome the New 2016 Year, you will enjoy a piece of baklava and a serving of Panna Cotta, Italian dessert topped with raspberry coulis. FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, GROUP RESERVATIONS AND REQUESTS PLEASE CONTACT THE EVENT COORDINATOR VALERIYA NEDEVA AT 602 908 2454

title: Connect(); 2015 Watching Party

title: TiffyTalks Boston Brunch & Coaching
description: Boston Brunch & Coaching is a great opportunity to connect with other positive and progressive women to discuss matters that are impacting urban women today: purpose, faith, self-love and relationships, while being coached by Tiffany Wilson, the founder of TiffyTalks.com. Being from the Dorchester area of Boston, Tiffany is excited to return home to promote her debut book, #GetEngaged with Yourself & Win! 12 Keys to Unlocking the Life & Love You Desire. Do you feel stuck, unsure about your purpose, wonder if it's possible to be seriously satisfied as a single? We're going there! So, come ready to leave changed.YOU MUST RSVP to attend. This will be a casual, cool brunch.About Tiffany Wilson, M.Div. She's the Founder of www.TiffyTalks.com, an inspirational speaker andlife coach to millennial women. She holds a Master of Divinity degree and has a gift of empowering women to let go of their fears, step out in faith and #GetEngaged with their lives. In her book, #GetEngaged with Yourself & Win! Tiffany introduces insightful keys to help women unlock the passion and purpose within, making winning at life and love possible.After we chat and chew, Tiffany will be available to sign copies of her book.

title: Improv 101 with Brad McMurran
description: Jump into the wonderful and wild world of improv comedy!!!Learn the beginnings of Chicago-based, long form improv. Students will learn how to create scenes based off of audience suggestions. They will learn the fundamentals of 'Yes, And,' how to support scene partners' ideas and energy, and how to make strong character choices. Absolutely no experience in acting or comedy is needed. The Push Comedy Theater strides to create a fun, safe and supportive experience for all students.At the end of the session, students will take part in a graduation show on the Push Comedy Theater stage.This class is 6 weeks long and is held on Saturday afternoons from 3pm to 6pm. November 14 through December 19th.Cost: $190Improv 101 with Brad McMurran at the Push Comedy Theater--The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting and film production.Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: CONVERSATIONS ON DEATH: Death as a Rite of Passage
description: Death as a Rite of PassageWhat if the process of dying and death were considered a Rite of Passage? What preparations would need to be undertaken to make the crossing of this threshold one of courage and celebration?Come join us to explore the literal, mythic and energetic levels of Death as a Rite of Passage, and how to create communities to support you in each. Presenters: Kitty Edwards, The Living & Dying Consciously ProjectGeo Case, Compassionate Home Health Care and HospiceAnita Hauenstein, Ph.D.,  Sacred Soul Space$10 IN ADVANCE  I   $15 AT THE DOOR (cash only)

title: Hollow Half Marathon
description: RUN THE HUDSON RIVER!Trail and Road Half MarathonLooking for a change of pace? The Sleepy Hollow Half Marathon has the best of fun and scenery. It is the perfect event if you enjoy running for fun or are gearing up for a spring marathon! If you are Boston Bound - Better run here first!!The Sleepy Hollow Half-Marathon features approximately 5 miles of carriage roads and groomed trails (meaning crushed gravel and dirt) in the Rockefeller State Park Preserve. The 13.1-mile USATF-certified course also travels along the Old Croton Aqueduct and, as in past years, winds through picturesque neighborhoods in Sleepy Hollow.The idyllic landscape and scenic views of the Rockefeller State Park Preserve now make up part of the course due to construction and development along sections of the Sleepy Hollow waterfront. We are thrilled to make it possible for you to race on the same spectacular carriage roads and trails that serve as a training ground for many of the areas top runners.And if the magnificent Hudson River views on our new course don't take your breath away, the hills on our course will!* Electronically Timed* USATF Certified Course* Cash Awards and Prices to Top 3 Overall Female and Male Winners* Finisher Medal* Goodie Bag* LS Technical Shirt* Gatorade on cours

title: The AFROFUTURISM Series
description: Renegade Performance Group (RPG) is introducing dance and technology as a vehicle of AFROFUTURISM. The AFROFUTURISM Series will be the first RPG season in our home borough- Brooklyn. The company is presenting two unique full-length programs: “Untitled Distances” and “The Inscription Project.” The season runs four nights, November 4-7, 2015, at the Irondale Center in Fort Greene. AFROFUTURISM as a movement expresses new narratives, ideologies, and symbolisms of Black culture from a global perspective.RPG launched the AFROFUTURISM Series in January 2014 to be an ongoing project investigating the presence of Blackness into and beyond 21st Century techno-culture and society. It is a platform where themes and contexts of Black diasporic culture will be remixed and reimagined through contemporary dance, digital projections, and interactive sound environments.

title: The 666 Project: A Horror Anthology Show
description: In the grand tradition of The Twilight Zone and Tales from the Crypt comes The 666 Project.  The Push Comedy Theater has gathered six writers, six directors and six actors to bring you six rib-tickling, tales of terror. The 666 Projectdirected by:Garney Johnson, The Core Theater Ensemble, Jill Sweetland, Brendan Hoyle, Christopher Bernhardt and The Pushers.written by:Evan Grummell, Brant Powell, John Sharp, Matt Cole, Sean Devereux and Brad McMurranstarring:Nancy Dickerson, Rob Williams, Barrett Sigmon, Kat Schultze, Noelle Peterson and Rafael HenriquezThe Push Comedy Theater is proud to present The 666 Project: A Horror Anthology Show!October 17, 22, 23, 24, 30 and 31 at The Push Comedy TheaterThe show starts at 8pm.  Tickets are $15 The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street and in the lot directly behind the theater.---The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For nearly ten years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. This fall they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.--The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW @ The Screening Room
description: Costumes encouraged, props permitted... just don't break anything!!!Synopsis: THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW is a magical phenomenon unlike anything ever before seen onscreen. Borrowing largely from cinema's horror conventions, the film begins as an innocent young couple is stranded at the home of a mad scientist who is building the perfect man. The castle is filled with a most bizarre group of characters who worship their master, Dr. Frank-N-Furter, played magnificently by the fabulously sexy Tim Curry, in leather jacket, pearls, fishnet stockings, and heavy makeup. Brad (Barry Bostwick) and Janet (Susan Sarandon) are forced to examine their own sexuality as the voluptuous doctor releases the hidden desires in each of them."...the king of the hill of midnight movies, the undisputed champion of camp, the consummate cult classic."

title: Welcoming Immigrants via Outdoor Rec Programs
description: In 2010, Adrienne Blattel developed a program through an inner-city community centre in Montreal to bring together newly-arrived immigrants and other Montrealers through outdoor recreation. During this presentation, Adrienne will outline how activities are run to foster integration and intercultural understanding, which types of outings have worked well, lessons learned and ideas for the future.Adrienne Blattel started up an Intercultural Outdoor Recreation Program in 2010, through a local community centre, with the goal of bringing together Montrealers from near and far through outdoor activities. Adrienne originally hails from Ottawa, where she developed a taste for paddling, cross-country skiing, camping and more. During her time spent in France, Montenegro and Montreal, she learned first hand how outdoor recreation can help people settle in, and was inspired to start this program in Montreal. Adrienne has a Masters in Environmental Studies from York University.

title: EUFF 2015: Home
description: Directed by Maximilian Hult | Sweden/Iceland, Drama, 90 min, Language: SwedishCast: Moa Gammel, Anita Wall, Simon J. BergerLou is a super bright woman, but socially awkward – to the point of being neurotic. She’s a woman who speaks her mind, which is not to everyone’s taste. Led to believe that her maternal grandparents are long dead, she is shocked one day when she is told that her grandfather has just died and that her grandmother is still alive. This sets her off on a journey to a small village where she gets to know her mischievous grandmother Frida, a misplaced boy Tom and most importantly Henrik, who promptly falls head over heels in love with her. Lou’s journey is not to change, but to learn to love and find a home in those that love her.￼￼

title: EUFF 2015: Sworn Virgin
description: Directed by Laura Bispuri | Italy/Switzerland/Germany /Albania/Kosovo, Drama, 90 min, Language: Italian/AlbanianCast: Alba Rohrwacher, Lars Eidinger, Flonja KodheliHana Doda, still a girl, escapes from her destiny of being a wife and a servant, a future imposed on women in remote village life in Albania. With the help of her uncle’s guidance, Hana appeals to the old Kanun traditional law and takes an oath of eternal virginity for the chance to bear a rifle and live free as men. For the villagers, Hana becomes Mark, a “sworn virgin”. But something restless stirs under these men’s clothes. Years later, the immense Albanian mountains and her choice now seem like a prison. Mark decides to set out on a journey, too long put off. He travels to Italy, crossing borders into many different worlds: Albania and Italy, past and present, masculine and feminine. ￼￼

title: TEDxYouth@ColumbiaHeights 2015: Independence
description: TEDxYouth@ColumbiaHeights is a local, independently organized TEDx event that seeks to connect youth in the DC community to new ideas, opportunities, and each other, in order to build a space where students can grow as individuals to help them positively impact their communities. For our inaugural 2015 event we are bringing in experts and accomplished young people to spark conversation and action to challenge the meaning of and introduce new understandings around this year's theme of “independence.”

title: TEDxUF 2016: Identity
description:
At TEDxUF 2016, we challenge you to examine your identity.What were we born with, and what have we adopted?How have our experiences shaped who we are?And most importantly, how can we shape better experiences for others in the future?SCHEDULE3 - 4:30 p.m. Food Trucks Pre-Fest and Badge Pickup4:30 p.m. Auditorium Doors Open5 - 6:30 p.m. Session I6:30 - 7:45 p.m. Networking Break7:45 - Session II
FAQ: 1. Is this event FREE? ABSOLUTELY! TEDxUF is 100% free for everyone!2. Will I need to print out the tickets for the event?Nope, please have a valid photo ID OR confirmation email. Badges that are not picked up by 4:30 PM will be given away.3. Are there assigned seats?No, this event will be first come first serve. If you want a seat up front, we suggest you get to the event early!4. Are tickets transferable?Yes, but we do require a confirmation email or photo ID to gain access to the event. Please email us with your name and registration order # if you are no longer able to attend.5. I wasn't able to grab a ticket in time. Is there another way to get a ticket for this event?Yes! We will have a limited about of tickets available after 4:30 PM the day of the event.6. I can't make it until after 4:30 PM. Will I still be able to attend the event?Yes, if you registered, please email us at tedxuf16@gmail.com with your name and email.7. What is the attire?We highly recommend wearing smart-casual attire.8. Are you selling t-shirts to this event?Yes! T-shirts will be sold at this event. We take card or cash!9. I am a volunteer. Do I still need a ticket?Nope! You will be helping out the TEDxUF team the day of the event and will gain free admission.10. I can't go to this event anymore. What do I do?Please email us at tedxuf16@gmail.com with your name, email and registration order number.11. Will there be food at this event?Yes! Before the event, there will be a food truck rally with local food trucks around the county. Please come out and support your local community! We will also have light snacks and refreshments available during the break.12. Is there free parking?Yes. The Phillips Center has free parking after 2:30 PM.Are you ready to go to TEDxUF 2016? We're excited for you to see our 10 great speakers!

title: Naz & Maalik
description: Naz & MaalikNarrative Feature | 85 minutes | 2014 | USADirector: Jay DockendorfTwo closeted Muslim teens have their Friday afternoon ruined by FBI surveillance when their small-time scheming sets an agent on their trail. Set over the course of a single day in Brooklyn, Naz & Maalik examines the mysterious forces that animate teenage minds, ten years into the War on Terror."Shot on the streets of Bedford-Stuyvesant, Naz & Maalik unfolds with a youthful vitality, bolstered by the charm of its lead actors."-Sheri Linden, Hollywood ReporterPre-Screening Live Music from JE Sunde 5:30-6:00pmBefore striking out on his own, Jon Sunde spent years making beautifully unusual music with The Daredevil Christopher Wright. In 2014 he released his first solo album, Shapes That Kiss The Lips Of God, with Cartouche Records out of Davenport, IA. With a love for the craft of the singer / songwriter and an admiration for artists such as Nina Simone and Leonard Cohen, he tries to write honest songs that feel good and hopefully aren't excessively derivative. In this endeavor he has, at times, been more and less successful.

title: Energy Tune-Up: Brisbane
description:
Join Lee on his first ever Australian tour!Refresh your body, mind, and spirit during this special evening of energetic guidance, channeling, and audience Q&A.Every  month, 30,000 people around the world tune in to watch Lee’s Energy  Forecast videos (maybe you are one of them!). Now is your opportunity  for a live, in-person “energy forecast”—a memorable evening to tune in  to yourself and tune up to your higher frequencies. With deep-reaching  insight—and a good dose of healing humor—Lee will help to cut through  the noise of the world to access the quiet, empowering truth of  yourself.Live group  experiences with Lee are uniquely powerful. Reading the energy of the  room, he speaks directly to the core topics and themes that are taking  place for those in attendance— opening mind and heart and bringing light  to areas where there has been confusion, contraction, or suppression.What to expect from the evening…
A clear sense of your bigger, fuller self.
“Aha” moments of clarity and new awareness.
A remembrance of what you are here to do and who you are here to be.
The second part of the evening is a live Q&A with Lee.Book signing: There will be a 1-hour book signing after the official event.“My  favorite feeling at live events is experiencing the alchemy of change  that takes place for people. There is nothing more uplifting.” – Lee

title: SW Michigan Jewish Film Festival - Deli Man
description: Our opening night film!  Take a mouthwatering tour throughout the country in search of the cuisine brought here by Eastern European immigrants.  Your tour guide is a third-generation deli man from Houston, TX.  Director Erik Greenberg Anjou connects the story of Jewish delis with the changing history of American Jews, and we learn about the passion, sacrifice, and commitment necessary to keep these businesses alive.  With cameo appearances by Larry King, Jerry Stiller, and Fyvush Finkel.Following the film, join us for an authentic Jewish deli meal served buffet style.  Zingerman's pastrami and corned beef on rye, vegetarian soup, potato kugel, coleslaw, fruit salad, and dill pickles, with rugelach, brownies, and apple strudel for dessert!  Catered by Elizabeths Catering and Events Company. Deli meals must be ordered separately and in advance.  Please order online or via the ticket form, and mail in payment by October 17th.  Deli meals can be purchased for $20 per person.About the SW Michigan Jewish Film Festival: The best of Jewish film comes to the Kalamazoo area October 25 - November 1, including comedies, dramas, and documentaries.  A whole week of thought-provoking and entertaining films from around the world are coming to four venues near you!  Learn more about Jewish history, culture, and identity at this year's festival, sponsored by the Jewish Federation of Kalamazoo and SW Michigan.

title: 6 Meditation sessions for the price of 5!!
description: Meditation is a great way to take time out from your busy schedule, sit quietly, let your mind relax and your body heal. The Mind Detox Tunbridge Wells Salt Cave Meditation group meets fortnightly at The Salt Cave, 10 Vale Road, Tunbridge Wells, Kent.With this offer, you will be able to support yourself through the winter months with a structured meditation practice led by Mind Detox therapist Becci Harvey and the incredible benefits of 1 hours Salt Therapy (www.SaltCave.co.uk). In our experience, the negatively charged atmosphere of the Salt Cave has a powerfully cleansing effect on emotions, as well as its intended use of helping those with breathing conditions such as allergies, sinusitis, COPD and asthma.  Benefits of meditation include a greater sense of peace and wellbeing, a clearer head and a more relaxed body, mind and soul. It is a perfect antidote to a busy life, and recommended as part of a balanced and healthy lifestyle.This session is suitable for experienced meditators as well as complete beginners. Valid session dates are:3rd Nov17th Nov1st Dec15 Dec5th Jan19th Jan2nd Feb16th Feb1st MarTime: 8 - 9.15pm

title: Chicago Fil-Am Craft Beer and Food Fest
description: Put your mugs and forks together for the 1st AnnualChicago Fil-Am Craft Beer and Food Fest Rizal Center 1332 W Irving Park Rd., Chicago, ILNovember 14, 2015Session One: 1 p.m. to 4 p.m.Session Two: 5 p.m. to 8 p.m.The Filipino American Council of Greater Chicago (FACC) and BRUNDER are bringing a burst of fun & excitement to the Rizal Center with the first ever  Fil-Am Craft Beer and Food Fest! Chow down on specially selected mix of Chicago Food Truck treats!Sample some of the best-tasting, local beers from a variety of breweries!Grab your pals & meet other Chicagoan Filipino Americans!Jam to house lounge & 90s music from local pinoy DJs!"Kain na tayo!" Or, as we say in Chicago, “Let’s eat and drink!”This is a 21+ only event (Official government ID will be checked at door).$40 ticket includes a punch card for beer samplings & a "bite" of Filipino food tastingPre-registration is required. **TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT THE DOOR**See our Facebook Page for updates: https://www.facebook.com/events/891198424304991/FINE PRINT:This is a rain or shine (or snow) event. No refunds.Anyone drinking on a Designated Driver ticket will be immediately ejected from the festival. Food is sold separatelyFAQs:Do I need to print my ticket? No. We like to save trees. Tickets can either be printed or can be the electronic version accessible on your smartphone or wireless device.How do I get there? Where do I park? We encourage you to use public transportation & leave the driving to someone else.What can't I bring to the event? You CAN’T BRING: outside alcohol, food or drinks, glass containers, children and people under the age of 21, animals (unless a guide or service animal), bicycles, skateboards, or rollerskates/rollerblades. All the same usual stuff.  Use your head. Other:  Bite size Filipino tasting not guaranteed for the entire duration of the event and is intended to be a taste, not a full serving.  Additional food is available for purchase.  Last call is 15 minutes prior to end time. Questions? e-mail us at findit@brunder.com

title: ¡VAMOS! Liverpool: Day of the Dead NIGHT-TIME
description: Advance tickets for tonight’s Day of the Dead extravaganza are now offline - Make sure to get down early for tickets at the door!¡VAMOS! LiverpoolSat 31 October 20156.30pm doors open - 1am closeSt. Georges Hall, Liverpool. £10* (limited early bird ticket)£14* (advance ticket)* Please note there is a service fee of £1.50 + 42p per transaction¡VAMOS! comes to Liverpool in partnership with Monkey Mind Productions with a Day of the Dead (Día de Muertos) extravaganza at the spectacular St. Georges Hall featuring Mexican musicians, wrestlers, street food, DJs, a Day of the Dead shrine and before the main party starts a Guinness World Record attempt at the largest gathering of people dressed as La Calavera Catrina and/or her male counterpart, Catrine, in one place at one time!Go here for detailed instructions on how to take part in the World Record attempt!This event features live Mexican wrestling with superstar Cassandro, plus punk rock ’n’ roll Mexican star El Vez (Mexico’s Elvis), world-renowned Latin rock outfit Los Straitjackets, plus Mariachi troupe – Mariachi Las Adelitas, a vast Day of the Dead shrine by folk artist Francisco Monterrosa, star spangled couture from designer to the stars Manuel Cuevas and DJ performance by electronic producer Daferwa of Mexican label Kumbale!Please note this event is over 18s only.Join the Facebook event here!¡VAMOS! Liverpool Day of the Dead event is supported by Arts Council England, the Government of Mexico as part of the Year of Mexico in UK 2015, Liverpool City Council, St. Georges Hall, MX Proyecta, Wahaca, Hotel Indigo, Marco Pierre White Steakhouse Bar and Grill.

title: Miss Hokusai (14A)
description: Based on the manga Sarusuberi by Hinako Sugiura, Miss Hokusai is the untold story of O-Ei, often the real, uncredited painter behind her famous father’s work. Her father, more renowned now as Katsushika Hokusai, is most known for such works as The Great Wave off the Coast of Kanagawa..  Toronto Premiere. Click here for more details

title: Lunatick, An OdDancity Horror
description: An OdDancity work based on the psychology of mental instability and its direct correlation to humankind. Choreographed by Alex Floyd. Composed by Gian Trinidad. Danced by Ana Miro, Kistina Pressler, Angela Todaro, Chrissie Leong. Dancers explore the normality of “crazy” through four differently affected people.From obsessive compulsive and introverted, to over emotional and hyperactive, audiences may find themselves easily relating to these “mental patients.”The tiCk of time leads us all to lunacy.OdDancity is a modern dance company under the direction of Alex Floyd which breaks new ground, pushing art past its limitations using psychology and physical language of the subconscious.

title: The Passion General Admission
description: THE PASSION tells the 2000-year-old story of the last hours of Jesus Christ’s life on earth through passages from the Bible and a variety of popular music, sung by the cast and arranged specifically for this event by executive producer and hit music producer Adam Anders (“Glee,” “Rock of Ages”). Set in modern day, the event will follow the dramatic and inspirational story of Jesus of Nazareth, as he presides over the Last Supper, is betrayed by Judas, put on trial by Pontius Pilate, convicted, crucified and resurrected. This epic event will take place in Woldenberg Park on the banks of the Mississippi River.Doors Open: Sunday, March 20 at 4:30pm CTShow Starts: Sunday, March 20 at 7:00pm CT SHARPShow Ends: Sunday, March 20 at 9:00pm CT

title: SYRFILMFEST Einstein and Eddington
description: Welcome to the Syracuse International Film Festival 2015. This is our 12th annual film festival. We have another fantastic festival filled with amazing films, special guests, receptions, live music, talks and our Filmmakers Forum. 9:15PM, Genesee Grande HotelFilm – EINSTEIN and EDDINGTON (2008) by Philip Martin – 94 minutes (England).  Celebrating the 100th anniversary of Einstein’s General Theory of Relativity. Drama about the development of Albert Einstein's theory of general relativity, and Einstein's relationship with British scientist Sir Arthur Eddington, the first physicist to experimentally prove his ideas. The film stars David Tennant and Andy Serkis.Seating is limited - 45 seats. This is a FREE eventA complete list of all of screenings can be found at: www.filminsyracuse.com You can also signup for our online newsletter to get all the latest updates and learn more about our organization and the other events and work we do. If you have questions please contact us.Thank you! Your support helps keep the film festival and arts alive and thriving here in CNY. We look forward to seeing you at the Festival!

title: DeveloperWeek 2016 Hackathon
description: The DeveloperWeek 2016 Hackathon is San Francisco's largest hackathon - with 1,200 on-site developers and 10,000 remote developers building new apps within 36 hours. You can build whatever you want - and compete for $100,000+ in cash, products, and prizes!There are 3 ways to hack:1- Hack on-site at our headquarters (limited to the first 800 attendees). See the main stage talks, visit our sponsor tables, get full food & drinks for the entire event.2- Hack on-site at our partner venues. We have space for another 800 hackers to participate at partner venues around the city of San Francisco. You'll still be able to submit for judging and interact with our sponsors virtually!3- Code from anywhere in the world. You'll be able to create a project and submit your app for virtual judging from any city or country!

title: Dusk
description: DuskNarrative Feature | 91 minutes | 2015 | USADirector: Michael Maney John Whitmore’s (John McGlothlin) world is turned upside down when he wakes one morning to find that his wife, Anne (Juliana Harkavy, Dolphin Tale, The Walking Dead, Graceland), has been kidnapped. A mysterious recording left in her place demands that John contact a man named David (Ford D’Aprix), who is to escort Whitmore to a cabin deep within the woods. The voice assures John that if he follows the plan exactly, he will be reunited with Anne in exchange for his life savings.Pre-Screening Live Music from LOTT 6:30-7:00pmLOTT is the solo classical experimental violin project of Minneapolis musician Leah Ottman (We Are The Willows). The core inspiration for LOTT's compositions is the Romantic Period of classical music. She explores the range on her violin by utilizing a looping pedal and similar techniques employed by looping violinist pioneers Andrew Bird, Kishi Bashi and Owen Pallet.LOTT was awarded "Best Acoustic Performer" in City Pages' Best of the Twin Cities 2015. "...With a looping pedal hooked up to her instrument, Ottman layers intricate melodies that combine classical beauty with an adventurous ear for contemporary experimentation not unlike Andrew Bird. Her voice, loaded with attitude and a penchant for flowing leaps, sweetens the deal..."

title: It's Already Tomorrow in Hong Kong
description: It's Already Tomorrow in Hong KongNarrative Feature | 78 minutes | 2015 | USA, Hong KongDirector Emily Ting in attendanceIn this sparkling romance, Ruby, a Chinese American toy designer from LA, visits Hong Kong for the first time on business. Finding herself stranded, she meets Josh, an American expat who shows her the city. Meandering through nighttime streets pulsing with energy and possibility, they fall into a winding and carefree conversation, buoyed by an undeniable attraction.  Just as things start to look promising romantically for the pair, the night is stopped short by a surprising revelation.“A delightful, honest look at personal connections and the trouble with timing.”- Rob Hunter, Film School RejectsPre-Screening Live Music from JE Sunde 6:30-7:00pmBefore striking out on his own, Jon Sunde spent years making beautifully unusual music with The Daredevil Christopher Wright.  In 2014 he released his first solo album, Shapes That Kiss The Lips Of God, with Cartouche Records out of Davenport, IA.  With a love for the craft of the singer / songwriter and an admiration for artists such as Nina Simone and Leonard Cohen, he tries to write honest songs that feel good and hopefully aren't excessively derivative.  In this endeavor he has, at times, been more and less successful.

title: Art on Paper 2016
description: Art on Paper NYC - Building on the success of its inaugural edition, Art on Paper will return to Manhattan's Pier 36 this March 3 –­ 6, bringing the best in modern and contemporary paper­-based art to downtown Manhattan. The first Art on Paper welcomed 20,000 visitors to the Lower East Side over the fair's four buzzing days. The fair was set apart by the quality of its exhibitions. The medium­-driven focus lent itself to significant projects – unique moments that elevated Art on Paper, quickly shaping the fair into an important and influential New York City destination.

title: Play in a Pub 2015: The Jedi Doth Return
description: This fall, the epic saga concludeth. In a pub.Driftwood  Theatre's Play in a Pub returns for a third year to bring to a close the  most epic saga ever penned by the illustrious Bard!The stars of  the stage come together in a pub very, very nearby for an evening of  theatrical and cinematic mash-up of Shakespearean proportions in support  of Driftwood Theatre!Building on the sold-out success of both Play in a Pub: William Shakespeare's Star Wars and Play in a Pub: William Shakespeare's The Empire Striketh Back,  Driftwood Theatre reunites some of the finest performers of the stage  for another epic reading! GET IN ON THE ACTION by participating in the Rebels, Imperials and Droids n' Creatures Live Auction,  and bid on one of three walk-on character tracks - rebels, imperials,  or droids n' creatures. GET A JAWA DEAL on some swank merchandise with a  rebel-worthy selection of boutique baskets during our Cantina Market Auction. GET DRESSED UP and enter our  Star Wars Cosplay Competition! In the spirit of the season, come dressed as your favourite Star Wars inspired character and win - cash prize!Grab your lightsaber and a pint and join Driftwood Theatre at the Social Capital Theatre (154 Danforth Avenue, Toronto) on Monday, October 26. Please note, this is a 19+ event.

title: IIMUAHII - LA Fashion Week - S/S 2016 RSVP
description: IIMUAHII  - LA Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2016 Pronounced “eee-mooah-ee” IIMUAHII was started by Academy of Art alumni Elena Slivnyak in 2010. She was cast in Project Runway season 10 where she ended up presenting a press-favorite collection at Mercedes Benz New York Fashion Week. One year later she was called upon again by the producers of Project Runway All Stars to compete yet again. She took the challenge and was consistently producing top three looks weekly and became a finalist, showing her final collection at the United Nations representing her home country of Ukraine.  Based in San Francisco, Elena’s avant-garde couture wear pushes conceptual boundaries and is consistently sought after by celebrities, stylists, and the entertainment industry. Lady Gaga, Ciara, Tyra Banks, Debbie Harry, Victoria Justice, and St. Vincent are all fans of IIMUAHII. Expanding her brand’s repertoire, Elena recently launched a new division of sportswear, R2Wear, and she plans to launch a menswear and accessory line in the near future. She is eager to get started working in the film and entertainment industry as a creative, channeling her visions throughout all spectrums of the art world.

title: The BUDDHIST WAY to HAPPINESS
description: Join us for a Day of Compassion & Wisdom (via Budddhist teachings, chanting, and meditation)09:30 - 10:00 Lecture: Buddhism 101 (Intro to Buddhism)10:00 - 10:30 Chanting: Triple Gem Chanting in Pali10:30 - 11:15 Lecture: The Buddhist Way of Life11:15 - 12:15 Lunch*12:15 - 13:00 Chanting: Om mani padme hum (with explanation)13:00 - 15:15 Meditation: Mindfulness of Breathing15:15 - 15:30 Closing: Sharing of meritsIf you are only able to join us for parts of the event that's ok.* Please bring your own VEGETARIAN lunch, or there will be vegetarian sandwiches and Chinese treats available for purchase. Coffee and Tea are free but please bring your own mug/water bottle.

title: ETA Awards 2015 | Emerging Toronto Artists Awards
description: E m e r g i n g |   T o r o n t o |   A r t i s t sArt Exhibit & Awards GalaThe ETA Awards is the most exciting new event to hit the Emerging Artist scene in Toronto!An annual, curated indoor art exhibit & awards gala, featuring 50+ local visual/performing artists. Open to the public, the event provides a platform for purchasing beloved artworks, networking with creative locals, socializing, dancing, celebrating & recognizing all the talents and efforts of Toronto's most motivated and hard working artists!Hosted lakeside, at Toronto's iconic Palais Royale Ballroom, our 2015 event themed: "La Belle Époque (The Beautiful Era)", is an all-ages/licensed event, with cash bar available to guests providing ID and wrist-banded.A live Jury of industry professionals at the event will be observing and interacting with the artist exhibitors throughout the evening. The 'ETA Trophy' in 5 categories will be presented along with prizes during the Awards Presentation segment of the event, concluding the evening, Audience members are invited to participate in a 'People's Choice' selection at the event.With music, dance, food & drink, it will be an epic celebration for all supporters of the arts, to admire and be inspired, by the talents and enthusiasm of the Thriving Artists of our era! Join the movement, to define TORONTO as the city of THRIVING ARTISTS.The end of the 'starving artist' begins with the ETA Awards. #THRIVINGARTISTS #ETAAwardswww.ETAAwards.com

We will be selling season tickets at the door at the Mauna Lani as well. This season, each concert will feature a different guest conductor, and at the end of the season we will announce our final pick for new Artistic Director / Conductor for the Kamuela Philharmonic. The Season Ticket is the best way to catch every concert and to see all three of our talented guest artists."The Power of Inspiration!", featuring guest conductor Brian Dollinger - 4:00 PM at the Hale Hoaloha Pavilion, Mauna Lani Bay Hotel & Bungalows in Puako, HI"Promethean Passions!", featuring guest conductor David Mackenzie - 4:00 PM at the Kahilu Theatre in Waimea, HI"A Salute To Youth! title: Flora Miranda - LA Fashion Week - S/S 2016 RSVP
description: FLORA MIRANDA  - LA Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2016Flora Miranda is an Austrian fashion designer, based in Antwerp, Belgium. Throughout her work the main focus is on the human being, one’s body, senses and perception. Flora explores physical border experiences that take place in a virtual or actual reality.Flora spent her formative years growing up in a family of artists and musicians where she developed her skills as a painter. After her graduation, at the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Antwerp, she  made her name at the ateliers of Dutch designer, Iris Van Herpen. Flora then moved back to Antwerp to establish an atelier for her new creations. Her drive to function as an inspiration and visionary by challenging the obsolete idea of haute couture. Flora seeks to create dreams and desires. Her fashion does not only describe garments, it involves a whole aesthetic world that we are surrounds us.

title: Cosmogyral - LA Fashion Week - S/S 2016 RSVP
description: COSMOGYRAL - LA Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2016 Jenine Nerecina is a fashion designer based in Los Angeles. Cosmogyral was devised during her senior year at Woodbury University, where she was required to draft a business plan for a theoretical brand of her own. The plan focused on a resort wear brand that offered lightweight clothing for tropical seasons. Her debut collection, Diaphanous – light, delicate, and translucent – sets the tone to the aesthetic of Cosmogyral. This capsule collection is inspired by evening wear from the Philippines, nature, and the sensuality of lingerie.  Her collections are inspired and revolve around women who like to whirl around the universe in beautiful, experimental clothing. The aesthetic of the collections is a fusion of the designer’s dreams and reality. The designer’s love of romanticism and celestial bodies combined with neoteric fashion give the garments a contemporary, chic vibe. Cosmogyral is designed and produced in Los Angeles. Their goal is to endorse garments made in LA, exhibit that American-made products are high-quality, and promote the luxurious Los Angeles lifestyle.

title: Zhivago - LA Fashion Week - S/S 2016 RSVP
description: ZHIVAGO - LA Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2016West Australian-based label Zhivago is rapidly building a reputation for their signature fusion of impeccably tailored ready-to-wear, avant-garde separates and show-stopping red carpet gowns.Co-designed by longtime friends, Lara Kovacevich and Lydia Tsvetnenko and meaning ‘daring’ in Russian, Zhivago was launched at the 2012 Perth Fashion Festival to widespread critical acclaim.In April 2013, Zhivago made their debut at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week, closing the New Generation show with their S/S13/14 collection. Titled Suspended Animation, the cohesive 12-piece collection was a juxtaposition of influences that included athletica, body con boudoir-luxe and their signature high-octane eveningwear. The response from retailers was overwhelmingly positive, with deliveries selling out nation wide literally within a matter of weeks.Over the past 3 years Zhivago have dressed an enviable list of international and national celebrities including Lady Gaga, Katy Perry, Kendall and Kylie Jenner, Giuliana Rancic, Dej Loaf, Leslie Grace, Liz Trinnear, Jennifer Hawkins, Dannii Minogue, Delta Goodrem, Samantha Jade, Jesinta Campbell, Nicole Trunfio, plus many, many more.

title: AyA | AVANI Kitchens + Monogram
description: INVITE YOU TO————Designlines VIP PartyAt the AyA Castlefield showroom and Monogram Design CentreOctober 22————Join us at the newly opened AyA Castlefield Showroom and Monogram Design Centre in the heart of the Castlefield Design District where AyA and AVANI’s cabinetry is on full display for an evening of wine and design. ————Conversation Panel: The Future of Kitchen Innovation @ 7:00 p.m.Tory Healy, Editor, Designlines;Dave Marcus, President & CEO, AyA Kitchens and Baths;and Designer Scott Eunson from Scott Eunson Studio ————Mix and mingle with Toronto’s design community. You could win a Monogram Stainless Steel Wine Reserve, with adjustable temperature control for up to 57 bottles of red or white wine valued at $2,380.

All funding raised will go directly to this campaign to provide a home for our women for good! Join in the fight for freedom by partying with us!

title: DX Intersection: KISMET
description: Tickets for DX Intersection 2015 are now SOLD OUT online. Tickets can be purchased at the door at 9PM.DX INTERSECTION 2015: KISMETJoin Design Exchange for our annual party celebrating all things creative. DX Intersection is a vital and preeminent annual fundraising event for DX, Canada's Design Museum. Each year, DX celebrates a Canadian individual or partnership that demonstrates superior creativity, outstanding talent, and innovative vision.This year, we're celebrating the chance meeting of two individuals who have inspired and influenced the international world of design. In 2015, we recognize and honour a partnership that has risen to international acclaim and influence. DX is delighted to announce George Yabu & Glenn Pushelberg, founders of Yabu Pushelberg, as the DXI 2015 Awardees.Dance, eat, drink, and celebrate a night of promising kismet. Be immersed in a synthesis of design disciplines and creative cultures, realized through ephemeral installations and unexpected interventions curated by Yabu Pushelberg.November 7, 2015 DONOR DINNER: 7-10PMPARTY: 9PM- 2AM234 Bay Street, Toronto416.368.0684#DXKISMETTICKETSSOLD OUT  Donor Dinner, 7-10PM: $600+HSTSOLD OUT Donor Dinner Bundle: 7PM-10PM: $6000+HST (Includes 11 Dinner Tickets with reserved seating) Please contact Rosa Ricci at 416.216.2160 for inquiries.DX Members: $175+HST (includes pre-party cocktail lounge from 8-9PM for DX Members)General Admission, 9PM: $200+HSTGeneral Admission + One Year DX Membership, 9PM: $235General Admission Bundle (11 Tickets), 9PM: $2000+HST*Processing fees not included. Prices include HST. Please note, there are no refunds..Design Exchange will issue a partial tax receipt for the maximum allowable amount.Be the first to hear about exciting installations, special performances, and the evening's finest fare. Sign up here, to be among the first to learn more about this hot ticket!Proceeds of ticket sales support DX education programs, the Permanent Collection, and curatorial initiatives.

title: America's Toy Wrap - Los Angeles
description:
America's Toy WrapJoin the festive fun this Christmas season at Children’s Hunger Fund as you join volunteers from coast to coast in wrapping toys for children in need.All of the events are currently sold out. 

NEW TO THIS YEAR!You can Think Inside the Box! We are attempting to raise 25 Million Meals for hungry kids. Each meal can be sent for only 25₵. So, when you come to Toy Wrap you can bring along your coins for meals!

We have 3 ways to help you collect coins to bring to America's Toy Wrap:1. Download a Christmas Coin Pak pattern. Print it out and make your Coin Pak at home.2. title: Week 4 | Chuan Cuisine | Thursday Dinner
description: CHUAN CUISINE | Sichuan RegionTHE PLACE AND FOODThe most populous region of Western China, Sichuan is known as the "Heavenly country." Its cuisine is frequently stir-fried and braised, producing big flavors that are pungent and spicy, with liberal use of garlic and the fragrant, citrusy Sichuan pepper. THE MENU1: Kung Pao Chicken 2: Don Don Noodle 3: Tea Smoked Duck 4: Sichuan Moon CakeServed Family Style with Rice

title: Toby Hemenway Lecture and Book Signing (CANCELLED)
description:
DUE TO UNFORESEEN CIRCUMSTANCES, THIS EVENT WILL NOT TAKE PLACE THIS EVENING! Join us for a special talk on urban permaculture with Toby Hemenway, author of the bestselling permaculture book, Gaia's Garden.We all need and want a healthy, abundant and sustainable environment that provides for our basic needs, fostered and shared with a peaceful, diverse and collaborative community. Permaculture, as design science and ecological lifestyle, provides the most viable framework for this path to individual, environmental and social sustainability!Join Us to learn how to you can apply permaculture in your own life and local community from the author of the bestselling book on permaculture in the world, Toby Hemenway!In this talk, Mr. Hemenway will provide insights from his new 2015 book The Permaculture City: Regenerative Design for Urban, Suburban and Town Resilience.The Permaculture City begins in the garden but takes what we have learned there and applies it to a much broader range of human experience; we’re not just gardening plants but people, neighborhoods, and even cultures. Hemenway lays out how permaculture design can help town dwellers solve the challenges of meeting our needs for food, water, shelter, energy, community, and livelihood in sustainable, resilient ways.The evening will include: An inspiring talk and presentation on urban permaculture
Q & A with Toby Hemenway
Signing of Toby Hemenway's new book, The Permaculture City: Regenerative Design for Urban, Suburban, and Town Resilience.
Seats are limited. Reserve your spot in advance.Speaker: Toby HemenwaySpeaker Bio: Toby Hemenway is the author of Gaia’s Garden: A Guide to Home-Scale Permaculture, which was awarded the Nautilus Gold Medal in 2011, was named by the Washington Post as one of the ten best gardening books of 2010, and is the best-selling permaculture book in the world. Toby has been an adjunct professor at Portland State University, Scholar-in-Residence at Pacific University, and has taught over sixty 72-hour permaculture design courses. He has presented lectures and workshops at major sustainability conferences such as Bioneers, SolFest, and EcoFarm, and at Duke University, Tufts University, University of Minnesota, University of Delaware and many other educational venues. His writing has appeared in magazines such as Natural Home, Whole Earth Review, and American Gardener. He has contributed book chapters for WorldWatch Institute and to several publications on ecological design. More at http://tobyhemenway.com/about/Cancellation Policy: We understand your plans may change. We will give you credit toward a future program if you cancel at least 24 hours in advance. Credit must be redeemed within 90 days of issue. To account for our preparation and our instructor's time, we cannot give refunds or credits if cancelled with less than 24-hours notice or in the event of a no-show.

title: Sanchez Kane - LA Fashion Week - S/S 2016 RSVP
description: SANCHEZ KANE  - LA Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2016 Barbara Sanchez Kane is a Mexican born designer. After graduating from Industrial Engineering Barbara Sanchez Kane decided to change her path and study fashion design. Recently graduated from Polimoda (IT) where she presented “Catch as a Catch can” at Villa Favard during Pitti Uomo. Barbara collection was chosen as Vogue Talent 200 emerging designers.  While always specifically menswear focused, her collections are motivated by her mexican heritage and deeply influenced by her personal intrinsic emotional elements.

title: Madison Ghost Walk
description:
Discover the haunted history of Madison, Wisconsin with our 90-minute ghost walk around the state’s capitol. You can expect to meet the colorful characters, vengeful spirits, monsters, and stories of the people who love Madison so much that even death can’t stop them from staying in the city!

We’ve spent a lot of time researching supernatural and weird stories around Mad City so that we have brand new stories and content that we can guarantee you’ve never heard before.

title: Learn to Make a Macrame Bracelet
description: Workshop #7 - Etsy Made in CanadaTying one cord to another cord and making a knot is the basis of macramé.  Macramé can be used in many different ways and can be embellished with charms and beads.  In this workshop, you will learn how to use a basic knot to make your own macramé bracelet with glass connector. Taught by Carmai Seto of Etsy shop Mai's Jewelry.This workshop is one of a series offered by the Toronto Etsy Street Team and 416 Hustler Team as part of the Etsy Made in Canada day of pop up markets across the country on Saturday, September 26th. description: CHUAN CUISINE | Sichuan RegionTHE PLACE AND FOODThe most populous region of Western China, Sichuan is known as the "Heavenly country." Its cuisine is frequently stir-fried and braised, producing big flavors that are pungent and spicy, with liberal use of garlic and the fragrant, citrusy Sichuan pepper. THE MENU1: Kung Pao Chicken 2: Don Don Noodle 3: Tea Smoked Duck 4: Sichuan Moon CakeServed Family Style with Rice

title: Trimmed-Line - Bio Energy and Urban Logging Team
description: We are a local tree company located in Red Deer, AB.  However, we are the only tree company in Alberta that is a full circle tree company that encompasses Urban Logging.  What this entails is:1.  We cut the trees down for reasons such as development, disease, mother nature or the end of the trees life2. We salvage the lumber and mill it on our saw mill3. We dry the lumber in our kiln via a wood fired boiler that uses our wood waste as fuel.  The boiler is also piped in to heat our shop4.  Once the lumber is dried and stable we have the capabilities to turn it into a value added product such as furniture, cutting boards, home decor and the list continues.5. We finish the circle by having 2 sizes of tree spades to re-plant trees.We've quickly learned the power of leed credits through our recycling efforts and found a niche in our local market.Some of our Local Willow has gone to a renovation project for Peavy Industries right her in Red Deer.  Local Aspen has been sent to Brewster's in Calgary as casing as the designers wanted something rustic and not the regular go-to douglas fir.  Local Maple bar tops have gone to the District Bar in Medicine Hat.  Furniture has gone to Edmonton.  Live edge slabs have been used as wedding guest sign boards and the list continues.Our goal is to be the best tree company we can be and have a competitive cut about the rest.  We are actively participating in reducing our carbon footprint for our future generations.

title: "Actions Speak Louder Than Words"
description: Feeling inspired? Take the next step toward action with a full day of films, panels, and interactive workshops at Saint Paul University. FREE Entry. Donations accepted at the door.10am | Inter Pares InterPares will hold a screening of La fièvre verte (The Green Fever) . This short film was created by InterPares, the Université de Montreal's REDTAC research group and the West African peasant movement COPAGEN based on our research project that documented the impacts of landgrabs on peoples' livelihoods and food security in West Africa. InterPares Africa Program Manager Eric Chaurette, along with some of the filmmakers, will lead a bilingual discussion following the screening.12:30pm | The Canadian Institute for Conflict Resolution The Canadian institute for Conflict Resolution, whose mission is to empower individuals, communities and organizations to resolve conflicts peacefully,  invites you to a two-hour interactive workshop on conflict resolution. You will learn about transformative approaches and tools to analyze and work through conflicts experienced within family, community and the workplace, and we will share success stories about challenging conflicts in Canada and abroad.  3pm | Oxfam CanadaInside Syria, 12 million people are in need of aid. Almost 4 million more have fled the country and are now living as refugees. Oxfam Canada is proud to screen clips of interview footage from the field, sharing the voices of Syrians who are now in Lebanon and Jordan. Noor is a Syrian refugee, teaching hope to children in the refugee camp, and Haifa is intent on returning home someday. Join us for a workshop to further explore the situation in Syria following the screening.
