title: Granger Leadership Academy 2016
description: Your entire life you've loved stories about great heroes. Now it's time to become one. At the Granger Leadership Academy you'll learn how to become the next Harry, Katniss, or Agent Carter, here in our own world. You'll join a team, develop your hero skills, and come together to address a great global peril - all in the course of one exciting weekend. Whether you're a first time leader or a long time wizard activist, let GLA be your training ground.Our event is designed to walk participants through the Social Change Model of leadership development as seen through the lens of The Hero's Journey. By drawing on beloved characters like Hermione Granger, Captain America, and Luke Skywalker, attendees will get to experience what it is that sets fan activism apart from more traditional modes of activism and leadership development.GLA offers Harry Potter Alliance (HPA) Chapter Organizers and fan activists of all stripes the opportunity to develop their own unique toolbox of skills in order to effect measurable change in their communities around the world.Refunds are available until February 1st. Beginning February 1st, ticket price cannot be refunded. Questions? Email gla@thehpalliance.org

title: CONVERSATIONS ON DEATH: The Story of Our Mortality
description: The Story of Our Mortality – Who Teaches Us How to Die?Who taught us how to live and how does that impact how we die? How do we feel about the lives we will be leaving behind?  Our personal and cultural histories conspire to shape our individual deaths.  How do we write our own stories? Come join us for an intimate, practical discussion.Presenters: Kim Mooney, Practically Dying and Sue Mackey, Out of the Box Funeral Planning.

title: TEDxHeriotWattUniversity
description: Heriot-Watt University brings to you TEDx this September! TEDxHeriotWattUniversity aims to share the progress being made not just within the university but also the local community.This is Heriot-Watt University's first TEDx event which will feature live speakers with a combination of TEDTalks videos that seek to spark deep discourse.We have selected "Think Aloud!" as the theme for our TEDx; the speakers have not just thought in-depth about their innovative ideas but have actually put them into practice, displaying proficiency in their ability to take things from the drawing board to the field.TEDxHeriotWattUniversity will be held on September 30, 2015, Wednesday at James Watt Centre 2, Heriot-Watt University. It is going to be a half-day event with a breakout session, lunch will be provided alongside our interactive spaces where we have some interesting surprises planned for the audience.

title: The Festival of Wood and Barrel Aged Beer (FoBAB)
description:
#FoBAB is the country’s largest celebration of wood and barrel-aged beers. Brewers around the nation produce craft beers that have been aged in a wooden barrel or in contact with wood to share at our annual #FoBAB event. The general public has access to some of the rarest beers in the world, which may or many not be available commercially from breweries across the country.Over 90 breweries and 300 individual beers will be pouring at tables spread throughout an expanded 24,000 square foot space. Additional tickets for each session will be available this year. Catering services and food trucks will be available for purchase as well.#FoBAB also features a special project called “BarricAle,” which, much like Oak Park Microbrew Review’s “ReplicAle”, gives brewers an opportunity to create barrel-aged beer with only slight variables. Except, unlike ReplicaAle, this time most of the variable comes from the barrel provided, creating amazing, one-off, rare beers! This year’s “BarricAle” project is sponsored by Goose Island. BarricAle features barrel-aged beers from more than 20 Illinois craft breweries. Heaven Hill barrels are the variable this year, as brewers filled empties with their craft beer of choice. Some beers have been sitting for 12 months, 6 months and even at 3 months. Come taste the different nuances of each Illinois hand-crafted barrel-aged beer and find out exactly why they chose to work with the beers they did. The National Wood Aged Beer Competition is judged by a panel of industry experts prior to the public sessions. Each beer is judged on the basis of how that underlying style reflects the expression of wood and/or barrel character. Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals are awarded in 12 categories as well as “Best of Show.”2015 National Wood-Aged Beer Competition (Style Categories):
Porter/Stout (< 7%ABV) 
Strong Porter/Stout (> 7% ABV)
Specialty Strong Porter/Stout (> 7% ABV)
Barleywine/Wheatwine
Classic Beer Styles (> 7% ABV)
Strong Pale Beer (> 7% ABV)
Strong Dark Beer (> 7% ABV)
Fruit Beer
Specialty/Experimental Beer
Wild Beer/Brett (non-acidic)
Wild Beer/Sours (acidic)
Cider/Mead/Perry
PLEASE NOTE: Tickets go on sale Friday, September 4th at 10AM CST. Tickets are $60 plus payment processing fee: 3% through Universe. Each transaction is allowed up to four (4) tickets. Each ticket holder will receive a complimentary glass, a FoBAB booklet, and 20 sampling tickets. All sales are final. Tickets are transferable for General Admission sales. No refunds.About the Illinois Craft Brewers GuildThe Illinois Craft Brewers Guild is a non-profit organization founded in 1997 dedicated to promote the development and expansion of the craft beer industry in Illinois. Its efforts are focused on the following areas:1. Legislative/Regulatory – To allow the Guild a voice in addressing all issues, governmental or other, which affect the regulation of our industry.2. Education – To provide opportunities for its members to further their brewing knowledge and to educate the consumer about the benefits and varieties of craft beer, and to encourage responsible, moderate consumption.3. Promotion – To promote its members and their products to other brewers, suppliers, legislators, tourists and the general public.www.illinoisbeer.comwww.drinkillinois.com

title: Vegan Supper Club Series: CNE
description:
WE ARE BACK!!! It’s all about the Canadian National Exhibition this week, which has prompted us to do a bit of homework on this annual midway and dedicate our first Supper Club of the season to all things epic CNE food style (but vegan of course!) Our Chef Daniel Holloway has transformed and veganzied popular CNE treats into visually stunning and (somewhat) refined flavours.Vegan Menu

Introduction Course: “Deep Fried Butter and Blooming Onion” Battered Wood & Water Cashew Cheez Fritters served with Honey Mustard andBlooming Fried Shallot topped with Creamy Ranch Dressing

Second Course: Parsnip Gratin Poutine: Thinly sliced Parsnip layered and baked served with Lupini Bean “curds” and Gravy topped with Shredded Zucchini Slaw

Main Course: “The Cronut Burger”: Black Bean Burger served on a Handmade Vegan Croissant Bun, Gherkin Remoulade Heirloom Tomatoes and Caramelized Leeks

Dessert: Funnel Cake served with Ontario Huckleberry Jam, Chocolate Ganache and Vegan Coconut Ice Cream
Coffee, tea, sparkling and flat water included.The event begins at 7pm and dinner will start at 7:20pm or when most of the guests have arrived.No alcohol will be served onsite; if you choose to bring wine/beer, don't drink and drive.{About Vegan Supper Clubs}We host a monthly themed Vegan Supper Club in our second level loft kitchen.What's a Supper Club you ask? Think of it as an informal dinner party meant to encourage guests to mingle, share and celebrate food. Events are 19+, complimentary sparkling and flat water will be provided. Here's a sneak peak of what to expect  or check out our Supper Club Gallery.Are they always Vegan? Yes. We want people to feel included in the discussion around food, culture and the arts and feel making these events vegan will allow more guests to participate. We also do special Gluten-Free editions a few times a year.{About Urban Acorn LTD.}Just like an idea, acorns begin small with the hopes of becoming something big, strong and meaningful. This was the initial push behind Urban Acorn LTD. a Flexiatarian Catering company founded by Chef Daniel Holloway and his parntner Marie Fitrion. Inspired by art, music, and using food as a dialogue for social change, Urban Acorn wants to encourage people to broaden their understanding of food and each other with the hopes of building stronger communities. Their mostly plant-based 'Flexitarian' approach to cuisine, allows them to seemlessly create menus to both omnivores and vegans. Their philosophy is simple, they believe food should unite,  not divide people

title: Willow's Eat to the Beat
description:
60 Female Chefs. One Worthy Cause.Benefitting Willow Breast & Hereditary Cancer Support
Eat to the Beat at a GlanceCelebrating its 20th year, Willow's Eat to the Beat is a mecca for urban foodies who come to experience the best Ontario’s culinary scene has to offer. It is the only event in Canada that exclusively features the talent of 60 female chefs – women supporting women through the challenges that come with a breast cancer diagnosis.Tickets include savoury and sweet dishes at 60 stations along with wine, beer and a selection of non alcoholic libations from 20 of the finest beverage purveyors.Early Bird Tickets: $150 (available until September 10)Regular Tickets: $175 (after September 10)Date:Tuesday, October 27, 2015Time:7pmVenue:Roy Thomson Hall, 60 Simcoe Street, Toronto (St. Andrew subway station)Dress:Smart casualVisit eattothebeat.ca for more information.
About WillowWillow Breast & Hereditary Cancer Support was founded in 1994 as a national, not-for-profit organization. Willow provides free-of-cost peer support, insight and information to anyone affected by breast or hereditary cancer.Visit willow.org for more information.
Registered Charity No. 89551 3737 RR001. A tax receipt will be issued in the name of purchaser, for the maximum amount allowable by Canada Revenue Agency.Group orders requiring individual tax receipts should register separately.If required, refunds are available upon request.If you have questions or require any further information, please contact Alicia Hoffman at 416.778.6314 x 236 or ahoffman@willow.org.

title: Hand Eye Society Ball: A Fancy Videogame Party
description: Experience an elegant night of videogames from around the world in the Masonic Temple, the famed heritage building in the heart of downtown.Dress up fancy, enjoy a curated selection of delightful and surprising games amidst music and mingling, and support a videogame arts not-for-profit at the same time!More details and poster art here!

title: Maschera: Deception, Mystery and the Unknown
description: There are only a few more weeks of Maschera before a new show is debuted.A mask; it allows you to hide, to change, to transform.  These are the opening lines spoken in Paul Prater’s show Maschera.  In this show, Paul talks about the power and seductiveness of masks while providing uncanny demonstrations of transformation, synchronicity and mindreading.What happens when you are asked to lie? Can you do so successfully or will your face betray you? Can a mask hide the truth?  Would you be willing to risk placing a curse on yourself to save another?  Can a mask actually confer true power on the wearer?  These are but a few of the questions explored in this terrific, interactive show.  Paul will share some very unique antiques and items he has acquired over the years while inviting the audience to take part in creating the performance.The entire audience is invited to attend while wearing masks of some type.  They can choose whether to keep them on and remain hidden or take them off to reveal themselves. The show has a limited number of seats available, so make sure to buy your tickets in advance.  You can get them online or at 109 & Co..  They are $10.00 in advance and $13.00 the day of the show.

title: Glory Days: A New American Musical
description: A year after graduating high school, four best friends reconnect on their old school's football field. Will has called the boys together with a mission: to hack into the sprinkler system so that it goes off when the jocks who bullied them in high school take the field for a charity game. But as the guys wait for instructions on how to break into the system, they quickly realize how dramatically their lives have grown apart. With a soaring pop-rock score,Glory Days is a poignant and witty coming-of-age story about friends searching for understanding and validation as they face the consequences of growing up.

title: Future of Yoga @ YJ LIVE: Estes Park
description: Yoga Alliance is coming to Estes Parkl! This is your chance to get your profile upgraded, ask questions and to gain knowledge about the future of the yoga industry! Not to mention you can grab a free professional headshot!We will have a photography studio set up in our booth at Yoga Journal LIVE's market place on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Our spokesman Andrew Tanner, E-RYT 500, will also be giving a presentation on Friday that is free and open to the public. Make sure to stick around and have your questions answered live during our Q+A.During the presentation, you'll learn:+ Current and future trends and opportunities in the yoga industry.+ Legal and regulatory issues around yoga and what YA is doing about it.+ How Social Credentialing works+ How to enhance your profile on our directory+ The ins and outs of our Continuing Education requirementSee you soon, CO Yogis! Make sure to RSVP and invite your friends too!

title: Social Media for Nonprofits- Boston, 2015
description:
Join us as we bring  together nonprofit decision-makers and supporters in the Boston area to share practical tips and tools for fundraising, marketing, and advocacy.  Speakers will address a variety of topics in a series of short, TED-meets-Twitter style talks and interactive workshops. We'll be adding a couple hands on workshops and breakouts this year to allow participants to get their hands on experience with measurement and designing compelling email newsletters.Who Should Attend?
Executive Directors & Founders
Development & Online Marketing Professionals
Marketing & Communications Staff
Nonprofit Bloggers and Media
Board Members & Volunteers
Nonprofit Consultants
Directors of Development
Social Fundraising Professionals
Key Takeaways:
Actionable insights for fundraising, marketing, and advocacy
How to incorporate social media into your fundraising and marketing efforts
How to maximize your presence on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn
Lessons learned by leading nonprofit practitioners and consultants
Measurement, analysis, and dash boarding best practices
How to recruit and engage volunteers using social media
Incredible networking opportunity with like-minded peers
Free and easy-to-use platforms and resources
Conference registration includes access to the full-day program, access to all breakouts, continental breakfast, and lunch.Refund and Cancellation Policy:We do not offer cancellations nor refunds, but we will gladly transfer your ticket to someone else if you notify us 48 hours before the event date. Tickets cannot be transferred to another city.

title: FORGE: Artist Health: Stress, Self Care & Safety
description: Free!FORGE: Artist's Health: Stress, Self Care and Studio SafetyWednesday, October 7, 6:30-8:30pm.Auditorium, Toronto Western HospitalYour health is important! Join the staff of the Al and Malka Green Artists’ Health Centre (AHC) at Toronto Western Hospital for a unique workshop focusing on your health and well-being.From dealing with stress, to repetitive strain injuries, use of harsh chemicals and demanding schedules, artists put a lot of strain on their physical and mental well-being. Join us to learn tips to take care of your body and mind.Come and meet Dr. Dugoua (Naturopathic Doctor), Ruth Bittorf (Nurse Practitioner) and Susan Lucas (Psychotherapist) as they guide you through self-care strategies including tips for managing stress, naturopathic medicine to heal the body and a guided meditation. The workshop will include an introduction to the services of the AHC, tour of the clinic and a Q&A.www.akincollective.com

title: Bethany Hamilton at Orchard Grove
description: Bethany Hamilton, professional surfer and author,  will be sharing her inspiring message of hope at Orchard Grove on  Sunday, October 18th.Doors will open 20 minutes prior to service start time for ticket  holders. Tickets for reserved seating are valid until five minutes prior to start time of  the service displayed on the ticket.  Upon the start time, seating will  be open to non-ticket holders at a first come first serve basis.  You  must have a paper copy or mobile phone copy of your ticket to enter the  event.Children: The Children's Ministry (KidsWorld) will be available for  children birth - 3rd Grade.  Children 5 years and older that wish to  attend the service with Bethany Hamilton require a ticket unless the  child sits on the lap of an accompanying adult ticket holder.If your plans change and you are no longer able to attend the service please cancel your ticket through universe.As we want as many people as possible to hear Bethany's inspiring  message of hope, please order only the amount of tickets needed and  attend only one service.

title: uPaint Events: Windswept Blossoms
description: Join us for a fantastic night of fun, painting, drinks, and food! Tickets include admission to uPaint Events painting class, instruction for 2 - 2.5 hours, music, free digital photography, and all supplies to create your painting!Food, drinks, and gratuities not included.Please arrive 15 - 20 minutes before the event start time to choose your seats, place food and drink orders, and get comfortable.uPaint Events is a mobile paint studio based out of New Bedford, MA. We teach social painting classes in almost any location: homes, offices, local restaurants, and more!uPaint Events is an exciting and creative experience for any skill level. Recommended ages 10+!

title: Calling All Rebels: The Moral Imperative To Revolt
description:
Tickets will be sold at the door for $25 if there is still any availability.$20 On-line General Sale$25 after September 6th If your organization wants a booth= $5010pm After Event Author ReceptionSchedule:Chris Hedges Author Reception: 10pmChris Hedges 8:00pmJill Stein 7:10pmGayle McLaughlin 6:20pmOriginalites: 5:40pm Melted: 5:00pmWe strongly recommend that you purchase your tickets in advance as there are only 640 seats available and this is an event will more than likely draw the interest of more than that. After the event there will be a 1 hour Reception for Chris Hedges in a smaller room at the Delhi Center. Tickets will be $100.. It will include Cheese and Wine. Only 70 tickets will be available. Chris will be at the event signing books.All Proceeds from Tickets and Alcohol Sales will go to the Green Party of Orange County so we can continue to promote and bring some of the Country's most influential thinkers and speakers to the Orange Curtain which will help us fund our candidates gain political office and address the core issues that effect our lives but both political parties have refused to touch. Like The Green Party of the Orange Curtain on FacebookAlso instead of taking Corporate Money... this is how we raise funds... Vendors:The May Day Coalition based in Santa Ana will be providing the food. Alcoholic Beverages will be served by Stir It Up Bar Crafts + Bev Catering. A local Mobile Bartending Company. Like Them On Facebook$5 Beer, $5 Wine, $7 Cocktail (It will be a Punch Drink). Parking:There is a Parking Lot that can fit many cars but there is also a residential area all around the venue that do not require permits in order to park there... It is free parking in the neighborhood.________________________________________________________________________________The Green Party of Orange County Presents:Calling All Rebels: The Moral Imperative of RevoltThis event features Chris Hedges, Jill Stein, and Gayle McLaughlinChris HedgesChris Hedges is a Pulitzer Prize Winning Journalist and Best Selling Author. He has written such classics as "War is a Force That Gives Us Meaning", "Days of Destruction Day of Revolt" and his new book "Wages of Rebellion: The Moral Imperatives of Revolt" which is causing all kinds of interest and controversy. He also has a weekly column at truthdig.com which you can check out HERE! He also has a brand new internet video pod cast called Days of Revolt: Chris Hedges was the Foreign Bureau Chief for the New York Times and covered the Central American Civil Wars, The Revolutions of Eastern Europe in the 1980's, The 1st Gulf War, The disintegration of Yugoslavia, and later moved to France to cover Al Qaeda in North Africa. He has lived in places like the Gaza Strip and has witnessed the true horrors the Palestinian people are faced with between the Authataurianism of Hamas in the Gaza Strip, the ineffectiveness of Palestinian authority, to the under reported suffering and oppression Israel causes through blockades, occasional invasions, violent reactions to protests, indiscriminate bombings and harassment (like flying Israeli Military Jets over residential areas at 3 am in the morning). Chris left the New York Times, a paper with an unofficial motto "Do not alienate our donors (leisure class) too much", around the time of the initial invasion of the 2003 Invasion of Iraq: Operation Iraqi Liberation (OIL) I mean Operation Iraqi Freedom. He was scheduled to make a commencement speech at Rockford College as a stage to denounce the invasion of Iraq.He as booed off stage and his mic was cut off twice... There was such a reaction to his speech at this College that the New York Times gave Chris an official warning to stop criticizing the Iraq war or he would be fired. He did not want to betray the ethics that his father instilled in him, who was a pastor, so he quit and shortly after released the book "War Is A Force That Gives Us Meaning" which was an non-chonologically organized book that talks about the horrors of Warfare and is a critical look about how violence, even if it is necessary, is a something that will poison us and that critique is used to analysis the war and violence of American society. Chris was there in the early days of the Occupy Wall Street Movement and became one of its most visible faces and voice. He and Cornel West put Wall Street on trail and was arrested outside of Goldman Sachs.Watch It Here:Chris was featured in one of Michael Moore's films "Capitalism: A Love Story"His new book called Wages of Rebellion: The Moral Imperative of Revolt. It is book that delves into the history of some critical revolutions and the leaders who uplifting the masses to rebel against the structures of power that had decay to such a state to cause people no longer accept a status quo that people so easily previously accepted as the natural order of things. Here is a panel of Chris Hedges, Cornel West, and Richard Wolff: How do you kick off a revolution? Chris over the years has been a strong advocate for "F***ing Up The System" as he called it when he addressed a Green Party in New Jersey in 2013. The video is a critique of the Green Party is that electoral politics should be a tangential element of the activities of the party's business while it should be a party of activism or at a very minimum a support group that can provide logistical support for supplying protesters with food and other materials they need to maintain their activities... A criticism the GPOC has taken seriously as we have realized that our party has been playing by the rules of system not designed for them on the State and National level but with the acknowledgment that there is a lot of potential on the local level. This includes blocking vehicles with roadblocks that are trying to frack your communities, occupying police stations, organizing prisoners who more than half are in prison for non violent drug offenses and are mainly black and latino to do hunger strikes/ stop working for companies(while in prison) that pay a wage comparable to wages paid to 8 year old Chinese factory workers, boycotting and divesting in institutions that support despotic regimes or countries like the Israeli Apartheid State, running for local political office like Ksama Sawant and shaking things up on the local level, Public Banking to replace the rapacious vampires  of Wall Street, and just starting to look into Alternatives all together because what we have now is not sustainable and if there are no alternatives proposed the Tinder box we call America is going to catch fire like the once unbothered Arctic Forests have been due to climate change.  Heed the Call Orange County. TIME TO THROW SOME WRENCHES INTO THE MACHINE.Also to understand the what Chris Hedges has been saying from a local context/perspective it is best to look at the Anaheim Police Department's extrajudicial killing of Manuel Diaz in the Summer of 2012 and how the police handled themselves afterwards... It is a common pattern around the country. So they already know how this is going to play out... the question is do you?
When a group of concern citizens started inquiring about the death of their neighbor Manuel Diaz the police of Anaheim had quite a reprisal for them. These are, in what Chris Hedges says, are brushfires that are breaking out and are being extinguished. Other Key examples Occupy Wall Street/The Marches on Ferguson, The Baltimore Riots, etc. The current conditions that exist to create right wing movements like the Tea Party, but since the grievances of many of these people are not being addressed: The public Bail Out of Wall Street and massive losses of property(their savings and homes) of many American citizens, The maimed veterans who are coming back realizing they are not fighting legal wars to the benefit of a handful of major companies (Dick Cheney's Haliburton stock price has quadrupled since before the invasion of Iraq) and are not being taken care of by Uncle Sam, People of minority communities are having members of their community lock away in prison for non-violent drug offense(by in large), America has lost around 60,000 major factories that has turned the countries inner economic core into an abandoned shell of its former self and has pitted the Cheap Labor of the 3rd World against the lowering wages of American workers and even the wage slavery/state sanction chattel in our own prison system which makes up of 25% of the world population of prisoners. The elite class knows this... they have designed this... and as a result they are passing laws or adding to laws like to the NDAA section 1021 and 1022 where it will be legal for the military to detain American citizens indefinitely... no habeaus corpus. Chris Hedges Sued Obama in Obama vs. Hedges and won in a lower court but it was thrown out because they ruled that Hedges had no standing... regardless if this would be a wonderful tool to disappear journalists just like Mr. Hedges who spends his time challenging the narrative our puppet leaders would have us believe. So the gun powder has outgrown the powder kegs and is all over the ammunition room... and we don't know when the start of this will ignite... but one this is for sure... the clock is ticking. Many of the conflicts and/or "brushfires" we are seeing today are is the beginning of the conflicts that we are going to see for the next century. It is on.  Chris Hedges Interview of Julian Assange:Written Version:Verbal Version:So they already know how this is going to play out... the question is do you?Jill SteinJill Stein is the Green Party Presidential Candidate for 2016. She was also for 2012.In 2012 She was arrested because she and her running mate Cheri Honkala for trying to enter a presidential debate. http://www.rt.com/usa/police-jill-stein-debate-589/Her Presidential Candidacy raises bigger questions for our Democracy as a whole. Do we as Americans actually get represented, our interests and values, during a Presidential campaign? We have a two party system and both parties are coalitions are several different interest group that are sometimes at odds with each other that have been bought out by economic interest group and it is a winner take all system. Even in places like Turkey, a country with Democratic organs, they even have a this thing called proportional democracy. The HDP won 13% and they are "attempting" to form a coalition government.  Our republic is very disproportionate in its representation of its people and on top of that it is bought out by more and more money thanks to the Citizen's United Decision which is exasperating these issues even further.One of Jill Stein's major policy pieces is her "Green New Deal" which is a Green version of FDR New Deal on how to stabilize the economy for the masses of people. Gayle McLaughlinGayle McLaughlin is the former Green Party Mayor of Richmond, CA. (The Bay Area). She made national headlines when after the housing crisis causes all kind of mayhem for the economy and non 1% America and especially the worker class her city had a crisis on her hands... Hundreds on families were loosing their homes. Many of these families were also paying 2-3 times more than the house was actually worth... all these homes were clearly underwater. So her plan was to use Eminent Domain, which is traditionally famous usually for how governments collude with private interests to force people to sell their property for "Fair Market Value" for the "good of the community" only to be used by commercial interests- like for making room for oil and gas pipelines through rural and suburban America though it also used appropriately in many cases like making room for Freeways, to be fair. "Under Richmond's plan, the city would seize the mortgage—but not the home—with backing from a private firm. They would then reduce the loan principal and refinance into a new government-guaranteed loan. That would leave the borrower with a fixed payment and less debt."Novel Use of Emminent DomainHere is Gayle on Bill Moyers & Company:  _______________________________________________________________________________Notes from Event Producer:When I threw an event with Dr. Richard Wolff in February of 2015 I was told by everyone that only 30 people would show up for the event. Even KPFK who drove Dr. Richard Wolff to the event said that only 30 people would show up because this is Orange County but when they showed up there eyes were wide open in amazement to the fact that there were 400 people sitting down in a room, after only 12 days of promoting the event, all to hear what the Marxian Economist had to say. What was said here is that Orange County is not what it used to be.The numbers also point to the fact that 90% of the online ticket sales were from people living in Orange County. The same will be true for this event.

title: Feature: Benefit & Opening VIP Evening
description:
VIP Benefit & Opening Evening
Wednesday October 21st, 2015  VVIP Collectors Preview : 4 pm - 10 pmVIP Opening Evening : 6 pm - 10 pmJoin us for this highly anticipated VIP evening, which offers exclusive access to a preview of the works from the 80 artists presented at the fair!This is a fantastic opportunity for patrons, collectors, art professionals and art enthusiasts alike to view a focused selection of cutting edge contemporary art while enjoying a festive evening in the presence of gallerists and artists.The generous support of VIP guests will provide a significant support to the Albright-Knox Contemporary and Modern Art Foundation Canada. The funds raised will be used to advance the stature of Canadian art and artists through collaborative projects.Our VIP program grants access to a variety of activities including cocktails, private collector tours and other exclusive events. VIP ticket holders can register for a maximum of two VIP activities.Soirée d'ouverture-bénéfice VIP de FeatureMercredi 21 octobre 2015VVIP Avant-première des collectionneurs : 16h à 22hVIP Ouverture de la soirée-bénéfice : 18h à 22hJoignez-vous à nous pour cette soirée hautement attendue, offrant un accès exclusif au travail de 80 artistes présentés à la foire !Il s'agit d'une opportunité exceptionnelle pour les mécènes, collectionneurs, professionnels du milieu des arts et amateurs de voir en exclusivité une sélection d'oeuvres d'art contemporain de pointe tout en prenant part à une soirée festive en présence des galeristes et des artistes.La générosité des invités VIP procurera un support significatif à la Albright-Knox Contemporary and Modern Art Foundation Canada. Les fonds levés seront utilisés pour promouvoir l'art et les artistes canadiens par le biais de projets collaboratifs.Notre programme VIP offrira un accès à une variété d'activités, incluant des cocktails, visites de collections privées et d'autres événements exclusifs. Les titulaires de billet VIP peuvent s'inscrire à un maximum de deux activités VIP.

title: Broetje Orchards Tour
description: Broetje Orchards has over 4,300 acres stretching nearly 10 miles along the Snake River northwest of Eureka. We will tour the orchard and learn about the planting, growing, and harvesting of the fruit. We will also see their storage facility, which can hold over 500 million apples, and see the packing lines that grade, sort, and package the fruit that ends up all over the world. The Broetje operation is unique in the apple industry in that the fruit is grown, stored and packed at the same location.

title: Cask Days 2015 - Session #4
description:
GENERAL TICKET INFO
Cask Days 2015 is a tasting event
Advertised ticket prices above includes HST (13%) and do not include online service fees
Online service fees will be added to the ticket price on the event registration page
Purchased tickets are non-refundable, but are transferable (unique ticket id)
Printed copy of your Cask Days 2015 ticket (sent via e-mail) must be presented at the door
Paypal, credit cards (Visa, Mastercard,Amex) and Interac are accepted for online orders
Only persons who are 19 years of age or older may attend event sessions 1-4
Session #5 will be all ages
Valid ID must be presented and will be checked at the door of the event location
Drink tickets are $2.50  for 5oz serving and will be available for purchase at event
Last call will be announced 45 minutes prior to advertised session end time
TICKETS INCLUDE
Four food and drink sample tokens ($10.00 value)
Commemorative 11th Annual Cask Days 2015 glass (each session has a unique design)
100+ breweries and 200+ beers brewed for the festival to choose from
One offs, collaborations, special imports and non-regularly produced beers will be available
Official Cask Days 2015 Festival Guide and tasting book
Live entertainment with local DJ's and live artists
Event security (off-duty police officers and evergreen brickworks security)
Elevated festival experience with attention to detail, quality and uniqueness
TOKENS
All Cask Days 2015 tickets include tokens in the ticket price (read above)
Additional tokens can be purchased during the event
Each token costs $2.50 
Tokens can be applied to beer, food and non-alcoholic beverages
Tokens can be used across all festival sessions
Once purchased, tokens are non-refundable
Unused tokens at the end of the event can be donated to charity
Food will be priced in values of $2.50, $5.00, $7.50 and $10.00
ATM machine will be available during the event
BEER
Cask Days 2015 is a tasting event, large servings will not be available
Samples of each beer and cider will be offered by the 5oz or 10oz pour only
Higher alcohol beers and ciders (7%+) will only be available by the 5oz pour
5oz = $2.50 (1 token) and 10oz = $5.00 (2 tokens) for all domestic or local offerings
Imported (outside of Canada) beers will only be offered by the 5oz for $5.00
The landed cost of imported beers is double the price of local beers

title: African Fashion Week Toronto 2015
description: African Fashion Week Toronto is one of the most recognized Fashion Weeks in Canada. The program was established by the Fashion Ready Foundation in 2012 and has developed into an internationally-recognized event. AFWT continues to grow each season, creating a community of designers, models and industry professionals who shape this unique experience.

title: Activate
description: ACTIVATE is an OMAC sponsored OOH forum bringing together industry leaders to discuss the evolving role of OOH and how digital and emerging technologies will continue to transform the OOH industry and drive future growth. Hear from agencies and marketers on how OOH creativity and innovation are delivering engaging and interactive consumer experiences with successful business results. Learn how mobile and social media can be effectively integrated with OOH to enhance brand relationships.Tickets for ACTIVATE event are NOT refundable.Date: Wednesday, October 28 2015Time: 7:30am to 12noonLocation: Glenn Gould Studio, 250 Front Street West, Toronto, ONFor more information about ACTIVATE, please subscribe to our newsletter by clicking here or contact Jacques Major at (416) 968-3435 ext. 107 or jmajor@omaccanada.ca

title: HAMLET | Scugog Shores Museum, Port Perry
description: Driftwood Theatre proudly presents Hamlet, the world’s most famous play, like you’ve never seen it before. On stage outdoors in communities across Ontario, July 9 - August 16, 2015. The summer tour will feature a thrilling new adaptation by dramaturg Toby Malone that is unpredictable, unsettling and downright dangerous - Hamlet with the brakes off. This electrifying revenge-thriller pits one man against the world around him as he sacrifices everything and everyone he loves to avenge his father’s murder.Young Hamlet’s world is turned upside down when, after the death of his father, his mother quickly marries Hamlet’s uncle Claudius. When the ghost of Hamlet’s father appears before him to accuse Claudius of murder, Hamlet is set upon a course of action which will have significant consequences for everyone that he holds dear. Hamlet is gripping tragedy fueled by grief and framed by a world dominated by the politics of fear.Both newcomers to Hamlet and Shakespeare aficionados will delight in this version; a perfect match for Driftwood’s inventive theatrical style and our magical outdoor settings.

title: Garden State Open 2015
description:
LEADERBOARD/HEAT SCHEDULEThe official date of the 4th annual Garden State Open at CrossFit 908 is Saturday, October 10, 2015.  Athlete registration goes on sale Friday, August 7th at 12PM.  We are again capping this year's competition to 150 athletes.  This includes men's and women's Rx and scaled divisions. ***This year - both men's divisions and scaled women's division sold out in just 30 minutes!***Josh Arcona (2012 & 2013's Garden State Open at CrossFit 908 winner and Regional CrossFit competitor/GRID Baltimore Anthem player) said this about the Garden State Open: "Thanks for an excellent competition! The WODs were challenging and tested a wide range of skills. I also wanted to comment on how well run the competition was from the tight scheduling to the standards being upheld by the judges. Definitely one of the best and most enjoyable contests I have participated in."NEW for 2015 - Cash prizes for the RX Division podium finishersKeep up to date with news on our Facebook page:  http://www.facebook.com/908GSOInterested in a being a vendor at this year's competition? Please email erin@crossfit908.com for more information!$90 for athlete registration.  $10 for spectator tickets (children under 18 are free).  A portion of the spectator ticket proceeds will go to the JDRF. JDRF is the leading global organization funding type 1 diabetes (T1D) research.  Tim Carroll, owner of CrossFit 908, was diagnosed with T1D in June 2012, so we feel strongly about donating to the JDRF.  Thank you in advance for your support!No refunds will be granted due to the event selling out in August.   
WORKOUTS:The GSO consists of 3 scheduled workouts and 2 floating workouts (Each floating workout is worth 50% of a scheduled workout).  No final workout, the winner is top scorer after five events.  All workouts will be announced on Monday, August 3rd.GSO 2015 Workout 1 - Frantastic (7 min time cap) workout standards:RX -21 Thrusters (95/65#)21 Pull Ups15 Thrusters (115/75#)15 CTB Pull Ups9 Thrusters (135/95#)*9 Bar Muscle UpsScaled -21 Thrusters (75/45#)15 Pull Ups15 Thrusters (95/65#)12 Pull Ups9 Thrusters (105/75#)9 Pull Ups*There will be a tie break time taken for the RX division after the last 9 thrusters are completed.            GSO 2015 Workout 2 - Triple Threat (8 min AMRAP) workout standards:RX -10 Toes to Bar10 Deadlifts (225/155#)10 Lateral Burpees over the BarScaled -10 Hanging Knee Raises10 Deadlifts (155/105#)10 Lateral Burpees over the Bar  GSO 2015 Workout 3 - Sprint Chipper (6 min time cap) workout standards:RX -30 Calorie Row20 Deficit Handstand Push Ups (4" for men, 2.5" for women)10 Clean & Jerks (205/125#)Scaled -30 Calorie Row20 Handstand Push Ups (head to 10# plate & abmat for men, head to 25# plate & abmat for women)10 Clean & Jerks (135/95#)  GSO 2015 Floater Workout 1 - Dumbburpees (workout standards):20 Dumbbell Burpees over 20" Box (Rx = 50/35#, Sx = 35/25#)   GSO 2015 Floater Workout 2 - Slam Sprint:200 Meter Run holding a Slam Ball (Rx = 50/35#, Sx = 35/25#)

title: Game On Winters: Winters Frosh Week 2015
description: Game On Winters!Winters Orientation Week is the best way for incoming AMPD and Communications students get to know their new home and family. Every September we plan an epic-filled week to introduce incoming students to the wonderfully weird world of Winters. We are an incredibly diverse community and our Frosh Week reflects that. There’s something for everyone during this week, from bumpin’ quad parties to movie nights. We also have the option of commuter sleepovers for those who don’t live on campus so that everyone has the chance to have the best week of all time! This year’s theme is GAME ON! So get ready to develop your character and LEVEL UP!Tegan Macfarlane and Jeffrey CollinsO-ChairsCheck us out on social media to stay informed with all the epic stuff we have planned!!Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/GameOnWinters/YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCktpBc1rXspAY1vS7zrwwUwInstagram: gameonwintersTwitter: @wintersfrosh15-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Please note: ALL FROSH WEEKS AT YORK ARE COMPLETELY DRYListen up, Gamers!!ALL YORK UNIVERSITY FROSH WEEKS ARE DRY. No alcohol. No drugs. This is a seriously important part of making this week the best that it can be. Under-aged Frosh won’t feel left out and sober connections are far more meaningful than drunken ones. We don’t need booze or drugs because Winters is so good at partying, we can do it sober. This week is a huge transition and can often be a little nerve-wracking. Just remember- everyone is on the same page. Being sober is the best way to make lasting friendships. Frosh Week is going to be so epic that alcohol is not needed. GAME ON.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------****No CASH SALES: Visa, Debit-Visa, MasterCard, Amex and Discover Cards are all accepted forms of payment********ALL SALES ARE FINAL******Please ensure to have YorkU Card/ Government Issued I.D at all times over the week**

title: The RUN Saga: BREATHE Red Carpet Movie Premiere
description: You are cordially Invited to the Main Event of the summer. Phoenix 4 in Association with McItoshBros & Good Theory Studios presents the Highly Anticipated Red Carpet Movie Premiere of  The RUN Saga: BREATHEThis night also marks the 25th Birthday of Director & Writer Frederick Nah IV.  Film: BREATHEWhen: 7:00pm Thursday July 30th, 2015Where: Studio Movie GrillRed Carpet Screening Industry ViewingPress Screening Special:$25.00 General Red Carpet Press Admission*Studio Movie Grill food and beverages are not added to this pricing.This is film is dedicated to the life of our crew memberSarah HowellWritten Directed Produced By:Frederick Nah IV"Faced with life’s obstacles, interrelated sets of situations control the fate of individuals who are connected. Four controversial and seemingly isolated stories interlock as the characters battle their own personal demons, as well as the burdens that society places on them. A young man deals with haunted nightmares of his abusive family past that seem to arise in his present. The story heightens as a Hispanic family deals with their father figure’s three year deployment to Iraq while coping with his absence in destructive ways. Dive into a complex, interracial religious family, whose faith is tested when dealt sexual tragedies and shocking truths. Finally a couple's consistent battle with pride and control leads to an untimely death in the family. Roots of history lie within a hidden deeper battle for their souls. That history shapes their present and fates their future. Before they face each other, they must first face themselves. In order for them to get to the end they must first begin. In order for them to begin to change situations in their lives they must first BREATHE "Executive Produced By:Ottavio LobefaroTom Clement Co Executive Producers:Claire Brigett Florentine Micheal Feingold Associate Producers:Ben DavisNilsa CastroDanny Williams, Akeeme ClarkeJohn KapUnit Production Management:Jessica NamDirector of Photography Josh Saidemen Christian MonckenbergCinematography By:Jabriel McIntoshJake Hart Assistant Directors:Adam WalkerClayton KoskiJae ShawlMusic Score By:Evan Hodges Ben WoodsSound Design By:Nicholas MinterStokes TurnerSean McCaneFilm Edited By:Carlos Bradley Assistant Editors:Carlos Ascencio Racquel MasonWalker WhitedIMDB PAGE

title: Black Alphabet Film Festival 2015
description: BLACK ALPHABET is proud to present our 3rd Annual Black Alphabet Film Festival!Black Alphabet is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization formed in Chicago, Illinois. Our premier program is the Black Alphabet Film Festival (BAFF), a film festival  designed and dedicated to showcasing works by and about the Black LGBTQ/SGL community. Our  mission is to empower our community by promoting, nurturing and celebrating the stories of Black LGBTQ-identified people through the art of film.The 2015 festival will open at The Reva and David Logan Center for the Arts on July 23rd and 24th on the south side at the University of Chicago campus in Chicago's historic Hyde Park neighborhood and then moves to Center on Halsted in the Lakeview neighborhood with two full days of screenings on July 25th and 26th. FAQWhen is the festival?The festival will take place July 23 - 26, 2015.Where is the festival being held?The festival will be held at the Reva and David Logan Center (915 E 60th St, Chicago, IL 60637) at the University of Chicago on July 23rd & July 24th. On July 25th & July 26th, the festival will be held at the Center on Halsted located at 3656 N Halsted, Chicago, IL 60613.Where can I see the film schedule?You can visit www.blackalphabet.org to access the film festival schedule. Are there accommodations for individuals with disabilities?Yes. We asked that you contact us in advance so that the staff may accommodate your needs to the best of our ability and email inquiries here. How can I contact Black Alphabet if I have questions?The best way to reach us via email or Facebook. (Click the highlighted links.) For a more detailed information about the Black Alphabet Film Festival 2015 in general, please visit our website at: www.blackalphabet.org

title: Coder Bridge Training Program
description: A 3 hour high-level overview and understanding of ICD-10 for those who are currently using ICD-9 and are working in an outpatient medical setting. AAPC instructors present the program which is ideal for administrators, clinical staff, front office, ancillary staff, and others needing ICD-10 awareness and a basic understanding of ICD-10 but who are not directly involved in implementation, coding and/or clinical documentation activities. The training is an excellent resource to help build organizational awareness of ICD-10 and support implementation efforts to transition to IDC-10. The training is provided by the Montgomery Business Development Corporation (http://montgomerybusiness.org/) in partnership and the Montgomery County Medical Society (http://www.montgomerymedicine/) and will be held at the Montgomery County Medical Society (see map below.)Cancellation policy: Full refund if cancellation received 48 hours prior to date of the class.

title: Human Centered Design for Product Owners
description:
Design should be driven by real people's problems and vetted through a process of problem finding rather than premature problem solving. Ultimately, it is the Product Owner's responsibility to mirror the goals of the business with the needs of the customer.Join us as we explore the partnership/collaboration between the Product Owner and User Experience teams through Human Centered Design. Our UX experts will walk you through:
connecting the dots from concept to creation by engaging end users
utilizing lean user research to create better informed design
discovering techniques for effective product ideation
defining methods to better integrate feedback loops into agile development
For additional information or questions, please contact Adam Simpson (asimpson@solstice-mobile.com) or Megan Gilmore (mgilmore@solstice-mobile.com)

Friday July 17 - 7:00pm

New York Times says, "Evokes something from a picture book!"  “I saw this circus when my son was in 3rd grade.  It was AWESOME...truly a cut above! Nino, the clown, is laugh out loud funny. Ever since then I've been hoping to see a circus as good. ” Teresa O., Great Barrington MAEat and play at Circus Alley 2 hours before each performance where everyone can enjoy games, test skills and dine on local cuisine. title: Ruined Heart
description: RUINED HEART: ANOTHER LOVE STORY BETWEEN A CRIMINAL AND A WHORENEW YORK PREMIEREKHAVN (aka KHAVN DE LA CRUZ), 2014 | CAST: TADANOBU ASANO, NATHALIA ACEVEDO, ELENA KAZANTHE PHILIPPINES/GERMANY | FORMAT: DCP | 73 MINUTES A nearly dialogue-free gangland visual tone poem shot in just four days in the slums of Manila by master cinematographer Christopher Doyle and directed by the king of Filipino digital filmmaking, Khavn De La Cruz (Mondomanila along with 47 other features and over 100 shorts!). Starring Japanese indie icon Tadanobu Asano (Ichi the Killer) and one of Mexico’s best new actresses Nathalia Acevedo (Post Tenebras Lux), Ruined Heart defies easy explanation. The basic plot is simple: Asano’s gangster rescues Acevedo’s whore and they go on the run. Along the way there is a Godfather (poet-playwright Vim Nadera) who is “the world’s poem,” dance parties, dream parades and carnivals, orgies, and murder. All of this is accompanied by wild visuals and an even wilder soundtrack. Acevedo’s exuberant acting and eye-popping costumes and Asano’s raw physicality (sequences where he runs through the back alleys holding the camera are some of the most striking in recent cinematic memory) create an emotional core to the action that gives the chaos a joyful tenderness that stays with the viewer long after the film is over.

title: Tiger Canyon Tour with Bob Carson
description: Join Whitman geology and environmental studies professor Bob Carson on an adventure up Tiger Canyon. This trip will include a geology field trip and a beautiful one-mile hike at the top of Tiger Canyon. Bob will discuss the canyon’s trees, rocks, faults and geologic history. Come prepared to have your eyes opened to the natural history of this area.Bring water, a lunch and be ready for an adventure. Whether you are a birder, wildflower enthusiast or just love to enjoy the fresh air while you learn, this hike is one not to be missed!

title: Gopher Dunes MX National
description: Gopher DunesGopher Dunes is known as the toughest track in the country. Not only do riders have to battle a rough, whooped out sand track, but mid-July usually brings out the hottest temperatures of the year, which makes it grueling for the riders. It's the first eastern round of the series where series regulars will be making a push to the front, and the hottest riders in the east will be looking to make their mark against some of the best riders in the world. You can see the majority of the track where ever you sit. It's a round not to be missed.Saturday is amateur day featuring the Eastern  Canadian Women and Super Mini Nationals.Sunday is Pro Day - practice starts at 8am, qualifiers start at 9am, and racing begins at 12pm. Camping available on-site.Directions to Tracks:From Hwy 401 Exit Hwy 59 Woodstock/Delhi and turn south onto 59.Travel for about 10 min. until you come to a small hamlet called Holbrook. You will see an Al’s Tire on your right and a sign for Oxford Road 13. You must veer off to your right onto 13 (do not follow 59 which makes a sharp curve to the left).Follow Oxford Road 13 for close to 10 minutes until you reach a small village called Springford and you come to a dead end stop.To continue traveling south, you must make a quick jaunt to the left and a quick right. After another 5 minutes you will come to stoplights. This is where Oxford Road 13 ends, and you cross over Hwy. 3 and will be back on Hwy 59 South.From the stoplights you travel 5 km. further and Gopher Dunes will be on your right hand side.For more detailed directions please visit www.gopherdunes.comTicket Prices:WeekendAdult        - advanced tickets $45, at-the-gate $50Under 12  - advanced tickets $25, at-the-gate $30Pre-schoolers (Under 4-years-old) FREESunday Pro DayAdult        - advanced tickets $30, at-the-gate $35Under 12  - advanced tickets $15, at-the-gate $20Pre-schoolers (Under 4-years-old) FREEHow to follow the series: Internet – www.mxnationals.ca, www.rockstarmotofest.ca, www.cmrcracing.com, www.mxpmag.com, www.directmotocross.com Facebook – www.facebook.com/CMRCMX, www.facebook.com/MXPMagazineTwitter: https://twitter.com/CMRCRacingGoogle +: https://plus.google.com/u/0/b/118314871843388361111/118314871843388361111/postsYouTube: www.youtube.com/cmrcracingInstagram: http://instagram.com/cmrcmxPinterest: http://www.pinterest.com/cmrcmxVine: https://vine.co/u/1058903116365598720Live Lap Times: Watch how each lap unfolds on your mobile device mobile.cmrcracing.com, or tablet or computer at www.cmrcracing.com.

title: Dr. Atul Gawande - Speaking of Being Mortal
description: MNHPC is pleased to present “Speaking of Being Mortal,” a life-changing conversation with best-selling author Dr. Atul Gawande, moderated by Minnesota Public Radio’s Cathy Wurzer. In his best-selling book, Being Mortal, author and surgeon Dr. Atul Gawande explores the limitations of health care delivery and what really matters in end-of-life care. Now he’s bringing his unique perspective to the Twin Cities.Dr. Gawande’s bold vision for improving performance in health care has made him one of the most sought-after speakers of our time, placing him among TIME magazine’s 100 most influential thinkers.Moderating the discussion will be Minnesota Public Radio’s (MPR) Cathy Wurzer, who recently collaborated with Bruce Kramer on the book We Know How This Ends, a chronicle of Kramer’s experiences living with ALS. We Know How This Ends will be available for purchase and you will have an exclusive opportunity to have Cathy Wurzer sign copies at the end of the program.Join us for transformational evening that will also include musical performances by the Steeles and the Larry McDonough Jazz Quartet.Cancellation Policy: All Registrations are final. No refunds will be given. Registrations are transferable.

title: Spend Analytics for Governments and Contractors
description:
Spend, Procurement and Contract Analytics for Governments and Government Contractors (Free Workshop)The Background:The George Washington University Virginia Science and Technology Campus (VSTC) based in scenic Ashburn, Virginia will launch the "Technology Acceleration Zone" initiative in Fall 2015 to drive public value through private growth in partnership with transformation catalysts Launch Dream, LLC and GOVonomy, Inc. The Goal:The goal of the GW Technology Acceleration Zone is to systematically bring federal, state and local governments, government technology contractor community and transformative technology suppliers together to build better, faster and more cost effective business technology solutions for the public and private sectors and to help grow the regional technology economy. Mini-Transformation Workshops:As a prelude to the launch of this initiative, the GW Technology Acceleration Zone will host "mini-transformation workshops" in June 2015 to introduce the concept, as well as to showcase presentations from transformative, high growth technology companies. Please register today if you plan to attend. Space is very limited. Workshop Details:This free transformation workshop brought to you by the GW Technology Acceleration Zone and GOVonomy features Jonathan White from Spikes Cavell, a global industry leader in procurement processing. He will discuss and demonstrate their transformative “Spend, Procurement and Contract Analytics Platform” which has processed over $500b in procurement data through an innovative man-machine interface. Agenda:
Introduction to the GW’s Technology Acceleration Zone
What is spend analytics?
Why do spend analytics?
How to do spend analytics?
Procurement data capture and transformation
Category management - how to make it work?
Analyzing your organization’s spend
Strategic sourcing and managing spend strategically
Cooperative procurement management
Using spend analytics to change buyer behavior
Delivering and measuring savings
Spend Analytics leader in action (live demo)
Case Study – Savings for the Country of Scotland
Case Study - The California State University System
Questions and answers
Location:The GW Virginia Science & Technology Campus, Exploration Hall, 20101 Academic Way, Room 410, Ashburn, VALike us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/GOVonomyFollow us on Twitterhttps://twitter.com/govonomyIn partnership with GOVonomy and Launch Dream

title: Fundraising Yoga Event @ London’s Living Room
description: The Greater London Authority is pleased to support "Africa Yoga Project" through this special fundraising yoga event. Tuesday 28th July 2015 at 18.00 @ City Hall, More London, SE1 2AARegistration starts at 17:30 Africa Yoga Project at the main entrance and yogis should be ready to start the class at 18:00.It will be a 60 min Ashtanga Vinyasa Yoga Class with Risa followed by a 15 min Meditationsession with Julita.After the class, yogis will be able to enjoy some free healthy snacks and smoothies. Please note that:- the room has toilet facilities- there is no shower facilities or changing rooms– yogis must bring their own mat; limited mats (~10) available on demand– complementary filtered water will be at your disposal at all time About the Africa Yoga ProjectAfrica Yoga Project was founded in 2007 after the post-election violence in Nairobi, Kenya. Their mission: empower, educate, elevate and employ lives in East Africa and globally through yoga. The charity supports economic development and alleviates poverty by creating a local market for yoga.For more details visit: www.africayogaproject.orgAbout Risa Risa is a qualified Ashtanga, Dynamic and Rocket Yoga teacher trained with the Yoga People (Yoga Alliance RYT 200 hours).  Risa's style of teaching is Ashtanga based Dynamic Yoga combined with Pranayama (breathing technique) and short meditation. By attending my classes, you will find yourself becoming stronger and balanced, both physically and mentally.  To find out more visit: http://risavasanayoga.com

title: Hope Connections: Atlanta
description: Hope ConnectionsDiscover Your Role in God's Mercy to the Poor. The Psalms say that God is “near to the brokenhearted and saves the  crushed in spirit.” And there are few experiences in life more beautiful  than when God chooses to use us to show His mercy to another.Join us for a meaningful evening of reflection and vision-casting  with Children’s Hunger Fund. Together, we will trace the amazing  connections that God is utilizing to provide hope for children here at  home and around the world. We hope you will discover your role in the  story of God’s mercy to the poor.We hope you will attend and bring with you friends who you believe will share your passion to deliver hope for suffering children. Speakers: Dave PhillipsPresident and Founder of Children's Hunger FundMichael RichardsExecutive Director, SouthD.A. HortonPastor, Author, SpeakerSunday, June 14, 20156:00-8:30 PMMaggiano's Little Italy 4400 Ashford Dunwoody Road #3035Dunwoody, GA 30346Buffet dinner to be served

title: MTE Presents "Art" June 4-6 @ 8pm, June 7 @ 2pm
description: By Yasmina RezaOne of Marc's best friends, Serge, has just bought a very expensive painting. It's about five feet by four, all white with white diagonal lines. To Marc, the painting is a joke, but Serge insists Marc doesn't have the proper standard to judge the work. Another friend, Ivan, though burdened by his own problems, allows himself to be pulled into this disagreement. Lines are drawn and these old friends square off over the canvas, using it as an excuse to relentlessly batter one another over various failures. As their arguments become less theoretical and more personal, they border on destroying their friendships. Directed by Keone Fuqua

description:

The event is free and open to the community. This is a great space for all current Giving Project participants, Social Justice Fund members, donors, and friends to learn more about progressive movements around the Northwest.  Make sure you select one panel for the morning and the afternoon.

title: Federal Market Intelligence Workshop on DHS
description:
Federal Market Intelligence Workshop on
Department of Homeland Security (Free)
The Background:The George Washington University Virginia Science and Technology Campus (VSTC) based in scenic Ashburn, Virginia will launch the "Technology Acceleration Zone" initiative in Fall 2015 to drive public value through private growth in partnership with transformation catalysts Launch Dream, LLC and GOVonomy, Inc. The Goal:The goal of the GW Technology Acceleration Zone is to systematically bring federal, state and local governments, government technology contractor community and transformative technology suppliers together to build better, faster and more cost effective business technology solutions for the public and private sectors and to help grow the regional technology economy. Mini-Transformation Workshops:As a prelude to the launch of this initiative, the GW Technology Acceleration Zone will host "mini-transformation workshops" in June 2015 to introduce the concept, as well as to showcase presentations from transformative, high growth technology companies. title: Ivey Entrepreneurship Bootcamp with Ash Singh
description: The Pierre L. Morrissette Institute for Entrepreneurship is excited to invite you to the Ivey Entrepreneurship Bootcamp.You may already be an entrepreneur, or you may be wondering if you have "it" in you. This bootcamp will pace you, hour-by-hour, through a syntax for the creation of a startup company out of a raw idea that you can pitch with confidence to qualified investors within 48 hours of a cold start. You may have an idea and passion for it, or you may simply be curious or have desire. You don't need an idea, or a pre-existing team, or certainty to attend and succeed at this bootcamp - but you do need to keep an open mind and work hard. Explore what you are capable of achieving.Date: Friday 7:00 p.m. on June 19 – Sunday 7:00 p.m. on June 21, 2015Location: Ivey Business School – Multipurpose Room (0140)Facilitator: Ash Singh, HBA 2004Fee: FreeCapacity: Space is limited to 30Food and refreshments will be supplied to all participants and space is limited for this bootcamp.For more information contact Shanthal Perera at sperera@ivey.caBio: Ash SinghMr Singh has accumulated over a decade of diverse experience in Sales, Marketing, Business Development, Business Model Innovation and General Management. He has led organizations through turn-around, start-up and high growth situations. His success in the field was noted by Business Week in 2009 as one of "Asia's Top Young Entrepreneurs" and reiterated by the Economic Times in 2012 for having "built a solid reputation as one of the most successful serial entrepreneurs in Southeast Asia".Over the past 15 years, Ash has focused on creating and bringing to market, applications and services in the mobile, trans-media, digital and Internet spaces. While still a student at Chinese University in Hong Kong, he conceived and launched SNBS, a corporate social networking company which was acquired when he was just 22 years old.In his next role, Ash served as the Chief Technology Officer for At-Life, which created Singapore’s largest customer loyalty rewards program with 500,000 members, for McDonald's in all of their 125 restaurants.Ash is the founder Interactive SG - Asia's leading digital media and new business accelerator based in Singapore. Interactive.SG has already collaborated on new media projects with established companies from such diverse industries as entertainment, technology, real estate, and educationHis project "The Angel's Gate" is Asia's first 360 TV platform for entrepreneurs that was aired prime-time on MediaCorp's Channel NewsAsia and YouTube.Singh is also committed to nurturing the next generation of entrepreneurs. He is a speaker and honorary judge for business venture competitions at INSEAD, SMU, NUS, NTU, Synergy Business School (Russia) and his alma mater, The Ivey Business School.As a basketball fan, he is a co-owner and "super fan" of the Singapore Slingers professional basketball team.In his free time, Ash promotes his favourite hobby, turbans, through his mobile app "Turbanizer" which is on track for 1MM downloads this year.

title: Empowered Heart Yoga Retreat
description: This retreat is designed to awaken your body, mind and heart to receive all the goodness around you and within you!  What better place to reconnect to oneself then the warm climate of Sayulita, Mexico nestled in the jungle along the coast of the Central Pacific Ocean. We will be footsteps away from an amazing private beach and be fed fresh organic meals three times a day at the Haramara Resort. This is the perfect place to escape the busy life and truly unplug for a week.  There is no electricity at the resort; you can of course travel into town and connect there but the resort will be your sanctuary for true relaxation and letting go. We shall see what happens when the phones and computers close and your inner life opens. Let's unwind and reconnect together through yoga, meditation and play.There will be two yoga classes offered a day as well as guided meditation and breath practice led by special guest teacher Noé Khalfa. In the evenings, there will be a inspired class offered to enliven your spirit and bring you closer to your creative passion center: your empowered heart.

title: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck with Tomi Swick
description: Limited tickets are also available at the door, cash only, on a first come, first serve basis. Box office opens at 7:30 pm on the night of the event.Kurt Cobain: Montage of HeckRating: STC (Subject to Classification)Running Time: 132 minutesHailed as one of the most innovative and intimate documentaries of all time experience Kurt Cobain like never before in the only ever fully authorized portrait of the famed music icon. Academy Award® nominated filmmaker Brett Morgen expertly blends Cobain’s personal archive of art, music, never seen before movies, animation and revelatory interviews from his family and closest friends. Wildly creative and highly acclaimed, follow Kurt from his earliest years in this visceral and detailed cinematic insight of an artist at odds with his surroundings.With a musical performance by Tomi SwickDepending on how much rain is falling, the event may be able to move indoors at 99 Sudbury and run on the same schedule as if it were outside. In the unlikely event that the indoor venue is unavailable, a raincheck will be provided to a future screening. All info will be sent to the email address provided when purchasing your ticket. Tickets are non-refundable. In the event of a cancellation, proceeds from tickets will be donated to MusiCounts. Please use an email you check frequently for information regarding any potential cancellations.

description: After leaving the helm of the Biff's Bistro kitchen in 2012 to open his own restaurant, Porzia, Chef Basilio Pesce is back for one night only, going head-to-head against Biff's own Chef Amanda Ray.  The duo will battle it out for mouths and minds, with a menu that will make everyone a winner except those who miss out! Biff's Bistro Presents: France vs. ItalyMay 26, 7pm $95 per person, including tax and gratuitiesWelcome Sparkling & Amuse-Spot Prawn Crudowith preserved lemon(Basilio Pesce)-Fromage Blancwith asparagus, wild leeks, garlic scapes & green peppercorn crostini(Amanda Ray)-Spring Pea Tortelliniwith brodo & smoked pancetta(Basilio Pesce)-Chermoula Lamb Saddlewith chickpea gnocchi à la Parisienne, sauce verte, red peppers,fava beans, cumin labneh & lamb jus(Amanda Ray)-Duel of Éclairsyou choux the winner(Amanda Ray vs. Basilio Pesce)

title: The Movement: 50 Years of Love and Struggle
description: In this performance written, co-directed, and performed by EMMY-Award-winning actor Ron Jones, he plays a range of characters - both comedic and poignant - that will take the audience on a journey through the ever-changing face of the African-American experience. Supported by original and interactive video, stock historical footage, notable quotes and some of the most memorable music of the last two generations; Jones will weave the tapestry of struggle and triumph that made for the fastest cultural expansion of any group in American history and the effects it has had on our cultural self-perceptions even to this day.

title: When Art Meets Jazz
description: Only one thing is for sure. At 4 pm on Saturday, May 23 at the Fresno Art Museum, no one knows what is going to happen. That's the beauty of art (and music) that is based on improvisation. “When Art Meets Jazz” is not the typical art show or jazz concert. Rather than displaying their work while a jazz trio plays softly in the background and the audience sips chardonnay and nibbles on cheese, seven amazing Valley artists will begin with a blank canvas - literally. As the show begins, they will draw their inspiration from the improvised music of many of the Valley's best jazz musicians and the atmosphere of the event itself and create work on the spot. The event will feature two stages: inside the museum's Bonner Auditorium and outside in the Sculpture Garden. The early hours of the event will feature the five ensembles of the Milestones Youth Jazz Workshop, student musicians from 18 schools who study weekly with four acclaimed Valley jazz educators.    At 7 pm, a collection of the Valley’s best jazz pros will take to the stage. Accompanying the musicians will be notable local artists who will follow no rules except to be inspired by the sights, sounds and rhythm of the event. The event will also include a silent auction, no-host cocktails and local  food trucks. The work created by the professional artists, in fact, will also be up for bid – before it is created – bringing yet another new twist to the event. Participating local artists include Leslie Batty, Bill Bruce, Yuliya Gasio, Chris Janzen, Garrett Masterson,  Will Portis and Anne Scheid. Participating musicians include Eva Scow and Espacio, the Tim Shaghoian Trio (with Spee Kosloff and Nate Guzman), the Richard Giddens Trio (with Tom Wilson and Brian Hamada), the Ayala-Lewis Quintet (featuring John Ayala, Joe Lewis, David Aus, Kevin Hill and Joe Lizama), and the Fresno City College Faculty Some-tet. Serving as emcee for the event will be the Cultural Arts Rotary Club's Dr. Jackie Ryle. The event benefits both the Fresno Art Museum and the Milestones Youth Jazz Workshop. Day of event tickets will be sold at the door for $25, space permitting.

title: Contempo Physical Dance presents Vulcão May 29-31
description: Forces acting within the Earth, generally unseen by humans, manifest themselves in awesome displays of fiery power. Vulcão is Contempo Physical Dance’s latest collaboration between choreographer Marciano Silva dos Santos, composer Divanir Antonio Gattamorta, and its unified and fiercely athletic cast of dancers. Utilizing the company’s Afro-Brazilian contemporary dance fusion, the work takes inspiration from volcanoes, which are both majestically beautiful and powerfully dynamic. Also slang in Brazilian Portuguese to describe someone extremely desirable or detested, Vulcão goes beyond nature to reveal parallels found in human relationships. From shifting tectonic plates to fluid and viscous lava, the work pushes the dancers’ physicality and displays their unyielding vitality. In addition to the world premiere of Vulcão, Contempo Physical Dance will perform excerpts from Batuque, a memorable favorite from the company’s repertoire exploring the flavors of samba. Join us at Macalester College this May for Contempo Physical Dance’s Saint Paul debut performance.“This  activity is made possible by the voters of Minnesota through a grant  from the Metropolitan Regional Arts Council, thanks to a legislative  appropriation from the arts and cultural heritage fund.”

title: The Social Collective: Newness
description: The Social Collective is pleased to invite you to its next event on May 20th from 7pm to 9pm  at Soho House Toronto (192 Adelaide St. W., Toronto, ON M5H 0A4).   Our discussion will be led by Aliyah Shamsher, Features Editor of Elle  Canada and Founding Editor of the arts and culture publication ISSUE28.On Nostalgia, Newness & The Internet  We are living in the most technically advanced eras in human history.  Yet, as our technological capabilities evolve at an almost alarming rate, culture is simultaneously overrun with nostalgia-soaked revivals and the mimicking of styles and looks from nearly every decade pre-2000.In  the wake of sometimes feeling like we may be running out  of new ideas,  perhaps it is time to ask some questions: what exactly  are we producing;  how are we producing it; and why are we producing so  much of it?We hope you can join us for an engaging session and to mingle with fellow art and culture enthusiasts over a light dinner.Love,TSC TeamThe Social Collective is brought to you by Bazaar Marketing & Communications Inc.

title: 2015 MEGAPOLIS Audio Festival
description: NOTE: online ticketing has ended! To buy at the door on Friday night (7-10p), come to the the Lab (2948 16th St., SF). Or on Saturday (10-5p), head to E.M. WOLFMAN BOOKS (410 13th St., Oakland).A weekend-long celebration of sound from June 5th to 7th in Oakland + San Francisco. Showcasing artists of all stripes who use audio as their primary medium. Fun times several million (that's math). Featuring Matmos, Roman Mars, Doseone, Al Letson, Kevin Blechdom, Fantastic Negrito, and 30 more workshops, performances, electronic experiments, subversive audio tours, installations, and more.Full festival lineup at megapolisfestival.org.Those who buy a full festival pass are automagically registered in a raffle for one of three revolutionary sound-making gadgets (the QuNeo, QuNexus, and K-Board) by local device-making wizard Keith McMillen.SUPERFUN UPDATE!!! Ableton gave us three licenses of Ableton Live intro to throw into our amazing raffle. That's one of three more special things you could win if you buy a pass at. this. minute.

title: Ramp Up 2015
description: Barriers in our built environment prevent many people from accessing the spaces that they desire. StopGap created the Community Ramp Project to raise awareness about this issue whereby organizations with single step entryways are invited to participate and receive a deployable ramp at no cost. This summer we will be bringing a Community Ramp Project to six different Ontario communities, to do it, we will need your support. Mark May 29th on your calendars and come out and enjoy music, drinks and fantastic eats from local restaurateurs. Help make an impact on people's lives and support accessibility for all. Bring your wallet to bid on a selection of 24 custom painted ramps, uniquely illustrated and decorated by local artists. Hope to see you there!

title: Techweek | Kansas City 2015
description:
For a more detailed explanation of our badge experiences and more information about Techweek Kansas City 2015 in general, please visit www.techweek.com!For more information visit:www.techweek.comDetailed questions? Contact us!Connect with us: Facebook | TwitterAbout Techweek: Techweek is a 7-day conference, expo and festival where entrepreneurs, tech visionaries and thought leaders meet to enable the innovation ecosystem in the cities of Chicago, New York City, Los Angeles, Kansa City, Miami and Detroit.
