title: Ravel's "L'Heure Espagnole"
description: Stu&Jess Productions has made it their mission to present talented,  young singers in unique, non-traditional venues. "L'Heure Espagnole"  marks the third collaboration of Stuart Martin and Jessica Derventzis,  the creative team behind Stu&Jess Productions, their first success  having been with Gian Carlo Menotti's "The Medium" in the fall of 2013,  which was presented in a re-envisioned church. Their production Ravel's  comedic classic will be given a modern twist, housed in the upper floor  warehouse of the Techno-Lith paper company in Montreal.Ravel's classic "L'Heure Espagnole" It is the clockmaker          Torquemada's day to regulate the municipal clocks, and consequently, it is wife Concepción's          day to entertain her lover. When Ramiro, a muleteer, visits the clockshop          to have his watch repaired, Concepción worries that his presence will          ruin her rendezvous with the poet Gonzalve. To distract Ramiro, Concepción          asks him to carry out various tasks. Another suitor, Don Inigo, arrives,          and a hilarious attempt to hide the lovers from each other and smuggle          each of them to her bedroom without Ramiro noticing ensues. Finally, Concepción--weary          of her suitors' antics--exits with the virile muleteer. Torquemada returns, delighted to see so many eager customers with his wife. This opera is performed in French with English subtitles and runs just under an hour. This production is made possible by a grant from "Dandy Andy Award for Performance Arts" from the Main & Station Nonesuch. CAST:Stage Director: Jessica DerventzisConductor: Stuart MartinStage Manager: Samantha PickettFeaturing the Stu&Jess OrchestraRamiro: Dimitri KatotakisTorquemada: Lee ClappConcepción: Charlotte GagnonGonzalve: John CookDon Inigo: Russell WustenbergTickets: $20 for children, seniors, students and arts workers               $25 for adultsOption for donations to Stu and Jess Productions with ticket purchase!Due to the nature of the venue, it is not handicap accessible.For all ticket and production inquiries, please call 5147096834 OR 4162763241 and NOT the Techno-Lith StudioWhere to go: The entrance of Techno-Lith LTD is at 141 Rue Ann. Parking  is available if required at 956 Rue Ottawa, in the designated  Tehcno-Lith spots.Transit:1)Take bus 107 to Peel and Wellington2) Go to Station McGill, and take bus 61 to Wellington/AnnVERSION FRANCAISE:L’heure espagnole de Ravel Vous êtes à Tolède. Et chaque jeudi, Concepción reçoit la visite de son amant poète, pendant que son horloger de mari, Torquemada, s'occupe des horloges municipales. Mais la présence intempestive d'un financier amoureux et d'un muletier têtu compromet son rendez-vous hebdomadaire. Force lui serait de rester sage si le vigoureux muletier, venu faire réparer sa montre, ne profitait de la situation...Cet opéra sera chanté en français avec sous-titres anglais et dure un peu moins d’une heure. Cette production est rendue possible par une subvention de "Dandy Andy Award for Performance Arts" de Main & Station Nonesuch. Billets : 20 $ pour les enfants, les personnes âgées, les étudiants et les artistes $ 25 pour les adultes Possibilité de faire un don à Stu et Jess Productions lors de l’achat de vos billets ! Pour toute information au sujet des billets et de la production, prière de contacter 514-709-6834 OU 416-276-3241.S’il vous plaît, ne PAS communiquer avec le studio Techno-Lith. Directives : L’entrée de Techno-Lith ltée est située au 141 Rue Ann. Un stationnement est disponible si nécessaire au 956 rue Ottawa, dans les espaces Tehcno-Lith désignés. Transport en commun : 1) Prendre le bus 107 à Peel et Wellington 2) Aller à la station McGill, et prendre le bus 61 à Wellington/Ann

title: Barnstock BYOB Music Fest
description: Barnstock is a a local grassroots benefit music festival held every summer in Huntersville, NC. Over the past six years, Barnstock has generated more than $50,000 in financial support for charitable organizations such as the Davidson Fire Department, W.A. Hough High School, Cannon School, Second Harvest Food Bank of Metrolina, and The American Red Cross. The Barnstock experience caters to all genres of music and attracts festival-goers from across the country.

title: TEDxSanFrancisco
description: Theme: A DAY TO REMEMBERLocation: Pier 70, San FranciscoDate: Oct 29This is the first TEDxSanFrancisco curated by Niki Ernst, global TEDxAmbassador & Florian Brody. It will be a TEDx event for the local TEDx community of SF and the Bay Area, but also a global network of TEDx organisers, fans and friends and everyone who will gravitate to San Francisco on Oct 29. Niki Ernst is a global traveller and the line up of speakers is a reflection of his constant travel, meeting the best, our planet has to offer.Tickets are non-refundable

title: East Chinatown Tasting Tour
description: Bites & Sights next journey is to East Chinatown. The second largest Chinatown in Toronto is well-established, but if you haven't been there in awhile, you will be surprised of the not so hidden gems.Among the markets and restaurants, new shops and restaurants are opening as the neighbour has been changing. Now, you have a variety of food options inspired by French, Italian, Mexican, Canadian and of course Chinese cuisine.This will truly be a unique experience

title: JNF Future Tech Shuk
description:
Innovation. Creativity. Ingenuity. Entrepreneurship.Tech Shuk is a start-up showcase and networking event for entrepreneurs, venture capitalists and young professionals.The event features a Demo Pit (Shuk) where representatives of Toronto-based  start-ups will showcase diverse and innovative products and services. As well, 3 companies will be selected to present to our 'Lions' in a Dragon's Den-style competition. The winning company, as determined by the attendees, will receive a mentorship package.Our 'Lions' are: 
Matthew Golden (Managing Director, Golden Venture Partners)
Daniel Klass (Managing Partner, Klass Capital)
Matthew Leibowitz (Partner, Plaza Ventures)
Ben Zlotnick (CEO & Founder, INcubes)
Yishay Waxman (Entrepreneur)

(Food included in the ticket price, Kashrut Observed)Thank you to our Generous Sponsors:Presenting Sponsor: The Asper FoundationPlatinum Sponsor: Event MobiGold Sponsors: Chuck & Marilyn Gold and Fabricland Fasken Martineau, Slavens & Associates, Tandem Investment and TorquestOfficial Transit Sponsor: MoovitOfficial Media Sponsor: Canadian BusinessCommunity Partner: MaRSFor any questions please contact rebecca@jnf.ca

title: 2015 Two Brothers Summer Festival
description: The Two Brothers Summer Festival is a weekend long music, food and beer festival focused on charity and community. The idea stems from the ideologies of the Ebel brothers, owners of the Two Brothers Brewing Company. Two Brothers Summer Festival was created to raise money and awareness for a growing list of charities, as well as give back to the local and regional community. Two Brothers Brewing Company is proud to have granted several wishes via the Make-A-Wish Foundation and helped a number of other children’s charities in its 18 years. This year The Two Brothers Brewing Company will donate net proceeds from the festival to Make a Wish Illinois and Friends of Fisher House Illinois, helping military families.Children age 12 and under can enter the festival for free with a paid adult ticket.Sunday is Family Day with activities for the kids, everyone enters for free, no ticket required.Tickets are non-refundableJUNE 26th- 28thFriday Festival Hours: 5pm - 11pmFriday Concert Lineup:6:30pm Train Company8:30pm DawesSaturday Festival Hours: 3pm - 11pmSaturday Concert Lineup:4pm Brent Brown5pm Under The Willow6:15pm Cornmeal8:30pm Jason IsbellSunday Festival Hours: Noon - 6:00pmSunday Concert Lineup:1pm Medtality Roots Featuring Zion

title: RAPUNZARELLA WHITE, a Fairly Fractured Tale
description: Stir in a pinch of Bullwinkle with a dash of Carol Burnett, and what do you get? A Charming Musical that Appeals to the Kid in Each of UsRapunzel,  Cinderella, and Snow White are triplets who are stolen by an angry  witch.  When she casts an evil spell, each sister is catapulted into her  own fractured fairytale -- Rapunzel craves junk food, Cinderella has  self-esteem issues, Snow White is allergic to apples, and each dreams of  being rescued by a handsome Prince.Beau,  Barry, and Burly Bob may be a little more bashful and bumbling than  bright, but with the help of the Fairy Tailor and a little magic, they  all live happily ever after!  Written by June Rachelson-Ospa and Daniel NeidenDirected by Daniel NeidenRunning time: 60 mins."Great songs, great comedy, and the best singing you'll hear on or off Broadway." ~ Mike Reiss, Writer for #TheSimpsons“Rapunzarella White is everything a kids show should be: Colorful, fun, inclusive, and totally delightful! It is  a clever spin on three fairy tales that all of us know and love. Plus,  the music and lyrics are smart and sharply performed by a talented group  of actors.”~ Jack Hyman, Author of "Breakfast with the Birds"“It's better than the Spongebob movie!”~ Sofia L., age 6"...there  is nothing kids love more than being silly!  RAPUNZARELLA WHITE is  wonderful.  These marvelous actors totally connect with the whole  family.”~ Frances Breuer, Pre-school teacher“…an unabashed joy!  Terrific music, an adorably sassy script, and zingers that keep parents laughing along.”~ Bruce Kluger, Contributing Editor, Parenting Magazine"My daughter and I saw Rapunzarella White this weekend and loved it! She walked out and immediately said she wanted to see it again. This is the first time she's felt that way about a show....It really felt like the kind of show I saw and loved as a kid. Not so easy to find anymore."~ Vivian Connolly, a NYC mom“It’s a total delight!” ~ Mary McCormack, Tony Award-winning actress from Broadway's BOEING-BOEING

title: uPaint Events: Paris in Bloom
description: Join us for a fantastic night of fun, painting, drinks, and food! Tickets include admission to uPaint Events painting class, instruction for 2 - 2.5 hours, music, free digital photography, and all supplies to create your painting!Food, drinks, and gratuities not included.Please arrive 15 - 20 minutes before the event start time to choose your seats, place food and drink orders, and get comfortable.uPaint Events is a mobile paint studio based out of New Bedford, MA. We teach social painting classes in almost any location: homes, offices, local restaurants, and more!uPaint Events is an exciting and creative experience for any skill level. Recommended ages 10+!

title: CASA DRAMA - Slings and Arrows
description: CASA DRAMA: Slings and Arrows – Shakespeare’s Hamlet ReimaginedDirected by Dave Barton/Monkey Wrench CollectiveCasa Romantica CommissionApril 10, 11, 17 & 18Tickets: Members $20, General Admission $25Visitors will be guided through the Casa as adapted scenes from Shakespeare’s classic play throughout the Casa in this unique and modern theatrical experience. Moderate walking will be required.

title: The Entrepreneurship Society: Cdn vs U.S. equity
description: Join your fellow high-growth entrepreneurs and industry experts on May 27, for our two-year anniversary  Entrepreneurship Society event, at the Blake, Cassels & Graydon LLP office in downtown Toronto.Attendees can choose from the following roundtable discussion topics:1. Canadian versus U.S. equity. You need to raise money. Which route should you go?2. How to position your company for sale. How to manage your exit when the time comes.3. Sourcing and landing top talent. One of the great business challenges in today's economy.We'd like to thank our sponsors: Blakes, EY, Entrepreneurs' Forum, Telus, CFO Centre, Sales Enablement Centre and Air Canada, which will be raffling off one round-trip economy-class ticket!

title: Open Farm - Annual Season Launch Event
description:
Fresh City's annual season launch event is here and YOU'RE INVITED! Please join us at our farm and greenhouse in Downsview Park on Sunday, June 7th from 1-4p.m. You can expect: 
Free farm tours & workshops led by Fresh City member farmers
A pop-up farmer's market featuring local makers 
Farm Yoga (Open Flow - All Levels) led by Laura Baron of YogaBe from 2:00-3:00p.m.
Nature crafts & scavenger hunt
Children's garden drop-in sessions with Downsview Park from 1:30-3:00p.m.
Local beer from Indie Alehouse

Live music by The Most Loyal

Tickets for this event are FREE! Food and drink will be available for purchase. Bring a blanket, a yoga mat, your friends and family, and enjoy a beautiful summer's day on the farm! We will be joined by:Cookie Martinez (meat & veggie empanadas)Downsview ParkEarth + City (salads, wraps, smoothies & juice)Evelyn's CrackersFresh City Member FarmersIndie AlehouseJ.K. FriesLocalista Food Truck (steak & meatball sandwich)Pekoe KombuchaPrairie Boy (locally baked bread)Shockingly Healthy (brownies, blondies & cookies)Soup GirlToronto Tool LibraryUrban Acorn (chicken & vegan sandwich)Village Juicery (fresh, cold-pressed juices)YogaBeYou can also join Downsview Park Nature Connection from 12:00-1:00 for a Garlic Mustard Pesto Workshop! Details and registration here.

title: Front Range Rally 2015
description: The Front Range Rally is a festival celebrating Colorado’s rich culture of Craft Brewing and the emergence of a growing cadre of quality Mobile Food Vendors. The two certainly go hand-in-hand and are a logical choice to support the work of Food Bank for Larimer County.Last year, 40 Craft Breweries and 10 Food Vendors served up an amazing array of unique food and fantastic beer. If you were there, you know what a blast it was. With 50 Craft Breweries and 12 Food Trucks, we’re working to make it even better this year.One Hundred Percent of the net proceeds from the festival go directly to Food Bank for Larimer County. In 2014, with a staff of 34 and over 2,400 volunteers, Food Bank provided more than 8.9 million pounds of food to thousands of people who struggle each day to feed themselves and their families. Front Range Rally is proud to be part of their mission. You can find more information about them at http://www.foodbanklarimer.org/Get your tickets early.  Prices go up after April 15th.  Must be 21 years of age to attend.

title: Spring 2015 Demo Day Dinner
description: Demo Day is coming up quickly and as usual we'll be hosting a dinner after the pitches to celebrate the Spring 2015 cohort and we'd love for the FounderFuel alumni to join us.The dinner will be held at the Rialto Hall and should be a major event! We'll be crossing over the 100 attendees line and the table will have the be even bigger! And with summer quickly approaching our theme will be BBQ. So that means lots of yummy BBQ'd meats & vegetables with tons of salads and sides.Please RSVP if you'll be coming so we can plan for how much food we'll need.We look forward to all the eating, drinking and merry making!

title: Celebrate Earth Day at Twin Rivers Ranch Preserve
description: Join us for an early celebration of Earth Day and help us do critical maintenance of our riparian buffer plantings at Twin Rivers Ranch Preserve near Shelton.  We will be removing weeds from existing plantings, and installing plant protectors around recently planted trees.

title: Everything Easter at Fort York
description: Everything Easter is Toronto’s newest Easter Egg Hunt to take place on April 4th 2015 at Fort York. This fundraising event is being planned by the final year Special Event Student’s from George Brown College’s Special Events Program. Half of the proceeds will be going to the Ronald McDonald House Charity and half will be going towards bursaries for GBC students. There will be an Easter egg hunt, crafts, egg race, raffle and much more.  Come and join us with your WHOLE FAMILY to enjoy Fort York's Easter Egg Hunt!

title: Burger Brawl - Rumble in the Kitchen Chef Battle
description: Burger Brawl is not about being nice. Burger Brawl is not about being just ok. Burger Brawl is an all out battle for the right to be called the best.A series of midnight showdowns between some of Canada's most passionate chefs. Using everyone's favourite quick grabs as a canvas, our battles will pit two chefs against each other to create their signature burger using secret locally sourced ingredients.The winning chef will win bragging rights to be called the Burger Brawl King for a month while featuring the winning burger at their establishment.Burger Brawl brings the burger back to basics. No pretentiousness, only passion and creativity! So get ready Toronto, as our chefs battle it out to win your hearts and stomachs! Let the gloves come off, get ready for the Rumble in the Kitchen.Intro Video: https://youtu.be/prw-f5I7S1AUNDERCARD BATTLE:The Good Son Kitchen vs Lisa Marie KitchenMAIN BATTLEVITTORIO COLACITTI (The Good Son) vsMATT BASILE (Lisa Marie/Fidel Gastro's)DATE: WEDNESDAY, APRIL 15THDOORS OPEN: 11PMLOCATION: THE GOOD SON ( 1096 QUEEN STREET WEST)TICKETS: $10 (EARLY BIRD)$15 (ADVANCED)$20 (AT THE DOOR)

title: PROMdemonium 7
description: Ottawa’s radical, community-oriented, gender-bending, bike-loving,  enviro-humping, queer-diggin’, slow dancing, big dress wearing prom that  you never had is back at it! The PROMdemonium rocketship  is blasting-off Saturday, April 11, 2015 at the Glebe Community Centre. title: IdentityNorth 2015 - May 7 & 8th
description:
2015 Theme:Canada First. Strong Digital Identity For A Robust Digital Economy.Now is the time for us to step up. We have all the ingredients and participants required to build a future that is the envy of the rest of the world. Strong digital identity technologies, processes and partnerships will be the foundation of a robust digital economy. We call upon all attendees of IdentityNorth 2015 to seize the opportunity that is before us: affirm Canada’s place leading the development and adoption of robust, scalable, privacy-enhancing digital identity ecosystems that serve the needs of all stakeholders, securing digital transactions.
What is IdentityNorth?IdentityNorth is the leading event for individuals and organizations interested in digital identity and the digital economy.  It is an important platform to share the ideas and knowledge that will drive Canada’s digital future. The conference delivers high value content through its subject matter experts, keynotes and an “unconference” day - a participant driven event where attendees build the agenda and lead inspiring and insightful sessions on contemporary identity topics. What to Expect:Day One will be full of presentations by leading identity and digital economy experts from Canada and around the world, and that evening we will host The Leaders Dinner, honouring the visionaries that have led and continue to shape the Canadian and global identity space. Day Two is slightly shorter, as an “unconference”. We will draw upon the incredible expertise of gathered attendees to tackle the hottest topics and thorniest issues facing the industry. Come prepared to challenge the room with the toughest "opportunities" on your plate.

title: Pushpins
description: Pushpins uses audience suggestions to create an imaginary map with specific geographical landmarks where anything can happen. Maybe it’s love at the local ski shop, a family feud at the farmers market or an epic historical battle in ye olde’ towne square – Pushpins is improv at its finest – a distinctively imaginative theatrical experience.

title: Sky doesn't talk by Carolyn Chen
description: Chamber Cartel kicks off their fourth season, Bhavana, with a premiere of Sky Doesn't Talk by Carolyn Chen at the Emory Planetarium. Dr. Chen will be at the premiere and there will be a lecture about the piece as well as a Q&A session for the audience after the concert. Dr. Erin Bonning, director of the Emory Planetarium will be hosting the event as well as projecting a beautiful array of stars above the performers for this performance.Funding is generously provided by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation for  this Creation Stories Project administered through the Emory College  Center for Creativity & Arts.

title: ChocoSol's Maiz Symposium & Dinner
description: Local, Sustainable Maiz Symposium & DinnerHosted by ChocoSol Traders and Mad MexicanLearn about the historical and cultural significance of maiz (corn) and the Mesoamerican Indigenous knowledge associated with this symbolic grain.Experience how ChocoSol draws from Indigenous teachings by joining us for a delicious dinner. Enjoy a 6-course local, sustainable menu inspired by the eco-gastronomy of the 3 sisters: corn, squash, and beans. All food will be prepared with vegan and/or local sustainable ingredients only. Non-alcoholic beverages included. Cash bar available.Date: Wednesday March 25thTime: 5:30 - 7:30pmPrice: $50 per person

title: Why Risky Play is So Important for Children
description: Do we overprotect our children? Might our attempts to keep children safe actually do more harm than good? This webinar will consider these questions and what we might be able to do to restore balance. Mariana will share some tools for talking to parents, educators and others about the importance of risk taking, and will provide an example from her research showing the effects of good play space design on children’s behaviour. Dr. Mariana Brussoni is an Assistant Professor in the Faculty of Medicine at the University of British Columbia and with the British Columbia Injury Research & Prevention Unit. She is a developmental psychologist investigating parents’ perceptions of children’s risk engagement and safety, the influence of nature-based challenging play on child health and development, and promoting developmentally appropriate opportunities for children’s risky play.

title: OPENING GALA: La danza de la realidad
description: *****SOLD OUT*****THE DANCE OF REALITY Director: Alejandro Jodorowsky Country: Chile/ France/ Mexico Year: 2013 Length: 130’ Genre: Fiction Synopsis: Alejandro Jodorowsky was born in 1929 in Tocopilla, a coastal town on the edge of the Chilean desert where this film was shot. It was there that Jodorowsky underwent an unhappy and alienated childhood as part of an uprooted family. Blending his personal history with metaphor, mythology and poetry, The Dance of Reality reflects Jodorowsky's philosophy that reality is not objective but rather a "dance" created by our own imaginations.Gala reception:Based on the belief that quality food and drink can transform the spiritual well-being, Fonda Lola showcases Mexican food beyond fish tacos and enchiladas, in an authentic atmosphere.http://www.fondalola.ca942 Queen St. W,Toronto, ON, M6J 1G8

title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
description: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan is considered by many fans to be the best of the Star Trek movies (and rightly so as far as we're concerned), as well as being the closest in spirit to the original show. Admiral Kirk (William Shatner) escapes the tedium of a desk job to join Mr. Spock (Leonard Nimoy) and Dr. Leonard "Bones" McCoy (DeForest Kelley) on another space mission. While boldly going where no man etc. etc., Kirk crosses the path of his old enemy Khan (Ricardo Montalban), who as any die-hard fan knows, was the villain in the 1967 episode "Space Seed." Leading a crew of near-savage space prisoners, Khan insinuates himself into the Genesis Project, which is designed to introduce living organisms on long-dead planets. Intending to harness this program for his own sinister purposes, Khan engages in battle with the Enterprise crew.We will be presenting this special screening of Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan in memory and honour of the inimitable Leonard Nimoy. May his memory live long and prosper. Join us, and say it loud for Mr. Spock. KHAAAAAAAAAAAAAANNNN!See Trailer HERE.

title: Carlsberg St. Party's Day 3PM-5PM Entry Time Slot
description: **Please enter event during time slot specified. Once you have entered, you may stay until last call at 2 AM**St. Party's Day promises to be Toronto's biggest party for everyone's favourite psuedo-holiday. An all day banger at Brassaii sponsored by Carlsberg, this event will blow your little green trousers right off.Last year was a hoot with over 8000 people attending, and the event has only grown, now bringing in more live music including Rich McGhie, sponsored give-aways, and a whole new batch of St. Party’s Day enthusiasts eager to break a leg on the dance floor!What some of you may refer to as St. Patrick’s Day is now commonly being referred to as St. Party’s Day. In 2011 the first ever St. Party’s Day celebration was born when 3000+ people attended in Toronto, ON at the historical St. Lawrence Market. Event goers and members of the community came together and signed a petition for St. Party’s Day to become a statutory holiday which created a huge buzz around town. 2012, 2013 and 2014 each played host to over 8,000 patrons celebrating the fast growing, authentic Irish holiday, and St. Party’s is back with its partner, Carlsberg, for another year of the best celebrations in the country.**Please enter event during time slot specified. Once you have entered, you may stay until last call at 2 AM**

title: Le Bordel de la Poesie: Bestiaire
description: Dearest cats and kittens, hound dogs and ravenettes, take wing, take paw, run, walk, or crawl to The Poetry Brothel's first ever Bestiary in Paris on March 6th! The Poetry Brothel's world renowned Poetry Whores will be inhabiting their true animal natures for one night only at Les Caves Saint Sabin. You're invited to look deep within yourselves to find the beast lurking just beneath your civilized surface. So don those claws, those tails, that fur, those fangs and feathers, and join us for a very special two part Poetry Brothel Bestiary. The first half of the evening will feature beastly burlesque by Sucre d’Orge, Soa de Muse, and Velena Rossa, electro-swing from DJ Elo, and, of course, private readings from your favorite Poetry Whores in all their animal majesty. However, once the hour is witching, we will be switching gears and turning the event into an all night raging animal dance party. From 12am to 5am, DJ Atomstaub will be spinning the froggiest techno tunes and the foxiest jungle jams. Come hop the night away with The Poetry Brothel for our second-ever show in Paris. What can we say loves, we just can't stay away.Doors open at 8pm. The show begins promptly at 9pm. Tickets are €15 online (€14 if you share the event on Facebook/Twitter) or €20 at the door. The price of admission includes one free drink. Special thanks to our partners, Le Fabuleux Cabinet des Curiosites and We Love Words. About The Poetry Brothel:The Poetry Brothel is an interactive poetry experience set up as a decadent fin de siècle brothel.  Poets performing under pseudonyms offer private, one-on-one poetry readings of their original  work in candlelit back rooms…for money. Of course, any true brothel needs a good cover; The Poetry Brothel’s is an immersive cabaret, offering a full bar, musicians, burlesque dancers, painters, actors, and fortune-tellers, with newly integrated themes, performances and installations at each event. ___Très chers chats et chatons, dogues et pinsons, venez à toutes ailes ou à toutes pattes, courez, marchez ou rampez au tout premier Bestiaire du Bordel de la Poésie, à Paris, le 6 Mars! Le Bordel de la Poésie permettra à ses Putains Poètes de renommée mondiale de vivre leur vraie nature animale le temps d'une nuit. Vous êtes invités à trouver la bête qui sommeille juste en-dessous de votre surface civilisée. Alors arborez fièrement griffes, crocs et plumes, et joignez-vous à nous pour un extraordinaire Bestiaire du Bordel de la Poésie en deux parties. En première partie de soirée, le chemin d'Apollinaire et de Baudelaire croisera celui du burlesque bestial de Sucre d’Orge, Soa de Muse, et Velena Rossa et de l'électro swing de DJ Elo et, bien entendu, vos Putains Poètes favoris dans toute leur majesté animale proposeront des lectures privées. La croisée de la nuit et du matin, quant à elle, sera pure danse animale endiablée. De minuit à cinq heures, DJ Atomstaub jouera ses tons technos les plus mordants et autres morceaux musicaux à se lécher les babines. Venez hurler à la lune avec le Bordel de la Poésie pour notre deuxième événement à Paris. Que voulez vous mes chéris, nous sommes conquis.Ouverture des portes à 20h. Les représentations commencent à 21h. Les tickets coûtent 15€ en ligne (14€ si vous partagez l'évènement sur Facebook ou Twitter), et 20€ sur place. L'entrée inclut une boisson offerte. Un merci spécial à nos partenaires, Le Fabuleux Cabinet des Curiosites et We Love Words.Au sujet du Bordel de la Poésie:Le Bordel de la Poésie est un évènement poétique unique et immersif qui sort la poésie des salles de classes et des amphis et la place dans le cadre décadant d'une maison close. Inspiré dans son concept par les bordels de la Nouvelle Orléans et de Paris à la Belle Epoque, nombre desquels servaient de refuge pour des artistes méconnus d'avant-garde, la "Maquerelle" du Bordel de la Poésie présente une troupe toujours en évolution de poètes en tant que "putains", qui règlent leurs actions sur un personnage soigneusement construit et partagent leur œuvres dans des lectures publiques, des éruptions spontanées de poésie et - c'est là l'essentiel - en tant que fournisseurs de lectures privées, individuelles, dans des arrière-salles. En échange d'une petite rétribution, touts les "putains poètes" peuvent être engagés pour une lecture privée à tout moment au cours de l'évènement. Evidemment, tout vrai bordel a besoin d'une bonne couverture; celui du Bordel de la Poésie est d'être un cabaret immersif proposant un bar complet, du jazz live, des danseurs de burlesque, des peintres et des diseurs de bonne aventure, avec de nouveaux thèmes, spectacles et installations à chaque évènement.

title: Powerful Every Run: Series III
description:
STRONGER. FASTER. BETTER.Powerful Every Run (PER) is a strength and conditioning program formatted specifically for runners while also benefiting any athlete that seeks to improve their running skills, execution, power and endurance.PER workouts assist runners –- new and experienced -- to become overall stronger, faster and better athletes. With progressive and specifically formatted workouts, the program will ensure that participants who are putting in the effort have tremendous gains.Once you consistently apply the techniques and training you learn in these fitness sessions, your ability to perform increases and allows you to constantly improve yourself and your running. Athletes can expect to achieve:
Structural development to withstand impact of running on joints and muscles;
Increases in total and sport-specific muscle strength, endurance and mechanic execution;
Improvement and sustainment of top speed;
Ability of the body to work at a higher capacity during distance runs without accumulating enough fatigue to stop your efforts; and, but not limited to,
Overall effective progression in their athletic goals. Sessions are as follows:
OPEN SESSIONSome of you may have checked out our demo classes at Reebok Fitbhub Georgetown,  participated in a past series, or are unsure whether PER is the right fit for you. Join me Saturday, March 7th, at 9am & 11am for a special PER class and enrollment question & answer session to participate in the Strength or Conditioning class -- or both!OPEN SESSION | CONDITIONING - Saturday, 3/7 @ 9amOPEN SESSION | STRENGTH - Saturday, 3/7 @ 11amPROGRAM SCHEDULEConditioning - Saturdays @ 9:00am - 10:00amStrength - Saturdays @ 11:00am-12:00pm DATES -  3/21, 3/28, 4/4, 4/11, 4/18, 4/25Open to all, including those that already sign up for the full program. Space is extremely limited. For more info and FAQ'S, check out Coach Neechie's website.QUICK FAQ
All sessions are INDOORS. 
All sessions are SATURDAYS ONLY.
Sessions are open to ALL. Ages 18 & up.
All class sizes are small to benefit participants in a semi-private training atmosphere to ensure progress and success. 
This program focuses on cross-training. Participants train just like athletes to prepare for running or sports involving running.
There will be an additional online training component for those would like to purchase it. This will complement the on-site training. 
The equipment package will be available for purchase and is optional.

title: Atelier des semis intérieurs Semis urbains
description:
Débuter vos propres plantes à partir de semences est amusant, fascinant et une excellente façon d'économiser de l'argent sur les plantes pour votre jardin. En plus d'obtenir une avance sur la courte saison de croissance à Montréal, germer les semis à l'intérieure vous donne accès à une grande variété de plantes inhabituelles, nouvelles ou du patrimoine qui ne sont pas facilement disponibles dans la plupart des pépinières ou magasins à grande surface.Dans cet atelier de deux heures, en plus des techniques et des outils utiles dans le démarrage de semences, vous allez apprendre à :
choisir des semences appropriées pour votre jardin
comprendre la différence entre les semences du patrimoine, les semences hybrides et les OGM
débuter des légumes, fines herbes, fleurs comestibles et fruits
préparer un bon mélange de terreau
comprendre les besoins des plantes et la fertilité des sols
arroser, déterminer le climat approprié, et fournir un éclairage adéquat
repiquer et comment éviter les ravageurs et maladies
À la fin de l'atelier, les participants recevront leur propre bac semis planté au cours de l'atelier, un document de conseils sur les semis intérieurs, ainsi q'un paquet de semences pour débuter chez soi.  Il y aura des semences, des sols, de l'éclairage et d'autres fournitures de démarrage de semences disponible à l'achat.Semis urbains est une entreprise basée à Montréal qui aide les gens à cultiver leur propre nourriture fraîche en ville. Pour les 5 dernières années, nous avons aidé le monde à travers Montréal à cultiver des légumes frais, des fines herbes et des fruits dans leurs cours, sur leur balcons, terrasses et toits.Animée par co-fondatrice et conférencière Tereska Gesing.Ceci est un atelier donné en français. L'atelier anglais est samedi le 14 mars à 13h00.L'atelier est à la Coalition de la Petite-Bourgogne, à 2 minutes à pied du métro Georges-Vanier dans la Petite-Bourgogne.

title: Food Photography Crash Course
description: Fat Girl Food Squad presents in conjunction withRender: Feminist Food & Culture Quarterly forFeminist Food FebruaryFOOD PHOTOGRAPHY CRASH COURSEJoin two of Toronto’s rising food photography talents in a jam-packed 90 minute workshop. Learn everything from staging, lighting, and storytelling, shooting on DSLR and mobile.Saturday, February 22nd | 9am - 10:30amLe Dolci Cupcakes & Cakes(1006 Dundas St W)Class fee $65, includes workshop and treatsBrilynn Ferguson’s work can be seen in Rock Lobster Food Co.’s, The Great Lobster Cookbook, and her most recent project, Industry Ink, in which chefs step out of the kitchen to tell stories of their food and industry related tattoos. In this workshop Brilynn will walk you through her creative process on the DSLR.Yuli Scheidt has been shooting for over 20 years and specializing in food for the last three. As Fat Girl Food Squad’s lead photographer, Yuli travels the city snapping your next favourite dish. In this workshop Yuli will offer tips on shooting mobile and creating a narrative.Remember to bring your camera and mobile device!#FGFSCrashCourse #FEMFOODFEB

title: Griffin SESSION Toronto #6 - A craft beer festival

Host to Collaboration Nation where craft breweries team up with celebrities to make unique beer for you to try.  Vote for your favourite and it will be listed in the LCBO!  Past winner from 2013 Tom Green (with Beaus All Natural brewing Company) hosted last years event and this year the prize will be given out by last years champion SAM ROBERTS (with Spearhead brewery)  Try over 100 different beers and enjoy amazing food, beer education and live music!

title: JUNO Fan Fare: Dallas Smith, Kira Isabella & More
description: Here's your chance to meet Dallas Smith, Kira Isabella, MacKenzie Porter, Paul Brandt & The Road Hammers! Get your tickets now!One of the most popular events of JUNO week, JUNO Fan Fare, presented by hmv Canada, gives Canadian music fans the opportunity to meet their favourite artists. Much VJ Liz Trinnear and Tyrone Edwards host of E!, will be hosting the event featuring interviews with artists, autograph sessions, live performances, prize giveaways and much more.Please note: you can only attend one signing session.

title: The Living Room Series 2015: Bareknuckle
description: It's been a wild ride, and all performances are SOLD OUT! Try your luck at the door. CASH only, please.The Living Room Series, a signature project produced by Vertigo Theater Company, is an exciting evening of theater that defies preconception by removing the audience from its familiar comfort zone. Each year, Vertigo commissions emerging, buzz-worthy playwrights to create new works for a site-specific setting. Guests are invited to continue conversations and exchange ideas at post-show receptions that include complimentary drinks and food. Last year’s sold-out performances featured three new works by Labyrinth Theater Company Member and Farm Theater Artistic Director, Padraic Lillis.The 2015 Living Room Series production, Bareknuckle, champions women. Vertigo Theater Company— whose Co-Artistic Directors and production team are all women— has teamed up with director Laura Savia and playwrights Lucy Thurber, Pia Scala-Zankel, and Lindsay Joy. Performances are scheduled for February and March at Gleason’s Gym in DUMBO. Special post-show receptions are scheduled for Friday, February 20; Saturday, February 28; and Sunday, March 8. Updates and info at www.thelivingroomseries.orgA portion of proceeds go directly to Give A Kid A Dream, a charity founded by Gleason's Gym owner Bruce Silverglade. Give A Kid A Dream provides children from disadvantaged backgrounds both mentorship and a place to come and develop themselves both physically and mentally through the sport of boxing.

title: Why Design Matters by Lynn Osmond
description: This event is brought to you by The Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA).The Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) is Singapore’s national land use planning and conservation agency. URA’s mission is “to make Singapore a great city to live, work and play in”. We strive to create a vibrant and sustainable city of distinction by planning and facilitating Singapore’s physical development in partnership with the community.URA is the main land sales agent for the state and the development agency for Marina Bay. Our multifaceted engagement strategy includes the sale of state land to attract and channel private capital investment to develop sites for meeting our land use needs. To create an exciting cityscape, URA also actively promotes architecture and urban design excellence.For more information, please visit us at www.ura.gov.sg

title: uPaint Events: March of Dimes Fundraiser
description: Join us for a fantastic night of fun, painting, drinks, and snacks! Tickets include admission to uPaint Events painting class, instruction for 2 - 2.5 hours, music, free digital photography, and all supplies to create your painting!Food, drinks, and gratuities not included. Fundraiser is to support the March of Dimes.Please arrive 15 - 20 minutes before the event start time to choose your seats, place food and drink orders, and get comfortable.uPaint Events is a mobile paint studio based out of New Bedford, MA. We teach social painting classes in almost any location: homes, offices, local restaurants, and more!uPaint Events is an exciting and creative experience for any skill level. Recommended ages 10+!

title: FINLAND - Hyvä poika (The Good Son)
description: Fifth film in Bright Nights: the 5th Annual Baltic-Nordic Film Festival dir. Zaida BergrothFinland, 2011, 88 minutes Finnish with English sub-titles  Bergroth’s second feature film is a black comedy with sinister undertones, revolving around a psychologically troubling relationship between a profoundly diva-ish film star mother and her teenage son. Leila (Elina Knihtilä), a middle-aged and profoundly narcissistic actress, is constantly surrounded by scandal. Vain and demanding, she’s relied on her oldest son Illmari (Samuli Niittymäki) for everything from career and emotional support to housekeeping duties. Taking Illmari and his little brother with her on a weekend “break” to their lakeside cabin, a bored Leila invites a drunken coterie of friends and sycophants to join them. Enter screenwriter Aimo (Eero Aho), who immediately catches Leila’s eye. Illmari is not amused. Tension mounts. “Bergroth treads a fine line, offering up, on the one hand, a devastating satire of showbiz life and, on the other, a serious drama about a psychologically damaged youth. This rare thematic coupling is as unsettling as it is richly satisfying.” Palm Springs International Film Festival.

title: NORTH PASSAGE film @ CEC THEATERS MENOMONIE
description: Popple Creek Pictures presents NORTH PASSAGE at the CEC Theaters Menomonie 7Please join us for a screening of the locally produced film NORTH PASSAGE along with a Q&A. A fragmented suburban family flees a cultural meltdown, seeking refuge on their survivalist grandfather's farm.  Part northwoods fairy tale, part psychological thriller, NORTH PASSAGE explores a young girl's psyche as she seeks peace and redemption while facing a startlingly close past.Seating: 7 pm Screening: 7:30 pmQ&A: 8:30 pmwww.northpassage.com61 minutes, 2014

title: Crowdsourcing Week Global 2015
description: Now in its third edition, Crowdsourcing Week Global 2015 empowers leaders with crowd-focused approaches & tools that organizations need to thrive in today's hyper-connected world. With the 2015 theme "Crowd Economy: Disrupting Billion Dollar Industries and Empowering Billions," the conference will explore the diverse ways your can harness crowdsourcing to capitalize on the new economy while empowering billions to create a better future.Join international leaders across enterprise, government, finance, marketing and tech at this must-attend event for an unparalleled inside look at the disruptive transformations, technological innovations, growth and market opportunities being driven by crowdsourcing, crowdfunding, and the crowd economy.The 3rd annual global conference includes:60+ inspiring, actionable sessions across enterprise, platforms, academia, and governmentDedicated tracks on the crowd-driven future of business, society and financeDaily Open Innovation Sessions with Roland Harwood of 100% OpenLive Startup Crowdfunding Competition in partnership with CNBCBuilt-in networking sessions day & nightFor complete conference information visit http://crowdsourcingweek.com/global-1550+ SpeakersThey are pioneers leading disruptive transformations in their industries, from SIilicon Valley to Singapore.And many more! Be inspired by these innovative minds  >>The Week At A GlanceMonday, April 20 | CSW Opening GalaBy invitation only. A CSW Full Access Pass includes an invitation. Tuesday - Thursday, April 21-23 | CSW ConferenceRegistration 8-9am | Conference 9am - 6pm Friday, April 24 | CSW Startup WorkshopVenueGenexis TheatreFusionopolis, Connexis Tower 1 Fusionopolis Way, Singapore 138632Google map | Venue photos"Fascinating talks, from smart cities to the sharing economy." - VIRGIN MEDIA"Like TED, but specifically for the social and innovation space." - ENTERPRISE INNOVATIONFor complete conference information visit http://crowdsourcingweek.com/global-15Questions? If for some reason you cannot attend, your best option is to transfer the ticket to another name.

title: SOLD OUT! Only sponsors. TEDxBarcelonaWomen 2015.
description: Our third and largest edition so far!Speakers and performers around different themes: Invest in Women, Women in Media, Get men involved in gender equity.It's time to shift the balance!

title: The Twilight Gala
description:
The Twilight Gala is TTRC's annual fundraiser. This year it is supporting Covenant House Toronto, an organization that provides services to at risk or street youth.Tickets are $65 in advance, $75 at the door. About the EventYour ticket will include the following:
Open bar
Food / Refreshments by Presidential Gourmet
Silent Auction
50/50 draw and other fun
Live music and other entertainment
About TTRCThe Toronto Twilight Rotary Club (TTRC) is a not-for-profit organization of young professionals with a goal to bring positive change to communities at home and abroad. We work on a variety of projects from local volunteerism to international development. This year we are partnering with Covenant House Toronto for our annual fundraiser, The Twilight Gala.About Covenant House TorontoAs Canada's largest homeless youth agency, Covenant House Toronto changes lives by providing the widest range of services and support under one roof. More than a place to stay, the agency provides 24/7 crisis shelter and transitional housing on-site and in the community along with comprehensive services, including education, counselling, health care, employment assistance, job training and aftercare. About 3,000 young people seek help from them annually.  Assistance is provided to youth between 16 to 24 years of age regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation or gender identity.Guests must be 19 years of age or older to attend.

title: Creativity Symposium for Women Leaders
description: Spark your creativity, build strong connections, and unleash joy at our 2015 Creativity Symposium for Women Leaders. At this one day annual event, you'll mingle with high level, dynamic, entrepreneurial women leaders in a creative, fun and inviting atmosphere including an experiential opening and closing ceremony, cutting edge thought leadership, peer advisory masterminds, and learning workshops on Saturday, March 7, 2015.57% of College graduates are now women, yet less than 5% are CEO's or other high level leadership positions. This event was designed to address that leadership gap by providing a forum where powerful women will support each other's success. In regards to creativity, recent studies indicate how only 1 in 4 people utilize their creativity at work while over 85% believe it's critical to their success. Study after study indicate how creativity helps any organization not just achieve a stronger bottom line, but it nurtures a better place to work in the long run. Ultimately, the Creativity Symposium aims to transform the future of global women leadership, one connection at a time. Join other dynamic women who want to grow bigger or faster, live true to themselves, and be unstoppable in the face of any challenge. Gain high quality connections, resources, and a community to reignite innovation, gain breakthrough insights, and be inspired with new actions to manifest powerfully what you want by tapping into the greater collective wisdom of community.Speakers:Patti Dobrowolski, Up Your Creative Genius Susan Preston, General Partner for the CalCEF Clean Energy Angel FundKay Smith-Blum, CEO of Butch-BlumKristiina Hiukka, Big Agenda CoachingJanaki Severy, Managing Dynamics LLCTawn Holstra, Creative Entrepreneurs 101Special Guests: Heather Beckett, Ceremonialist with Muse Mansion & Chaitra Vedullapalli, CMO of MeylahVisit http://www.creativitysymposium.com for more information. Press passes are available upon request.Event InformationSat March 7, 2015  10:00am - 4:00pm on International Women's Day!Venue: Brightwater Education and Community Center22505 Washington 9, Woodinville, WA 98072We are proud to showcase our venue, the Brightwater Environmental Education and Community Center. Retreat to this powerful, LEED® Platinum certified education center used by IslandWood for children's education on clean water which also doubles as a venue for weddings. Located on a 70 acre site, you can stroll through a sustainable garden, while enjoying artwork integrated into the landscape. The design of the venue was guided by a community advisory group that included local businesses, environmental groups, local Indian Tribes, education administrators and Friends of the Hidden River, a Bothell nonprofit organization comprised of local teachers dedicated to environmental education in the Puget Sound and surrounding regions. The group has to date raised more than $1 million in grant money to cover costs associated with the facility’s sustainable features and furnishings, and to develop its educational programs.WhoExecutive Women, Entrepreneurial Women, Women Leaders Who Want to Change the World. 80-100 attendees, speakers, and workshop facilitators consisting of local leaders and visionaries who are interested in creating a culture of creativity and advancing women in leadership. Intimate enough to create a quality connection and big enough for diverse perspectives and experiences.Ticket Sales End Feb 28th, 2015 $75 Early Bird through 1/31/15$100 Regular Bird through 2/21/15$125 Late Bird through 2/28/15Group DiscountsWe believe our ticket pricing is highly affordable for a full day conference that includes lunch, inspiring keynotes, breakout workshops, and high caliber networking. We want to reward our Connectors with a few more discount perks if you bring: 10 people=Receive a 10% discount off whatever going price is for the whole group15 people=Receive a 15% discount off whatever going price is for the whole group20 people=Receive a 20% discount off whatever going price is for the whole groupJust email anna@joysproutproductions.com a list of your friends, their emails, then send in one check or provide a credit card number and we will block register your group for you. If you are an organization and would like to partner with us in sharing with your members, we can set up a discount code just for your members! Contact Karina Miller at karinamill3r@gmail.com.

title: Be A Hero
description:

title: Tech Triangle U | Entrepreneurship Symposium
description: In collaboration with the Downtown Brooklyn colleges, we are pleased to bring you the 2nd annual Tech Triangle U, a week-long series of events that will include open office events geared toward college and professional students, career panels, an entrepreneurship symposium, and a mentorship hackathon. These programs will enable the area’s colleges to highlight the talent of their faculty and students to companies in the Tech Triangle, while companies can learn about talent recruitment and collaboration opportunities with higher education institutions right in their own backyard.

title: The Remnants of Penn Station: Tour & Cocktail
description: In partnership with The Eternal Space, a play about an untold story of the destruction of Penn Station, we are hosting a special tour of the remnants of Penn Station with Tamara Agins, licensed tour guide, project manager at NYC Department of City Planning, and author of our popular article on the Secrets of Grand Central. Weaving in moments from the play, which features over 1,000 never before published photographs of the station Station by renown photographers Norman McGrath, Peter Moore, and Aaron Rose, along with the work of railroad aficionados Alexander Hatos, an employee of Pennsylvania Railroad and Ron Ziel, a railroad historian, the tour will also cover the past, present and future plans for the central transportation hub in New York City, accompanying a hunt for the remaining pieces of the grand McKim, Meade & White station.A portion of the tickets supports The Eternal Space, which has been previewed at The Center for Architecture. The event includes an optional drink afterward and conversation with the tour leaders and The Eternal Space creator at The Breslin.

title: Cyril's Wine Flight Club #3: Champagne
description: The IdeaWe love wine. We love making it. We love sharing it. We love exploring all that it has to offer. So join us in a series where we look at some of the most fabled and loved regions and wines around the world. But these amazing wines are not always accessible. So we have found the best way to try them is as a group! A small group that can taste, ask questions, learn, argue and laugh. And as our tastes and learning shifts, we will let the group decide what region or wine we explore next. Wine for the people, by the people! “Too much of anything is bad, but too much Champagne is just right”  -Mark TwainEpisode #3: Champagne: Grower v House We will taste six (6) Champagnes highlighting the differences between House and Grower Champagnes. Nothing stirs excitement and lore like Champagne. Perhaps it is the bubbles. Perhaps it is the mystique of name. Perhaps it is the high prices? Regardless, we love Champagne. We will thoroughly explore the region, its history with royalty, war and trademark issues with other sparkling regions. We will learn about Dom Perignon, the widow Clicquot and the laborious steps needed to make Champagne. The tasting will include examples of Grower Champagne (grapes are grown and vinified by the producer) and House/Negociant Champagne (grapes are purchased to produce a house-style sparkling). This will be another fun and informative tasting of one of the most celebrated, and celebratory, wines. If there are any of the wines that stand out, we can special order these for you! Tasting Party: February 4th, 6:30-8:30pmCost: $50 photo credit: http://www.authentic-champagne-tour.com/

title: Tom Tom Founders Summit
description: Join the founders of Reddit, the Container Store, the Maker Movement, Chromat, Lockn, and more for a daylong exploration into the art and science of building from scratch at the historic Paramount Theater in Downtown Charlottesville on Friday, April 17th. See the full lineup of speakers and panels: http://tomtomfest.com/events/founders-summit/ Tom Tom Founders Summit is just one component of Tom Tom Founders Festival, a week of music, art, and innovation, which is otherwise free, and takes place April 13-19 in multiple venues across Downtown Charlottesville.TICKETING SCHEDULEMarch 1st: $60 Early BirdApril 1st: $75 Full Price+ $25 Student Scholarships

title: Cirque 2015
description: Tickets for the 2015 Conference on Industry and Resources Queens University Engineering are now available! The Conference on Industry and Resource: Queen’s University Engineering (CIRQUE) is a student run conference that was founded in 1983 to show engineers the versatility of their degree, as well as the wide spectrum of job opportunities available to engineering graduates. Each year, CIRQUE connects motivated and intelligent students with industry leaders, who share their insights and experiences on career paths and success after graduation.Speakers come from a wide spectrum of backgrounds, including traditional engineering, business consulting, finance, and academia, but all started as engineering students and have used the skills they gained in their rigorous programs to succeed after graduation. CIRQUE aims to inform engineering student about industry expectations and dynamics to make conference delegates more well-rounded professionals when entering the business world.

title: Darkness on the Edge of Town w/The Tide Keeper
description: Darkness on the Edge of TownTroubled teenage sharpshooter Cleo Callahan strives to avenge the death of her estranged sister after she is found murdered in a public bathroom. Unknown to Cleo, her best and only friend Robin O’Riley is the murderer she's sworn to kill. As Robin's damaged brother Virgil also draws closer to the truth, the three become tragically entangled, leading to a bloody showdown that costs them all severely.IrelandRunning Time: 87US PremiereDirector(s): Patrick RyanScreenwriter(s): Patrick RyanProducer(s): Lisa Mackintosh, Patrick Ryan, Tommy FitzgeraldCast: Emma Eliza Regan, Emma Willis, Brian Gleeson, Chris Fitzgerald, Olwen Catherine Kelly, Clodagh Downing, Sam MonaghanProgrammer's Notes:An Irish western noir with two female teenage leads?  Yes, please.  Repurposing a genre in ways as authentic as they are inventive is a feat, and everything about Darkness on the Edge of Town is a surprise wrapped in a subverted convention.  There is something familiar in the accomplished handling of dark themes, the dead-eyed vow to avenge a sibling’s death, the crackling danger that permeates every scene – and yet the variations are what elevate this tale and let you know you’re watching something truly special.  Damn. - Drea Clark, Programmer & Co-CaptainPlaying with short film:The Tide KeeperOne night an old seaman dreams the ocean into his bed. His sea green sheets become the polluted waters of his worst nightmare. His own mortality is at risk as his household objects become begin to suffocate him.New ZealandRunning Time: 9Director(s): Alyx DuncanScreenwriter(s): Alyx DuncanProducer(s): Alyx DuncanCast: Lee Stuart

title: Paris’ Mangroves by David Mangin
description: This event is brought to you by The Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA).The Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) is Singapore’s national land use planning and conservation agency. URA’s mission is “to make Singapore a great city to live, work and play in”. We strive to create a vibrant and sustainable city of distinction by planning and facilitating Singapore’s physical development in partnership with the community.URA is the main land sales agent for the state and the development agency for Marina Bay. Our multifaceted engagement strategy includes the sale of state land to attract and channel private capital investment to develop sites for meeting our land use needs. To create an exciting cityscape, URA also actively promotes architecture and urban design excellence.For more information, please visit us at www.ura.gov.sg

title: The Tower of Babel and the Splitting of Languages
description: Against the Grain Theater Festival's Story Series presents literature in dynamic ways with actors, storytellers, artists and scholars in locations throughout Buffalo. The second installment of ATG's 2014-2015 Story Series is "The Tower of Babel and the Splitting of Languages," a close reading and guided investigation of the "Tower of Babel" passage in the Bible.  The conversation will be led by Edan Dekel, Chair of Classics and Jewish Studies at Williams College.  The event will take place January 24, 2015 at 2 PM at the historic Guaranty Building in downtown Buffalo.

title: 5th annual Powering Prosperity Awards
description:
This event is presented by: the Carpenter's UnionFor more than thirteen years OSEA has been at the vanguard of the energy sector working with organizations like yours to champion sustainable energy to power, heat, cool and move Ontario's prosperity, creating good jobs, resilient communities and healthy environments.On January 29, 2015 we turn the spotlight on the champions of our sector, honouring them during OSEA's annual Powering Prosperity Awards dinner at La Primavera Banquet Hall in Vaughan.We are excited to announce that CISCO's Dr. Rick Huijbregts, a visionary in the area of innovation, sustainable energy and smart communities, will be joining us as the evening's keynote speaker.Dr. Huijbregts has been named one of "Top 35 People to Watch" by Realcomm and will speak about the critical drivers and opportunities for our sector in the 21st century.Please join us and an impressive network of more than 500 sector decision-makers including developers, builders, manufacturers, suppliers, government representatives and community leaders for an evening of networking, celebration and learning.To purchase tickets offline, please download, fill and email us this order form. Limited sponsorship opportunities are available and we urge you to seize the opportunity. Please contact Nicole Risse at 416-977-4441 ext. 3 or nicole@ontario-sea.org for more details.We look forward to seeing you at the Powering Prosperity Awards.Message from our Keynote Speaker:“Cisco Canada is excited to deliver the keynote at the “Powering Prosperity Awards” in January 2015. Cisco and the Ontario Sustainable Energy Association (OSEA) share a belief that industry transformation is inevitable as we get introduced to new technologies and capabilities. The convergence of Information Technology (IT) and grid modernization, intelligent communities, and business process optimization is providing for a 21st Century platform of innovation that will have a profound impact on how we live, learn, work, and play. Sustainability is positively impacted if we embrace the role of IT for industry transformation.” Dr. Rick HuijbregtsThank you to our partners:

title: Batkid Begins: The Wish Heard Around the World
description: Batkid Begins: The Wish Heard Around the World5-year old Miles Scott spent half his life battling leukemia. Now, it's his wish to be Batman. San Francisco's Make-a-Wish thinks bigger. Why not turn San Francisco into Gotham City. Then the idea goes viral. Will it overwhelm Miles, Make-a-Wish, and the city or will the good of humanity make this into a day to remember for millions?  USARunning Time:  81World PremiereDirector(s): Dana NachmanScreenwriter(s): Dana Nachman, Kurt KuenneProducer(s): Liza Meak, Dana NachmanCast: Miles Scott, Natalie Scott, Nick Scott, Patricia Wilson, Eric Johnston, Mike Jutan, Jen Wilson, Teresa ClovickoProgrammer's Notes: Filmmaker Dana Nachman exemplifies how the power of film can capture the emotion of a great collective event and deliver it to an audience.   The positivity and joy is contagious in this film that chronicles a city's quest to make a dream come true for a little boy, Miles. We revisit that day that San Francisco became Gotham City and the whole world joined to play pretend. Nachman also captures the tremendous power of social media and it's contribution to this unforgettable event.  A feel good movie through and through that demonstrates the beauty of humanity. - Nubia Flores, Co-Captain & Programmer

title: Still Alice Private Walk for Memories Screening
description: 72% of Canadian's diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease are women. Join the Alzheimer Society of Toronto on Wednesday, January 21, 2015, for a private screening of Still Alice. Still Alice   will touch home for many people. The film shows the toll that Alzheimer's disease takes on the  life  of a brilliant linguistics professor is superbly detailed by Julianne Moore. Screening starts at 7:00pmAdmission is Free for registered walkers of the Walk for Memories presented by Memory Care.Note: Present printed paper ticket at box office,no electronic tickets will be accepted.

title: Lovesick: The Bay Area 2015
description: Lovesick is back! We -- and our partners at Offbeat Bride -- are once again traveling the country to unite the best wedding talent and those looking beyond the traditional to bring their big day to life! It's fun. It's crafty. It's guy-friendly. It's same-sex friendly. And it's heading your way! Learn more at www.lovesickexpo.com.

title: Life After Death From Above 1979
description: >>> Band & Director in Attendance!!! <<<The story of Canadian dance-punk band, Death From Above 1979, and how the power of music shaped their tumultuous decade-long friendship.In 2001, after years of playing together in various bands, living together, and bonding over a mutual desire to continue playing music while peers abandoned rock n' roll to follow more traditional career paths, Jesse Keeler (bass) and Sebastien Grainger (drums), started a band out of boredom and necessity. They hammered out their sound in an unfinished basement in the east end of Toronto, and the result is what many have described as "an elephant in your living room."They were propelled into the limelight based on the strength of their raucous live performances and the release of their seminal album, You're a Woman, I'm a Machine (2004). But as the band's success grew internationally, their friendship became strained due to constant travel, and little-to-no buffer between them. Over the course of grueling schedules and never-ending tours, they broke up in 2006, right after the biggest tour of their careers, and ended the band before reaching potential stardom.In 2011, after five years of silence between them, and each focused on their own musical projects and respective lives, Jesse and Sebastien decided to reunite for one show: the legendary Coachella Music and Arts Festival. Life After Death From Above 1979 tells the story their rise, break-up, and coming back from the dead.Featuring music by Death From Above 1979, MSTRKRFT, Sebastian Grainger & The Mountains, Femme Fatale, CSS & more, and iinterviews with members of Death From Above 1979, Justice, MSTRKRFT, The Strokes, Metric, Yeah Yeah Yeah’s & more

title: DXParties: Party Politics
description: ONLINE SALES ARE NOW CLOSED. PLEASE PURCHASE TICKETS AT THE DOOR.Strike a pose at our posh party on November 26! Eat, drink, dance and mingle. DJ Mama Knows drops the beats and artist Cameron Lee joins us with s special feature. Plus, hit the after-party at Drake One Fifty.Cameron Lee is a Toronto artist, curator and DJ. Cameron performs, builds, collects and combines using humour, making familiarity feel strange. Cameron is one-third of DJ collective Body Interface (regularly hosted at Bambi’s), is the curator for the monthly art, food and music event Feast in the East, and a founding member of Toronto gallery 8-Eleven. Cameron’s sculptural work was recently shown at The Power Plant, in an exhibition curated by Micah Lexier.Anni Araujo Spadafora aka DJ Mama Knows is a DJ and mixed media artist based in Toronto. She was recently an artist in residence at NES Residency in Skagaströnd, Iceland. She has been a regular DJ at the AGO's First Thursdays series and her band New Fries is set to release their first album with Pleasence Records in this fall.This is a 19+ event.TICKETSGeneral Admission: $25 + HSTDX Member: $12.50 + HSTStudent/Senior: $18.75 + HST

title: 2015 ReFrame Film Festival
description: ReFrame is a three-day film festival that takes place during the coldest, darkest time of year.  Although it may  be cold outside, you'll be warm and cozy indoors traveling around the  world, being entertained, informed and inspired as you watch incredible  documentary films.  The films selected to screen at ReFrame will challenge you to  reconsider, reflect on, and re-imagine the world we live in.  Come  and join us Friday January 23 – Sunday January 25, 2015

title: POLAND - Jack Strong
description: RUSH TICKETS FOR THIS FILM CAN NOW ONLY BE PURCHASED AT THE VENUE.BOX OFFICE OPENS 30 MINUTES BEFORE THE SCREENING TIME.Jack StrongDir. Władysław Pasikowski / 2014 / 128 minutesBased on a true story from depths of the Cold War, this intense and entertaining spy thriller tells the extraordinary tale of a man who dared to challenge the Soviet empire. While planning the military maneuvers of the Warsaw Pact forces, Polish army colonel Ryszard Kuklinski has access to top secrets. He is also increasingly haunted by Poland’s forced participation in the repressive and violent events that took place in Czechoslovakia and the Baltic States under Soviet control. In the 1970s, Kuklinski decides to rebel. He starts a long, lonely and psychologically exhausting cooperation with CIA as a double agent. From that very moment the life of his family and his own is in constant danger:  one careless move may lead to catastrophe. English sub-titles.Cet intense et enlevant thriller d'espionnage raconte l'histoire vraie d'un homme qui a osé défier l'empire soviétique. Alors qu'il planifie les manœuvres du Pacte de Varsovie, le colonel de l'armée polonaise Ryszard Kuklinski a accès à des secrets de haut niveau. Il apprend que les Américains prévoient exécuter une contre-attaque nucléaire contre les forces soviétiques en sol polonais. Déterminé, il entame une longue, solitaire et épuisante coopération avec le CIA. Sa vie et celles des membres de sa famille sont dès lors menacées : un faux pas, et c'est la catastrophe. Sous-titres en anglais.

title: EUFF 2014: This Life
description:
Directed by Anne-Grethe Bjarup Riis | Denmark, Drama, 123 min,
Language: DanishCast: Jens Jørn Spottag, Bodil Jørgensen, Bjarne Henriksen, Anne Louise Hassing"The Hvidsten Group" is the authentic story of the spirit of one family  who revolts and insists on individual freedom during World War II. It is  the story of how just a few people can make a huge difference - but not  without serious consequences.

title: EUFF 2014: West
description:
Directed by Christian Schwochow | Germany, Drama, 102 min,
Language: German, English, Russian, PolishCast: Jördis Triebel, Tristan Göbel, Alexander ScheerSummer, late 70s. Three years after her boyfriend Wassilij died in a car  accident, Nelly Senff decides to escape from the GDR with her son  Alexej and leave her memories and grief behind. She pretends to marry a  West German, who takes them over the border. Two suitcases, a schoolbag,  a cuddly toy – that’s all Nelly and Alexej take with them to start  their new life in the West. She believes in a fresh start on the other  side of the Wall. But in the West she doesn’t know anybody. Her only  shelter is the cramped Emergency Refugee Centre in West Berlin, where  the past catches up with her: The Allied secret services demand  information on Wassilij, who allegedly was a spy. Nelly has to decide if  she lets the trauma of the past destroy her hopes for a better  tomorrow.

title: ​Digital Tropics - Uma Nota Fest Saturday
description: Digital TropicsSweaty sounds from the transglobal undergroundDuring last year’s Uma Nota Tropical Mash-Up at the Great Hall, The Music Gallery presented Tribe Called Red in the Black Box downstairs as part of the X Avant Festival. Needless to say, it was a pretty festive evening from top to bottom, so this year we’re going one step further by joining forces for this transcultural party at Remix Lounge featuring New York’s DJ Ushka in her Canadian debut alongside the infamous Poirier from Montreal. Expect digital ecstasy and a few surprises. feat.DJ Ushka (NYC) El Poirier (Montreal) + Special surprise guestsCustom Visuals by Bá Land DJ Ushka (NYC) http://www.djushka.com/Ushka is a Sri Lankan-born, Thailand-raised, Brooklyn-living migrant. She is an activist, cultural organizer, and deejay re-defining the boundaries of global bass music and culture.Having grown up in several parts of the world, her musical influences are as transnational as she is. She deejays from the perspective of a dancer, blending a wide range of music from soca to cumbia, hip hop to South Asian rhythms, kuduro and other African styles to samba. She does so with the philosophy that global genre-blending connects cross-cultural struggles and tells important stories between communities but most importantly, she translates this onto dancefloors.Poirier (Montreal) http://poiriersound.com/Poirieris Montreal’s pre-eminent Tropical Bass producer. Pinpointing the bits and pieces of dancehall beats, soca energy and electronic intensity is futile in the face of Poirier’s dance-driven creativity and air horn-worthy excitement. He has been nominated for a couple of Junos in his time. This is a man who just understands what works in the dance. He’s released several acclaimed albums on Ninja Tune, remixed the likes of Busy Signal, Salif Keita and Pole and has toured the world several times over. In 2013 Poirier embarked on a new mission: the “chamber techno” music of Boundary. This alias was responsible for one of the remixes in the Music Gallery’s Hugh Le Caine project last year.Remix Lounge, 1305 Dundas W,Doors 10 p.m.Co-presented with X Avant IX: Transculturalism (The Music Gallery) Tickets: 12 advance.

title: Pain & Wound Management - Ann Arbor, MI
description: Course Title: Pain and Wound ManagementPre-requisite: Basic Wildlife Rehabilitation Strongly EncouragedFee: Member-$105, Nonmember-$125Delivery Method: Classroom, This is a One day class Hours are 8:30 am – 5pm CE Hours: 10Pain Management is designed to give wildlife care professionals a working knowledge of the vocabulary and concepts underlying the modern approach to pain management in mammalian and avian species. Topics include the physiology and clinical signs of pain, supportive care techniques, and drug therapy including indications, contraindications and side effects.Wound Management provides a systematic review of the physiology and treatment of the most common types of soft-tissue wounds seen in injured mammalian and avian species. Topics include wound assessment, wound types, antibiotic therapy, cleaning and topical agents, bandaging techniques and the physiology and stages of wound healing. Fractures and wound management in herpetiles are not covered in this course. Lab Included.****To pay by check or over the phone call 866-871-1869 x0 or send a US check or money order and information to PO Box 3197 Eugene, OR, 97403****

title: Learn Vibrant Voice - the Online Workshop!
description:
The Vibrant Voice Technique is a revolutionary approach to enhancing your voice. The simple (and surprising) idea: use a vibrator.

After all, what do the vocal folds do? They vibrate. What is resonance? It is sympathetic vibration. The Technique uses a small, hand-held vibrator and a series of exercise targeting the head, neck, and shoulders. The goal is to enhance your vocal resonance and help you reduce the muscle tension that can lead to vocal fatigue. In other words, the goal is more sound with less work.

The Online Workshop

The workshop occurs across two days of instruction separated by a week of practice and implementation time:

Day 1: Sunday July 31st from 1pm-3:30pm mountain time (12pm PST/3pm EST)

Day 2: Sunday August 14th from 1pm-3:30pm mountain time (12pm PST/3pm EST)

Ideally, you'll want to make yourself available for both days of the workshop as Day 2's learning will build upon Day 1's lesson and questions will be addressed on both days. However if you cannot make it to some portion of the workshop, a recording will be made available to all those enrolled. Please note the workshop size is limited to provide ample opportunity for participants to ask questions and receive personal feedback.

The workshop will be led by the Vibrant Voice team: David Ley and Elissa Weinzimmer.

Who is the workshop for?: If you rely on your voice, this technique can help you. So whether you're a school teacher, a professional singer, or anything in between, this workshop is for you.

What you'll need: Your computer with a camera and microphone and the ability to download some simple software (www.zoom.us) and your own vibration device (if you don't have one yet, you can get one here: vibrantvoicetechnique.com/faqs/)

Workshop fee: $250 CAD ($195 early registration by July 16th at 10pm mountain)

Your workshop fee also includes: Online access to the video recordings of the workshop sessions, a copy of the Vibrant Voice Technique How To Guide (only available to those who have participated in a training), monthly access to our live online refresher sessions, and membership in the Vibrant Voice Technique Facebook Forum.

(If you prefer to pay in US dollars please send us an email and we will send you a separate invoice)

*please note that there are no refunds

Want to know more about Vibrant Voice Technique? Visit us at vibrantvoicetechnique.com

Contact Mimosa (mkabir@torontopubliclibrary.ca) for the promotional code! Join the after-hours party in the stacks at the 2nd Hush Hush bash. Hosted by New Collection, the Toronto Public Library Foundation’s young patrons group, this exclusive underground party is going to rock in true speakeasy style. Following the success of the inaugural bash, the prohibition themed party will feature delicious cuisine from the popular Rock Lobster diner, live jazz, a DJ, a secret bar with a specialty cocktail available only by “password”, awesome prizes and much more. Dress code: Cocktail Funds raised at Hush Hush enable groundbreaking programs and services, innovative community spaces and exceptional book collections.

title: Buffer Festival Industry Day
description:
*TICKET SALES FOR THIS EVENT ARE NOW CLOSED ONLINE*You may check in at our registration desk tomorrow from 8am-9am to enquire about availabilityAboutBuffer Festival Industry Day is presented by the Canadian Film Centre's Media Lab in partnership with Buffer Festival. This one-day conference is for industry professionals looking to optimize YouTube as a content and talent development platform and a marketing and distribution channel. It provides a unique opportunity to network with celebrity YouTubers, MCNs, CMOs and digital entertainment industry executives.Attendee Information Buffer Festival Industry Day is not a fan event. All attendees must be industry professionals. Any ticket purchases/applications are subject to verification by the CFC Media Lab and Buffer Festival. Approved buyers will receive a confirmation and ticket receipt. Any applicants not accepted will be refunded and notified via email.Attendees must bring proof of purchase and ID on the day.Who Should Attend
