Industry professionals looking to optimize YouTube
Contact UsAny questions or enquiries can be directed to our customer services department at bufferfestivalID@cfcmedialab.com

title: Girls Night Out: The Genius of Marian Screening
description: Did you know that women make up almost three-quarters of Canadians with dementia? Or that over 70% of informal caregivers are women, mostly wives and daughtersJoin the Alzheimer Society of Toronto on September 16th 2014, for a Girls Night Out at the Movies.  Bring out your entire family and your friends, regardless of gender, to learn more about the experiences of women living with the disease. Guest speakers include Lynn Posluns, President of Women's Brain Health Initiative, who will discuss Women's Brain Health & Dementia and  Carolyn and Claire Poirier who will share their personal journey with their mother's early onset of dementia.Together, we'll watch The Genius of Marian, a documentary about one family's struggle with Alzheimer's disease. After Pam White is diagnosed at age 61 with early onset Alzheimer's, life begins to change, slowly but irrevocably, for her and everyone around her. Pam's husband grapples with his changing role from primary partner to primary caregiver. Her adult children find ways to show their love and support while mourning the slow loss of their mother. And Pam begins a journey from fear to acceptance.Doors Open at 6:00pmScreening starts at 6:30pmAdmission is Pay-what-you-can. Questions: Contact Kimberlee Waymann at 416-640-6327 or kwaymann@alzheimertoronto.orgAbout the Alzheimer Society of Toronto:The  Alzheimer Society of Toronto provides free counselling, education &  information to people with Alzheimer’s disease & other dementias,  their families, & caregivers. Our  mission is to alleviate the personal and social consequences of   Alzheimer's disease and other dementias and to promote research

title: Big Sister Summit
description:
European Conference Weekend Blast for Women Entrepreneurs! Where marketing meets mindfulness, yummy food meets productivity and great women meet each other. It is time for women entrepreneurs to start supporting each other. The world needs more big sister energy.
Big sisters know your quirks and love you anyway. Big sisters make you go for your dreams (and shove you in the right direction when you feel like wimping out). Big sisters let you in on their secrets. Big sisters listen. Big sisters help you get up after you fall. And repaint. And get a new haircut. And reinvent yourself. Big sisters know that giggles and chocolate are important business ingredients.
This business party is for you if you are ready to connect with fun entrepreneurs who are going places.  If you can't wait to learn holistic business tools that will help you grow your fab business while remaining sane(!) and happy.
What to kick off the weekend blast early?  On Friday, October 17th, you can sign up for our Confidence Workshop to help you make the most of Big Sister Summit or join us on a easy hike in the Alps through a beautiful gorge with crystal clear waters, followed by a light snack in a traditional Bavarian restaurant. Both of these events are offered free of charge to all Big Sister Summit attendees.  Sign up details will be sent  via email. 
Check out the full details at Big Sister Summit.

title: TEDxVCU
description: TEDxVCU 2014 will open doors at 10:00am and begin at 10:30am. The talks will be broken up into 2 hour blocks, separated by lunch and breaks to decompress, digest, and discuss the ideas of the day.The primary parking deck for TEDxVCU is the VCU West Main Street deck, located at 23 S Cherry St, Richmond, VA 23220. Parking will be available for $8 for the entire day, and TEDxVCU-goers are encouraged to carpool, bike, or walk to the event if possible. TEDxVCU shares it’s date for 2014 with the Anthem Marathon in Richmond. There are major road closures from 4am to 4pm. A map of road closures is available for download here. Doors for the conference open at 10am, and the following routes have been cleared for entry to the West Main Street deck.In the spirit of ideas worth spreading, TED has created a program called TEDx. TEDx is a program of local, self-organized events that bring people together to share a TED-like experience. Our event is called TEDxVCU, where x = independently organized TED event. At our TEDxVCU event, TEDTalks video and live speakers will combine to spark deep discussion and connection in a small group. The TED Conference provides general guidance for the TEDx program, but individual TEDx events, including ours, are self-organized.

title: Tennis on the Hill - Fall 2014
description: Tennis on the Hill is a non-profit Community Tennis Association (CTA),  promoting and facilitating the playing and enjoyment of tennis as a  means of healthy recreation and lifelong physical fitness for all ages,  abilities, income levels, and backgrounds in the community of greater  Capitol Hill and surrounding area. Anyone can learn. Come play with us.

title: Michel Gondry's MOOD INDIGO (Aug 15, 17 - 27)
description: Set in a charmingly surreal Paris, wealthy bachelor Colin (Romain Duris), whose hobbies include developing a cocktail-making piano and devouring otherworldly dishes prepared by his trusty chef. He soon meets Chloé (Audrey Tautou from Amélie) and, before they know it, they’re dancing to Duke Ellington and plunging headfirst into a rapturous romance. Their whirlwind courtship is tested when an unusual illness plagues Chloe; a flower begins to grow in her lungs. To save her, Colin discovers the only cure is to surround Chloe with a never-ending supply of fresh flowers.Based on the beloved novel by Boris Vian,  inventive auteur Michel Gondry (Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind) brings to life visionary and romantic love story. Mood Indigo was Nominated for three 2014 César Awards: Étienne Charry (Best Original Music), Florence Fontaine (Best Costume) and Stéphane Rozenbaum (Best Production Design). In French with English subtitles

title: Smithsonian Family Workshop: Changing Colors
description: Changing ColorsRecommended Ages: 6 - 18 monthsSaturdays: October 18 - November 8Time: 10am—11:30amYour infant is beginning to take notice of the world around them. Encourage their natural curiosity with this multi-sensory introduction to color and its many applications.You can purchase the 4-week package for $170 OR individual classes for $45/each. Tickets are for one child and their caretaker.More information about our family programmingFAQ'sDo I have to stay with my child during the class?Yes, this is a family workshop and parents are expected to attend and PARTICIPATE.  Its a great way to connect!My child isn't the right age, can they still attend?We work hard to create age-appropriate programs and hope that you can find a class that suits your child's age and schedule.  If you still feel strongly about attending, we will of course, welcome you.  But, please understand that we are unable to alter the class format and content to suit the needs of individual children and thus, your child might not have the best experience.Can I bring a sibling?We would prefer that you don't as it can be distracting and take away from the connection you can make with the child attending the class.  However if its a choice between the sibling or not attending the class, we would much prefer you come to the class! What will we do during the class?We will meet at the Natural History Museum introduce the theme in a SEEC classroom.  After our introduction, we will walk to a museum on the Mall and return to the classroom for a final activity.Will we be walking?Yes and in ALL weather.  Come prepared!  It’s a great way for the kids to get some exercise and fresh air too!What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?Metro - Federal Triangle, Smithsonian There is limited availability of street parking along the National Mall and Constitution Ave.Several parking garages in the area.No matter what you choose, give yourself an extra 20 minutes to park and walk to Natural History. Is my registration/ticket transferable?If there is room in another class, we will do our best to accommodate you. Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?Yes, please! What is the refund policy?Tickets will be refunded minus a $50 non-refundable deposit up to 2 weeks before the first class.

title: Latin American Fashion Week
description: Latin American Fashion Week (LFWC), is the largest Latin Fashion exhibition in Canada, established in 2012.  LFWC continues to grow each season, creating a community of designers, stylists and industry professionals who shape this unique experience.LFWC introduces local and international designers from Mexico, Peru, Colombia, Chile and Brazil by providing a progressive environment for them to promote their work. The event will also offer a trade show with over 140 fashion related business offering and promoting their products and services.

title: Vancouver Fashion Week SS15
description: VANCOUVER FASHION WEEK is a diverse and innovative semi-annual fashion experience that features both established and emerging designers. It is North America's second largest industry event and the fastest growing fashion week in the world. We thrive on inviting and showcasing the most creative and dynamic talent in international award winning established and emerging designers from over 30 global fashion capitals.The upcoming Vancouver Fashion Week Spring / Summer 2015 will begin with the  Opening Gala on the night of September 15th, where our guests will be treated to a night of sensory indulgence that will include music, performances and a sneak preview of the designer collections.This invite-only event kicks off the week in style, creating local buzz and steering all attention towards the highly anticipated runway shows. Our lineup of hand-picked talent from all across Canada, and around the world, will showcase their designs over the week of September 16th to 21st, 2014.

title: Smithsonian Early Explorers (Fall Semester)
description:
Smithsonian Early ExplorersAges: 18 months - 3 years (and caregiver)Mondays & Wednesdays: September 2014 - June 2015Time: 10am -12pmJoin SEEC this fall for a brand new early learning opportunity in partnership with the National Museum of Natural History; Smithsonian Early Explorers. SEE retains many of the elements that have made the SEEC program successful the past 25 years. Combining the best in early learning practice and the rich learning environments of the Smithsonian Institution, young learners, 18 months – 3 years, together with their caregivers will meet twice a week, Monday & Wednesday, for the duration of the school year. This small cohort of young learners and caregivers will engage in the practice of museum learning and have access to the best of the Smithsonian Institution’s early learning resources. See below for course details. Space is very limited; please contact Cynthia Raso at rasoc@si.edu for additional information.Smithsonian Early Explorer Curriculum The SEE program builds on 25 years of experience Smithsonian Early Enrichment Center educators have in using museums and community resources to enrich the lives of young children and provide a positive foundation for life-long learning experiences. The SEE program combines the children’s interests with overarching themes taken from SEEC’s Museum Magic resource guide to inspire individualized classroom and community encounters for children and caregivers together.The Learning EnvironmentClass will meet in the Q?rius Junior Discovery Room space on the 1st Floor of the National Museum of Natural History. Regular trips out of the classroom are integral to the SEEC curriculum.Children learn about their world through frequent excursions beyond the classroom into the Smithsonian Institution, as well as into the greater community. Parents/Caregivers should plan on spending time in spaces outside of the Natural History Museum and should dress their child accordingly. Parents or caregivers must participate in all aspects of the child’s experience and are required to participate in museum and community visits.Registration and TuitionSEE participation is on a first come first served basis with SEEC full day program applicants receiving an advance registration option. Advance registration opens on April 14, 2014. General registration begins on May 5, 2014. To register, advance payment for the month of September is required. The remainder of the semester’s tuition will be received through a direct deposit payment two weeks prior to the first of each month.The remainder of the semester’s tuition will be received through check or through our third party registration. Enrollment requires a commitment of one semester, please see below for early withdrawal information. Enrollment confirmation and additional forms will be mailed via e-mail within three days of payment receipt. Tuition Rates and DatesFall Semester Tuition - $3420

Month   Tuition   Amount   Date   Due   Payment   Method  

September   $720   Upon   enrollment   On   Line Registration  

October   $720   September   22   On   Line or By Check  

November   $720   October   20   On   Line or By Check  

December   $540   November 24   On   Line or By Check  

January   $720   December   15   On   Line or By Check  
Spring Semester Tuition - $3420Waiting List FeesA non-refundable fee of $25 is required for interested applicants to be place on the waiting list. Should openings occur, individuals on the waiting list will be contacted using the contact information provided. Once a message has been left, waiting list applicants will be given 48 hours to respond before SEEC will offer the opening to the next applicant on the waiting list. Students enrolled in the fall semester will have first priority for the winter/spring semester. If openings occur for the winter/spring semester, waiting list applicants will be notified in turn. Enrollment ConfirmationUpon acceptance into SEE, parents will receive a confirmation letter. Additional information will be disseminated towards the end of the summer as the program approaches.Re-enrollment Process Appropriately aged students enrolled in SEE will receive priority for participation in SEE the following year. Involvement in the SEE does not in any way impact future enrollment opportunities in SEEC’s full time program. SEE participants do not receive priority in the traditional school year lottery. Children with special needsThe Smithsonian Early Enrichment Center welcomes children with diverse needs and seeks to support their growth through personalized interactions and collaboration with parents and external educational experts.Educators at SEEC modify practices for children with special needs within the classroom, but assist parents in finding outside experts and specialized programs when a child’s needs cannot be met within the SEE program. Withdrawal from SEEEnrollment in the SEE programs requires a commitment of a full semester. Early withdrawal requires one month notice for any reason other than illness. This notice is required to enable the center to fill the child's vacancy.Failure to provide proper and timely written notice shall result in the forfeiture of one month of payment. HoursParents/Caregivers are expected to arrive with their child when the Museum opens its doors at 10:00 and proceed upstairs to the Q?rius Junior space. Caregivers will be responsible for finding the class if they arrive late and the group has left the building for a museum visit. Classes meet Monday & Wednesday.HolidaysSEE will follow the DCPS calendar including all holidays observed by the Federal government.School ClosingAny closing for weather or other emergency situation by the Smithsonian Institution will also include the center.Families will receive a credit for days that class is not held because of federal government closings.Involuntary Closing PoliciesIf SEEC is involuntarily closed due to budgetary or other issues affecting the Smithsonian as a whole, SEE will be canceled for all related days and parents will receive a payment credit for that class.Inclement Weather ClosingsSEEC/SEE will be OPEN if the Federal Government is operating on a regular schedule.SEEC/SEE will be CLOSED if the Federal Government is closed.SEE/SEE may operate on a LIMITED SCHEDULE when the Federal Government announces unscheduled leave, adjusted home departure, or any other approved late arrivals. Families will be notified via email by 7:00 am on the day in question.

description: In support of CAN Fund a not for profit organization located in Toronto devoted solely to raising funds and awareness for Canadian Athletes. CAN Fund is the only organization in Canada that with each donation you find                                                                   out directly which athlete you                                                              have directed supported.Where: Boston Pizza Front and John, 250 Front Street, TorontoWhen: Tuesday, July 15th 2014              6PM-10PMWhat: Every Summer has a story, what's yours? title: Driftwood Theatre's The Tempest | Dundas
description: Driftwood Theatre presents Shakespeare’s masterpiece, The Tempest. One of Shakespeare’s most celebrated plays, The Tempest pits one man’s need for personal vengeance against his hopes for the future of his family. It is a story of magic, power and forgiveness told in Driftwood’ signature style blending movement, song, puppetry and classic storytelling.

title: Driving Miss Daisy
description: Driving Miss DaisyBy ~ Alfred UhryStarring ~Walter Borden - HokePru Donaldson - Miss DaisyMike Petersen - BoolieDirected by Eva MooreWinner of the 1988 Pulitzer Prize and Critics Circle Award for Best Off-Broadway Play. This warm-hearted, humorous and affecting play explores the unlikely relationship between an aging, crotchety white Southern lady, and her chauffeur, a proud, soft-spoken black man. Off-Broadway success and an Academy Award-winning film starring Jessica Tandy and Morgan Freeman, Driving Miss Daisy “is a total delight” and “gives off a warm glow of human affirmation.”Mr Borden, Mr Petersen and Ms. Moore appear courtesy of Canadian Actors Equity Association Produced in cooperation with Dramatists Play Service

title: Two Islands Weekend - Camp For Grown-ups
description: Grab your toothbrush, your flannels, and your flashlight, and head to Two Islands Weekend, a one-of-a-kind summer camp for adults! From September 5-7, TIW will take over Camp Timberlane, located on Lake of Two Islands, a secluded, spring-fed lake, surrounded by 600 acres of hardwood forest in the Haliburton Highlands. This all-inclusive adventure offers two nights in shared cabins, and all day camp activities, including canoeing, arts and crafts, yoga, and field sports. There’ll be some nostalgic camp-wide games, like capture the flag, and opportunities to amaze your fellow campers at the camp-themed trivia night. And, unlike memories of summer camps past, dine on remarkable camp-inspired meals from amazing Toronto chefs.  At night, indulge in beverages at the bar, grab a guitar, and enjoy the camp fire (yes, there will be s’mores). Our bars will be fully stocked by Rosewood Estate Winery, McAuslin Brewery and Black Fly Spirit Beverages.*** No refunds***

title: Is the Man Who Is Tall Happy?
description: (dir. Michel Gondry, France, 2014)Director Michel Gondry (ETERNAL SUNSHINE OF THE SPOTLESS MIND) applies his playful imagination to animating a series of conversations with the esteemed linguist, philosopher, political commentator and activist Noam Chomsky. At the heart of these talks is Chomsky's theory of the emergence of language. In this intellectual feast, Gondry uses drawings to make complex ideas more accessible and to expand the documentary form.Venue:George Brown College | 2nd Floor Cinema (Room 237) | 51 Dockside Drive, Toronto

title: Dynamic Character Animation in Toon Boom
description: Want to take your subtle Toon Boom facial animation to the next level? Join GURU lead animator Sean Bartlett (Guruin this hands on workshop using wacom tablets and Harmony,  where participants using GURU’s EVER AFTER HIGH character rigs focus on posing, breakdowns, secondary, all leading us towards beautiful, believable character acting.Venue:Corus Quay | Computer Room (6th Floor) | 25 Dockside Drive, Toronto

title: Decoding Annie Parker: An AVON Exclusive Screening
description: Join us at the exclusive pre-screening of Decoding Annie       Parker. Based on true events, this groundbreaking film tells the story of two remarkable women; the irrepressible Annie Parker, a       three-time cancer survivor and Toronto resident and the Geneticist Mary-Claire       King, whose discovery of the breast cancer BRCA gene mutation is considered one of the most important discoveries of the twentieth century.Watch the trailer here. DATE:     JULY 16, 2014TIME:      5:45 pm - VIP LOUNGE OPENS               6:45 pm - ENTRY FOR GENERAL ADMISSION TICKET HOLDERS               7:00 pm - SPECIAL AVON ANNOUNCEMENT               7:15 pm - FILM BEGINS               9:00 pm - PANEL DISCUSSIONPLACE:   TIFF BELL LIGHTBOX TORONTO, 350 KING STREET WEST, Cinema 2Panel discussion to feature Annie Parker, producer Stuart Ross and Dr. Ellen Warner, Medical Oncologist specializing in hereditary breast and ovarian cancer. The discussion will be moderated by Sharon Hampson (Sharon, Lois & Bram), a breast cancer survivor and founding member of Willow Breast & Hereditary Cancer Support.

title: Free Arts Grant Writing Workshop
description: Limited space! Book here on Uniiverse or RSVP: forgeworkshops@gmail.comYou want to know how to get grants. The funders want to show you how to get their grants. It's a match made in heaven. Join us Wednesday, June 11 at 6:30pm for our latest Forge Workshop: OAC Grant Writing Workshop 2The Ontario Arts Council will guide us through the application process and discuss do's and don'ts as you review real applications like jurors and learn where people go wrong in grant writing.Hope you can join us- bring your friends!FREE!Location:Ontario Arts Council, 151 Bloor St. West, 6th Floor, Torontowww.akincollective.com

title: Locke with Weaves
description: Limited tickets are also available at the door, cash only. Box office opens at 7:30 pm on the night of the event.Director: Steven KnightGenre: DramaRunning Time: 85 minutesRating: 14AStarring: Tom HardySynopsis: Ivan Locke (Hardy) has worked diligently to craft the life he has envisioned, dedicating himself to the job that he loves and the family he adores. On the eve of the biggest challenge of his career, Ivan receives a phone call that sets in motion a series of events that will unravel his family, job, and soul. All taking place over the course of one absolutely riveting car ride, LOCKE is an exploration of how one decision can lead to the complete collapse of a life. Directed by acclaimed filmmaker Steven Knight (EASTERN PROMISES, DIRTY PRETTY THINGS) and driven by an unforgettable performance by Tom Hardy, LOCKE is a thrillingly unique cinematic experience of a man fighting to salvage all that is important to him.Watch the Trailer:Music Performance By: WeavesWeaves is a guerrilla project, intentionally forcing each member to create outside of the tiresome redundancy of a four-piece band. Reluctant to hide behind a wall of reverb or instantly affiliate with a scene, they are focused on mirroring pop sensibilities while evoking a visual and vulgarized experience.______________________________________________________________________Depending on how much rain is falling the event may be able to move indoors at 99 Sudbury and run on the same schedule as if it were outside. In the unlikely event that the indoor venue is unavailable, we’ll be sure to let you know. A raincheck will be provided to a future screening. All info will be sent to the email address provided when purchasing your ticket. Tickets are non-refundable. No outside food or drink permitted.

title: The Entrepreneurship Society - Raising Capital
description: Join The Entrepreneurship Society and co-host EY on September 17, 2014, at the Arcadian Loft in downtown Toronto, for a pair of roundtable discussions designed to introduce you to fellow entrepreneurs, and to learn from them and other experts who can help you grow your business. Our topics at the next event will be:1. Raising capital   * Search fund/private equity   * Growth capital    * Early stage funding (seed and angel)    * Venture capital    * Raising debt2. Business Operations    * Incorporating a new venture and joint ventures    * Expanding into other countries    * Goal setting and KPIsThere will be two 45-minute roundtable discussions, followed by 30 minutes of open networking. The event runs from 6pm to 9pm.Only a limited number of tickets are available on a first-come, first-served basis.

title: Her Campus National Pre-Collegiette Conference
description:
On Saturday April 26 at Northeastern University in Boston, MA, Her Campus is hosting our first-ever National Pre-Collegiette Conference and we can't wait to see you there!
	This conference is for high school students (pre-collegiettes!) and their parents, and will cover everything you need to know to get ready for college (no matter what year in school you are)--from the nitty gritty of college apps, to how to pick the best college for you, to how to navigate applying for internships, to how to stay healthy in college, to what living with a roommate is like, and much, much more.
	There will be panels, workshops, and talks, plus free breakfast provided by Maia Yogurt, free yummy lunch provided by Chipotle, sweet goody bags, and a fun college dos & don'ts fashion show, all running on Saturday April 26 from 9:30am-4:30pm. The conference will feature a keynote by Jess Bashelor, founder of The Handle Bar in Boston and a graduate of Northeastern University.
	While you're in town, take advantage of the trip to check out college tours and info sessions at the many amazing colleges and universities in the Boston area.
	Questions?  Email HStoHC@hercampus.com.
	Already coming?  Tweet about it with #HStoHC.
	We are so excited to be hosting this conference and can't wait to see you there! Thank you to our partners Intel, Chipotle, Maia Yogurt, Neuro, Popchips and Temptations Cafe for supporting the National Pre-Collegiette Conference.

title: Shooting Stars Summer (overnight) Camp
description: Heritage College – June 22-28, 2014This is not your typical basketball camp. Unlike other basketball and sports camps, Four Point Basketball specializes in shooting. Whether you’re an elite athlete or new to basketball, there is always room to improve your shot. Four Point Basketball camp is designed to encourage athletes physically and mentally.The basic mechanics of technical shooting will be covered; however individual player assessment will guide athletes’ Four Point Basketball summer camp experience. title: Songkran Toronto 2014!
description: We are SOLD OUT for this year's Songkran!  Thanks for all your support!Songkran is Thai New Year's and the tradition goes that we all pour water on each other as a symbol of cleansing and ridding ourselves of any bad from the past year and to start all fresh and squeaky clean.   On April 12th, 2014, celebrate the Thai New Year with Khao San Road, chef Matt Blondin (Junk (opening soon)), La Carnita, Come and Get It, Ardor Bistro, Gushi and other participating restaurants for some great food, drinks, music and water fight festivities.  Come to the afternoon session (1pm-4pm) or evening (8pm-11pm) - we will be located across the street from 326 Adelaide St West (just east of Peter).Admission will get you into our heated tent for all the action and includes a dry bag for your items. We are SOLD OUT for this year's Songkran!  Thanks for all your support!Additional food and all drink tickets will be available for purchase on-site (cash only).For a charitable donation of $100, you can come with rain gear, otherwise, be prepared to get wet!  No outside "weapons" (aka water guns) allowed!  The early-bird water gun raffle has now closed, good luck to those who qualified, the winner will be notified by email prior to Songkran.Raffle tickets for large soaker guns will be available at both our afternoon and night sessions.

title: Action Potential Lab Grand Opening
description: Action Potential Lab, Toronto’s first laboratory for science and art, is holding its grand opening with special events on Friday, March 21st and Saturday, March 22nd. Located at 451 Christie St. (Christie and Davenport), and situated in a 100-year-old pharmacy, Action Potential Lab has been engaging students in projects ranging from DIY microbiology and food science to DNA extractions and biological art since January 1, 2014 . Action Potential Lab offers a variety of programs including kids classes, birthday parties, adult workshops, lecture series, and community outreach projects. On Friday, March 21st, from 7pm to 11pm,  Action Potential Lab will be holding a public launch party for adults and the media. Come for some refreshments and get an introduction to the lab and its unique and exciting programs through some hands on science-art activities! RSVP here and join us for a night of Science and Arts.Email: hello@actionpotentiallab.caWebsite: www.actionpotentiallab.caPhone Number:  416.538.4100

title: The Endometriosis Network Canada Symposium 2014
description:
Join us on March 22nd, 2014 for the second Endometriosis Symposium presented by the Endometriosis Network Canada.Keeping in line with our previous Symposium, we will cut through the myths and biases to provide access to accurate, detailed information about Endometriosis. Between lectures browse our exhibitor section for edibles, products and services specific to Endometriosis. Door prizes and baskets provided by our sponsors will also be given away.Location: Marriott Eaton Centre, 525 Bay Street, Toronto M5G 2L22014 Speaker Line Up (Subject to Change):
Heather Guidone: “Endometriosis: A Collaborative Disease - Working Together to Make a Positive Difference
Pamela Frank, ND: “Nutritional Interventions for Endometriosis”
Andrea Meade: “Making Movement Make Sense: Physiotherapy Perspectives in Endometriosis”
Tara McKee: “Outside the Box: Endometriosis and Sex”
Dr. Iris Orbuch: “Diseases that Commonly Co-exist with Endometriosis”
Dr. Ken Sinervo: “Endometriosis & the Bowel – Surgical Intervention”
Dr. Herbert Wong: “Endometriosis – Your Journey Through The Gynecologist’s Office”Every dollar from the ticket price is going back into the Endometriosis Network to continue to provide access to information and awareness on Endometriosis through our ongoing events and support groups.Space is limited. Buy your ticket today!

title: Mixpanel Office Hours with Autodesk
description:
Understanding your Users Across Platforms Presented by Ishan Verma, Business Analyst, Autodesk

When: Thursday, February 27th at 5:00 - 7:00pm Where: Mixpanel HQ - 799 Market St, 7th Floor, San Francisco Cost: $5 (includes ample food, beer, and Mixpanel tees)

Autodesk allows customers to build, design and collaborate on 3D projects using cloud technology. Allowing users to work on projects through a variety of platforms drew users but understanding what they were doing with the product became difficult. Join us to hear more about how Autodesk has tackled the challenge of allowing flexibility while understanding their users across platforms.

Schedule: 5:00 - 5:30pm: Meet & greet with the Mixpanel team 5:30 - 6:00pm: Talk: Understanding your Users Across Platforms  6:00 - 7:00pm: Additional Q&A with the Mixpanel team

title: Free Papercraft Demos — Washi Wednesday at The JPP
description:
Drop-in, learn and shop from 1 – 7 pm, the last Wednesday of every month (except December). Come and watch artists at work, have a tour, shop for specials, consult with staff, watch related videos, share what you've been doing with washi, and mingle with other washi fanciers.On Washi Wednesdays we will repeat brief demonstrations throughout the day at approximately 1:00, 2:15, 3:30, 5:00 and 6:00. Please drop in at your convenience.Here's the lineup:
                                    Wednesday April 30
                    Playful Monotype 
                    with Victoria Cowan
Want to learn how to open up with your printmaking? Come
                    and watch innovative Victoria Cowan today as she plays with
                    monotype. She will work both on old prints and new papers
                    (selecting from our wide range of delectable washi surfaces),
                    maybe reducing an old print in size or printing only a reduced
                    portion of a plate; maybe making prints into instant books
                    and then printing from previously made soft lino plates,
                    each step responding to the previous one. Intuitive and responsive
                    to materials this will indeed be playful monotype!Spill - Intaglio & relief on washi
                      - 12" x 18" by Victoria Cowan

description: ON SALE MAY 1st at 10AM!Inspired by night markets of the world, The Stop Community Food Centre will transform Honest Ed’s alleyway and parking lot into a bustling night market.Join us on June 17 & 18 to raise money for The Stop - all while experiencing some of the city's best food and drinks in an iconic, re-imagined space.  $65 all-you-can-eat-and-drink!This event is 19+ - please bring your ID.  Rain or shine, no refunds, no date exchanges. title: Brazilian Fever 2014
description: BRAZILIAN FEVER 2014   www.brazilianfever.ca  MUSIC. DANCE. CULTURE. CARNIVAL. PURE BRAZIL!  No celebration better reveals the Brazilian love of music, dance, and revelry than its world-renowned carnival festivities. Get ready to live an authentic Brazilian experience, and a night never before seen in Ottawa – a sultry display of carnival costumes, sexy samba dancers, world-class Brazilian musicians playing exotic high-energy beats, live drummers, capoeiristas, and much more.  Join us as the city comes alive with the rhythms & sounds of this sizzling cultural spectacle!When & WhereDate: Saturday, February 15, 2014Time: 8:00 pm until 2:00 amLocation: The Majestic GRAND HALL of the Canadian Museum of CivilizationCanada’s TOP tourist attraction, minutes from Parliament Hill The AttractionsBANDA BRACATUM - guarantees to get revelers on the dance floor with a high-energy musical repertoire that includes samba, frevo, axé, marchinhas and more!BATUCADA CARIOCA - a spectacular group of 20 musicians led by Maninho Costa, a reference in the Brazilian music scene in Canada. Get ready to dance the night away to the most traditional and original rhythms of Rio de Janeiro’s samba schools and experience the joy, fidelity and soul of true samba!CAPOEIRA CAMARA - an internationally-renowned group of capoeira experts that have won the attention of both the Canadian and Brazilian media with their spectacular performances throughout the Americas, Europe and Asia                DANCE MIGRATION - Canada’s leading Brazilian dance company, presenting exhilarating performances in samba, Afro-Brazilian dance, and more…

title: EUFF Encore: The Consul of Bordeaux
description:
Directed by João Correa and Francisco Manso 
Drama, 90 min
Language: Portuguese
Cast: Vitor Norte, Carlos Paulo, João Monteiro

This is the story of Aristides Sousa Mendes, Portuguese Consul in Bordeaux who, defying direct government orders in 1940, rescued more than 30,000 people including 10,000 Jews, by granting them safe passage to Portugal. In 1966, Yad Vashem named him Righteous Among the Nations. He is considered to have achieved the largest single rescue operation of World War II.

title: Access 2014
description:
ACCESS is an evening to raise awareness and resources for the Arts Access Fund. All funds raised through ACCESS help support the Arts Access Fund’s scholarship program. #ACCESS2014

The Arts Access Fund is a charitable organization that partners with arts institutions around the city of Toronto in order to provide children and teenagers, with limited financial resources, access to first class arts curriculums.  Current partners include Sistema Toronto in partnership with the Royal Conservatory of Music, the Avenue Road Arts School and the Canadian Contemporary Dance Theatre.

Attractions include:

- The Great Wall of China Mural
- Traditional Associations
- Historic Garment Factory 
- Taoist Temple
- Chinese Herbal Pharmacy
- Dim Sum Demonstration
……
This is a walking tour unlike any other!

description:
On the hunt for unique gems, fashion finds, vintage scores and other market must-haves, but hate the idea of spending the weekend knee-deep in thrift store piles?

We've teamed up with Anita Clarke of I want - I got and Haley Mlotek of Worn Fashion Journal to bring you a curated, handpicked, holiday marketplace for December 7. Packed with purpose, artist goods, reclaimed vintage, craft, design, jewelry, clothing, and more, Gladstone Flea curates the market to help save you from the thrift store itch.

title: Japanese-French Fusion by Chef Taka Kuroki
description:
Both Japanese and French cultures are somewhat obsessed and defined by their food, resulting in a remarkable sophistication and highly esteemed place in the national identity. So it comes as no surprise that there has long been a fascination with fine French cooking in Japan, and the emergence of a fusion Japanese-French culinary ideas.

Chef Taka Kuroki trained in French cuisine and spent a decade as the sous chef at Le Poutriere, a prestigious French restaurant in Fukuoka, Japan (where he specialized in lobster dishes). Chef Taka will be assisted by Chef Shinji Yamaguchi of Gushi Japanese Street Food﻿.

This menu represents a thoughtful combination of French and Japanese flavours, ingredients and techniques, elegantly presented by a talented chef informed by a lifetime immersion in both these cuisines. This will be The Dep's last Supper Club of 2013, and a very special ending to a year of remarkable food.

Chicken Paupiette
Thin slices of poached chicken breast wrapped around asparagus and carrot

Katsuo no Tataki
Raw skipjack tuna briefly seared on the outside

Canapés with miso cream cheese 

Cream of Japanese Kabocha Squash Soup

Miso Langue de Bœuf Mariné
Tender beef tongue slow-cooked in miso

served with a Shimeji and Enoki mushroom risotto

Zenzai boule blanche de lentilles

Zenzai is Japanese winter dessert traditionally made with soft red Adzuki beans, sweetened and thickened with mochi (Japanese rice cake). Chef Taka's Zenzai will be made with French lentils.

$40 +HST
B.Y.O.B. — No corkage
Doors open 7:30 — Dinner at 8:00

Book Now

Learn more about The Rusholme Park Supper Club
http://thedepanneur.ca/supper-club/

title: EUFF 2013: Bajari: Gypsy Barcelona
description:
Directed by Eva Vila 
Documentary, 84 min
Language: Spanish

Juanito is about to fulfill his dream of getting a pair of red boots that will make him a true flamenco dancer. His uncle Coco, a legendary singer in the flamenco tablaos of Barcelona, will help him achieve it. Flamenco is passed on within the family in the Gypsy community that bore Carmen Amaya, the greatest flamenco dancer of all time. Her grand- niece, Karime, comes to Barcelona to pick up her trail. The journey is only complete when Winy, her mother, joins her from Mexico in order to prepare a show with some of the city’s biggest talent. Together they will discover the spirit of Bajarí, the name of the city of Barcelona in Caló, the language of the Gypsies.

title: EUFF 2013: Alcan Highway
description:
Directed by Aleksi Salmenperä 
Documentary, 86 min
Language: English, Finnish

Hese is a 44 year old Finnish man trying to solve the paradox of wanting to be constantly on the move and to find a home to settle down. To this end, he plans to build a mobile home and find a place to turn off the engine for good. He travels from Finland to Anchorage, Alaska, customizes a 60 yearold truck with his friends and drives to Vancouver Island to seek peace of mind. At least, that’s the plan.
Alcan Highway is a film about a journey, a dream which seems to be coming true. But is it what Hese really wants?

description: Join members of the IPCC in Toronto for the opportunity to network with experts in the advertising industry. As representatives from the advertising industry do not visit Ivey during the recruiting season, this is a unique opportunity to learn more about the field.

title: Mixpanel Office Hours with Venmo
description:
Leveraging Social Proof for Growth
Presented by Andrew Staub, Growth Lead, Venmo

When: Thursday, November 14 at 5:00 - 7:00pm
Where: Mixpanel HQ - 799 Market St, 7th Floor, San Francisco
Cost: $5 (includes ample food, beer, and Mixpanel tees)

Venmo is an app that helps you make and share payments.  The app lets you send money to friends for dinner, drinks, rent, etc. and checkout in other apps with a single click, removing the need to re-enter credit card information. Their growth team has focused on social virality to help drive their recent growth. Andrew Staub, growth lead at Venmo, will share what he’s learned about the value of social proof and the power of the customer invite.

Schedule:
5:00 - 5:30pm: Meet & greet with the Mixpanel team
5:30 - 6:00pm: Talk -- Leveraging Social Proof for Growth

title: EUFF 2013: Oh Boy
description:
Directed by Jan Ole Gerster 
Comedy/Drama, 88 min
Language: German
Cast: Tom Schilling, Friederike Kempter, Marc Hosemann

"You have dropped out of law school?What have you done in the last two years?”-“I was thinking”. Niko is a loveable slacker from Berlin. While searching for plain drip coffee, Niko is wandering through the city and has quaint conversa- tions with the people he meets along the way. But one day everything changes: His relationship ends, his father cuts off his allowance and a psychiatrist confirms his‘emotional imbalance’. Niko has to face the consequences of his inac- tion. Meanwhile, a peculiar beauty from his past confronts him with the emotional wounds he inflicted, his neighbor tries to make friends with him, but all Niko actually wants is a decent cup of coffee.
OH BOY is a fleet-footed, smart, silly and satirical comedy with an unexpected happy ending: a large cup of coffee.

title: 360 Screenings Halloween Event
description:
Welcome to 360 Screenings Halloween event!  After the success of previously sold out events, this highly anticipated event will offer four screenings.

Join us on...
Friday, October 25th, 7:00pm -- SOLD OUT!
Friday, October 25th, 11:00pm -- EXTREMELY LIMITED
Saturday, October 26th, 2:00pm -- EXTREMELY LIMITED
Saturday, October 26th, 7:00pm -- SOLD OUT!

Please note:
- The venue location is only revealed 24 hours before the event via email.  It is in downtown Toronto, and is easily accessible by public transportation.  You will also receive further instructions about attire, what to bring, etc at that time 
- Ticket price includes: admission & screening
- Food, wine & beer available at cash bar

360 Screenings provides a cinematic experience that audiences not only watch but also become a part of through live theatre installations. title: Mixpanel Office Hours with Duolingo
description:
This month's topic:
Improve your Product with AB Testing & Data Focus
Presented by 
Severin Hacker, CTO, Duolingo 

When: Thursday, September 26 at 5:00 - 7:00pm
Where: Mixpanel HQ - 799 Market St, 7th Floor, San Francisco

Duolingo removes language barriers by connecting people that need websites translated with students that are learning a language. Through trial and error the team at Duolingo has mastered the art of data driven product development through AB testing and a focus on the right metrics to optimize. 6:00 - 7:00pm: Additional Q&A with the Mixpanel team

title: Homegrown Park Crawl
description:
On Sunday, September 29th, come for a tasty tour at the David Suzuki Foundation's first-ever Homegrown Park Crawl! Enjoy delicious food and great music as we crawl —by foot, bike and canoe — between four city parks along Toronto's former Garrison Creek corridor.

Join 16 homegrown food vendors, 16 local groups, 4 local musical acts and the David Suzuki Foundation's team of Neighbourhood Park Rangers in celebration of the first year of the Homegrown National Park Project.

PARK CRAWL SCHEDULE:

11:00am - Join us in Christie Pits Park to kick off the crawl
1:00pm - Crawl to Bickford Park
2:00pm - Parade to Fred Hamilton Park
3:00pm - Final parade to Trinity Bellwoods Park

Each of the four parks will host food booths, entertainment and eco-activities. Participants will be led from one park to the next by parade marshals and musical acts -- including Lemon Bucket Orkestra and Choir!Choir!Choir!. More details to be announced.

FOOD TICKETS:

Food tickets are limited so get yours today! Each food ticket will allow you to sample a delicious, homegrown specialty from local restaurants and chefs including Jamie Kennedy, Pizza Libretto and Crush Wine Bar. 

Food tickets will be 5 for $20 or $5 each at the event. Food tickets are non-refundable. 

All proceeds support the David Suzuki Foundation's Homegrown National Park Project. The event is rain or shine.

title: The Night Market at 99 Sudbury
description:
UPDATE: Tonight, Wednesday October 23, 2013 is the final Night Market of the season. We look forward to seeing you tonight! 

The Night Market is a FREE, weekly bazaar, held every Wednesday Night from 5pm-10pm at 99 Sudbury, from July 3rd - October 23 2013.

Vendors include farmers with fresh produce; grocery items from local purveyors like cheeses, breads and meats and locally made products like sauces, pickles, preserves and baked goods. Food vendors include local restaurants, pop ups, and food trucks selling freshly made food to eat at the market or to take home. Stay for a drink from one of the local drink vendors including wineries, spirit distilleries and breweries. Retail vendors including artisans are also on hand selling clothing, jewelry, art, crafts, flowers and more.

The market takes place in the 99 Gallery space every Wednesday evening from 5pm-10pm and runs until October 23 2013.

For more information visit: www.NightMarketTO.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/NightMarketTO
Twitter: www.twitter.com/NightMarketTO

title: WORKSHOP: Jump Up with Greg Couillard
description:
Spend an evening with one of Toronto's culinary icons, learn some fabulous new recipes and end with a lovely summer meal.

This intimate, hands-on workshop will feature one of Greg's most famous recipes, Jump Up Soup, probably as close as Toronto has ever come to having a signature dish (Loblaws even tried to package it). It's his take on the spicy Jamaican flavours of pepper pot, a traditional hearty soup of sweet & hot peppers, Jamaican pumpkin, veggies and curry seasoning. Keeping with the West Indian theme, the menu will also include a baked Jerk Chicken with Coconut Rice, and Mango & Jicama Coleslaw.

It would not be hyperbole to suggest that Greg Couillard is one of the most influential chefs in Toronto's culinary history. His prescient embrace of this city's multicultural flavours and ingredients revolutionized fine dining in Toronto, and foreshadowed the eclectic, international menus many now take for granted.

Learn more about Workshops at The Depanneur
http://thedepanneur.ca/workshops/
